Cut cabbage into quartersremove core. Cut quarters into thin strips and place in large bowl. Toss with apples. Heat oil in a heavy skillet or Dutch ovenadd cabbage mixture and sprinkle with caraway seed. Saute 8 minutes or until tender. Add watercover and simmer 4 minutes or until water evaporates. Stir in 1/4 cup cidercook 5 minutes or until liquid evaporates. Remove from heatsprinkle with salt.

Warm sesame oil in a pan. Add in the garlic clove and the ground ginger. Fry until fragrant. Add in the broccoli florets. Cook for 30 seconds. Add in the scallops. Pour in the sherry. Cover the pan with a lid. Cook for 2 minutes or until the scallops are done. Remove the pan from the heat. Add in the soy sauce and the garlic sauce. Mix well. Serve over rice. Garnish with the chopped parsley.
Scallops are a versatile food that can be prepared in a variety of ways. They can be baked, grilled, sauteed, or even added to a salad. No matter how they are prepared, they are always delicious.
One of the great things about scallops is that they are relatively easy to find and they are not very expensive. They are also a good source of protein and they are a good source of omega-3 fatty acids.
Scallops are a great addition to any meal. They can be added to a salad for a little extra flavor or they can be the main course

Peel and devein the shrimp. Combine the cilantro, tomatoes and green onion in a medium bowl. Add the clam juice and refrigerate until ready to serve. In a medium bowl, combine the iceberg lettuce, ketchup and Tabasco sauce. Peel the lettuce and serve.
Cut the white bread into two pieces and spread the butter on both sides of the bread. Sprinkle with black sesame seed. Dust with icing sugar. Serve hot with tea or coffee.

Heat oil and add garlic, onion and basil. Cook 2 minutes. Add tomato sauce and broth. Bring to a boil and simmer 5 minutes. Add macaroni and zucchini. Simmer 12 minutes. Stir occasionally. Serve immediately.

Cook fettuccine in plenty of boiling water. Add chicken to a frying pan, cook for about 5 minutes on each side. Remove from pan and slice. Add carrots to the pan. Add chicken stock and dried garlic. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Add red capsicums and cook for 1 minute. Add fettuccine and sliced chicken. Pour over olive oil, add salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Cook pasta as per pack instructions. Drain and rinse under running water. Mix together pasta, peas and rocket. In a seperate dish mix together remaining ingredients. Pour over pasta mixture and mix together. Chill before serving.
In a large bowl stir together the sour cream, taco seasoning mix, and avocados. Serve with lettuce, tomatoes and cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 f. Grease an 8x8 pan. In a small bowl, combine muffin mix, water, eggs, oil and sugarbeat until smooth. Pour half of batter into pansprinkle with half of the peaches. Sprinkle with half of the sugar and half the cinnamon. Pour remaining batter into panspread evenly. Sprinkle with remaining peaches, sugar and cinnamon. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Cool in pan on wire rack for 15 minutes or until cool enough to handle. Cut into squares to serve.

In a large bowl, combine the cream cheese, sour cream, cumin, salt, pepper, and chicken. Spread about 2 tablespoons of this mixture in the center of each flour tortilla. Roll up tightlyplace seam side down in a 9x13-inch baking dish. Top evenly with the enchilada sauce. Sprinkle evenly with the Jack and Cheddar Cheeses. Cover and bake in a 350 degree oven for 15 minutes or until heated through. Uncoverbake an additional 5 minutes or until the cheeses are melted and golden brown.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Season the chicken breasts with the salt and pepper and the dried thyme. Heat the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and saute until tender. Add the wine and reduce by half. Add the cream and the honey. Bring the mixture to a boil and reduce it by half. Pour the mixture over the chicken breasts. Place the chicken breasts on a baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes. Serve hot with your favorite rice or pasta.

In a large mixing bowl, combine the apples with the maple syrup and cinnamon. Spread into a greased 9-inch square baking pan. In a separate bowl, combine the flour, quick-cooking oats, brown sugar, cinnamon and salt. Stir in the melted butter until the mixture is crumbly. Sprinkle over the top of the apple mixture and bake for 40 minutes or until bubbling on top. Serve warm with whipped cream.

Beat together oil, water, matzo meal, salt, sugar, and eggs until smooth. Place 1/2 cup of the mixture in a small bowl. In another small bowl combine the remaining matzo meal mixture with the chopped onion. On a large piece of wax paper, shape the hot dog into a sausage by placing a length of the hot dog on one end of the wax paper. Place 1/4 of the onion mixture on the hot dog and roll the sausage lengthwise into the wax paper. Repeat with remaining hot dogs. Remove the wax paper from the rolls. Dip each roll in the beaten mixture. Place in the frying pan. Cook over medium heat until the rolls are golden brown on both sides. Remove from the heat. Serve with mustard.

In a heavy 2 quart saucepan melt the sugar, salt and butter over medium heat. Stir frequently until a candy thermometer registers 245 F on a candy thermometer. Remove from heat and stir in the evaporated milk, vanilla and marshmallow creme until smooth. Add the candy bars and stir until melted. Stir in the almonds and walnuts. Pour into an ungreased 13 x 9 inch baking dish and refrigerate for 1 hour or until firm. Cut into squares and serve.

In a mixing bowl combine cake mix and oil until crumbly. Stir in sugar and cinnamon. Form into balls and place on a baking sheet. Bake in preheated 375 oven for 6 to 8 minutes. Roll the cookies in powdered sugar before serving.

In a saucepan, combine the cocoa, sugar, and salt. Add the milk. Heat and stir over low heat until a smooth paste forms. Add the vanilla. Serve in a cup with a small amount of whipped cream.
Sugar Cookie Mix. Made With Real Butter!
1/4 cup butter or margarine 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour 2 teaspoons baking soda 1 teaspoon salt 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg 2 cups granulated sugar 1/2 teaspoon ground cloves 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon 1 teaspoon ground anise seed 1 teaspoon ground cardamom 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger 1/2 teaspoon ground cloves 1/8 teaspoon ground mace 1/8 teaspoon ground nutmeg 1/8 teaspoon ground allspice 1/8 teaspoon ground cinnamon 1/

Mix beef with sausage and breadcrumbs. Form into burgers, about ½ inch thick. Grill over medium heat, turning once. Brush with barbecue sauce during the last minute of grilling. Add cheese slices to each burger during the last minute of grilling. Melt cheese on top. Serve on buns with jalapeno slices, if desired.
Mix flour and egg until smooth. Dip the brie slices in the batter and fry in hot oil until golden and crisp. Sprinkle with sugar and serve immediately with cranberry sauce.

Season the chicken breasts with seasoning. In a large stockpot, saute the onion and celery in butter until tender. Add the seasoning to the onion and celery mixture. Add the broth and bring to a boil. Add the half-and-half, soup, and water. Stir in the biscuits until they are covered with the liquid. Simmer for 20 minutes. Remove the chicken breasts from the broth and place in a baking dish. Spoon half of the broth over the chicken breasts and sprinkle with half of the cheese. Bake at 350 degrees until the chicken is cooked through and the broth is bubbling, about 1 hour. Repeat with the remaining ingredients.
Beat egg yolks and sugar till thick and light. Add flour. Fold in egg whites. Pour into greased and lined tin. Bake for 1 hour. Cut in wedges and serve with coffee.
Grate the zucchini. Squeeze out the liquid. Chop the onion. Mix the zucchini, breadcrumbs, and oregano. Add the other seasonings and the oil. Stuff chicken. Bake.

In skillet brown sausage. Drain fat. Add garlic clove to skilletcook until tender. Cut into 1 inch pieces. In large mixing bowl combine eggs, water, basil, chives and salt. Add sausage to the egg mixturemix well. On lightly floured surface roll out dough to 1/8 inch thickness. Cut dough into 6 rectangles. Spread the filling down center of dough. Fold dough over fillingpress edges together. Place seam side down on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 degrees for 14 to 18 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven. Top each roll with cheese. Return to oven to melt cheese. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Makes 6 servings.
name: easy crescent sausage and cheese appetizersingredients: refrigerated crescent dinner rolls, honey mustard, gruyere cheese, sausagespreparation:Prepare a lage baking sheet and spray with non-stick cooking spray. Unroll
In a saucepan over medium heat, saute garlic and zucchini for a few minutes. Salt to taste. Add pasta and toss. Serve immediately.

In large bowl combine all ingredients and mix until well blended. Press into greased 9x13 pan. Chill until firm. Cut into squares. Wrap individually.
name: peanut butter krispies energy barsingredients: margarine, marshmallows, creamy peanut butter, quaker oats, sesame seeds, rice krispies, peanuts, raisinspreparation:Melt together margarine, marshmallows, and peanut butter. Roast oats and sesame seeds seperately in a skillet over a low heat. Very swiftly mix together marshmallow mixture and the rest of the ingredients. Pat mixture on a greased jelly roll pan or cookie sheet. Let cool. Loosen sides and turn onto cutting board. Cut into bars. Wrap individually in waxed paper.
name: peanut butter crunch barsingredients: peanut butter, light corn syrup, sugar, butter, salt, corn flakes, rice krispies, chocolate frosting
Combine all ingredients in slow cooker and stir to coat roast. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours. Serve over egg noodles if desired.

Mix brown sugar and butter together. Add 1 tsp. Vanilla and 1 tsp. Pecans to mixture. Crush 8 graham crackers into mixture. Add 1 cup of miniature chips to mixture. Beat cream until stiff. Frost cupcakes and sprinkle 1 tsp. Miniature chips on frosting.

In a small saute pan, melt the butter. Add the carrots and crystallized ginger and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the brown sugar and cook until the mixture bubbles. Add the chicken broth and cook until the sauce thickens. Remove from the heat and season with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

Put lard into a skillet. When it begins to melt, add duck with its wings attached. When fat starts to brown the duck, add water or wine, salt and marjoram. Cook over low heat for about an hour and half or more (the time depends on the size of duck). Remove from heat. Let cool. Cut it into slices and serve with a salad of lettuce or cabbage.
Name: Honey Whiskey Sour Ingredients: 2 ounces bourbon 1 ounce honey 1 ounce lemon juice 1 ounce water 3-4 ounces ginger ale Preparation: Fill a shaker with ice cubes. Add bourbon, honey, lemon juice and water. Shake well and strain into a highball glass filled with ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale and stir gently. Garnish with an orange wedge.
Name: Chocolate Mudslide Ingredients: 2 ounces peppermint schnapps 2 ounces chocolate liqueur 4 ounces heavy cream 1 tables

To prepare the squash and bulgur wheat, peel the skin off the squash. Cut off the stems and seeds and dice the flesh. Bring 2 cups of water to a boil in a small saucepan. Add the bulgur and cook over low heat for 30 minutes. In a large bowl, mix the bulgur with the diced squash, feta cheese and sage. Sprinkle with black pepper and serve with a drizzle of agave and fresh lemon juice.
In this category you will find information about the fruit and vegetable butternut squash.

In a bowl, combine lemon juice, coriander, cayenne pepper, and salt. Rub half of the mixture over the turkey. In a large skillet, heat remaining mixture with olive oil over medium high heat. Add spinach and garlic. Cook until spinach is wilted. Remove from heat. Spoon spinach over the turkey. Sprinkle with pepper. Garnish with cilantro. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Serve.
In non-stick frying pan brown ground beef with diced onions. Drain fat. Add diced tomatoes. Add rice, water, chili powder and pepper. Cook covered for 20 minutes.

Mix all dressing ingredients in a bowl and set aside. Heat a skillet over medium high heat. Rub chicken with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Cook chicken for 4 minutes per side. Allow to rest 5 minutes. Meanwhile, combine all the dressing ingredients in a bowl. Cut chicken into bite size pieces. Toss with dressing and chill until ready to serve. Divide chicken mixture between 2 plates. Sprinkle with cherries and walnut pieces. Serve with boston lettuce.

Cut chicken into small pieces. Place in a 2 quart casserole dish. Stir together canned tomatoes & chilies with the remaining 1/2 can diced tomatoes & 1/2 can water. Pour over chicken. Top with onions & peppers. Cover & bake at 350 degrees for 1 1/2 hours or until chicken is cooked through & no longer pink inside. In a small bowl combine sour cream & chipotles until smoothpour over chicken before serving.

In a Dutch oven, saute the onion, celery and garlic powder in the bacon drippings over low heat until tender. Add the seasonings. Add the pinto beans. Add the stock. Heat through. Serve with crusty bread.

Combine first seven ingredients. Mix well. Add wings and toss to coat. Spread wings out in a single layer in a shallow baking dish. Bake at 400 for 1 hour. Flip wings and bake for an additional hour. If you like spicy food, you might want to add more hot sauce. This is a great dish for parties. It is a favorite in our home.

In a small bowl, combine flour, cinnamon, allspice and 2 tablespoons of the butter. Place in a resealable plastic bag. Cut the crust into 12 squares. Press 6 squares into the bottom of the 9x13-inch pan. Evenly spread the pie filling over the crust squares. Place the remaining crust squares on top of the filling in a lattice pattern. Sprinkle with the brown sugar and nuts. Drizzle with lemon juice. Place the bagged spice mixture on top of the crust squares. Seal the bag and use a rolling pin or hammer to crush the mixture over the top of the crust squares. Bake for 35 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly. Let stand for 5 minutes. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped topping.

dip the chicken breasts in seasoned flour and saute in olive oil till browned. Add the diced tomatoes and garlic. Cook until the liquid thickens. Add the onions and cook 2 minutes longer. Season to taste and garnish with olives. Serve over rice.

Place the asparagus spears on a rack. Drizzle with soy sauce. Roast for 10 to 15 minutes or until tender but firm when pierced with a knife. Remove from oven and set aside to cool slightly. In a small bowl, combine the dark sesame oil with the garlic and set aside to marinate. In a small bowl, combine the sesame seeds with the pepper and saltset aside. To assemble the rafts, place the asparagus spears on a platter. Sprinkle the garlic sesame sauce over the spears and top with the sesame seed mixture. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Wash fresh green beans and trim the ends. Place in a large bowl. Add the scallions, garlic cloves, olive oil, lemon peel, salt & freshly ground black pepper. Toss to coat evenly. Transfer to a roasting pan and bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes or until tender crisp. Remove from oven, add the sliced almonds, toss to coat evenly, and serve immediately.

Dice the chicken and the mushrooms and saute them in oil until they are cooked. Add lemon juice and wine. Cook for a couple minutes. Add the cream and cook till thickened. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve over rice or pasta.

In a large skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add steaks and brown on both sides. Add cornstarch and worcestershire sauce to skillet. Stir and cook until mixture thickens. Place in crockpot. Add remaining ingredients and mix. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours. Serve with steamed brown rice.

Microwave sugar and water to soft ball stage (250 degrees). Add corn syrup to the boiling mixture. Stir constantly until thermometer reaches hard crack stage (300 degrees). Add butter, salt, and baking sodamix well. Add vanilla and mix well again. Drop by spoonfuls onto wax paper. Let stand for one hour or overnight to set.
Rub chicken with paste and yogurt. Add lime juice. Let stand for 2-3 hours. Cook at 375 degrees until done. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Unroll the crescent rolls, and separate them into 4 rectangles. Place the rectangles in the bottom of a 9 x 13 inch baking pan. In a saucepan over low heat, combine the butter and brown sugar until melted and smooth. Stir in the almonds. Pour the mixture over the crescent rolls, and pat down the filling gently. Place the brie in the center of the filling. Fold the sides of the crescent rolls up and around the brie. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes, or until the crescent rolls are golden brown and the cheese is melted. Serve warm.

Heat butter in a saucepan over medium-high heat until foaming. Add flour and stir with a whisk. Add water gradually and stir. Add the bouillon cubes, turn heat to medium-low and simmer. Add chicken. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add broccoli and simmer for 3 minutes. Add cream and bring to a boil. Turn heat to low and simmer for 3 minutes. Stir in cheese.

Combine raisin bran cereal, sugar, and flour in a bowl. Stir in buttermilk, oil, and eggs. Add pineapple and raisins. Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Fill greased muffin pans 3/4 full. Bake for 20 minutes.

Brush both sides of each slice of bread with melted butter. Sprinkle with blue cheese and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Broil until cheeses are melted and crust is lightly browned. Serve warm with salad.
Combine milk and soup. Cook rice in it and salt to taste. Combine with cheese and chilies and serve.

Cook the green beans in a large pot of boiling water for 3 to 4 minutes. Drain and set aside. Combine the remaining ingredients in a bowl. Add the cooked green beans and toss well. Chill 1 hour. Toss again before serving.

In a mixing bowl, combine parsley, oregano, and seasonings with the lamb. Let stand for 10 minutes. Heat the oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add the lamb and brown it for about 10 minutes on all sides. Add the wine and bring it to a boil, cover and simmer for about 1 hour or until the lamb is tender. Transfer the lamb to a serving platter, reserving the pan juices in another bowl. Arrange the tomato slices on top of the lamb. Heat the pan drippings in a large saute pan over high heat. Add the diced tomatoes and cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, or until the tomatoes are thickened. Add the artichoke hearts, garlic, and black pepper and cook for about 10 minutes longer. Pour the sauce over the lamb.

Mix together ranch dip mix and egg in a shallow dish. Dip chicken breast in egg mix and then in the Panko bread crumbs. Fry in a skillet with a little cooking oil until cooked through. Crumble bacon and top each burger with it. Top with cheese and serve with salsa or ranch dressing.

Mix cornbread mix with milk. Add egg, onion and melted butter. Add broth slowly until dough is stiff. Divide dough in half. Press each half onto the bottom of an 8-inch square baking dish. Top each dough layer with about 2 cups of the chicken mixture. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

Place cream cheese in food processor. Process until creamy. Add garlic. Process to combine. Add egg white and process until combined. Refrigerate until ready to use. Place 1 tsp of cream cheese mixture in center of each wrapper. Fold over in half and press edges together to seal. Deep fry at 375 degrees for 2-3 minutes until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Makes 2 dozen.

Place romaine lettuce in a serving bowl. Add cabbage and toss lightly. Set aside. In a small saucepan over medium-low heat, heat oil and vinegar. Add mustard and heat until mixture begins to simmer. Remove from heat. Stir in cheese until melted. Pour dressing over romaine lettuce mixture. Toss lightly. Sprinkle with green onions. Serve immediately.

Spray 8x8 inch pan with cooking spray. Layer sausage and croutons in bottom of pan. Beat together eggs, milk, and seasonings. Add spinach, mushrooms and cheeses. Pour over sausage and croutons. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Bake 45 minutes at 350 degrees. Let set 5 minutes before serving. Serves 6.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil over medium-high heat. Add carrots and boil until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain, rinse under cold water to stop cooking and drain again. Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add brown sugar, stirring until melted. Stir in honey, white wine vinegar and spices until well blended. Stir in cooked carrots until coated well. Serve warm or room temperature.

Slice bell peppers. Slice onions into thin rounds. Heat oil in large skillet. Add bell peppers and onions. Cook, stirring frequently, for 3-5 minutes. Remove from heat. Whisk eggs, egg whites and italian seasoning together in a large bowl. Add vegetables. Add peas. Pour into skillet. Cook over low heat until edges of frittata begin to brown. Place skillet into oven. Broil for 2 minutes or until top is golden brown. Cut into wedges to serve.

Puree cucumber and ranch dressing in a blender until smooth. Add milk and pulse until smooth. Add horseradish and pulse until combined. Add cider vinegar and pulse until smooth. Add wasabi powder, salt and cayenne pepper and pulse until combined. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate for up to 8 hours before serving.

Cook the broccoli florets for 2 minutes. Drain well. In a large bowl combine the broccoli florets with the mayonnaise and prepared mustard. Fold in the prepared horseradish. Serve at room temperature or refrigerate.

In crock pot place tomatoes with onion and garlic and tomato sauce and stir in italian seasoning. Add chicken and cover with water. Cook on low for 6 hours or high for 3 hours. Add orzo pasta and cook on high for 20 minutes or until done.

Season the chicken with the seasoning salt. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the chicken and cook until browned on both sides. Transfer to the slow cooker. Add the 7-Up and parsley flakes. Cover and cook on low for 6 hours.

In a large saucepan, bring the stock, with the dill added, to a boil. Add rice. Reduce heat and simmer, covered, for about 15 minutes-- just until the rice is tender but still firm. In the bowl with the beaten eggs, slowly stir about 2 cups of the soup in, beating constantly. Once combined, slowly pour this mixture back into the soup-pot. Increase the heat to medium and cook, stirring constantly, for about 5 minutes or until the soup has slightly thickened. Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice. Taste and add salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Place all the sauce ingredients in a saucepan and bring to a gentle simmer. Set aside to cool. When cool, combine the marinade with the meat. Cover tightly with plastic wrap and place in the fridge to marinate for at least an hour. When ready to cook, heat the oven to 180c. Line a shallow baking dish with aluminum foil or a silicon mat. Place the meat on the base of the dish. Spoon over the remaining marinade. Bake in the oven for 40 minutes. Serve with toasted sesame seeds and steamed rice.

Heat oven to 375F degrees. Cream buttergradually add sugarsadd vanillamix well. Add eggs one at a timebeating after each additionadd wateradd dry ingredientsbeat until well blended. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheetflatten slightly with wet spoonbake 7-8 minutes or until light browncool 5 minutesremove to wire rack. Makes about 3 1/2 dozen.

Separate crescent rolls into 12 triangles. Spread chicken with about 1 Tbsp. Of soup mixture. Fold into triangles and place on baking sheets. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 c. Cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes. Serve warm. Makes 12 servings.
name: roast turkey with sage dressingpreparation: In a large mixing bowl combine the bread cubes, onion, sage, thyme, rosemary, marjoram, pepper, salt, celery seeds, parsley, parsley flakes, parsley salt, celery salt, and celery seed. In a small bowl combine the melted butter, poultry seasoning, poultry fat (optional), and chicken fat (optional). Add the butter mixture to the dry ingredients and mix well with the hands, kneading the dressing until it is soft and moist and holds together nicely. Divide the dressing in half, place one half in the roasting pan, then place the turkey on

Mix butter, peanut butter and sugars until light and creamy. Add egg and mix well. Add rest of ingredients and mix well. Roll into small balls and press with fork dipped in flour. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Let stand 1 minute.

Cook pasta according to package directions, omitting the fatdrain. Cook the bacon until the fat rendersadd the tomatoes to the drippingscook over medium heat until the tomatoes are hotadd the pastatoss until the pasta is well coatedadd the buttertoss until meltedadd the colbytoss to combineserve immediately.
In a 2-quart saucepan, combine broth, cumin and salt. Heat to boilingreduce heat. Stir in rice and simmer 20 minutes or until tender. Stir in green onions. Serve hot.

Heat butter in skillet. Add onion and saute until softened. Add olive oil and saute until onions are golden brown. Whisk together eggs, salt and pepper in bowl until thoroughly combined. Pour egg mixture over the onions in the skillet. Cook until the bottom is set, then place spatula over the center of the omelette, lift up the sides of the pan and tilt the pan until the uncooked egg flows underneath the spatula. Cook for about 1 minute longer to set the center of the omelette, or until the eggs are cooked to your liking. Slide the omelette out of the pan onto a cutting board or plate. Slice in half and serve warm.
name: omelet with flowersingredients: fresh edible flower, eggs, water, flour, salt, pepper, cheese, olive oilpreparation:Beat eggs add water and flour and make a batter. Combine with cheese, flowers, salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in a pan. Poor the mixture in the pan or take spoonfuls of batter and drop into the

Prepare cake mix according to directions. Beat cream cheese until soft. Gradually add powdered sugar. Spread half of batter over prepared cake. Spread filling on top. Bake as directed. Sprinkle nuts over filling. Bake topping. Spread topping over nuts. Cut into squares.

Saute onions in butter till tender. Add mustard, poppy seeds and worcestershire sauce. Place in refrigerator until it reaches spreading consistency. Open the rolls, spread both sides with the mixture. Place small amount of ham and cheese on roll and replace the top of the roll. Cover with foil and heat at 425 degrees for 20 minutes.

Separate crescents into 8 triangles. Press 1 corner of each triangle to the opposite corner to form a triangle. Pinch corners together. Place 1 tbsp jam in each crescent. Sprinkle with coconut and nuts. Bake as directed on package.
Combine all ingredients in a blender or food processor. Process to desired consistency. Store in refrigerator for up to two weeks. Serve with lettuce, greens or grilled fish or chicken.
Prepare pudding as directed on box. Stir in lemonade mix and milk. Chill. Beat together pudding and cool whip. Spread over graham cracker crust and freeze for 1 hour or until firm.

Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until translucent (3-4 minutes). Add arborio rice and cook for about 1 minute until it is well coated and slightly translucent. Add the broth and cook for about 5 minutes or until most of the broth is absorbed and the rice is al dente. Add the salami and cook for about 1 minute more. Stir in the sun-dried tomato and cook for another minute or two. Add the olives and the dried chili pepper and continue stirring for an additional minute or so. Add the cheese and the black olives and cook for a minute or two more until the cheese is melted. Serve immediately.
Beat egg. Add sugar. Mix with flour, baking powder, vanilla, and salt. Add apples and nuts. Bake in muffin tins.
Beat egg. Add sugar to egg. Add lemon juice, orange juice, salt and vanilla. Stir in fruit. Pour over fruit. Serve.

Rinse the fish and pat dry with paper towels. In a shallow dish combine the honey and mustard. Dip the fish in the mixture and then in the breadcrumbs. Sprinkle with the thyme. Place the fish in a single layer on a lightly greased baking sheet and bake at 400 degrees F for 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily. Garnish with fresh parsley if desired. Serve with fresh lemon wedges.

Heat oven to 425 degrees f. Heat large heavy saucepan over medium heat. Add couscous, stirring welladd 2 cups water. Bring to a boil. Add 2 tablespoons butter and the scallionsreduce heat to low. Cover tightly and cook for 5 minutes or until liquid has been absorbed. Remove from heatlet stand for 5 minutes. Stir in remaining 1 tablespoon butter until melted. Garnish with the parsley. Serves 4.

In a food processor or blender, combine all the ingredients except the peanuts and paprika and blend until well mixed. Put into a serving bowl and add paprika and stir gently. Garnish with peanuts and serve with vegetables.

Cook the onion and green pepper in the olive oil until tender. Add the ground chuck and cook until no longer pink. Add the tomato sauce and simmer for about 40 minutes. Add the kidney beans and the corn and simmer for another 30 minutes. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Brown lamb and beef in a single layer in hot oil for 2 minutes per side. Add onions and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes or until onions are soft and translucent. Add stock and bring to a boil over high heat. Cover and cook over low heat for 2 hours or until meat is tender. Add prunes and apricots and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove meat to a platter and keep warm. In a small bowl, combine tomato paste and 2 tablespoons of water to make a smooth paste. Add to stock and simmer for 5 minutes or until sauce thickens slightly. Stir in ginger and cinnamon and cook for 5 minutes more. Pour sauce over meat and sprinkle with almonds. Serve over couscous or rice.

mix together 1 cup of flour, 3/4 cup of sugar, 1/4 teaspoon of salt and 2 teaspoons of baking powder. Stir in 1/2 cup of butter and 1/3 cup of milk. Add 1 teaspoon vanilla. Pour over fruit. Bake at 375 degrees until top is golden brown.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat melt the butter. Add the flour and cook for one minute. Slowly add the milk and continue stirring constantly for about 5 minutes or until the sauce thickens. Stir in the salt and nutmeg.

Drain sardines and mash them with a fork. Add onion and celery. Add remaining ingredients. Serve on crackers or bread.
You will need some type of container to mix everything in. I use a plastic gallon storage container and use a hand mixer.
Blend all ingredients together. It will look very liquidy but as it sits in the refrigerator it will thicken.

Spray muffin tin with cooking spray. Place a wonton wrapper in each cup and press to adhere to sides. Bake at 350f for 5 minutes. Mix together all other ingredients and spoon into cups. Bake for 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Place the butter and 3/4 cup of the sugar into a bowl and beat until light and creamy, then beat in the vanilla essence and egg until well combined. Sift the plain and rice flours together with the baking powder and mix with the butter mixture, stirring until well combined and smooth. Divide the mixture into 20 walnut-sized balls and press into the wells of a greased 12-hole muffin pan (or use a 12-hole donut pan). Press 1 teaspoon of the jam into the center of each muffin then top with another muffin.

Soak liver in water for 1 hour. Drain. Slice liver. Place slices between 2 pieces of wax paper. Pound until about 1/4-inch thick. Dip in flour. Brown lightly in bacon fat. Slice bacon into small pieces. Saute bacon pieces with sliced onions. Cook until bacon is crisp and onions are tender. Pour off fat. Pour 1 cup of water over liver and onions. Cover and simmer until tender, about 1 hour. Remove bacon pieces from onions. Season with tarragon and pepper. Serve over hot biscuits.

In a 2 quart saucepan add the water and bouillon cubes. Bring to a boil and add the diced onion, carrot and celery. Lower heat to medium and simmer for about 15 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Add the diced tomatoes and garlic clove and stir. Simmer for another 15 minutes or until the tomatoes are cooked through. Add the cooked noodles and stir gently. Add the chicken and cook for another 5 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions and cook until soft. Stir in green chiles. Stir in cheese and sour cream. Pour into tortillas and roll up. Place in a lightly buttered baking dish. Spread enchilada sauce over top of each rolled tortilla. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes. Sprinkle with chopped cilantro and serve with salsa or sour cream.
Mix all ingredients. Shape into small balls (about 1 inch). Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 for 8 minutes. Remove from oven and cool on wire rack. Roll in chocolate sprinkles if desired.

In a large pot, combine the bacon, onion, garlic, water and brown sugar. Bring to a boil over high heat. Lower the heat to a simmer. Cook until the bacon is cooked through (about 15 minutes). Stir in the vinegar, cider vinegar, salt and red pepper. Add the collards. Cook for 15-20 minutes more. Remove from the heat. Let stand 5 minutes.

Spread one side of each cracker with butter and sprinkle with brown sugar. Arrange with almonds on top in a single layer in an ungreased jelly roll pan. Bake at 400 for 7 minutes. Cool completely in pan before breaking into pieces.

In a large saucepan, saute garlic in butter until golden. Add curry powder. Stir in chicken broth, tomatoes, thyme and parsley. Cook over medium-high heat for about 5 minutes. Add the rice. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat. Simmer uncovered for about 10 minutes. Add the chicken. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

Place a layer of graham crackers in the bottom of an 8-in. Square baking pan. In a blender or food processor, process margarine until smooth. Add the egg yolks and process until smooth. Add the sugar and process until well blended. Add the condensed milk and process until smooth. Add the real lemon juice and process until smooth. Spoon mixture on top of crackers. Sprinkle with additional crackers. Freeze until firm. Spread with whipped topping. Freeze until ready to serve.
name: orange lemon parfaits low fat low sugaringredients: sugar-free lemon gelatin, fresh orange juice, low-fat cream cheese, evaporated skim milk, vanilla extractpreparation: Sprinkle gelatin over orange juice in a heavy saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium high heat, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Combine remaining ingredients in a blender. Add gelatin mixture and pure. Chill before serving in individual serving glasses.
name: old fashioned homemade lemonade concentrateingredients: citric

Process garlic in blender. Add all other ingredients. Blend to smooth dressing. Refrigerate for several hours to blend flavors. Stir before using. Makes enough dressing for 4 servings. Dressing is good for 1 week.

Melt butter in a saute pan, add chopped sprouts and cook until tender but still firm. Add whipping cream, parsley and seasoning and continue to cook until cream thickens and coats the sprouts. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in large pan over medium heat. Stir in flour until smooth. Add milk gradually stirring constantly until mixture is thickened and bubbly. Add bouillon stirring until dissolved. Stir in beef cubes until heated through. Serve over biscuits or toast with parsley if desired.

In a saucepan bring water, sugar and candies to a boil and stir until candies are melted and dissolved. Remove from heat and cool. In a large pitcher mix the water, candies, lemonade and orange juice concentrates and stir until well blended. Cover and freeze for 4 hours or until solid. Remove from freezer and stir in the sherbet and the ginger ale. Put in ice cream cups and garnish with maraschino cherries and oranges.
