In a large bowl, mix the cake mix and butter until it resembles a coarse meal. Press into a greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Cool completely in pan. Beat the powdered sugar, butter and milk together until smooth. Spread over the cooled crust. Sprinkle with the chocolate chips and refrigerate until ready to serve.

Heat oven to 350. Grease 13 x 9 pan with shortening or nonstick cooking spray. In large skillet, saute onion in shortening until tender. Stir in tomatoes and corn until heated through. Stir in chili with beans and cooked rice. Spread mixture evenly in pan. Top with shredded cheese and sprinkle with paprika. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes or until bubbly. Let stand 5 minutes before cutting. Yield 6-8 servings.

Preheat oven to 400f. Lightly oil a baking dish. Combine mayo, cream cheese and garlic in a blender and puree till smooth. In a large bowl combine mayonnaise mixture and roasted peppers and artichokes. Add parmesan cheese and mix until blended. Spoon mixture evenly in baking dish and bake for 10-15 minutes or until heated through. Serve with crackers or pita chips.
The Artichoke is a perennial thistle native to southern Europe and North Africa and is now grown commercially in California and Florida. The Artichoke is a member of the Thistle family and its botanical name is Cynara scolymus.
Artichokes are one of the most nutrient dense foods in existence and contain high levels of Vitamin K, C, E, magnesium and potassium.
Artichokes are also a good source of fiber and folic acid and are low in calories and fat free.
Artichokes also contain silymarin (a flavonoid), which has been proven to be protect

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl, mix the bread crumbs and the dried apple. Add the sage, black pepper and salt and mix well. In another bowl, combine the paprika, the red pepper and the nutmeg. Add the turkey and mix well. Stir in the apple mixture and mix thoroughly. Shape into 16 patties. Place patties on a wax paper-lined baking sheet. Coat with nonstick cooking spray. Bake for about 25 minutes or until no longer pink in center.

Bring a pot of water to a boil for pasta. Cook the pasta according to package directions. In a large skillet or saucepan, heat the butter until it melts. Add the garlic and stir until it is golden. Add the tomatoes and basil. Bring to a boil. Simmer for 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and season with balsamic vinegar. Add the hot pepper flakes and parmesan cheese and mix well. Drain the pasta and toss with the sauce. Serve immediately.

Rinse beans& soak overnight in fresh water. Drain& cook in a pot with 3 cups of water. Boil for 2 minutes, then turn heat down& cook for 2 hours. Add 3/4 cup coconut milk& 1 clove garlic chopped. Cook for 1/2 hour. Add 1/2 tsp salt& 1/2 tsp pepper. Cook for 15 minutes more. Serve over white rice with a side of meat or fried plantains.

Place tea bags and fresh mint in a large measuring cup or teapot. Pour boiling water over all and steep for 5 minutes. Strain into a large pitcher. Add apple juice. Stir in lime and apple slices. Refrigerate until cold. Serve over ice.
Name: Lemon Mint Iced Tea Ingredients: 4 Tea bags (your favorite tea), fresh lemon, fresh lime, fresh mint (optional), boiling water Directions: Steep tea for at least five minutes in boiling water. Remove the tea bags and add the lemon and lime slices. Stir and allow to steep for at least an hour. Serve over ice. Name: Mango Peach Iced Tea Ingredients: 1 box (4 serving size) fruit flavored drink mix (mango or peach), lemonade concentrate, boiling water Directions: Prepare fruit flavored drink mix according to package directions using boiling water. Remove from heat and add lemonade concentrate. Stir well and serve over ice. Name: Berry Delight Iced Tea Ingredients: St

Heat a medium size sauce pan. Add the water, brown sugar and vinegar. Bring to a boil. Add the drained beans and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the red onion and bell pepper and simmer for another 10 minutes. Add the Mexican corn and heat for 5 minutes more. Cool and serve.

Heat the butter in a saucepan and add the onions and garlic. Cook over medium heat until the onions are soft. Add the cherry tomatoes, curry powder and chickpeas. Stir well and cook until the chickpeas are warmed through and the tomatoes have broken down. Stir in the lemon juice, sugar and 1/2 cup water. Season to taste with salt and black pepper.

Toss apple pieces with applesauce and lemon juice and lemon rind. In a mixing bowl beat egg yolks slightly and then beat in apples and all other ingredients until blended. Turn into unbaked 9-inch shell. Bake in preheated 400°F oven until a knife inserted in center comes out clean, 45 minutes to 1 hour. Let cool on a wire rack. Serve with sweetened whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Mix all ingredients except nuts in a small saucepan. Heat over medium heat until all ingredients are well blended. Stir occasionally while heating. Remove from heat. Stir in nuts until well coated. Spread the nuts onto the baking sheet in a single layer and bake until the caramel is browned and the nuts are crispy, about 20 minutes. Let cool completely on the baking sheet. Break into pieces and serve or store in an airtight container for up to 1 week.

Pour the Guinness into a saucepan and heat through (about 10 minutes). Whisk in the brown sugar and simmer for 5 minutes more. Slice the bananas into 4 pieces and arrange them on plates or in bowls. Pour the Guinness mixture over the top and serve immediately with some whipped cream if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cut bread into cubes. Combine bread cubes with cranberries and orange marmalade in a large bowl. Add milk, eggs, and sugar. Beat until well combined. Spoon into two greased loaf pans. Bake for 40 minutes. Cool. In a medium saucepan, combine caramel ice cream and milk. Cook over medium heat until melted. Stir in cranberry sauce and cinnamon. Pour over cooled bread pudding. Chill until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix cake mix with melted butter. Spread evenly in greased 9 x 13 baking pan. Spread crushed pineapple over top of cake batter. Sprinkle blueberries over the top. Sprinkle with nuts. Bake 30 to 40 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with whipped topping or vanilla ice cream.

Place lime juice, honey and ginger in a large bowl. Stir in soy sauce and vinegar. Thread fillets onto skewers. Place in marinade and refrigerate 3 hours. Preheat broiler. Place fish on broiler pan and broil 4 inches from heat for 4 to 6 minutes. Turn and broil 3 to 4 minutes longer or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Garnish with green onion and sesame seeds.
name: salmon tuna sushi skeweringredients: soy sauce, rice vinegar, seaweed flakes, sushi rice, sushi rice, toasted sesame oil, black pepper, green onion, soy sauce, sugarpreparation:Mix rice vinegar and salt in a small bowl. Stir in rice, cover and refrigerate 30 minutes. Meanwhile, combine toasted sesame oil, pepper and green onion in a small bowl. Thread a piece of salmon on one end of each skewer and a piece of tuna on the other end.

Sift together flour, baking powder, salt, and cream of tartar. Cut in vegetable shortening and mix to crumbs. Add milk, then mix to soft dough. Knead lightly. Roll 1/2 inch thick. Cut with 2-inch cutters. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake in 400 degree oven 10 minutes. Cool on wire racks.

Cut cabbage in small thin strips. Combine cabbage, vinegar, sugar, bay leaf and peppercorns in a medium pot. Cover and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer until cabbage is very tender. Drain cabbage well in a colander set in the sink. Let cool. Add remaining 2 teaspoons of vinegar. Cover cabbage and refrigerate at least 1 hour. Whisk together oil and shallots in a small bowl. Pour over cabbage. Toss until well coated. Let stand for 1 hour. Serve at room temperature.

Place cutlets in flour. Brown in margarine over moderate heat. Remove from pan and set aside. Add olive oil to pan. Add oranges, onion, garlic. Saute until soft. Add wine, water and juice. Add veal to sauce. Heat thoroughly. Add parsley. Season to taste. Garnish with orange sections. Serve over hot cooked rice.
Mix together mayonnaise and yellow mustard. Spread on tortilla. Top with cheese and meat. Roll up. Cut in 1 inch pieces. Serve with lettuce leaves and more mustard.

In a skillet, boil together the potatoes, butter, flour, milk and cream cheese until the mixture thickens and becomes smooth. Sprinkle in the salt and pepper and mix well. Pour half of the mixture into a greased casserole dish or baking dish. Sprinkle with half of the cheese. Add the onions and the rest of the potato mixture. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese. Bake at 400 degrees for about one hour or until done.

Preheat oven to 400. In a bowl, combine dry ingredients. In another bowl, combine milk and water. Add milk mixture and mix until combined. Place spoonfuls of the mixture on a baking sheet. Bake for 12 minutes or until the dumplings are firm. Cool 1 minute. In a saucepan over medium heat combine the remaining ingredients and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and add the dumplings. Cook for 3 minutes. Serve with whipped cream.

Preheat oven 400 degrees F. Line baking sheets with parchment paper. Whisk together eggs and mayonnaise. Place goat cheese on paper and coat with mayonnaise mixture. Roll in flour. Dip in oil and place on baking sheets. Bake 10 minutes until lightly browned. Remove from oven and sprinkle with chopped hazelnuts. Cool. Serve as a snack or with vegetables.

Preheat oven to 400. Beat egg white and water. Dip each fish fillet in egg mixture. Roll in crumbs. Place in a baking dish. Add lemon pepper and parsley. Bake for 20-30 minutes. Serve with tartar sauce.

In a saucepan over medium heat, melt 1 tbls of the butter. Stir in the cream cheese until melted. Stir in the spinach fettuccini. Add the remaining 1 tbls of the butter and stir until melted. Add the crushed red pepper flakes to taste. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese.

Heat oven to 400 degrees f. In medium skillet, cook sausage over medium heat until no longer pinkdrain. Unroll dough. In center of each rectangle, press 1/2 cup sausage. Bake as directed. In small bowl, beat eggs, milk and salt and pepper. Spoon over hash browns. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake until center of each rectangle is set. Let stand 1 minute. Cut into 12 wedges. Serve immediately. Makes 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line the bottom of an 8x8 baking dish with 2 tablespoons of the oil. Add the potatoes and the onions. Season with the thyme. Drizzle the remaining 2 tablespoons oil over the vegetables. Add the kielbasa. Season with the salt and the pepper. Roast in the preheated oven until the potatoes are golden and tender and the sausage is no longer pink in the center, about 45 minutes.

Peel and slice eggplants. Place in a large pot of boiling water. Blanch for 3 to 4 minutes. Drain the eggplants. In a blender or food processor combine the lemon juice, garlic cloves, salt, parsley, black pepper, tahini, scallion, olive oil and 3 or 4 tablespoons of hot water. Blend on high speed. Pour into a serving bowl. Garnish with parsley.

Cut the potatoes into 1/4-inch-thick rounds. In a large bowl combine butter, thyme, salt and hot sauce. Add the potatoes and toss until well coated. Transfer to a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes or until potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork. Serve warm or at room temperature with additional hot sauce for dipping or drizzling.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease two 9 inch round pans. Sift flour and baking powder together. In large bowl mix together cake mix, eggs and oil. Mix in flour and extracts. Pour into pans and bake for 20 to 25 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool. Fill and frost as desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x9 inch square baking dish with butter. Sift together the flour, baking powder, ground ginger, brown sugar, white sugar, salt, and butter into a mixing bowlblend well. Add the golden syrup, egg yolks, milk, and boiling watermix well. In a small bowl, beat egg whites with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form. Fold the egg whites into the batter with a rubber spatula. Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes, or until the top of the pudding is golden brown. Dust the top of the pudding with the confectioner's sugar just before serving.

Combine honey, cinnamon, cardamom and water to make a glaze. Place carrot slices in a skillet with a little olive oil to prevent sticking. Cook until tender crisp. Drizzle glaze over hot carrots. Sprinkle with cilantro and serve immediately.

Mix together flour, Crisco, and salt. Cut in margarine with pastry cutter or fork to the size of small peas. Add egg and vinegar. Gradually add water one tablespoon at a time until dough forms a ball that is moist enough to hold together when pinched between your forefinger and thumb. Pat into a ball. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for several hours or overnight. Roll out for your favorite pie or pastries.

In a large frying pan combine the ham, flour, and broth. Cook over medium heat until the flour is cooked out. Stir in the soup and milk. In a greased casserole dish layer the potatoes, carrots, and onion in the dish. Pour the ham mixture over the top. Cover the casserole dish with foil and cook in a preheated oven at 350 f for 50 to 60 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Uncover the casserole dish and sprinkle the cheese over the top. Cook an additional 5 minutes or until the cheese melts. Serves 6 to 8 people.

Preheat oven to 400f. Toss the potatoes with the oil, thyme, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Transfer to a baking sheet and spread into a single layer. Roast in the oven until the potatoes are crisp and golden brown, 40 to 45 minutes. Transfer to a large bowl to cool slightly. Toss in the artichokes and onion, then mix in the feta. Serve at once.

Combine butter and sugar and mix until creamy. Add eggs and mix thoroughly. Add flour and mix. Spread in a 9x13 pan and bake at 375 for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with cherry pie filling. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes or until the filling is bubbly. Cool completely. Cut into squares.

Combine first four ingredients in a small bowl. Spread over corn. Place on grill and cook until heated through and browned on all sides, about 15 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.
name: herb grilled corn wwingredients: corn, butter, salt, fresh cilantro stems, dried rosemary, dried thymepreparation:Preheat grill to medium high. Tear off 4 sheets of tin foil. Brush corn evenly with melted butter and sprinkle with salt, cilantro sprigs and with the rosemary and thyme. Wrap corn with the tin foil. Place wrapped corn on the grill and grill covered until corn in tender.
name: grilled corn with citrus butteringredients: orange peel, lemon peel, lime peel, kosher salt, unsalted butter, vegetable oil cooking spray, cornpreparation:Combine first 4 ingredients in small bowl. Mash to combine. Mix in butter. Preheat barbecue.
Combine oil, vinegar and mustard in a medium bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Add lettuces and cabbage. Add the drained mandarin oranges and toss well.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease 2 - 8 inch round cake pans. Line bottoms with parchment paper. Grease parchment. Combine flour, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl. Mix in butter with your hands until mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in milk and ricotta until well combined. Whisk together sugar and eggs in a large bowl. Stir in pure vanilla extract. Fold flour mixture into egg mixture. Divide batter among prepared pans. Bake until tops are golden brown and toothpick inserted into center comes out clean, 35 to 40 minutes. Cool on wire racks for 10 minutes. Remove cakes from pans. Cool completely. Slice cakes.

In a large pot, combine the beans, 1/2 teaspoon of the salt and enough water to cover the beans by 2 inches. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer the beans for about 30 minutes until they are very tender but still have some bite. Drain the beans and set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the oil, add the garlic, cumin, paprika and cloves. Stir for 30 seconds to toast the spices. Add the almonds and cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring often. Add the cooked beans to the skillet, stir well to combine. Stir in the remaining 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Cook over low heat for a minute or two to warm through. Transfer the mixture to a large serving bowl and serve at once or let stand at room temperature for 15 minutes or more to allow the flavors to blend. Sprinkle with paprika before serving. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 375f degrees. In a small bowl, combine the spices with the salt. Set aside. In a small bowl, combine the egg white with the canola oil and beat until blended. Put the pecan halves in a large bowl and add the egg white mixture. Stir and coat the pecans evenly. Add the spice mixture and stir until the pecans are evenly coated. Spread the pecans on 2 baking sheets and bake until the coating is crisp, about 20 minutes, rotating the pans halfway through baking. Cool on the baking sheets for 5 minutes and then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Store in an airtight container for up to 1 week.
Nuts are the fruit of trees and bushes of the genus Juglans, which is native to the Northern Hemisphere. Nut trees and bushes are also called Juglans.
The edible part of the nut is the seed in the kernel. The kernel is usually surrounded by a hard shell (husk) that is usually removed before eating. The shells are often very hard

Brown beef and pork in large skillet. Drain fat. Stir in taco seasoning. Add green pepper and tomato sauce. Cook 5 minutes. Stir in diced tomatoes and cooked pasta. Sprinkle with monterey jack cheese. Spoon mixture into baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Top with sour cream. Serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large skillet brown bacon and onions. Stir in mushrooms and cook for 1 minute. Add the shrimp and cook until done. Add the cheese and stir until melted. Remove from heat. Pour into pastry shell. In a bowl whisk together the eggs and cream. Pour into pastry shell. Bake for 35 minutes. Cool 5 minutes before serving.

Light a grill. In a shallow dish, whisk the mayo with the mustard. Whisk in 1 Tbsp. oil. Whisk in the lemon juice and zest. Whisk in the garlic. Add the salt and pepper. Add the asparagusturn to coat. Let stand for 30 minutes. Grill the asparagus over moderately high heat, turning occasionally until tender and blistered in spots, about 6 minutes. Serve warm.

Combine the cooked rice with half-and-half cream. Season with salt and pepper and bring to a simmer. In a separate bowl combine the egg yolks with the egg whites. Stir into the simmering mixture. Stir over low heat until the mixture is smooth. Remove from the heat. Beat the egg whites until soft peaks form. Fold into the rice mixture. Turn into a baking dish and top with Parmesan cheese and green onion. Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes.
Bring 2 cups water to a boil. Add potatoes and cook until tender. Drain and add butter and milk to hot potatoes and mash well. Add remaining ingredients and stir well.

Beat together shortening and 1/2 c. of the sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in egg. Gradually add the milk and beat well. Combine the flour, cocoa and the remaining 1/2 c. sugarstir well. Gradually add the flour mixture to the creamed mixturebeat well. Stir in vanilla and baking soda. Fill cupcake papers with batter 2/3 full. Bake at 350 for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool on racks for 10 minutes before removing from pans to cool completely. Frost with marshmallow creme. Makes about 24 cookies.

In a medium bowl, beat together cream cheese and butter. Add icing sugar and mix. Add brown sugar and mix. Stir in mini chocolate chips and skor bits. Refrigerate for 3 hours or overnight. Roll into a ball and roll in coconut. Serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Butter an 8-cup baking dish. Tear bread into 1-inch pieces. Combine bread with 2 cups of the soymilk in the dishset aside for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, place remaining 1 cup soymilk in a small bowladd egg substitutewhisk until well blended. Add peanut butter and brown sugarwhisk until well blended. Add remaining 1/2 cup soymilkwhisk until well blended. Pour peanut butter mixture over breadtoss to coat. Sprinkle with the chocolate chipstoss gently to coat. Bake 30 minutes. Cool slightly. Serve warm or cold. Serves 4-6. Makes 1 1/2 quarts.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Sprinkle ribs with salt and pepper. Place in greased baking dish. Combine remaining ingredients in medium bowl. Spoon over ribs. Cover dish with foil. Bake 1 hour. Remove from oven. Uncover and bake 1 hour more.
name: pork skillet supperingredients: onion, vegetable oil, condensed cream of celery soup, milk, worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, cooked pork, potato, frozen peaspreparation:In a skillet, saute onion in oil until tender. Stir in soup, milk, worcestershire, salt and pepper. Mix well. Add pork, potatoes and peas. Heat through.
name: sticky pork with bok choyingredients: oil, pork fillets, oyster sauce, honey, water, ginger, bok choy, green onions, corianderpreparation:Heat large pan over medium heat. Add oil and pork, cook

In a small bowl combine veal, eggs and spices and parsleymix well. Divide evenly into 6 portions. Roll into logs about 1 inch thickflatten into a 4-inch round. Place 1/2 teaspoon of cranberry sauce on each roundtop with a slice of leekroll upsecure with a toothpickcoat in flourdip in eggsroll in breadcrumbsplace in a 9 x 13 x 2-inch pancover with foilbake at 350 degrees for 1 hourturnbake until meat is doneremove toothpicksserve with mashed potatoesgravyand a green salad.

Prepare crescent dinner rolls according to package directions. Remove from oven and cool slightly. Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium heat, cook ground beef and taco seasoning according to package directions. Remove beef from skillet and let cool slightly. Spread 1/2 of the beef mixture over each crescent roll, leaving 1 inch of crust uncovered on one side. Top with 1 cup of the shredded Velveeta cheese and remaining beef mixture. Fold other half of crescent dough over the filling to cover completely, making 2-3 layers of dough. Spread the top of the pie with the remaining Velveeta cheese. Bake in 350 degree oven for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown and cheese is melted. Serve with desired toppings such as lettuce and tomato and/or salsa.

Bring a large pot of water to boil. Add pasta and cook until al dente. Drain and cool under cold running water. Toss pasta in 4 tablespoons olive oil and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Transfer to large bowl and chill in refrigerator. While pasta is chilling, make dressing. In a medium bowl, combine oil, vinegar, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt. Chop tomatoes and arugula and add to dressing. Stir to combine. Transfer to large serving bowl and toss with pasta and remaining 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Serve cold.

In a medium bowl, combine the dry cake mix and the oatmeal. Set aside. In a large bowl, beat the peanut butter until smooth. Add the egg and milk and beat well. Add the dry mixture and mix until just combined. Fold in the bananas. Place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake at 350 degrees F for about 9 minutes. Let cool and remove to a wire rack. To assemble the cookies, place the bottom half of the cookie on a plate. Add a spoonful of whipped topping. Spread with chocolate syrup. Add a slice of banana. Spoon on the mascarpone cheese. Top with the other half of the cookie.

Peel and pit the avocado. Scrape the flesh into a bowl. Add the remaining ingredients. Mix well. Serve immediately. Serve with tortilla chips.

I’ve never had guacamole but I love the look of it! I’ll have to give some of those recipes a try!
I love guacamole! My favorite way to eat it is with tortilla chips.

In a mixing bowl cream together the peanut butter, shortening and sugars. Add the egg and mix well. Stir in the flour and soda until just combined. Chill dough in fridge for at least one hour. Heat oven to 375 degrees. Roll into 1 inch balls and place on a greased cookie sheet. Bake 8-10 minutes. Allow to cool for one minute before removing them from the cookie sheet.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the milk, butter and eggs until smooth. In a separate bowl, sift together the dry ingredients. Stir the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients until just combined. Drop by tablespoons onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven.
In a large bowl, combine all ingredients. Knead lightly to make dough. Divide dough into 12 equal pieces and roll into balls. Place on ungreased cookie sheet and press with a glass bottom into a circle. Bake in 375 F oven for 8-12 minutes.
In large bowl combine imitation crabmeat, celery, onion, Miracle Whip and salt and pepper. Spread on hamburger buns. Top with lettuce leaves.

In a saucepan, mix together the sugar, condensed milk and water. Cook until a soft ball forms in cold water. Remove from heat and add the chocolate and the peanut butter. Stir until smooth. Pour into a greased 11-12x7-inch pan. Refrigerate until firm. Sprinkle with nuts and cut into bars.

Mix together all the ingredients except the cooking oil. Knead the mixture with your hands until it forms a firm dough. Knead until soft. Divide into 6 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a ball. Place a ball of dough between both palms and roll it out into a thin circle. Place the rolled out dough on a hot flat surface. Cook each side on both sides until golden brown. Serve hot.

Combine the first six ingredients in a 1 qt saucepan. Stir in the cornstarch until smooth. Bring to a boil. Stir in the corn syrup. Remove from heat. Dip the chicken in the cornstarch. Add the canola oil to the skillet. Cook the chicken 2-3 minutes per side. Remove from the skillet. Add the broth to the cornstarch mixture. Boil until thickened. Pour over the chicken. Sprinkle with the lemon zest. Serve over broccoli and red peppers.
Heat a skillet. Mix dry ingredients. Add milk and egg. Cook on skillet.
Combine all other ingredients in a food processor. Blend until smooth. Spoon into a shallow serving dish. Sprinkle with peanuts. Serve with crackers and spinach leaves.
In a medium bowl combine together cream cheese, sour cream, brown sugar and vanilla. Fold in grapes. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Top with pecans before serving.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook for about 3 minutes or until tender but not brown. Add garlic and cook for about 1 minute. Add tomato paste and water. Bring to a simmer, stirring constantly. Add vegetables and cook for 3 minutes or just until heated through. Stir in beans and remove from heat. In a 9 inch pie plate, layer 3 phyllo leaves. Top with 1/3 of the vegetable mixture. Top with 1/3 of the remaining phyllo leaves and brush with cooking spray. Repeat with remaining phyllo leaves and vegetables. Sprinkle with herbs and spray with cooking spray. Bake for 20 minutes or until pastry is crisp and golden brown. Cut into wedges and serve warm.
I found this recipe on the Kraft website. It is soooooo good. My husband said it was the best meal I ever made. The only thing I did different was I doubled the sauce recipe. I have made it several times since. It is a keeper.
In a medium

Melt broth in saucepan on low heat. In blender or food processor, puree frozen raspberries with jelly and lemon zest. Blend or process 15-30 seconds. Add broth mixture to berry mixture and blend or process 30 seconds longer to make a smooth sauce. Strain if desired. Add lemon juice, salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot with chops, steak or meatloaf.

Peel and slice the pear into 6 wedges. Halve the cantaloupe. Remove seeds. Cut each half into 6 wedges. Remove the stem of each red bell pepper. Cut each pepper into 6 wedges. Remove the seeds. Cut each seedless grape into 4 wedges. Remove the stems from the grapes. Cut each raisin into 2 halves. Remove the stems from each end of the skewer. Insert 2 of the bamboo skewer into each of the following fruits: 2 grapes, 2 raisins, 1 orange, 2 red bell peppers, 1 cantaloupe wedge, 1 apple slice, 1 pear wedge. Insert 1 bamboo skewer into each of the following fruits: 1 cantaloupe wedge, 2 grapes, 2 raisins, 2 red bell peppers, 1 apple slice, 1 pear wedge. Insert 2 bamboo skewers into each of the following fruits: 1 apple slice, 1 cantaloupe wedge,

Preheat oven to 350F. Trim fat from meat. Cut into 2-inch pieces. Place in a 9-inch square pan. Add oil. Cook over med heat until browned. Remove from pan. In the same pan, add butter. Add salt and pepper. Add onion. Cook and stir over med heat until soft. Add the soup and onion soup mix. Mix well. Add pork to the mixture. Add wine. Mix well. Add water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Add the egg noodles. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes.
Cook macaroni according to package instructions. Drain and rinse with cold water. Set aside to cool. In a large bowl combine all ingredients and mix thoroughly. Cover and refrigerate.

Fry bacon til crisp. Break into small pieces. Add eggs. Scramble. Add meat and fry til done. Add mushrooms. Fry til done. Add green onions. Fry til done. Add rice. Stir until well mixed. Add soy sauce. Cook a few minutes. Add bean sprout. Stir thoroughly. Add salt and pepper. Cook a few minutes. Serve immediately.

Season fish all over with salt & pepper. In a large skillet heat olive oil over high heat. Add fish and sear for about 2-4 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Transfer to a plate. Whisk vinaigrette ingredients in a large bowl and season to taste. Toss fish & vegetables in vinaigrette. Serve at once.
Slice baguette lengthwise. Add butter. Sprinkle with chopped parsley. Arrange tomatoes on top.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Pound pork chops to 1/4 inch thickness. Sprinkle both sides with salt and pepper. Heat oil in skillet over high heat until very hot. Place the pork chops in the skillet and brown on both sides. Place pork chops in a greased 13 x 9 inch baking dish. In a small bowl combine honey and dijon. Pour over the pork. Pour white wine around the chops. Bake for 45 minutes.

In a large bowl combine the pasta and the olive oil. Add the garlic and cook until tender. Stir in the chicken and the crushed red pepper. Add the sun-dried tomatoes and the pesto sauce. Toss well. Add the salt and the pepper. Serves 4 to 6.

Place flour in shallow dish. Combine cheeses, butter and seasonings. Shape into 1 inch strips and roll in flour. Place 1 inch apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes or until golden. Cool. Store in tightly covered container. Makes 12 servings.

Beat cream with mixer until soft peaks form. Add cocoabeat until stiff peaks form. Beat in the whipped cream until blended. Fold in the cool whip until blended. In a separate bowl beat the heavy cream until it forms soft peaks. Add the sugar, coffee and kahluabeat until blended. Fold into cream mixture until blended. Refrigerate 4-6 hours. Spoon into individual dessert dishes and garnish with chocolate sprinkles and wafer cookies. Makes 6 servings.

Combine dry ingredients in a large bowl and make a well in center. Add liquid ingredients and mix just to moisten. Pour into a greased 9x13-inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown and firm to the touch. Serve warm with butter or margarine and honey or syrup.

Cream butter and cornstarch together and set aside. Combine flour and powdered sugar. Cream together butter and cornstarch mixture again. Add flour mixture and mix well. Shape into small balls and place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for about ten minutes or until slightly brown around edges.
Combine ground beef with chopped onions. Form into small meatballs. Add a few chopped fresh parsley leaves to the top. Grill on skewers. Serve with tzatziki sauce or your favorite dipping sauce.

Halve the bell peppers lengthwise and remove the seeds. In a small bowl mix together yogurt, garlic and the juice and zest of half the lemon. Season with salt and pepper. Stuff the yogurt mixture into the bell pepper halves and sprinkle with the olives. Serve topped with the remaining lemon wedge and honey.

Melt butter in pan over medium heat. Add onions and saute until lightly browned, stirring frequently. Stir in garlic, potatoes& spinach. Cook for about 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Remove from heat& stir in bacon, eggs& salt& pepper. Sprinkle with shredded cheese. Bake at 375 for about 40 minutes or until top is golden brown& center is set. Cool slightly& cut into wedges.

Place tea bags in large glass or ceramic container. Pour boiling water over bags. Let steep for 5 minutes. Remove bags. Stir in sugar until dissolved. Add lemon. Chill at least one hour. Pour over ice.

Cook the somen in salted water for 2-3 minutes and rinse under cold water. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add the chicken and cook for 3-5 minutes on each side. Add the broccoli and carrot and cook for 2 minutes. Add the teriyaki and soy sauces and the chicken broth and cook for 1 minute. Add the garlic and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add the somen and toss to coat. Serve hot.
I’m a sucker for a good bowl of pasta, but I’ll admit I get stuck in a rut. It’s not that I don’t like trying new things…I do…I just get a little lazy when it comes to finding new recipes that I can make quickly. The recipes I’ve listed here are all easy and delicious and take little more than 30 minutes from start to finish. I hope you like them!
Combine all of the above in a large pot and bring to a boil.
Add the shredded cheese and mix well. Serve immediately.
Add all the ingred

Cut the fish into serving-size pieces. Place in a greased 8-inch-square baking dish. Dot the fish with lemon wedges. Combine the mayonnaise, lemon juice, mustard and onion. Season to taste. Spread over the fish. Bake for 15 minutes. Serve warm.

Heat beans in microwave. Add scallion, chili powder and cumin. Add corn and chicken broth. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir in sour cream. Add tomatoes and green chilies and simmer for 5 minutes. Spoon 2 tablespoons of bean mixture in each tortilla. Roll up tortillas and place in a greased casserole. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 for about 30 minutes. Serve with lettuce and sour cream.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Season beef with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Add oil and beef and cook until browned on all sides. Remove to a cutting board and slice against the grain into thin strips. Add red bell peppers and mushrooms to skillet and cook 2 minutes. Add cooked bow tie pasta and asparagus and toss until evenly coated. Return beef to skillet and stir to distribute. Pour in the sauce and toss to coat. Divide among 4 plates and sprinkle with cheese. Serve immediately.

Pierce roast with fork in several places. Layer beef roast with chopped onions in crock-pot. Combine water and au jus mix. Pour over top of roast. Cover and cook on low setting for 10 to 12 hours. 3 hours before serving, remove roast from the liquid and cut in serving slices. To serve, place beef on rolls. Add slices of cheese and some of the liquid. Serve immediately.

Cut off any woody bottoms from fennel bulbs and cut into 1/2 inch thick pieces. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Add fennel bulbs and cook until golden brown and crisp-tender, about 15 minutes. Sprinkle with pernod and cook until liquid is absorbed, about 30 seconds. Stir in garliccook 1 minute more. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat and add sea bass fillets. Sprinkle with olives and dillcook just until sea bass is heated through, about 1 minute more.
In a large skillet brown hamburger meat and drain off excess fat. Add remaining ingredients and cook over low heat for 30 minutes. Serve hot with onions and condiments on a bun or hot dog rolls.

Rinse and slice the tomatoes in half. Remove the seeds and skin and chop the flesh into small pieces. Add the chopped tomatoes and the rest of the ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Bring the relish to room temperature before serving. Serve on a bed of greens or as a side dish with meats.
Combine breadcrumbs, Parmesan, parsley, salt and pepper. Dip chicken into melted butter. Dip in breadcrumb mixture. Place on baking sheet. Bake at 425 for 30 minutes or until golden brown.

In a large skillet add oil and heat over medium heat. Add potatoes and chicken and cook until done, about 10 minutes or so. Add bell peppers and continue cooking for another 5 minutes. Add green beans and cook until done, about 10 minutes or so longer. Sprinkle with salt and pepper as desired. Serves 4-6.
name: green beans with garlic butteringredients: green beans, butter, garlic, pepperpreparation:Cook beans according to package directions. In a separate bowl, combine butter, garlic and pepper. Drain beans. Place in serving bowl. Add butter mixture. Toss to coat evenly. Serve immediately.
name: garden green beansingredients: fresh green beans, fresh mushrooms, onions, garlic, olive oil, sliced water chestnuts, italian seasoning, salt, pepper, parmesan cheesepreparation:Place beans in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer until crisp
Brown venison with onion. Add remaining ingredients and simmer covered until meat is tender. Serve over cooked rice.

In a saucepan, combine the cooked chicken, chicken stock, chutney and the can of soup mix. Heat to a boil. Stir in the milk. Cook until heated through. Drain the pasta. Add the pasta to the saucepan with the chicken mixture. Heat through. Serve with chopped parsley.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Place the graham crackers and butter into a food processor and process until the mixture forms fine crumbs. Spread the mixture out into the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch pie plateset aside. Melt the white chocolate and allow to cool slightly.Combine the soft cream cheese and mascarpone in the bowl of an electric mixer and beat until well mixedset aside. Beat the egg yolks until light and fluffyset aside.Beat the egg whites until stiff and glossyset aside.Combine the beaten egg yolks and the melted white chocolate and beat until well mixedset aside.Fold the egg yolk mixture into the soft cheesesset aside.Fold the egg whites into the white chocolate mixtureset aside.Spread the filling into the pie crusttop with sliced strawberriesset aside.Bake in the preheated oven until the filling is set and slightly golden on top, about 30 minutes.

Cook the spaghetti according to package directions. Meanwhile in a large skillet over medium-high heat, brown the beef. Drain and stir in the seasonings. Once the meat is browned and the seasonings are mixed in, pour the beef mixture over the spaghetti. Top with the mozzarella and the cheddar. Bake in the oven for 15 minutes.

Cook beef in a Dutch oven over medium heat until no longer pink. Add bell pepper, crushed tomatoes, broth, soy sauce, worcestershire sauce and salt & pepper to taste. Stir to combine. Cover and cook over medium low heat for 3 hours. Stir in mixed vegetables and cook for another 30 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Serve over pasta.
name: vegetable beef soupingredients: ground beef, carrots, celery, onion, cannellini beans, frozen mixed vegetables, water, dried thyme, dried basil, dried rosemary, dried oregano, dried parsley, dried marjoram, garlic powder, dried tarragon, dried sage, dried savory, dried bay leaves, dried peppercorns, dried mustard, dried curry powder, dried cloves, dried cardamom pods, dried coriander seeds, dried cinnamon sticks, dried nutmeg, dried star anise,

Melt 1 tablespoon butter in saut pan. Saut pears until just turning soft. Beat together eggs, cream or milk, and salt & pepper until blended but not frothy. Melt remaining butter in omelet pan over high heat until foam begins to recede but before beginning to color. Pour in egg mixture and prepare omelet, stirring lightly, but allowing it to set on the bottom. Fill with sauted pears and gruyere cheese. Fold or roll and slide out of pan onto a heated plate.

Melt butter in skillet. Add onions and cook until tender. Add spinach. Cook until wilted. Remove from heat and stir in crabmeat. Add seasoning. Bake in 350f oven 20-25 minutes. Top with grated parmesan.

Combine chocolate chips and butter in top of double boiler over boiling water until melted stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in butterscotch chips until melted. Stir in peanut butter. Add noodles and nuts. Drop by spoonful onto wax paper. Refrigerate until set. Can be made into bars.

Beat 2 eggs, 1 tsp. salt, and 1/2 cup water in a large bowl. Whisk in 1-1/2 cups of all-purpose flour. Add 1/3 cup of the chestnut flour. Mix until smooth. Add more flour or water to adjust the consistency. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and allow to rest for 30 minutes. After the dough has rested, roll it out with a rolling pin on a lightly floured surface. Cut the dough with a pastry wheel or pizza cutter into long thin strips. Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Add the strips of dough and boil for 3 minutes. Drain the noodles in a colander. Toss with 1/2 cup of butter. Season the noodles with salt and pepper. Serve with meat sauce or pesto.

Mix sausage and mash potatoes in a large bowl. Add an egg. Mix until blended. Heat oil in frying pan. Shape mixture into 3 or 4 balls. Flatten each ball to form patty. Brown on both sides. Serve with lingonberry or catsup.
name: potato gnocchiingredients: all purpose flour, salt, eggs, water, pepperpreparation:Cook potatoes in a pot of boiling water until they are soft. Drain and let cool. Peel and grate. In a bowl, add eggs and salt and pepper. Beat well. Slowly add flour and grated potatoes until dough is formed. Roll into small balls and place on lightly floured surface. Flatten with your fingers. Boil for about three minutes in salted water. Drain. Top with butter and parmesan cheese.

Prepare potatoes as directed on package. Combine cheese and sour cream. Add potatoes and seasonings. Grease 12 standard muffin cups. Place potatoes in cups. Bake at 400 f for 15 minutes. Let cool slightly. Top with black olives and green chili. Bake for 2 minutes more. Cut in half. Makes 12 servings. Mash potatoes as directed on package. Grease 12 standard muffin cups. Fill with potato mixture. Bake at 400 f for 20 minutes or until golden. Top with cheese and chili. Bake for 2 minutes more. Cut in half. Makes 12 servings.

In a shallow bowl, combine mustard, olive oil & orange zest. Add shrimp & toss to coat. Set aside. In a skillet, heat orange juice until boiling. Stir in hot sauce. Add mango, green onions & pepper. Cook until mango is just tender. Add shrimp. Heat through. Serve immediately over rice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease a baking sheet with non-stick cooking spray, and set aside. Toss together baby carrots and onion in a large bowl until coated. Pour olive oil and brown sugar into a medium saucepan over medium heatbring to a boil. Cook until mixture is thickened, about 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Pour brown sugar mixture over vegetable mixture. Stir in kosher salt. Transfer vegetables to prepared baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until vegetables are tender and carrots have browned slightly, about 20 minutes. Sprinkle with pecans before serving.

Boil sweet potatoes in water until tender. Drain and mash. Stir in butter. Add milk. Add nutmeg, salt & freshly ground black pepper. Stir until smooth. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar before serving.

Heat oven to 350f. Grease a 2-quart casserole dish. In a large skillet over medium heat, brown sausage with onions. Drain wellreturn skillet to heat and add eggs. Stir constantly until eggs are scrambled. Transfer to casserole dishstir in bread cubes. Stir in cheesepour in milkstir well. Bake uncovered for 40-45 minutes or until a knife inserted in center comes out clean.
Place all ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth. Pour into unbaked shell. Bake at 350f for 50 minutes to 1 hour. Serve hot or cold with whipped cream.

Heat oil in a large skillet. Add sausage. Cook until browned. Add sauce. Stir in tomatoes. Add garlic. Cook for about 1 minute. Add minced garlic. Stir in tomatoes. Simmer uncovered for 15 minutes. Serve over hot cooked spaghetti. Sprinkle with Parmesan.

Combine chocolate and oil in a heavy saucepan over low heat. Stir until smooth. Remove from heat and stir in bark and marshmallows. Pour into buttered 8 x 8 inch pan or form into rectangle with wax paper. Sprinkle with cereal, nuts, cherries and coconut. Refrigerate until firm. Slice with a hot knife.

In a large bowl combine the first 6 ingredients and marinade the ribs for 2 hours. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees f. Place the ribs in a shallow baking dish and bake for 1 hour. Turn and bake for 1 hour more or until tender.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Season with salt and fresh ground pepper. Serve at room temperature.

Pre-heat oven to 375f. Mix ground beef, stuffing mix, water, oregano. Press into muffin cups. With spoon make an indentation in center of each meatloaf. Add the roasted red pepper. Fill indentation with cheese. Bake 30 min or until cooked through. Top with feta cheese. Continue baking 5 min or until cheese is melted.

Cut the chicken in small pieces and bring a pot of water to a boil. Add the chicken and boil for 3 minutes. Drain the chicken and set aside to cool down a bit. In another pot, add the dashi stock and bring it to a boil again. Add the tiny peas and cook for 3 minutes. Add the cooked chicken and simmer for 5 minutes. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs with the soy sauce, ajinomoto and granulated sugar until smooth. In a serving bowl, add the dashi and the cooked chicken and tiny peas and top it with the eggs. Sprinkle the nori over the egg and serve hot with rice.

Prepare the package directions for the scalloped potato mix. Add diced tomatoes. Place in a buttered 9x13 baking dish. Top with pepperoni and cheese. Bake 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

Bring water to boiladd rice, bring back to boil and stir frequently for 15 minutes until tender and all water is absorbed. Mix eggs, milk, sugar, cornstarch, vanilla, nutmeg and cinnamon. Add raisins. Mix well. Add mixture into the rice, stirring until thickens. Serve hot or cold with whipped cream.

In a large bowl combine buttermilk, red pepper sauce, cornmeal, and taco seasoning mix. Add drumsticks. Cover and refrigerate 8 hours or overnight. In a large heavy skillet heat oil over medium heat until hot. Working in batches dip drumsticks in buttermilk mixtureplace in skillet. Cook 15-20 minutes or until browned turning once. Drain on paper towels. Serve with salsa.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the olive oil and swirl to coat. Add the garlic cloves, cut side down, to the skillet and cook until the cut sides begin to turn golden brown. Add the chicken breast halves to the skillet and sear the flesh side until brown. Turn the chicken over and sear the other sides. Remove the chicken from the skillet. Add the blueberry juice to the skillet. Bring to a boil. Add the white wine vinegar. Add the lime juice and bring back to a boil. Add the raspberries to the skillet. Add the chicken back to the skillet. Cook over medium heat until the blueberry sauce thickens. Serve the chicken with the blueberry sauce.

Heat up soup bones in a large pot of water and simmer for about two hours. Drain the bones and place them aside. Brown meat and add to bones. Add salt and pepper and cook for 10 minutes. Add parsley and cook for another 5 minutes. Add in vinegar and pour in bone water. Add rice and simmer for 20 minutes. Serve with garlic and olive oil.

In a large saucepan or Dutch oven cook the onion and garlic in the olive oil until onion is soft. Add the tomatoes and their juice, olives, lemon juice and wine. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 10 minutes. Place the fish in the sauce. Sprinkle with the black pepper and cook for 20 minutes or until the fish is cooked through. Serve with the sauce poured over the fish.

In saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for 2 minutes. Add cream and stir. Add the cheeses and stir until the cheeses are melted and the sauce is smooth. Add the poblano peppers and tomatoes and stir. Season to taste. Serve with chips.

Cook onion and paprika in butter over medium-high heat 4-5 minutes. Add potatoes and 2/3 cup waterbring to a boil. Reduce heatcook 5 minutes. Stir in soup, 1/2 cup sour cream and 2/3 cup water. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup cheese. Pour into a 2-quart baking dish coated with cooking spray. Combine remaining sour cream and cornflakes. Sprinkle over top. Bake at 375f for 25-30 minutes or until heated through. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.
Melt bacon grease in skillet on medium heat. Stir in flour and let brown. Stir in cornmeal and add egg and milk. Cook until thick. Serve with butter.
Combine water and sugar in large pot. Bring to boil. Add cinnamon sticks and let stand for 1 hour. Add remaining ingredients. Serve hot. Garnish with orange slices.

In skillet over med. high heat, saute butter until melted. Add mustard, then cider. Cook over low heat until reduced by half. Add cream and reduce heat to simmer. Add salt, pepper and parsley. Dip chops in flour, then saute in skillet until browned. Put in cider sauce. Cover and simmer until tender. Serve over egg noodles.

In a soup pot combine the yellow split peas, chicken broth and cold water. Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to low. Cook for about 2 hours, adding more cold water if needed to keep the level of the liquid in the pot constant. Season with the salt and the black pepper. Remove the ham bone. In a saucepan saute the onions and leeks in the butter until tender. Add the chopped cooked ham. Stir the cooked vegetables and the ham into the split pea mixture. Stir in the fresh chives. Serve the soup garnished with whipping cream and chives.

Combine the first 5 ingredients. Cut butter into the mixture. Dip 4 slices of bread into the mixture and place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees F for 10 minutes or until light golden. Cool. Break into 3-inch strips. Makes about 12 strips.

In large bowl combine flour and white pepper. Cut in shortening to form a crumbly mixture. Set aside. Cook sauerkraut in boiling water 15 minutes or until tender. Drain. Add to the flour mixture. Form into 1 inch balls and place 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 minutes. Makes 6 to 8 dozen.

Chop the garlic and parsley finely and put into a small bowl along with the olive oil and the juice of the lemon. Add the asparagus and toss to coat well with the dressing. Season lightly with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

Combine all in a saucepan over low heat. Simmer until the liquid is reduced by half and the onions are tender. Add the liquid to the skillet and simmer until the mixture is thick and the liquid evaporates. Cool. Refrigerate until ready to use. To serve: Drain the onions from the liquid. Place the onions in a serving dish. Add a small amount of the liquid to the dish and toss. Sprinkle with the parsley and serve.

Heat the oil in a frying pan and saut the leeks for a few minutes. Add the sun-dried tomatoes and cook until the liquid evaporates and the tomatoes are soft. Season with salt and pepper. In a separate bowl beat the eggs with the parsley and pour them over the leeks and tomatoes. Turn the heat down to low and let the frittata set for 3 minutes. Serve hot or cold cut into wedges.
 tomato riceingredients: tomatoes, onion, garlic, green bell pepper, cayenne pepper, hot sauce, long-grain white ricepreparation:Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Saute onions until tender and add garlic and bell pepper and saute for 1 minute. Stir in tomatoes and cayenne and simmer for 5 minutes or until thickened. Bring to a boil and add rice, cover and simmer 10 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Serve with hot sauce.

Wash and dry bell peppers. Remove tops and seeds. Chop tops. Place chicken in a large mixing bowl. Add salsa, soy sauce, gingerroot, lime juice and 1/4 cup chopped tops. Mix well. Fill peppers with mixture. Place in a baking pan. Add water to pan to about 1/4 inch deep. Bake 1 hour or until chicken is tender. Sprinkle with chopped nuts.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease muffin cups or line with paper cups. In a large bowl, combine the dry ingredients. In a small bowl, combine the milk and eggs until smooth and well blended. Add to the dry ingredients and mix just until combined. Stir in the cheese and chives until evenly distributed. Fill the muffin cups 2/3 full and bake for 20-25 minutes until lightly browned. Let the muffins stand in the pan for a minute or two before removing and serving warm.

In a 3 quart bowl, combine puddings and gelatin. Stir in enough boiling water to make a thick batter. Add crushed pineapple and mandarin oranges. Cover and refrigerate. Just before serving, fold in cool whip.
Mix together maple syrup and spices. Sprinkle over mahi mahi fillets. Cook as directed. Serve with rice and/or mixed veggies.

In a large skillet heat oil over high heat. Add garlic and stir-fry for about 10 seconds. Add bok choy and stir-fry for about 1 minute. Add chicken broth and cornstarch mixture. Bring to a boil and stir to combine. Reduce heat to low and cook for 3-5 minutes to thicken sauce. Serve immediately.

Cut the thighs into bite size pieces. Heat vegetable oil in a wok and fry the chicken. Add the sugar and stir fry. Add the garlic and stir fry. Add the soy sauce and black pepper. Stir and cook for 2 more minutes. Serve with rice.

Combine the almonds, flour, seafood seasoning, and half of the parsley in a shallow dish. Combine the egg white with 1 tablespoon water in a bowl. Dip the shrimp into the egg white mixture then into the almond mixture until coated. Heat the corn oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the coated shrimp, in batches if necessary, and fry for 2 to 3 minutes on each side until golden brown. Remove from the skillet with a slotted spoon and place on paper towels to drain. Transfer to a serving dish and sprinkle with the remaining parsley. Serve immediately with lemon wedges.

In 10-inch skillet over medium heat, cook onion and pepper in olive oil for 5 minutes. Stir in carrot and cook for 3 minutes. Stir in cabbage and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in soup mix and 1 1/2 cups v8 juice. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Add mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes or until cabbage is tender. Add remaining v8 juice and mexican-style tomatoes. Cook for 10 minutes or until heated through. Makes 6 servings (2 quarts).
Combine pork, vinegar, salt, chili powder, garlic, oregano and cumin in a bowl. Mix well and stuff into casings. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Cook for 5 minutes in a small amount of water.

Cut off both ends of the potato. Slice lengthwise in half, then into 1/4 inch slices. In a large skillet with 1/4 cup water, boil potato slices for 10 minutes. Drain water from skillet. Add pineapple-orange juice concentrate. Simmer for 3 to 4 minutes. Add remaining ingredients. Simmer for 3 minutes longer. Serve hot.
name: roasted sweet potatoes potatoes and carrotspreparation:Peel and cut in bite size pieces all the vegetable. Peel and squash the garlic but do not cut it. Mix the vegetables, garlic and all remaining. Ingredients. Spread on a parchemin lined pan. Broil until nice and golden about half an hour.
name: bourbon brown sugar sweet potatoespreparation:Cube sweet potatoes and boil in water until soft. Add brown sugar, bourbon, butter and mash well. Add cinnamon, nutmeg, and vanilla. Mix all ingredients well. If you want to add more cinnam

In a skillet, saute chiles, jalapeno and garlic in olive oil until tender crisp. Stir in processed cheese. Heat till cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve over tortilla chips. Makes 2 cups. Serve as a dip for vegetables or meat.

Combine peppers and vinegar in a large kettle, cook 5 minutes, stirring often. Add sugar and cook until it reaches 220 degrees on a candy thermometer, stirring often. Add 1 box liquid pectin and stir until completely dissolved. Pour into jars and seal immediately. This is a great spread for crackers or sandwiches or just eat it with a spoon. Makes about 12 half-pint jars of jelly.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour an 8x8 inch baking dish.Combine the sugar and the butter in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook and stir the mixture until the butter has melted, and the sugar is completely dissolved into the mixture.Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the mixture cool slightly.Add the eggs and the vanilla extractmix well.Combine the flour, baking powder and salt in a small bowl and whisk until the mixture is free of lumps.Combine the flour mixture and the baking powder mixture into the saucepan with the butter mixture and stir just until the mixture is combined.Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish and smooth the top.Bake the bars in the preheated oven until the top is light golden brown and the center is set, about 25 minutes.Cool the brownies in the pan on a wire rack. Cut the brownies into squares with a sharp knife.
name: chocolatey hot cocoa for one
name:

In a pan saute onion and garlic over low heat till they are tender, about 3-5 minutes. Add the mushrooms and saute till tender. Add stock cube, white wine and olive oil. Cook on low heat for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally till the wine has been absorbed by the onion, garlic and mushrooms. Add heavy cream and simmer for about 10 minutes on low heat stirring occasionally till the cream thickens.

Combine sugar and cornflour in a large saucepan and stir in the cocoa. Add the malted milk powder and the milk and bring to a boil. Boil for 1 minute. Remove from the heat and stir in the cream and coffee until smooth. Pour into 2 buttered 9x13 inch pans. Let cool and cut into squares.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet or saute pan. Add salt & pepper to taste. Saute wings for 20 minutes, turning once. Transfer wings to a plate. Add butter to the pan. Cook over medium-high heat until butter melts. Add curry paste, lime juice & zest, honey & soy sauce. Cook 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add the wings back into the pan. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with cilantro. Serve warm.

In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the shallot in the butter until soft. Add the broth and bring to a boil. Add the spinach and cook until the spinach is wilted. Remove from the heat. Stir in the sour cream and lemon juice. Season with nutmeg and salt and pepper. Serve hot. Garnish with the almonds.

Mix egg yolks with sugar and water. Place mixture in a double boiler. Beat egg whites until stiff. Fold in egg whites and vanilla extract. Pour into 10 1/2 inch x 5 inch loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Cut into 1/2 inch slices. Makes 8 servings.

Soften cream cheese and mix well. Add mayonnaise and celery. Mix well. Add soup and mix well. Add gelatin and let cool for 10 minutes. Add crab and mix well. Chill overnight. Serve with crackers or on a lettuce leaf.

In a blender combine all the ingredients except the celery seeds and the pepper. Blend until smooth and stir in the celery seeds and pepper. Serve over the burger.
In a blender combine all the ingredients except the celery seeds and the pepper. Blend until smooth and stir in the celery seeds and pepper. Serve over the burger.
I have made this burger sauce for years. It is very easy to make. I use it with every type of burger.
I love this burger recipe. I use it a lot.
This recipe was given to me by my neighbor. I love it. It is so easy to make and I like how it has a sweet taste to it.

Combine flour, butter and egg yolks in a bowl and mix until crumbly. Drain vinegar into the mix and stir until well blended. Add enough water to make a stiff dough. Knead on a lightly floured surface and roll to about 1/8 inch thickness. Cut into strips 1 inch wide and 8 inches long. Place 1/4 inch from edge of pan. Bake at 350 for 15 to 20 minutes until lightly browned.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Spray a 9x13x2-inch pan with cooking spray. In a small bowl, sift together flour and baking powder. In a large mixing bowl, beat together the butter and brown sugar with an electric mixer on medium speed until smooth. Beat in the egg and vanilla extract. Gradually beat in the flour mixture and then stir in the morsels. Spread the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool the brownies in the pan on a wire rack. Sprinkle with the toffee bits. Cut into bars and serve.

Remove beards from mussels with a knife. Add wine and lemon rind to a large frying pan. Add mussels to pan and cook for 5 minutes. Remove mussels from pan and keep warm. Add peppercorns to pan with butter. Stir until melted. Pour contents of pan over cooked mussels. Serve with crusty bread.

Place lard in a large cast iron dutch oven or heavy pot. Heat over high heat. When lard begins to sizzle add pork. Brown pork on all sides. Add remaining ingredients. Stir together. Cover pot. Reduce heat to medium. Simmer until pork is tender. This will take about 2 hours. When done remove pork to a serving platter. Strain cooking liquid. Skim fat. Season to taste with sea salt. Pour over pork. Serve with warm tortillas.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large bowl, combine the cake mix with the light brown sugar, butter, water, oil, and eggs. Stir in the nuts and chocolate bit. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven.

Combine milk, sugar, espresso powder and chips in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Stir until smooth and sugar is dissolved. Remove from heatcool to room temperature. Beat egg whites in a large mixing bowl until stiff peaks form. Add cooled chocolate mixture to beaten egg whites, beating until smooth. Chill in refrigerator or freezer until ready to serve. Garnish with a dollop of whipped cream or shaved white chocolate if desired.

Slice and toast the bread. Combine the eggs and milk. Melt the butter in the skillet. Place half the slices of toast on the bottom and top with half the eggs and cheese. Repeat with the other half. Bake at 400 for 20 minutes. Serve immediately.
Beat together milk and heavy cream with an electric mixer until thickened. Fold in lemon pudding mix. Pour into a freezer container. Freeze overnight.

Bring water to boil in a large stockpot over high heat. Add the pasta and cook according to the directions on the box, until tender yet firm to the bite. Drain the pasta and return it to the pot. Heat the milk in the microwave for about 1 minute or until warm to the touch. Add the milk to the pasta and stir until the pasta has absorbed all of the milk. Add the butter and stir until the butter has melted into the sauce and it has thickened. Stir in the flour and cook, stirring frequently, until the sauce thickens and bubbles (about 1 minute). Add the white cheddar cheese and stir until the cheese is melted into the sauce (about 1 minute). Add the lobster meat, the remaining 1/2 cup cheddar cheese and nutmeg and mix to combine well. Season with the salt and pepper to taste. Transfer the pasta to a 3-quart casserole dish and top with the brie cheese and bake until the cheese is bubbly and lightly browned (about

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Brush 1 side of each piece of bread with oil. Place one side of each piece of bread down on a lightly oiled baking sheet. Top with 1 slice of cheese and 2 slices of mortadella. Bake 8-10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Top with remaining cheese and basil. Serve warm.

Cook pasta as directed on package. Drain when done and add tuna fish, cream of mushroom soup and green peas. Put in a 9 by 13 pan. Sprinkle shredded cheese on top. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.
I love Tuna Noodle Casserole. It is so easy to make and so good!

In tall glasses, crush 4 mint leaves or 1 or 2 sprigs of mint or 2 to 3 teaspoons peppermint extract. Pour in 1 can of orange juice concentrate. Fill with club soda. Top with a maraschino cherry for garnish.

Dissolve gelatin in cold water. Stir in milk. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Dissolve sugar in hot liquid. Add extract. Cool. Fold in fruit cocktail, lychees, mandarin oranges and cherries. Refrigerate 2-3 hours. Serve in parfait glasses or small custard cups. Serves 4.
name: fruity dessert pizzaingredients: white flour, water, salt, olive oil, 1 can (20 ounces) crushed tomatoes, 1/2 cup ricotta cheese, 1 can (14 ounces) diced tomatoes, 1 can (10 ounces) tomato sauce with garlic, 1 can (15 ounces) diced tomatoes with basil and oregano, 1 cup chopped fresh basil, 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 1/3 cup chopped fresh oregano leavespreparation:Heat oven to 450°F. Mix flour, salt and olive oil

Preheat oven to 450. Season pork with garlic powder and salt and pepper. Roast for 10 minutes. In a small bowl, combine orange zest, ketchup, mustard, soy sauce, curry powder, coriander and worcestershire. Add 2 tablespoons water and stir until smooth. Remove from oven and brush with half the glaze. Roast for another 10 minutes. Brush with remaining glaze and roast for another 10-15 minutes or until meat thermometer reads 145. Let rest for 10 minutes. Slice thinly and serve with mashed sweet potatoes.
Peel and dice potatoes. Cook in hot water to boiling. Add salt. Drain and mash potatoes. Add milk. Heat through. Add crabmeat. Stir. Add cream-style corn and stir. Add parsley and stir. Serve hot.

In large skillet heat margarine over medium heat. Add flour. Cook for one minute stirring constantly. Gradually add milk. Cook and stir until thickened. Add macaroni. Cook for one minute. Stir in cheese. Remove from heat. Add wieners. Add pepper. Stir. Serve over hot rice.

In a large bowl combine cereal, dried fruit, nuts and pretzels. In a small bowl combine honey and cinnamon. Microwave on high for 1 minute, stirring once. Pour over cereal mix and toss to coat. Cool to room temperature and store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).Cut top rind from brie wheelset aside. Place dried cherries in a small bowl, add hot water, and let stand for 10 minutes to reconstitute. Drain cherries, saving liquid for another use. In a small bowl combine the cherries with the almonds. Remove the top rind of the brie cheesediscard the rind. Spread the cherry-almond mixture over the briesprinkle with brown sugar. Fold up the puff pastry dough to cover the cheesepinch edges together and seal with a fork. Crimp the edges together with a forkcut slits in the top for vents. Beat the egg with a fork in a small bowlbrush over the pastry. Place the pastry-covered brie onto a foil-lined baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until the pastry is golden brown, about 20 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.
name: baked brie in puff pastryingred

Mix butter and cream cheese together. Add garlic powder, milk and bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Add parmesan cheese and black pepper. Toss with pasta and serve. You can add cooked chicken or shrimp if you'd like.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over high heat. Sprinkle both sides of the pork chops with the spices. Cook in the hot oil for about 3 minutes per side. Set aside. In a small bowl mix together the salsa, honey, garlic & lime juice. Pour over the pork chops. Serve over rice or a baked potato.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a small bowl, combine the orange juice and mustardset aside. In another bowl, combine the onion and pecansset aside. Cook the beans according to the package directions. Drain and add the onion mixture and the butter. Toss to coat and place in a large bowl. Drizzle with the orange juice mixture and toss well. Sprinkle with the pecan mixture. Transfer to a baking pan and bake for 10 minutes. Serve immediately.
Melt butter in saute pan. Add onions and saute over medium heat until light brown. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add catsup and honey. Simmer for 1 minute. Serve warm.

In a skillet, add olive oil and sautee chops for about 10 minutes. Turn over and sautee for another 10 minutes. Salt & fresh ground pepper to taste. Add garlic and sautee until fragrant. Add pickled peppers (I used the whole jar) and sautee for another minute or two. Serve with potatoes or rice. I love this dish.

Combine the sugar, milk & cream in a heavy 3-quart pan. Cook over medium heat to 236f stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Add chocolate and mix until melted. Beat until mixture loses its gloss. Fold in butter and vanilla. Pour into buttered 13-inch by 9-inch pan. Sprinkle with candied cherry. Chill until firm. Cut into squares.

In a large pot, combine sugar and water. Stir over medium heat until sugar is dissolved. Add chocolate chips. Stir over medium heat until melted. Remove from heat. Stir in butter, light corn syrup, and vanilla. Store in refrigerator. Serve warm over ice cream. Makes about 1 cup.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine the parsnips and potatoes with 3 cups water and the thyme. Bring to a boilcover, reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Drain. In a blender or food processor, process the vegetables until smooth. Heat the heavy cream in a saucepan over medium heat until it just comes to a boilremove from the heat. Stir the hot heavy cream into the vegetablesseason with the thyme, nutmeg, salt and freshly ground black pepper. Transfer to a lightly greased 2-quart casserole dish and sprinkle with the cheese. Bake for 20 minutes or until the top is golden brown and bubbly. Serve immediately with chopped fresh parsley if desired.

Preheat oven to 350. Pound each chicken breast until they are about 1/2 inch thick. Place a slice of swiss cheese on each breast and top with a slice of ham. Fold in sides and roll up. Tie with kitchen twine. Combine mushroom soup and sour cream in a bowl. Place chicken in a shallow baking dish. Pour mushroom soup mixture over the top of the chicken. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove twine and sprinkle with mushrooms. Bake for an additional 5 minutes.

In a small saucepan combine all the ingredients. Bring to a boil. Stir until the sugar dissolves. Transfer the mixture to a small bowl. Marinate for at least 1 hour. Drain before serving.

Cut up the chicken into bite size pieces. Cut up the mushrooms. Add all the ingredients to the crock pot. Cook on low for 6-8 hours. Stir occasionally. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Sift together the cornmeal, all-purpose flour, sugar and spicesset aside. In a separate bowl mix the butter and low-fat milk together until smooth. Add the milk mixture to the flour mixture and mix until smooth. Beat the eggs into the batter and then fold in the corn kernels. Pour batter into greased loaf pans or a greased 13-inch skillet or cast-iron griddle. Bake for about 50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. Let cool for a few minutes and then enjoy!

Melt butter in 10-inch skillet on stove over medium heat. Add zucchini, onion and garliccook for 2 minutes, stirring frequently. Remove from heatadd stuffing mix. Blend until well-coated. Set aside 1/4 of the mixture. Divide remaining mixture evenly into 2 portionsevenly spread over 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts. Sprinkle with 1 cup cheesetop with another chicken breastsprinkle with remaining cheese. Wrap tightly in plastic wraprefrigerate for 2 hours or overnight. Remove from refrigerator 30 minutes before baking. Preheat oven to 350F. Unwrap chickenplace on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake for 30 minutes or until no longer pink at bone. Combine barbecue sauce and remaining stuffing mixturespoon over baked chicken. Serves 4.
name: chicken stuffed with bacon and cheesepreparation:Cut a slit in each chicken
Mix all the above together and form into small meatballs. Fry or bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Serve with sweet chili sauce and chopped cilantro for garnish.

In a bowl, combine milk, vanilla, brown sugar, cinnamon & allspice. Add the egg & stir well to mix. In a 13 x 9 baking dish, arrange the bread slices on the bottom of the dish. Pour the milk mixture over the bread & add the apple chunks & the cranberries. Press the fruit & bread into the liquid. Bake for 1 hour or until the pudding is set. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Cut cauliflower into 1 inch pieces. In a food processor, combine bread, herbs and salt and pepper. Add 1/4 cup olive oil and pulse until crumbly. Transfer mixture to a shallow bowl. In a large skillet, combine cauliflower, remaining olive oil, garlic, thyme and pepper. Saute until crisp-tender. Sprinkle with crumb mixture. Bake for 15 minutes, or until brown. Serve hot.
Combine apples, honey dijon mustard and white cheddar cheese in medium bowl. Divide evenly into 4 tea sandwiches. Serve on raisin bread.

Soak saltine crackers in water and mash them up. Add ground beef and mix well. Add grape jelly, chili sauce, lemon juice and season with salt & pepper. Form into balls. Cook in frying pan over medium heat until done. Pour into sauce pan with leftover gravy. Stir and serve over rice.

In a small skillet over medium heat, stir together cheddar cheese, mayonnaise and milk until melted and smooth. Remove from heat. Stir in bacon, peppers, oregano and garlic powder. Cut bread into 1 inch slices. Place slices in single layer in a shallow baking pan. Top with cheddar cheese mixture. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven until warm and bubbly. Cut into wedges to serve with crackers or sourdough bread.

Combine yeast, milk, sugar and butter. Mix well. Add salt and flour. Knead about 10 minutes. Put in greased bowl. Turn greased bowl upside down on dough. Let rise about 1 hour or until doubled in size. Turn out onto floured surface. Knead lightly 2 or 3 times. Divide into 12 parts. Shape into round rolls. Place on greased or waxed paper. Let rise until doubled about 15 to 20 minutes. Bake at 400 for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown on top.

Sprinkle tenderloin with seasonings. Stir-fry in hot oil. Add vegetables. Cook until vegetables are crisp-tender. Add stir-fry sauce and juice. Simmer until thickened. Serve over rice.

Combine first 7 ingredients in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heatstir constantly 2 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heatlet cool slightly. Beat together remaining ingredients in a bowl until smooth. Pour into a greased 13x9x2-inch baking dishspread evenly. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes or until set. Cool for 10 minutes. Serve warm or chilled. Makes 16 servings.
Boil potatoes until tender. Cut into cubes. Slice bacon and brown in large frying pan. Add potatoes and saute until lightly browned. Add seasoning. Mix well. Serve hot.

Cut the chicken in pieces. Fry the onions with butter until transparent. Add the curry powder. Slowly add the flour and stir until the flour is well mixed. Add the stock and bring to a boil. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the half-and-half cream. Mix well. Add the pieces of chicken. Cook for 20 minutes. Serve hot.

Bring water to a boil. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Add the other ingredients. Stir to mix. Let cool and serve. Garnish with orange wedges.

In a saucepan over medium heat, combine the butter, flour and green onions until smooth. Add the milk and cook until thickened, stirring constantly. Add the salmon and the seasoning and heat through. Toast the bread slices and spread with the salmon mixture.

Place the ingredients in the bread machine in the order recommended by the manufacturer. Set the machine on the dough cycle. When cycle is complete, remove the dough from the machine and shape it into two loaves of 3 inches wide by 14 inches long. Place the loaves in two lightly greased 8 1/2 x 4 1/2 inch loaf pans and let rise in a warm place for about 30 minutes. Bake the loaves in a preheated 375 degree F oven for 25 to 30 minutes until they are golden brown. Let the bread cool for 20 minutes and then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely before cutting.

Peel and rinse eggs. Discard two of the egg yolks. Chop remaining 4 whites and 2 yolks. Mix remaining ingredients. Refrigerate any leftovers, or chill. Toast two slices of your favorite bread. Top one slice with lettuce leaves. Spread bottom slice with egg mixture. Place on top slice. Serve immediately.

Water rice according to package directions. Melt butter in pan. Fry onion until soft. Add instant rice to pan. Stir for a minute or until thoroughly mixed. Pour in beaten egg. Stir until mixture is combined and mixture is evenly moistened. Add soy sauce to taste. Serve hot.
Mix the ingredients together well. Heat oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet or wok. When the oil is hot, add the vegetable mixture and stir-fry until crisp-tender. Add the cooked rice and stir-fry for 2 to 3 minutes or until thoroughly combined and heated through. Stir in the parsley and serve immediately.
Cook the vegetables in a wok or heavy skillet until tender but crisp. Drain and set aside.
