Mince the pork with a food processor. Add the chinese cabbage and water chestnuts. Stir through the onion and fresh coriander. Heat the oil in the pan and saute the garlic and ginger until fragrant. Add the pork mixture and sambal oelek and stir through. Add 1 1/2 cups water and stir to combine. Bring to the boil, cover and simmer for about 30 minutes or until the liquid has reduced and the pork is cooked. Stir in the spring roll wrappers and gently toss to coat. Line up the wrappers and place 1 tbsp of filling in the centre. Bring the two sides together and press down to seal. Repeat with the remaining filling and wrappers. Heat the oil in a deep frying pan and fry the spring rolls until golden and crisp. Drain on paper towel and serve with sweet chili dipping sauce.

Preheat oven to 425F. Lay tomatoes, red onion, bell peppers on a baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil. Roast for about 45 minutes until vegetables are soft. Cool. Combine vegetables with stock and sage in blender. Puree until smooth. Heat through and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Cook pasta as label directs. Drain. Melt cream and mascarpone in saucepan. Stir in half the Parmesan and basil. Toss hot pasta with sauce. Top with remaining Parmesan. Garnish with basil.

sift all dry ingredients into a bowl. add milk and stir well. add egg and stir again. melt butter and add vanilla. pour over pancake mixture and stir well. heat non-stick frypan over medium heat. drop pancake mixture 1-2 tablespoons at a time. cook for 2 minutes or until bubbles appear on the top of the pikelets. turn and cook for a further minute or until cooked through. sprinkle with caster sugar. serve with jam or honey.

Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and mix until smooth. Pour into the prepared shells. Bake in a preheated oven at 425f for 15 minutes. Lower the heat to 350f and bake for an additional 50 minutes or until done.

Peel and slice the beetroots as thinly as possible and place them in a heavy saucepan with the vinegar, brown sugar, and a little of the water. Simmer for about 30 minutes until tender and the liquid has reduced to a syrup. Blend the beetroots with the syrup and add the cornflour mixed with a little of the water. Boil for a minute or two until the sauce has thickened, then add the orange rind and the remaining water and boil for a further 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and serve hot.

Heat oil in a large pan. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add water and soy. Bring to a boil, then add sugar and peanut butter. Add more water as needed to achieve desired consistency. Add fish sauce and adjust to taste. Add more salt if necessary. Serve with noodles.

Cook sausage over medium heat until browned. Remove from heat. Cut sausage into 1/2 inch pieces. In a large bowl, combine the sausage pieces with the apples. Add the oil, vinegar, dijon, honey and spices. Toss to coat. Add the spinach leaves. Add the nuts and toss. Refrigerate for 30 minutes before serving.

Dissolve the chili sauce in the cola. Add the rest of the ingredients. Marinate the meat overnight. Cook in slow cooker for about five hours.
Name: Grilled Short RibsIngredients: Soy Sauce, Brown Sugar, Garlic Cloves, Sesame Oil, Beef Short Ribs, Lettuce Leaf, Sticky Rice, Red MisoPreparation: Whisk together marinade ingredients in a 15 x 10 inch pan and add ribs to marindade, turning to coat and let marinade for 30 minutes to 2 hours at room temperature. Prepare grill to medium high heat. Brush grill with oil. Grill ribs until cooked through. Remove meat from bones. Wrap meat in lettuce leavs with a small amount of miso and sticky rice.
Name: Kalbi Short RibsIngredients: Soy Sauce, Water, Honey, Ginger, Sesame Seed Oil, Garlic Cloves, Green Onion, Apple Cider, Beef Short Ribs, Sesame Se

Boil the potatoes until soft when pierced with a fork. Drain and cool. Cut carrots and onions in thin slices. Add oil to a pan and saute vegetables. Add stock cube and sugar, let it boil. Add vinegar and mix. Add salt to taste. Serve the potatoes cold with the vegetables and hard boiled eggs on top. Cut cucumber in small cubes or slices. Add to the rest of the vegetables for garnish.

In large bowl, cut butter into flour and salt with pastry blender or two knives until mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in milk until mixture comes together and forms a soft dough. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate one hour or overnight. On a lightly floured surface, roll dough into a 12-inch circle. Fold dough into thirdsunfold and roll again into a 12-inch circle. Fold into thirdsunfold again and roll into a 12-inch circle. Fold into thirdsunfold once moreroll into a 12-inch circle. Using a 3-inch round cutter, cut out dough roundsreserve scraps for a second set of dough rounds. Place rounds on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone baking matrefrigerate 30 minutes or until firm.

Combine white bread and half-and-half. Let soak for 30 minutes. Combine ground chicken with egg, salt and pepper. Dip chicken into soaked bread mixture. In a skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add chicken and cook until browned on both sides. Drain and remove chicken. In a small bowl, combine dry bread crumbs and Parmesan. Sprinkle over chicken and bake in 350 oven for 15 minutes.

Cook the elbow macaroni according to package directions. Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the ground beef to the saucepan and cook for 5 minutes. Add the onion and cook for 3 minutes more or until the onion is softened. Add the paprika and cook for 1 minute more. Add the frozen corn and cook for 1 minute more. Add the tomato sauce, the chopped tomato, the macaroni, the cheddar cheese, the frozen peas and the salt and pepper to the saucepan. Toss to combine well. Cook for 10 minutes more or until the cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

In mixer bowl, beat butter with applesauce until fluffy. Add sugar and vanilla, beat well. Blend in dry ingredients. Add morsels. Shape into small balls and place on cookie sheet. Bake at 350 f for 10-12 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray 2 baking sheets with cooking spray. Separate petals. Gently press inside of blossoms to flatten. Stuff cheese filling inside blossoms. Sprinkle with herbs. Bake 15 minutes. Combine chopped tomatoes, onions, vinegar and herbs. Dress blossoms with vinaigrette. Serve on bed of greens.
Zucchini is one of those garden vegetables that is easy to grow. In fact it is considered a "sure thing" by many gardeners because it is one of those plants that will produce even if you are not the best gardener.
Zucchini can be eaten cooked or raw. It has a mild flavor that makes it easy to eat with just about any food. Zucchini is delicious on its own, but it also makes an excellent addition to soups and salads. It is also an excellent choice for baking.
There are many recipes available for cooking zucchini. You can make it into pancakes, fritters, casser

Fill a large pot with cold water and add the fiddleheads. Cover and bring to a boil over high heat. Uncover, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until tender crisp, about 3 minutes. Drain well and transfer to a bowl of ice water to stop cooking. Drain againpat dry with paper towels. Heat the oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook until it just begins to brown. Add the fiddleheads to the skillet and cook until they are well browned, stirring frequently. Add lemon juice and stir until it coats the fiddleheads well. Remove from heat and serve immediately.

Sift together the flour, baking powder, and vanilla. In a separate bowl, beat together the butter and the egg yolks. Stir the dry mixture into the creamed mixture, then stir in the milk. Beat in the egg whites until the batter is smooth. Heat a frying pan over medium-low heat and coat with butter. Pour 1/4 cup batter into the pan for each pancake. Brown on both sides and cook through in the center. Serve with rum sauce.

Trim the woody ends of the asparagus spears. Steam the asparagus until just tender. While the asparagus is cooking, combine the juice of the orange, vinegar, garlic, cheese and salt and pepper to taste in a small sauce pan. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 10 minutes or until the sauce has reduced to 1/2 cup. Remove from heat and cool for 15 minutes to thicken slightly. While the sauce is cooling, place the cherry tomatoes on a plate or platter and sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Drain the asparagus when it is cooked and arrange them over the cherry tomatoes. Drizzle the warm sauce over the top of the spears. Toss gently to combine and serve immediately.
Name: Baked Asparagus with Parmesan Cheese Ingredients: 1 pound medium asparagus 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese 1/4 cup panko bread crumbs 1

Boil potatoes until fork tender. Drain. Melt butter in large skillet. Saute onion and carrots until tender. Add ground beef. Brown. Add corn, mushrooms. Season with salt and pepper. Pour into baking dish. Add milk. Mix potatoes in. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes.

Hard cook the eggs. Let them cool, then cut them in half lengthwise and scoop out the yolks. In a mixing bowl combine the yolks with all the other ingredients except for the tarragon leaves. Season with salt and pepper and mix well. Spoon the mixture back into the hollowed out egg whites and garnish with tarragon leaves. Chill in refrigerator until ready to serve.

Brown chicken in pan with diced onion and celery. Add broth and seasonings. Add carrots and peas. Cook for 15 to 20 minutes. Add diced tomatoes and chilies. Heat through. In a separate bowl combine spaghetti and cheese. Spoon chicken mixture into 9 x 13 casserole dish and top with cheese mixture. Bake at 350 for 15 to 20 minutes. Serve hot.

Heat oil in skillet and cook onions and garlic cloves over medium-low heat until soft. Add gingerroot and cook about 1 minute. Add chicken breasts and saute 5 minutes. Add diced tomatoes and lime juice and bring to a boil. Add curry powder and cook 5 minutes longer. Remove from heat and add chopped coriander. Serve with basmati rice.

Brown sausage and red peppers in large saucepan over medium-high heat until sausage is cooked through. Add milk, cheese, and cooked rice. Simmer over medium-low heat until cheese is melted and mixture is hot. Stir in broccoli and heat through.

Cook ground beef in a skillet with onions until it is cooked thoroughly. Drain the fat. Add pasta sauce and mix well. Pour into a 9 by 13 baking dish. Boil pasta in water until tender and drain. Stir in baby spinach, ricotta cheese, parmesan cheese and 1 cup mozzarella cheese. Spread mixture over the meat mixture evenly. Sprinkle the remaining mozzarella cheese over top of the lasagna. Bake for 35 to 45 minutes or until the sauce is bubbly.
Cool cake for hot days!

Prepare grill. Prepare the marinade by combining olive oil, Worcestershire sauce and seasonings in a large bowl. Add the cherry tomatoes and shrimp and coat with the marinade. Refrigerate at least 30 minutes or up to 2 hours. Remove the shrimp and cherry tomatoes from the marinade and thread onto the wooden skewers. Place the skewers on the grill and cook for 2 to 3 minutes on each side or until the shrimp are pink and firm. Serve immediately.

Cream sugar and margarine. Add corn syrup and egg. Blend well. Beat in flour and egg white. Add almond extract. Spray cookie sheet and pour dough. Add poppy seeds. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with sugar. Cool and remove from pan. Cut into squares.

Slice steak into thin strips. Heat oil in skillet. Brown meat in oil. Add water and onion soup mix. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer about 10 minutes. Stir in sour cream. Add flour to 2 tbsp water and stir into gravy. Cook 2 minutes longer. Serve over egg noodles or rice.

Cut halibut fillets into 1/2 inch cubes. Sprinkle lightly with lemon-pepper seasoning. Place in a large platter. Chop large shrimp into bite-sized pieces. Sprinkle over halibut. Place fennel seed on top of mixture. Chill. Serve cold.
Brown roast. In a small bowl combine remaining ingredients. Pour over roast. Cook at 350 F. for 1 1/2 hours. Turn and baste every 15 minutes. Slice thinly. Serve with horseradish sauce.

Brown beef and drain grease. Combine beef, kidney beans, pizza sauce and italian stewed tomatoes. Add water as needed. Mix in green pepper and pizza seasoning. Simmer for 20 minutes. Top each bowl of chili with pepperoni and mozzarella cheese.

Cream butter and sugar. Add milk and vanilla. Blend well. Combine dry ingredients with salt. Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture alternately with milk. Stir in chips. Drop by spoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 for 10-12 minutes. Makes about 4 dozen large cookies.

Cream margarine with sugar until light and fluffy. Add molasses and beat well. Sift together flour, spices and salt. Add to margarine mixture and mix well. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour or until firm. Roll into 1-inch balls and roll in granulated sugar. Place on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 for 8-10 minutes until lightly browned. Cool on wire rack.

Cut brisket into small cubes. Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Place jalapenos in a small bowlcover with hot water for 20 minutes. Drainpat dry. Beat cream cheese until smooth. Add brisket and baconstir well. Stuff each jalapeno with mixture. Bake 25 minutes or until done to your liking. Makes about 30 pieces.

Beat eggs and water together. Melt butter. Add the eggs and cook until almost set. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add peppers, onions and mushrooms. Top with pizza sauce and cheeses. Add pepperoni and olives. Bake for 10 minutes.

Place tomatoes and juice in a saucepan. Bring to boil over medium heat. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 3 minutes. Blend until smooth. Return mixture to saucepan. Add milk and basil. Bring to boil over medium heat. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 10 minutes or until heated through. Ladle into bowls. Garnish with basil leaves and cheese. Serve with bread.

Combine all the spices in a bowl. Place lamb in bowl and mix to incorporate. Heat 1 T oil in a large skillet or grill pan. Form lamb into 4 patties, about 1/2 inch thick. Brown on each side. Place flat breads on baking sheet. Toast until golden brown. Place flatbreads on plate. Spread 1 T tzatziki on each flat bread. Arrange lamb patty on flat breads. Top with spinach and feta cheese. Serve.
Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Cook onion and carrot in oil 4 minutes. Add chicken, and cook 1 minute. Stir in remaining ingredients. Cook 2 minutes. Serve warm or cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line bottom of spring form pan with parchment paper or wax papergrease sides with butter. Crush gingersnap cookiesmix with melted butter. Press crumb mixture evenly into bottom of pan. Bake for 5 minutes in preheated oven. Cool completely in pan on wire rack. In a large bowl, beat cream cheese until light and fluffy. Add sour cream, and beat until smooth. Gradually beat in brandy, then beat in sugar and eggs. Beat well. Pour filling over cookie crust in pan. Bake in preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes, or until filling is set and top is lightly browned around the edges. Cool completely in pan on wire rack. Remove from pan. Cut into slices and serve.

Heat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease and flour a 10 cup bundt pan. Beat butter with a mixer until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in sweetened condensed milk and milk until smooth. In a small bowl, combine flour and baking powderbeat into butter mixture alternately with flour mixture and sweetened condensed milk. Fold in shredded coconut until evenly distributed. Pour batter into prepared pan and spread evenly. Bake for 45 minutes or until a wooden toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely. Dust with more shredded coconut before serving.
Combine eggs and 1/2 cup of sugar in a blender. Add butter and blend. Add lemon juice and pulp and blend. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake in 400 degree oven for 15 minutes. Makes one 9 inch pie.

Combine apple juice, lemon juice, and orange zest in a small bowlset aside. Add the cinnamon sticks to the bowlset aside. In a large bowl, combine the apples, pineapple, oranges, and seedless grapesset aside. Just before serving, stir the lemon-orange mixture into the fruit mixture. Serve immediately.

Pour the cranberry juice and limeade concentrate into a punch bowl or large pitcher. Add the carbonated lemon-lime beverage and the ice cubes. Add the vodka and the orange liqueur. Serve immediately with slices of limes.

Slice the tomatoes into 1/4 inch thick slices. Place in a bowl. Add the capers, basil, vinegar, water, oil, and the crushed garlic. Toss the mixture. Salt and pepper to taste. Let marinate for at least 15 minutes before serving.

Heat oil in a large soup pot over medium-high heat. Saute onion and garlic clove in oil until translucent. Add bell peppers and saute until tender. Add tomato puree and bring to a boil. Add cannellini beans and water. Reduce heat to low and simmer 20-25 minutes. Add additional water if necessary. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Dice beef and saute in bacon drippings until done. Crumble into chunks. Brown chicken breast in bacon drippings. Remove to plate and set aside. In same pan saute onion until soft. Add flour. Stir until flour is lightly browned. Add soup and beef. Bring to boil. Add mushrooms. Cook until done. Place on top of chicken. Ladle sauce on top of chicken and sauce. Top with sour cream, bacon bits, and parsley flakes. Serve over cooked pasta or rice.
Combine first 4 ingredients. Cook for 1 minute. Add vanilla and then stir in oats. Drop by spoonfuls onto wax paper. Cool before removing from wax paper.
In a small bowl, beat cream cheese until smooth. Add chili sauce and mix well. Stir in shrimp and parsley. Serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Rinse and pat dry the chicken breasts. In a small bowl combine flour, salt and paprika. In another small bowl combine milk and pepper. Dip the chicken breasts into the milk mixture and then into the flour mixture, coating each side well. Place the coated breasts into a 9x13 inch baking dish and bake for about 45 minutes or until the juices run clear and the chicken is cooked through. While the breasts are cooking prepare the liquid shortening. In a small saucepan over medium heat combine the butter and milk, bring to a boil and then remove from the heat and add the shortening, whisking constantly until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Spoon the shortening mixture over the cooked chicken breasts and bake for another 5 minutes or until the top is browned and crispy.

Cook beef. Add onion. Cook until tender. Drain. In a 2 qt. casserole combine the cooked meat, onion mixture, egg, 1/2 cup of cottage cheese, 1/2 cup of mozzarella cheese, penne pasta, and spaghetti sauce. Stir well. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Mix all together. Form into patties with a little flour on your hands. Grill or fry in a skillet until browned on both sides. Top with cheese while grilling or put a slice on top of each patty. Serve on buns or with potato salad.

Combine the eggs and milk. Soak the slices of bread in the egg mixture. Melt the butter and brown the egg soaked slices of bread on both sides in the butter. Sprinkle the top of the french toast with cinnamon and sugar. Place the french toast in the oven on 350 for about 10 minutes or until it is cooked all the way through.

Wash swiss chard and cut into strips. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add swiss chard, onion, garlic. Saute 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in egg whites. Place skillet back over heat. Cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add beaten egg yolks. Stir constantly over medium heat for 3 to 4 minutes. Add tomatoes, basil and cheese. Cook for 1 minute longer. Serve hot.

Cut 6 or 7 beans into thirds. Wrap each third of a green bean around one slice of bacon. Secure with wooden picks (if you can find any). Mix brown sugar and soy sauce in saucepan. Heat over medium heat until brown sugar is melted. Stir in butter and garlic. Pour over bundles. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake 15 minutes longer or until bacon is crisp.

Wash and cut the green beans. Heat the butter over medium heat and saute the garlic. Add the beans and the seasonings. Toss and cook over medium heat until the butter is absorbed by the beans. Serve immediately.

Combine broccoli with thyme in a large pot of boiling water. Reduce heat to medium and cook 3 minutes or until just tender. Drain. Melt 3 tbsp butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add orangecook 1 minute or until slightly tender. Add honey and gingercook 30 seconds. Stir in broccoli. Cook 1 minute or until heated through.

Bring 4 cups of water to boil. Stir barley into boiling water. Coverreduce heat. Simmer 30 minutes or until barley is tender. Meanwhile, heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion. Cook until tender. Stir in garlic. Cook 2 minutes longer. Add tomatoes, basil, and oregano. Cook 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in barley.
I have had good luck with these recipes. I hope you find them useful. If you find more recipes for this theme, please share them with us!
Happy Birthday to my husband! We're going to spend a lazy Saturday at home. I'm thinking of making some delicious tomato soup and serving it with some good bread for lunch. I'll let you know how it turns out!
I'm so excited to announce that I have been asked to be part of a cookbook project that will benefit the American Heart Association. It's called "The Heart Healthy Cookbook for Women" and will include recipes from women all over North America.
The idea was conceived by Kathleen

Scoop out the meat of the pineapple and add to a blender with the rest of the ingredients. Blend until very smooth and creamy. Pour into two tall glasses and serve immediately with a sprinkling of cinnamon on top.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute the onion until translucent. Add the butter and saute until melted. Add the garlic and saute until soft. Add the shrimp and the serrano chilies. Season with the kosher salt. Cook until the shrimp are pink. Remove the skillet from the heat. Garnish the cooked shrimp with the fresh cilantro. Serve with the corn tortillas, the limes, and the hot sauce.

Pierce the eggplants with a fork first in a few places so it wont explode in the oven. Bake the eggplants for 1 hour, or until it is soft throughout. Cool the eggplants. Slice the tops off the baguettes. Cut the bottoms of the baguettes so they stand up on the serving dish. Spread the bottoms of the baguettes with tomatoes. On top of the tomatoes spread the mozzarella cheese. Cut the eggplants into little cubes. Slice the basil. Spread the basil leaves over the mozzarella cheese. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese. Lay the top of the baguette on top of the cheese. Serve.
Cream together butter, icing sugar, cornstarch, flour, vanilla & salt. Form into balls. Place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake in a 350 oven for 10-15 minutes or until golden.

In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Stir in the onions and cook until translucent. Add the corn and cook 3 minutes. Season to taste. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant. Stir in the cayenne and cook until the corn is heated through. Pour the mixture into a blender or food processor. Add the goat cheese and milk and blend until smooth. Season to taste. Garnish with freshly chopped jalapeño. Serve immediately.

Pound cheddar and cream cheese together in a small bowl until blended. Spread mixture over both halves of the bread, reserving 1/2 cup of the mixture for the top. Sprinkle top with green onion and remaining cheddar mixture. Broil until top is melted and lightly browned. Remove from oven and let stand 10 minutes before cutting into wedges to serve.
In a saucepan over medium heat, combine condensed milk with evaporated milk. Cook until thick. Stir in vanilla and espresso powder. Stir in white chocolate until melted. Serve with lattes or mochas.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Beat egg whites until foamy. Gradually add sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time, beating constantly. Add flour, spices, and oilmix well. Dough will be stiff. Divide dough into 24 portionsroll each portion into a 12 inch rope. Place ropes on greased cookie sheetsflatten with a spatula to 1/2 inch thickness. Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks. Makes 24 cookies

Peel carrotscut into 1-inch slices. In a medium saucepan, combine water with the rest of the ingredients. Cook over high heat until the liquid is reduced by half. Remove from the heatcool slightly. Drain and arrange the carrot slices on a serving plate in a single layerspoon the liquid over the slices.
Blend cream cheese with sour cream and mayonnaise in a large bowl. Stir in the rest of the ingredients. Serve with favorite crackers or party bread.

Sauté onion in olive oil in large heavy pot over medium heat, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and sauté 1 minute more. Add wine and cook 5 minutes. Add broth, cover and simmer 10 minutes. Add escarole and cook 5 minutes more or until escarole is tender. Add cannellini beanscover and simmer 5 minutes or more to heat through. Season to taste with salt and pepper, sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Cream together cream cheese and mayonnaise until smooth and spread over each cracker. Top each with crabmeat, a shrimp and a few strips of green onion and a pinch of dill weed. Serve immediately or refrigerate up to 1 day ahead. Serve chilled. Makes about 4 dozen appetizer pieces.
Microwave frozen cauliflower until tender. Mash with butter and sour cream. Add parsley and cheese. Place in pie plate. Bake at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes.

Slice the bread into thin slices and arrange on a shallow baking sheet or pizza pan. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Place the bread slices in the oven and bake for about 5 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from the oven and let cool for a minute or two before spreading with the melted butter. Slice the tomatoes into thin slices and place on the toasted bread slices. Top with the mozzarella cheese. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper to taste. Drizzle with the olive oil. Garnish with the basil leaves and serve immediately.

In a large pot combine cauliflower, carrot, peas, pineapple juice and chicken stock. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 15 minutes or until tender. Stir in chickpeas and green curry paste. Cook for 5 minutes. Pour in coconut milk. Simmer for 5 minutes more. Stir in pineapple and heat through. Garnish with cilantro. Serve over rice.
My husband loves to make soups but he has a difficult time finding the time to do it. I can just see him making this one, though. Thanks!
This recipe looks very similar to the one that I posted a couple of days ago. I'll have to try both.
Oh my, I think my family would go nuts for these recipes.
I will have to try a couple of them.

Spread each slice of bread with Dijon mustard on one side. Sprinkle on one slice with bacon bits. Top with turkey slices. Spread on one slice of bread with mayonnaise. Sprinkle with cranberry sauce. Layer on one slice of bread. Top with one slice of Gruyere cheese. Place sandwiches on hot griddle or skillet. Cook until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is melted. Flip sandwiches over. Cook until the other side of sandwiches are golden brown and the other side of the sandwiches are melted. Cut sandwiches in half diagonally. Serve on plates.

In a large stockpot, combine the water, cornstarch, chicken broth, chicken bouillon cubes and ground sage. Cook over medium heat until the mixture thickens. Remove the bouillon cubes. Serve warm over white rice.

Peel and slice mangoes lengthwise. In a blender combine 1/2 cup chopped mango, 1/4 cup rum, 1/4 cup lime juice, 1/4 cup sugar and 1/4 cup orange liqueur. Blend until smooth and frothy. Strain mixture through a fine mesh strainer. Pour mixture over crushed ice in 4 glasses. Garnish each glass with 1/4 mango slice and 1/4 slice lime.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Heat 1 tbsp oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Sprinkle chops with 1/4 tsp salt and 1/4 tsp pepper. Brown chops in hot oil 3 minutes per side. Remove from pan. Heat remaining 1 tbsp oil in pan. Add garlic and saute 30 seconds. Add broth. Stirring constantly, bring to boil. Return chops to pan. Add remaining ingredients and gently stir to combine. Transfer to shallow baking dish. Bake 15 minutes. Turn chops over and bake 15 minutes more or until chops are done. Serve with hot cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 400f. Grease or line muffin cups with paper cups and set aside. Mix all-purpose and cornmeal together in a large bowl. In another bowl combine eggs, oil and milk. Stir egg mixture into dry ingredients just until moistened. Stir in pumpkin and nuts. Spoon into prepared cups filling 2/3 full. Bake 15-20 minutes until golden and springs back when lightly touched with a finger.
name: pumpkin cream soup
ingredients: butter, onion, curry powder, flour, chicken broth, canned pumpkin, brown sugar, nutmeg, salt, milk
preparation:Saute onion in butter. Add curry powder and flour. Cook until bubbly. Add other ingredients. Simmer. Garnish with chives or parsley.
name: pumpkin bran muffins
ingredients: wheat flour, wheat bran, sugar, ground cinnamon, pumpkin puree,

In a large skillet brown meat with chopped onion and potatoes. Drain and add sage, salt and curry powder and chili powder. Add enough water to cover. Simmer over low heat for 15 minutes. Serve with hamburger bun and cheese.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease a 10 inch bundt pan or a 9x13x2 inch pan. Thaw the rolls for 1 hour at room temperature or overnight in the refrigerator. In a medium bowl combine the pudding mix, brown sugar, butter, eggs, nuts and cinnamon. Pour the pudding mixture over the rolls in the pan. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the pan comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before turning out onto a serving plate. Dust with powdered sugar before serving.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, saute zucchini in a small amount of salt. When almost tender, add the vegetable broth. Cover and cook over low heat for 5 minutes. Remove the lid and cook for 2 minutes more. Stir in the garlic. Cook 2 more minutes. Stir in the lime juice and black pepper. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with the oregano. Serve immediately.

Heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions and saute until soft. Add ground pork and sprinkle with spices. Stir to combine and cook until browned. Add stock and frozen peas. Cover and simmer until beans are tender. Whisk together yogurt and 2 tablespoons water in a small bowl until smooth. Add to skillet and heat through. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.

Combine apples juice & vodka in a crock pot. Add tea bags & simmer for about 15 minutes. Remove tea bags & add the brown sugar & spices. Heat until brown sugar has dissolved & the mixture is heated through. Serve hot.

Mix apples, water, lemon juice and cinnamon together. In separate bowl, combine flour and brown sugar. Add margarine and mix until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Sprinkle over apples and bake at 425 for 40 minutes or until top is brown and apples are tender. Cool slightly before serving with ice cream or whipped cream.

In a small bowl stir together rice vinegar, soy sauce, rice vinegar, rice wine and corn syrup. Heat olive oil in a small sauce pan over medium high heat. Add the scallions and cook until they just start to soften and turn brown. Add the garlic and cook until softened. Add the red chili paste and cook until fragrant and bubbling. Pour in the rice vinegar mixture and cook until the rice vinegar has reduced by half. Whisk in the sesame oil and cook until the mixture has thickened. Stir in the sesame seeds and serve.

Wash the eggplants. Cut them lengthways into thin slices. Dip the slices in plain flour, then in rice flour, then dip them in a mixture of 1 teaspoon of baking powder mixed into 300 ml of soda water. Heat oil in a wok or frypan. Drop the slices into the oil. Fry till crisp. Remove them from the oil with a slotted spoon. Drain on kitchen paper. Sprinkle the fried slices with lime juice, salt and pepper. Serve while hot.

In a medium saucepan combine the soymilk and rice. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat and simmer until the liquid is absorbed, stirring occasionally. Stir in the brown sugar and raisins. Season with salt. Divide the mixture evenly among four serving bowls. Garnish with almonds and rose water.

1. Slice bread into 1/2" slices. Spread the cheese on one side of each slice of bread. Place 2 slices together and cut each sandwich in half diagonally. Place in a ziplock bag.
2. In a small bowl combine the soy sauce and honey. Pour over the sandwiches in the bag. Press the sides of the bag together and turn several times until the sandwiches are coated on both sides with the soy sauce/honey mixture.
3. Refrigerate for 1/2 hour. Remove from the refrigerator. Spread the mustard on the other side of each sandwich.
4. Cut each sandwich in half and

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grease a 8x8 inch baking dishset aside. Peel applescore, leaving stems intact. Mix together 1 cup of apples with 2 teaspoons of cinnamon, 1 teaspoon of nutmeg, 1/2 cup of rolled oats, and 1/3 cup of raisins. Mix together remaining apples with 1/2 cup of rolled oats and 1/3 cup raisins. Stir together 1/4 cup of brown sugar and 1 tablespoon of water in a saucepan over medium heat until sugar dissolvesbring to a simmer. Remove from heatstir in 2 tablespoons of caramel topping until melted. Pour half of caramel mixture over prepared dishtop with apple-oatmeal mixture. Top with remaining caramel mixture. Bake in preheated oven until apples are tender when pierced with a knife, about 40 minutes.

Melt butter with brown sugar on medium heat until well blended. Stir in eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add vanilla. Sift together flour, baking powder and salt. Gradually add to butter mixture, stirring to combine well after each addition. Fold in 2 cups of chocolate chips. Spread in a greased 9x13x2 inch pan. Bake at 350f for 25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool. Melt remaining 1 cup of chocolate chips with 1 tablespoon of shortening over low heat until smooth. Spread over top of bars. Sprinkle with toasted nuts if desired. Cool completely before cutting.

Place chicken wings in a large bowl. Combine the remaining ingredients and mix well. Add to the wings and toss well to coat. Place the wings on a baking sheet. Bake at 400° for 45 minutes or until the skin is crispy. Serve with carrot sticks, celery sticks and blue cheese dressing for dipping.

Prepare a medium-hot charcoal fire or preheat the broiler. Place bread slices on grill or broiler toasting both sides until golden brown. Rub the toasted sides with the garlic. Brush with olive oil. Combine the tomatoes, basil leaves, onion, roasted red peppers, vinegar, salt and pepper in a bowl. Spoon evenly over the bread slices. Serve immediately.

In a small saucepan combine butter and rosemary sprigs, and cook over low heat until butter is melted and rosemary is fragrant. Remove from heat and cool for 15 minutes, then pour over walnut halves. Add salt and cayenne to taste and stir well.

In a large saucepan combine the sugar and salt. Cook over low heat until it is dissolved and mixture begins to boil. Boil over low heat for one minute, stirring constantly. Add the white corn syrup and stir until it is melted and mixture begins to boil again. Boil over low heat for two more minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the peanut butter until it is melted and blended with the mixture. Add the whole milk and butter and stir until melted and mixture begins to boil again. Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla and nuts. Quickly pour into the prepared pan and let cool completely before cutting.

In a small bowl combine together the lime juice, olive oil, garlic and thyme. Add the chicken and toss to coat. Let stand for 10 minutes. Remove from the marinade and thread the chicken onto 4 metal skewers. Place the skewers over medium heat and grill the chicken for 5 minutes per side or until no longer pink in the center. Remove the chicken from the grill and slice the chicken into 1/2 inch pieces. In a large bowl combine together the penne and the tomatoes. Pour in the oil and garlic mixture and toss to coat. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Lay the chicken over the top of the penne and garnish with fresh thyme. Serve immediately.

Mix dry ingredients. Add pie filling. Cut up apples into chunks. Add. Stir in butter. Add egg. Add water to make a soft dough. Fill muffin cups about half full. Bake at 350f for 20 minutes. Makes 12 muffins.

Heat milk to boiling point. Let cool. Mix egg yolks with sugar, flour, and salt. Beat until foamy and gradually add milk. Bring to boiling point, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and add butter. Beat well. Pour into buttered baking dish. Bake in 350 degree oven 30 to 40 minutes or until set. Cool slightly, pour fruit sauce over top of cake. Cool completely.
Brown sausage and cut into small pieces. Spread tomato sauce on each piece of french bread and sprinkle with seasonings. Top with sausage and cheeses. Bake at 350 until bubbly and golden brown.

Prepare two 9-inch round pans with a little butter and flour. In a large bowl beat together the egg whites, sugar and salt until frothy. Continue beating until stiff peaks form. In a separate bowl combine the flour and sifted cream of tartar. Fold the dry ingredients into the whites. Beat in the almond flavoring. Bake in the pans at 350 degrees F for 30 to 40 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.

Combine mustard powder, salt, and pepper in a small bowl. Place butter in a medium saucepan over low heat. Stir in mustard mixture and cook until butter is melted and bubbly, about 1 minute. Remove from heatstir in cedar planks. Place planks in a large piece of aluminum foil. Divide the butter mixture evenly between the planks, spreading it over the planks to make a 1/2-inch-thick layer. Place a piece of salmon, skin side down, over each plank. Sprinkle with remaining mustard mixture. Fold foil around planks to form a sealed pouch. Grill for 10 minutesflip and grill for an additional 5 minutes or until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Remove fish from planks. Serve with chives sprinkled over fish and planks.

Preheat oven to 350. Cut apples into 1/2-inch slices. Mix lemon juice and sugar. Place slices in a baking dish. Pour over apples. Sprinkle with 1/3 cup oatmeal and 1/3 cup brown sugar. Combine flour, cinnamon and saltcut in butter until crumbly. Sprinkle over oats. Bake for 30-40 minutes until topping is golden brown. Serves 4.

Boil 1 pound fettucine according to package directions. Reserve 1 cup pasta water and drain fettucine. Heat 1 tablespoon butter in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Stir in cognac and cook until evaporated. Add whipping cream, tomato sauce, and 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Heat until warm and smooth. Stir in reserved 1 cup pasta water and cook until slightly thickened. Add prosciutto and mushrooms and stir until mushrooms are heated through and prosciutto is crisp. Serve with remaining 3 tablespoons butter and 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese. Serves 4-6. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Bring a pot of water to boil. Add kale and cook for 2 min or until tender. Remove from water and drain. In a large bowl add the cooked kale, udon noodles, and toasted sesame oiltoss lightly. Top with the sesame seeds.

Peel potatoes and cut into 1-inch cubes. Place them in a large saucepan and add enough cold water to cover by 2 inches. Add a big pinch of salt, then bring to a boil over high heat, reduce heat and simmer until the potatoes are tender but still slightly firm in the center, 10-15 minutes. Drain the potatoes through a colander set into the sink and let them cool slightly while you make the sauce. Mash the potatoes until smooth or coarsely mash them, then beat in the parmesan cheese until it's almost completely blended into the potato mixture. Beat in the yogurt and margarine until well combined. Stir in the remaining 2 tablespoons parmesan and the salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm or at room temperature, garnished with the chives, if desired.

Combine butter and marshmallows in top of double boiler. Heat until melted. Remove from heat and add peanut butter. Stir until smooth. Add cereal and peanuts. Spread in greased 9 x 13-inch pan. Cool. Cut into squares. Makes 18.

Combine apple juice and strawberry with frozen raspberries in a blender. Blend for 1-2 minutes until all ingredients are blended. Add ice cube. Blend for 1-2 minutes until all ingredients are blended. Serve immediately.

We always have new dog supplies in our range and regularly add new dog products. You

In a large stockpot or dutch oven, heat oil over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and fry for about 1 minute. Add chopped onion and fry for about 10 minutes. Add chili flakes and fry for another minute. Add split red lentils and stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for about an hour. Add chopped tomatoes and cook for another hour. Add chickpeas and simmer for an additional half hour. Stir in cilantro and adjust seasoning. Serve warm or cool. Serve with greek yogurt if desired.

Preheat oven to 375f. Heat fries in microwave on high for 4 to 5 minutes or until heated through stirring once. Combine hot sauce and vinegar in a small bowlset aside. In a small saucepan or skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add hot sauce mixture stirring constantly until mixture is well-blended with melted butter. Serve fries warm with blue cheese or ranch dressing for dipping.

Melt butter in heavy-bottom saucepan over medium heat. Add onionsaute until tender. Stir in flour, stirring constantly until bubbly. Stir in stock. Add broccoli. Simmer for 15 minutes. Stir in pepper and cayenne. Add milk. Cook until heated through. Stir in cheese.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Wash the tomatoes thoroughly. Cut a small cross into the bottom of each tomato so that they will sit flat on the baking sheet. Stuff each tomato with a small amount of ricotta and sprinkle with parsley and basil. Add a pinch of crushed black pepper and a few garlic cloves to the center of the tomatoes. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Return to the oven until the breadcrumbs begin to brown, about 10 minutes.

In a large skillet over medium heat, saute mushrooms and green onions in butter for 3 minutes or until mushrooms are lightly browned. Stir in flour and cook 1 minute. Add milk and parsley. Cook and stir 3 minutes or until thick and bubbly. Stir in lemon rind and season with salt and pepper to taste. Place 1/2 cup sauce in a shallow bowl. Combine remaining sauce with melted butter. Dip fillets into sauce and coat thoroughly. Place fillets in a baking dish. Pour butter sauce over fillets. Bake at 400 for 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Garnish with fresh parsley. Serve with mashed potatoes and green beans.

Bring the broth to a boil in a small pot. Add the orzo pasta and cook until just done (about 6 to 8 minutes). Drain the pasta and set aside. In the same pot, melt the butter over medium-low heat. Add the frozen chopped spinach and cook, stirring frequently until it wilts (about 3 minutes). Add the egg and cook, stirring frequently until the egg is fully cooked (about 4 minutes). Remove from the heat and add the pasta and broth to the spinach mixture. Add the cheese and season with salt and pepper to taste.

In a small bowl combine basil, mint, salt and pepper. Set aside. In a large skillet heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add garlic and saute for 1 to 2 minutes. Add chicken and cook until browned. Pour wine vinegar and lemon juice over chicken and cook for about 2 minutes. Sprinkle with basil mixture and serve with pasta.

Place peppercorns in a small nonreactive bowl and cover with kosher salt. Crush with a wooden spoon until mixture is powdery. Rub liberally over both sides of each steak. Place each steak between two sheets of plastic wrap and pound with a mallet or rolling pin until 1/2 inch thick. Repeat with remaining steaks. Heat a large cast iron skillet or grill pan over high heat and add 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil. Sear each side of each steak for 2 minutes or until lightly charred on each side. Transfer to a platter and let rest for 5 minutes. Slice each steak against the grain into 1 inch thick slices. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350. Place a layer of tortilla chips in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Layer onion on top. Sprinkle with garlic powder. Top with cooked chicken. Pour cream of chicken soup over mixture. Stir in cheese. Sprinkle with green chiles. Pour milk over mixture. Bake for 30 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Top with sour cream. Serves 6-8.

Slice potatoes 1/4 inch thick. Pour oil over potatoes to cover them. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake in 350c oven until tender. Brush fish with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Place on grill. Cook 5 minutes on each side. While fish is cooking, in medium bowl combine tomatoes, onions, capers and basil. Add 2 tbsp. of extra virgin olive oil. Toss to blend. Cut fish into serving portions. Sprinkle with capers. Place on potato slices. Top with tomato mixture. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Mix dry ingredients and then mix wet and dry together until just blended. Do not over mix. Add butter to skillet and heat in oven while bread is baking. When bread is done, pour butter over it and serve hot with butter and/or maple syrup.
Combine spinach with vinegar, soy sauce, and sesame seeds. Add sesame oil. Toss. Add vegetable oil. Serves 4.

Heat butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add in chopped onion and cook until tender. Add in eggs and stir until well combined. Add in frozen spinach (no need to defrost). Stir until well combined. Add in parmesan cheese, breadcrumbs, seasoning and mozzarella cheese. Stir to combine. Form into 4 patties and place on a baking sheet. Bake in preheated oven for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown on both sides and heated through.

Roast peppers on a baking sheet until skins are blackened. Let cool in a sealed container for a day. Peel off blackened skins. Chop roasted peppers into small pieces. In a blender, combine remaining ingredients. Whip until smooth. Refrigerate until ready to use. Dressing should last for 2 weeks.
Fresh sweet bell peppers are among the most versatile vegetables in the garden. Their sweet flavor is perfect for snacks or appetizers and they can be chopped up and added to salads or vegetable dishes. Bell peppers have thick walls that make them excellent for stuffing with a variety of fillings. You can use bell peppers in soups, pasta dishes, and casseroles. Bell peppers are available in a variety of colors from green to orange or red. All varieties are sweet and mild with the green being the least sweet. Choose bell peppers that are firm with smooth skin. Store bell peppers in the refrigerator for up to a week. If you find that your bell peppers are not as sweet as you would like, try using them in soups or past

Brush both sides of fish with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place in an ungreased 9-inch square baking pan. Combine green onions and chopped tomato. Sprinkle over fish. Bake at 375 for 25 minutes. Garnish with parsley and lime wedges.

Heat oven to 450 degrees f. Heat oil in ovenproof skillet over medium heat until hot. Place mahi mahi in skillet. Sprinkle both sides of fish with salt and pepper. Bake uncovered 5 minutes per inch of thickness of fish. Turn fillets and bake 5 minutes more or until fish is opaque throughout and flakes easily when tested with fork. Meanwhile prepare sauce. Heat oil in small saucepan over medium heat until hot. Add garlic and cook and stir until golden. Stir in vinegar and lemon juice. Add tomatoes and simmer 2 minutes or until heated through. Add basil and season to taste with paprika and salt and pepper. Divide sauce among four plates. Serve fish on top of sauce. Makes 4 servings.

Wash the tomatoes. Remove the cores and seeds. Cut into large chunks. In a large pot combine the tomatoes. Green peppers. Serrano peppers. Jalapeno peppers. Hot peppers. Vinegar. Onions. Brown sugar. And salt. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat. Reduce the heat and simmer. Stirring occasionally. For about 45 minutes. Remove from heat. Ladle the mixture into hot. Sterile. Glass jars. Add 1/2 inch of head space. Process the canned tomato mixture in a boiling water bath for 45 minutes. Cool completely. Store the canned tomato mixture in a dark. Cool area.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Prick the potato all over with a fork. Rub with olive oil and place in a baking pan or on a cookie sheet. Bake until tender when pierced with a fork, about 1 hour. In the meantime, saute the pepper in a skillet with the olive oil and the garlic until tender-crisp, about 10 minutes. Transfer the peppers to a blender or food processorprocess to a smooth puree. Season with salt and pepper to taste. When the potatoes are done, cut in half lengthwise. Spoon the pepper puree into the potato halves, sprinkle with the sage leaves, drizzle with olive oil, sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese.
Dissolve jello in hot water. Add cream cheese and stir. Add cool whip. Chill and add the fruit before serving.

Heat the almond milk on the stove over medium heat. Add the dry oats and cook for about 15-20 minutes. When cooked remove from the heat and stir in the remaining ingredients. Put back on the stove and heat for another 5 minutes. Serve in a bowl and top with your favorite fruit.
