Preheat broiler. Cut each loaf of bread into two slices. Place on baking sheet. Mash or crush the garlic clove with the back of a spoon. Add the garlic and mayonnaise to a small bowl and mix together. Spread the mixture on each slice of bread. Broil until toasted. Sprinkle with the four cheese blend and salt and pepper to taste. Cut into slices and serve.

Cook ground beef with onion until brown. Drain. Add soup and green beans. Mix well. Spread in a 9 x 13 pan. Top with tater tots. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until heated through. Serves 6.

Soak the beans overnight. Drain and place in a crock pot. Add the garlic and herbs. Fill the crock pot with water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and allow to cook overnight. In a separate bowl combine the sauce and cream cheese. Cook according to instructions on the box. In a large bowl combine the cooked beans and sauce mixture and stir. Serve with chips and the optional toppings.

Bake cake according to directions and let cool completely. Poke holes all over cake with end of wooden spoon. Pour can of condensed milk on top of the cake. Melt jar of hot fudge and pour that over the cake. Top cake with cool whip and crushed heath bar.

Cook bacon in frying pan until crispremove from pan, saving bacon fat. In same pan, combine cider vinegar, water, sugar, celery seed, and saltbring to a boil and cook until mixture is slightly thickened, about 5 minutes. In a large bowl, combine bacon fat, cooked vegetables, and hot vinegar mixturetoss to coat well. Serve warm or cold.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix all dry ingredients together in a bowl. Cut in softened butter with a pastry blender or fork until mixture looks like coarse crumbs. Add water to mixture 1/4 cup at a time until dough holds together. Press mixture into a 9 x 13 baking pan and place in oven. Bake for 3 minutes. Cool slightly, then frost with a low carb frosting. This recipe can be used as a base for many low carb desserts. The possibilities are endless!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Coat a baking sheet with cooking spray. Cut the potatoes into 1/2-inch dice. Toss with the mayonnaise, lemon juice and five-spice powder in a large bowl. Spread the mixture on the prepared baking sheet and bake until tender, about 30 minutes. Remove the mixture from the oven and stir in the walnuts and currants. Season with salt and pepper. Cool completely before serving. Makes about 4 cups.

In a small bowl combine the water and cornstarch. Mix well. Cook over medium heat until mixture thickens. Add sugar and apple cider vinegar. Stir until dissolved. Add ketchup and cook over medium heat until thickened. Add garlic and crushed red pepper flakes. Serve hot with lumpia. Serves 4.

In a large mixing bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, kosher salt, and sugar. Add thyme leaves and butter and mix until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs with some pea-sized pieces of butter remaining. Stir in milk just until dough comes together. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead gently to form a ball. Wrap dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or up to 1 day.Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).Roll out dough on a lightly floured surface to 1/4 inch thickness. Using a 2 1/2-inch round biscuit cutter or a glass, cut out biscuit shapes and transfer to a parchment lined baking sheet. Gather scraps, reroll, and cut out remaining biscuits. Brush tops with mayonnaise. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, until lightly browned on bottoms. Remove from oven and allow to
Cook carrots and potatoes in boiling water until tender. Drain and return to saucepan. Add milk, butter, and nutmeg. Heat and mash. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

Bring water to a boil in medium sauce pan. Stir in quinoa, cover tightly and reduce to simmer for 15 minutes or until quinoa is tender. Stir in remaining ingredients. Cook on low for 2 minutes or until thoroughly heated. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cut vegetables into 1-inch pieces. Toss vegetables with oil in a large roasting pan. Sprinkle with thyme. Roast for 45 minutes. Season to taste. Drizzle with truffle oil just before serving.

Mix together the chunk light tuna, portabella mushroom caps, olive oil, butter, red bell pepper, carrot, onion, cajun seasoning, soft breadcrumbs, mexican blend cheese and garlic powder in a bowl until well mixed. Heat in the microwave for 2 minutes. Place each portabella cap in an oven safe plate and spoon tuna mixture in each cap. Top with a slice of cheese and place in a 375 degree oven for 20 minutes or until the cheese is golden brown.

Place rhubarb in a bowl and cover with boiling water for about 5 minutes. Meanwhile, with a mixer, mix sugar, egg, butter and flour until smooth. Strain rhubarb well. With wooden spoon, add strawberries and rhubarb to batter and mix. Pour into uncooked pie shell. Mix topping ingredients with a fork, and sprinkle over uncooked pie. Bake at 375 for 50 minutes or until set. Top with whipped cream if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spread mashed potatoes in ungreased 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Sprinkle with 1 cup cheese and 2 tablespoons onion. Top with meat and corn, sprinkle with remaining 1 cup cheese and 2 tablespoons onion. In a small bowl, combine egg and taco seasoningstir well. Pour egg mixture over meat mixturetop with remaining potato mixture. Bake uncovered 1 hour or until heated through. Let stand 10 minutes before cutting into 6 pieces to serve.

Sauté hot dogs in skillet. Add chili and diced tomatoes. Stir in onion and garlic powder. Season to taste with cayenne pepper, cumin, and yellow mustard. Serve over cooked rice. Top with cheese if desired.

Slice garlic thinly. Cut tomatoes in wedges. Trim mushrooms. Discard stems of shiitake mushrooms. Cut in bite size pieces. Sprinkle the button mushrooms with lemon juice to prevent darkening. Place oil, garlic slices and bay leaf in skillet. Heat until aroma is released. Add all mushrooms and stir fry over high heat. Swirl in white wine and season with salt and pepper. Marinate in refrigerator at least 1 hour. Garnish with tomato wedges and parsley.
Marinate a variety of vegetables and use them to make tasty salads.
Marinate vegetables for soups or stews.

Combine mayonnaise, jalapeno juice, and lemon juice in small bowl. Lay fillets in 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Spread mayonnaise mixture over fillets. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered in 350 degree oven for 20 minutes or until fish is just cooked through and the cheese is bubbly. Serve with rice or pasta.
name: white cheese dipingredients: white processed cheese, milk, canned jalapeno slices, garlic cloves, saltpreparation:In saucepan heat milk to a simmer. Cube cheese. Add to milk and stir until melted. In blender jar add jalapenos and juice. Blend till minced. Add to melted cheese. Add garlic and salt. Serve with tortilla chips or use as a sauce for chimichangas or burritos.
name: jalapeno spread dipingredients: mayonnaise, jalapeno peppers, jalapeno juice, ground

Combine the flour, baking powder, salt, and dry milk in a large bowl. Add the egg and enough of the warm water to make a soft dough that will stick together. Kneed the dough for at least ten minutes by hand or by using a mixer with the dough hook until it is smooth. Cover the dough with a cloth and let it rest for about an hour. Divide the dough into 12 equal balls about the size of a golf ball. Roll each ball out flat to about one-eighth of an inch thick. Heat a heavy skillet over a medium heat and fry the dough until the edges begin to brown. Turn the bread over and continue cooking until both sides are golden brown.
Place beef in bottom of crock pot. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Mix vegetables and tomatoes with beef. Cook on low 8-10 hours. Serve over hot white rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heatadd green onions and mushroomscook until onions are translucent. Slice french bread in half lengthwiseplace on a baking sheet. Spread butter evenly over breadtop with mushrooms and onions. Top each half with a layer of mozzarella. Bake in preheated oven until cheese is melted, about 10 minutes. Serve warm topped with olives.
 spinach cheese pattiesingredients: low-fat cottage cheese, egg yolks, flour, wheat germ, fresh spinach, olive oil, salt and pepperpreparation: Mix together the first four ingredients. It gets thick and gooyey. Add spinach and mix again. Pour olive oil in a skillet. I use about 2 t. Get it hot. Fry the patties until golden brown.

Cook the couscous according to package directions. Meanwhile, put the frozen peas in a bowl. In the same bowl, mix the spices together with 1 tbsp of the oil, the cumin seeds, and 1/8 tsp of the black pepper. When the couscouss is done, stir in the peas and spice mixture. Heat the remaining 1 tbsp of oil in a frying pan over medium heat until hot. Add the remaining 1/8 tsp of black pepper and stir-fry for about 1 minute until fragrant. Toss in the couscous and stir-fry for 30 seconds longer. Serve at once.

Heat oven to 350 F. In a large bowl, combine the broccoli florets, ice water, and olive oil. Toss well to coat. Spread florets in a single layer on a large baking sheet. Bake uncovered for 15 minutes. While broccoli is cooking, combine the remaining ingredients. Drain the broccoli and toss with the remaining ingredients. Serve warm or chilled.

Heat oven to 400. Grease 1.5-quart casserole dish. In small bowl, combine soup with milk. Add carrot. Set aside. In large skillet over medium-high heat, cook chicken in butter until lightly browned. Add onion and cook until tender. Add cream soup mixture. Cook 2 minutes. Stir in zucchini and cook until tender. Pour mixture into prepared dish. Bake uncovered for 20-25 minutes or until bubbly and hot. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve with croutons and yogurt.
Combine all the ingredients in a bowl.

Preheat the oven to 400. Spray a shallow 2-quart casserole dish with cooking spray. Line the dish with a piece of aluminum foil. Place the salmon in the dish. In a small bowl combine the mustard and garlic powder. Brush the mustard mixture over the top of the fish. Wrap the foil around the dish and bake for 20 minutes. Open the foil and top the fish with the dill. Bake an additional 5 minutes.
Sounds great - I love Salmon.
Thanks for the recipes. Salmon is my favorite fish. I'll have to try these recipes.

Beat eggs add water and flour and make a batter. Combine with cheese, asparagus, salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in a pan. Poor the mixture in the pan or take spoonfuls of batter and drop into the oil. When the bottom side of the omelet is golden brown turn it over the cooked on the other side4.

Thaw puff pastry according to package directions and place onto greased baking sheet. Remove the rind from the top of the brie round and place in the center of the puff pastry circle. Top the cheese with preserves and sprinkle almonds over the top. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes or until the puff pastry is golden brown and the cheese is softened.

In a large heavy pot heat the butter over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook until soft. Add the curry powder and cook for 1 minute more. Stir in the water and then the broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 25 minutes. Puree the soup with an immersion blender or blender and return it to the pot. Stir in the coconut milk and pumpkin puree and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a 12-cup muffin pan with paper baking cups. Combine the gingersnap cookies and 2 tablespoons sugar in a food processor. Pulse until fine crumbs form. Reserve 1/4 cup for garnish. Place the remaining gingersnap crumbs in a medium bowl. Add the ricotta cheese, pumpkin and brown sugar. Mix until blended. In a small bowl, combine the eggs and vanilla. Beat the eggs until smooth. Add the egg mixture to the ricotta mixture and stir until blended. Divide the mixture among the paper baking cups. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with the remaining gingersnap crumbs. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until set. Allow the cups to cool for 20 minutes in the pan. Remove from the pan and transfer to a wire rack. Cool completely. Store in the refrigerator. Top each cup with a dollop of whipped topping and a sprinkle

Cook ravioli according to package directions. Drain. Rinse with cold water. Drain again. In a large bowl combine artichokes, mozzarella, pepperoni and onion. Add raviolitoss to coat. Add olives and basil. Add salad dressingtoss to coat. Serve with spinach. Makes 8 side-dish servings.

In a large pot, combine all ingredients except the beans and bring to a boil. Boil for about 2 minutes stirring constantly. Add the beans and boil for 3 minutes, stirring constantly. Serve immediately.

Peel off the skin of the eggplants. Cut the eggplants into slices about 3 cm thick. Stew the slices in boiling water until tender. Cut into pieces about 1 cm thick. Mix the vinegar, spring onions, red chile and minced chicken. Pour the vinegar over the steamed eggplants. Heat gently for 1-2 minutes. Sprinkle white pepper powder on. Serve hot.
The first time I cooked this I made the sauce too strong. It was good but I found it too strong for my taste. I'm not sure how I did it because I followed the recipe exactly. This time I adjusted the recipe to suit my taste. I think I should have made it less salty than I did though. The next time I will just make the sauce recipe more to my taste. The other thing I did was to add a bit more of the eggplant than the recipe called for.
This is a quick and easy recipe that is very good. It is similar to a recipe I've made before. You can use any vegetables you like.
This

Heat the oil in a large heavy saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion. Stir for 1 minute. Add the fresh okra and stir. Cover the pan. Cook the okra for 10 minutes until tender. Add the plum tomatoes. Simmer for 10 minutes until tender. Add the tomato sauce. Bring to a boil. Add the garlic and the pepper. Add the lemon juice. Salt to taste. Add the water. Simmer for 5 minutes. Serve.

Melt butter in skillet. Add mushrooms and saute. Sprinkle with pepper. Saute until mushrooms are limp. Add onion and garlic cloves. Saute until onions are limp. Dust chicken with flour and shake off excess. Add to skillet. Brown slightly. Add cream, port wine, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Simmer about 20 minutes. Sprinkle with fresh parsley.

Sprinkle both sides of the chops with the seasoning salt and black pepper. Brown the chops on both sides in a frying pan or griddle. Set aside. In the same pan add the onion and saute until the onion is translucent. Add the potatoes, carrots, celery ribs and stir for one minute. Add the cream of mushroom soup, milk and the chops to the pan. Cover and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes until the chops are cooked through. Serve the pork chops over rice or mashed potatoes or both. Serves 2 to 3.

Boil red potatoes with salt and pepper until tender, drain and set aside to cool a little while. Melt a small amount of butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in heavy cream and continue whisking until warm and smooth. Add boursin cheese and stir until melted. Place red potatoes on a serving dish or platter. Pour sauce over top of potatoes and sprinkle with chives to serve.
In skillet, cook pork in oil over medium-high heat 5-6 minutes or until no longer pink. Add salsa and cook 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in lime juice and cilantro. Serve on salad greens.

Boil potatoes and onions until tender. Drain. Season to taste. Add remaining ingredients, mix thoroughly. Pour into casserole. Bake uncovered in 350 oven for about one hour or until heated through. Serve with rolls and salad.
Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Add tomatoes and artichokes. Heat through. Stir in garlic. Add oil and mix well. Serve at once. Garnish with basil and sprinkle with cheese.

Season each chop lightly with salt and pepper and dredge in flour mixed with Chinese five-spice powder. Heat oil in a large skillet and brown each chop for 3 to 4 minutes per side. Transfer browned chops to a baking dish and pour off all but 2 tablespoons of the fat from the pan. Add the port wine and apple juice to the pan along with the remaining 1/4 cup flour mixed with the Chinese five-spice powderstir until smooth. Cook the mixture for 30 seconds, then pour it into the baking dish along with the browned chops. Cover and bake at 375 degrees F for 15 minutes, or until the internal temperature of the meat reaches 145 degrees F.
Combine all in medium saucepan. Cook over medium heat 10 minutes. Cool 10 minutes. Pour into hot sterilized jars. Seal.

Preheat oven to 375. Beat eggs with milk in large bowl. Add tarragon, paprika, and saltbeat until well blended. Add 1/2 cup of the cheesestir just until blended. Divide the mixture evenly among 4 of the bagels. Sprinkle each bagel with remaining 1/4 cup cheese. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until eggs are set. Serve warm.

Heat the oil and fry the garlic until lightly golden. Add the chillies and fry until they soften and turn dark brown. Add the peanuts and stir fry for a few minutes. Add the lime juice and the water and stir well. Add the fish sauce and the sugar and stir well again. If the sauce is too thick add some water until the sauce is the thickness you prefer. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and more fish sauce if necessary. Serve with crunchy vegetables or meat or fish.

Heat oven to 400 degrees F. In small bowl, combine hot pepper sauce and cider vinegar. Set aside. In small bowl combine butter and cornmealset aside. In shallow bowl combine cayenne pepper and salt. Dip each tender in butter mixture, then in cornmeal mixture. Place tenders in single layer on baking sheet. Bake 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve hot with dressing.

Heat the oven to 350 degrees. Slice the tomatoes 1/4-inch thick and remove the seeds and stems. Beat the milk and egg together in a shallow dish. Put the cornmeal in another shallow dish. Dredge each slice of tomato in cornmeal and then in milk mixture. Carefully drop into hot oil and cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side or until crisp and brown. Remove from the oil and sprinkle with paprika and salt and place on a wire rack or baking sheet to drain.

Peel and cut the cantaloupe and honeydew melon into cubes. In a blender, puree the melons and ginger until smooth. Strain into a large bowl and chill. In the bowl of a food processor, combine the cantaloupe puree and the cream cheese and blend until smooth. Stir in the lime juice, tabasco sauce and mint. Serve in the cantaloupe rind or in chilled bowls. Garnish each serving with a mint sprig.

Combine all in a large mixing bowl. Divide the mixture into small portions and shape into patties or links. Brown in a skillet over medium heat, turning to brown evenly. For links, place in a large stock pot half full of water. Bring to a boil and boil for 25 minutes or until water is clear. Remove from heat and cool in ice water. Drain, refrigerate, and use within a few days. Serve over toast with ketchup or brown gravy. Makes approx. 40 links or 40 patties.

In 9x13-inch baking pan, arrange biscuits to form one layer. Spread with chicken mixture. Top with potato mixture. Arrange vegetables over vegetables. In a medium bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Pour over vegetables. Cover with foil. Bake 40 minutes. Uncoverbake 10 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Serve with salad.

Wash and soak the lentils for 2-3 hours. Cook the rice and the lentils in separate pots with water and salt until they are soft (this will take about 30-40 minutes). Mix the lentils and the rice together and cook for 5 more minutes. Add the ghee and the cumin seeds and cook for 2 minutes more. Add the garlic and green chili and mix well. Cook for 2 more minutes and serve hot. You can add finely chopped coriander or mint leaves for garnish at the end.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Butter one side of each bread slice and toast in the oven until lightly browned and crisp. Cut each slice diagonally into quartersplace on plates. Combine honey and water in a small saucepanbring to a boil over medium-high heat and cook for 1 to 2 minutes or until mixture thickens slightly and reduces to about 1/4 cuppour mixture into a small bowl and stir in mintlet cool to room temperature. In a small bowl, toss together berries, 1 tablespoon of mint syrup, and butterarrange berry mixture on each piece of breadtop with mascarpone and serve immediately or cover and let stand at room temperature for up to 1 hour.
Dry breadcrumbs and spices. Coat chicken pieces. Combine the other ingredients and pour over the chicken. Bake at 400 degrees until done. About 30 minutes.

Spray a large skillet with cooking spray. Add the oil and garlic and saute for about 30 seconds until fragrant. Add the tomatoes and cook for another 2 minutes. Add the beans, cayenne pepper to taste and cook for another minute or two. Season with fresh cilantro. Serve with lime wedges.
i love your recipe for corn and black bean salad!! looks so fresh and good!
I have never liked black bean anything but your recipes look fantastic! I think I need to give it another try!
I love all of your recipes for black beans. I'm not sure why I never tried them before but I'll have to give them a try!
Black bean dip is my all time favorite! I love how versatile it is to use it in so many dishes!
I love your ideas for black bean recipes! We love them too!
I love your recipes for Black Bean Corn Salad and your soupy black bean recipe looks so easy to make!
I am loving all of your recipes for black bean recipes! I love them and need to try some of these

Soak cutlets in milk for 30 minutes. Combine eggs and flour in a shallow dish. Combine breadcrumbs in another shallow dish. Dip cutlets into the egg mixture then into the breadcrumbs. Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan. Cook the cutlets in the hot oil for 5 minutes on each side. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Sprinkle lightly with nutmeg. Serve with a squeeze of lemon.

Combine balsamic, white wine vinegar, cider vinegar, sugar, habanero peppers and mint in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil for 1 minute. Pour into a glass jar or bottle with a tight-fitting lid. Cool to room temperature and store in the refrigerator for up to 3 weeks.

Bring 4 cups of water to a boil with the white sugar, brown sugar and vodka. Stir to dissolve the sugar. Pour into a blender filled with ice cubes. Add the almond extract and the vanilla extract. Blend until slushy and serve in tall glasses with the maraschino cherries on top of the drinks.

Heat butter in a pot over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until softened. Add the sugar and oregano and cook until the liquid has evaporated. Add the tomatoes and cook until the mixture thickens and the tomatoes soften. Stir in the cream and the chopped spinach. Add the milk and simmer for 1 minute. Season with basil and Parmesan and serve immediately.

Combine all sauce ingredients, stir until smooth. In a separate bowl combine cornstarch and water. Heat oil in wok or large skillet over high heat. Add garlic, cook 15 seconds, add beef and stir until no pink remains. Add wine, stirring occasionally, until beef is no longer pink. Stir in sauce, cook 1 minute or until thickened. Stir in water chestnuts and green pepper, cook 1 minute or until vegetables are crisp tender. Stir cornstarch mixture until smooth. Add to pan and cook 1 minute more or until thickened. Serve over rice or noodles if desired.

Place a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the oil to the pan. Once the oil is hot add the red onion and cook until translucent, about 2 minutes. Add the jalapeno and cook until tender. Add the cilantro leaves. Season with salt and pepper. Whisk together the eggs and pour over the vegetable mixture. Cook until the eggs begin to set. Turn omelet over. Cook until the eggs are just cooked through. Cut into wedges. Serve.

Place pumpkin in a saucepan with 1 cup water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer and cook until tender. Mash or purée pumpkin in a food processor or blender. Add marmalade, ginger, lemon juice, salt and cinnamon stick to pumpkin mixture. Simmer over low heat for 10 minutes or until mixture is thickened. Remove cinnamon stick. Ladle marmalade into hot sterilized jars, leaving 1/4 inch headspace. Wipe rims with a damp paper towelcenter lids on jars. Screw bands down until fingertip tight. Process in a boiling water bath for 10 minutes. Remove from canner. Let stand for 5 minutes. Remove lids to check seals. Label and store in a cool, dry place. Makes about 7 half-pints.

Cook tempeh in a nonstick skillet over medium heat for about 10 minutes. Cut into small pieces and place in a large bowl. Mix together the mayonnaise, parsley and soy sauce. Add to the tempeh and stir well. Add the remaining ingredients and stir to mix. Chill for 1 hour before serving. Serves 4.

In a large pot, add all the ingredients and the 3 cups of water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 45 minutes to 1 hour. If the mixture becomes too dry, add more water. Serve the soup in shallow bowls with a generous sprinkling of parsley.

Mix sugar, butter and yolks. Cook until boiling stirring constantly. Add flour, then gradually add water. Stir until thick and smooth. Add dates and brown sugar and cook until mixture is clear and thick. Cool to room temperature. Beat egg whites until stiff and fold into date mixture. Pour into a greased and floured 9-inch square pan and bake in 400 degree oven for 30 minutes. Cool and cut into squares.

Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl. Place the ribs in the bowl and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Preheat oven to 300 degrees fahrenheit. Drain the ribs in a strainer and place in an ovenproof dish. Bake for 1 to 2 hours or until the meat is tender.

Cut the potatoes in half lengthwise. Brush with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Grill until tender. Cool and dice. Cut the bacon into lardons. Cut the green beans in half and cook in boiling salted water until crisp tender. Drain and rinse under cold water. In a bowl combine potato, bacon, beans and chicken. Add the mixed greens. Make the honey mustard dressing. Pour over the chicken and vegetables. Mix gently. Serve at once.

Toast rice in a heavy frying pan over moderate heat until it is golden brown. Remove from heat and set aside. In a saucepan, combine 3 cups water, barley, bay leaf, thyme and salt. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes or until barley is tender. Drain barley. In a heavy saucepan, combine rice with the remaining 3 cups water, 1 tablespoon of butter and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low. Cook for 15 minutes or until rice is almost tender. Stir in barley. Continue to cook over low heat until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed. Add butter. Stir in mushrooms. Continue to cook for 2 minutes. Remove bay leaf. Stir in parmesan cheese. Season to taste with ground pepper. Serve immediately.

Cook bacon in skillet over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon from skillet and place on paper towel. Discard all but 1 tablespoon of fat from pan. Add water to skillet. Add cabbage. Cook over medium-high heat until soft. Add vinegar. Reduce heat to low. Add sugar and bacon. Mix well. Stir in flour. Cook 1 minute.

Peel potatoes and grate on a coarse grater. Place in a large bowl. Season with bacon, onion powder, gruyere cheese, and 1 tsp. of pepper. Mix well. Spoon into a 13 x 9 casserole dish. Dot the top of the potato mixture with small pieces of butter. Bake for 45 minutes. Allow to set for 10 minutes before serving.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium heat, cook the chicken and garlic in oil for 4 to 5 minutes or until heated through. Whisk in cream and taco seasoning until blended. Cook until heated through, do not boil. Stir in parmesan cheese. Drain pasta, toss with chicken mixture. Serve immediately.

Remove the fat from the tenderloin as much as possible. Rub the tenderloin with the barbecue sauce, the onions and the garlic cloves. Sprinkle with the hot sauce and the salt and pepper to taste. Cover the tenderloin with the lid of the slow cooker. Cook the tenderloin on the low setting for 7 hours or the high setting for 3 hours. Remove the tenderloin from the slow cooker and cut it into small pieces with a knife or a fork. Serve the tenderloin in the barbecue sauce or drizzle the barbecue sauce over the meat.

Steam cauliflower for 5-8 minutes. Set aside. In a small bowl combine the garlic cloves, 2 tablespoons of the olive oil, apple juice, parsley and vinegar. Season with the paprika and salt. Toss the cauliflower with the sauce. Garnish with the remaining 2 tablespoons of the olive oil. Serve hot.

Sprinkle seasoning mix over each slice of melba toast. Place a piece of cheese on each slice. Place a pork chop over each slice. Add a slice of tomato and sprinkle with some more seasoning mix. Drizzle with mayonnaise. Broil for a few minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve hot.
Sift flour and salt into a small bowl. In a mixer cream butter and icing sugar. Add vanilla. Add flour mixture. Add chocolate chips.

Mix the cake mix, oil, water, and egg in a large bowl. Stir in Fruity Pebbles cereal until well coated. Drop by spoonful onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 7-10 minutes or until light golden brown. Cool completely on wire racks.

Mix together the cream cheese, cumin and all purpose greek seasoning. Add cayenne to taste. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cook sausage in a skillet and drain off fat. Mix sausage and cream cheese mixture. Lay one tortilla on a baking sheet. Sprinkle a bit of cheese and corn. Top with a second tortilla. Brush the outside of the tortillas with olive oil. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown. Cut into 4 wedges and serve.

In medium bowl combine the beef, cheese and soup mix. Spread evenly onto 8 crescent rolls. Roll up from wide end and place 1 inch apart on ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 10-15 minutes. Cool slightly. Cut each roll into 4 triangles. Serve warm.

In mixer, combine flour and oil. Add water gradually to make a soft dough. Knead well for 10 minutes by machine or hand. Add salt, baking soda, cream of tartar and knead for an additional 5 minutes by hand. Let rest for 15 minutes then divide dough into four parts. Form into balls with oiled hands. Place on greased cookie sheets. Let rise for 1 hour or until doubled. Bake at 375f for 45 minutes or until done.

Combine olives and ham in a bowl. Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Place 1 teaspoon of filling in the center of each pastry square. Fold pastry over filling and pinch edges to seal. Brush each pastry with beaten egg yolk. Place in baking dish sprayed with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Makes 24 empanadas.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Peel the outer leaves of the Brussels sprouts and discard. Cut Brussels sprouts in half and cut into thin slices. Toss Brussels sprouts with red onion in a large bowl. Add garlicmix well. Place half of vegetable mixture in a medium baking dishdrizzle with 1 tablespoon of the oil and toss. Repeat with remaining vegetable mixture. Drizzle with remaining 2 tablespoons oiltoss. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake 30 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Sprinkle with red pepper flakes, if desired.
brussels sprouts are so easy to grow in my garden. I plant them in mid august. I had a problem this year though as all of my brussel sprouts were eaten by ground hogs. I just planted 5 new ones in my garden. I hope they do better this year.
This is a great list of recipes. I love Brussel Sprouts but my husband won't eat them. I can't believe

Preheat oven to 375 f. In a medium bowl, combine mashed potatoes with cream cheese. Add onion powder. Add eggs and blend well. Combine flour and salt and pepper. Add flour mixture to potato mixture and blend well. Turn onto a lightly floured surface and shape into an oval loaf. Place butter in an oiled 9-inch square baking pan. Place loaf on top of butter. Combine butter and French-fried onions. Spread over top of loaf. Bake for one hour or until golden brown. Cool. Cut into serving pieces. Serve warm.

Mix together cream of chicken soup and sour cream. Spread on the bottom of a 13x9 inch baking dish. Layer with rice and chicken breasts. In a large bowl combine butter, cracker crumbs and poppy seeds. Sprinkle evenly over the top. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake for an additional 10 minutes or until top is golden brown.

Cook the pasta in water seasoned with a little salt until it is done. In the meantime, put the oil in a pan on medium heat. Add the chili powder, seasoning salt and garlic powder. Stir until it is well mixed. Drain the pasta when it is done and add it to the chili powder mixture in the pan. Stir until it is well mixed. Serve with grated parmesan on top of each portion.

Bring a large pot of water to boil. Add the beans and blanch for 2 to 3 minutesthey should still be firm to the bite. Drain, then run under cold water to stop the cooking. In a large bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, garlic and salt to taste. Add the pine nuts and toss to coat evenly. Add the drained beanstoss to coat evenly. Transfer to a serving bowl. Serve at room temperature or cool to room temperature before serving.

Mix all marinade ingredients together. Pour over beef and let marinade overnight. Next day, place roast in slow cooker and add more beer. Cook 7 hours. Remove from slow cooker. Carve meat and place back into crockpot. Add extra juice from slow cooker. Heat through. Serve with mashed potatoes and vegetable.
Cut pita bread into wedges. Spray both sides of each wedge with cooking spray. Sprinkle both sides of each wedge evenly with seasoning mix. Bake for about 10 minutes or until crisp. Serve warm.
Cream the cheese and fish with a fork in a small bowl. Add onions, lemon juice and parsley. Season to taste with salt and white pepper. Chill thoroughly. Serve on crackers with pickles and gherkins.

Preheat oven to 350f. On a large baking sheet brush tortillas with olive oil. Sprinkle with garlic powder and sesame seeds. Bake for 10 minutes. Flip the tortillas and brush with barbecue sauce and return to oven for 10 minutes longer. Serve warm. Makes about 25 chips.

Bring a large pan of water to the boil then add the potato and boil for 20 minutes or until tender. Drain the water, then mash the potato with the back of a fork to make a thick mash. Pre-heat the oven to 190°C/375°F/gas 5 then put the mashed potato into a baking dish with the zucchini and mix well with the cumin, red pepper flakes and caraway seeds. Season with salt, lemon juice and the garlic cloves and mix well again. Drizzle with the olive oil and bake in the oven for 10 minutes or until golden brown on top. Serve with chicken or lamb.

Preheat oven to 300f. In a 2 quart saucepan combine 2 1/2 cups white sugar, 2 1/2 cups dark brown sugar, 2 eggs, 1/4 cup evaporated milk, 1 tablespoon pure vanilla extract, 1 box chocolate flavored instant pudding mix. Mix well. Bring to a boil over medium high heat, stirring constantly until a candy thermometer reads 236f or until a small amount of the mixture dropped into cold water forms a soft ball. Remove from heat. Beat until slightly thickened, about 2 minutes. Fold in 1 cup chopped pecans. Drop by the tablespoonful onto ungreased wax paper or parchment paper. Let stand until set. Store in an airtight container.
The Praline was a favorite among Southerners. It was a delicious confection of nutty flavors. The Praline was an early favorite of the Southerners who immigrated into the New World. Praline candy was brought to Louisiana by the Acadians who came there from Canada. The Acad

Combine butter and brown sugar in a heavy saucepan. Cook over medium-low heat, stirring constantly until the mixture comes to a boil. Continue boiling, stirring constantly, for 3 minutes. Remove the saucepan from the heat. Stir in the light corn syrup and the condensed milk. Stir in the vanilla. Let mixture cool completely. Peel the apple and cut into wedges. Skewer apple slices onto wooden sticks. Dip into the caramel mixture. Place in freezer. Repeat until all the fruit is used.

Spray olive oil on a baking sheet. Place a flour tortilla on the baking sheet. Spread pizza sauce on the bottom third of the tortilla. Top with mozzarella cheese. Bake in the oven for about five minutes. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and top the pizza with any other pizza toppings you desire. Place back in the oven for two minutes. Cut into triangles and serve hot.

Cut chicken into 1/2-inch cubessprinkle with 1/8 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Beat egg in shallow bowl. Combine breadcrumbs, paprika, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in another shallow bowl. Coat chicken with eggdredge in breadcrumb mixturecoat with remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heatadd chicken, 1/3 cup at a time, to pancook 4 minutes or until browned on all sides. Transfer chicken to paper towel-lined platekeep warm. Add Alfredo sauce to panbring to a boilreduce heat to low. Add mozzarella cheesestir until melted. Add tomatoestoss to coat. Top with chickensprinkle with basil.

Peel black peppercorns. Cut beef into 1/2-inch cubes. Mince garlic. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic. Cook until golden about 1 minute. Add cubes of beef. Cook until browned 3 to 4 minutes. Add peppers and sugar. Cook until juice from the peppers forms a thick syrup 2 to 3 minutes. Add soy sauce and mirin. Cook until the liquid boils and thickens. Stir in groats. Serve immediately.

Slice peppers and onions and saute in olive oil. Cook the sausage in a separate pan or on a grill and slice. Spread some olive oil on the hoagie rolls and layer the ingredients on each roll as desired. Makes four heroes.

In a large pot over medium heat melt 2 tablespoons butter. Add the linguica and 1/2 teaspoon of the salt. Cook until browned and crisp. Remove and set aside. In the same pot, add the remaining butter and the onion. Cook until transparent. Add the water, the rice and the remaining 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer covered for 15 minutes. Stir in the linguica and parsley. Serve hot.

Beat butter and brown sugar until creamy. Beat in eggs one at a time, then beat in flour and salt. Roll into small balls with your fingers and place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake in 350 degree oven 10-12 minutes or until set. Cool on wire rack. Mix jam with egg white to make glaze. Spread onto the bottoms of half of the cookies and top each with an almond half.

Heat 1 T. oil in large nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Add pork and stir fry for 4-5 minutes or until no longer pink. Add shallots and stir fry 30 seconds or until softened. Add green beans and snow peas and stir fry 2 minutes or until crisp-tender. Add 2 t. water and stir fry 1 minute or until heated through. Stir in remaining 1 T. water, char siu sauce, and walnuts. Cook 2 minutes or until thickened and heated through. Serve over noodles.

Sauté vegetables in oil in a 10-inch skillet until tender. Add potatoes and bratwursts and cook until done. Add milk and soup. Bring to a boil. Simmer until heated through. Serve over rice or noodles. Makes 3 servings.

Preheat the oven to 350 f. Roll out the pie crusts and line the tart tins with the pastry. Toss together the ground almonds, sugar, eggs, and orange flower water. Spoon the mixture into the tins and sprinkle with the kiwi fruits. Bake for 35-40 minutes in the preheated oven until the tarts are lightly browned on top. Cool completely before unmolding the tarts.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a baking dish with cooking spray. Unroll tortillas onto a flat surface. Brush with melted butter or margarine. Sprinkle with sugar, cinnamon, and red-hot candies. Roll tortillas up, starting at one end with the plain side facing outward. Cut into 1 inch slices. Lay slices in baking dish. Pour apple pie filling over tortilla rolls. Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly, about 30 minutes.
I would love a recipe for some good old fashioned homemade tuna salad. My husband has been craving it for a week. I have a couple of recipes, but I am hoping someone has a really good one that I can use as a starting point.
I have a recipe for tuna salad that is really good. I have made it many times before and everyone enjoys it.
I was just looking through the recipes last night. I made a new recipe for tuna salad last week that I think

Remove fat from the roast. Cut into large chunks. In a crockpot, place the roast, onion, salsa, chiles, cumin, garlic, and lime juice. Cook on low for 6 hours. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with the cilantro. Serve with tortilla chips.

In a large saucepan combine white & brown sugars& boiling water. Boil until mixture forms a syrup& begins to turn a caramel color, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon. Add salt& maple flavoring& butter flavoring& continue stirring until the mixture begins to thicken& becomes a dark caramel color.

Cook noodles according to package directions. Add peas during last 2 minutes of cooking. Drain. In a small saucepan melt margarine over medium heat. Add flour. Cook for 1 minute stirring constantly. Stir in milk. Bring to a boil. Add in noodles. Add in ham. Stir in cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Combine egg and water in shallow bowl. Combine crumbs and cheese in another shallow bowl. Dip fish in egg mixture and then crumbs. Melt butter in nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook fish for 3-4 minutes per side until golden-brown and cooked through. Top each fish fillet with 1/4 cup marinara sauce and 1/4 cup mozzarella. Cover skillet and cook until sauce is bubbly and melted. Serve over rice.

In a small bowl, mix yogurt, eggs, and green onions. Set aside. In a medium-sized skillet over medium-high heat, melt butter and saute onions until translucent. Add cheese, stirring until melted. Add yogurt mixture, stirring constantly until it begins to bubble. Reduce heat to low, stir in ham, cover skillet. Cook for 5-10 minutes until set. Serve with toast or biscuits.

Cook rice according to package directions.In a large skillet, saute onion and garlic in peanut oil until tender. Add green pepper and maui onionsaute until pepper is crisp. Add chicken and pineapplestir to coat. Add soy sauce and cream of chicken soup. Heat until hot. Serve over rice. Sprinkle with macadamia nuts.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Sear steaks in a large skillet over medium heat for 2 to 4 minutes on each side. Remove from heat and set aside. In a large pot over medium heat, heat butter and saute onion until tender, about 4 to 5 minutes. Add mushrooms and garliccook until mushrooms are tender, about 4 minutes more. Add broth and bring to a boilstir in steaks to coat. Cover pot and transfer to ovenbake until meat is tender, about 30 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve with hot cooked rice or noodles.
name: grilled sirloin with port wine saucepreparation:In a small saucepan heat the wine until hot. Add all the seasonings except the lemon juice. Simmer 3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Place the steaks in a single layer in a shallow dish. Add 2 tablespoons of the port wine mixture to each steak. Cover and refrigerate 4 hours or overnight. Preheat an

Beat eggs and oil together. Stir in sugar and mix well. Add pumpkin, applesauce and vanilla. Blend well. Stir in flour, soda and spice. Fold in chocolate chips. Fill muffin cups 2/3 full. Bake at 400f for 18 minutes or until done. Cool 1 minute before removing from pan. Makes 18 muffins.

Heat the heavy cream in a saucepan. In a small bowl, combine the egg yolks with the Splenda and salt. Stir the mixture into the heavy cream and continue cooking over low heat for another minute. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the vanilla and the mint extract. Add the food coloring if you desire. Stir in the splenda sugar substitute. Pour the mixture through a sieve into an 8 x 8-inch square pan. Let cool to room temperature. Chill thoroughly in the refrigerator. Put the sugar-free chocolate in a microwave-safe dish and melt on high for 2 minutes. Stir and re-heat for another 2 minutes. Pour the melted chocolate into a pastry bag fitted with a star tip. Pipe the melted chocolate in lines over the ice cream. Refrigerate until the chocolate is set. Serve and enjoy!
Boil potatoes till tender. Cut in cubes. Melt butter. Add cubes and stir. Beat eggs well with milk or cream. Add to the potatoes. Sprinkle with bacon and parsley.

In a small bowl whisk together the mayonnaise, cilantro, garlic cloves and lime zest and juice until smooth. Season with cumin and salt and pepper to taste. Set aside. Brush the fillets with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Grill over medium heat until the fish is just cooked through and flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve with the cilantro cream sauce drizzled over the top.

Prepare the jasmine rice by rinsing it through a colander under cold running water until the water runs clear. Cover the jasmine rice with cold skim milk. Bring to a simmer and cook for 20 minutes or until the rice is tender. Pour the mixture through a strainer to remove the rice grains. Beat together the egg yolks with the white chocolate chips and the raspberry. Stir this mixture into the jasmine rice. In a small bowl mix the cream cheese with the vanilla extract. Blend the cream cheese mixture with the jasmine rice mixture. Pour the mixture into a 8x8 baking pan. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes. Sprinkle the topping with the white chocolate chips and place back in the oven for 10 minutes to melt. Remove from the oven and serve warm.

preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease a tube pan. combine cake mix and dry sherry in medium bowl. Add pudding, oil and eggs. Mix until well blended. Spread batter into prepared pan. Bake for 1 1/2 hours. Cool 20 minutes before unmolding. Dust with powdered sugar.
Peel and shred carrots (I use a food processor). Toss with mandarin orange segments and grapes. In a small bowl, combine yogurt and vinegarstir in ginger. Drizzle over slaw just before serving.

Mix all three ingredients together in a glass or a mason jar, and enjoy!
name: strawberry kiwi banana smoothie no dairyingredients: banana, kiwi, strawberries, apple juice, water, flax seed, psylliumpreparation:Cut all fruit into chunks. Blend. Add apple juice and water. Add flax seed and psyllium husk. Blend and serve.
name: banana breakfast shakeingredients: skim milk, banana, vanilla extract, almond extractpreparation:Mix all three ingredients together in a glass or a mason jar, and enjoy!
name: chocolate cherry breakfast smoothieingredients: sweet cherries, vanilla yogurt, nonfat milk, unsweetened cocoa powder, ice cubes, honeypreparation:In the jar of a blender, combine the cherries, yogurt, milk, cocoa, and ice cubes. Blend on high speed or ice crush setting for 30-60 seconds, or until smooth. St

Combine 1 cup dried apples, 1 1/2 teaspoons ground cloves and 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon in small bowl. Divide apples among 2 1/2 quart jars with 1 tablespoon each of the spice mixture in each jar. Add 4-5 whole cloves to each jar. Add 1 gallon cold water to each jar. Stir well. Cap jars tightly. Refrigerate for 24 hours before serving. To serve, pour 1/2 cup of the tea over ice cubes in tall glasses. Add 1 tablespoon honey to each glass before serving.
Preheat oven to 350 f. Toss apples with cinnamon and 1/4 cup sugar. Place 1/2 cup filling into each shell. Top with walnuts. Bake for 25 minutes or until filling is bubbly. Let cool. Serve warm.

Place water and salt into the inner pot of 3-in-1 Multi-Cooker. Cook on High pressure for 30 minutes. Drain off the water from the rice. Add the reduced-fat milk, Splenda Granular and vanilla extract. Cook on High pressure for 15 minutes. Stir in the ground cinnamon and raisins. Cook on High pressure for 5 minutes. Serves 6-8.

Pound out the chicken with a meat mallet. Season with salt and pepper. Heat oil to 375 degrees. Dip the chicken in the flour mixture. Add the butter to the hot oil and fry until golden brown, about 5 minutes on each side. Add half-and-half to the pan with the fried chicken and boil for 10 to 20 minutes. Serve over mashed potatoes with gravy.

Brush beef with steak sauce. Sprinkle with thyme. Season with black pepper and cayenne. Grill for 4 to 6 minutes per side or until desired doneness. Serve with remaining steak sauce.

Cream together the butter, sugars and vanilla for 5 minutes. Then add the eggs one at a time beating after each addition. Beat well after each addition. Combine the flour and baking soda. Sift together and add to the creamed mixture. Stir just enough to incorporate the flour mixture. Stir in the peanut butter chips. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto waxed paper or greased cookie sheets about 2 inches apart. Bake at 350 degrees for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 1 minute before removing from the pan to a wire rack to finish cooling.

Boil potatoes in salted water until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain well and place in large bowl. Melt 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and saute until golden brown about 10 minutes. Add remaining tablespoon olive oil to pan along with garlic and saute another 2 minutes. Add butter to pan and saute until melted. Pour butter mixture over potatoes and toss to coat. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste.

In a heavy saucepan combine chocolate frosting, peanut butter chips, peanuts & 1/2 c. of confectioners sugar. Stir till smooth. Remove from heat and add remaining 1 1/2 c. of confectioners sugar. Stir till smooth. Spread into 9x13" pan. Let cool. Cut into squares.

1. Mix water chestnuts & shrimps together. Season to taste. 2. Beat the egg & cornstarch together in a separate bowl. Add to the water chestnuts & shrimps. 3. Heat the oil in a pan. Roll mixture into balls. 4. Fry until golden brown. 5. Drain on paper towels. 6. Serve.

Peel the pomelo fruit. Cut each piece in half to expose the flesh. Remove the seeds. Slice the fruit into bite-sized pieces. Place the pieces in a medium sized bowl. Add the raspberries. Toss together. In a small bowl, whisk together the honey, lime juice, mint leaves, and lime zest. Pour over the fruit. Toss together again. Serve atop a bed of roasted cashews.
name: melon and grape medleyingredients: cantaloupe, watermelon, green grapes, orange juice, honey, lime juice, jalapenos, lime peelpreparation:In a resealable bag, combine cantaloupe, watermelon, and grapes. In a small bowl, whisk together orange juice, honey and lime juice. Stir in the jalapeno and lime peel. Pour over fruit, seal and refrigerate at least 1 hour. Serve with slotted spoon.

Cook the bacon until crisp. Remove from fat and cut into pieces. Fry the garlic in the same fat until golden. Add the sausage meat to the pan. Add the sauerkraut, wine, juniper berries, bay leaves, cloves, peppercorns and thyme. Cook, covered over a low heat for 2 hours. Add the bacon at the end of cooking time. Serve in a large bowl.
In a food processor pulse together garlic, tomato, onion, olive oil, vinegar and basil. Rub pork chops with mixture. Grill 6 minutes per side or until cooked through. Salt and pepper to taste.

In a large mixing bowl combine the sugar and cranberries. Let stand for 30 minutes. Add the marshmallows and apples. Add the grapes and pineapples. In a large mixing bowl combine the cranberries, sugar, marshmallows, red apples, seedless grapes, pineapple tidbits, pecans. Let stand for 30 minutes. Add the marshmallows and apples. Brown sausages in skillet. Set aside. Saute onion and celery in butter. Add stuffing mix and 1 cup brothheat through. Add remaining broth to mixture. Add sausages and pecans. Stir in remaining butter. Pour into greased 13x9 pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes. Increase heat to 450 degrees F and bake an additional 15 minutes or until golden brown. Serves 8.

Combine water and corn syrup in saucepan over medium heat. Stirring constantly, bring mixture to hard ball stage on candy thermometer. Add sugar all at once, stirring constantly until mixture is at soft ball stage. Add powdered sugar and cinnamon oilmix well. Divide into 2 parts. In one part, add food coloring until desired color is reached. On greased pan, drop mixture by rounded teaspoonfuls. Allow to cool completely before lifting from pan. Break apart. Store in tightly covered container in cool place.

Preheat grill to medium high heat (about 450 degrees). In a bowl, toss the fruit with the Earth Balance, brown sugar, cinnamon, vanilla, lemon juice and salt until the fruit is coated with the mixture. On a well oiled grate, place the fruit in a single layer. Grill for 6-8 minutes until the fruit is tender and begins to brown in spots. Transfer the fruit to a bowl, sprinkle with granola and serve with caramel sauce and vanilla ice cream.
name: peach ice cream pieingredients: 2 1/2 cups fresh peaches peeled, pitted and sliced, 1 1/4 cups granulated sugar, 4 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 2 cups chilled vegetable shortening, 3 tablespoons cold water, 1 cup hot water, 2 tablespoons white vinegar, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract,

Beat butter and sugar together until light and creamy. Add eggs and beat well. Add flour salt and baking powder, beat well. Press mixture in to a greased 9x13 pan. Melt chocolate and nuts together and spread on top. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until set. Cool and cut into bars.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Combine crackers and butter with fingers until well blended and crumbly. Divide beef between four burgers and mix in crackers. Form into patties and place in a baking dish or shallow pan. Bake for about 20 minutes or until cooked through. Remove from oven and turn off heat. Bring to a boil ketchup and soup mix. Add worcestershire sauce and garlic. Add to burgers and cover. Let stand for 20 minutes. Add sliced mushrooms and cook for another 20 minutes or until desired doneness. Serve on buns with lettuce and tomato.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Combine corn kernels and creamed cornset aside. Combine cornbread mix, sour cream and beaten eggset aside. Melt 2 tablespoons of the butter in a medium skillet over medium heatsaute onion until tender. Combine onion with corn mixture. Spread into a lightly greased 2 quart baking dish. Combine the remaining butter with the cheddar cheesesprinkle over the top of the cornbread mixture. Bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.
Combine all ingredients and bake at 350 for 25 minutes.
Mix together and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
Combine all ingredients except corn and bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Add corn and bake for an additional 5 minutes or until heated through.

In a 9x13 pan layer the vegetables. Mix the cream cheese with the vegetables. Mix the cream of mushroom soup with the milk. Pour over vegetables. Sprinkle with croutons. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add shallots and onioncook 5 minutes or until soft. Add baconcook 5 minutes or until crisp. Add garliccook 1 minute or until fragrant. Increase heat to high. Add creamheat through. Remove from heatstir in yolks. Add bacon mixture to pan. Cook 2 minutes or until yolks thicken. Season with salt and pepper. Serve over hot cooked spaghetti. Garnish with cheese.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Place turkey in shallow baking dish. In small bowl, combine chili powder, cumin and saltrub over both sides of turkey. Bake uncovered for one hour. Turn and sprinkle with barbecue sauce. Bake for another hour. Transfer to cutting boardpull off the skin. Cut into serving pieces and sprinkle with lime zest. Serve hot.

Grease an 8-inch square pan. Spread the coconut evenly on the bottom of the pan. Sprinkle evenly with the marshmallows, then the crumbs. Combine the remaining ingredients in a saucepan. Cook and stir over medium heat just until thickened and bubbly. Pour over the crumbs. Cool at room temperature for 1 hour or until set. Cut into bars.

Toss the fruit with the cornstarch and sugar and set aside. In a large bowl combine the flour, baking powder and cinnamon. Cut the butter into the flour mixture until it resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in the buttermilk with a wooden spoon until the dough just comes together. On a lightly floured surface roll out the dough to a 12 inch round. Place in a greased pie plate. Spoon the fruit on top. Fold the sides of the dough over the fruit. Brush the top with melted butter. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 40 minutes.

Beat the eggs with the crisco until smooth. Add the sugar and oil and beat until creamy and smooth. Add the vanilla and the lemon juice and beat well. Sift the baking powder with the flour and add to the creamed mixture and mix well. Add the nuts and mix well and chill thoroughly. Drop by teaspoonful onto greased cookie sheet and bake at 375 degrees F for 10-15 minutes or until lightly browned. Do not overbake. Let cool on the tray for 2 minutes. Remove from tray and cool on wire rack.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter 2 pieces of whole wheat bread on one side each. Cut 1 apple in half and remove seeds. Place apple halves on one piece of toastplace remaining apple half on second piece of toast. Sprinkle grated white cheddar cheese on applescover each sandwich with remaining piece of toast. Cut each sandwich into 3 trianglesplace in ungreased 12x8 inch pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 250 degrees F. Combine butter, mustard, honey and garlic salt in a small bowl. Mix well and set aside. Unwrap pretzels, lay flat in a baking dish or cookie sheet. Bake for 15 minutes or until lightly browned and toasted. Remove from oven, brush with half of the glaze mixture and place back in oven for another 5-10 minutes or until glaze is bubbly. Remove from oven again. Brush with remaining glaze mixture. Place back in oven for an additional 5 minutes or until glaze is bubbly. Remove from oven again and sprinkle with onion powder. Let cool for about 10 minutes before serving.

In 12-inch nonstick skillet, cook sausage over medium-high heat until no longer pink. Remove sausage from skillet. Add potatoes to drippings in skilletcook over medium-high heat until potatoes are tender. Drain. Add green onions and green bell pepperscook for 2 minutes. Stir potatoes and vegetables. Pour eggs over mixture. Sprinkle with Tabasco sauce. Bake at 350 degrees for 12-15 minutes. Sprinkle with sausage.

Bring chicken broth to boil in medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook noodles according to package directions, adding to broth for last 3 minutes. Combine soups in separate bowlstir in broth mixture and velveeta cheese. Heat through. Stir in chicken meatremove from heat. Serve with crackers.

In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the onion and bell peppers in oil. Add the chicken pieces. Cook until the chicken is browned. Add the remaining ingredients. Place in slow cooker. Cover. Cook on low for 6-8 hours.

In a large bowl combine the first five ingredients. Beat well. Add the remaining ingredients. Beat until smooth. Pour into a 4 to 5 quart casserole. Bake at 325 for one hour. Cool and serve with whipped topping.

Prepare crescent dinner rolls as directed on package, using larger pan. Spread each roll with one tablespoon creamy peanut butter and sprinkle each roll with one tablespoon sugar. Top each roll with one tablespoon chocolate chips. Bake as directed on package, until golden brown. Serve warm.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. In a large skillet over medium heat, combine chicken, sun-dried tomatoes, and caesar dressing. Cook until warmed through. Add cooked pasta. Stir in spinach and cheese. Serves 4.

To make the shortcrust pastry put the flour and salt in a food processor and whizz until well combined. Add the butter and whizz until it resembles fine crumbs. Add the water gradually and pulse until you have a firm dough that comes together when squeezed. Roll out on a lightly floured surface and use to line a deep 10in pie dish. Brush with milk or beaten egg and chill while you make the filling. Put the flour and water in a saucepan and whisk over a medium heat until you have a smooth paste that just comes away from the side of the pan when you run a spoon down it. Add the cooking apples and cook for about 1 minute until they are lightly coated in flour then remove from the heat and stir in the cinnamon and sugar and leave to cool. Meanwhile put the blackberries in a food processor with 45g of the sugar and pulse until they are roughly chopped then stir in the remaining sugar. Now spread half the apple mixture on top of the shortcrust base and spoon on half the blackberries then repeat with the remaining apple and black
Combine the oatmeal and yogurt. Stir in the almonds. Divide yogurt mixture between two bowls. Add strawberries to each.

Saute kielbasa in oil until browned. Add the chopped onions. Cook 5 minutes. Add the garlic. Add the potatoes and cover. Add the stock. Season with fresh coarse ground black pepper. Cook until tender, stirring occasionally.

Soak dried mushrooms in hot water for 1/2 hour. Drain mushrooms, reserving liquid. Saute onion & carrot in oil until soft. Add mushrooms & water to make a soup. Add buckwheat groats & stir well to combine. Cover & simmer 15 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir often to avoid sticking. Remove from heat & add butter & parsley. Serve hot.

Cut the cabbage into thin slices. In a small bowl, mix together the sour cream and mayonnaise. Add the sugar and lime juice and mix well. Toss the cabbage and the scallions with the dressing. Let stand for 15 minutes. Add the cilantro and serve.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).Wash the vegetables. Cut them into cubes. Combine the vegetables and honey in a large bowl. Spray a large baking dish with cooking spray. Spread the vegetables into the prepared baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 40 minutes. Stir occasionally. Season with salt. Sprinkle with shallots before serving.

Select either juice or syrup packed canned pears, mash them well. Add mashed pears, water, honey and egg to bread machine. Add dry ingredients, ending with yeast. Select basic white cyle. Follow manufacturers directions.

Heat oil in wok or large skillet over high heat. Add onion. Saute until golden. Add green beans. Saute until tender-crisp. Add shiro miso. Add 3 tbsp water. Stir until smooth. Add mirin. Stir until heated through. Add pure maple syrup. Stir until heated through. Add cornstarch mixture. Stir until thickened. Serve immediately.

Bring sugar-free instant pudding mix and water to a boil. Stir for two minutes. Remove from heat and add cool whip lite and stir until smooth. Pour into pie shell and chill. Top with cool whip lite and coconut flakes.

In a large bowl, combine tomatoes, green onion, basil, and peppermix well. In a 9-inch pie pan, arrange tomato mixture in a single layer. Sprinkle cheese on top of tomato mixture, cover with pie shell, and seal edge. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Bake for 15 minutes in preheated oven. Reduce temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake for 15 minutes longer. In a small bowl, combine egg white and 1 teaspoon water. Brush the top of the pie crust with the egg wash. Bake for an additional 5 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the crust is golden brown. Allow pie to cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Shake cranberry juice cocktail and vodka in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Strain into an old-fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Top with triple sec and lime juice. Garnish with a lime slice and cranberries. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add garlic. Cook 1 minute. Stir in peas and sugar snaps. Season with salt and pepper. Cook until tender crisp 3-5 minutes. Sprinkle with mint and serve warm.

Preheat broiler. Cut bread lengthwise in halfplace cut sides down on a baking sheet. Brush tops with 1/2 tablespoon oilsprinkle with salt and pepper. Broil 4 to 5 inches from heat 2 minutes or until golden brown. Meanwhile, in a small bowl combine gorgonzola cheese with remaining 1 tablespoon oilstir in honey and remaining 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Spread evenly over bread topsserve immediately.

Place chiles in a blender or food processor along with garlic clove and cilantro stem. Add broth and blend until chiles are coarsely chopped. Serve as an accompaniment to grilled chicken or beef or as a sauce for enchiladas or tacos
Sift together flour, soda, salt, & sugar. Add shortening. Add eggs. Add milk. Add orange & vanilla. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Mix flour, dried onion, cilantro, basil, vegetable oil, milk, salt, and pepper in a plastic bag. Add potatoes to bag and shake to coat. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add potatoes in small batches to the skillet. Saute until nicely browned on all sides. Repeat until all the potatoes are cooked. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Season the chops with the seasoning salt and pepper. Brown chops. Mix the stuffing and place in a 13x9 inch baking dish. Layer the chops over the stuffing. Top with the apple pie filling and cheese. Bake for 45 minutes. Serves 6.

Slice Spam into 1/2-inch rounds. Place in shallow dish and pour milk oversoak for 10 minutes. Sauté bell pepper and onions in oil. Drain Spam and add to vegetables. Add Sazon and tomatoes. Serve in small bowls and top with shredded cheese. Serve with chips.
name: sausage con queso dipingredients: lean ground beef, hot italian sausage, onion, mushroom soup, diced tomatoes with seasonings, velveeta cheese, jalapeno peppers, hot salsa, tortilla chipspreparation:Brown ground beef, sausage meat and onion. Drain fat. Add the rest of the ingredients. Simmer until the cheese melts. Serve warm with tortilla chips.
name: breakfast nachosingredients: tortilla chips, refried beans, eggs, salsa, monterey jack pepper cheese, scallionspreparation:Cover the bottom of a large oven-safe platter with tortilla chips. Mic

Place baguette slices in shallow baking dish. Top each slice with a slice of gruyere. Cut 1/2 inch off each end of the kielbasa. Place each piece of kielbasa crosswise over gruyere. Spoon 1 tablespoon of the cucumber mixture down center of each. Broil 2 inches from heat until cheese is melted and kielbasa is heated through. Cut each sandwich in half. Serve with remaining cucumber mixture.
Tip: I like to use the mini baguettes for these. You can cut them in half to make 4 sandwiches.

Cook squash and onion in boiling water until tender. Drain and mash. Combine squash mixture, sugar, salt, eggs, and bread crumbs or cracker crumbs. Bake in a 2 quart casserole in a 350 degree oven for 30 minutes or until thoroughly heated. Serves 4.
Name: Savory Squash
Name: Scalloped Zucchini (Yellow Squash)
Name: Country Yellow Squash Bake
Name: Steamed Yellow Squash With Vidalia Onions
Name: Charlotte's Squash Casserole
Name: Barb's Zucchini Pancakes
Name: Yellow Squash With Peanuts
Name: Bibby's Yellow Squash Bake
Name: Yellow Squash With Broccoli And Cheese
Name: Yellow Squash With Peppers And Onions
Name: Yellow Squash With Onions And Parmesan Cheese
Name: Yellow Squash And Rice
Name: Yellow Squash And Cheese Casserole
Name: Y

Place all the ingredients in a slow cooker and cook on low for 8 to 10 hours or until potatoes are tender. Serve with a salad.
name: chicken pot pieingredients: chicken pieces, mushrooms, onion, flour, butter, milk, frozen pastry sheets, saltpreparation:Saute onion in butter until translucent. Add mushrooms, flour, and saltstir until browned. Stir in milk gradually. Bring to boilcook until thickened. Remove from heatstir in chicken pieces. Place 2 pastry sheets in pie panspread chicken mixture over bottom pastry sheet. Top with remaining pastry sheetseal edges with forkcut slits in top for steam to escape. Bake at 400 for 35-45 minutes or until pastry is golden brown. Cool slightly before serving.
name: chicken pot pieingredients: 2 skinless boneless chicken breasts (about 1 pound each), 3 carrots (cut in 1/2-inch dice), 1/2

Bring large pot of lightly salted water to boil. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. In a medium bowl combine tomatoes, basil, mozzarella, olive oil, capers, salt, and pepper. Set aside. In small bowl combine garlic clove, 2 tablespoons olive oil, and 1/4 teaspoon of the salt. Rub on both sides of chicken. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken, skin side down. Cook until browned, about 5 minutes. Turn chicken over. Cook until no longer pink, about 2 minutes. Transfer to cutting boardcut into 1/2-inch slices. Toss chicken with tomato mixture. To serve, place chicken on 4 serving plates. Top with tomato mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Serves 4.

Cook sirloin in skillet with garlic and onion. Stir in tomato sauce, basil and simmer for 10 minutes. Drain and set aside. Cook fettuccine in large pot of salted, boiling water until tender but firm. Drain. Layer 1/2 of pasta in 13x9x2 baking dish. Top with 1/2 the meat mixture. Sprinkle with 1/4 of the cheese. Repeat layers. Top with 1/2 of the cream cheese mixture. Bake 30 minutes at 350 degrees. Uncover and bake 5 to 10 minutes longer to brown. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a food processor, combine the bread crumbs with the parsley and basil. Blend until smooth. Press out about 1/4 of the mixture between the 2 layers of meat. Spread a thin layer of olive oil over the top of the steaks. Sprinkle with the green onions and ground pepper. Bake in the oven for 20 minutes.

In a large skillet heat oil over medium high heat. Add shrimp and cook for about a minute. Add butter and garlic and cook for 3 minutes. Add onion and cook for another minute. Add hot sauce, salt, and pepper and cook for another minute. Add parsley and lemon juice and cook for another minute. Cool completely and store in refrigerator.

Slice watermelon into cubes or wedges. Toss in a bowl with balsamic vinegar. Toss gently to coat. Add crumbled feta cheese. Toss again. Add arugula. Toss again. Sprinkle with black pepper. Drizzle olive oil over top. Sprinkle almonds over top.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In a medium-size mixing bowl, combine the onions, potatoes, water, raisins, sugar, salt, ginger and cinnamon. Transfer to a 2-quart casserole dish. Cover with foil. Bake for 45 minutes. Remove the foil. Bake 10 minutes longer. Serves 4.

Melt the chocolate in the milk. Add honey and stir until smooth. Stir in orange peel and cinnamon. Pour over ice cubes.
