Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gradually beat in sugar until stiff peaks form again. Blend in vinegar and raspberry gelatin powder. Drop by tablespoons onto wax paper. Top each with a miniature chocolate chip.

Melt bittersweet chocolate in a small saucepan over low heat. Whisk until smooth. Cool. Whisk cream in a large bowl until it just begins to thicken. Add vanilla bean seeds, sugar, and salt. Whisk until soft peaks form. Add the chocolate mixture. Continue whisking until the mixture is stiff enough to hold a peak. Serve with fruit. Top with pistachios.

Brown bacon in a large skillet. Remove from pan and add onions. Saut until soft and then add the carrots and cook until soft. Add the chicken stock and let it come to a boil. Add the sauerkraut and cook for 30 minutes. Add the wine and juniper berries and cook for about 5 minutes. Add the kielbasa and cook for 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and serve hot.

In a skillet over medium heat add butter. When butter begins to foam add cream. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Add white wine and bring to a simmer. Add italian cheese blend. Stir until melted. Add cooked pasta to cream sauce. Serve over cooked pasta. In a shallow bowl combine italian salad dressing, chicken breasts and lemon juice from lemons. Toss to coat. Let marinade 10 minutes. Grill to your liking. Serve over cooked pasta.

In a stockpot, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the leeks, onions, carrots, celery and bay leaves. Sauté the vegetables until softened but not browned. Add the herbs and sauté for 1 minute. Pour in the cold water. Bring the liquid to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer. Cover the pot and cook for 30 minutes. Remove the bay leaves. Strain the broth through a fine-mesh strainer into a large bowl. Let the broth cool to room temperature. Stir in the parsley. Season the broth with salt and pepper to taste.
Marinate tenderloins overnight in marinade. Preheat broiler. Place pork in a single layer in a shallow baking dish. Broil about 4 inches from heat for 8-10 minutes per side. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a small bowl, beat egg white until frothy. In a large bowl, combine pecans and next 4 ingredientsstir well. Add egg white mixturestir gently until coated. Spread in a single layer on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until coating is crisp. Cool on baking sheet on a wire rack for 1 hour. Store in an airtight container.

Cook the onion and carrot in oil in a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish until tender. Add the italian sausage and bell pepper. Cook 5 minutes or until the sausage is browned. Drain. Stir in the flour. Add milk and worcestershire sauce. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Add the beans. Cover. Simmer 5 minutes. Sprinkle with sage. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until the mixture is bubbling. Makes 6 servings.

Heat olive oil over medium heat in a dutch oven. Add the roast and brown on all sides. Add the onions and garlic and saute for 3 minutes. Add the bay leaves and pancetta and continue to saute for 5 minutes. Add the beer and enough water to cover. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer and cover. Cook for 2 hours. Remove the roast and cut into cubes. Return to the pan and stir well. Add the brown sugar and stir well. Simmer for 10 minutes until the gravy thickens. Serve over mashed potatoes.

Preheat broiler. Slice tomatoes 1/2 inch thick. Grill tomatoes and onions until tender. In a small saucepan combine vinegar, water and sugar. Boil and stir until sugar dissolves. Add salt and pepper. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature. Place tomatoes and onions in serving dish. Pour vinegar mixture over top and garnish with caraway seeds and hot pepper flakes.

Heat oil and add onions, ginger and red pepper to taste. Saute until soft. Add garlic and coriander and saut for 2 minutes. Add stock and bring to a boil then add pumpkin and simmer for 5 minutes. Add coconut milk and season with fish sauce to taste. Serve hot with crispy noodles or rice noodles and fresh coriander to garnish.

Melt butter in a heavy pot over medium heat. Add sugar and stir until melted and smooth. Add cinnamon and stir well. Add popcorn and stir until well coated. Spread on a cookie sheet to cool. Store in air tight container.
It is very important to know the process of how the popcorn is made. It is also important to know the right way of storing the popcorn to make it more delicious. Popcorns are a great source of entertainment for the family because you can watch the movie together with your family or friends while eating the popcorns that you made at home.

In a large pot of boiling water cook linguine until al dente. Drain. In a large saucepan heat the olive oil. Add garlic and italian seasoning. Cook 2 minutes. Stir in frozen peas. Cook 2 minutes. Add pasta. Toss well to coat. Add prosciutto. Toss lightly. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. In a large bowl, mix together the popcorn, canola oil, unsalted butter, and white truffle oil. Sprinkle with salt to taste. Toss to coat evenly. Spread in a single layer on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat. Bake for 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes to prevent burning.
name: popcorn de provence
ingredients: popped popcorn, butter, garlic cloves, herbes de provence
preparation:Melt butter in small saucepan. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Stir in herbs de provence. Place popcorn in large bowl. Toss flavored butter mixture over popcorn. Serve immediately.
name: chili cheese popcorn
ingredients: margarine, chili powder, garlic salt, onion powder, popcorn, parmesan cheese
preparation:In a small saucepan over low heat, melt margarine. Add

Wash and scrub potatoes. Boil in a large pot of water until fork tender. Drain and let cool. Cut into bite-sized pieces. Add the scallions and dill pickles. Mix well. Add the mayonnaise and mix lightly. Add the parsley and season with the salt and pepper to taste. Chill until serving time.

Cook potatoes and onions in a Dutch oven or slow cooker in the oven until tender (about 2 1/2 hours). Slice ham into bite sized pieces. Dice celery and add to potatoes along with ham, corn, butter, bouillon cubes, evaporated milk and seasonings. Cover and cook for another 1 1/2 hours or until heated through. Serve hot.

Fry onion in extra virgin olive oil until soft. Add bacon. Cook until crispy. Remove bacon, then add sweet potatoes. Cook for 5 minutes. Add bay leaves. Pour in enough chicken stock to cover. Bring to boil. Cover. Simmer for 20 minutes. Remove bay leaves. Stir in half the bacon. Add nutmeg. Salt & pepper to taste. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375f. Sift flour with baking soda and salt together. Set aside. In a large bowl with an electric mixer, cream the butter until light and fluffy. Beat in both sugars until well blended. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Beat in the vanilla extract. Blend dry ingredients into wet. Stir in the chocolate chips with a wooden spoon until well distributed. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet 2 inches apart. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until the edges are lightly browned and the centers still look a little raw. Let cool on the cookie sheets for a few minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cream together the sugars and margarine until light and fluffy. Blend in the egg and the flavoring of your choice. Beat in the flour, oats, coconut, baking powder, baking soda, and vanilla. Chill dough for at least 1 hour or overnight. Roll dough into 1 inch balls and place 2 inches apart on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350f for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned. Makes 4 dozen.
Mix together the dressing and the shrimp. Add the peas. Let marinate for about 30 minutes. Serve on a bed of lettuce.

Layer all ingredients in order as listed in air tight container. Mix salad dressing ingredients together. Put dressing on top of layered salad. Do not mix. Refrigerate overnight. Do not unseal until ready to serve. Mix just before serving.

Prepare the strawberry jell-o gelatin dessert according to directions on box. Fold in the cool whip. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix well. Place in the refrigerator and chill for at least 1 hour before serving.

Combine all ingredients in a jar or other airtight container. Store in the refrigerator or freezer. When ready to use, remove a pinch of the mixture and crush in a mortar or grinder. Add the crushed herbs to a sauce or marinade. If not using immediately, store any remaining herbs in the refrigerator. To use as a seasoning, sprinkle fines herbes over a salad. To make a seasoning paste, combine a pinch of the mixture with a small amount of mayonnaise or mustard. Use as a spread for a sandwich or as a condiment for meat or fish.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees Fahrenheit. Heat olive oil in a medium frying pan over medium heat. Toss with the potatoes, lemon juice and zest, honey and red onion. Cook 8 to 10 minutes until potatoes begin to brown at the edges. Remove from pan and cool slightly. Place in a large bowl and toss with the mint and feta cheese. Season with pepper. Serve warm or cold.

I have read your post about the potatoe recipes.. it was so good.. I am also searching for such recipes.. I will bookmark your site..

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add the penne pasta, and cook until tender, 8 to 10 minutes. Heat the butter in a skillet over medium-low heat. Add the spinach leaves, and cook for 1 minute. Add the bacon, and cook for another minute. Stir in the penne pasta, the garlic and the olive oil. Toss to combine. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese.

Preheat a sandwich maker or toastie maker until hot. Spread a little olive oil onto one slice of white bread. Spread the brown onion on the bread. Sprinkle the grated cheese on top. Spread the chives on top of the cheese. Place the other slice of white bread on top of the sandwich maker. Cook until the bread is golden brown. Serve and enjoy.
1.Gourmet Jaffles 2.Citrus French Toast 3.Orange French Toast 4.German French Toast 5.Healthier French Toast 6.Tuna and Corn Jaffles 7.Onion and Herring Sandwich Smorrebrod 8.Cheesy Chive and Onion Toasties Jaffles
1.Gourmet Jaffles
1/2 cup (125ml) chopped olives
2 large handfuls of baby spinach
2 slices of pepperoni
2 slices of sliced ham
2 slices of sliced salami
2 slices of sliced smoked chicken
2 slices of sliced roast

Heat oil over medium heat in stockpot or dutch oven. Saute garlic and onion until soft. Add garlic and cook 2 more minutes. Add tomato paste and cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Stir in sugar and cook 3 minutes more. Stir in tomatoes, thyme and bay leaf and simmer until thickened and fragrant, 10 to 15 minutes. Stir in milk and heat through. Taste and add additional seasonings if desired. Remove bay leaf and ladle into serving bowl. Stir yogurt into each serving and serve immediately.

Mix corn flakes and butter in large bowl. Spread out on wax paper and press with waxed paper until about 1/2 inch thick. Cut into wreath shapes and set on cookie sheet. Bake for about 20 minutes at 300 degrees F. Cool and then decorate with marshmallows and red candies for berries.

Saute onion and garlic in oil. Add mushrooms. Cook until tender. Add tomatoes and cook 1 minute. Stir in beans. Cook for 15 minutes. Season to taste. Stir in lemon juice and parmesan. Sprinkle with scallions. Serve over cooked ziti pasta.

Put flour in bowl, make well in center. Add eggs, yolk, and oilmix well with fork, then knead on floured surface until smooth and elastic (about 5 minutes). If dough is too dry add more eggif too wet add more flourmix well and knead again until smooth. Wrap in plastic wrap or in damp clothlet rest at room temperature for 30 minutes.
Brown ground chuck with onion and bell pepper. Add hot sauce and pasta sauce and simmer for 1 hour. Add cooked egg noodles and cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cream together the butter and the chocolate. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Mix in the sugar and the almonds. Sift together the cornstarch and the flour. Add to the chocolate mixture alternating with the grand marnier. Pour into greased and floured 9 inch round pan. Bake in the preheated oven for about 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Let cool. To make the glaze combine the icing sugar with the grand marnier. Pour over the cooled cake. Garnish with blackberries.

In a small bowl stir together the ground cumin, paprika, chili powder, dark brown sugar, cracked black pepper and dried oregano to create the spice rub mixture for the chicken drumsticks. Remove the chicken drumsticks from the package and rub the spice rub mixture all around the chicken drumsticks until fully covered. Heat the canola oil in a deep skillet over medium high heat and add the chicken drumsticks into the hot oil. Cook the chicken drumsticks for about 5 minutes on each side until fully cooked. Serve the chicken drumsticks with the banana boats. To create the banana boats slice the bananas into thin slices and remove the inside of the bananas to create the banana boats. Mash the inside of the banana with a fork and mix together with the brown sugar and cinnamon to create the filling mixture for the banana boats. Add the filling mixture into the hollow of the banana boats and enjoy!

In a shallow dish, combine pepper and onion flakes and garlic clovemix well. Dip fish into seasoning mixture. Coat fish evenly and place in baking dish. In a small bowl, combine margarine and cuminblend well. Spread mixture evenly on fish. Bake at 400 for 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve on lettuce cups with fresh cilantro and limes squeezed on top of fish.
Combine first 4 ingredients in a blender container. Blend until smooth. Add coffee ice creamblend until smooth. Pour into 2 glasses. Top with whipped cream. Sprinkle with malted milk powder.

Line an 8 inch square baking pan with foil. Melt the butter in a medium saucepan. Add the sweetened condensed milk and stir to combine. Cook over medium high heat until the mixture comes to a rolling boil. Stir constantly until the mixture reaches 234 degrees F. Remove from the heat and stir in the vanilla extract and instant coffee. Add the chopped pecans and mix well. Pour the mixture into the prepared pan and stir in the morsels. Sprinkle the top with the additional chopped pecans. Refrigerate for one hour. Cut into squares with wax paper. Store in the refrigerator.

Cut summer squash spears in half lengthwise. Lightly spray with cooking spray. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes. Combine garlic powder, salt, pepper. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine cheese and butter. Stir until melted. Brush mixture over cooked squash. Bake at 375 for another 5 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Mound apples evenly into an 8 x 8 baking pan or 9 x 9 glass dish. In a medium bowl, combine lemon juice, 1/2 cup of the brown sugar, the flour, rolled oats, cinnamon, nutmeg and saltcut in the butter until mixture resembles coarse meal. Spread topping mixture evenly over the fruit. Bake uncovered for 1 hour or until the topping is golden brown. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped cream.

Heat oil in heavy medium skillet over medium heat. Add sausage and crushed red pepper flakes. Cook until sausage is browned, 5 - 7 minutes. Add white onion. Cook until onion is soft, about 5 minutes. Add bacon and garlic. Cook until bacon is browned. Add water. Bring to boil. Add chicken bouillon cubes. Cook 8 minutes. Add heavy cream. Cook until heated through. Add potatoes and kale. Cook until potatoes are tender.

In a large soup pot over medium-high heat, saute the onions and celery in the butter until tender. Sprinkle with the celery seed and pepper. Stir the thyme, rosemary and rice into the pot. Add the sherry and chicken stock. Simmer for 20 minutes until the rice is tender. Stir in the parsley and the chicken. Simmer for an additional 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

Combine pepper and onion in a large skillet over medium heatcook about 10 minutes or until tender-crisp. Transfer to a small bowlset aside. In a large bowl, combine cream cheese and sour creamstir until smooth. Add pepper mixtureset aside. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook corn in the butter about 5 minutes or until tenderset aside. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a shallow 2-quart baking dishset aside. Stir potato chips into cream cheese mixturestir in corn. Spoon into prepared baking dishsprinkle with bacon. Bake about 30 minutes or until hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add bacon and saute until almost crisp, about 6 minutes. Drain off the bacon fat and spread out the bacon on paper towels to cool.In a large bowl, mix together the bacon, pecan halves, brown sugar and salt.Place the mixture on a greased baking sheet and bake until toasted and slightly crisp, stirring every so often, about 10 minutes.

Bring water to a boil in a saucepan. Add the pasta and cook until al dente, stirring occasionally. Drain and cool in a colander. In a large bowl combine sausage, egg, 1 cup of mozzarella cheese and seasoningsblend well. Add cooked pasta and mix well. Transfer the mixture to an 8-inch square baking pan, spreading evenly. Sprinkle with remaining mozzarella and parmesan cheeses. Bake for 25 minutes or until browned. Cool for 10 minutes before serving.
Brown pork chops in hot fat. In blender combine all remaining ingradiants. Process to smooth. Pour over browned chops. Simmer for 1 hour.

Bring water to a boil in a large pan. Add broccoli rabe and boil for 3 minutes. Drain well. Heat oil in a small pan over medium heat. Add garlic and saut for 1 minute. Add apricots, pine nuts and rabe. Toss to mix. Season with salt to taste. Serve warm.

Beat cream cheese until smooth. Blend in icing sugar. Add vanilla. Gradually add whipping cream and blend. Fold in graham cracker crumbs. Fold in cherry pie filling. Pour into greased 9-inch springform pan. Chill 4 hours or overnight. Garnish with fresh cherries.
Cook beans according to package directions. In a large bowl, toss beans with dressing. Stir in cranberries. Serve immediately.

In medium saucepan, bring 2 cups water to boil. Add quinoa. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 15 minutes or until quinoa is tender. Drain. Add remaining 2 cups water to the saucepan. Bring to boil. Add lima beans. Reduce heat to low. Cover and cook for 5 minutes or until lima beans are tender. Stir in cream. Heat through. Season to taste with hot chili sauce, sun-dried tomatoes, lemon juice, and parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

In a skillet heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Cook chicken in the hot oil about 4 minutes per side or until no longer pink. Add garlic, wine, honey, and Worcestershirecook and stir until bubbly. Reduce heat to low. Stir in apples and thyme. Covercook for 10 minutes. Serve over rice pilaf.

Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute until tender. Stir in garlic and saute until fragrant. Add mint leaves and saute until wilted. Stir in pine nuts and cumin. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with lemon juice. Serve with pita bread.

Sift together flour, cornmeal, sugar and baking soda. Add salt and mix well. Add yogurt and stir just until mixed. Stir in eggs and mix well. Fold in corn and jalapeno pepper. Spray a jelly roll pan with pam. Pour mixture into pan. Bake at 375 degrees for about 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cut into squares and serve warm.

Combine first 4 ingredients in small saucepanbring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer for 1 minute. Pour over cucumber slicescool to room temperature. Refrigerate at least 2 hours or up to 1 week. Garnish with paprika before serving.

In a small saucepan combine sugar and lemon. Add water and bring to a boil for about 1 minute or until sugar dissolves. Stirring constantly, bring to a boil and boil for about 1 minute or until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat and add the strawberries. Allow to cool to room temperature before adding the yogurt. Mix together and pour into an ice pop maker and freeze according to manufacturer's directions. Serve immediately or store in a freezer safe container for up to 2 weeks.

Preheat oven to 350f. Pound each of the breast halves until they are about 1/4 inch thick. Place them in a 13x9 inch baking pan. Combine the barbecue sauce and water. Spread over the chicken. Sprinkle the bacon and cheese over the top. Bake uncovered for 25 minutes.

In a large skillet, heat oil. In a small bowl, combine seasonings. Add tenderloins to skillet. Brown tenderloins on all sides. In a separate bowl, combine flour, seasoning, and nectar. Pour over tenderloins and stir until coated. Cover and simmer 40-45 minutes until tenderloins are fork tender. Makes 4 servings.

Mix coffee, milk and 1 tablespoon of the melted butter in a small saucepan over low heat. Set aside and let cool to lukewarm. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 12-cup muffin pan or line with paper liners. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder and salt. In a medium bowl, whisk the egg and remaining 2 tablespoons of the butter until smooth. Add the maple syrup, coffee mixture and vanilla extract, and stir to combine. Stir in the walnuts and the sugar until well combined. Add the flour mixture and stir just until moistened. Fill each prepared cup 3/4 of the way full. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes. Cool in the pan on a wire rack for 5 minutes before removing to cool completely on wire racks.

Arrange romaine lettuce on large serving platter. Arrange avocado slices and cherry tomatoes on top of lettuce. Sprinkle with sliced onions. Serve with italian salad kit.

Ingredients for "Strawberry Romaine Salad"
Ingredients for "Tomato Cucumber And Green Pepper Chopped Salad"
Ingredients for "Fast And Easy Bean And Corn Salad"
Ingredients for "Cool Summer Veggie Salad"
Ingredients for "5 Minute Southwest Layered Salad K"
Ingredients for "Mediterranean Marinated Vegetable Salad"
Ingredients for "Vegetarian Salad"
How Do You Cook Italian Salad?

How to cook
Preheat oven to 375f. Mix together all ingredients except breadcrumbs. Place in a buttered 13x9x2-inch baking dish. Cover with breadcrumbs. Bake 20 minutes. Serve on toast points.

Peel potatoes and dice. Bring to a boil in a large pot of water and boil until done. Mash and add garlic, milk, rosemary, chives and parsley. Add butter and stir until blended. Add sour cream and white pepper to taste. Serve hot with a little extra sour cream on top if you like.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Lightly grease baking sheets or line with parchment paper. Cream butter and sugar. Beat in egg yolk and syrup. Sift flour, bicarb of soda and spices. Beat into mixture, add nuts and raisins if using. Turn out onto lightly floured surface and knead lightly. Roll out to about 3/4-inch thickness and cut into rounds with floured cutter. Bake until pale golden brown. Cool on wire racks. Makes 24-28 cookies.
Melt the semisweet chocolate and sweetened condensed milk over very low heat. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla. Add chopped nuts. Pour into a greased pan and chill. Cut into 1 inch squares.

Cut the trout into 2 inch pieces and coat them in cornmeal. Heat a skillet with a teaspoon of butter. Add the trout pieces and saute for 3-4 minutes on each side. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Combine the first five ingredients in a large bowl. Mix together the next three ingredients in a separate bowl. Add the meat mixture to the salad mixture. Toss to combine. Serve with tortilla chips. You can top with avocado if you like.

In skillet, brown ground beef with onion. Add seasoning, diced tomatoes and black beans. Cook until heated through. Serve in warmed shells. Top with cheese, lettuce, sour cream and whatever else you like to use to top your taco.

Place frozen berries and water in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook stirring frequently until thickened. Cool to room temperature. Stir in orange rind and salt. Arrange granola on bottom of greased 12x17x1/2 inch baking pan. Spread half of fruit filling over granola. Top with remaining granola. Top with remaining filling. Bake at 350f for 25 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool. Serve at room temperature. Makes 6 servings.

In a medium saucepan over low heat, melt the butter. Add the sugar and cocoa. Beat with an electric mixer until well combined. Add the vanilla. Add the eggs one at a time. Beat until smooth. Stir in the flour and baking powder. Stir in the pecans. Spread in the bottom of a greased 13x9x2-inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 35 minutes. Let cool before cutting.
Combine the olives, orange peel, lemon peel, red chili pepper flakes, fennel seed, olive oil, almonds and chickpeas in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with toasted bread.

Rinse potatoes with cold water. Add to a 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Drizzle with butter. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with dried parsley, basil and garlic powder. Toss to coat. Cover and bake at 375f for 30 minutes. Stir and bake uncovered for another 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown and tender. Serves 4 to 6.

Soak wooden skewers in water 1 hour. Thread prawns and zucchini onto 12 skewers. Combine skewers with remaining ingredients in a shallow dish. Cover and refrigerate 3 hours or overnight. Drain reserving marinade. Grill skewers until prawns are cooked brushing with marinade.

Bring 2 cups of boiling water to a boil. Add 1 tablespoon of salt and 1 tablespoon of margarine. Add 2 pounds of sliced carrots and boil until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain. Melt 1/4 cup of margarine. Blend 1 tablespoon of lemon juice and 1/2 teaspoon of sugar substitute into melted margarine. Toss the carrots with the margarine mixture and sprinkle with 1 tablespoon of minced parsley.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine butter and sugar until smooth and creamy. Beat in egg whites and almond extract. In a small bowl combine the flour and baking powder. Add to butter mixture and mix well. Press into a 9x13-inch greased pan. Bake for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Combine preserves and egg yolks in a small bowlmix well and spread on baked crust. Bake for an additional 10 minutes or until lightly browned on top and the center is set. Cool on wire rack for 30 minutessprinkle with powdered sugar and almonds.
I've had this recipe booklet for years and it is one of the best I've ever seen! There are so many delicious recipes to choose from and I have tried many of them and they all turned out wonderful! This is a must for anyone who likes to make their own candy and snacks!

Combine the first five ingredients in a large bowl, and beat until smooth and creamy. Stir in remaining ingredients. Pour into a lightly greased 10 inch skillet or large cast iron skillet. Bake for 30 minutes in a 400 degree oven or until a wooden pick comes out clean when inserted in the center of the cake. Serve hot with butter, honey or syrup.
In a large bowl, combine the egg, buttermilk, molasses and melted butter. Add the flour, salt, baking soda and baking powder. Add the cornmeal last, stirring just until combined. The batter will be slightly lumpy. Drop by tablespoons ful on a hot greased griddle until bubbles form around the outer edges. Turn and brown on the other side --. Serve with butter and sorghum molasses or maple syrup.
In a large bowl, combine the egg, buttermilk, molasses and melted butter. Add the flour, salt, baking soda and baking powder. Add

Combine dried salad dressing mixes and vinegar in a large non-reactive bowl or a one gallon food storage bag. Add the vegetable oil and chicken breasts. Turn to coat all sides. Cover or seal tightly. Marinate for at least 1 hour or overnight. Cooked on barbecue or in a 350 degree oven.
I’ve never tried the Sheila’s simple marinara sauce. I’ll have to try it soon.
That looks delish! I love making my own wraps because I can control how much I eat and what I eat.
I love making my own wraps too!
I love homemade wraps too. I have some in the freezer as we speak!
I love wraps too! Great idea for dinner!
I love wraps! They are so versatile and healthy!
Thanks! I love making my own wraps too!
I love making my own wraps!
I love wraps too! I’m glad that you stopped by!
I love wraps too! Thanks for stopping by!
I love wraps too! I hope you enjoy

To make the dressing, combine soy sauce, vinegar, oil, sugar, cilantro, and ginger in a blender. Blend until smooth. Place spinach in a bowl. Top with the dressing. Arrange the vegetables around the edges of the bowl. Arrange the chicken over the vegetables. Sprinkle the peanuts over the top. Cut the mango into cubes. Place the cubes on top of the salad. Garnish with the sprigs of cilantro. Serve the salad within 4 hours.

Cook onion in pan until soft and tender, add sweet italian sausage links break them up as they cook add green peppers cook until tender add the soup mix together add water to desired consistency add noodles cook till tender to desired consistency serve on crusty bread or toast topped with parmesan cheese and oregano

Dip chicken tenders in eggs, then coat with breadcrumbs. Place on a cookie sheet. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 - 15 minutes or until no longer pink. Serve with dijon mustard for dipping.

Heat oven to 350. In a large bowl with a hand mixer beat margarine, chocolate squares & flour until creamy. Add sugar, 1 egg & vanilla. Mix well. Stir in nuts. Drop by teaspoons on greased baking sheet. Bake 8-10 minutes or until puffed & golden brown. Cool on wire rack. Melt powdered sugar in a small pan. Dip each cookie into powdered sugar. Allow excess powder to drip off. Place on wax paper. Repeat until all cookies are dipped. Cool. Store in airtight container.

Cut roast in half and place in a 3 quart or larger crockpot. Add pickles with juice, chili sauce and garlic. Cover and cook on low 7 to 9 hours or until beef is tender. Discard pickles. Remove roast. When cool enough to handle, shred the meat. Return meat to sauce and heat through. Using slotted spoon, fill buns with desired amount.

Make simple syrup by boiling water and sugar and simmering for five minutes without stirring. Let cool and add lime zest and lime juice. Puree the strawberries and add to the simple syrup. Place mixture in a container and freeze for two hours. Then take the mixture from the freezer and beat with an electric mixer for a minute or two to break it up. Then return it to the freezer for at least six hours before serving. When serving, garnish with a few fresh strawberries and a slice of lime and serve with a spoon or a straw.

Prepare a double boiler. Pour soy sauce into it. Add chicken to double boiler for 20 minutes. Remove from soy sauce and set aside. In a large skillet or wok, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion, mushrooms and garlic cloves to oil. Cook until onion is soft. Add honey and soy sauce to mixture. Cook for one minute more. Place cooked chicken on skewers alternating with onion mixture. Baste kabobs with remaining sauce. Grill or broil until no longer pink inside. Serve with your favorite rice dish or noodles.
This is a recipe that I got from a friend of mine, I do not know who invented it. It is very good and easy to make.
This is a very quick recipe to make if you have a crockpot on hand.
This is a very easy recipe to make if you have a crockpot on hand.
This is an easy recipe to make if you have a crockpot on hand.
This is an easy recipe to make if you have a crockpot on hand. You can

Cook green beans according to package directions or in a large pot of boiling water until crisp-tender. Drain in a colander and immediately rinse with cold water to stop cooking. Drain again in colander or on paper towels to remove excess liquid. Heat butter in a skillet over medium-low heat. Add garlic, slivered almonds and lemon juice to the pan. Saute 3 minutes or until lightly browned and fragrant. Pour over the warm green beans. Sprinkle with salt before serving.

Heat the oil in a skillet. Add the garlic and stir. Add the shrimp and cook for 2 minutes. Add the lemon juice and cook for 1 minute. Add the dry sherry and cook for 2 minutes. Add the crushed red pepper and cook for 2 minutes. Add the parsley and cook for 1 minute. Season with salt and serve.

Cut the red potatoes into quarters and the brussels sprouts into halves. Cut the cauliflower into florets and slice the apple into thin rounds. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Once the butter has melted add the potatoes, brussels sprouts, cauliflower, apple slices and sprinkle with a few grains of sea salt. Cook the vegetables until they begin to brown slightly about 5 minutes. Sprinkle the vegetables with flour and cook for another minute stirring frequently. Remove from the heat and add the stout beer, frozen apple juice concentrate, and dijon mustard stirring well to combine. Return the vegetable mixture to the skillet over medium heat and stir constantly until the cheese has melted about 5 minutes. Serve warm with crusty bread or baguettes.
Combine crabmeat, salsa and peas. Sprinkle in chickpeas and scallions. Mix in salt and pepper to taste. Chill and serve.

In a food processor or blender, puree the garlic and olive oil until smooth. Add hearts of palm and process until creamy. Season with salt. To serve, layer greens on a platter or in a bowl. Spoon the hearts of palm mixture on top. Arrange tomatoes and scallions on top. 4 servings.

Combine 3/4 cup Bisquick with 1/2 cup sugar. Add 1/4 cup melted butter. Combine until mixture resembles coarse meal. Set aside. In separate bowl, mix 1/4 cup sugar and 2 Tablespoons cornstarch. Add 1 cup fruit juice. Stir well and add more cornstarch if mixture is too thin to coat fruit. Add fruit and 1/4 cup water. Stir well. Spray 9 inch pie plate with baking spray and add fruit mixture. Spoon topping over fruit. Bake at 350 for 30 to 40 minutes. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped topping.

Skewer the shrimp and set aside. To make the cocktail sauce, combine the ketchup, lime juice, worcestershire and hot pepper sauce. Serve the cocktail sauce with the shrimp. 3 points per serving.
110 calories and 3 points per serving.
In a medium bowl combine the sour cream, ranch dressing mix, and 1 tablespoon water. Blend well. Stir in the cheddar cheese and shrimp. Serve with crackers.
Serve this dip with crackers.
In a blender or food processor, combine all the ingredients. Cover and process until smooth. Refrigerate until well chilled. Serve with crackers.
This is a great snack for parties.
Combine all the ingredients and serve with crackers.
In a medium bowl combine all the ingredients. Cover and refrigerate for 3 hours. Serve with crackers.
Spoon into a small serving dish and serve with crackers.
Combine all the ingredients. Serve with crackers

Boil 2 chicken breasts in 4 cups water for 40 minutes. Drain and cool. Chop meat and add to a large bowl. Add chopped onion and celery. Stir in pickles. In a small bowl whisk together 3 tablespoons of mayo and 1 teaspoon of paprika. Add mayo mixture to the chicken and vegetables. Add salt and pepper to taste. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve with lettuce or crackers.

Preheat oven to 300°F. Toast almonds and chop coarsely. Combine almonds, chocolate, egg whites, salt and sugar and mix well. Press the mixture into a greased 12 x 8-inch pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until set. Cool completely. Drizzle with toasted almonds and serve.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Combine garlic, olive oil and seasoningsrub over pork. Place pork in shallow baking pan. Roast for 30 minutes. Reduce heat to 325 degrees F. Continue roasting for an additional 2 1/2 hours or until fork tender. Remove from oven and cover with foil. Let rest for 15 minutes before carving. Serve.

Combine water and skim milk in a medium saucepan. Bring the mixture to boil. Stir in oats, sugar, pomegranate seeds and blueberries. Cook for 3 minutes. Let stand for 2 minutes. Stir in almonds before serving.

Mix frozen concentrate with water in saucepan over med. heat until smooth. Let cool, then add lime juice, rum and mustard. Add salt to taste. Slice sweet potatoes and apples into 1/2-inch slices. Combine with celery in large bowl. Pour dressing over top and toss well. Refrigerate 24 hours before serving. Garnish with currants if desired.

Preheat oven to 400f. Roll out each crust to form a 12-inch square. Spread 1/3 cup pizza sauce over 1 crust, leaving a 1/2-inch border. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup pepperoni and 1/4 cup cheese. Repeat with second crust. Cut each crust into 4 triangles with a sharp knife or scissors. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake 15 min or until golden brown and crisp. Sprinkle with italian seasoning. Makes 16 servings (2 per serving).

Combine the bittersweet chocolate and the water in a large bowl and let sit for 10 minutes to soften the chocolate. In a double boiler or saucepan, combine the egg yolks and the sugar and beat until well combined and lightened in color. Add the salt and the chocolate mixture. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens and coats the back of a wooden spoon. Remove from heat and add the heavy cream and the whole milk. Beat until smooth and thick. Cool thoroughly, then refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve each portion with whipped cream and/or sprinkle with cocoa powder if desired.
Combine dry ingredients. Add butter. Mix well. Press mixture into 9 x 13-inch pan. Sprinkle mincemeat on top. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes.

Season steak with seasoning and brown in skillet. Add broth, hoisin sauce and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until tender. Add onion and fresh mushrooms to skillet. Heat until hot. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Melt butter in a medium saucepan over low heat. Add the shallots. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes until shallots are softened. Add the crabmeat, tomatoes, cream, chablis, parsley, parmesan cheese, and pepper. Cook until thickened. Add the spinach fettuccine to the sauce. Toss until well coated.

In a large skillet, saute the onion and pepper. Add garlic and cook until tender. Stir in the sausage and cook until browned. In a separate bowl combine the diced tomatoes and paste with basil and oregano. Stir into the skillet. Bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and cover. Cook for 1 hour. Serve over spaghetti. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Put the rhubarb and sugar together and cook slowly until tender (about ten minutes). Remove from heat and set aside. In another pan, heat the half-and-half and egg yolks on low heat until it thickens slightly. Add the salt and flour and stir until the mixture is smooth and well blended. Add the rhubarb mixture and stir until well blended. Pour into the pie crust and bake at 350 degrees for twenty minutes. Beat the egg whites until they are stiff and fold into the pie filling until well blended and smooth. Bake at 350 degrees for about another twenty minutes until the egg whites are brown and the filling is set. Serve while still warm and cut with a serrated knife.

Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat and saute the leeks until softened but not brown. Add the ham and cook until the ham is heated through and the leeks are slightly browned. Add the cream and bring to a simmer. Cook the pasta according to the package directions until tender but still firm to the bite. Drain the pasta and add the sauce to the pot with the pasta. Stir until the pasta and sauce are well combined. Add the parmigiano-reggiano cheese and gruyere cheese and stir to combine. Sprinkle the breadcrumbs and chives over the top of the pasta and bake at 350 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes until the sauce is bubbling and the top is lightly browned. Serve immediately with extra chives.

In a small bowl, combine butter & garlic. Set aside. Place a steaming basket in a pot with 3 cups of water. Add a can of beer & bring to a boil. Add shrimp & cook until they turn pink. Remove from heat & transfer shrimp to a baking dish. Pour butter mixture over shrimp. Bake uncovered for 5 minutes. Season with hot sauce & old bay. Serve immediately.

Combine water, egg, sugar, yeast and nonfat dry milk powder to dissolve yeast. Let stand for about 5 minutes, until foamy. Add flour and oil, stirring well until smooth. Place in greased bowlcover with plastic wrap or plastic bag and let rise for 1 hour or until doubled in bulk. Knead on lightly floured surface about 5 minutes or until smooth and elastic. Divide into 6 equal portionsshape each portion into ball. Place on greased cookie sheetlet rise 30 minutes or until doubled in bulk. Bake at 375 degrees F for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown on top. Remove from cookie sheetcool on wire rack. Serve with fruit or fruit spread or dip.

Place 1/2 of the chopped apples in a large bowl. Add brown sugar, lemon rind, lemon juice, cinnamon, vanilla extract, and salt. Toss until well blended. Stir in remaining 1/2 of the chopped apples. Transfer mixture to a large pot. Add enough water to cover the fruit completely. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat and simmer uncovered for 15 minutes or until the apples are very tender when pierced with a knife or skewer. Cool slightly then puree using an immersion blender or food processor, or a potato masher. Return the puree to the pot over low heat and cook until thickened and bubbly, about 5-10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in the creme fraiche. Season with salt.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the sausage and cook until browned. Add onions and cook until tender and brown. Add caraway seeds and bay leaf and stir in the sauerkraut. Pour in the wine and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer for 15 minutes or until the sauerkraut is heated through and the wine has reduced to a syrup. Serve at once with pumpernickel bread.

In a large saucepan over low heat, melt butter then add caster sugar, stirring to combine. Add flour and stir through for 1 minute. Remove from heat and add eggs one at a time, stirring well after each addition. Add milk and stir through until well combined. Bring to the boil over medium heat, stirring constantly, then simmer for 2 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heat then add vanilla essence and stir through. Cool slightly then transfer to an ice cream maker and follow manufacturers instructions to churn. Transfer to a container and store in freezer until set.

Heat oven to 375-degrees. In shallow dish or large resealable plastic bag, combine dressing mix and balsamic vinegar. Add chicken to bag or dishturn to coat well. Place chicken on rack in shallow baking pan or broiler panbake 30 minutes or until done. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Grease an 8-inch round baking dish. In a large bowl, whisk together eggs, milk and seasonings. Set aside. In a 10-inch skillet over medium heat, melt 2 tablespoons of the butter. Add onions and cook until softened. Remove from heatstir in vermouth. Spread onion mixture evenly into prepared baking dish. Pour egg mixture over onions. Bake for 25 minutes or until set. Garnish with tomatoes. Serve hot.

Place flour in shallow dish. Beat eggs in another shallow dish. Place yellow cornmeal in third shallow dish. Dip fish into flour, then egg, then cornmeal. Spray skillet with cooking spray. Fry over medium heat 5 minutes per side until golden. Place on baking sheet. In saucepan, saute onion until tender. Stir in broth and milk. Boil until thick. Stir in parmesan cheese and mix well. Add cornmeal to mixture. Place mixture on top of fish. Sprinkle with paprika and black pepper. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes or until bubbly.

Cook potatoes in boiling water until tender. Peel and mash potatoes with potato masher or ricer. While potatoes are still hot, add onion, eggs, salt, and pepper. Mix together well. In a separate bowl sift together flour and baking powder. Mix into potato mixture until well blended. In a skillet over medium heat melt butter. Drop potato mixture by teaspoons into hot butter to cook. Brown on both sides. Drain on paper towel lined plate. Serve with bacon bits, cheese, sour cream or whatever topping you choose.
Place tomato soup, vinegar, soy sauce and brown sugar in saucepan. Heat until boiling. Add ginger, garlic powder and chicken parts. Boil until tender. Serve over rice.

Combine the flour, garlic and ginger paste. Add spices and mix. Slowly add the water. Continue adding water until a batter is formed. Dip vegetables in batter and deep fry. Serve hot. Serve with mint chutney or tzatziki.

Heat oil in a skillet. Add onion and cook until tender. Add tomato sauce. Stir in peppers. Cook over medium heat until heated. Spoon chicken mixture into tortillas. Top with guacamole and sour cream. Serve with lime wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In small skillet over medium-high heat combine cream cheese and garlic and cook until smooth and bubbly, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in sun-dried tomatoes and basil. Remove stems from 16 jalapenos and remove seeds and veins. Stuff each chile with about 2 teaspoons of mixture. Wrap each stuffed chile with about 2 inches of bacon. Place stuffed chiles on a greased baking sheet. Bake about 20 minutes or until bacon is crisp.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan. Add the onion, garlic, apple and cook for 3 minutes. Add the cauliflower and cook for 3 minutes more. Add the stock, butternut squash and garam masala and cook for 10 minutes. Add the dried chili pepper flakes and cook for 2 minutes. Blend the mixture until smooth and then season with salt and pepper. To serve, reheat the mixture and ladle into bowls. Garnish with the low-fat sour cream.

Combine graham cracker crumbs, melted butter and 1/2 cup sugar. Press in bottom of 10-inch tube pan. Combine remaining 1/2 cup sugar, flour and lemon zest. Beat in cream cheese. Add eggs one at a time and beat until smooth. Add vanilla and mix well. Beat in heavy cream until smooth. Pour into pan. Bake 50 minutes. Cool completely. Wrap tightly and refrigerate at least 6 hours. To serve: Run knife around pan sides to loosen. Invert onto platter. Unwrap. Cut into wedges. Garnish with lemon zest.
name: Chocolate Peanut Butter Cookie Pieingredients: 1 1/2 cups finely chopped walnuts 1 cup brown sugar 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour 1/2 cup unsalted butter 1/2 teaspoon salt 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder 1

Cut the fillets into 1 inch pieces. Lightly fry the pieces in a small amount of olive oil. Take out and set aside. Fry the parsley and the onions in a little more olive oil. Add the mayonnaise and the juice of a lemon. Season with salt and pepper. Place the pieces of cod in a baking pan. Pour the mayonnaise mixture over them and cover with grated cheese. Sprinkle with the bread crumbs and bake in the oven. Serve.

Sprinkle steak with garlic and black pepper. Place steak in 9" by 13" glass baking dish. Layer with bell peppers. Drizzle with teriyaki sauce. Cover tightly. Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes. Uncover. Bake for an additional 5 minutes or until steak is no longer pink and peppers are tender. Serve over rice.
name: unstuffed bell pepper skilletingredients: ground beef, onion, crushed tomatoes, green bell peppers, salt, pepper, garlic powder, dried italian seasoning, cooked rice, parmesan cheesepreparation:Brown ground meat and onion. Drain. Season with salt, pepper, garlic and italian seasoning. Add crushed tomatoes and green pepper. Cover and simmer until peppers are tender crisp. Serve over cooked rice. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.
name: simply elegant steak and riceingredients: boneless beef round steak, vegetable oil, onions
Cook carrot in water till just tender. Add marmalade, curry powder and salt. Cook for 2-3 minutes.

Bring 8 cups of water to boil in large saucepan. Heat 1/2 teaspoon vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Saute cabbage and mushrooms in hot oil until crisp-tender, about 3 minutes per side. Drain and set aside. In a medium bowl, combine cabbage mixture with soy sauce, green onion and mustard. Cook pot stickers in boiling water, 5 minutes for frozen or 2 minutes for fresh. Drain pot stickers and place in serving bowl. Top with sauce mixture. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 175C/350F/gas mark 3. Butter 6 x 150ml ramekins or small pudding basins. Beat together egg yolks, caster sugar and lemon rind. Whip up egg whites to stiff peaks and fold into egg yolk mixture with lemon juice and butter. Divide mixture evenly between ramekins. Put ramekins into roasting pan. Fill pan with boiling water to come halfway up sides of ramekins. Bake for 20 minutes or until set and golden brown. Allow to cool completely before unmoulding. Can be served on toast or scones or with fresh cream or ice-cream. Makes 6 servings.

In medium bowl beat together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Stir in flour until well mixed. Stir in Velveeta until well mixed. Press into a 9 x 13 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oven. Spread canned sliced apples evenly over crust. Combine milk, cornstarch, and sugar in a saucepan over medium heat until thickened. Stir in cinnamon. Spread over top. Bake at 350 degrees for another 10 to 15 minutes or until cheese is golden brown. Cool before serving.

Cut the steak into bite-sized cubes. Place steak cubes in a plastic bag with the cornstarch. Toss until cubes are coated with cornstarch. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add ginger and garlic to the skillet and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add steak cubes to the pan. Stir-fry for about 1 minute. Add soy sauce and water. Stir-fry for another minute or two until the liquid is about half-gone. Add brown sugar and simmer for an additional 30 seconds to 1 minute. Pour steak mixture into a crock pot. Add green onions and stir. Cook for 3 hours on high or 6 hours on low.

Place chicken in shallow bowl and season with paprika, cayenne pepper and chili flakes. Heat oil over medium-high heat. Add chicken to hot oil and cook until browned. Remove from heat and add frozen peas, garlic, cumin. Cook until heated through. Serve immediately.
Bring water to a boil. Cook asparagus until tender. Drain. Heat a pan over medium heat. Add olive oil. Add mushrooms and shallots. Cook for 3 minutes. Add the cooked asparagus. Add cilantro.

Tear off the large stems from the collards. Chop the stems, then cut the leaves into 1/2 inch ribbons. In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the chopped stems and saute until they are lightly browned. Add the collard leaves. Season with the salt and pepper. Add the lemon juice. Cook until the greens are tender.

Peel and core pears. Place pears in a 3-quart baking dish. Add water to pan. Bake 30 minutes. Meanwhile, in saucepan, combine maple syrup, brown sugar and maple flavoring. Bring to a boil. Add butter and pecans. Simmer 2 minutes. Serve hot over pears. Garnish with additional pecans.

Peel parsnip and carrot. Cut into cubes. Peel pear, cut in half, remove seeds with a sharp knife. Cut into cubes. In a large pot, combine vegetable broth with curry powder and white pepper. Bring to a boil. Add other ingredients. Reduce heat, cover and simmer 20 minutes until all vegetables are very tender. Add milk and simmer until heated through. Makes 2-3 servings.

Mix together turkey, bacon bits, mayonnaise and mustard. Spread onto crackers. Top with tomatoes and lettuce. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Cut in small cubes. Serve with your favorite cocktail.
I am a stay at home mom of two very active boys.
I love cooking for my family. I like to experiment in the kitchen.
I am also a self proclaimed "foodie".
Preheat oven to 350. In a small bowl, combine the first four ingredients. Beat in onion. Pour into ungreased 13x9x2-inch baking dish. Bake uncovered for 50 to 60 minutes. Serve hot. Serves 8.

Mix dry ingredients together. Cream together shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in egg and milk. Fold in dry ingredients. Stir in honey. Place in greased muffin tins. Bake at 350 for 20 to 25 minutes or until done.

Wash olives and set aside. Soak black pitted olives in water for 2 hours. Drain water from olives. Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Add the stuffed olives. Marinate for 24 hours in refrigerator. Serve chilled.

Dissolve yeast in milk in a warm place. Let stand until foamy (10 minutes). In a large bowl, combine the shortening and the sugar, mixing well. Beat in the eggs and the salt. Add the milk mixture and 4 cups of the flourstir well. Add enough remaining flour to form a soft dough. Turn onto a lightly floured surfaceknead until smooth and elastic (about 10 minutes). Place in a greased bowl, turning once to grease the top. Coverlet rise in warm place until doubled in bulk (about 1 hour). Punch down doughcoverlet rest 10 minutes. Divide dough into 16 equal portionsroll each portion into a 3 1/2-inch ball. Place 2 inches apart on greased baking sheets. Coverlet rise until doubled (about 30 minutes). Bake at 375 for 15-18 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on a wire rack.

Separate the whites from the yolks of the eggs. Beat the yolks well with the sugar, flour, prepared mustard and salt. Combine with the vinegar and water until smooth. Bring to boiling over medium heat, stirring constantly. Cook 1 minute. Stir in the butter until melted. Add the miracle whip and mix well. Remove from heat. Whip the whites stiffly. Fold into the mixture. Chill before serving. Serve with lettuce and tomato.

Beat together the 2 eggs with 1/4 cup of the bread crumbs and the onions. Stir in the meat and add the salt and pepper to taste. Mix well, shape into meatballs of desired size, and brown in a large frying pan in which a small amount of oil has been heated to medium-high heat until cooked through. Serves 2 to 3.

Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F. Rinse the rabbit and pat it dry. Season it generously with the salt and the white pepper. Heat a heavy cast-iron skillet over high heat. When the pan is very hot add the rabbit pieces and brown them all over. They should be golden brown all over. Remove the rabbit pieces from the skillet and place them in a roasting pan. Add the garlic cloves, rosemary and coriander seed to the skillet, reduce the heat to medium low, and cook the spices until they are lightly toasted. Remove the spices from the skillet and add them to the roasting pan. Add the black peppercorns and the chile powder to the skillet. Stir to combine them. Cook for a few seconds then add the chicken stock. Increase the heat to high, stirring occasionally until the sauce has thickened and reduced. Pour this mixture over the rabbit in the roasting pan. Roast the rabbit for 45 minutes. Remove the pan from the oven, increase the heat to 500 degrees F and

Brown the hamburger and drain. Add the soup, tomato and cook for 5-10 minutes. Stir in macaroni and cook for an additional 3 minutes. Sprinkle with the cheese. Bake for 20 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve warm.

Heat oven to 350. In a small bowl combine jam and soy sauce. Stir until smooth. Place chicken in a greased 13x9-inch baking pan. Bake uncovered 20 minutes. Turn chicken over and brush with jam mixture. Bake an additional 20 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

1. Preheat oven to 350 F. Spray a 9x13 inch baking pan with nonstick spray and line with aluminum foilset aside.2. In a large bowl, combine the butter and sugarbeat until smooth. Beat in the vanilla and eggs until light and fluffy.3. In a medium bowl, combine the flour, cocoa and baking powderstir well. Add to the batter alternately with the milkbeat just until combined after each addition. Spread into the prepared pan. Bake at 350 F for about 20 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.4. Cool in the pan on a wire rack for about 5 minutesremove from the pan and let cool completely on the rack.5. Melt the chocolate with the condensed milk in a double boiler until smooth. Spread over the topsprinkle with the powdered sugar. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hourscut into squares when ready to serve.

Cut the smoked haddock into small cubes. In a medium size bowl, beat the egg and milk together. Add the flour, salt and pepper. Heat the griddle or skillet. Butter the toast and put on griddle. Spread the cheese on top of the haddock and add a generous amount of the egg mixture. Cook on the griddle until the cheese is melted and the egg is firm. Serve hot.

In saucepan, bring 1/2 cup water to a boil. Add cranberries. Boil 5 minutes. Add lemon juice, cinnamon stick, 1/2 cup water, 2/3 cup sugar, and 3/4 cup orange juice. Return to boil. Reduce heat to medium. Simmer until thickened. Cool. Drain and chill. Makes 1 1/2 cups.

In a bowl, combine the eggs, sour cream, butter and orange zest until smooth. Mix the flour and salt together and add to the egg mixturemix well and set aside. Peel and core the baking apples and cut into wedgesarrange the apple wedges around the outer edge of the unbaked pie crust. In another bowl, combine the rhubarb and the sugarpour over the apples. Pour the flour mixture over the fruit and bake for about 45 minutes at 400 degrees Fahrenheit until the crust is golden brown and the juices are bubbling. Cool slightly before serving with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.

Mix the Miracle Whip and tarragon vinegar first. Then add the sugar and mix thoroughly. Add the onion and mix again. Add the carrots and mix thoroughly. Add the cabbage and mix until all veggies are coated. Refrigerate before serving.

Combine dressing ingredientschill. Cut up the turkey bacon, chop the onions. Arrange the lettuce leaves on a platter. Place the bacon pieces and the onions on the platter. Sprinkle the cheese over top. Pour the dressing over top. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Brown the pork chops with salt and pepper. Set aside. In a skillet, heat oil and add chopped onions. Saut& until translucent. Add broth and bring to a boil. Add cornstarch mixed with water and stir. Add pork chops and cover. Simmer until tender. Serve over cooked rice.

Wash the beans and soak over night. In the morning drain and put in the slow cooker and add 4-5 cups of water and add the other ingredients. Set the slow cooker on high for 6-7 hours. Check the beans for doneness. If it is not as thick as you like add more beans or liquid. When done serve with tortillas.
Mix shrimp, jalapeno, garlic and olive oil in medium bowl. Heat oil in skillet and saute until pink. Remove from heat and pour in chambord. Pour mixture over bread slices and serve.

Slice eggs in half lengthwise. Remove yolks to small bowl. Mash yolks with a fork. In a separate small bowl, whisk mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar, and prepared mustard until smooth. Mix into mashed yolks and stir to blend well. Stuff or pipe yolk mixture into egg white halves. Sprinkle with paprika and minced parsley as desired.

Combine corn and milk in a blender and puree until smooth. Add eggs and salt. Cook over low heat in a double boiler. Stir frequently. Once mixture has thickened, remove from heat. In a pan, heat the butter over medium heat. Add the onions and the serranos and saute until translucent. Remove from heat. Add the mixture to the corn puree. In a skillet heat the butter over medium heat and saute the corn puree and the sauteed mixture until slightly browned. Top with cotija cheese before serving.

Cream butter and sugars together. Beat in egg. Add cherry juice and orange extract. Beat well. Combine flour, baking powder and saltadd to creamed mixture and mix well. Chill until easy to handle. Shape into 1-inch balls. Roll in flaked coconut. Place 2 inches apart on greased baking sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool for 1 minute before removing from pans to wire racks. Let cool completely. Store tightly covered.
Saute carrots, celery, onion, and garlic in 2 tbsp sesame oil until onions are soft. Add rice, ham, peas, 2 eggs, and soy sauce and stir over medium heat until well blended and heated through.

Cut the meat into serving size portions. Dredge in the flour and brown in the oil. Remove the meat and set aside. Cook the vegetables in the oil left in the pan until tender. Add the diced tomatoes. Stir well. Add the meat to the vegetables and stir. Add the seasoning. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 1 hour or until meat is tender. Serve over rice or noodles.

Peel grapefruit. Cut into segments. Combine 1 cup of water with the honey. In a blender or food processor, combine the grapefruit segments with the honey mixture until smooth. Place the mixture in the refrigerator until chilled, about 1 hour. Once chilled, transfer the mixture into a plastic container. Add the coconut extract and the low-fat plain yogurt. Stir until combined. Next, stir in the crushed pineapple with the juice. Pour the mixture into an ice pop maker mold and freeze until set, about 3 hours. Remove from the mold. Garnish with a mint leaf if desired.

crush the crackers. Melt butter in saucepan. Add the crushed crackers and the poppyseed. Saute about 5 minutes. Add the cream of chicken soup. Add the cooked chicken. Bring to a boil and remove from heat. Add the sour cream. Serve over rice. Serve with a green salad.
In a medium bowl combine pumpkin puree with the coconut milk and Thai Red Curry Paste. Add the maple syrup and butter. Cook over low heat until heated through. Add salt to taste. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place a baking sheet in oven to heat. Slice off a thin slice from the bottom of each tomato to make it flat. Mix sugar with basil, salt & pepper in a bowl. Add a tsp of soft breadcrumbs to each slice of tomato. Place on heated baking sheet and place in oven for 2 minutes. Add blue cheese on top of each slice. Broil for 2 minutes more, or until cheese has melted.

Cut the meat across the grain into 1/4 inch pieces. Place meat in a large saucepan or Dutch oven. Cover with broth and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to a simmer, cover, and cook until meat is tender, about 1 to 11/2 hours. Transfer meat to a cutting board and pull apart with 2 forks. Stir in vegetables and parsley and cook until vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes. Serve hot.

Brown ground beef and onion in a large skillet. Add refried beans and green chilies. Cook for 10 minutes. In a small bowl combine 1 can of enchilada sauce with 1 can of chili with beans. Spoon about 2 tablespoons of meat mixture on each of 6 corn tortillas. Roll up. Place in 9 x 13 baking pan. Spoon enchilada sauce mixture over tortillas. Sprinkle with olives and top with cheese. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes.

In a large bowl, stir together milk, cornstarch, and salt until smooth. Microwave on high for 3 minutes. Stir well and microwave an additional 3 minutes or until very thick. Stir in vanilla and butter. Serve warm or cool.

Melt 1 Tablespoon butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the broccoli florets and cook for about 5 minutes or until the broccoli is tender. Turn off heat. Add 2 Tablespoons milk and the dried onion flakes and stir well. Add the cooked rice and cook over low heat for 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in the remaining milk. Combine the rice mixture, 2 cups milk and the cheddar cheese in a casserole dish. Stir until smooth. In a small bowl combine the melted butter and the flour. Mix well. Sprinkle over the top of the rice mixture. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Serve hot.
Mix together chicken, sauce, and seasoning mix. Heat in microwave for 5 minutes. Serve with burritos.
Mix all in a bowl, then bread chops in this mixture. Brown in butter in skillet.

Heat milk to 100 degrees F. Sprinkle yeast on top of milk and let sit until foamy, about 10 minutes. Combine flour and salt in a large bowlstir in yeast mixture and eggs until combined. Pour into a greased 9-inch tube pan or 10-inch tube pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 55 minutes or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on wire rack. Meanwhile, prepare icingcombine butter, powdered sugar, and lemon juice in a small bowlstir in enough milk for desired consistency. Spread over top of cakesprinkle with almonds and lemon zest.
Dice onion. Add breadcrumbs and savory to onion. Add butter to melt. Add moose heart, cook to brown. Salt and pepper to taste.

Combine seasoning mix and water in large bowl. Add beef. Toss until coated. Shape into 2-inch balls. In skillet or Dutch oven over medium heat, brown meatballs in oil. Add remaining ingredients. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Simmer uncovered for 20 minutes. Stir in cheese. Serve over spaghetti or rice.
