Cook pasta as directed. Melt butter over low heat. Add half-and-half. Stir until smooth. Add cheese. Cook over low heat until cheese is melted. Serve immediately. Add salt and pepper to taste.

Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the apples and cinnamoncook for 5 minutes or until the apples are tender. Stir in the noodles and the brown sugarcook and stir for 1 minute more. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line baking sheet with parchment paper and spray with nonstick cooking spray. In medium bowl combine graham cracker crumbs, butter and sugar and mix well. Press crumb mixture into bottom of baking sheet to form a crust. Bake for 5 minutes. Remove from oven and evenly sprinkle with semi-sweet chips. Bake until chips are melted and crust is golden brown, about 2 to 3 minutes longer. Cool completely. In medium bowl combine heavy cream and marshmallow cream and stir until smooth. Add in remaining ingredients and stir until well blended and smooth. Pour mixture over baked crust and spread evenly to cover. Freeze until set, at least 4 hours or overnight. To serve, remove from pan using parchment paper and cut into 12 pops. Dip bottom of each pop in chocolate sprinkles and insert popsicle stick into each pop. Makes 12.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Lightly brush baguette slices with olive oil. Top each slice with 1 teaspoon cream cheese and a sprinkling of dill. Bake until lightly browned. Meanwhile, combine horseradish with 1/4 teaspoon of salt in a small bowl. Top each baguette slice with 1 teaspoon horseradish sauce and top with 1 teaspoon smoked salmon. Sprinkle with remaining 1/8 teaspoon salt.
Soak veggies in vinegar and water overnight in fridge. Grill onions and zucchini. Grill onions and zucchini. Grill potatoes and squash. Drizzle with dressing and serve.

Grease two loaf pans, 9 x 4 x 2 1/2 inches or 2 pound coffee cans with oil. Combine all ingredients. Pour into pans and bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until wooden pick comes out clean. Cool in pan and then remove bread and wrap in plastic wrap.

In a double boiler over hot water, whisk together egg yolks and sugar until thickened. Slowly add in milk. Add in gelatin and stir until dissolved. Add in cold water and stir until gelatin is dissolved. Set aside. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Add in 1/4 of egg whites to gelatin mixture and fold in. Add in remaining egg whites and fold in until completely incorporated. Pour into 2 greased 9x13-inch pans and refrigerate until firm. Fold in whipped topping and spread over top. Garnish with graham crackers.
There are no reviews written about Grahams.

Beat together eggs, flour, crushed red pepper flakes, chili powder, paprika and 1 tsp of the salt in a shallow dish. Dip the chicken pieces in the egg mixture, coating evenly, and then dip into the rice crispies. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add chicken and cook about 5 minutes per side or until done, turning once. Drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 tsp of the salt. Serve with spicy mayonnaise.

In a saucepan, combine water and butter. Bring to boil on medium-high heat. Remove from heat. Add flour and stir with a wire whisk until smooth. Return to medium-high heat and cook for 3 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in sugar, coffee, and cocoa. Beat for 2 minutes with electric mixer until thick. Add egg. Beat until well blended. Stir in hazelnuts. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour or until firm enough to roll. On wax paper, roll dough into 1/2 inch balls. Melt chocolate in double boiler or in microwave-safe bowl. Dip balls in melted chocolate and place on wax paper to cool.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees f (190 degrees c). Grease and flour two 9 inch round baking pans, or line with parchment paper, and grease and flour the paper. In a bowl, combine the flour and baking soda. Beat the butter and both sugars with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in the flour mixture until just incorporated. Stir in the orange peel. Pour the batter into the prepared pans and bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until lightly browned and the center springs back when lightly touched. Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes before removing from the pans and cooling completely on the rack. Melt the chocolate chips with the shortening over low heat, stirring constantly until smooth. Drizzle the warm chocolate over the cooled cookies and allow to cool and set completely before serving.
The best chocolate chip cookie is the one that is right in front of you

Cream margarine and sugars until light and fluffy. Mix in peanut butter and syrup. Add egg yolk and mix well. Sift together remaining ingredients. Gradually add to creamed mixture and mix well. Roll into 1 inch balls and place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool and roll in powdered sugar.

Melt 1 cup of the chocolate chips in a medium size pot over low heat stirring constantly until smooth. Beat the tofu until smooth and then add the maple syrup and the other cup of chocolate chips and blend well. Spread evenly into the prepared crust and refrigerate for 2 hours. Serve with fresh whipped cream and garnish with remaining tofu and the remaining 3/4 cup of the chocolate chips.

In a bowl, combine syrup, ketchup, mustard, ginger and red pepper. Place in a shallow baking dish and add the wings. Cover and refrigerate 4 hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Remove the wings from the marinade and bake in the preheated oven until browned and tender, 45 minutes to 1 hour.
These look delicious! I love chicken wings!
My kids love chicken wings! Thanks for sharing the recipes!
I love chicken wings but never had it grilled before!
i love chicken wings! thanks for sharing the recipes!
I love them too. I need to make them soon!
I love love love love love wings! Thanks for this recipes!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine all dry ingredients in a large bowl. Mix together yogurt, agave nectar and egg. Add to dry ingredients. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto a parchment lined cookie sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Remove from oven and cool on a wire rack. Store in an airtight container. Makes 12 large cookies.

Cream together butter and marmalade. Beat in eggs until thick and smooth. Add sour cream and beat until smooth. Stir in dry ingredients until blended. Stir in vanilla. Spoon into muffin cups and bake for 30 minutes at 350F. Makes about 15 muffins.

In a 6-cup percolator, place one teaspoon of raspberry extract in the filter basket. Add 8 to 10 scoops of Splenda Brown Sugar Blend (about 2 tablespoons) to the filter basket. Place a single serving of Splenda in a separate packet in each percolator cup. In a large measuring pitcher or a coffee carafe, combine 1 quart of water and 4 tablespoons Splenda Brown Sugar Blend. Add coffee grounds and stir until they are completely moistened. Set percolator on the stove. Pour about 4 tablespoons of water into each percolator cup. Fill percolator to the top with water and stir. Set percolator to a low boil and let coffee percolate for about 4 to 5 minutes or until it has reached your desired strength. If you do not have a percolator, you can also use a small saucepan and make a half pot of coffee. Add 1 quart of water to a small saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat. Once boiling, add 4 tablespoons of S

Heat the butter in a frying pan and add the mushrooms. Saute lightly for 1 minute. Add the plum sauce to the pan and bring to the boil. Add the ginger and the soy sauce and stir to combine well. Drain the tuna steaks and rub with the vegetable oil and peppercorns. Sear on each side for 3 minutes or until just cooked through. Add the mushroom sauce and let stand for 1 minute before serving.

Wash and scrub the shrimp well and remove the intestines. Cut each shrimp into 3-4 pieces. In a medium bowl, combine the shrimp with the remaining ingredients. Refrigerate 1 hour or more to marinate the shrimp. Thread the shrimp pieces onto skewers and grill over medium heat for 2-3 minutes per side or until the shrimp turns pink and is cooked through. Serve warm with rice and a dipping sauce (see below).

Mash the boiled eggs. Add the seasoning salt, chopped green onions and stuffed olives. Mix well and add the mayonnaise and ground black pepper. If desired add a dash of cayenne pepper. Toast the bread. Spread with mayonnaise and arrange the lettuce, tomatoes and the egg salad. Makes two sandwiches.
Mix cream cheese & meat in bowl. Spread in 13 x 9 baking dish. Mix green onion & jelly & sprinkle over meat mixture. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until bubbly. Serve with crackers.

Wash the potatoes, cut them in half and put in a pot of cold water over high heat. Boil until done. Drain the water and mash the potatoes in a bowl or food processor until smooth. Add fat, salt and pepper. Add heavy whipping cream until you get the desired consistency. Add more milk if needed. Stir well. Heat on low if desired.

In crock pot, combine the olive oil with the carrot, celery, dried rosemary, and salt and pepper to taste. Arrange the chicken over the vegetables. Add the beans to the crock pot. Combine the salad dressing with the water in a small bowl. Pour over the chicken. Cover crock pot and cook 6-7 hours.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 2 baking sheetsset aside. Combine flour, baking soda and salt in a small bowlset aside. Beat together the brown sugar, butter and vanilla until light and fluffy. Beat in egg until well blended. Gradually add the flour mixture into the brown sugar mixture until well blended. Stir in the chopped pecans and chocolate pieces until blended. Drop by teaspoons onto the baking sheets. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown. Remove from oven and place on wire wracks to cool for a few minutes. Let cool completely on the baking sheets before transferring to wire wracks to cool completely. Makes about 3 dozen 1-inch cookies.

In a small bowl combine the first 5 ingredients. Mix well. Form into 4 patties. In a skillet combine 1/2 cup water and the remaining ingredients except the butter. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes. Place patties in the skillet and simmer 15 minutes. Turn patties over and simmer 10 minutes more or until patties are done. Remove patties and keep warm. Combine the butter and flour until smooth. Gradually add the remaining liquid. Cook and stir until thickened. Spoon over the patties. Serves 4.

Place the dates into a bowl and add the boiling water, cover with clingfilm and leave for at least 1 hour until they are soft. Meanwhile peel apples, remove cores and chop finely into the bowl of the food processor. Add the butter and caster sugar and blend together until smooth. Add the ginger, ground ginger and the egg and blend again until smooth. Drain the dates and add these plus the self-raising flour into the processor. Blend together until smooth. Pour the mixture into a greased and lined loaf tin and smooth the surface. Bake in a pre-heated oven at 180C/fan 160C/gas mark 4 for approximately 1 hour or until cooked through (insert a skewer into the middle of the cake - if it comes out clean it is ready). Cool in the tin for at least 10 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack.

Spread mayonnaise on the bottom slice of bread. On top of the mayonnaise layer the hass avocado and the grilled chicken breasts. Then layer the tomato slices. Add the monterey jack cheese slices on top of the tomato slices. Finish with the top slice of the ciabatta bread. Serve.

Place apples and water in a medium saucepanbring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to mediumcook for 4 minutes or until apples are soft and tender. Mash apples with a fork or potato masher to desired consistency. Stir in sugarcook for 2 minutes or until sugar has dissolved. Remove from heat. Add milk, eggs, flour, salt, and nutmegmix well. Pour into a greased pie plate or casserole dishbake for 1 hour or until set. Cool for 10 minutesserve warm or at room temperature.

Combine dry ingredients. Add milk and melted butter. Mix well. Beat egg and add to batter. Fold in raisins. Spread into 10 inch pie pan or tube pan. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven for 30 minutes. While warm, sprinkle with cinnamon. Serve warm. Cool on wire rack.

Peel and cut the potatoes into bite size chunks. Place them in a large sauce pan with enough cold water to cover them by about an inch. Bring the water to a boil and reduce the heat to simmer. Cover the pan. And let the potatoes cook for 20 minutes. Remove from the heat and drain the water. Put the potatoes back in the sauce pan and mash them with the mayonnaise and the cheese. Add the onion. And season to taste.

Grease and flour 2 - 8 x8 inch square pans. Beat the egg white until foamy. Add the rest of the ingredients and beat until blended. Stir in the nuts and apples. Pour into the pans and bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until done. Cool on a wire rack for a few minutes then remove from pans and cool completely before frosting.
Combine ice cream and cherries. Fold in nuts and spread into crumb crust. Top with whipped topping.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Brown ground beef in skillet. Add drained beans in chili sauce and crushed tomatoes. Add chili powder and cook 10 minutes. Add water. Cover and cook until pasta is tender. Stir in cheese.

In a small bowl combine butter with instant coffee powder and lemon juice. Season with sea salt and onion powder to taste. Brush the mixture over catfish fillets. Grill or broil for about 5 minutes per side or until the fish is done. Serve warm with rice pilaf or pasta salad.

Bring 4 quarts water to boil in large pot. Add salt to taste. Meanwhile, fry bacon in large skillet over medium heat until crispdrain on paper towels. Reserve 1 tbsp of drippings. Whisk eggs and reserved bacon drippings in large bowl to blend. In medium saucepan over medium heat, heat remaining drippings until very hot but not smokingpour in egg mixturestir constantly with wooden spoon until eggs are scrambled and mixture is very thick. Stir in 2 c of the cheesestir over low heat until cheese melts. Stir in remaining cheesecontinue to stir until thoroughly mixed. Drain the cooked pastafold into egg mixturetoss to coat well. Transfer to a large serving bowlsprinkle with bacon bits and remaining cheese. Serve immediately.
Place all in blender and blend.
Combine ingredients, except for the celery, in a pitcher. Add ice and mix well. Pour into 6 glasses. Place a celery stalk in each glass. Serve.

Cut sirloin steak into bite-sized pieces. In large skillet over high heat, brown the pieces of steak until cooked to medium-rare. Drain and set aside. In the same pan, saute garlic in the remaining oil until lightly browned. Add the remaining vegetables and cook until tender-crisp. Stir in the soy sauce and oyster sauce. Add the steak and the stock, bring to a boil and simmer for 3 to 5 minutes or until the liquid has reduced. Add the tomatoes to the skillet and heat through. Serve over rice or noodles topped with the green onions.

Grease a 2 quart casserole or baking dish with butter. Cut each banana in half lengthwise. Place bananas cut side down in the dish. Combine cinnamon, butter, coconut, coconut milk and brown sugar in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil stirring constantly, then remove from heat. Pour over bananas. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until tender when pierced.

Boil pasta. While it cooks, heat olive oil in saucepan. Saute garlic until it turns light brown. Add lemon rind and saute for 2 minutes. Add heavy cream and bring to boil. Add tomatoes and let boil for 2 minutes. Add freshly ground black pepper and lemon juice. Cook for 2 minutes more. Drain pasta and add to tomato mixture. Add parsley. Add parmesan cheese.

Prepare macaroni & cheese according to package directions. In 12" skillet heat 1 Tbsp. butter and add ground beef. Cook until no longer pink. Stir in taco seasoning. Add diced tomatoes, corn & white onion. Cook 3 minutes. In small bowl mix remaining 2 Tbsp. butter with milk. Stir into meat mixture. Add celery & continue cooking until heated through. Stir in sour cream. Top with shredded cheese. Bake at 350* for 20 minutes. Serves 8.

Preheat grill to high heat. In a small bowl, combine teriyaki and garlic. In a resealable bag, combine the teriyaki mixture and the chicken. Seal and shake to coat. Grill the pita bread rounds until lightly toasted and slightly charred. Spray the rounds with cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine the romaine lettuce leaves and tomatoes. Add the bean sprouts. Place a pita round on the bottom of each lettuce cup. Top with the grilled chicken. Drizzle with the remaining teriyaki mixture. Serve immediately.
name: orange teriyaki chickeningredients: vegetable oil, boneless skinless chicken breast, frozen vegetables, quick-cooking tapioca, chicken stock, orange marmalade, teriyaki sauce, dry mustard, ground gingerpreparation:In a skillet, heat oil to medium-high heat. Add chicken and brown. Put chicken in crockpot. Add frozen vegetables and tapioca. Mix well. In a small bowl, mix all remaining ing

Heat a griddle or skillet over medium heat. Butter one side of each slice of bread. Place 2 slices of cheese onto one side of each slice of bread. Put the apple butter on the other side of each slice of bread. Cook sandwiches until cheese is melted and sides of bread are golden brown. Cut sandwiches into 4 triangles. Serve warm.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until golden. Add rice. Cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add 1 cup chicken stock, bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover, and cook 15 minutes. Uncoveradd remaining cup stock. Simmer until liquid is absorbed. Stir in pine nuts.

Line a 9 x 13 inch pan with lettuce leaves. Arrange oranges and apples over lettuce. Top with grapes. In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise, sour cream and cheese. Spread over salad. Refrigerate overnight. Serve chilled.

Combine ingredients in a large punch bowl. Add ice. Serve with straws. Garnish with lime slice. Serves 10.
Margaritas are traditionally served in highball glasses that are rimmed in salt. Margaritas are also often served with a slice of lime on the side.
To make the margaritas, fill the shaker with ice cubes. Add the tequila, Triple Sec, lime juice, Cointreau and margarita mix. Shake well.
To make the spicy pineapple margaritas, mix the salt and chili powder on a small plate. Rub the rims of four martini glasses with the lime wedge, then dip the rims in the salt mixture to coat.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice, and add all of the remaining ingredients. Shake vigorously, then strain into glasses. Serve immediately.
To make the margarita limeade on the rocks, rub rim of cocktail glass with lime, rub rim of glass in margarita salt.
Combine limeade,

Season the chicken pieces with salt and pepper. Melt the butter in a skillet or saute pan over medium high heat. Add the chicken breasts and brown them on both sides. Add the onions, green peppers and mushrooms. Cook until the vegetables are tender. Add the broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat. Cover the skillet or pan, simmer for 10 to 15 minutes until the chicken is tender. Stir in the whipping cream. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until the mixture is heated through. Stir in the sherry and mustard. Taste for seasoning. Serve over cooked noodles or rice or a baked potato.

Boil potatoes in water until done. In a large pot saut vegetables and ham in skillet. Drain potatoes and add to vegetables and ham. Combine chicken broth and fat free cream cheese and mix well. Pour over potatoes and vegetables and heat thoroughly. Add skim milk to thin. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Rinse the cauliflower and cut into florets. Place the florets into an oven proof dish and drizzle with the oil. Bake for 30 minutes or until tender. When the cauliflower is done, place it into a food processor or blender and add the vegan cream cheese, nutritional yeast, garlic, broth and black pepper. Blend until smooth. Stir in the chives. Serve immediately or keep warm on the stove until ready to serve.

Preheat the broiler. Place fish in a shallow dish. In another shallow dish, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, garlic and lemon zest. Brush both sides of the fish with the lemon mixture. Broil 4 to 5 inches from the heat until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork (5 to 7 minutes per inch). In a small bowl, combine sun-dried tomatoes and basil. Drizzle with capers and set aside. Arrange tomato mixture over fish and serve.

Mix together in large bowl 1 pound broccoli florets, 1 can diced red peppers, 1 can cream of mushroom soup, 1 cup milk and 1 cup shredded sharp cheddar cheese. Pour into a greased 9 by 13 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes. Sprinkle with french-fried onions. Serves 6.

In a food processor combine the egg yolk, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, and garlic. Process until smooth and creamy. Slowly add the olive oil in a steady stream while the processor is running. Once all the olive oil has been added, continue to process the mixture until it reaches a light and fluffy texture. If the mixture becomes too thick before you are ready to use it, you may add a little more olive oil. Add the vegetable oil and process for another 30 seconds. Transfer to a storage container and refrigerate for up to 3 days. You can make this up to 1 day ahead of time. Serve with chips or over grilled meats.

Heat oil. Add cumin seeds and allow them to splutter. Add onion and fry till brown. Add ginger and garlic and fry for about 2 minutes. Add the chopped chillies and fry for 30 seconds. Add the turmeric and stir. Add the tomatoes and cook for 10 minutes. Add the coriander leaves and stir. Add the panir and cook till the paneer is completely cooked. Serve hot.
Prepare the turkey. In a bowl combine all the remaining ingredients. Dip the cutlets in the mixture. Place in baking dish and bake for 20 minutes at 350. Serve with your favorite pasta.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a cookie sheet with foil. Place a pizza crust in the center. Top the crust evenly with the pastrami, sauerkraut and cheese. Combine dressing with mayonnaise. Brush evenly over the crust. Sprinkle with the salt. Bake for 18 to 20 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes before cutting. Serve warm.
Mix all the ingredients together. Pour into a large cookie sheet. Chill until firm. Slice into egg shapes. Melt paraffin wax and pour over eggs. Decorate with chips. Chill until wax is set.

Preheat oven to 350°F. Cut bread into 1/2-inch cubesplace in small bowl. Beat with fork until crumbs form. In 9-inch pie plate, combine bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese, parsley, lemon zest, and salt. In shallow bowl, combine mayonnaise, lemon juice, and water. Dip each chicken breast into mayonnaise mixturethen coat with bread crumb mixture. Place in single layer in pie plate. Bake 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Serve immediately.
Beat egg and mix in onion and bacon. Fill tortilla and sprinkle with cheese on top and bake in oven.

In a medium bowl, combine pineapple, jalapeno, cilantro, and a pinch of salt and pepper. In a skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Add shrimp. Cook until pink. Stir in curry powder and cook until fragrant. Add the pineapple mixture. Cook 1 minute. Season with salt. Serve over rice.
Sprinkle roast with garlic and onion powders. Season with salt and pepper. Cover with water. Add barbecue sauce. Cook 4-5 hours. Slice into thin strips. Serve over hot white rice.

Combine the first 4 ingredients in a medium bowlmix well. Stir in the oatmeal, the next 4 ingredients, and the egg until combined. Stir in the flour until just blended. Pour into a greased 9-inch square pan. Bake at 350F for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes in the pan on a wire rack. Cut into 4 squares. Serve warm.

In a medium saucepan over low heat, combine broth and salsa. Add orange rind, cook 3 minutes. Add frozen corn. Heat through. In a bowl combine evaporated milk and cornstarch. Add milk mixture to salsa mixture and stir until blended. Add tortellini. Cook 1 minute. Stir in cilantro.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Crumble pitas into a bowl. Add ground cumin, salt, and paprika. Mix well. Pour olive oil into the bowl and stir until the mixture is evenly coated with oil. Spread mixture evenly onto two baking sheets. Bake for about 30 minutes. Remove from the oven, allow to cool, and store in an air-tight container. Makes approximately 20 crisps.

Prepare the crusts as directed on the box. Prepare the pizza sauce as directed on the jar. Prepare the meatballs according to package directions. Top each crust with half of the pizza sauce. Top each crust with the cheese. Top each crust with half of the meatballs. Top each crust with the remaining pizza sauce. Bake according to package directions. Enjoy.

Peel and dice the rutabaga and onion. Sauté with the oil until the onion is translucent. Remove from heat and add the bacon drippings. Cool slightly. Add the apples and seasoning. Add the nutmeg last for color. Serve hot.

Prepare liquid pectin according to package directions. Wash plums and remove stones. Cut plums into small pieces. Peel oranges. Remove as much white rind as possible. Slice orange. Measure liquid from orange. Measure plums and orange. Add 1/2 cup sugar to fruit. Cook in microwave 3 minutes. Stir. Cook 3 more minutes. Stir. Add lemon juice. Stir. Add remaining 1 cup sugar. Cook 3 minutes more or until done. Remove from microwave. Stir. Add liquid from orange. Stir. Cook 1 minute more or until done. Cool. Store in refrigerator. Makes about 6 cups.

Preheat oven to 400. In a shallow dish, mix oil and broccoli soup. Place each chicken breast into the mixture. Bake for 30 minutes or until juices run clear. Uncover and sprinkle with cheese. Bake 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with rice.
The recipes in this book were compiled by a group of senior citizens in the state of Iowa. They are recipes that they have enjoyed cooking for their families over the years. These recipes are from their heart and their homes.

Mix first 5 ingredients. Shape into burgers. Cook and brown burgers. Remove from heat. Add sausage links. Cook 2 minutes on each side or until done. Serve on buns with lettuce, tomato slices.

In a heavy pot melt the butter and add the heavy whipping cream. Stirring constantly bring to a boil. Add the nutmeg and the salt & pepper to taste. Remove from the heat and add the grated parmesan cheese. Stir well and serve over your favorite pasta.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix eggs with sugar until pale yellow. Add coconut milk, salt and green food coloring. Sift together flour and baking powder. Add the flour mixture to the liquid ingredients and beat until well blended. Pour into muffin tins lined with paper cases and bake for 20-25 minutes. Remove from oven and allow cupcakes to stand for 5 minutes before removing from molds. Dust with desiccated coconut. Serve with sweetened condensed milk.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease a 13x9x2-inch baking dish. Cut bread into 2-inch cubes. In a large bowl, place bread cubespour milk over cubeslet stand 10 minutes or until bread is soaked. In a medium bowl, beat eggs with an electric mixer on medium speed until well blendedadd sugar, vanilla, butter, and cinnamonbeat until well blended. Drain cubes, reserving liquidstir reserved liquid into egg mixtureset aside. In a small bowl, beat cream with an electric mixer on medium speed until soft peaks formset aside in refrigerator. In another small bowl, melt white chocolate in the microwave on medium for 1 minutestir until smoothset aside to cool. In a large bowl, toss bread mixture with egg mixture. Spread in prepared baking dishbake for 40 minutes or until set. Remove from ovendrizzle brandy mixture over top of bread. Place in refrigerator until chilled

Bring water to boil in medium saucepan. Add polenta and cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, until tender and creamy. Stir in spaghetti sauce and half of the water from cooked polenta. Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature. Spread the mixture onto a baking sheet. Sprinkle with mushrooms and remaining water. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes. Stir in garlic and nutritional yeast. Bake for another 5 minutes.

Cook sausage until brown. Add evaporated milk and cook until mixture is thickened. Add eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Pour into greased casserole dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes, or until well set. Garnish with red pepper strips and green onions. Serve with italian bread.

Brown pork chops in a large skillet. Add the onions and saute until soft and transparent. Add the remaining ingredients and simmer for 1 hour. Serve over rice.
Whisk together all ingredients in a bowl until emulsified. Toss with cucumbers just before serving.

Mix sugar, margarine and milk in saucepan over low heat. Cook until bubbly. Add peanut butter and vanilla. Mix well. Stir in oatmeal until thoroughly combined. Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper. Allow to cool before removing from wax paper.

Peel and pit the peaches and cut them into cubes. Combine the wine and sugar in a medium saucepan. Heat to boiling and add the peaches and the lemon. Let cook for about 10 minutes. Cool and then refrigerate over night. To serve, combine the wine mixture with the champagne and add ice to serve.

Cook noodles in boiling water for 5 min until tender, drain. Melt 1/2 stick of butter in skillet over medium heat. Add flour to melted butter and stir constantly for 1 min until roux turns brown. Gradually add 1 cup of the milk while stirring constantly to avoid lumps. Stir in soup, chicken broth & seasonings. Add the remaining 1 cup of milk. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat & simmer for 1 min, stirring constantly. Add cooked noodles & stir until well blended with the cream soup mixture. Pour mixture into a greased 13 x 9 inch casserole dish. Sprinkle with french-fried onions & sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 for 30 min until bubbly.
Mix together all ingredients in large bowl. Drop onto waxed paper by teaspoons. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes or until done.

Prepare the dough according to package instructions. Roll out the dough into a rectangle approximately 10″ x 12″. Brush the entire dough with butter. Sprinkle with garlic salt and parmesan cheese. Roll up from the long side and slice into 1″ thick slices. Bake in a pre-heated 400f oven for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown.

Place breadcrumbs in plastic bag. Add mustard and cayenne pepper. Shake until well mixed. Coat chops in mustard bread crumb mixture. Spray cooking spray over chops to coat. Place in air fryer. Set timer for 15 minutes. Flip over. Set timer for 15 minutes more. Serve.

Place the cinnamon stick into the milkcover the pot and let it sit for five minutes. Add the couscous to the heated milkstir, cover, and let it sit for five minutes. Add the fruit bits and nuts. Cook over medium heat until the mixture begins to thickenstir often. Serve warm.

Place the lamb steaks between 2 sheets of waxed paper. Pound gently with a heavy skillet or mallet until about 1/2 inch thick. Combine garlic, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Place flour in a large shallow dish. Beat eggs in a shallow bowl. Combine bread crumbs, parsley and pepper in a shallow dish. Dip each lamb steak in flour then in egg and then in bread crumbs. Place in hot shortening in a skillet until browned. Drain and serve with your favorite sauce or gravy.

Spread each slice of bread with a thin layer of mayonnaise. Place one slice of cheese on each slice of bread. Arrange 2 slices of ham on top of each piece of cheese. Sprinkle with chopped onion. Sprinkle with lemon juice to taste. Sprinkle with hot pepper sauce to taste. Roll up each slice of bread and slice into 4 bites.
name: creamy ham and eggsingredients: butter, flour, dry mustard, salt, pepper, milk, cooked ham, hardboiled egg, toastpreparation: melt butter in a large saucepan. stir in flour and seasonings till smooth and bubbling. stir in milk stirring constantly, till thick and bubbly. stir in ham and eggs. heat till hot. serve on toast.
name: mustard ham sauceingredients: sugar, flour, eggs, prepared mustard, vinegar, beef bouillon, butterpreparation: stir flour and sugar together. add eggs and mix well. add remaining ingredients. cook over low heat, stirring constantly

Spread a little of the miracle whip on one slice of the bread. Place a slice of chicken on top. Spread another layer of miracle whip on another slice of the bread. Place a slice of american cheese on top. Layer a little lettuce on top. Sprinkle some basil on top. Add a few fresh tomato slices and crisp bacon. Top with another slice of american cheese. Spread another layer of miracle whip on a slice of bread. Place that slice on top. Spread a little more miracle whip on a slice of bread. Place that slice on top. Cut each sandwich into four triangles. Secure each with a wooden pick.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Pulse wafer cookies in a food processor until they resemble fine crumbs. Add sugar and butter, and pulse again until crumbs are moistened. Transfer to a 9-inch pie plate. Press the crumb mixture into the bottom and up the sides of the pie plate. Bake in the preheated oven for 5 minutes. Remove from oven. Set aside. In a small bowl, whisk together the heavy cream with the bittersweet chocolate and rum. Allow to cool to room temperature. Beat the whipping cream with the heavy whipping cream until stiff peaks form. Fold the whipped cream into the chocolate mixture. Spoon the mixture into the tart shell. Refrigerate for 2 hours.

Slice the bread into 1/2-inch slices and lay out in a 9 x 13 cake pan. In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk and seasonings. Heat the butter in a skillet over medium heat until hot and melted. Pour the egg mixture over the bread slices. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until the eggs are set. Sprinkle with the shredded cheese. Top with the ham. Bake for another 5 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl combine flour and salt. Roll ribs in the flour and shake off excess. Heat the oil and fat in a wok until very hot. Add the ribs and quickly brown on all sides. Add the garlic and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add the remaining ingredients and bring to the boil. Simmer uncovered for 15 minutes or until the meat is tender. Add the lemon juice and stir-fry for 1 more minute. Serve with steamed rice.

Melt butter in a saute pan and add the chopped onions. When onions are transparent add the squash and cook for about five minutes or until tender. Blend soup and water in a small saucepan. Pour over the vegetables and cook over medium heat for about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and add the green chili. Stir to combine. Spread into a 1 quart casserole dish. Top with breadcrumbs. Bake at 375 degrees for 20 minutes.

Bring water to boil, add jasmine tea, cover and steep for 4 minutes. Add the mint leaves and steep for another minute or two. Add lemon juice and honey to taste. Strain and chill. Serve over ice and garnish with more mint leaves and/or slices of lemon.

In a medium saucepan cook bacon until crisp. Remove from pan with slotted spoonreserve 1 tbsp. of the fat. Saute onion in reserved fat for 3 minutes or until softened. Add potatocook and stir for 3 minutes or until the mixture is slightly softened. Stir in the creamed corn and evaporated milkbring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 5 minutes or until the potato is tender. Stir in the reserved bacon. Add the sugar, salt and pepperstir to combine. Serve warm.

In medium bowl, combine berries and 1/3 cup sugarset aside.In a saucepan over medium heat combine remaining 1 cup sugar and remaining 1 cup condensed milk. Bring to a boil, stirring frequently until sugar is dissolved and mixture is a light brown color (about 10 minutes). Remove from heatadd lemon juice and stir until completely mixed. Cool to room temperature.In a large bowl, beat heavy cream and vanilla until stiff peaks form. Add cooled custard mixturebeat until well combined. Pour into cooled pie crust. Garnish with reserved strawberries. Chill 4 hours or overnight before serving.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a large rimmed baking sheet with aluminum foil. Peel the sweet potatoes, then slice into 1/2-inch rounds. Lay the rounds in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Brush both sides with melted butter. Mix the honey, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, cloves and salt in a small bowl. Sprinkle the spice mixture over the sweet potatoes. Bake for about 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and stir the spice mixture evenly into the potatoes. Bake until the potatoes are soft when pierced with a knife, about 10 minutes longer. Top with almonds.

Melt marshmallows and add to milkmix well and bring to a simmer on low heat. Add the vanilla, salt and peppermint extract and cook until smoothremove from heat and stir in red food coloring. Chill for 1-2 hours before filling the crust. To assemble the pie, pour the mixture into the chilled pie shell and freeze overnight. Decorate the top of the pie by scattering the peppermint candies around and drizzling the melted white chocolate. Allow the white chocolate to set before cutting and serving.

In a skillet heat the sun-dried tomatoes in the oil over low heat until soft. In a large bowl beat the eggs. Add the sun-dried tomatoes, tabbouleh and season to taste with salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat in a non stick skillet until the eggs are just firm. Garnish with crumbled feta cheese and chopped oregano.

Dissolve yeast in warm water. Add 1/2 cup sugar. Let stand 10 minutes. Add evaporated milk and butter. Let stand 10 minutes. Add 1 egg. Beat until smooth. Add 2 cups flour and salt. Beat 2 minutes. Add remaining flour 1 cup at a time until dough is easy to handle. Turn onto floured board. Knead until smooth. Place in greased bowl. Cover and let rise in warm place until double in bulk. Roll out on floured board to 1/2 inch thickness. Cut with floured 2 1/2 inch round cutter. Place on greased baking sheet. Let rise in warm place until double in bulk. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Brush with melted butter. Bake 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from oven. Immediately place on wire rack to cool.

In small saucepan over low heat, melt together margarine and peanut butter. Stir in soy sauce. Add brown sugar, garlic powder, dry mustard and ground ginger. Remove from heat. Stir in toasted rice and pretzels. Spread on wax paper or parchment paper to cool. Mix in almonds. Store airtight. Makes about 2 pounds.

Rinse ribs and pat dry with paper towel. Rub with salt and pepper. In slow cooker add ribs, onions, apple juice and water. Mix dry ingredients together in separate bowl. Sprinkle over ribs. Cook on low for 8 hours. Take out of slow cooker, add barbecue sauce. Cook on high for 1 hour.

In a large saucepan, combine broth and onion. Bring to boilreduce heat. Cover and simmer 10 minutes. Stir in frozen chopped spinach and hot Italian sausage. Simmer 5 minutes or until heated through. Add fennel seed and parmesan cheese. Stir until cheese melts.

Combine the first 5 ingredients in a large mixing bowlstir well. Spoon into prepared crusts. Freeze 4 hours or overnight. Spread with frozen whipped topping before serving. Makes 4 pies.

Sauté the onion with the plums in the oil until the plums are tender but not mushy. Add the herbs and cook for 1 minute. Add the mushrooms and cook until tender. Add the spinach and cook until wilted. Season with the salt & pepper. Garnish with the sliced almonds. Serve hot or warm over couscous or rice. Serves 4.

Combine the pasta, onion, celery, garlic, spinach leaves and 3 cups chicken broth in a Dutch oven. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-lowcover and simmer 15 minutes. Stir in remaining 2 cups brothreturn to a boil. Add vinegar and the cheese. Stir until melted. Stir in the remaining 2 cups chicken broth. Heat throughdo not boil. Garnish with parsley. Serve immediately.

Mix together the garlic and chicken broth in a small bowl. Place each breast in a plastic bag and pour about 1/2 cup of the garlic and broth mixture over each breast. Seal the bags and marinate in the refrigerator for 2-4 hours. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place each breast on a broiler pan and place in oven. Cook for 15 minutes. Turn over and bake for another 15-20 minutes or until done. Serve with any of your favorite sides.

Peel nectarines. Cut into thick slices. Arrange in a baking dish. Combine sugar, lemon juice and butter. Spoon over nectarines. Bake at 375° F for 15 minutes. Cool slightly. Serve with vanilla ice cream and sliced almonds.

Spread 2 slices of rye rolls with onion and sweet pickle relish. Top with slices of cooked ham. Sprinkle with cheese. Spread with prepared mustard and mayonnaise. Top with remaining slices of rye rolls. Serves 4.

Soften cream cheese in bowl of mixer. Add garlic powder. Blend well. Add basil leaves. Blend until smooth. Add diced tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, olives, and chopped wheat thins. Blend well. Chill for 2 hours or over night. Serve with crackers or vegetables.

Cook fresh corn with water to cover in a large pot on the stove in a large pot until tender. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature. In a large bowl beat the eggs with the flour, sugar, and salt. Add the cooked corn, then add the milk (add more if needed to get a good consistency). Pour the mixture into a greased casserole dish. Bake for 1 hour at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) or until done. Serve warm or cold.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cut squash in half lengthwise. Remove seeds and place cut side down on a baking sheet. Bake in oven 30 to 40 minutes or until soft. Use fork to scrape out spaghetti-like strands. Heat butter in skillet over medium heat. Stir in squash and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve.

Cut tomatoes and cheese into small pieces and layer on individual salad plates. Top with sweet onions and sprinkle with oregano. In a small dish, blend the italian dressing and sweetener together. Pour over the salad and serve.

Cream together the butter with the brown sugar until creamy. Beat in the eggs until well blended. Beat in the vanilla. Combine the flour, baking powder, and saltstir into the creamed mixture. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375 for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on baking sheets for 2 minutesremove to wire racks to cool completely. Makes 3 dozen cookies

Combine the first 8 ingredients in a medium bowlcover and refrigerate overnight. Prepare the lettuce wraps by spreading the lettuce leaves evenly on a baking sheet coated with cooking sprayset aside. Spoon the bean mixture evenly onto the lettuce leavesroll up the lettuce leaves to form wrapscut each wrap diagonally in half. Serve immediately. Makes 12 wraps (2 per serving).
Halve the tomatoes. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil. Sprinkle with coarse salt. Top with fresh ground black pepper. Sprinkle with the lemon thyme. Serve immediately.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add shallots and cook until soft and beginning to brown. Add sugar and stir until caramelized. Add 1 tablespoon water and stir until sauce is thick and caramelized. Add fish sauce and water. Bring to a simmer and cook until reduced to a syrup. Season sauce with salt and fresh ground black pepper. Cut fillets into 1/2-inch slices. Place slices in a single layer in pan. Cook until slices are brown and firm. Transfer to serving dish. Garnish with scallions and cilantro. Serve with rice or noodles.

Mix together filling and spread in pie crust. Cover with gingersnap crumbs. Bake 50 minutes at 350 degrees. Let cool before serving.

Bring large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook for 10 minutes or until al dentedrain. Meanwhile heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in the onion and cook 5 minutes or until it begins to soften. Add bay leaf. Stir in the remaining 2 tablespoons of the broth to deglaze the pan. Stir in the chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-lowcook 10 minutes or until the onion is very tender. Stir in the crushed tomatoes, parsley, salt, pepper, and cooked pasta. Mix well. Serve immediately with shaved parmesan cheese.
Preheat the oven to 350°F. Toss all of the ingredients in a large bowl. Pour into a baking dish and bake for 20 minutes. Let cool for 20 minutes.

In blender, puree watermelon and powdered sugar till slushy. Add half of lemonade concentrate and half of water. Blend well. Add remaining lemonade concentrate and water and blend again. Pour into glasses and garnish with mint sprig.

In a large bowl combine avocados, cherry tomatoes, red onion, cilantro, red bell pepper & green bell pepper. Set aside. In a small bowl combine black beans, 1 tsp lime juice, 1 Tbsp. olive oil & 1/2 tsp. of salt & freshly ground black pepper. Add to bowl of fruit & veggies. Toss together. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve in 4 bowls & garnish with remaining lime.

In small bowl combine mustard, honey, lemon juice, paprika and cayenne pepperrub evenly over both sides of each chicken breast halfplace on baking sheetbake at 375 degrees F for 25 minutes or until chicken is done to your liking. Serve on a bed of spinach, topped with more lemon juice

Preheat oven to 400-degrees f. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Drizzle salmon and potato wedges with 1 tsp. oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for 30 minutes or until done. Meanwhile, in a small cup or bowl combine remaining 1 tsp. oil and roasted red pepper. Place potatoes and roasted red peppers into a food processor or blender. Process until smooth. In a small bowl combine lemon juice and sesame oil. In a large serving bowl combine potato mixture and dressing. Stir in salmon and roasted red peppers. Toss well. Serve at once.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add onion and green chilies to pan. Cook stirring occasionally until onions are tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Add chicken broth to pan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Sprinkle chili powder and cumin over chicken mixture. Season with salt to taste. Place chicken breasts in a glass baking dish. Top chicken with peppers and onions. Cover with enchilada sauce. Top with tortillas and shredded cheese. Bake until bubbly around the edges, about 20 minutes. Let sit 5 minutes before serving.

Cook the sausage in a small amount of water until it is no longer pink. Drain the fat. Add the cabbage and cook for 5 minutes. Add the cheese and stir until the cheese is melted. Add the sour cream and cook until heated through. Season with the salt and pepper.
Mix all ingredients together and pour into a 9 x 13 inch pan. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 45 minutes. Cool before cutting into squares to serve.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, cut zucchini into thin strips. Heat oil in skilletadd garlic and zucchini. Cook and stir until tender. Stir in cheese and mint. Drain pasta and pour into skillettoss to coat. Sprinkle with nuts. Serve warm. Garnish with lemon wedges.

Dissolve breadcrumbs in a little water. Sift together flour and baking powder. Beat the eggs until foamy and beat in the sugar, lemon rind and juice and water until the batter is smooth and of the right thickness to drop from the spoon. Stir in the breadcrumb mixture and the oleo. Drop by teaspoonfuls on to a greased and sugared baking pan and bake in a hot oven for 20 minutes. When cold sprinkle with confectioners icing and garnish with walnuts.

Combine sugar&cornstarch. Stirring well. Gradually add water. Stirring constantly. Cook over low heat. Boil & stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in butter & lemon juice. Cool to room temperature before serving.

Bring to boiling point 1 quart of potato water (1 cup potato water, 4 cups cold water). Strain the potato water through a fine sieve and return to the saucepan. Dissolve 1 teaspoonful of sugar and 1 teaspoonful of salt in 1 cup of the potato water. Dissolve 2 teaspoonfuls of active dry yeast in the hot potato water. Stir 1 cup of white flour in the boiling potato water, stirring until the mixture is smooth and free of lumps. When it has cooled to room temperature add the other 1 cup of white flour and the remaining 1 teaspoonful of sugar and 1 teaspoonful of salt. Stir until the mixture is smooth and free of lumps and place in a tightly covered container. Use immediately or store in refrigerator up to 3 months or freezer up to 6 months. Prepared pizza crust according to package directions. Brown sausage patties in skillet until browned. Beat eggs with milk, salt and pepper. Pour eggs over browned sausage. Top with pizza crust. Bake as directed for 5-8 minutes or until eggs are set. Top with cheese and bake another 3-5 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat together milk and egg in a small bowl. Spread the milk mixture over both sides of each slice of white bread. Top each slice with a generous amount of grated mozzarella. Season with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in a frying pan. Brown the mozzarella sandwiches on both sides. Bake for 15 minutes. Serves 4.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Sprinkle seasoned pepper on beef. Brown the beef. Add the gravy. Stir. Cover and simmer over medium low heat for 5 minutes. Serve over rice.

Combine lemon juice, soy sauce, garlic, ginger and onion powder in a small bowl. Set aside. Thread shrimp, scallops and vegetables onto 4 skewers. Grill 3 to 4 minutes per side or until cooked. Serve with reserved marinade.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Peel potatoes and slice into 1/4 inch slices. Toss potatoes and brussels sprouts in olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Roast for 15 minutes. Stir and return to the oven for another 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and sprinkle parsley over. Serve immediately.
In a bowl combine the first 7 ingredients. Mix well. Refrigerate until serving time. Serve with crackers.

In small bowl combine vinegar, garlic and canola oil. Add chiles, oregano and cuminstir well. Rub mixture all over steak. Let stand 10 minutes. Grill over medium heat 6-8 minutes per side for medium rare. Remove meat from grill and slice thinly across the grain. Serve with remaining marinade.

Melt butter over medium heat. Saute onions and celery until tender. Add rice and stir for 2 minutes. Add chicken broth, stuffing mix and seasoning. Heat to a boil and simmer 8 minutes. Add tangerines and cranberries. Simmer until liquid is absorbed. Stir in peel and poultry seasoning. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Coat a rimmed baking sheet with cooking spray. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the chicken and 1 tsp hot sauce to the skillet. Cook until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes. Remove from the skillet and set aside. Put the butter in the skillet over medium heat. Once the butter is melted, add the hot sauce and stir until the butter is amber brown. Arrange the chicken on the prepared baking sheet. Sprinkle with the butter. Bake the chicken until the internal temperature registers 165 degrees F on an instant-read thermometer, 15 to 20 minutes.

Brown meat in pan. Add tomato sauce. Simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in cumin. Sprinkle with oregano. Add cinnamon. Add baby spinach last minute.

Beat eggs with sour cream, butter, vanilla extract, lemon juice, sugar and cinnamon until smooth. Add golden raisins and apples. Pour into a 13x9 inch baking pan. Cook on 375 degrees for 30 minutes or until brown and bubbly on top. Serve warm or cold.

Peel and cube the potatoes. Boil in water until tender. Drain. Add the garlic salt. Butter a 2-quart casserole. Into this layer the potatoes. Spread evenly with the cream cheese. Sprinkle evenly with the onion. Pour the sour cream evenly over the top. Sprinkle with the cheese. Bake for 30 minutes until the cheese is golden brown. Serve with hot rolls.

Heat a non-stick frying pan over a medium heat and add 1 tbsp of the vegetable oil. Gently fry the spring onion and garlic for about 2 minutes. Sprinkle over the chile and turmeric and cook for a further minute, stirring constantly. Transfer the mixture to a bowl and add the ground spices, then beat the eggs in a separate bowl and add to the spice mixture. Season with salt and pepper and mix well. Return the mixture to the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the base of the omelette is golden brown and set. Turn the omelette over and cook for a further 3-4 minutes or until the top is golden brown and cooked through. Transfer the omelette to a serving plate and sprinkle with the coriander leaves and serve immediately.

Brown chicken in large skillet. Add onion, green pepper, and chili powder. Stir in broth and olives. Cook until tender. Add rice and heat through. Spoon into serving bowls. Top with cheddar cheese. Serve with chips and salsa.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Rub butter over all sides of the leg of lamb. Place rosemary in the cavity. Rub meat with salt and pepper. Place meat in a 4 qt. slow cooker. In a small saucepan, combine the ginger and cider. Cook until liquid is reduced by half. Stir in cornstarch. Stirring constantly, cook and stir until thick and bubbly. Stir in the honey. Pour over the meat. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours. Uncover. Place under broiler for 10 minutes. Carve and serve.

In a saucepan over medium heat combine sugar and boiling water. Cook and stir for 1 min. Pour into a bowl with the pineapple juice, orange concentrate and lemonade concentratestir in the almond extract. Cool completely then freeze. In a bowl combine water, amaretto, vanilla and almond extract. Stir into the frozen mixture. Fill glasses with crushed ice and pour the mixture into glasses.

Brush fish with olive oil. Sprinkle with herbs. Place in baking pan. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes until fish is done. Top with slices of tomato and drizzle with extra virgin olive oil. Serve immediately.

Mix currants with sultanas and madeira wine. Let stand 10 minutes. Beat eggs with ricotta cheese, sugar and polenta. Beat in milk. Add currant mixture. Fold in flour. Bake in greased 8x8x2 inch baking dish at 350F for 20 minutes. Cool. Spread with orange rind and juice. Refrigerate.

Cream together the butter and cream cheese until smooth. Beat in the vanilla and almond extracts. Stir in the flour and pecans. Shape into 1 inch balls, place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake in 350 degrees oven for 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from oven and place on wire rack to cool. Dust with powdered sugar.

Squeeze the liquid from the bread and mash into a paste. Set aside. Mix crab, egg, bread, baking powder and salt. Add Old Bay and Worcestershire sauce and stir. Form into 4 patties and chill for 30 minutes. Heat oil and fry patties for 4 minutes on each side. Drain and place in a pan. Combine mayonnaise and parsley and spread on top of patties. Brown under broiler. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Mix brown sugar and cornstarch in small bowlset aside. In another bowl, combine yams, zest and cinnamontoss to coat. Transfer to ungreased 11x7-inch baking dish. Bake, uncovered, for 30 to 40 minutes or until yams are tender and browned. Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, bring apricot juice to a boilcook for 4 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in butterlet cool to room temperature. Remove yams from oven and sprinkle with cinnamon and pecans. Pour apricot mixture over yamslet stand for 30 minutes before serving.

Beat together cream cheese and butter in a large bowl until well combined. Add extract and beat until creamy. Add heavy cream and sweetener, and continue beating until mixture is creamy. Chill for 2-3 hours. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line baking sheet with parchment paper. Shape the cream cheese mixture into 1-inch balls. Place on parchment paper. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Remove from oven and roll in chopped peanuts. Return to oven for 1-2 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool completely. Store in an airtight container.

Whisk together oil, vinegar, orange juice and honey in a small bowl. Season to taste with salt and pepper. In a large bowl, combine lettuce, onion, apple, pecans, pomegranate seeds and feta. Gently toss to combine. Serve immediately, drizzling dressing over top.

In a 9x13 baking pan combine italian dressing and ranch dressing. Add chicken. Bake uncovered at 350 for 40 minutes or until no pink remains inside of meat. Cook pasta according to directions and drain. Add to chicken and toss to coat. Serve with parmesan cheese sprinkled on top.

Preheat oven to 400 F. Combine rhubarb and jelly. Place rhubarb on unbaked pie crust. Bake for 5 minutes, remove from oven and sprinkle with brown sugar and nuts. Bake an additional 5 minutes and remove from oven. Cool completely.
In a large sauce pan, combine rhubarb and water. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer over medium heat until rhubarb is tender, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in gelatin and sugar until dissolved. Add frozen strawberries and ice cream. Alow to thaw, stirring occasionally. Pour into indivitual servind dishes. Refrigerate several hours or until firm. Serve with a garnish of whipped cream on top.
Cut rhubarb in small pieces. Pile the rhubarb pieces in the pie shell. Sprinkle with the jello. Mix together the flour & sugar. Cut in the margarine. Sprinkle on top of rhubarb and jello. Bake at

Combine first five ingredients in a small bowl. Blend until smooth. Gradually add oil, blending well with each addition until mixture is thickened. Refrigerate until ready to use. Shake well before serving.

Place all the ingredients in a large plastic bag. Zip closed and shake to coat. Bake at 350 for 1 hour.
I used the creamy italian chicken recipe for dinner tonight. It was delicious. I did add some cooked spaghetti noodles to it and it was wonderful.
I'm going to try the chicken salad recipe. Sounds yummy.
I'm going to try the chicken in a bag recipe.
I'm going to try the tastes like a Chick-Fil-A Chicken Salad Sandwich recipe.
I'm going to try the Chicken and Mushroom Soup recipe.
I'm going to try the Creamy Italian Chicken recipe.
I'm going to try the Creamed Chicken recipe.
I'm going to try the Chicken with Egg Noodles recipe.
I'm going to try the Creamed Chicken recipe. I love that one.
I'm going to try the Tastes Like a Chick-Fil-A Chicken Salad Sandwich
Mix dry ingredients. Combine egg yolks with the rest of the liquids and add to the dry ingredients. Stir in the egg whites and pour into a hot iron.

Boil the mixed vegs for 5 min. Drain and place in a casserole dish. Blend the mayonnaise and onion and pour over vegs. Sprinkle cheddar cheese over all. Melt butter and add fine dry breadcrumbs. Sprinkle over cheese. Bake at 375f for 15 min.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Line two baking sheets with aluminum foil. Cut the squash and tomatoes into 1/4-inch-thick slices and place on the baking sheets. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the vegetables are softened. Meanwhile, bring 6 quarts water to a boil in a large pot. Add salt and cook the pasta according to the package directions. Drain and transfer to a serving bowl. Add the remaining tablespoon of olive oil to the serving bowl. Add the roasted vegetables, the tomato juice and the red-pepper flakes and toss. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Melt the butter over medium heat in a small saucepan. Stir in the basil and remove from the heat. Add the basil mixture to the pasta along with the parmesan cheese and toss. Serve immediately.

Heat pan and add butter. Add garlic powder and ground beef and cook. Drain excess fat. Slice french bread in half and place meat in center. Top with sour cream and sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Broil until bubbly.

In a small saucepan over low heat, melt the butter. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the other seasonings. Remove from the heat and allow to cool for about 30 minutes. Preheat the grill. Brush the corn with butter. Grill the corn, turning occasionally, until slightly charred and the kernels are tender. Makes about 2 dozen servings.

Preheat oven to 350f. Mix together all ingredients except mozzarella. Spread into a 9x9 glass dish. Bake for 45 minutes. Top with mozzarella. Brown at 450 for 5 minutes. Serve with crackers or bread.
Baby Food - A Scoop of Everything!

In a large skillet or deep fryer heat olive oil. Saute onion, garlic clove, cauliflower. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place in shallow baking dish. Dot with butter. Bake in preheated 400 degree oven for 30 minutes. In a small bowl mix together bread crumbs and cheddar cheese. Sprinkle over cauliflower. Bake an additional 3-5 minutes or until top is golden. Serve immediately.
Place truffle pieces in blender along with fresh thyme sprigs and peppercorns. Blend till smooth. With motor running slowly, add olive oil until combined and mayonnaise forms.

Heat oven to 375. Place broth and vinegar in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook 3 to 5 minutes or until reduced to 3 tablespoons (about 30 mL), stirring occasionally. Remove from heatstir in pepper. Spray a 9-inch (23 cm) pie plate with cooking spray. Place chicken in pie plate. Top with ham and balsamic mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink at center and cheese is melted. Serve with salad greens. Makes 4 main-dish servings.

Cook and drain spaghetti as directed on package. While spaghetti is cooking, cook bacon in a a skillet, stirring frequently, until crisp. Remove bacon from pan with slotted spoon and drain. Drain fat from skillet, reserving 1 tablespoon in the pan. Cook onion and garlic in bacon fat over medium heat about 3 minutes, stirring frequently, until onion is tender. Stir in spaghetti, chicken, cheese and whipping cream. Cook, stirring occasionally, until heated through. Toss with bacon.

Heat butter and cook the onion for about ten minutes until the onion becomes tender and translucent. Season with salt and add sugar. Cook until the onions are soft and translucent. Add the balsamic and stir until the mixture is thick and syrupy.
These are so easy to make and I just love them!
You can use any type of vinegars you like to suit your taste buds.
These are so easy and delicious!
The best way to make sweet and sour vegetables is to use the right kind of vinegar. The key to making this is to use the right type of vinegar. I like to use balsamic vinegar because it’s sweeter than other types. This recipe is great for any type of vegetables.
This is my favorite way to make sweet and sour vegetables. It's very easy to make and it's so delicious!
You can also use balsamic vinegar if you like.
I made this recipe with red cabbage but you can use any kind of vegetable you like.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Combine eggs, 1/4 cup of milk, and 3 teaspoons sugar in a bowlbeat well. In a large bowl, combine 2 cups of the cornmeal with the remaining milk, the remaining sugar, 2 cups of the corn, the remaining flour, paprika, salt, baking powder, and pepper. Stir in the egg mixture. In a large skillet, heat the fat over medium heat. Drop 1/4 cupfuls of batter into the hot fat and cook for 2 to 3 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Place on a baking sheet coated with cooking spraybake for 5 minutes in the preheated oven. Repeat procedure with the remaining batter. Makes 2 dozen.

Cut 1/2 pound of margarine into flour until it resembles pea sized pieces. Add 1/2 cup milk. Add 1 tsp of oil. Add 1 tsp of water. Add 1 tsp of milk. Mix together. Roll out 1 inch thick.
In a small bowl, combine 1/3 cup of the milk with the cornstarch. In a large bowl, combine the cornmeal, 1/2 cup of the milk, the eggs, 1/4 cup of the oil and 1/4 cup of the sugar. Stir in the cornstarch mixture.
Pour the mixture into a 9-inch deep-dish pie plate. Sprinkle with the cheese. Bake for 35 minutes, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes. Serve warm with whipped cream or sour cream, if desired.
Place first 3 ingredients in food processorprocess until mixture resembles coarse meal. With on/off turns, add 1/4 cup water through food chute. P
Fry egg in 1 tablespoon margarine. Spread pizza sauce on hamburger bun. Top with egg and sprinkle with shredded cheese. Broil for 5 minutes. Top with pepperoni. Broil for 5 more minutes. Serve.

Place the garlic, chick-peas, lime juice, cilantro, jalapeno peppers, olive oil and salt in a food processor or blenderprocess until smooth. Serve with pita bread or vegetables. Makes 1 1/2 cups.
name: red pepper hummusingredients: garlic cloves, garbanzo beans, tahini, fresh lemon juice, jar, salt and pepperpreparation: Wtih processor running, drop garlic through feed tube and mince. Scrape down sides of work bowl. Add chickpeas, tahini and lemon juice. Process until mixture is smooth. Add roasted peppers. Process until peppers are finely chopped. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer hummus to small bowl.
name: spicy hummusingredients: lemon, juice of, olive oil, garlic cloves, salt, black pepper, dried ancho pepper, hot sauce, cumin, sesame seeds, chickpeaspreparation: Drain 1 can of

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Brush both sides of the french baguette with olive oil. Sprinkle with sea salt and freshly ground black pepper. Wrap the baguette tightly in aluminum foil and place into the preheated oven. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove the baguette from the oven and remove the aluminum foil. Slice the baguette into 1/2 inch thick slices. Top the toasted baguette slices with roasted red peppers and fresh mozzarella cheese. Return the baguette slices to the oven and bake until the cheese is melted and browned. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with sea salt and freshly ground black pepper before serving.

Cook macaroni until tender. Drain. Add soup, milk and cheese. Stir till heated through. Add celery salt and worcestershire sauce. Mix together crumbs and melted butter. Sprinkle over casserole. Bake at 350 degrees F for 15 minutes. Serves 6 to 8.

Mix all dry ingredients together in a shallow bowl. Place egg in a second shallow bowl. Dip chops in egg, then in crumb mixture. Place in greased baking dish. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until pork is no longer pink in center. Remove from oven and sprinkle with herbs. Serve over hot cooked rice or noodles.

Cook bacon in large saucepan over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon from pan with slotted spoon. Add onion to pancook 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Add garliccook 1 minute. Add potatoes, water and next 4 ingredients. Bring to boiling over medium heatreduce heat to lowcover and cook 15 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Stir in cream of chicken soupcook 5 minutes or until heated through, stirring occasionally. Remove from heatstir in sour cream, green beans, 1/2 cup parsley and pepper. Garnish with remaining 1/4 cup parsley and bacon. Serve immediately. Serving Size 1 cup. Serving Size 1 cup. Exchanges Per Meal: 2 Starch, 2 Fat, 1 Other Carbohydrate. Calories 280 Calories from Fat 60 Total Fat 7 g Saturated Fat 4 g Cholesterol 55 mg Sodium 660 mg Total Carbohydrate 3

Melt the peanut butter and sugar in a large pot. Stir in the vanilla. Add the cereal and stir to coat completely. Spread the mixture evenly into a 13x9 inch pan. Refrigerate until solid. Cut into squares. Melt the chocolate chips and butter in a saucepan until smooth. Pour over the bars and spread evenly. Refrigerate until hardened.
Combine all ingredients. Knead until smooth. Cover and rest 15 minutes. Roll into thin 6 inch rounds. Cook on hot griddle or frying pan until brown. Serve hot.

Place all ingredients except chicken and sesame seeds in crock pot. Cover and cook on low 67 hours. Add chicken and cook on low for an additional hour. Remove from crock pot and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve over rice.

Cook the pasta in boiling water until almost done (al dente) but not quite. Drain well. In a saucepan melt butter over medium heat. Stir in the flour and cook for 1 minute while stirring. Slowly stir in the milk and cook for an additional minute. Stir in the chicken soup. Cook for another minute. Remove from heat and stir in the chicken and peas. Season with the rosemary, salt, pepper and parmesan cheese. Pour over the cooked but not quite done pasta and toss. Place in an ovenproof baking dish and bake at 350 degrees F until hot, about 20 minutes.

Cut the chicken into strips. In a skillet heat vegetable oil. Saute the onions, peppers and chicken. Add salt and pepper. Cook for 3-4 minutes. Add lemon juice. Add the red curry paste. Cook for 3-4 minutes. Garnish with Cilantro. Serve over rice.

Cut the celeriac in half and cut each half into 6 wedges. Place in a saucepan with the lemon juice, bay leaf and 1/2 cup water. Cover and cook over medium heat until tender. Drain and cool. In a small bowl, combine the lemon juice and apple. Place the celeriac and the apple mixture in a medium bowl and toss. In a separate small bowl, mix the mustard and mayonnaise until blended. Add the mustard mixture to the celeriac and toss to blend. Chill at least 1 hour. Garnish with the parsley before serving. Serves 4.

In a large saucepan, melt 2 tablespoons of the butter and saute the onion and celery until tender. Add the rice. Stir over low heat for about 1 minute to coat the grains of rice with the melted butter. Add the chicken broth and salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes. After the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed, add the parmesan and mix well. Sprinkle with the remaining tablespoon of butter and the chopped pecans. Garnish with chopped fresh parsley if desired. Serve hot. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 350F. In a large bowl toss together all the vegetables. In a separate bowl, combine the mustard and oil. Rub the chicken thighs with the oil mixture. Add the vegetables to the baking dish. Arrange the chicken thighs on top of the vegetables. Sprinkle the white wine over the chicken. Bake until the vegetables are soft. Pour the balsamic glaze over the vegetables. Sprinkle the rosemary over the vegetables and bake for about 5 minutes more. Remove the chicken thighs from the baking dish and slice. Serve with vegetables.

In a large mixing bowl, combine butter and sugars. Beat until light and fluffy. Add eggs and beat until well mixed. Blend in morsels and vanilla. Stir in flour. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto greased baking sheets. Bake at 375 for 8 minutes. Cool on baking sheets. In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt white chocolate with milk and shortening. Dip cooled cookies into the white chocolate. Decorate as desired. Refrigerate.
These are not your ordinary cookies. They are moist and chewy and they have the rich chocolate taste you expect from a cookie. My family loves these cookies. They are great for a snack or as a dessert.
These cookies are absolutely delicious. They are soft and chewy and have a great chocolate flavor. I love these cookies and I bet your family will too.
These are some of the best cookies I have ever made. They are soft and chewy and they have a great chocolate flavor. I love these cookies and I bet your family will too.

Butter and line a cookie sheet with waxed paper. Combine butter, egg yolks and vanilla in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in powdered sugar until smooth. Add a couple squares of chocolate and let melt. Remove from heat and pour onto waxed paper. Cool. With egg whites and a hand mixer or in a stand mixer, beat egg whites until frothy. Add powdered sugar and beat until stiff peaks form. Fold in half the chocolate mixture and the remaining egg whites. Scoop out into small balls and roll in remaining chocolate mixture. Place on waxed paper. Freeze for a couple hours.

Cook spinach according to package directions. Drain well. Heat olive oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions and garlic. Cook for a few minutes until onions are translucent. Add remaining ingredients. Cook for another 3-4 minutes or until hot. Remove from heat and stir in hot green peppers. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve over hot cooked rice.
