Mix 1/2 cup strawberry yogurt and 1/2 cup water in small bowl. Add 1/4 cup powdered drink mix and 1/2 cup strawberries. Mix well. Place in blender or food processor container with 1/2 cup ice cubes. Blend or process until smooth. Serve immediately.

Heat oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Season each side of chicken with a little salt and pepper. Add to skillet and brown. Remove from pan and set aside. In same skillet, whisk in broth and bring to a boil. Add chicken back to pan and simmer for 5 minutes. Slice lemon and drop into skillet. Cook until lemon is tender and liquid is reduced by half. Serve with pasta of your choice.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the whipping cream and liqueur. Heat until steaming. Stir in the chocolate. Continue stirring until melted. Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla. Serve immediately in fondue dishes. Makes 3 cups.

Cook the onion in the olive oil until golden brown. Add the herbs and spices. Add the pumpkin and potato. Cook for another 5 minutes. Stir in the tomato paste. Add the stock and lentil. Stir to combine. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes or until the pumpkin and potato are cooked. Add the tomato and cook for another 5 minutes. Add the frozen peas and simmer until just heated through. Serve with brown rice or over noodles. Serves 4-6.

Peel sweet onions. Slice into 1/8 inch thick rings. Combine breadcrumbs with salt, pepper and parmesan. Dip onion rings into egg white then into crumb mixture to coat each piece. Place in single layer on greased baking sheet. Bake in 400f oven for 20 minutes or until crisp. Sprinkle with more parmesan. Makes 2 dozen.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a medium bowl, mix graham cracker crumbs and melted butter. Press into a greased pie plate. Bake for 8 minutes. Remove from oven and cool. In a large bowl combine instant pudding, milk, and vanilla. Beat well with a wire whisk for 2 minutes. Let set. Fold in cool whip lite and spread over crust. Arrange sliced bananas on top. Sprinkle with pecans. Cover and refrigerate for at least an hour.

Cook chicken in pan. Add garlic powder, salt and black pepper. Remove from heat. Cook rice according to directions on box. Mix chicken mixture and rice in crock pot. Add in can of cream of chicken soup. Cover and let simmer for about 30 minutes.

Season the steaks with salt and fresh ground pepper. Heat the oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add the steaks and saute for 3 to 4 minutes per side for medium rare. Remove the steaks from the pan and set aside. In the same skillet, cook the shallot and mustard in the butter over medium heat until the mixture begins to brown. Add the lemon juice and boil until the mixture thickens slightly and is reduced by half. Pour the sauce over the steaks.

In top of double boiler, combine sugar, corn syrup, peanut butter and vanilla. Stir over hot water until mixture is smooth. Remove from heat. Add peanuts, rice cereal and chocolate chips. Mix well. Place in 9x13-inch greased pan. Let cool. Cut into 48 squares.

Beat together the butter, sugar and egg until creamy. Beat in the chocolate and milk until smooth. Add the vanilla and salt and mix well. Sift the flour into the mixture and mix well until all the flour is blended in. Divide the dough into 4 portions and shape each into a smooth ball. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour before rolling out the dough to make your cookies.

Beat eggs with flour, baking powder and garlic powder. Add onion and zucchini. Pour into greased muffin tins. Bake 400 degrees for 20 minutes or until puffed and browned. Serve with tomato sauce or gravy.
In small saucepan melt butter. Blend in flour. Stir in beef broth. Cook over low heat until thick. Stir in currant jelly and wine. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425-degrees f. Line a baking sheet with foil or parchment paper. Mix all ingredients except fish in a small bowl or cup. Brush fish with mixture and place skin side down on the sheet pan. Bake 30 - 40 minutes or until cooked through.

Core and slice apples. Toss with sugar. In mixing bowl combine flour, oil, egg, baking powder, vanilla extract and cinnamon. Press half the mixture into the bottom of a 9 inch pie pan. Spread apple mixture evenly over the base. Cover with the remaining mixture. Bake at 350 f for 45 to 60 minutes.

Sift first four ingredients in a medium size bowl. Blend in eggs and milk. Add oleo and coconut and blend well. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake in preheated oven at 350 degrees for about 40 minutes or till golden brown. Cool before serving.

Mix 1 can of sweetened condensed milk with the butter and the milk. Mix the pudding with the ice cream. Fold the oreo cookies into the ice cream mixture. Fold the oreo cookies into the ice cream mixture. Fold in the cool whip. Refrigerate.

Heat the oil and butter in a large frying pan. Slice the apples and fry the sage leaves in the pan until crisp and a little colour. Turn off the heat and add the apples and sage leaves to the pan. Pour over the cider and sprinkle with the jelly and stir well. Put the chops in the pan and cook over a gentle heat until they are cooked to your liking. In a small pan heat the creme fraiche until hot and stir in the sage leaves and a little pepper. Serve the chops with the apples and creme fraiche.

Mix flour, oats, milk, butter, and vanilla together until smooth. Roll into balls about 1/2 inch thick. Place on cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 5-10 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from cookie sheet and roll in peanut butter mixture (mix together 2 cups of peanut butter, 2-1/2 cups of powdered sugar, 1/2 cup water). Place back on the cookie sheet, let sit for 5 minutes or so. Melt semi-sweet chips and drizzle over the peanut butter balls. Let cool. Store covered in refrigerator.

Heat olive oil over medium heat in a large skillet. Cook onion and pepper about 3 minutes or until tender. Add mushrooms and cook and additional 2 minutes or until tender and browned. Add garlic and cook 1 minute longer or until fragrant. Add chicken and sprinkle with pepper and cook about 2 minutes or until browned on the outside and no longer pink on the inside. Add tomatoes and vinegar and cook 2 minutes or until heated through and slightly thickened. Garnish with basil before serving. Serve with rice or pasta.

Peel and pit the peaches, then puree them with the water until smooth. Add the honey, spices and whiskey. Cook slowly until thickened and smooth. Stir frequently. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Spoon into sterilized jars and process for 10 minutes.

Combine the first 4 ingredients in a large bowl and let stand 5 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the flour and 1 tsp baking powderstir into the yeast mixture. Knead on a lightly floured surface until smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled, about 1 hour. Punch down the dough and divide into 2 ballscover and let rise again until doubled, about 30 minutes. Roll each ball of dough into a 12-inch circle. Bake at 425 degrees for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown. Top with your favorite toppings before baking.

Cook the spaghetti al dente. Heat the oil and add the garlic. Saute for about 2 minutes, then add the hot pepper flakes and the salt. Stir for a few seconds. Add the chicken broth. Toss the pasta and the parsley together and serve immediately with grated cheese.
name: Italian Pasta Saladservings: 8 servingsprep time: 10 minready in: 30 miningredients: 2 (16-ounce) packages uncooked penne or ziti pasta2 (1-inch) slices white bread (about 1/2 cup crumbs)1/2 cup chopped celery1/2 cup chopped onion1 (15-ounce) can chickpeas, drained and rinsed1 (8-ounce) jar roasted red peppers, drained and chopped1 (8-ounce) jar pitted kalamata olives, drained and chopped2 cups cucumber, chopped1/2 cup diced roasted

Boil small potatoes in plenty of water for about 15 minutes. Drain and cool. In a bowl combine the boiled potatoes with rosemary, parsley, sage, mint, olive oil, lemon brine and salt and pepper to taste. Toss well. Serve at room temperature.

Spray a large nonstick skillet with cooking spray. Saute onion and mushrooms in skillet over medium heat until tender. Transfer mixture to a bowl and set aside. Bring 2 cups water and 1 tablespoon salt to a boil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir in cauliflower and return to boil. Cook 5 minutes or until tender-crispdrain and transfer to a bowl. Add onion mixture and toss with cauliflower until combined. Sprinkle with pepper.

Combine couscous with apple juice, currant juice and cinnamon stick in a medium saucepan. Heat on medium high until boiling, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Add mixed berries, lemon zest and lime zestcook for 1 minute more. Let cool slightly, then add yogurt and honeystir well. Makes 4 servings (2/3 cup each)

Mix all of the herbs, 2 tablespoons butter, garlic and shallots together in a small bowl. Spray grill pan with cooking spray and grill over medium high heat for about 3 minutes on each side or until pink. Serve with a drizzle of white rum sauce. White rum sauce: Combine 1 tablespoon each of white rum, soy sauce and teriyaki sauce with 1/4 cup water. Cook until reduced to 1/3 cup. Add remaining 2 tablespoons of butter and blend until smooth.

Boil eggs until yolks are firm. Slice into rounds. Combine eggs, mayonnaise, and onion in a bowl. Mix in curry powder and capers. Fold in frozen peas. Serve in a lettuce cup. Garnish with curry powder and capers.

Slice beans lengthwise to 1/2-inch thickness. Place in skillet. Add remaining ingredients. Heat through. Stir in pasta. Cook 4 minutes more or until pasta is tender. Remove from heat. Serve immediately.

Mix all ingredients in the container of an electric mixer or in a cocktail shaker. Shake well. Chill in the refrigerator for 2-3 hours or overnight. Serve over ice in martini glasses. Garnish with a lime slice.

Boil shells in plenty of water until just done. Allow them to cool completely and discard any broken ones. Place meat in a food processor or meat grinder. Grind to desired consistency. Place ground meat in a bowl. Add egg, parmesan cheese and breadcrumbs. Mix well. Add parsley, salt and pepper. Fill each shell with meat mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes or until shells are heated through. Top with spaghetti sauce and grated parmesan.
name: meat loaf with vegetablesingredients: eggs, milk, salt, pepper, catsup, minced onion, cooking oil, salt, vegetable oil, bread crumbs, lean ground meat, onion, carrots, celerypreparation:Mix eggs with milk. Season with salt and pepper. Add catsup. In skillet heat oil and saute onion and carrots until tender. In a large bowl mix together meat, eggs, milk and vegetables. Add bread crumbs. Shape into loaf and place in greased
Cream butter and sugar. Add instant pudding mix and flour. Chill dough. Roll out 1/4 inch thick. Bake at 350 degrees for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and cool on wire rack.
Combine all in a casserole dish except croutons. Top with croutons. Bake at 350 for 35-40 minutes until lightly browned and bubbly. Serve hot.

Heat olive oil in a cast-iron skillet over medium-high. Add sweet potatoes and scallionscook until lightly browned. Add garlic clove, pimientos, and salt and pepperstir until potatoes are evenly coated. Add eggscook 1-2 minutes longer. Place in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake until eggs are cooked through. Remove from oven. Top with manchego cheeselet sit 5 minutes. Cut into wedges. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Peel, clean, stem, slice and seed green chilies. Dice onion. In a bowl combine eggs, milk, onion, salt, pepper and cumin. Slice cheese. Heat oil in a 9x13-inch baking dish. Dip each stuffed chile into batter and fry until golden brown on both sides. Place in baking dish with the stuffing side down. Top each with a slice of cheese. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes or until bubbly and cheese is melted.
name: chili verdeingredients: beef, dried oregano, chopped cilantro, chopped onion, garlic cloves, tomatillos, tomatoes, canned tomatoes, ground cumin, ground coriander, dried ancho chile peppers, salt, beerpreparation:In a large pot cook beef cubes over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until no longer pink. Add onion and garlicsaute 2 minutes or until lightly brow

In a large heavy saucepan combine sugar, corn syrup, water, butter, coconut, and macadamia nuts. Boil to soft crack stage. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract and baking soda. Quickly pour mixture onto a large greased marble slab or stoneware platter. As candy cools stretch out thin by lifting and pulling from edges using a fork or wooden spoon. Break into pieces as soon as possible. Store in airtight container.

Spread a layer of cream cheese on one slice. Top with a layer of vegemite. Layer on ham and tomato. Spread a layer of vegemite on another slice. Spread a layer of cream cheese on another slice. Layer on ham and tomato. Top with a layer of vegemite. Sandwich with remaining slices. Secure each sandwich with a wooden toothpick. Cut sandwich into triangles.

Heat the peanut oil in a large frying pan. Add the garlic and stir over low heat until it begins to color. Add the peanuts and stir constantly. Add the ancho chile powder and cayenne to taste. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes, until the nuts are toasted and fragrant. Sprinkle with salt and serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a bowl, combine flour, baking powder, and saltset aside. In a large bowl, combine egg and sugar. Stir in milk and vanilla. Add the flour mixture. Stir to combine. Spread evenly in a greased 9x13 inch baking pan. Sprinkle with cherries. In a small bowl, combine butter and sugar. Crumble topping over the cherries. Bake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 180 C. Beat egg in bowl. Add sugar and beat until mixture is light and fluffy. Sift potato starch into mixture. Stir to blend. Add lemon rind and juice. Beat until mixture is smooth. Pour mixture into greased and floured 12 muffin cups. Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool. Drizzle with lemon icing. To make the icing, combine the egg yolk, vanilla extract and salt in a small bowl. Stir in the juice. Add the oil drop by drop. Beat until mixture is smooth. Drizzle on top of the cookies.
name: old fashioned homemade lemonade concentrateingredients: citric acid, tartaric, epsom salts, lemons, juice of, lemons, zest of, granulated sugar, boiling waterpreparation:Mix all ingredients together well. Pour boiling water over mixture. Stir shortly. Let stand overnight. Strain mixture and then bottle. When

Wash lentils. Add 4 cups water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer covered until tender, about 20 minutes. Add the remaining water. Stir in the Anaheim chili. Simmer uncovered for 30 minutes. Add the butter, the minced ginger, the garlic, the Berbere and the black pepper. Serve with rice.
Soak the kielbasa in cold water for a few minutes to get the salt out. In a large kettle or dutch oven combine all the other ingredients and kielbasa. Simmer for 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 450. Wash and trim the stalks from the mushroom caps. Cut them into 1/4-inch slices. In a bowl, toss the mushrooms and the onion with the garlic and salt. Place the mushrooms on baking sheet and roast until they begin to brown and the onion is tender, 10-15 minutes. Cut the asparagus into 1-inch lengths and add to the baking sheet. Roast 5 minutes more. In a bowl, toss the cooked vegetables with the vinegar and the olive oil. Serve at room temperature.

Juice lemons. Stir honey and hot water together until dissolved. Add to lemon juice. Add frozen strawberries. Cut into halves or quarters if necessary. Let stand for a few minutes before serving to meld flavors. May be served over ice or chilled.
name: ice cubesingredients: ice cubespreparation:Run some tap water into a small container or cup that has a lid or cover and freeze.
name: sherbetingredients: cream of tartar, 1 cup (8 oz) water, 1/4 cup (1/2 stick) butter (do not use margarine or hydrogenated oils), 1/2 cup (4 oz) granulated white sugar1/4 cup (4 oz) corn syrup (do not use glucose), 1/2 cup (4 oz) powdered sugar3 cups fresh fruit1/4 cup (1/2 stick) butter (do not use margarine or hydrogenated oils), 1/2 cup (4 oz) granulated
Peel the turnip and carrot. Cut in thin wedges. Puree the garlic and onion. Add the vegetables, apple and yoghurt. Add the dried herbs. Mix well. Toss in the eggs. Sprinkle with scallions. Season.

Season pork with salt and pepper. Place pork in skillet with oil. Brown on all sides. Add chicken broth to skillet. Remove pork from broth. In another skillet saute onion and garlic in oil. Add green chili. Cook until onion is transparent. Strain green chili from oil. Add to broth with pork. Cover and simmer 1 hour. Remove pork and chop. Add hominy and chili powder to broth. Cover and cook 20 minutes. Add pork and cumin. Cook 10 minutes. Serve with tortillas.

Roll 1 tbsp of flour and place on trays covered with greaseproof paper and prick with fork all over. Roll 2 tbsp jam into balls and place on each biscuit. Press jam into biscuits and bake 350 degrees until golden brown. Leave on trays for 3 minutes. Cool on trays or racks. Icing can be made with icing sugar, egg yolk and water or with lemon juice and water.

Fry onion and bacon bits in canola oil until onion is soft and bacon crisp. Add vegetable bouillon cube. Add mashed potatoes and skim milk. Stir until smooth. Add salt and pepper to taste. Top with crumbled bacon and shredded cheese. Serve warm.

Beat butter and powdered sugar together until fluffy. Add vanilla and gradually add enough milk to make a soft consistency. Drop by spoonfuls onto wax paper and press a graham cracker into the center of each ball of frosting. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and press a small piece of chocolate into the center of each cookie. Cool and frost.
The first is a variation of the very popular 7 layer cookies which are essentially a chocolate cookie sandwiched between layers of different goodies. These are similar but use a basic cookie recipe and I added a layer of coconut and peanuts to the original. I also used a slightly different way to do the condensed milk layer and topped it off with a layer of walnuts. This one is good and will be a keeper.
The second is a variation of the popular Magic Bar recipe which is very similar to a brownie and is a layer of cookie and different goodies topped off by a layer of chocolate and sometimes a layer of frosting as well. This one is a variation that uses Golden Grah

In a small bowl, mix together wasabi paste, tamari and vegetable oil. In a large bowl, combine the tuna, scallions and spinach. Toss with the wasabi mixture. Spread a thin layer of the tuna mixture on the tortillas. Roll up tightly, then refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight.

Combine first 3 ingredients in a small bowlset aside. In a large bowl, combine the remaining ingredients and toss well. Place one half of the mixture in a gallon size oven cooking bagspread evenly. Place in a shallow pan. Top with the remaining mixturespread evenly. Remove air from bagseal bag. Place in a 375 degree F ovencook 1 hour to 1 hour 10 minutes, turning once. Carefully open bagdiscard juicesarrange chicken on a platterserve remaining sauce with the chicken.

In a large bowl, combine the first seven ingredients and mix well. Divide evenly between 4 patties. In a small bowl combine the remaining ingredients and mix well. Spread each patty with a little of the mixture and top with a slice of cheese. Cook over low-medium heat for 10-15 minutes, turning once and brushing with remaining mixture. Serve on buns with lettuce and tomato if desired.

Marinate chicken in soy sauce, sugar, vinegar and Worcestershire sauce. Marinate for at least 2 hours. Heat oil in wok. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add marinated chicken to wok. Cook until chicken is lightly browned. Add ginger. Stir to combine. Add broth. Cook until broth is reduced. Add soy sauce and vinegar. Cook until sauce thickens. Serve over rice.

Place the baby onions in the chicken broth and bring to boil. Simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in the balsamic and sugar. Cook for 5 minutes more. Season to taste. Remove from the heat and let cool. Add the olive oil and parsley. Serve at room temperature.

Heat margarine in skillet over medium heat. Saute onions in skillet until tender. Add broccoli. Cook for 5 minutes. Beat together eggs, soup mix, milk, white pepper, and salt. Pour over onions and broccoli. Cook 2 minutes or until egg is set. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and parmesan. Brown under broiler. Cut into 4 wedges. Serve hot.

Peel and slice the sweet potatoes into thick slices. In a heavy skillet, heat the sunflower oil over high heat. When the oil is hot, put the panch phoran into the hot oil and stir for 3 seconds. Add the sliced sweet potatoes, and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add the minced onion and garlic. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the sliced green chilies. Stir-fry for another 2 minutes. Add the green coriander leaves and stir. Serve hot.

Rinse the mussels under cold running water to remove any debris. Remove the beards with your fingers or with the tip of a sharp paring knife. In a large saucepan with the butter, saute the bell pepper and celery until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the cilantro and the shallots and cook, stirring, for 1 minute more. Add the vinegar and cook for 1 minute more. Add the mussels and pour in the wine. Cover the pan and cook for 3 minutes. Add salt to taste and discard any shells that have not opened. Stir in the tomato and remove from the heat. Serve the mussels in their shells with the pan juices poured over them.
Cut the chicken and prawns into very small pieces. Chop the vegetables. Add them to a bowl with the garlic and seasonings. Fill the rice paper wrappers with the filling. Roll up and serve.

In a skillet over medium high heat saute the mushrooms in 1/4 cup of the olive oil for 2 minutes until lightly browned, stirring frequently to prevent burning. Add the wine, soy sauce and sherry to the skillet and simmer for 5 minutes. Stirring occasionally to prevent scorching. In a separate pot of boiling salted water cook the pasta according to the package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. In a large bowl combine the cooked pasta with the mushroom sauce along with the remaining 1/4 cup of olive oil, the parmesan cheese and the salt and pepper to taste. Toss to coat and serve warm or cold with additional freshly ground black pepper and parmesan cheese.

In a heavy saucepan, combine the condensed and evaporated milks. Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, add the cinnamon stick and simmer 20 minutes or until reduced by half and slightly thickened. Remove from heat and pour into a glass bowl. Add the rice, raisins, vanilla extract and mix well. Refrigerate until cold. Serve cold or at room temperature.

Sprinkle pork butt all over with kosher salt. Place in slow cooker. Pour apple cider over pork. Cook for 8-9 hours on high. Remove from slow cooker and pour off the excess liquid. Place the pork butt on a baking dish lined with foil. Cover the butt with liquid smoke to taste. Place the baking dish in the oven at 350 degrees for about 1 hour until the liquid smoke has seeped into the meat and the pork is tender.
Mix peas and butter in a bowl. Season with sugar, salt, and pepper. Place on lettuce leaves. Serve immediately.

Mix butter and brown sugar together. Add hot tap water and mix well. Add egg and mix well. Add white cake mix with pudding and mix well. Chill for 30 minutes. Scoop up 1 inch size balls with a spoon. Place on a cookie sheet and place in freezer. Let harden for a few minutes. Add a couple of chocolate chips to each ball. Take out of freezer and let set for 2 hours.
Combine parsley, lime zest and white wine in a small bowl. Stir to combine. Pour over chicken and marinate for 30 minutes. Grill until no longer pink in the center.

In a 2 quart saucepan over medium heat, add the vegetable oil. Add the chopped onions, bell peppers and green chili. Saute until tender, about 5 minutes. Add the Rotel tomatoes, cumin, cilantro and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer. Cook for 10 minutes. Add the refried beans and black beans. Heat through. Stir in corn. Sprinkle with corn tortilla strips. Ladle into bowls. Garnish with cheese. Serve with tortilla chips. Serves 4.

Slice up the bananas and saute them in the maple syrup on medium heat for about one minute. Remove the banana slices from the skillet and place them on top of the frozen yogurt. Sprinkle the topping on top and enjoy!

Puree all ingredients in a food processor except for parsley. Pulse in parsley. Serve with whole grain crackers.
I am making a dip for a pot luck and want to use humus but wanted to add some fresh spinach. The only recipe I have found for this has onions in it. Do you have any recipes with spinach in them.
I have a recipe that I think would fit the bill.
I think I have a recipe for you.
This recipe is really good and the spinach works out well.
This recipe is great and the spinach works well.
This recipe is good and the spinach works out well.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Place one or two corn tortillas at a time in the hot oil. Cook until the tortilla is golden brown on one side, then turn over and cook until crisp. Layer the crisp tortillas on the bottom of your serving dish. Top the crisp tortillas with the sauce. Sprinkle the onion and cheese on top. Bake until bubbly. Sprinkle the cilantro on top before serving.

Peel and chop gingerroot. In a saucepan combine orange juice, cornstarch and gingerroot. Cook until thickened, about 5 minutes. Stir in orange zest. Add almonds and cook 1 minute more. Arrange asparagus on a serving platter. Spoon sauce over top. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Beat together sugars with shortening until light and creamy. Add butter and mix well. Add eggs one at a time beating after each addition. Stir in vanilla. Combine flour, salt and baking sodastir into mixture until just moistened. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until slightly golden. Let cool on wire racks. Store in tightly covered container. Makes 36 small to medium cookies.

Pour cider into large punch bowl or pitcher. Add lemon wedge. Sprinkle cinnamon sugar on top of cider. Chill. When ready to serve add grape juice and caramel topping. Serve immediately over ice in glasses garnished with cherries.

Heat butter in heavy skillet until bubbly. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Brown on both sides, about 5 minutes on each side. Top with breadcrumbs and sprinkle with pecorino romano. Continue cooking until juices run clear.
Heat butter, olive oil in large skillet. Cook onions about 2 minutes. Add salt and pepper. Add chicken stock and scotch whisky. Cover skillet and cook about 15 minutes or until liquid is almost gone.

Bring 6 cups chicken broth to a boil in a 3-quart saucepan. Gradually add grits, stirring constantly. Cook over medium heat until grits are tender and mixture is creamy. Stir in garlic. Add tomato mixture and goat cheese. Stir well. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Prepare the sumac by combining all of the dry spices in a small bowl and stirring. Remove the skin from the salmon and rub both sides with the sumac mixture. Heat the olive oil and balsamic vinegar in a pan until simmering. Place the salmon in the pan skin side down and cook 3 to 4 minutes. Flip the salmon and cook for 3 more minutes. Garnish with lemon wedge and serve.

Combine cranberries and water in heavy small saucepan. Bring to boil and cook until berries pop and are tender, about 5 minutes. Add maple syrup and stir to combine. Add juice and bring to boil. Cook until mixture thickens and coats back of spoon, stirring constantly and skimming occasionally (about 5 minutes). Add orange and orange zest. Cook just until heated through, stirring constantly. Transfer to bowl. Let cool to room temperature. Refrigerate until chilled. Garnish with walnut halves. Serve at room temperature.

In a mixing bowl, combine the first 4 ingredients. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well using a fork. Spoon mixture into a decorative glass dish. Top with mozzarella cheese and bake 15 minutes at 400f or until heated through and bubbly. Serve with assorted crackers or vegetables.

Drain and flake the tuna with a fork. Combine with celery, green onion, apple and yogurt. Stir in 1/4 teaspoon of pepper. Spread 1/8 of each tortilla with 2 tablespoons of the tuna mixture. Top with 1 tablespoon lettuce and 1 tablespoon red onion. Fold in sides and roll up. Makes 2 rollups.
I've made this recipe with egg noodles instead of shells and I really like it. Thanks.

Beat the eggs and oil. Add the halvah and beat well until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Add the sugar and mix well. Add the baking powder, baking soda, and the flour and mix well. Drop by tablespoon on ungreased baking sheets and bake at 400 degrees F for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool and enjoy.

Bring water to boil. Add fusilli and cook according to directions. In skillet melt butter. Stir in all-purpose flour. Slowly stir in milk. Cook until thickened. Add chicken and cook until heated through. Add corn and green onions. Add cheese. Stir in salsa. Serve over fusilli.

In a large saut pan, combine bacon grease and oil. When it is hot, add the garlic. Cook until it is fragrant but not brown, about 30 seconds. Add the bok choy. Cook for 1 minute. Add the mushrooms and cook until they are tender. Add the soy sauce and the chicken stock. Bring to a boil. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot garnished with fresh chives.
The most interesting article about Bok Choy is “The Bok Choy Blog”. It’s a collection of short stories about the Chinese vegetable Bok Choy. The stories are all written by different authors, but they all have one thing in common: they’re all about Bok Choy. The stories range from serious to humorous. If you’re looking for some lighthearted reading material on Bok Choy, this blog is definitely worth checking out.
The most common question asked by Bok Choy lovers is “What’s the best way to cook Bok Choy?”. The answer is simple: there is no one-size-fits-all answer to this question.
In slow cooker, stir together the Velveeta and sour cream until smooth. Add the spinach, cook 1 hour on low. Stir in the bacon. Spoon into individual serving dishes. Garnish with diced tomatoes.
Mix all ingredients in a saucepan until thick and smooth. Add more flour or water to get the consistency you like. Serve in a bowl with tortilla chips for dipping.

Boil potatoes in their skins until tender. Drain & cool slightly. Cut them into chunks. Toss with the snow peas & the yogurt. Divide the mixture between two bowls. Cut the smoked salmon into strips. Arrange over the potatoes. Sprinkle with the spring onions. Whisk the remaining ingredients together in a bowl & pour over the potatoes. Serve immediately.

Melt together the butter and brown sugar over low heat. Stir continuously until smooth. Add in the light corn syrup and sweetened condensed milk. Cook until the mixture reaches 240 degrees. Remove from heat and add in the salt and vanilla. Cool to room temperature. Beat with an electric mixer until smooth. Pour mixture into a 9 inch by 13 inch pan that has been lightly greased. Allow to cool. When the mixture is cool and firm to the touch cut into squares. Reportedly, these taste better if allowed to set overnight.
The most common reason for this is that your computer is not compatible with the software or that you do not have enough memory.
Sugars are used in food to sweeten it.

Soak 2 cups of dried navy beans in water overnight. Drain the beans and add them to the pressure cooker. Combine 1 1/2 cups water, the oil, salt and brown sugar in a medium saucepan. Heat over medium heat to boilingreduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in dry mustard, molasses and ketchup. Pour over beanscover pressure cooker and pressure cook at high pressure for 30 minutes. Remove from heatlet cool slightly. In a small bowl, stir together the cornstarch and wateradd to the pressure cooker and stir. Stir in the chopped onionscover and let stand for 10 minutes longer. Serve hot.

Heat butter in heavy large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add red and yellow bell peppers and mushrooms. Saute until tender. Add chicken stock and bring to boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer until liquid is reduced to 1/4 cup, stirring occasionally. Season with salt and tarragon. Remove from heat and stir in parmesan cheese. Serve warm.

Peel and core applescut into 1/2-inch chunks. Toss with cinnamon and nutmeg in large bowl. In another bowl, combine flour and brown sugarcut in margarine until crumbly. Add apples and toss until coated. Transfer to greased 15x10-inch jelly-roll pan. Bake at 350 f for 35 minutes or until apples are tender. Sprinkle with granola. Bake 5 minutes or until lightly toasted. Serve warm or cool.

Melt butter in large pot over medium heat. Cook carrots and garlic powder in the melted butter for 8-10 minutes or until carrots are tender. Add sage, tarragon and parsleycook for 1 minute longer. Add the noodles and toss well to coat. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with additional chopped parsley just before serving.

In a 1-quart saucepan, combine half-and-half, sugar, flour, vanilla, butter and shortening. Bring to boil over medium heat. Cook, stirring constantly, 1 minute. Remove from heat. Stir in extract. Cool. In a large mixing bowl, combine boiled mixture with butter until smooth. Beat in powdered sugar. Beat on high speed until light and fluffy.

Wash and dry the vegetables. In a mixing bowl, toss together the vegetables. Pour the vegetable mix into an ungreased 9x13x2 baking dish. Drizzle the vegetable mix with the oil and sprinkle the herbs on top. Bake in preheated oven for about an hour or until the vegetables are tender. Toss well before serving

To prepare the polenta, combine the water, cornmeal and salt & pepper in a large pot. Bring to a boil and cook for 10 minutes stirring constantly. Lower the heat and add milk. Cook for 20 minutes more stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in butter, marjoram, and cheese. Spread in 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and let stand for 15 minutes. Cut into squares.
Name: basil polentaIngredients: water, yellow cornmeal, unsalted butter, basil leaves, kosher salt, nutmegPreparation: Bring water, cornmeal, butter and nutmeg to a simmer in a large heavy-bottomed pot with a thick bottom (like a Dutch oven) over moderate heat until thickened into a soft dough, about 20 minutes. Stir in the basil, salt and more nutmeg. Transfer to 2 small baking dishes (about 8" by 8") or 1 large baking dish (about
In a large bowl combine cucumber and chicken. Add yogurt and mix well. Add Miracle Whip and mix well. Add olives and parsley. Add oregano and garlic. Toss together. Serve over a bed of lettuce.

Bring 4 quarts water to boil in large pot. Add 1 tablespoon salt. Break 1/2 cup pasta into pieces in boiling water. Cook 1 minute or until pasta is al dente. Drain. Cut tomatoes in half. Scoop out pulp and seeds. Set tomatoes aside. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add onions. Cook 2 minutes or until tender. Add basil leaves. Cook 2 minutes more. Remove from heat. In another skillet over medium heat, cook prosciutto until crisp. Drain on paper towels. In small bowl, combine tomato pulp and juice. Add 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper. Stir in butter. Add pasta. Toss to coat. Divide pasta among 4 serving plates. Top with tomato sauce and prosciutto. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Place 1 cup of rinsed quinoa in a medium pot. Add 3 cups of water. Bring to a boil, lower heat, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes. Uncover pot and continue cooking for an additional 10 minutes or until quinoa is tender. Stir in 1/2 cup of frozen blueberries. Season with sea salt. Divide into two bowls. Top each bowl with 1 Tbsp of almond butter. Serve warm.

Cook pasta according to directions. Drain. Rinse with cold water. Drain again. Rinse pasta in a colander. Set aside. Place green onions in a small bowl. Cover with milk. Let soak for 30 minutes. Drain milk from onions. Squeeze milk out of onions. In a large bowl, combine pasta, frozen peas, onions, tuna, yogurt, mayonnaise, dijon mustard, garlic, milk onions. Add 1/4 teaspoon salt & 1/8 teaspoon of fresh ground pepper. Refrigerate for 2-3 hours to blend flavors. Serve cold. Serves 6.

Combine and cook butter, brown sugar and light corn syrup in a medium saucepan over low heat until the mixture boils. Remove from heat. Add the popcorn and mix until all pieces are coated. Add the vanilla and salt and stir to combine. Pour out onto waxed paper to cool. Store in an airtight container.
Name: nutty caramel cornIngredients: brown sugar, margarine, corn syrup, salt, butter flavoring, maple flavoring, cream of tartar, baking soda, popped corn, mixed nutsPreparation:In saucepan, combine brown sugar, margarine, corn syrup, and salt. Boil for 6 minutes, stirring constantly. Add flavorings, cream of tartar, and soda. Pour over popped corn and nuts, mixing thoroughly. Spread glazed mixture out on a large baking sheet. Bake in 200 oven for one hour.
Name: caramel popcorn snackIngredients: butter, white sugar, brown sugar, corn syrup, salt, vanilla, baking
Mix all the above ingredients in a crock pot on high for four to six hours. If you don’t have time to cook it all day in the crock pot you can cook it on high on the stove for about 20 to 25 minutes.

Heat olive oil in a large pan and saute onion and garlic until softened. Then add chicken breasts, season with flour, then stir in chicken stock and tomato juice. Add corn kernel, hot chili peppers and fresh cilantro. Heat through. Serve hot.

In a large skillet, saute chicken breasts, garlic and onion until chicken is no longer pink. Stir in lemon juice. Add the parsley. Cook and stir until heated through. Remove from the heat. In a small bowl stir together seasoning salt and lemon-pepper seasoning. In a 12-inch skillet, melt butter and margarine over medium-high heat. Add the olive oil and green onions. Cook and stir until lightly browned. Add the thin spaghetti and lemon seasoning. Toss. Add the chicken mixture and toss to coat. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Makes 4 servings.
Blend together first three ingredients in a heavy saucepan. Add kirsch and heat until melted and bubbly. Serve in a fondue pot with cubes of bread for dipping.

Preheat oven to 375f. Season sea bass with salt and pepper. Heat a small amount of olive oil in a heavy skillet or sauté pan. Sauté onion until soft and translucent. Add garlic. Remove sea bass from pan and set aside. Add honey to onion and garlic mixture. Cook over high heat until honey is reduced by half. Season with thyme. Return fish to pan. Add butter. Bake covered in a baking dish for 10 minutes. Uncover and bake for 10 minutes more.

In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the oil. Saute the garlic in oil for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in the cream cheese. Cook and stir the mixture until smooth over low heat about 5 minutes. Pour the cream into the skillet. Stir constantly until mixture comes to a boil. Remove the sauce from the heat. Stir in the parsley, salt & black pepper. Serve over your favorite pasta or vegetables.

Mix together the first 3 ingredients. In a 9-inch pie pan arrange the sliced bananas in the pie crust. Pour the pudding mixture over the sliced bananas. Cool completely. Fold in 1 cup of cool whip and spread over top of pie. Refrigerate at least 3 hours before serving. You can garnish with additional cool whip. I like it better without any.
I have been trying to locate the recipe for the banana pudding pie that was served at the Rice Hotel in Houston, TX. It was the best tasting banana pudding I have ever eaten. It was served in a chilled glass bowl and I believe the crust was made from graham crackers. I have looked at every recipe on this site for banana pudding, but none of them resembled the one at the Rice Hotel. If you can help me out with this I would appreciate it very much. Thanks in advance.
I just finished making this Banana Cream Pie and it was delicious. It was very easy and everyone loved it!
Hi I am looking for a

Sauté onions and garlic in olive oil. Add tofu and spices. Let cook while making toast. In a bowl, mix eggs and tofu mixture. Cook in the same frying pan over medium heat until the egg mixture is set but still creamy. Add toast. Top with diced avocado if desired. Enjoy!

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute until soft. Add diced tomatoes and cook for 2 minutes. Add heavy whipping cream and bring to a boil. Add fresh basil, reduce heat to low and simmer until sauce thickens. Season to taste with salt and ground pepper. Lay chicken breasts in a baking dish and top with tomato basil cream. Bake at 400 degrees for 20-25 minutes until cooked through and no longer pink in the middle. Serve with rice or pasta and a side salad.

Mix the cornflour into the milk. Gradually stir in the orange juice and lemon juice. Add the sugar and lemon rind. Cook over medium heat until thickened and bubbly. Cool and divide mixture evenly into 4 dessert pots or 8 dessert cups. Refrigerate until cold. Top each pot or cup with 2 tbsp yogurt and 1 tbsp each of orange segments and red grapes. Serve cold.

Mix together first two ingredients, add shrimp and garlic powder. Form into a ball and refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve with crackers or celery sticks. Can be made ahead and refrigerated until ready to serve.

Cream together the margarine and cream cheese in an electric mixer. Gradually add the sugar and beat until creamy. Add the eggs and beat until well blended. Add the orange rind and vanilla. Stir in the flour and salt. Roll into 1-in. balls and place 2 in. apart on ungreased cookie sheets. Flatten to 1/4-in. thick with a fork. Bake at 350f for 15-17 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool for 1 minute. Remove from pans to wire racks. Cool completely. Store in an airtight container. To make the glaze: Place the chocolate chip in a small, heavy-duty zip-top plastic bag. Microwave for 1-2 minutes or until melted. Snip off a corner of the bag and pipe onto the cookies.

In a large heavy pan, saute garlic in olive oil for 30 seconds to 1 minute until fragrant. Stir in the canned tomatoes with their juices. Bring to a boil over high heat and then reduce to a simmer. Lower the heat so that the liquid is barely bubbling and cook for 1 hour. Taste the sauce and season with salt and pepper. Serve hot over pasta.
Name: Tomato Sauce II
Name: Hot Spicey Tomato Oil For Dipping
Name: Awesomely Easy Marinara Sauce
Name: Italian Style Tomato Sauce
Name: Broccoli Tofu And Peppers In Orange Sauce
Name: Marinated Tomato Slices Marinierte Tomaten
Name: Wheatley Hills Marinara Sauce
Name: Spicy Tomato Sauce Martha Stewart

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain. Heat beef in skillet. Drain. Add taco seasoning and water. Cook over medium heat until beef is tender. Cool. Cut macaroni into 2 inch pieces. In large bowl combine all ingredients. Cover and chill at least 1 hour.
Combine watermelon, ketchup, brown sugar, lemon juice and garlic powder in saucepan. Simmer 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Cool to room temperature. Add onion powder to taste.

Rub the rims of four glasses with a lime wedge. Dip the rims in the salt. Place the ice in a blender. Add the grapefruit juice, tequila, Campari and Triple Sec. Blend until smooth. Pour into the glasses. Garnish with the lemon slices. Serve immediately.

Sauté the onions in the butter until soft and lightly browned. Add the garlic and continue to cook for another 10 seconds. Add the sugar and continue to cook for another 10 seconds. Add the chicken stock and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the dry white wine and cook for another 5 minutes. Add the cornflour mixed in a little water and simmer for another 5 minutes. Add the gruyere cheese and the kirsch and continue to cook for another 2 minutes. Season to taste with freshly ground nutmeg. Serve in a deep bowl with pieces of French baguette. Serves 4.
We have a lot of great recipes for soups from the archives of the Cooking Forum.
This is a great place to look for your favorite soups.
You can also look here for other types of soups.
I have a few recipes that might be of interest to you.

Combine cornmeal and breadcrumbs in a shallow bowl. In another bowl, combine 1 teaspoon dill weed, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon paprikaadd milk to make a paste. Dip fish in paste mixtureturn to coat both sides. Dip coated fillets in cornmeal mixture to coat. Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add fishcook 3 minutes per side or until browned. Transfer to a serving plateserve with lemon wedges.
battered fishingredients: flour, cornstarch, baking soda, baking powder, salt, water, fishpreparation:Sift dry ingredients. Add water and mix well. Use to coat fish or chicken filets. Cover the fish completely. Deep fry until a nice golden brown.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Coat a 10- by 15-inch rimmed baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray. Place the chicken breasts on the baking sheet. In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Mix well. Spread the mixture evenly over the chicken breasts. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes, or until the topping is golden and no pink remains in the chicken.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Season the chicken with the spices. Coat a baking dish with cooking spray. Arrange the chicken in the dish. Heat the apricot preserves with the orange juice in a small saucepan over medium heat until the preserves are melted. Spoon the mixture evenly over the chicken. Bake for 20 minutes or until the juices run clear. Arrange the red bell peppers around the chicken. Bake for 10 minutes longer or until the peppers are tender. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 350f. In large bowl, combine soy sauce, rice vinegar, bourbon, brown sugar, scallions and minced garlic. In another bowl, combine the flour and ginger. Season the thighs with salt and pepper and dredge in flour mixture. Heat 2 inches of vegetable oil in deep frying pan over medium high heat. Fry the thighs for 4 minutes per side or until golden. Drain the thighs and place them in the bowl with the soy and vinegar mixture. Let them marinate for 2 minutes. Transfer to baking dish and bake for 20 minutes. Serve with rice or noodles.

Heat olive oil over medium heat in a large skillet or saucepan. Add the garlic and saute 1 minute. Add the onions and saute 5 minutes or until onions are translucent and softened. Add the cracked wheat and saute for 1 minute. Add the broth and salt, stirring to combine. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Serve hot.

Place all in medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium high heat. Remove from heat and stir in oats and coconut. Drop by teaspoonful on waxed paper. Let stand until cool. Store in air-tight container in refrigerator. Serve with whipped cream or ice cream if desired.

Choose a mixture of fresh fruits for this salad. If you would like to add a little more crunch to the fruit, add some nuts. Toss the sliced fruit in the yogurt, stir in the nuts and add the honey and lemon rind. Taste and adjust the flavors to suit your palate.

Prepare graham cracker crust. In a large bowl, cream together cream cheese and sugar. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add vanilla and beat well. Spread evenly over crust. Top with the cherry pie filling. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Cool completely. Refrigerate.

Bring water to boil in a large saucepan. Add the tea bags and let steep for 5 minutes. Remove the bags and add the vanilla bean and bay leaves. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add the ginger and simmer for another 10 minutes. Strain the liquid into a large pitcher. Add the cinnamon stick, honey and milk. Stir and refrigerate for 2-3 hours. Before serving, stir in ice cubes.

Wash and scrub cukes well. Put in a bowl, cover with salt and cover with a towel. Let stand 1 hour. Drain well. Cut into spears or wedges about 1 inch thick. Put in a bowl with enough water to cover cukes. Let stand 2 hours or overnight. Drain well. In a saucepan boil 3 cups of water with 1/2 cup of sugar for 2 minutes until clear. Remove from heat. Add 1 cup of white wine vinegar and 2 tablespoons of whole mustard seeds. Cool to room temperature. Combine drained cukes and 1/4 cup of mustard seeds in a large jar or bowl. Stir in 1 tablespoon of freshly ground black pepper. Add 2 teaspoons of whole cinnamon stick and 4 whole cloves. Add cooled syrup mixture to jar or bowl. Cover tightly and store in a cool place for 2 weeks or more before serving.

Preheat oven t 375. Beat the first five ingredients for one minute. Add the rest of the ingredients. Drop from teaspoon onto waxed paper. Bake for 10 minutes. Let cool on the baking sheet for two minutes. Remove from baking sheet. Serve warm.

Cook the noodles in boiling water according to package directions. Drain, then rinse in cold water. Combine the butter, milk, seasoning, and pepper in a large saucepan. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Add the noodles to the saucepanstir to combine. Add the cheese. Transfer to an 11 x 15 inch baking dish. Topping combine the breadcrumbs, butter, and milk. Spread over the noodles. Bake uncovered for 20 min.

Heat the sauce in a saucepan over low heat. Place the frozen meatballs in a greased casserole. Pour the sauce over the meatballs. Top with cheese. Place the submarine rolls in the oven to brown. Serve the rolls with the casserole.

Preheat oven to 375f. Grease 12 muffin cups. Combine dry ingredients in medium bowl. In another small bowl, whisk together buttermilk, egg whites and honey. Make well in center of dry ingredient mixture, then slowly pour in wet mixture until well combined. Stir in berries by hand just until combined. Spoon into prepared cups. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pans 10 minutes. Remove from pans. Cool completely on wire racks.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Place tenderloin in roasting pan. Drizzle tenderloin with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook in oven for 30 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 160 degrees F. Cut apples into 1/2-inch slices. Place in large saut pan and cover with water. Add sugar and thyme. Bring to boil and then simmer until apples are tender and liquid has reduced by half. In saut pan over medium heat, saute onions and garlic in olive oil until tender. Add olives and cook until liquid from olives evaporates. Add vodka and flame until vodka evaporates. Add chicken stock and reduce by half. Add heavy cream and reduce by half. Add butter and thyme. Drain the apples and add to saut pan. Simmer until apples are tender. Remove tenderloin from oven and place in oven proof dish. Spoon apple vodka sauce over tenderloin and serve.

Combine first three ingredients in a sauce pan and bring to boil. Cook for 2 minutes stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and cornflakes. Pour into greased pan and refrigerate until firm. Break into pieces.
Soak beans overnight. Boil beans with garlic cloves until soft. Add lemon juice and cumin. Serve with pita bread.

In large bowl combine margarine and shortening with sugar, then add egg and vanilla and mix well. Blend in chocolate chips and combine with flour, baking powder and unsweetened cocoa powder and mix well. Pour into greased and floured 9x13 inch pan and bake at 350 degrees for 35 to 45 minutes until done. Makes 36 squares.

In a skillet saute the onion and garlic in olive oil until the onion is tender. Add mushroom and cook for 5-10 minutes. Season with salt and black pepper. Remove from heat and let cool. Preheat oven to 450 degrees. On the pizza crust spread tomato paste. Top with the mushroom mixture. Sprinkle with parsley. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until the cheese is bubbly. Let stand for 5 minutes before slicing.

In a 3 qt. Saucepan combine the white wine, honey mustard, brown sugar, water, potatoes and kielbasa. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes. Add the sliced onions and parsley and mix well. Serve immediately. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 350f. Heat oven to 350f. In a 13 x 9 inch pan combine stuffing mix with light butter and light sour cream. Spread evenly in the pan. Combine cream of celery soup with cream of chicken soup and pour over stuffing mix. Arrange chicken tenderloins on top of soup mixture and bake for 25 minutes until tender.

Preheat your oven to 350. Peel the potatoes and boil them until soft. Mash the potatoes with a fork. Add in the white potato and butter. Add in the egg, egg white, and water. Knead dough on a lightly floured surface. Divide the dough in half. Roll each half out with a rolling pin until the dough is about 1/4 inch thick. Roll the dough up jelly roll style. Place the rolls in a greased 9x13 pan. Cover the rolls with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place for about 30 minutes. Mix together the brown sugar, water, butter, and cornstarch. Bake the rolls for about 30 minutes. Pour the brown sugar mixture over the rolls while they are still warm. Let cool before eating.

Chop the parsley coarsely with the blade of the food processor fitted with the steel blade. Add the lemon juice, worcestershire sauce and sweet unsalted butter and process until blended. Chill for 3 hours before serving. The butter will keep in the refrigerator for up to 3 weeks. Makes 1 cup.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Sprinkle frying chickens with thyme, rosemary, sage and parsley. Rub with salt and pepper. Place onions and celery in a roasting pan. Add the frying chickens and pour the chicken broth into the bottom of the roasting pan. Add the frying chickens. Place in the oven and roast for 1-1/2 hours. After roasting, remove the frying chickens from the pan and set aside. Strain the liquid into a saucepan. Bring to a boil and add the minced garlic. Simmer for about 10 minutes until the liquid reduces to about 1/2 cup. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with frying chickens.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Brown chicken in skillet or broiler until no longer pink. Remove from skillet or broiler. To dripping in skillet add onion soup mix, cream of mushroom soup, rice, and water. Cook until hot, stirring frequently. Pour over chicken. Cover and bake for 25 minutes. Uncover, cook additional 5 minutes. Serve over hot rice.

Cut butter into flour and creole seasoning until mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in water and hot sauce. Bring to a boil and simmer for 2 minutes or until thickened. Brush tops of hoagie rolls with butter mixture and toast. Spoon chicken and hot sauce mixture on bottom of buns and garnish with carrot and celery slices and onion rings. Top with a slice of blue cheese. Serve with the dressing on the side.

Grate potatoes and mix with egg yolk, season with kosher salt. Add chopped jalapeno and oregano. Add matzo meal. Heat oil. Form potato mixture into latkes and fry to golden brown. Serve with sour cream and apple sauce.

Place chicken in shallow baking panset aside. Combine soup mix, mushrooms and mayonnaise in medium bowlset aside. Dip each chicken breast in soup mixtureturn to coat on both sides. Sprinkle with breadcrumbslightly press into chicken. Place chicken in oven. Bake 45 min or until chicken is done and crumbs are golden brown. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheesebake 5 more min. Cut into 1-inch pieces. Makes 4 servings.
Brown the hamburger with the onions and drain the fat. Add the macaroni and the can of tomato soup and the can of tomato sauce. Add salt and pepper to taste.

Heat the butter in a frying pan, add the flour. Cook for a few minutes. Add the wine and stir. Slowly add the stock and cook on low heat for a few minutes. Add the mushrooms and parmesan cheese. Simmer for 5 minutes. Mix the cream with a spoonful of flour to thicken it. Stir into the sauce. Season to taste.
It's a perfect time to visit the Philippines. The summer season is almost over. The Philippines has a lot to offer to tourists. There are lots of beautiful beaches to enjoy. If you want to go to the mountains you can choose to go to Baguio or to Sagada. But if you want to go to a place where you can have a great view of the sunrise you can go to Banaue.
There are also a lot of places to visit when you go to Banaue. You can visit the Banaue rice terraces which is a UNESCO World Heritage site. You can also visit the Tappiya Falls. It is located at the foot of Mt. Polis. You can also visit the Banaue Hotel

Cut cabbage into strips. Heat 2 tablespoons butter in large skillet. Saute cabbage until tender. Season to taste with sea salt and fresh ground pepper. Crumble cooked bacon. Set aside. Cook egg noodles in salted boiling water until tender, drain. Add remaining butter, thyme. Toss noodles to coat. Stir in cabbage mixture. Top with bacon crumbles. Serve with sour cream.

Heat olive oil in a wok over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until soft. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the portabella mushrooms and cook until the liquid is released and evaporated. Add the fresh basil leaves and cook for 30 seconds. Add the fresh spinach and stir until it begins to wilt. Add the cashews and raisins and stir until the cashews are lightly toasted. Add the soy sauce and toss. Season with salt and pepper.

Cook potatoes and sweet potato cubes separately in boiling water until tender but still firm. Drain well. Spray large baking sheet with cooking spray and place potatoes on it. Toss together potato cubes with spices and spread out evenly on baking sheet. Bake until golden brown and crisp on the outside but soft inside, about 30 to 45 minutes, depending on thickness of potatoes. Turn over halfway through baking and increase heat to 450 degrees F to brown both sides. Toss scallions into potatoes after turning to brown. Serve with sour cream and hot sauce.

Prepare pasta according to directions. When pasta is ready to drain, add onion and saute for 1 to 2 minutes. Add in the remaining ingredients and stir until well blended. Pour onto pasta and serve with minute steaks on top.

Mix together ground beef, egg, barbecue sauce, cheddar cheese, crackers, and bacon bits. Divide into 4 equal portions. Shape into 1/2-inch thick patties. Grill until cooked through, approx 6-8 minutes per side. Place a slice of cheese on the top of each burger the last minute of grilling. Heat until melted. Serve on toasted buns with lettuce, tomato, mayo, pickles, etc.

Heat the olive oil in a saute pan over medium heat. Add the garlic cloves. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the lemon peel strips and fresh oregano. Stir and cook for 1 more minute. Add the olives. Cook for 3 minutes. Remove from the heat. Season to taste with the black pepper. Serve warm.

Melt together butter, brown sugar and corn syrup. Remove from heat. Stir in Rice Krispies. Press into buttered 9x13 pan. Sprinkle with chocolate and butterscotch chips. Let stand until firm. Cut into squares.

Prepare pastry dough. Roll out and fit into a 9 inch deep dish pie plate. Arrange fruit in dish. Sprinkle with lemon juice and allspice. Combine cornstarch and equal. Stir in lemon rind and water. Boil for 1 minute. Cool slightly and pour over fruit. Bake at 400 degrees for 45 minutes. Cool. Makes 8 servings.

Drain the tuna thoroughly. Drain the pickle juice from the dill pickle. Combine the yellow mustard with the pickle juice from the dill pickle. Add the tuna, pickles, spinach and salt and pepper to taste. Toast the bun and top with a slice of swiss cheese. Place under the broiler until the cheese is golden brown.

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add the garlic and ginger, stirring often until fragrant. Add the cream and bring to a boil. Add the yams and simmer until tender, about 20 minutes. Season with salt & pepper to taste. Garnish with parsley if desired.
The name sweet potato (Ipomea batatas) is used to describe a number of species of plants native to the Americas, but most frequently to a species known as the "true" sweet potato. These plants are not closely related to the common potato (Solanum tuberosum) of the Andes.
Sweet potatoes were first cultivated in the Americas more than 5000 years ago. In the pre-Columbian era they were domesticated in southern North America. The cultivars of sweet potatoes have been greatly diversified by generations of selective breeding, the result of which are the hundreds of varieties now grown in the United States alone.
Sweet potatoes are grown around the world, especially in Asia where they are a staple food in many countries. The most popular

Combine 1/3 cup milk, 1/3 cup light cream and 1/3 cup sugar in a medium-sized saucepan. Stir in 4 tablespoons of cocoa and 1/2 teaspoon of each nutmeg and cinnamon. Heat over low heat until it comes to a gentle boil. Serve with 1 teaspoon of cinnamon extract in the center of each mug, top with 1 teaspoon of whipped cream and 1 or 2 marshmallows. Serve immediately.

Peel and pit the avocado, then coarsely mash it in a bowl with a fork. Add the lime juice, blending well. Mix in remaining ingredients, except for shrimp. Serve with shrimp as an appetizer, or as a dip for vegetables and crackers.

In a bowl, combine all the dry ingredients and whisk to blend well. In a separate bowl, whisk together the soymilk, oil and vanilla. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and pour the soymilk mixture in the center of the well. Stir just enough to moisten the dry ingredients. Do not overstir or the waffles will be tough. Heat the waffle iron and spray with cooking spray. Ladle some of the batter onto the waffle iron and cook according to the instructions. Repeat with the remaining batter. Serve hot with your favorite topping or condiment of choice.

Grease 9x 13 pan with oil or margarine and set aside. Mix first four ingredients together and add other ingredients and mix well. Pour into pan and bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Cool completely and cut into squares.
Combine first three ingredients. Form into patties. Brown in skillet or pan. Add seasonings. Cook 10 more minutes. Serve in a bun with lettuce and tomato.

In a large pot, combine 3 cups of cold water, 3 cups of milk, and 3 cups of potato pieces and bring to a boil over high heat. Once boiling, turn the heat to medium and add the butter and 1 tablespoon of the chopped parsley. Simmer for 20 minutes and then puree the mixture with a hand blender or food processor. In a small bowl combine the remaining 1 teaspoon parsley with the sour cream and stir until smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste and stir into the potato mixture. Place the soup back over medium heat and cook for another 3 minutes, stirring constantly so the soup does not burn. Serve immediately.

Heat olive oil in a medium saucepan. Add onion and cook until softened. Add garlic, cauliflower and stock. Bring to the boil. Lower heat, cover and simmer until tender (approx. 10-15 mins). Place the mixture in a food processor or blender and blend until smooth. Pour mixture into a saucepan and add water. Bring to the boil. Add oats, stirring well. Season with salt and white pepper. Stir in the curry powder. Simmer for 2 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan. Mix the water and stuffing together in a large bowl. Stir in the beef, eggs, and barbecue sauce until evenly blended. Pour into the baking dish. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven.

Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Stir in corn and cook until kernels are just tender. Remove from heat. Beat together eggs and milk. Stir into hot corn mixture. Add flour and salt and pepper. Stir until dough is smooth. Drop by tablespoonfuls onto lightly buttered baking sheet. Bake at 400 for 12-15 minutes or until edges are golden brown. Serve warm.

Combine orange juice and soy sauce in a large bowladd gingerroot and brown sugar and stir well. Add Worcestershire and 1 Tbsp canola oil. Toss to coat tofu cubes. Heat remaining canola oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook tofu in 2 batches for 3 min per side or until golden brown and cooked through.

Bring the water to a boil. Add the ginger, garlic, and chile. Cover and let steep for 10 minutes. Add the vinegar and stir to dissolve the salt and sugar. Add the turnips. Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Simmer gently until the turnips are just tender, 10 to 15 minutes. Cool slightly before serving.

Preheat oven to 425f. In a bowl combine the eggs with the pumpkin and milk. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the sugar substitute and continue beating on low speed for one minute. Pour the filling into the shell and bake for one hour. Cool before cutting. Garnish with whipped cream. Refrigerate leftovers.

In a 2-1/2-quart casserole dish, melt the butter over medium heat in a large skillet. Cook the onion until tender, about 5 minutes. Add the green pepper and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the flour and cook for 1 minute. Gradually add the sour cream, milk, and brothstirring constantly. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove from the heatstir in the cheddar cheese until melted. Place half of the mixture in a greased 1-1/2-quart baking dish. Arrange half the corn over the mixturesprinkle with half the bacon. Layer the remaining mixture over the corn, then top with the remaining corn and bacon. Bake until heated through, about 30 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley before serving.

Peel oranges. Combine apple juice, cinnamon stick, cloves, nutmeg and honey in saucepan. Simmer over low heat for 5 minutes or until spices are fragrant. Remove from heat. Add orange peel and lemon juice to potstir well. Serve warm or chilled with pineapple juice. Garnish with orange slices. Makes 4 servings.

Sprinkle the meat with the flour. Brown the meat in a skillet with a small amount of oil. Add the water and the seasonings. Bring to a boil, cover and simmer for 1 hour or until the meat is tender. Cook the potatoes in boiling water until tender. Drain and return to the pot with the milk and butter until mashing. Mash the potatoes with the butter until smooth. Spoon the meat mixture in a 9 inch pie plate. Spread the potatoes over the top, smooth the top with a fork. Bake in a preheated oven at 375 for 45 minutes or until the potatoes are brown and crisp. Serve hot.

Combine corn, butter, flour, salt, pepper. Add eggs, then milk. Beat well. Pour into buttered 9x13-inch baking dish. Dot with butter on top. Bake in 375 degree oven 1 hour or until souffle is firm. May be served hot or cold.

Place potatoes in a large pot of boiling water. Cook potatoes until tender. Drain and set aside. Saute onion and broccoli florets in butter until tender. Add to potatoes. In a small bowl combine the rest of the ingredients. Stir until smooth. Pour over potatoes. Top with shredded cheese. Bake until hot, 10-12 minutes.

Dust each chop with flour, then shake off excess. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add 2 tablespoons butter to panswirl until foaming. Brown chops for 2 minutes per side. Remove chops to a plateset aside. Add remaining 2 tablespoons butter to panswirl until foaming. Add onions and cook over medium-high heat until lightly browned, 10 minutes. Sprinkle chops with salt and pepperreturn to pan. Stir in vermouth, water and rosemary sprigsbring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and cook for 20 minutes, or until chops are cooked through. Remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Serve over rice or noodles with rosemary sprig as garnish.

Saute butter and onion. Add squash and cook 5 minutes. Add stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 20 minutes. Blend and bring back to a simmer. Add bacon and simmer 5 minutes. Add cream and cook until heated through. Stir in sour cream and sprinkle with cheese and sage. Serve with fresh bread.

Beat eggs with milk. Beat in baking powder and salt. Sift in 3 cups flour and mix well. Sift in remaining flour 1 cup at a time beating well after each addition. Heat oil in a deep fryer or skillet. Drop batter by tablespoonfuls into the oil and cook until golden brown on both sides. Drain on paper towels. Serve with syrup or jelly and butter or jam.

Butter a 13x9 inch baking pan and pour in the chocolate mixture. Place the baking pan in the freezer for about an hour. Combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Form into patties. Lightly dust patties with flour. Cook patties in hot oil for 2-3 minutes each side until cooked through. Drain on paper towel. Serve with salad.

Heat the oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring, until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. Spoon into greased loaf pan. Bake for 40-45 minutes at 375 degrees. Serve with butter or your favorite topping.

Cover and reduce heat. Cook 20 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in pomegranate. Add lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with foil and place parchment paper on top of it. Arrange them in one layer on prepared baking sheet, and roast in the preheated oven until they begin to burst open, about 45 minutes. Meanwhile, toast the garlic in a small pan over medium heat, stirring constantly until it is golden brown and crispy, about 5 minutes. Transfer to paper towels to drain. Increase the oven temperature to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). In a small bowl, combine the remaining oil and the remaining smoked paprika. Brush the mixture onto each of the cherry tomatoes, and sprinkle each with a pinch of red pepper flakes and thyme sprig. Roast until the tomatoes are golden brown and their skins are cracked, about 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and

Preheat oven to 400F (200C). Brush a 9×13 inch (23x33cm) baking dish with a little of the olive oil. Add a layer of the pasta and top with a third of the rosemary cream sauce. Add another layer of pasta and another third of sauce. Repeat until all the pasta is used. Sprinkle on the parmesan cheese and bake for 15-20 minutes or until bubbly. Garnish with the chives and serve.

Saut onions and garlic in oil for 5 minutes. Add pumpkin and cook for 2 minutes stirring constantly. Pour soymilk and vegetable broth over pumpkin and simmer for 20 minutes or until pumpkin is tender. Remove from heat and add curry powder and dried parsley and allow to steep for 10 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper and serve hot with crackers or bread. Garnish with fresh parsley or cilantro and sprinkle with toasted pine nuts.
Mix cottage cheese with lemon yogurt. Stir in honey and orange rind. Fold in coconut and serve with fresh fruit.

To prepare marinade, combine grand marnier, apricot jam, orange zest and white vinegar in medium saucepan. Bring to a boilreduce heat. Cook until slightly thickened, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Cool completely. Meanwhile, combine remaining ingredients except chicken in a large resealable plastic bag. Add chickenturn to coat. Refrigerate, covered, at least 1 hour. Preheat grill. Remove chicken from bagdiscard marinade. Grill over medium heat 6 minutes on each side or until done. Yield: 4 servings.
I have been making these since I first read this post. They are so good! We love them.
I love this recipe and have made it many times. It always turns out perfect and we love it.
This is a great recipe and really easy to put together. Thanks for posting!
I found this recipe on pinterest and it was delicious! It was so easy and everyone loved it.
I can't wait to try this! I'm sure my family will love it.
