Mix water, vanilla flavoring and flavor enhancer. Add crisco and butter. Mix on low to medium speed. Add powdered sugar in small batches to desired consistency. Beat until light.

Cut the oranges into thin slices. Arrange the orange slices on a serving plate. Combine the dates with the almonds and sprinkle over the orange slices. Add a few drops of rose water, if desired and garnish with mint leafs.

Combine horseradish and mustard. Reserve 1/4 of the mixture for brushing on the filets. Blend the remaining mixture with the olive oil. Combine the remaining mixture with the salt and pepper. Sprinkle the filets and press the mixture onto the filets. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the filets to the pan and cook 12 minutes or until desired degree of doneness. Turn the filets over and brush the top side of the filets with the reserved mixture. Cook 12 minutes or until desired degree of doneness. Let stand 5 minutes. Slice filets and serve.

Place the fish in a medium sauce pan. Add the wine, orange juice, water and peppercorns. Bring to a boil, cover and cook over low heat for 5 minutes or until the fish is opaque and just cooked through. Remove the fish and set aside on a serving platter. Strain the liquid into a small saucepan and bring it to a boil, add the tarragon and lemon zest and reduce until it is slightly thickened. Pour the sauce over the fish and serve immediately. Serves 2-4.

Peel and core the apples. Cut into wedges and place in a large non-stick frying pan. Add the caster sugar and lemon juice. Cover with a lid and cook for 10 minutes. Remove from the heat. Meanwhile, rub the pork with the butter and season with the salt and freshly ground black pepper. Place the pork chops in a roasting tin. Place the apples on top of the pork chops. Roast in the oven for 30 minutes or until the pork is cooked through.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Sprinkle the chicken breasts on both sides with salt and pepper. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Melt the butter. Add the shallots and saute until soft and translucent. Add the chicken stock and bring to a boil. Add the chicken and the vermouth and simmer for 3 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and let cool. Transfer the chicken to a baking dish and top with the artichoke hearts. Bake for 25 minutes or until the chicken is done. To make the sauce, combine the cornstarch and cold water and whisk. Add the shallots and the green grapes and bring to a boil over medium heat. Add the sauce to the baking dish and stir until it thickens.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook onion and garlic in hot oil until soft but not browned, 3 minutes. Add fish and shrimp and cook until fish is white and shrimp are pink and opaque through. Stir in diced tomatoes and chile. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in parsley. Serve over hot cooked linguine.
I like to take a box of the Trader Joes frozen pesto pasta and heat it up for a quick meal. It is so easy and delicious!
Linguine is the pasta shape that I most often use for soups. It is perfect for this one.
In a large saucepan sauté the bacon over medium heat until crisp. Add the onion and sauté until soft but not browned. Add the broth and bring to a boil. Add the linguine and cook according to package directions. Stir in the spinach and cook for 1 minute. Add the sage and cook for an additional minute or so. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot topped with Parmesan che

Combine apricots and warm water in a bowl and set aside for 5-10 minutes. Mash apricots to desired consistency and add to blender along with the remaining ingredients and blend until well combined. Pour mixture in to serving glasses and serve immediately.
Combine all filling ingredients and stir well. Pour into prebaked pie shell. Bake 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until filling is set. Cool before slicing.

cook the pasta as directed on the package. while the pasta is cooking make the pesto sauce. combine the pasta, the pesto sauce, the cream, the sun-dried tomatoes, the feta cheese, and the kalamata olives in a large bowl. mix well to combine. serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350. In a 12 inch skillet, brown the pork chops in the oil. Add the mushroom soup and water. Cover and bake for 20 minutes. Add the remaining ingradiants. Bake 10 minutes longer or until the chops are done. Serve with egg noodles.

Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Scrape out the center of the onion bulb. In a small bowl, combine the garlic with 1/4 cup (60 ml) of the olive oil, chili flakes and fennel seed. Spoon this mixture into the onion bulb, then set it aside to let it absorb the flavors while you prepare the rest of your meal. Once the flavors have blended, place the onion in a baking dish with a little water and bake for about 30 minutes or until tender. Drizzle with a little more of the olive oil while still warm to serve.
Combine cream cheese and dried beef and blend well. Shape into ball and roll in nuts. Chill. Serve with crackers or vegetables.

Beat together cottage cheese and eggs. Add sugar and milk and beat until smooth. Add dry ingredients. Beat until smooth and set aside. Heat oven to 350 degrees. In a greased loaf pan, pour half the batter. Sprinkle with a layer of dill. Pour remaining batter. Bake 45 minutes. Cool and slice. Spread with mayonnaise or sour cream. Sprinkle with more fresh dill.

Bring water to a boil in a saucepan. Remove from heat and stir in the unflavored gelatin until dissolved. Cool for 2 minutes. Add the fruit juice and stir to combine. Chill the mixture for 1 hour or until partially set. Add the champagne and stir to combine. Pour the mixture into the shot glasses and chill for 4 hours or until firm. Serve chilled.

In a saucepan combine the 1/2 cup water with the 1/2 cup milk. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture boils and thickens to a sauce-like consistency (about 1 minute). Stir in the flour and cook and stir for 1 minute more. Remove from the heat and beat in the butter, granulated sugar, and vanilla until the mixture is smooth. Let cool to room temperature. Transfer to a food storage container and refrigerate for up to 1 week.

Place the potatoes in a bowl with a good pouring of cold water to cover them well. Soak for about 30 minutes. While the potatoes soak, peel and thinly slice the fennel bulb. Cut the mushrooms into quarters. Cut the red bell pepper in half and remove the seeds and white pith. Cut each half into 3 long strips. In a large bowl combine the potatoes, fennel slices, mushrooms and peppers. Drain the potatoes in a colander and add them to the bowl with the other vegetables. Toss well to coat with olive oil. Spread out evenly in a single layer on a baking sheet. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake in a preheated 350 oven for about 35 minutes until the vegetables are nicely browned and tender when pierced with a fork. Remove from the oven and let rest for 10 minutes before serving.

Cut the cherry tomatoes in half and remove the seeds. Dip them into the beaten egg and then roll them in the bread crumbs. Heat the oil in a non-stick skillet and add the cherry tomatoes. Fry the cherry tomatoes until the crumbs are golden brown. Remove from the skillet and set aside. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the paprika and cook for about 1 minute. Add the onion and cook until the onion is soft and translucent. Add the walnuts and stir them in. Add the basil and cook for about 1 minute. Pour the lemon juice in and stir. Remove from the heat and season with the salt and pepper. Fill the cherry tomatoes with the mixture and top them with the parmesan. Serve warm.
Pesto is a delicious Italian sauce that can be served with a variety of meals. Whether you use it to top your favorite pasta dish or as a spread on your sandwiches or crackers, it’s sure to be a crowd pleaser!
In the past, I have used store
In a bowl combine the lime zest, lime juice and butter. Blend with an electric mixer until smooth. Chill until serving time. Spread on hot rolls. Makes 2 cups.

Peel and core the apples. Cut them into quarters and place them into a shallow baking dish. Mix together the dulce de leche and brown sugar and pour over the apples. Bake for 15 minutes or until the apples are tender. Arrange the banana, apricots, cherries and ginger on top of the baking dish and bake for another 10 minutes or until the fruit is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly. Serve with marshmallows.

Preheat oven to 425. Divide pastry in half. On a lightly floured surface, roll each half into a 10x8 inch rectangle. Cut each rectangle into 4 equal squares. Press each square into a muffin pan cup. Combine egg, cream and cream cheese. Brush over pastry. Sprinkle with ham, onion and pepper. Bake 12-15 minutes or until puffed and golden. Let stand 5 minutes. Makes 8 servings.

In medium bowl combine ground beef with onion soup mix and cheese. Unroll crescent dinner rolls. Fill with beef mixture. Roll up. Place on cookie sheet. Bake uncovered 375 for 12-15 minutes until golden.

Heat oil over medium heat, saute garlic and onions until lightly browned. Add celery ribs and saute until softened. Add tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Add chicken broth, beans, salt and pepper to taste. Heat to boiling over medium-high heat, reduce heat to low and simmer until beans are tender, about 20 minutes. Garnish with parsley and serve immediately with parmesan cheese.

Heat oil in wok and saute shallots and mushrooms until soft. Beat egg and add to pan. Stir until egg is set and remove from wok. Add cooked rice and stir in soy sauce and garlic powder. Stir in mushroom mixture and season to taste with accent seasoning.

In a large bowl stir together apricots, figs, raisins, coconut, pecans, orange liqueur, almond extract and granulated sugar until well combined. Transfer mixture to a greased 13x9x2-in. Baking dish. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until top is golden. Cool completely on a wire rack. Spread top with butterscotch frosting or store in an airtight container.

Bake or steam tofu until firm. Drain spinach then place in a small bowl. Add cilantro and onion to spinach mixture. Add tofu. Mix well. Heat beans in microwave oven or in saucepan on stove top. Add to spinach and tofu mixture. Combine well. Place about 1/3 cup mixture in center of each egg roll wrapper. Fold in sides and bottoms of wrapper. Fold in top edge of wrapper. Repeat until all mixture is used. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Fry egg rolls 2 to 3 at a time until golden brown on all sides about 1-2 minutes. Remove to paper towel-lined platter. Serve with refried beans. Garnish with cilantro or additional toppings.

Cut the beef into thin slices. Brown the onions in a heavy pan with butter. Add the beef and brown on both sides. Add the mushrooms and cook until the liquid is all gone. Add the flour, stirring well to blend. Add the cream, milk and Bovril powder, stirring well to blend. Add the potatoes and stir well to blend. Cook over low heat until the potatoes are tender. Serve with hot buttered rolls.
name: steak supper special
ingredients: flour, salt, cube steaks, oil, french bread, chili sauce, water, worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, prepared mustard
preparation:Mix flour and salt. Coat steaks. In skillet, heat oil and cook steaks until browned on both sides. Place each steak onto a piece of bread and keep warm. Into drippings in pan, stir in chili sauce, water, worcestershire sauce, lemon juice and mustard. Stir to mix well and heat to boiling. Spoon sauce over steaks.

Slice tomatoes into thin circles. Slice steak-ums into strips. Assemble sandwich on roll with steak-ums, tomatoes, hot sauce, chili powder and monterey jack cheese. Top with avocados and more hot sauce to taste. Sprinkle with salt and serve.
Remove all visible fat from pork. Place in a shallow baking pan. In a small bowl, whisk together remaining ingredients. Brush over pork. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes. To serve, slice thinly.

In a blender or food processer add 2/3 cup parsley and 2 cloves of minced garlic. Pulse until parsley is finely chopped. Add 1 tablespoon oregano, 1 tablespoon paprika, 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper, 1/4 teaspoon salt. Add 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar. Add 1/4 cup olive oil. Pour over meat before grilling.

Heat oil in heavy large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add sausage and cook, stirring frequently, until browned, about 10 minutes. Add onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 10 minutes. Add carrots and celery and cook, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender and carrots are browned. Add parsnips and cook, stirring occasionally, until parsnips are tender and browned, about 10 minutes. Add italian seasoning and brown lentils and stir to combine. Add broth. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, until lentils are tender but not mushy. Add spinach and parsley. Stir and simmer just until spinach wilts. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.

Cream together the butter, sugar, and egg. Add the flour, soda, and salt. Mix well. Stir in the buttermilk. Fold in rhubarb. Bake in a 9 x 13 inch pan in a moderate oven, 350 degrees F for 30 minutes. Cool on rack.

In a large pitcher, combine the superfine sugar and fresh lemon juice. Add enough water to make a syrup about the consistency of pancake batter. Pour into two glasses half filled with cracked ice. Add a few fresh strawberries to each glass. Top each glass with sparkling water. Garnish with a mint sprig.
I thought this was a great idea because it would help me to get more fruits and vegetables into my diet.
I made this for my daughter who is very picky about her foods. I used some of her favorite fruits and vegetables. She loved it and it was very healthy for her.
This recipe is super easy to make and is really healthy for you. I made it for my kids and they loved it!
I really enjoyed this recipe. It was easy to make and very delicious. I will definitely be making this again.
My family and I love this recipe. It is a great way to get your daily dose of fruits and vegetables without having to eat them!
I am a big fan of juicing and smoothies. This recipe is great because it is easy to

In slow cooker, place thawed meatballs. In small bowl, combine barbecue sauce, maple syrup, green pepper, garlic cloves. Pour over meatballsstir to coat. Covercook on low for 5 hours or until meatballs are thoroughly cooked. About 1/2 hour before serving, add pineapple. Stir to combine. Remove garlic cloves before serving. Serves 4 as a main dish or 6 as an entree.

Cook diced chilies and onion in olive oil for 1-2 minutes. Add diced potato and cook another 10 minutes or so. Add milk and bring to boil. Pour into 9x13 casserole dish and allow to cool. Layer with cooked chicken breast and grated cheddar. Beat together the eggs and add a dash of milk if necessary to make the egg mixture thin enough to pour over the chicken and cheese mixture. Bake at 350 for 20-30 minutes or until browned and set.

Melt butter in small saucepan over medium heat. Add flourcook stirring constantly until lightly browned. Gradually stir in cream. Bring to a boil. Stir constantly until thickened. Remove from heat. Add velveeta. Stir until melted. Season with salt, black pepper, sugar, paprika. Serve over steamed cauliflower or broccoli.

Cook up corned beef. Add baked beans in tomato sauce. Add onion. Simmer for a few minutes. Spread in a greased casserole dish. Cover with mashed potatoes. Sprinkle with shredded cheese. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes.
Saute onion and garlic in oil until tender. Add tomatoes and olives. Stir well. Bring to a boil. Add beans and seasonings. Simmer 3 minutes. Sprinkle with feta cheese. Serve over rice.

In a small bowl combine the apple, walnuts, nutmeg, cinnamon and the sugar. Set aside.In a medium bowl beat the eggs with the water until well blended. Pour into a flat omelet pan and heat over medium high heat. Once the eggs are set in the center, sprinkle the brie cheese over the eggs. Top with the apple mixture and fold the omelet in half. Sprinkle with nutmeg and serve warm with a side of berries.

Whisk the eggs and the flour together in a small bowl. Pour the vegetable oil into a large frying pan. Heat the pan over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Dip an asparagus spear into the batter and place in the hot pan. Cook until the pancake is golden and the asparagus is crisp-tender, about 1 minute per side. Remove the pancake from the pan and repeat with the remaining spears. Sprinkle each pancake with a few pieces of pancetta and a few pinches of sea salt, then fold the pancake in half and serve immediately.

Preheat broiler. In a shallow bowl combine the olive oil, vinegar, garlic, basil and oreganomix well. Place tomatoes in the bowlturn to coat with the mixture. Broil tomatoes 3 in. from heat 4-5 minutes or until lightly browned and tomatoes are tender. Sprinkle with red pepper flakes and cheesebroil 1 minute or until cheese is melted. Yield 4 servings.
I’ve been making these for about 15 years now. It’s a great dish to make when you’re short on time. The sauce is great over pasta, but I usually eat it with the toasted baguette slices. It’s a great dish for a pot luck or holiday dinner, or just to serve with some fresh salad greens for lunch.
This recipe is really easy and comes together very quickly. It’s also very versatileyou can make it with a variety of different meats, or no meat at all if you’re vegetarian or vegan. I usually use chicken because it’s cheap

Heat butter in skillet. Add flour and whisk into butter. Add remaining ingredients. Cook until thick. Add water as needed. Cook until thick. Add chicken and cook until done. Serve with rice.
1. If you are going to serve this with a baked potato or a baked sweet potato, boil them separately while the chicken is cooking.
2. If you are going to serve this with rice or pasta, start the rice or pasta to cook while the chicken is cooking.
3. If you are going to serve this with a salad, start the salad to make while the chicken is cooking.
4. If you are going to serve this with a vegetable, start the vegetable to cook while the chicken is cooking.
5. If you are going to serve this with a dessert, start the dessert to make while the chicken is cooking.
6. If you are going to serve this with bread or rolls or tortillas or other bread or bread-like products, start the bread to toast or bake or warm while the chicken is cooking.
7. If you

Snap woody ends off of asparagus and boil for 3-5 minutes or until crisp tender. Drain and cool on towel. Toss with basil, oil, cider vinegar, sugar, pepper and basil. Add tomatoes and toss lightly. Serve at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9×13 inch baking pan. Layer half the tater tots in the bottom of the pan. Sprinkle with the cooked turkey sausage. Spoon half the cream cheese over the sausage. Top with half the eggs. Repeat layers once. Sprinkle with colby-monterey jack cheese. Bake in the preheated oven until the eggs are set and the top is golden, about 30 minutes. Sprinkle with paprika before serving. Makes 4 servings.

Peel russet potatoes and cut into large chunks. Cook in boiling water for about 20 minutes or until tender. Drain potatoes and let cool slightly. Mash with a potato masher or a fork until desired consistency is reached. Combine mashed potatoes with fat-free margarine, fresh garlic, nonfat milk, salt, and ground black pepper to taste in a large mixing bowl. Mix thoroughly with a spoon. Reheat in the microwave for 1 minute to serve warm.

Beat the coconut milk with the eggs and the vanilla in a large bowl until well blended. Add the salt and beat well. Place 1 slice of bread in the coconut milk mixture and let soak up the liquid for 30 seconds. Place the soaked slice in a hot skillet or griddle. Cook for 3 minutes per side or until golden brown. Repeat with remaining slices. Top with the coconut and serve hot with butter.

Cut cucumbers in half lengthwise and remove seeds. Slice lengthwise into 1/4" thick slices. Combine remaining ingredients in saucepanheat until boiling. Remove from heatadd cucumber slices to mixture. Refrigerate overnight. Drain and serve.

In a blender container combine yogurt and milk. Blend until smooth. Divide into four small bowls or glasses and stir in blueberries and sugar. Pour into Popsicle molds or small paper cups. Insert Popsicle sticks and place in freezer. Let freeze for at least 2 hours before serving.

Heat a little vegetable oil in a frying pan and fry the onions until golden brown. Add the garlic and ginger and fry until fragrant. Add the carrots and fry for a further few minutes until slightly softened. In a mixing bowl combine the dark soy sauce and five-spice powder, pour over the carrots and stir well. Place the pineapple and mange-touts in a saucepan of boiling water and cook for 3 minutes or until tender, drain and set aside to cool slightly. Lay a piece of plastic wrap on a work surface and place a lamb chop in the center. Divide the carrot mixture between 4 of the pieces of meat and flatten with the palm of your hand so that it adheres to the chop. Roll up the meat and secure with cocktail sticks. Repeat with remaining meat and carrot mixture. Heat a little vegetable oil in a frying pan and add the rolls of lamb and fry until golden brown and cooked through. Transfer to a serving dish and garnish with pineapple and mange-

Preheat grill to high heat. Coat 1 side of each bread half with 1 teaspoon orange juice. Lay bread on grill 30 seconds per side. Remove from grill and spread 1 tablespoon orange marmalade on uncoated side of bread. Spread 1 teaspoon powdered sugar on remaining uncoated side of bread. Spread 2 teaspoons egg over bread that is spread with marmalade. Sprinkle with 1 teaspoon powdered sugar. Top with 1/2 teaspoon orange marmalade on top of egg. Top with 1 ham slice, 1 teaspoon powdered sugar on top of ham, 1 tablespoon orange marmalade on top of powdered sugar. Spread 1 teaspoon orange marmalade on top of egg. Sprinkle with 1 teaspoon powdered sugar on top of orange marmalade. Top with 1 ham slice, 1 teaspoon powdered sugar on top of ham, 1 tablespoon orange marmalade on top of powdered sugar.

Combine all ingredients except for the cheese. Transfer to a lightly greased 2-quart casserole dish. Cover and refrigerate for 8 hours. Uncover and sprinkle the top with the cheese. Bake at 350 degrees F for 15-20 minutes or until the top is bubbly and golden brown. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix together all ingredients except the roast. Stuff the roast with the mixture. Cover with foil and bake for 1 to 1-1/4 hours. Remove cover and bake for another 1-1/2 to 2 hours. Check at 2 hours to see if meat is cooked. Serves 8.

Heat oil in a large skillet or pan over medium heat. Add the shallotscook and stir until softened. Stir in the mushrooms. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the winestir to deglaze the pan. Bring the mixture to a boilreduce the heat. Simmer until the liquid is reduced by half. Stir in the heavy cream. Add the thymebring to a boil. Boil until the mixture begins to thicken. Remove from the heatstir in the mustard. Spoon the sauce over the pork chops.

Cook fettuccine according to package directions. Cook bell peppers and onion in oil until tender. Add broccoli florets and cook 4 minutes more. Combine bell peppers mixture with chicken and 1 can cream of mushroom soup. Heat through. Drain fettuccine. Add to chicken mixture along with basil and remaining can cream of mushroom soup. Toss together and serve with cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a food processor or blender, puree all of the pumpkin filling ingredients until smooth. Line a 9 by 13 inch baking dish with lasagna noodles. Spread pumpkin filling evenly over noodles. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake until browned, about 45 minutes. In a large skillet over medium heat, combine cream with wine. Bring just to a boil. Remove from heat. Stir in sage. Taste and adjust seasonings with salt. Drizzle cream sauce over pumpkin cannelloni. Sprinkle with more parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Coat a 9x13 baking pan with cooking spray. Place chicken breasts in pan. Pour teriyaki sauce over chicken. Bake until cooked through, about 15 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small bowl combine onion with 1/4 cup water. Let stand for 10 minutes. Drain onion. In a large saucepan bring stock to a boil. Add udon noodles. Cook as directed on package. Drain. Place in a serving bowl. Add onion, snow peas, and bean sprouts. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with chile. To serve place a portion of the chicken on top. Serve with salad.

Slice hard-boiled eggs in half lengthwise. Remove yolks and set aside whites. In a food processor or blender, combine yolks, jalapenos, sour cream, mayonnaise, lime juice, cumin, chives, salt and pepper. Pulse until smooth. Spoon mixture into egg whites. Top with sliced cilantro. Refrigerate until serving time.

Cut the loaf of French bread into 1-inch slices. In a large bowl, whisk together the corn syrup, brown sugar, butter and egg yolks. Add the milk and vanilla and whisk until smooth. Add the sour cream and stir until incorporated. Fold in the French bread slices. Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours. Arrange the French bread slices in a buttered 8-inch square baking dish. Arrange the strawberries and kiwi slices on top of the French bread. Pour the egg mixture over the fruit. Sprinkle the top with the brown sugar. Bake the French toast in the preheated oven until set and golden brown, about 50 minutes. Serve warm.

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken and cook about 4 minutes per side or until golden brown. Sprinkle with white wine and stir. Add broccoli and garlic. Cook 4 to 5 minutes or until broccoli is tender. Stir in cream of chicken soup and cook until heated through. Serve over pasta.

Combine pineapple juice, soy sauce, and brown sugar. Set aside. In a separate bowl, combine pineapple juice mixture with the ginger. Marinate beef in the pineapple mixture for at least 3 hours or overnight. Grill the beef 4-6 minutes per side and serve with remaining pineapple juice.

Cut the tomatoes in half. In a bowl mix the yogurt with the mustard. Sprinkle the cheese over the tomatoes. Pour the yogurt mixture over the top. Chill for at least 1 hour. Top with a little of the herbs just before serving. Serves 4.

Make pudding according to package directions. Spread in the bottom of a 9-inch pie pan. Cool. Mix cool whip and lemonade concentrate and spread over the top of the pudding. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Bring water to boil. Steep mint for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and discard mint stems and leaves. Add water and tea bags to infuse for 10 minutes. Strain and allow to cool for 15 minutes. Add lemon juice and sugar. Serve over ice in tall glasses. Garnish each glass with 1 lemon slice and 1 sprig of mint.

Choose very yellow, ripe plantains with black spots visible. Cut ends off plantain, then peel remaining skin off like banana. Slice diagonally in slanted pattern about 1 inch thick. In a frying pan over medium heat, heat butter, then sprinkle with ground cinnamon. Add vanilla extract and brown sugar to taste. Arrange slices on pan and cook until tender on both sides about 10 minutes per side or until golden brown. Remove from heat and serve. You can also use 1 tsp ginger and 1/2 tsp ground red pepper to taste or a dash of salt for spicier taste. You can also fry slices in oil. Serve with ice cream or whipped cream as a dessert or a side dish.

Boil carrots in chicken broth until just tender. Add zucchini to pan and cook for 5 more minutes. Add mint. Serve hot. Serves 4.
The zucchini is one of the oldest vegetable plants of the world. It was first cultivated in ancient Italy and Egypt. It is also called courgette.
The courgette is an annual plant of the gourd family. It is a long squash of different colors. The plant is large and can reach 40 cm in height. The leaves are large. The flowers are large and yellow. The fruit is the size of a cucumber. It is cylindrical, long and smooth. It can be light green, green, yellow, orange, white and grey.
Zucchini is a summer vegetable. It is very rich in water and has very little calories.
Zucchini is easy to grow in a garden. It needs sunlight. The plant requires a lot of water. It grows quickly. It can be harvested 60 to 70 days after planting.
Zucchini is eaten cooked or raw. It is used in sal

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Toss salmon fillets with the olive oil and season with salt and pepper to taste. Pour half of the honey-mustard mixture over the salmon fillets, then toss to coat evenly. Transfer salmon to a baking dish. Sprinkle with dill to tastedrizzle the remaining honey-mustard mixture evenly over the top of the salmon fillets. Bake in the preheated oven for 12 to 15 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and flaky.. Serve with lemon wedges..

In a bowl of electric mixer, whisk together the heavy cream and coffee granules until stiff peaks form. Gently fold in 1/2 cup of nutella until well blended. Pour into individual dessert dishes. Refrigerate for 2 hours or until firm. Top with whipped cream before serving.

Mix cream of mushroom soup, sour cream, swiss cheese, and dry sherry in 13x9x2-inch baking dish. Lay chicken on top of mixture. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Cover. Bake at 350 f for 35 minutes. Uncoversprinkle with mushrooms. Bake 5 minutes longer or until chicken is done.

Put wild rice and oats in a medium saucepan with water or stock. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes or until tender. Drain and rinse under cold water. Combine oats mixture with cherries, brown sugar and salt. Store in the refrigerator.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil and add the potatoes. Cook until they become tender when poked with a fork. Remove from the heat, drain and let cool slightly. In a sauté pan over medium heat, add 3 tablespoons of the butter (or 6 tablespoons if you want a richer flavor). When the butter has melted add the shallots and sauté for 2 minutes. Add the basil leaves, 2 tablespoons of the basil leaves, 2 tablespoons of the basil leaves and stir until the basil is wilted. Remove from the heat and add the cooked potatoes. Stir to combine and add the remaining 3 tablespoons of butter or 6 tablespoons if you want a richer flavor. Season with freshly ground black pepper. Toss to combine. Sprinkle with the chopped parsley and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line 9 x 13 baking pan with foil. Place 4 saltines in a row across the bottom of the pan. Place 1/2 of a chicken breast on top of the saltines. Top with 1/2 of the remaining condensed milk. Sprinkle with 1/2 of the parmesan cheese. Repeat with the remaining saltines, 1/2 of the remaining chicken breast, the remaining condensed milk, and the remaining parmesan cheese. Bake 40 minutes. Sprinkle with paprika and pepper. Serve with pasta.

Beat eggs and sugar in a mixer. Add salt and flour alternately with milk. Spread into a 15 inch tart pan. Bake for 45 minutes. Cool. Combine 3 cups evaporated milk and 2 cups sweetened condensed milk. Pour over cake. Refrigerate overnight. Cut into wedges. Serve cold.
name: easy peasy quick chocolate orange cakeingredients: caster sugar, margarine, flour, egg, baking powder, cocoa powder, vanilla essence, orange, juice and zest ofpreparation:Cream the butter and sugar together. Add the egg and the flour and baking powder. Add the orange rind and juice coco powder and vanilla essence. Mix well and pour into microwavable dish. Zap for five minutes in the microwave on medium. Serve with custard.
name: yellow angel food cakeingredients: egg yolks, cold water, salt, sugar, lemon extract, cake flour, cream of tartar

In a medium saucepan bring the water to a boil. Stir in the jello mix until dissolved. Remove from heat and add applesauce. Stir until thoroughly mixed. Add the lemon juice and the salt. Pour into a 9x13 pan or individual serving cups. Refrigerate until set. Combine the cream cheese with the milk until smooth. Gently stir in the mayonnaise. Fold in the nuts and spread over the jello. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Combine all dry ingredients in a large bowl. Add vanilla & mix well. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto baking paper & bake at 150C for 10 minutes. Remove from oven & sprinkle icing sugar over tops. Makes about 40.

Heat olive oil and butter in a large skillet. Brown the chicken pieces on all sides. Sprinkle with flour and season with salt and pepper. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the wine and lemon juice and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer, partially covered, until the chicken is cooked through. Transfer the chicken to a serving platter and sprinkle with parsley. Serve with hot cooked rice.

Beat the shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the egg yolks one at a time, beating after each addition. Add the flour, baking powder and salt. Stir in the milk and the unsweetened kool-aid powder. Divide the dough in half and flatten the dough halves into two round disks. Wrap each disk in plastic wrap and chill until firm. Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Remove the plastic wrap and roll out the dough to 1/4-inch thickness on a lightly floured surface. Cut out desired shapes with a cookie cutter. Place the cookies on an ungreased cookie sheet and bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Remove the cookies from the oven and cool on wire racks. Decorate the cookies as desired.

Brew strong coffee and stir in hot cocoa mix. Add orange liqueur, vanilla extract, and marshmallows. Sprinkle with cocoa powder. Top with whipped cream and garnish with orange peel and chocolate sauce.

In a bowl, combine the vinegar and 3 tbsp of the oil. Season with salt & pepper. Cut the cherry tomatoes in half lengthwise and arrange on a serving platter with the bocconcini. Brush the bread with the remaining oil and arrange on the platter. Arrange the arugula over the bread. Tear the basil into pieces & scatter over the arugula. Sprinkle with the garlic and drizzle with the remaining vinegar mixture.

Saute the onions in the butter until transparent. Add the mushrooms and saute until they lose their liquid. Add the wine to the pan and saute until evaporated. Add the tomato puree and presunto. Cook for about 5 minutes. Add the thyme and seasoning to taste. Serve hot.

Cut potatoes into cubes and place into a medium sauce pan of cold water. Cover pan and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium low and simmer uncovered for 20 minutes or until tender. Drain and place into a large bowl. Add garlic, bacon, scallions, milk, sour cream, salt and pepper. Beat with an electric mixer until smooth. Serve immediately.

Combine the sugar and corn syrup in a large microwavable bowl. Stir in the flavorings and coloring until evenly mixed. Microwave on high in 1-minute intervals, stirring each time until a smooth, shiny syrup is formed. Remove from the microwave and let cool in the bowl until it is no longer warm or sticky to the touch, stirring occasionally with a rubber spatula to break up any large crystals that form. Drop the mixture onto a parchment lined baking sheet by the teaspoonful, and let cool until firm to the touch. Store the hard candy in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 month.
Salt and drain eggplant. Fry in oil until soft. Mince onion and tomatoes. Mix together with the eggplant. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Let stand 5-10 minutes before serving.

Peel and slice onions and put in a large pot of water. Add salt and bring to a boil. Cook about 30 minutes or until tender. Add honey and bring to a boil again. Cook until thick and syrupy. Remove from heat and strain through a fine mesh strainer. Let cool for about one hour and then refrigerate. Makes 2 pints.
Peel and cube the bananas and the strawberries. Combine in blender with the grapefruit and orange juices, and the water. Cover and blend until smooth. Pour into tall glasses and serve immediately.

In a large mixing bowl cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time until well blended. Combine dry ingredients. Slowly add dry ingredients to the creamed mixture. Stir in sour cream and nuts. Chill dough at least 1 hour or overnight. Divide dough into 12 equal portions. Form each portion into a 3 inch ball. Place on greased baking sheet. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes or until slightly browned. Cool on wire rack.
Boil sweet potatoes till tender. Drain & add the rest of the ingredients. Mash. Serve hot.

Peel and devein the shrimp and rinse. Mix together the parsley and olive oil. Mince the garlic and press the lemon rind through a sieve. Skewer the shrimp alternating with the parsley mixture and the garlic. Arrange the skewers in a shallow dish. Add the lemon rind and pour the olive oil over the top. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Makes 20.

Combine chips and spices in large zip bag. Place fish in bag and shake until coated. Dip into eggs and roll in taco shells. Place in baking dish with lime juice. Bake 15 minutes at 400.
This is my favorite meal! I love to eat it when I get home from work. I'm not sure what it is about this recipe that I like so much. Maybe it is because I love fried fish and I like the taste of spicy.
I love the Cajun Rubbed Tilapia! My husband and I both like it. I have tried making it several ways and this is the best so far!
This was delicious! I have tried many different ways to cook fish and this is one of my favorites.
I made this for dinner and it was so good. I'm not a big fish fan but this was really good! My kids liked it too.
My family loved this recipe! We made it for dinner and everyone loved it. I've never seen Cajun Rubbed Tilapia before and was unsure of how it would taste. I was very surprised

Place breadcrumbs and butter in a medium skillet over low heat and stir to toast breadcrumbs until golden brown, 1 to 2 minutes. Pour tomatoes on top of breadcrumbs and let cook until tomatoes begin to break down, about 5 minutesstir occasionally. Remove from heat. In a small bowl, whisk together the heavy cream, the egg yolks, the Tabasco, the marjoram, and the salt and pepper to taste. Add to breadcrumb mixture and stir until combined. Arrange the egg whites on a platter or individual plates. Spoon the egg yolk mixture over the whites and bake until the whites are set, 15 to 20 minutes. Serve warm. Serve with bacon.
In a small mixing bowl, thoroughly whisk together eggs, reduced-fat mayonnaise, and salt. Heat a skillet over low-medium heat. Melt butter. Then add egg mixture. As eggs cook, slowly but constantly move them around skillet. Cook only until eggs are set, yet still soft and moist--avoid overcooking. Transfer scrambled eggs to
Cube the camembert. Place in a bowl and add pecans and Tabasco. Toss together. In a separate bowl beat butter and the lemon juice. Add the mixture to the camembert. Stir in pecans. Serve immediately.

In a skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Season pork with salt and pepper. Brown pork on both sides. Add onion and garlic. Cook until tender. Add water. Stirring constantly, bring to a boil. Add flour. Stir to combine. Gradually stir in broth and browning sauce. Return to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes, or until gravy reaches desired thickness. Serve over mashed potatoes.

In blender or food processor puree pineapple chunks and canned peaches. Add brown sugar and spices to taste. Set aside to chill. Place cool whip in freezer. Divide fruit into small bowls or ramekins. Layer fruit and cool whip in each serving until they are full. Serve immediately.

Wash the carrots and peel them. Cut them into small cubes. Cut the onion into small pieces. In a large pot with a lid add carrots, onion, and water to cover the carrots. Bring to a boil, reduce the heat to a simmer, cover the pot and simmer for about 40 minutes or until the carrots are very tender. Drain the liquid from the pot. Grind the carrots to a pulp using a potato masher or blender. Strain the pulp into a bowl with a fine mesh strainer. Squeeze the pulp to extract as much liquid as possible. In a large bowl combine the ground carrot pulp with the tuna fish, eggs, and ground pepper. Using a fork or hand mixer, mix the ingredients until they are well combined. Lightly oil the inside of a 9-inch pie plate with the oil. Form the ground carrots into a large ball and place the ball into the pie plate. Press the ball down into the pie plate until it is flat. The pie plate should be 1/4 to 1/2

Mix sour cream and butter together. Add 2 cups of flour. Mix thoroughly. Add salt and baking soda. Mix again. Add enough more flour until you have a soft dough. Knead. Add chives. Divide dough into 12 balls. Let rise. Bake. Makes 12 muffins.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl, melt butter in microwave oven. Stir in tabasco and worcestershire sauce. Add the pecans and toss well to coat evenly. Transfer to a lightly greased baking sheet and bake until lightly browned and fragrant, 10 to 15 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle lightly with salt and a few grinds of fresh black pepper and cayenne sauce to taste. Cool completely before serving. Store in an airtight container in refrigerator for up to a week.

Spray 10-inch skillet with cooking spray. Heat skillet over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms. Saute 3 minutes or until tender. Add onion and garlic. Saute until onions are tender. Stir in 2 cups water. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Add couscous. Stir in remaining 1 cup water. Cover. Let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff with fork. Top with additional mushrooms if desired. Serve immediately.

Prepare all the ingredients. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line the bottom of a baking dish with aluminum foil. Place the wings in the pan. Brush with 1/2 of the marinade, cover and bake for 1 hour. Brush with remaining marinade and bake 1 hour longer. Serve with rice.
Mix cake mix, pumpkin, eggs and oil as directed. Stir in chips. Drop by rounded tablespoon onto waxed paper. Bake 8-10 minutes at 350f. Cool 1 minute before removing from cookie sheet.

In large skillet, heat olive oil. Add onion, garlic powder and salt and pepper. Cook for 5 minutes or until onions are tender. Add tomatoes and continue to cook 2 minutes. Add zucchini. Cook 3 minutes, stirring frequently. Sprinkle with dried basil and parmesan cheese. Serve warm or room temperature

In a small bowl combine the flour and cajun seasoning. Place in a shallow dish. In another bowl beat together the egg and milk. Place the tilapia in the egg and milk mixture and coat evenly. Dredge the fish in the flour mixture coating both sides. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the tilapia in the skillet 3 minutes per side or until the fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve with lemon wedges.

Combine all the ingredients in a food processor until smooth. Transfer to a bowl and refrigerate for at least 3 hours or overnight. Brush both sides of the tuna steaks generously with the olive oil. Grill the fish until charred but still rare (4 to 5 minutes per side), or until the internal temperature is 120 degrees F. Serve immediately with the aioli.
Thai Tuna Salad Recipe
Chicken-and-Tuna-Salad Sandwich Recipe
Thai Tuna Salad
Tuna Sashimi Recipe

In a large stockpot over medium high heat, melt butter. Add onion & garlic. Cook until onions are clear. Stir in dry white wine & cook until wine is evaporated. Add flour & stir until flour is blended in well. Slowly add milk & whisk until sauce is smooth. Add salt & pepper to your taste. Add crabmeat & mix well. Serve over cooked noodles & top with fresh parsley.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease a baking sheet. Mix cake mix and egg whites in a large bowl until well blended. Stir in oats and oil. Stir in raisins. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto baking sheet. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden. Cool completely on baking sheet. Store in airtight container.

Heat oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and shallots and saute until just tender. Add white wine and sherry and bring to a boil. Cook until reduced by half. Add broth and beans and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 10 minutes. Add chili powder and cilantro and stir until combined. Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm over rice.

Spray a skillet with cooking spray. Brown sausage and drain. Add potatoes and cook until brown. Add the rest of the ingredients. Stir. Cover. Cook for 3-4 minutes or until cheese is melted. Remove from heat. Serve in a bowl.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).In large bowl, beat eggs, milk and vanilla extract with whisk until frothy. Combine cinnamon and nuts in separate bowlset aside. In skillet over medium-high heat, melt 1 tablespoon of butter. Dip one side of each slice of bread into egg mixture then turn and dip other side into mixture. Place in skillet, browning each side of bread. Remove from skillet and place on baking sheet. Spoon cinnamon-nut mixture over each slice of toast, spreading evenly with spoon. Bake in preheated oven for 5 minutes. Serve sprinkled with powdered sugar.
name: mac and cheese grilled cheeseingredients: cheddar cheese, shredded cheddar cheese, american cheese, cooked macaroni and cheese, whole wheat bread, margarine or butterpreparation:Cut the bread in half lengthwise and then again crosswise so that you have four triangles. Spread margarine or but

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In large bowl beat together eggs, applesauce and self-rising flour. Pour into 9-inch pie plate. Spray Pam cooking spray in plate. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool 10 minutes. Serve warm. Makes 8 servings.
Slice the tomatoes into wedges. Toss together the sliced tomatoes, scallions, parsley, prepared mustard, and vinegar. Add sugar to taste. Cover. Chill. Top with sour cream before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease two 9x5 inch loaf pans. Mash bananas with a potato masher in a large bowl. Combine brown sugar and egg in a small bowlbeat until smooth. Mix brown sugar mixture with mashed bananas until well blended. Whisk whole wheat flour, ground flax seeds, salt, and baking soda in a medium bowladd to banana mixture, stirring just until blended. Pour batter into prepared pans. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 50 minutes. Cool in pans for 10 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely. Store loaf in an airtight container.

Slice onion and place in 9 to 10 inch skillet. Pour in bottle of beer. Add brats and simmer until onion is tender and brats are firm and cooked through. When beer has evaporated, allow brats and onions to brown while turning frequently, adding a little oil if the pan needs it. When the onions turn golden, remove. When the brats are browned on all sides, plate them. Wrap the buns in paper towels and microwave on high for about 30 seconds until soft and warm. Serve with baked beans and or chips.
Marinate 30 minutes and turn several times. Heat heavy skillet. Add butter. When hot, add the steak. Cook over high heat until charred on other side. Serve immediately on a well heated platter.

Heat oil in a large pan. Add green onions and cook until soft. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add curry powder. Cook for 1 minute. Add cumin. Add cauliflower. Cook until tender. Add lentils. Cook for 2 minutes. Add tomato. Sprinkle with paprika.

In a microwave safe bowl or plate, melt the butter in the microwave. Add the vinegar and the tabasco sauce. Whisk and let cool slightly. In a small bowl mix together the cayenne pepper and the garlic salt. Add to the vinegar mixture and stir until well blended. In a shallow bowl add the salt and the raw cashews. Dip the cashews in the vinegar mixture and roll in the salt mixture until well coated. Spread out the cashews and let sit and cool. Store in a sealed container or plastic bag.

In a heavy-bottomed sauce pan combine the sugar, evaporated milk, light corn syrup, butter, dates and nuts. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook to soft ball stage. Add nuts. Remove from heat and beat until creamy. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper covered cookie sheets. Let stand until cool. Break into pieces with your hands. Store in a covered container.
name: 10 minute sweet potato casseroleingredients: 1 sweet potato, 1 tablespoon butter or margarine, 2 tablespoons brown sugar, 2 teaspoons bourbon, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, 1/4 teaspoon nutmegpreparation:Bring to boil 2 cups water in medium saucepan. Peel and cube sweet potatoadd to boiling waterreduce heat to low. Cook uncovered 10 to 15 minutes or until tenderdrain. Melt butter in heavy medium skillet over medium-low heat. Add brown sugarcook 2 minutes or

In a small bowl, combine the first 5 ingredients. Rub mixture over chicken. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat oil until hot. Add chicken and cook 10 minutes or until browned. Add next 4 ingredients. Bring to a boilreduce heat to low and simmer 15 minutes or until no pink remains. Sprinkle with basil. Serve over rice.

Heat oil over medium high heat. Brown the steak cubes. Add 1/2 cup broth to the skillet. Add 1/4 cup consomme to the broth. Add rice and cook until almost done. Add remaining broth and 1/4 cup consomme. Cook until tender. Serve over rice.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Melt butter and olive oil together in an ovenproof casserole dish. Add the sliced onions and saute over low heat until soft and golden. Stir in the wine and honey, then transfer to the oven. Bake for 30 minutes or until the liquid is bubbling. Sprinkle with thyme just before serving.
Cut livers into 3/4 inch slices. Dip in milk, then in flour mixture. Deep fry in oil until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve with tartar sauce or cocktail sauce.
Heat the oil and saute the onion. Add the green beans and stock. Cook uncovered until the beans are tender. Stir in the chopped basil and serve.
Combine cheese and butter in medium bowl. Mix horseradish and worcestershire sauce together. Mix into the cheese mixture. Add the red radish and green onion. Chill. Serve on crackers.

Mix together buttermilk and taco seasoning. Put flour in a shallow dish. Put breadcrumbs in another shallow dish. Heat butter in a frying pan. Coat each chicken piece in flour. Dip in buttermilk mixture then coat in breadcrumbs. Shake off any excess. Fry in hot butter until crisp & golden brown. Serve with salsa if you like.

Whisk egg in milk. In a shallow dish combine flour, cayenne pepper and parmesan cheese. Dip fish in egg mixture, then in flour mixture. Heat oil in a skillet until hot. Fry fish in oil over medium heat for 2-4 minutes or until golden brown on each side. Remove fish from pan and place on paper towels to drain. Sprinkle corn flakes over the fried fish. Serve hot.

Combine 1 cup whole wheat flour, baking powder, baking soda, sugar and salt in a bowl. Combine egg, milk, vanilla extract and 1/4 cup yogurt. Add to dry ingredients along with oil. Stir in raisins. Mix just until dough forms. Grease 8x4-inch loaf pan or 2 (8-inch) round pans. Spoon batter in pans. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until done. Cool for 5 minutes in pans then turn out onto wire racks to cool completely.

Place the ingredients in the pan according to the order in the manufacturers instructions. Set crust on medium and program for the basic cycle. Press start. When the baking cycle ends, immediately remove the bread from the pan and place it on a rack. Let cool to room temperature before slicing.

Heat olive oil in a large non-stick fry pan over medium high heat. Season chicken with salt and black pepper and place in the pan. Cook for about 10 minutes or until cooked through. Remove from pan and let cool. Meanwhile, cut the red and green peppers into strips and dice the onion. Heat a small amount of olive oil in a large non-stick fry pan over medium high heat. Add the red and green peppers and onions. Cook until the vegetables are slightly soft. Divide the chicken evenly into four French rolls. Divide the vegetables evenly between the rolls and add the Parmesan cheese. Enjoy.

Bring a pot of water to a boil. Add pasta and cook to al dente. While pasta is cooking, combine crabmeat, butter, oregano, garlic and tomatoes in a large saucepan over medium heat. Cook 2 minutes. Add whipping cream and bring to a simmer. Cook 2-3 minutes. Stir in green onions. Drain pasta and stir in sauce. Divide pasta among plates. Sprinkle each serving with Swiss and Parmesan cheese.

Prepare dressing by whisking together oil and vinegar. Whisk in parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper. Divide lettuce between two plates. Cut artichokes into quarters and arrange on top of lettuce. Garnish with pimiento, olives and red onion. Drizzle dressing over the top. Serve with crackers or bread.

Heat oil over medium heat in a large saucepan or dutch oven. Sear sausages on all sides turning often to brown all over. Remove sausages from pan and reserve liquid in pan. Set aside. Heat stock in pan. Add shallots and wine. Bring to a boil reduce heat to simmer. Simmer for about 10 minutes or until liquid has reduced by half. Whisk in butter one tablespoon at a time until melted. Whisk in parmesan cheese one tablespoon at a time until melted. Stir in parsley. Return sausages to pan and simmer for 3 minutes or until heated through. Serve on toasted bread slices.

Boil potatoes until tender in a large saucepan of boiling water. Draincool slightly. Slice cooled potatoesplace in a large bowl. Toss with butter and salt until well coated. Arrange potato slices in a single layer in a greased 15x10x1-in. baking dish. Bake uncovered at 425° for 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned, turning slices after 10 minutes. Sprinkle with cheeses and bake until cheese is melted.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Combine the butter and sugar in a small bowl and cream until smooth. Beat in the eggs one at a time until well combined. Stir in the buttermilk. In another bowl combine the cornmeal, gluten free flour, xanthan gum and salt. Stir into the butter mixture. Spoon into greased or paper lined 12-cup muffin tin. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Makes 12 Muffins.

To cook the quinoa, bring broth to boil in medium saucepan. Stir in quinoa. Reduce heat. Simmer uncovered until quinoa absorbs liquid and is tender, about 15 minutes. Transfer to bowl. Allow to cool. In skillet over medium-high heat, warm oil. Add onion. Cook until tender. Add jalapeno and paprika. Cook until jalapeno is tender. Stir in chile powder. Add swiss chard. Cook until tender. Add garbanzo beans. Cook until heated through. Toss with quinoa. Top with lime juice. Serve immediately.
Cut eggs in half lengthwise. Scoop out yolks into bowl with other ingredients and mash until a thick paste forms. Add more mayo if necessary to desired consistancy.

Combine sugar, corn syrup and syrup in a heavy 2 quart pan. Cook and stir until boiling. Cook and stir until candy thermometer reads 250 degrees. Remove from heat and add smooth peanut butter and crispy rice cereal. Stir until cereal is coated. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper. Cool. In double boiler melt chocolate and butterscotch chips. Dip each cereal ball into the melted chocolate. Place on waxed paper. Let stand until cool. Store in tight container.

Preheat oven to 375°. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Cut each clove of garlic in half lengthwise. Arrange the cloves in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Place in the oven. Roast for 1 hour. Remove from the oven. Turn off the oven. Cool for 10 minutes. Transfer the confits to a jar or a small crock and cover with the duck fat. Refrigerate the confits for 1 week to let the flavors blend. They will keep for up to 6 months.

In large bowl combine crabmeat, garlic, pickled jalapeno pepper and mayonnaise. Add worcestershire sauce and hot sauce to taste and mix well using a fork. Divide mixture equally into 2 serving bowls. Add jack cheese to 1 bowl and mix using a fork. Sprinkle Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese on top and serve with crackers or vegetable chips. Refrigerate any unused portions.

In a large bowl, mix together the salt and garlic. Add the cabbage and toss to coat. Transfer the mixture to a colander. Let sit at least 12 hours or overnight. Transfer the cabbage to a glass bowl. Mix in the olive oil and sesame seeds. Chill for at least 1 hour. Makes 1 cup.

In a large bowl combine the lemon gelatin with 1 cup of boiling water. Stir until dissolved and add the rest of the boiling water. Add the crushed pineapple and stir. Add the orange juice concentrate. Refrigerate until set. Add the mandarin oranges and refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease 24 muffin cups or use paper cupcake liners. Mash bananas in a bowl. In another bowl combine the sugar, egg, baking soda, and baking powderstir until smooth. Add the banana mixture and stir to combine. Combine the flour and saltstir into the batter just until blended. Fold in the butter and chocolate chips if desired. Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cupssprinkle with the walnuts if desired. Bake 15 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Makes 24 muffins.

Steam or blanch beans until tender, but still bright green. Melt the bacon fat in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Add shallots and saute until translucent. Add the bacon bits. Stir until crisp. Add the garlic and saute for 30 seconds, then add the flour and stir for about 30 seconds until the flour is lightly browned. Add the chicken stock and whisk until smooth. Bring the mixture to a boil. Add the chicken stock and whisk until smooth. Bring the mixture to a boil. Add the green beans and the cooking sherry to the skillet. Cook until the sauce is thickened. Season with the salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Combine all other ingredients except for liver and water in a large bowl and mix well. Cut liver in 1/4-inch slices and place in a plastic bag. Add enough dressing to completely cover liver in bag and seal. Refrigerate overnight. Remove from refrigerator 1 hour before cooking. Heat oil in skillet and fry liver until brown. Remove liver and place in a 13x9-inch baking pan. Add dressing and bake for 30 minutes.

Combine the potatoes, boiling water and vegetables in a large saucepan. Simmer covered for 25 minutes. Drain and return to pan. Add ham and mix well. Combine soup, milk and sour cream in a small bowl. Stir into potato mixture. Add pimento and mix well. Turn mixture into unbaked 9 inch pie shell. Sprinkle with pimentos and bake in a 350 degree oven for 40 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

Melt butter in a 2 quart saucepan over medium heat. Add onions. Cook until onions are soft & lightly browned. Add flour & paprika & stir until blended. Add milk & stir until thickened. Add pepper & salt. Remove from heat. Beat eggs lightly & add to milk mixture, stirring constantly until well blended. Pour into a buttered 2 quart baking dish. Sprinkle with cracker crumbs & dot with butter. Bake in a preheated 350 oven until eggs are set, about 45 minutes.

Cook spinach until almost dry. Crumble cream cheese into small bowl, add garlic cloves and mash until smooth. Add cooked spinach. Stir to combine well. Spread one tablespoon cream cheese mixture down center of each tortilla. Sprinkle with monterey jack cheese. Roll up tightly. Place tortillas seam down in shallow 9 x 13 pan. Spoon green enchilada sauce over tortillas. Sprinkle with sour cream and monterey jack pepper jack cheese. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Serve with salsa.
In a bowl, combine all ingredients except green beans. Toss to mix well. Add green beans. Toss to mix well. Serve chilled.

Soften the cream cheese in a bowl with a knife. Add the sugar and beat until smooth and creamy. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in the brandy. Bring the cream to the boil in a saucepan over a high heat. Turn off the heat and pour in the boiling water. Beat the mixture well to ensure it is smooth. Pour the cream mixture into the bowl of beaten cream cheese mixture and stir well until the mixture is smooth. Place the milk chocolate in a heatproof bowl over a saucepan of simmering water. Stir until melted, then add the dark chocolate and stir until the mixture is smooth. Add the chopped nuts to the milk and dark chocolate mixture and stir well to combine. Refrigerate for a few hours before serving. Pour the mousse into individual serving glasses and garnish with a few chopped nuts and fresh berries if desired.

In small saucepan, whisk together the milk and cocoa powder. Bring to a boil and whisk for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and whisk in coffee powder, vanilla and nutmeg. Add the orange rind and serve immediately.
Fry rice with spices. Add water. Cook until tender. Remove from heat. Add butter. Stir until rice is coated. Serve with chicken or lamb.

To make the crust combine the flour and butter in a food processor and pulse until the mixture resembles coarse meal. Add the water tablespoon by tablespoon until the dough begins to form a ball. Press the dough into the prepared pie plate. Prick the bottom of the crust with the tines of a fork and bake for 10 minutes in the oven or until the crust is firm. Remove from the oven and let cool completely. To make the filling combine the sugar, butter, corn syrup, Kahlua, vanilla extract, eggs and salt in a large bowl and mix well until smooth. Pour the filling into the cooled crust and bake until the filling is set and no longer jiggles when the pan is moved. The filling will still be a little jiggly in the center when the pie is removed from the oven. Remove the pie from the oven and let cool completely on a wire rack before cutting and serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Melt margarine in a 9x13 pan. Stir in diced tomatoes. Cook over medium heat until slightly thickened. Stir in egg noodles and smoked sausage. Transfer to baking pan and bake uncovered for 30-45 minutes.

Mix together corn flake crumbs and pecans in shallow bowl. Dip chicken in honey. Then dip into mixture. Bake on a lightly greased baking pan at 400f for 40 minutes. Serve with baked potato and steamed broccoli.

Heat oil and saute onions until soft. Add paprika, cumin and garlic. Saute until fragrant. Add tomato paste and cook until well combined. Add sugar, salt and water. Bring to boil. Turn down heat and simmer until thick. Add fresh cilantro just before serving.

Soak the wontons in ice water for 15 minutes to soften. Wash cucumbers and slice thinly. Peel oranges and slice thinly. Combine vinegar, oil, and sugar in a bowl and stir well. Add the cucumbers and oranges to the dressing. Just before serving, add the wontons to the salad and toss gently. Serve at room temperature.

Cook beans according to package directions. Meanwhile, fry bacon in a large skillet over medium-low heat until almost crisp, about 4 minutes per side. Remove bacon from pan and set aside to drain on paper towels. Drain all but 1 tablespoon fat from skillet. Add onion and cook over medium heat until softened, about 2 minutes. Stir in wine vinegar. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Drizzle over beans and toss to combine. Top with bacon just before serving. Serve hot or warm.
name: green bean casseroleingredients: green bean casserole, cream of mushroom soup, french fried onionspreparation:In a large bowl, mix together the soup and pepper. Set aside. Melt the butter in a large frying pan. Add the onion to the frying panstir well, and cook until tender. Stir in the mushroomscook for a minute or two. Remove from the heat. Add the green beans to the frying pantoss well to coat with the other ingred

Cook bacon in skillet over medium heat until cooked through but not crisp. Remove from skillet and set aside. In the same pan add the eggs and tomatoes. Cook until the eggs are done to your liking. Top the eggs with the cheddar cheese. Place a crouton in the center of a dinner plate. Top the crouton with a scoop of the egg mixture. Garnish with the chopped parsley and a few pieces of the cooked bacon. Serve hot with whole wheat toast.

In a large skillet, combine butter and brown sugar. Stir until melted and smooth. Add vanilla and stir. Remove from heat and stir in pecan halves until coated well. Spread on a baking sheet and bake in a preheated 300 degree f oven for 20-30 minutes or until the nuts are coated. Cool on a wire rack. Store in a tightly covered container in a cool place.

Combine flaxseed and water in a small bowl. Let stand at room temperature for 10 minutes. Combine quinoa and olive oil in a medium bowl. Add baking powder to flaxseed mixture. Mix well. Add quinoa mixture and combine well. Spread onto a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake for 15 minutes or until toasty. Cool and store in an airtight container.
Flax seed can be purchased at health food stores or online.
Quinoa can be purchased at most health food stores or at a supermarket.
I am not sure if this is a true recipe or a copycat recipe of the restaurant. But it is really good. I have made it many times.
This is a true recipe of the restaurant. The only thing I changed was I added more cayenne and used a little less sugar.
I am not sure if this is a true recipe or a copycat recipe of the restaurant. But it is really good.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Mix together cornbread mix, onion and eggs. Add sour cream and mix well. Add green chilies and jalapeno peppers and mix well. Stir in cheese and creamed corn and mix well. Pour batter into greased and floured 12 inch x 9 inch pan. Bake at 375 degrees f for 35 minutes. Remove from oven and brush top with oil. Sprinkle with cheese. Return to oven and bake at 350 degrees f for 5 minutes more. Makes 12 servings.

Cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in egg, add flour and baking powder. Add jelly crystals. Drop by teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350f until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks.

Mix butter, sugar and vanilla essence. Add beaten egg and flour. Spread the mixture out on a tray lined with baking paper. Sprinkle with carob powder and bake in the oven at 200C/390F/gas mark 6 for 20 minutes until just firm. Leave to cool completely on the tray before rolling up and cutting into pinwheels.
This page contains information about Carob and is created by a member of Snap-it.
Our Carob Review is designed to help you decide whether or not the Carob is right for you. Make sure to also check our Verified Reviews and our Buying Guides.
Carob has been rated 1 stars based on 4 reviews.

Line pie plate with pie crusts. Preheat oven to 400f. Put chocolate in small heavy saucepan. Stir in 1 cup of the water. Cook over low heat until smooth. Pour mixture into crusts. Bake 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Reduce oven temperature to 350f. Beat eggs lightlystir in remaining 2 cups of water, brown sugar, corn syrup and salt in a bowl until blended well. Pour over hot chocolate layer. Bake 35 minutes or until crust is firm and filling is set. Cool completely. Garnish with whipped cream and chocolate halves.

Cut tofu in 4 pieces (lengthwise). Heat vegetable oil in a heavy skillet or wok. Add tofu and cook over high heat until golden brown and crispy. Drain and remove from skillet. In a small bowl combine soy sauce and rice vinegar. Pour over tofu and toss to coat evenly.
Drain olives. Mix remaining ingredients together. Pour over drained olives. Marinate 1 day or longer.

Dice the peppers and onions. Cover with boiling water and let stand 10 minutes. Drain well. Save juice to add to vinegar mixture if needed to cover vegetables. Add sugar, vinegar, celery seed and salt. Boil 15 minutes. Pour into sterilized canning jars and seal.

Soak the skewers in water for 30 minutes to prevent burning. Prepare the vegetables by cutting them into cubes. Cut the broccoli into florets. Combine the vegetables in the bowl with the dressing. Thread the vegetables onto the skewers. Grill the skewers over high heat for 5 minutes per side. Serve warm.

Cut bacon into small pieces and saute with onions and green peppers until crisp-tender. Drain off fat. In a large bowl, combine coleslaw mix with chili powder, salt and pepper. Add tomatoes and chilies. Add bacon mixture and toss to mix thoroughly. Serve at room temperature.

In a large skillet over medium-low heat, saute the onion and garlic in butter until the onion is soft. Stir in the tomatoes and cook until the mixture is thickened. Stir in the basil. Season with salt and pepper. Serve over hot cooked penne. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
name: penne with lemon and garlicingredients: penne, lemon juice, olive oil, garlic clovespreparation:Cook the penne according to the directions on the package. Heat the lemon juice and the olive oil in a small saucepan. Stir in the minced garlic. Toss the cooked penne with the lemon mixture. Serve immediately.
name: penne with feta and spinachingredients: penne, olive oil, garlic cloves, fresh spinach leaves, feta cheesepreparation:Cook the penne according to the directions on the package. Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan. Add the minced garlic and saute until the garlic is golden. Add the spin

Preheat oven to 450 F. Place the chicken in a shallow baking dish. Combine all the remaining ingredients in a saucepan and heat to a boil. Pour over the chicken. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes, or until the chicken is no longer pink in the center. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Layer half the bread cubes in the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Pour in the egg mixture over the bread. Sprinkle with the cheese. Layer the remaining bread cubes on top of the cheese. Sprinkle with the remaining mustard powder. Bake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from the oven and let stand for at least 10 minutes before serving.
Beat all ingredients together until smooth. Press into a ball shape and roll in bacon bits and pimento strips. Serve with crackers.

Mix together seasonings in a small bowl. Coat tenderloin evenly with the mixturerefrigerate 30 minutes or up to 3 hours. Grill over medium heat 25-30 minutes or until desired doneness, turning occasionally. Let stand 5 minutes before cutting into thin slices.

Peel and quarter baking potatoes. Cut into wedges. In 1-1 1/2-quart microwave-safe baking dish combine butter, potatoes and parsley. Microwave uncovered on high 7 to 9 minutes or until tender. In small bowl combine the remaining ingredients. Remove potato mixture from ovenpour dressing over. Toss to mix well. Cover and return to oven. Bake uncovered 10 minutes. Stir. Bake uncovered 10 minutes longer or until golden. Garnish with parsley sprigs.

Pour 1 cup of water over 1 tablespoon of ground coffee in a saucepan over medium heat. Add 1 teaspoon of sugar. Stir well. Add 1/2 teaspoon of ground ginger. Continue to stir well until coffee is dissolved. Turn off heat. Drink while hot.

In a large bowl, combine popcorn, cereals, peanuts. In a medium saucepan, combine the butter, brown sugar, corn syrup and baking soda. Boil for 1 minute. Pour over popcorn mixture and stir. Spread on wax paper. Let cool. Store in an airtight container.

Combine jellied cranberry sauce and pineapple chunks in crock pot and heat on high for 1 hour. Add the cooked meatballs and heat on high for another hour. Remove from crock pot and stir in chile peppers. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cream butter. Add sugar and mix well. Add egg and beat well. Add flour and mix. Add chips and stir well. Shape into balls and place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Let sit for 1 minute. Remove from sheet and cool on a wire rack.
Suzie’s Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies Recipe.
Suzie’s Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies is one of my all-time favorite cookie recipes. These cookies are delicious and easy to make.
Combine all of the ingredients in a large bowl and mix well.
Roll the dough into 1-inch balls and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until the edges are lightly browned. Allow the cookies to cool on a wire rack. Enjoy!
Suzie’s Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies is one of my all-time favorite cookie recipes. These cookies are delicious

Heat oil in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Season the meat with salt and pepper. Brown the meat on both sides. Add wine and stock. Reduce heat to medium. Cook covered until the meat is cooked through and tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in the remaining 1/2 cup of stock. Add garlic and cook for 2 to 3 minutes more. Transfer to a serving platter. Whisk together the remaining ingredients. Spoon the mixture over the chops. Garnish with parsley.
I like this recipe. I don't like to use the wine because of the price.
The recipes sound wonderful. I love sweet & sour dishes. I'm going to try this one.
I like to make sweet & sour dishes. I'm going to try these recipes.
I love sweet & sour dishes. I'm going to try these recipes. I like to use wine in my recipes.

Heat 2 teaspoons of the oil in a large heavy saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook 3 minutes or until golden. Add rice and stir 1 minute. Add stock and increase heat to high. Cook 15 minutes or until rice is tender and stock is absorbed. Stir in remaining 1 teaspoon oil. Fold in cheese and mint. Season with salt and zest. Transfer to a serving dish.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl and stir until smooth. Cook over medium heat until thickened, stirring often. Serve with a bit more sea salt if desired.

Cook asparagus in boiling water for about 2 minutes. Drain and cool thoroughly. Place the cooked asparagus into a large serving bowl and pour the dressing over the top. Toss to coat and serve at room temperature.

Saut onions in oil until golden brown. Add stock and bring to a boil. Lower heat and add tomatoes and maple syrup. Cook for 15 minutes. Peel and dice pumpkin and cook in separate pot until tender. Mash together and season with white pepper and salt to taste. Mix into tomato mixture and serve hot. Garnish with fresh parsley. Makes 6-8 servings.
Dissolve the bicarbonate of soda in the rice milk. Mix the remaining ingredients together. Pour into a greased loaf pan. Bake at 180 degrees for 1 hour. Cool on a wire rack.

Marinate the chicken in the soy sauce and mirin with a little sake and sugar and allow to stand at room temperature. Thread the chicken alternately with the vegetables and secure with wooden skewers. Cook over medium heat turning often until the chicken is thoroughly cooked. Drizzle with the sauce and serve at once.

Combine butter and baking powder. Add the salt. Add the flour and work into a stiff dough. Add milk and form into a ball. Divide into small balls. Fry in hot oil until golden brown. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

Remove chicken from the bone and shred with a fork. Add enough bouillon cubes to make 1 cup of bouillon. Add to the chicken in a large bowl and add the broccoli florets. Mix the soup with the mayonnaise until smoothpour over the mixture in the bowl and mix well. Pour into a greased 2-quart casserole dish and top with the cheddar cheese. Cover with foil and bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Remove the foil and cook for an additional 10-15 minutes to brown the top. Serves 4 to 6 people.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook the pasta until al dente. Drain well. Melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the dried onions and stir for 2 minutes. Add the eggs and stir well. Stir in the ham and pasta. In a small bowl, combine the breadcrumbs and cheeses. Stir the breadcrumb mixture into the pasta mixture. Spoon into a lightly greased 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with the paprika. Bake for 25-30 minutes until the top is browned.

In a small saucepan, combine water and sugar. Bring to a boil and let cook for 3 minutes. Add the egg whites to the boiling mixture. Stir until all is combined. Remove from heat and allow to cool slightly. Add the corn syrup, vanilla and salt, stirring until well mixed. Beat with a hand mixer until stiff peaks form. Serve immediately or refrigerate for 1 day.

Combine all the marinade in a large glass bowl or plastic bag. Add the lime zest and mix well. Add the meat and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate over night. Drain and discard the marinade. Grill the meat for 5-7 minutes per side or until desired doneness.

Heat vegetable oil in a wok or frying pan. Add shallots and garlic clove. Stir fry for 1 minute. Add shrimp. Stir fry until pink. Add lemongrass and stir fry for 2 minutes. Add mushrooms. Stir fry for 2 minutes. Add fish sauce, sugar and salt. Stir fry for 1 minute. Serve immediately.
I would love to see more of these recipes. Thanks for the idea.
My husband loves seafood. I am a vegetarian. So, I can't cook seafood. But he is so fond of seafood that he likes to eat seafood everyday. So, I have to cook for him. I have tried a few of the recipes you have posted. I am glad I found your blog.
I've made the garlic lime shrimp once before and it was a huge hit! I've also made the shrimp sauteed with tomatoes for a party and it was delicious! Thank you for the great recipes!
I am so glad I found your website. I can'

Place garlic in a small bowl with 1/2 teaspoon sea salt. Mash with a fork or the back of a spoon until well crushed. Add yogurt, tahini paste and lemon juice. Whisk to combine. Stir in ground cumin and drizzle with olive oil. Serve with pita bread.

Peel and seed the tomatoes. Dice the tomatoes and place in a large pan. Add the light olive oil and stir to coat the diced yellow tomatoes. Add the sugar and stir. Simmer over low heat for 30 minutes. Add the chopped basil and the crushed red pepper flakes. Stir and serve.
This is a good recipe for pasta sauce. It’s easy to make and tastes great.

Cut carrots into thin slices and then into small pieces. Boil carrots with water for 10 minutes. Drain well and add sugar. Cook till carrots are tender. Add milk powder and cook till it becomes thick. Remove from heat and add cardamom seed. Cool completely. Beat butter till soft and fluffy. Beat in sugar and carrot mixture. Beat till light and fluffy. Sift flour and baking powder into a bowl and blend well. Add to carrot mixture and mix well. Spread mixture into a greased 8-in square pan. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until firm to the touch. Let cool on a wire rack. In a double boiler, melt chocolate and almond/cashews mixture. Spread over carrot cake. Cut into squares.

In a large skillet brown ground beef. Drain and add onion, garlic and soup mix. Stir well. Add water and worcestershire. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and add pasta shells. Cover and simmer until shells are tender. Sprinkle with cheese. Cover again until cheese is melted.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl toss chicken with 1/4 cup blackening seasoning and olive oil. Arrange chicken in a single layer in a baking dish and bake until cooked through. While chicken is baking prepare pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a skillet over medium-high heat and saute the green onions for 2 minutes. Add blackening seasoning and saute for another minute. In a saucepan over medium heat whisk together the light cream, sun-dried tomatoes and garlic until smooth.
