Whisk in chicken broth and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and add cheddar cheese and half of the parmesan and stir until melted and combined. Drain pasta and combine with chicken, green onion mixture and 1 cup of the alfredo sauce. Top with remaining parmesan cheese and serve.

In a bowl, whisk together the mustard and syrup. Place the fish on the planks and brush with the glaze. Top with the sliced lemons. Broil the fish for about 10 minutes (depending on the thickness of the fish), until it flakes easily with a fork. Serve with the lemon slices and the glaze.

Mix sugar, cornstarch, water and pineapple juice until smooth. Stir in banana. Cook over medium heat stirring constantly until mixture thickens. Remove from heat and stir in crushed pineapple and lemon juice. Let cool.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add bell peppers. Cook for 10 minutes. Add onion. Cook for 3 more minutes or until tender. Add spinach. Cook for 5 minutes or until tender. Add white wine. Cook for 2 minutes or until liquid is evaporated. Add alfredo sauce. Cook for 2 minutes or until heated through. Fold in pasta. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Spread jelly on one slice of bread. Spread peanut butter on another slice of bread. Lay the jelly side of the first slice down on the grill. Place the second slice on top of the first slice so that the jelly side of the second slice is facing upwards. Grill the sandwich until the bread is lightly browned. Remove the sandwich from the grill. Place the other slice of bread on top of the sandwich. Garnish with a slice of banana. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in a 13 x 9 glass baking dish. Add broccoli and stir to cover with melted butter. Pour in soup and stir. Add remaining ingredients except ritz cracker crumbs. Sprinkle with crumbs and bake at 350 for 40 minutes. Uncover and bake for 5 minutes more.

Bring water and juice to a boil in a large pot over high heat. Add in the onion and cook for 3 minutes or until they are soft and translucent. Add in the macaroni and cook for about 10 minutes or until it is tender. Add salt and pepper to taste and serve hot with your favorite breads and crackers or sliced cheese.
 chili macaroni saladingredients: ground beef, green peppers, celery, onions, elbow macaroni, can of chili (with beans), milkpreparation:Cook the ground beef in a large skillet until browned. Drain the grease and add the onions, celery and green peppers and cook until tender. Stir in the milk and canned chili and heat until hot but not boiling. Drain the elbow macaroni and add to the mixture in the skillet and heat thoroughly. Chill in a large bowl and serve cold. Serves 6-8.

Preheat oven to 350. In a large bowl combine stuffing mix and bread cubes. Stir in enough water to make a soft dough. On a lightly greased 12-in. baking sheet, press the dough to form a 12-in. square. Place a layer of the cooked turkey breast in the center of the dough. Spread with the turkey gravy. Sprinkle with the remaining turkey breast and spread with the remaining gravy. Sprinkle with the cheese. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Serve warm with a side of cranberry sauce and mashed potatoes. Makes 8-10 servings.

Wash the swiss chard leaves thoroughly in cold water until the water runs clear. Cut off the thick stems and set aside to use in another recipe or throw away. Slice the leaves thinly or shred them finely. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add 2 tablespoons olive oil, the onion, and garlic cloves to the pan and cook until the onion is translucent. Stir in the sliced or shredded swiss chard leaves and cook until the leaves are tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in the navy beans and cook until heated through. Season the mixture to taste with salt and black pepper. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan, bring 2 cups of water to a boil. Add grits. Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently until tender and creamy, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in cheese and butter. Add jalapenos and green onions. Beat eggs in separate bowl. Stir into grits. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer to serving dish. Sprinkle with Jack cheese.

Peel the oranges. Cut them into wedges. Remove the outer layer of the onion. Slice the onion into thin strips. Put all the vegetables in a bowl. Add the salt, oregano, vegetable oil, orange juice, lemon juice and black olives. Mix well. Serve over a lettuce leaf.

Cream shortening and sugars. Add lemon juice and beat until smooth. Add eggs and beat well. Combine flour and baking soda and add to mixture. Add nuts and cinnamon. Chill dough for an hour. Shape into balls and roll in powdered sugar. Bake at 375 for 12 minutes. Roll in powdered sugar while warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place the fish in a roasting pan and rub with the oil. Sprinkle with the sherry wine and the soy sauce. Arrange the green onions over the fish. Add the ginger and the sesame oil. Cover the fish and place in the oven. Bake for about 15 minutes or until the fish is cooked through. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in skillet, add onions & saute until tender. Add chili, salt & pepper & heat through. Spoon over fritos in 9x13 baking dish. Top with American cheese slices & bake at 350f until melted. Serve with lettuce & tomato on side, if desired.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat. Season water with salt. Cook fettuccine until just tender, about 5 minutes. Drain in a colander. Return pasta to pot. Add pumpkin seeds, garlic, chipotle powder, cilantro, lime juice, olive oil and lime zest. Toss to combine. Serve warm or cold, sprinkled with feta cheese.

In a medium saucepan combine sugar and cocoa. Stirring constantly bring to a boil over medium heat. Boil 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in milk, peanut butter and butter. Stir until smooth. Pour into a lightly greased 8x8 pan. Cool 1 hour. Spread with peanut butter and sprinkle with pecans. Cool. Cut into squares.

Bring 2 cups of the chicken broth to a boil in a 2-quart saucepan. Add the Splenda. Stir in the egg whites and stir vigorously until the eggs form small curds. Add the spinach and green onions. Season with the salt and the pepper. Serve hot.

Brown the pork with onion and potatoes until potatoes are cooked through. Add yogurt and ranch mix and cook for about 2 minutes. Add in corn, peas, spinach and black pepper. Turn off heat and let it cool for a bit before putting it in the dough. I use a bread lame to cut the dough into strips before putting it in the oven. I also put some on the top before putting it in the oven. Bake for about 15-20 minutes at 350 degrees. Serves 6-8

In a large pot, melt butter over medium heat. Add onion and saute until tender. Add currants, apricots and seasoningscook 1 minute longer. Add brothbring to a boil. Add cinnamon sticks, cover and reduce heat. Simmer 5 minutes or until currants are plumped. Add couscouscook 7 minutes or until done. Stir in fresh cilantro just before serving.
What kind of recipes do you make with this ?
I like it with chicken, turkey, fish and salad.
I've been searching for a recipe for Isreali CousCous with a slight kick. Any suggestions?
What brand do you buy?
Israeli couscous is very delicate, so if you buy a coarse brand you'll be disappointed with your results. I buy only fine Israeli couscous.
How long does it take to cook israeli couscous?
The best way to cook it is to make it in a rice cooker. Or you can use a saucepan on top of your stove, but don'

Heat oil in a large saucepan over low heat. Add onion and saute for 5 minutes. Add garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add remaining ingredients. Bring to a boilreduce heat to medium. Cook, uncovered for 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Blend until smooth.

In a large bowl combine olive oil, sugar, white balsamic vinegar, garlic cloves, red pepper flakes. Mix well and pour over the asparagus. Marinate for at least 2 hours. Serve on a bed of greens with crusty bread.

Prick the potatoes in 5 or 6 places with a fork. Bake in oven at 400 degrees for 40 minutes or until tender when tested with a fork. Cut each potato in half lengthwise and place in a shallow baking dish. Arrange onion, green pepper and bacon in the bottom of each half of the potato. Sprinkle with cheese. Pour milk, butter and egg into a small bowl. Heat in microwave for 30 seconds or until hot. Pour into each half of the potato. Sprinkle with salt. Return to oven and bake an additional 10 minutes or until hot.
Combine all ingredients in a food processor until smooth. Taste and adjust seasonings as needed. Refrigerate for up to 2 weeks. Makes about 1 cup.

In a heavy saucepan, combine egg yolks and sugar over low heat, whisking constantly until the mixture thickens and turns a golden color. Add lemon juice and rind and continue whisking until the mixture coats a spoon. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla. Cool to room temperature and then refrigerate until ready to serve. When ready to serve, spoon into bowls and top with a dollop of whipped cream and a spoonful of strawberry jam. Serves 4-6.

Cut the tops off the asparagus. Discard. Wash the stalks and cut into 1-inch pieces. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat. Add the chicken breasts, cut-side down. Cook for 2 minutes. Turn the breasts over and pour in the white wine. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the asparagus and continue to cook for 10 minutes more. Add the remaining tablespoon of oil. Season to taste with the salt and pepper. Serve immediately.
Place in slow cooker. Pour soup mixture over. Stir until well blended. Cook on low for 4 hours or high for 2. When done stir in sour cream. Sprinkle with onion. Serve over rice.

Peel the potatoes and cut them in quarters. Cook them in boiling water until tender. Cook the leeks in the oil until soft. Stir in the tomato sauce and chicken broth. Bring to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the potatoes and leeks and cook for about 10 minutes until the potatoes are soft. Stir in the queso fresco and salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Cook the bacon in a skillet, then drain well and set aside. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large bowl, beat together the eggs, milk, bread, cheese, margarine, and mustard until smooth. Mix in the cooked bacon. Pour into a 9x13 inch baking dish and bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven. Let stand for 15 minutes before serving.

Brown the chicken breasts in butter until no longer pink in center and lightly crisp on outside. Lay out two slices of bacon overlapping and place a piece of swiss cheese in center of each slice. Place one chicken breast over each slice of cheese and secure with toothpick. Heat the cream of chicken soup and skim milk in saucepan over medium heat until bubbly. Add breadcrumbs and butter stirring until lightly browned and thickened. Serve over chicken and garnish with additional chopped parsley if desired. Serves 4.

In a large frying pan or Dutch oven, heat oil over medium-high heat. In a small bowl, combine soy sauce, brown sugar, chicken broth, cornstarch, garlic, salt and pepper. Stir until smooth. Add to pan and cook for about 5 minutes or until thickened. Add chicken or pork and cook until done. Serve over rice with green peas.
Combine all ingredients in medium saucepan over low heat. Stir until smooth. Let cool and bottle in sterile jars. Refrigerate and enjoy.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Peel and finely chop garlic cloves and place in the bottom of a small baking dish. Toss in chopped parsley and kosher salt and black pepper. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice and toss to coat well. Cut off and discard tough ends of Brussels sprouts and quarter remaining sprouts. Arrange on top of garlic in baking dish and drizzle with more olive oil and lemon juice and toss to coat well. Cover and bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until tender but still bright green and crispy on the edges. Top with parmesan cheese and zest of 1 lemon before serving.
I just had this for lunch at my local cafe. It was really yummy but I can't seem to find the recipe anywhere online. I'd love to make it myself!
Hi there! I'm looking for a recipe for an appetizer that I've had at restaurants several times that I can'

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine first four ingredients in a bowl. Work in the egg and vanilla. Roll out the dough between two pieces of wax paper to fit in a greased pie pan. Spread with the apple mixture. Sprinkle with the walnuts. Bake for about 30 minutes or until done. Cool in pan. Serve with whipped topping.

In a large pot or Dutch oven, saute the onions until translucent. Add the garlic, green pepper, and bacon. Cook until the vegetables are softened. Add the baked beans. Add the cream or half & half. Add the sausage. Simmer for 10 minutes. Serve in bowls.

crush and process the cookies in a food processor or place in a baggie and roll them with a rolling pin. Mix together the pudding and milk. Pour into a bowl and fold in the cool whip. Pour into the graham wafer crumbs and pat down to form a pie crust. Spread the pie filling over the top of the wafer crumbs and chill for at least two hours.

Dip fish fillets into flour seasoned with salt, then into egg wash and finally into seasoned bread crumbs. Place on a baking tray. Melt butter. Coat the fish with it on each side. Bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees F until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Sprinkle with sliced almonds, lemon juice to taste, salt and pepper to taste. Serves 4-5 as an appetizer or side dish.

Cook tortellini and vegetables according to package directions. In a large skillet, saute meatballs in oil until browned on all sides. Add condensed soup and water. Stir and bring to a boil. Add vegetable mixture and heat through. Serve over pasta and garnish with sour cream.

Place a heavy pan over medium heat. Add the butter and cook until it turns a light brown color. This will take about 2 minutes. Add the egg yolks and whisk constantly for 2 minutes or until mixture turns a light brown color. Remove from heat. Add the lemon juice and whisk vigorously until mixture thickens. Add red chili and salt. Mix well. Add 1/2 cup of sour cream and mix well. Refrigerate. In a bowl mix red radishes with 1/2 cup sour cream. Arrange on a serving plate and cover with the sauce. Garnish with chopped green onion.

Pound the chicken breasts to 1/4 inch thickness. Mix together the sweet chili sauce, cilantro, lemon rind and garlic until well combined. Add the sour cream and mix until well combined. Gently stir the mixture into the pounded chicken until well combined and spread in a 9x9 baking dish. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 20-25 minutes or until done. Remove from the oven and allow to cool slightly before serving.
Brown ground beef with onion and garlic. Add water and simmer until meat is tender. Mix in paste and seasonings. Simmer 15 minutes. Serve with spaghetti and Parmesan cheese.

Heat 2 teaspoons of the oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened but not browned. Add the ginger and cook for 1 minute more. Stir in the curry powder and cook for 30 seconds more. Add the tomatoes and cook for 2 more minutes. Stir in the salt. Add the beans and the chickpeas and their liquid. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook for 20 minutes. Stir in the cilantro. Season with lemon juice and serve hot.
Heat the first six ingredients over medium heat until reduced by half. Cool slightly. Whisk together the oil and poppy seeds. Whisk the reduced mixture into the oil. Chill until ready to serve.

In skillet, brown pork chops in hot oil for 5 minutes per side. Add remaining ingredients. Cover crockpot. Cook on low 5 to 6 hours. Serve on platter over cooked potatoes and onions. Serve immediately.

Cut baguette on the diagonal in half. Remove crumbs from each half. Arrange the parma ham on the bottom half of the baguette and set aside. In a large bowl beat the eggs with milk and parmesan cheese until smooth. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Pour in the beaten eggs and cook until golden brown. When done pour onto the ham. Top with parsley and prosciutto. Cover with the other half of the baguette. Cut in half to serve.

In a large nonstick skillet cook the potatoes over moderate heat until golden brown, about 10 minutes. Stir in the cream. Cook over moderate heat until the cream has thickened and the potato mixture is tender, about 5 minutes longer. Stir in the onion, anchovies and dill. Season with salt and pepper.

In a medium bowl, mix butter with olive oil and garlic until blended well. Add the tequila and cook until alcohol evaporates, stirring frequently. Add shrimp to the tequila mixture and cook until opaque. Add the juice of 1/2 lime, stirring gently to combine, then sprinkle with crushed red pepper flakes before serving.

Peel the mangos. Cut the mangos into small cubes. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add the cubed mangos. Saute until slightly brown. Add in mint leaves. Continue to saute until the leaves are crisp. Pour in broth and lime juice. Cook for 1 minute. Serve over rice or noodles. Sprinkle with mint leaves.

In a medium bowl, combine molasses, butter and milk. Cook on high in microwave 4 to 5 minutes until molasses is dissolved. Add sugar and bring to boil over medium heat, stirring often until thickened. Remove from heatadd 1/2 cup of the cornmeal and blend well. Return to heatadd remaining 1/2 cup of the cornmeal and blend well. Remove from heat. Add eggs 1 at a timebeat until well blended after each addition. Stir in vanilla and spices. Pour into buttered 1-quart baking dish or 8-cup muffin cups. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 15 minutes, or until set. Serve warm with whipped cream or ice cream.

Toss together chicken and juice from canned pineapple. Set aside. Cut asparagus into small pieces. Mix mayonnaise with chopped pineapple. Add asparagus. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Toss with romaine lettuce and top with chopped walnuts. Serve on a bed of romaine lettuce. Serves 4.

Combine yeast and warm water in a bowl and let stand till frothy. In another bowl mix the egg and lard. Add the yeast and water and stir till well blended. Cover and let rise for 30 minutes. Stir in the salt and enough flour to form a soft dough. Knead well and let rise until doubled in volume. Divide dough into 12 portions and shape each into a ball. Place balls in greased pan and let rise until doubled in size, about 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown and done through. Serve warm or let cool on rack and refrigerate or freeze for later use.
Line bottom of pie plate with pie crusts. Combine sweetened condensed milk and Hershey's syrup and pour evenly over pie crusts. Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours or until firm.
Heat together applesauce, apple cider, spices and lemon juice until thickened. Pour into container and refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve with hot biscuits or muffins.

Butter both sides of bread with orange marmalade spread. Place 1 piece of ham on each slice of bread. Spread each piece of bread with 1/4 cup chili paste. Layer 1/2 of the tomato paste on top of each piece of ham. Layer 1/4 of blue cheese on each piece of ham. Layer 1/2 of jarlsberg cheese on each piece of ham. Add remaining piece of ham and layer other half of jarlsberg on top of ham. Add remaining tomato paste. Top with blue cheese. Add remaining piece of bread, marmalade side up. Close sandwich and serve.

Prepare the veggies and fish first. Peel and dice the potatoes and mushrooms. Slice the zucchini and fish into bite sized pieces. Next make the pesto sauce by mixing all the ingredients together. In a large sheet of aluminum foil add the fish and veggies. Season the fish and veggies with pesto sauce and parmesan. Wrap the foil tightly and cook over medium heat for 20 minutes. Serve warm.

Cut the baguette into 1-inch pieces and place them onto a baking sheet. Melt the oil in a small saucepan over medium heat and add the garlic and the herbs. Cook for 30 seconds until the garlic is fragrant and the herbs are slightly wilted. Season with salt and pepper to taste and pour the oil mixture over the baguette pieces. Turn to coat and spread out the pieces so they are not overlapping and bake for 8 to 10 minutes until the pieces are lightly toasted and crisp at the edges.

Remove the fat from the roast and sprinkle with garlic and seasonings. Place in roasting pan. Heat olive oil in a dutch oven over medium heat. Add the roast and brown all sides. Add the red wine, cover tightly and simmer over low heat for 1-1/2 hours. Uncover and turn roast over and simmer for another 1-1/2 hours. Add beef broth to cover 1/2 way up the roast. Cover tightly and continue cooking until meat is fork tender, about 2-1/2 hours more. Strain the cooking liquid into a bowl to remove fat. Skim the fat from the cooking liquid and heat the liquid in a small pan over low heat until thickened. Stir in the cornstarch mixture until smooth. Serve over the beef.

Saute onion and pepper in butter. Add chicken and mushroom. Add refried beans. Place 1/2 of the mixture on a flour tortilla. Sprinkle with 1/4 of the shredded cheese. Fold over halfway and place on greased baking sheet. Repeat with remaining mixture. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes until cheese is melted. Cut each tortilla into 4 wedges. Serve with lettuce and tomato.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Sift together flour and salt and set aside. Beat butter and sugar on medium speed until fluffy and light. Beat in vanilla and flour mixture until smooth. Press dough into greased and floured jelly roll pan or brownie pan. Bake until lightly browned (about 10 to 15 minutes). Cool completely. Spread evenly with sweetened flaked coconut. Cut into squares and serve with tea or coffee.

Bring a large pot of water to boil. Add the potatoes and cook for 15 to 20 minutes, or until tender. Drain and transfer to a large bowl. Add the vinaigrette and sour cream. Mix to coat. Sprinkle with the horseradish, bacon, and sweet pickle relish. Toss to combine. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Garnish with the green onions and dill. Serve at room temperature.

In a large mixing bowl combine the milk and the cornmeal and stir until smooth. Add the eggs and stir thoroughly. Add the butter and stir until melted. Add the sugar and the salt and stir until well mixed. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan. Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 45-50 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. Serve warm with butter and syrup.
Pour boiling water over gelatin. Mix well. Add cottage cheese and stir until smooth. Add cool whip free. Refrigerate 6 hours. Makes 3 servings.

Place sweet potato in saucepan. Cover with water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat. Simmer until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain sweet potato. Mash until smooth. Stir in egg and whipping cream. Mash again until smooth. Stir in nutmeg and pepper. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Preheat the broiler. Mix together all marinade ingredients in a large bowl. Add lamb to marinade and turn to coat thoroughly. Cover and refrigerate overnight or up to 24 hours. Place the lamb fat side up in a shallow pan. Bake at 400f for 15 minutes then turn over and continue cooking for another 15 minutes or until done to taste.
These recipes are for a leg of lamb or lamb loins but it is easy to adjust to smaller cuts of meat.
The leg of lamb is a delicious and lean cut of meat that can be cooked in a number of ways. It is also a good source of protein and essential vitamins and minerals.
The leg of lamb is a cut of meat that comes from the hind leg of a sheep. It is a popular choice for barbecuing and roasting and can be cooked in a number of different ways.
The leg of lamb is a good source of protein and essential vitamins and minerals including iron, zinc, and B vitamins. It is also a good source

Spread butter onto the slices of bread. On the first slice of bread add the mozzarella cheese, then the provolone cheese and then the turkey. Add the second slice of bread, with the ham and the cheddar cheese. Then add the third slice of bread with the pepperoni, genoa salami, and the pepperoncini peppers. Add the fourth slice of bread and the sandwich is ready to be placed in the sandwich press. Place the sandwich in the press and press down for about 3 minutes until the sandwich is crispy. Enjoy.

Mix the first six ingredients together until smooth. Beat the butter and sugar until creamy. Add the eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. Beat in the vanilla. Slowly mix the flour mixture into the butter mixture. Stir in the chocolate chips. Roll dough into balls using 1 tablespoon of dough for each ball. Place on a greased cookie sheet and bake at 375 for 8-10 minutes until lightly browned. Makes about 2 1/2 dozen cookies.

In a small bowl combine the cream of mushroom soup, sour cream and onion soup mix. Put in a crock pot. Place the chicken in the bottom of the crock pot. Season the chicken with the red pepper flakes, onion powder, garlic powder, worcestershire sauce, pepper and salt. Add the button mushrooms. Cook on low for 5 hours. Stir the chicken occasionally. Serve over rice or noodles.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Butter a 13 x 9-inch baking pan. Slice off crust from the loaf of bread. Tear the bread into 1-inch pieces and toss in a large bowl. Combine the milk and eggs in a 4-quart saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the mustard and seasonings. Continue stirring until the mixture thickens and coats the back of a spoon. Remove from heat. Stir in the cheese and chile. Pour the mixture over the bread and toss to coat well. Press firmly into the baking pan. Bake for 20 to 30 minutes or until firm. Let the souffle cool for 10 minutes before cutting into squares. Serve warm.

In a large mixing bowl combine the first six ingredients. Beat until smooth. Stir in the applesauce, brown sugar, skim milk, oil and bran flakes. Beat at medium speed for 2 minutes. Pour into a greased 9 x 5 x 3 inch loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 55 to 60 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes. Remove from pan to a wire rack. Cool completely. Makes one loaf.
I like the idea of making French toast with applesauce.
I never thought about it before, but it makes perfect sense.
Thanks for sharing this recipe with us at Inspire Us Thursday on Organized 31.
In a bowl combine butter, flour, sugar and baking soda. Blend in vanilla and nuts. Press into a 9 inch pie plate. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool.

Preheat waffle iron. Sift together flour, sugar and baking powder. Add salt and set aside. In a large bowl beat eggs until light and fluffy. Gradually add oil and continue to beat until well mixed. Add flour mixture and stir until just moistened. Gently fold in raspberry preserves and pecans. Ladle waffle batter into preheated waffle iron according to manufacturer's directions. Serve warm with fresh raspberries.

Wash and dry the avocados. Halve lengthwise and remove seeds. Scoop flesh into a medium bowl. Add the jalapeno and cilantro and mash to a chunky consistency. Add tomatillos, red onion, garlic clove and lime juice. Salt to taste. Serve with tortilla chips.

Mix together cream cheese, butter, and mayonnaise. Chill. When ready to serve, mix with lemon juice, seasoning salt and horseradish. Fold in the green onions. Arrange on toast points and serve. Serve with cocktail sauce.

Melt butter in a heavy duty pot or Dutch oven over low heat and saute the cabbage and sweet onion until softened and translucentabout 10 minutes. Turn up the heat and stir occasionally to lightly brown the cabbage and onions. Remove from the heat and sprinkle with the salt and black pepper and set aside. Preheat the oven to 350F degrees. Meanwhile, brown the kielbasa sausage in the same pot or Dutch oven over low heat for about 5 minutes. Remove from the pot and set aside. Then add the potato and cheddar pierogies to the pot and stir to separate them. Brown the pierogies for about 5 minutesstirring occasionally to prevent them from sticking to the bottom of the pot. Pour the cabbage mixture over the browned pierogies and then top with the browned sausage. Lightly sprinkle with black pepper and bake for about 30 minutes or until the top is lightly browned and bubbly. Remove from the oven and serve immediately. Serves 4.

Spread bread with Philadelphia cream cheese and sprinkle with tasty cheese, then add sour cream and mix well. Spread a layer of this mixture in a shallow bowl. Top with ham and capsicums. Repeat the layers once again and sprinkle with paprika. Chill for one hour and then serve with crackers.

In a medium saucepan, combine 1/2 cup of beer, 1/2 teaspoon paprika, 1 teaspoon garlic salt and 1/2 teaspoon oregano. Bring to a boil and cook until reduced by half. Add 1/2 cup of the reduced liquid to 2 cups of cooked rice. Top with 1 teaspoon paprika, 1 teaspoon garlic salt, 1/2 teaspoon oregano, 1/2 teaspoon dried lemon peel and 1 teaspoon parsley.

In a microwaveable bowl combine caramels and evaporated milk. Heat on high for 3 minutes, stirring every 30 seconds until smooth. Pour into 8x8x2 pan. Bake cake according to directions on box, but only bake 20 minutes or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Remove from oven and immediately pour over the caramel mixture. Sprinkle chips on top and bake for an additional 10 minutes or until top is firm and caramel is bubbly around edges. Cool and cut into squares to serve.

Mix dry and hot water in saucepan. Stir until dry mix is completely dissolved and no longer grainy. Stir in crushed pineapple with juice. Stir in lemon juice. Remove from heat. Add in the other ingredients and mix well. Pour into a 9x13 pan and refrigerate for 3 hours. Serve as desired.

In a large skillet over medium heat, saute onions in butter until tender. Add the flour and stir constantly until a roux is formed. Stir in the milk and cook until thick. Season to taste with garlic and pepper. Pour into a 2 qt baking dish. Sprinkle evenly with the cheese. Bake in a preheated 350F oven 25 min or until light golden brown.
Dissolve lemon and lime in hot water. Cream together cream cheese and powdered sugar. Fold in both fruits. Pour into mold and chill.

Combine mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar, garlic powder, salt, and 2 teaspoons dried spearmint in a small bowl. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Peel cucumbers and slice them crosswise 1/8 inch thick. Gently stir the spearmint into the dressing just until blended. Arrange cucumber slices in a bowl or shallow dish. Spoon dressing over top, and sprinkle with remaining spearmint. Let stand at room temperature until ready to serve.

Cook the noodles in boiling salted water until they are tender but firm. Drain off all but 2 tablespoons of the cooking water, reserving this liquid for later use. Rinse the cooked noodles well under cold running water. Drain them in a colander set over a bowl. Heat a skillet with cooking oil over medium heat. Add chicken pieces and stir fry until lightly browned. Add spinach leaves and stir until wilted. Add all of the remaining ingredients except for the reserved cooking water. Cover and simmer until the sauce has thickened and the chicken is cooked through and tender. Taste for seasoning and add salt and pepper if necessary. Drain the cooked noodles well and add them to the saucepan with the chicken. Stir well to combine. Add the reserved cooking water a tablespoon at a time if the pasta is too dry and stir well after each addition of the water until you have a smooth sauce that is not too thin or too thick. Serve immediately in shallow pasta bowls topped with grated Parmesan cheese or serve with

Roll out pastry dough about 1/8 inch thick. Spread with filling leaving about a half inch border. Roll up tightly starting from one end and ending at the other. Crimp edges with fork and place on baking sheet. Brush with egg mixture and sprinkle with sugar. Bake at 375 degrees for about one hour until pastry is brown and filling bubbly.

Heat oven to 400. In small skillet, saute celery and sage. In 12-inch skillet, heat gravy and sausage. Cook until sausage is crumbled. Stir in celery mixture and cook 1 minute. Remove from heat. Spread 2 cups gravy mixture over crust. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Top with remaining gravy mixture and cheese. Bake 15 minutes longer or until crust is golden brown and cheese is melted.

Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Drain well. In the same pot, heat oil or margarine over medium heat until melted. Add garlic powder and garlic. Sauté until garlic is golden. Add spaghetti to the pan and toss until well coated. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with dried chives. Serves 2-3.
i am sorry to say i am not a fan of broccoli.
i love the garlic spaghetti.
i’ll have to try the creamy italian noodle dish.
I’d go for the broccoli & noodle supreme. I don’t think I’ve ever had a garlic spaghetti before.
I love pasta so much. I am definitely going to try some of these!
I’m going to try the electric chimichurri sauce.
I like the garlic spaghetti recipe.
I think the creamy italian pasta dish sounds delicious!
I’d like to try the garlic spaghetti recipe.
I love garlic spaghetti. It’s delicious.

In a medium saucepan sauté the onions and garlic until translucent in olive oil. Add the beans and prosciutto and cook for 5 minutes until the prosciutto is cooked through and the beans are softened. Add the bouquet garni and the chicken stock and bring to a boil. Simmer until the liquid has reduced to about half. Remove the bouquet garni. Stir in the tomatoes and season with salt and pepper to taste. Divide the mixture among 4 to 6 ovenproof soup bowls or individual ramekins and crumble the white bread over the top. Bake for 30 minutes until the bread is golden and the top is bubbly. Serve immediately.

Cook onion in oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat until tender. Add garlic and cook 1 minute longer. Add turmeric, cumin, cayenne pepper, and curry powder. Cook 1 minute longer. Add yogurt. Cook until mixture bubbles. Add spinach. Cook until spinach is tender. Season to taste.
The best way to avoid health problems is to eat a balanced diet rich in fruits and vegetables. But sometimes you can't get enough fruits and vegetables. In this case you can take a dietary supplement. Fresh spinach with ground beef is a great way to add nutrients to your diet. It contains vitamin A (Retinol), vitamin C (Ascorbic acid), vitamin E (Tocopherol), vitamin K (Phytonadione), thiamin (Vitamin B1), riboflavin (Vitamin B2), niacin (Vitamin B3), pantothenic acid (Vitamin B5), vitamin B6 (Pyridoxine), vitamin B12, bi
Combine all ingredients and toss well. Refrigerate 2 hours or overnight. Serve chilled.

Combine cider vinegar, cloves, bay leaves, peppercorns and salt in a saucepan or pot. Bring to a boil for 3 minutes, then remove from heat. Remove bay leaves and cloves. Pour into a blender container. Blend at low speed until smooth. Pour into a blender container. Blend at low speed until smooth. Mix in sugar and dry mustard. Cover and allow to stand at room temperature for 24 hours. Stir and refrigerate.

Combine first four ingredients in a large bowl. Place salmon steaks in the bowl, turning to coat both sides with the sauce. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight. Remove the salmon steaks from the refrigerator 30 minutes before cooking. Spread the breadcrumb mixture evenly over the tops of the salmon steaks. Bake in a preheated oven for 20 minutes or until the fish flakes easily with a fork.
Beat together the egg, rice, savory and parmesan cheese. Form into 1-inch balls. Dip in the breadcrumbs. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Brown the breaded rice puffs.

Slice cabbage thinly. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add onions and saute until soft. Add apples and cook 2-3 minutes more. Add cabbage and cook until tender-crisp, about 10 minutes. Season to taste with salt, pepper and sugar.
Slice bread in half horizontally. In a small bowl, combine the mayo, cheese and spices. Spread one half of each slice with the mixture. Broil until golden-brown. Serve warm.

Wash potatoes. Place in a large pot with enough cold water to cover by 2 inches. Add bay leaf, thyme sprig, peppercorns and 1 teaspoon salt and bring to a boil. Simmer until fork tender about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool in cooking liquid about 15 minutes. Remove thyme sprig. Stir in butter and oil. Season with more pepper, if desired. Serve immediately.
Combine all ingredients and marinate for 2 hours in refrigerator. Thread chicken pieces onto skewers. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes at 400 degrees F. Serve warm.
Dissolve jell-o in hot water. Mash bananas in bowl. Add jell-o and remaining ingredients except 7-up. Chill. Garnish with strawberries or other fresh fruit. Before serving add chilled 7-up.

In a large baking dish, combine potatoes and onion. In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients and mix well with a fork until smooth. Pour over potatoes and onion and mix well with a fork. Cover with foil and bake for 1 hour at 400 degrees. Uncover and bake for another hour until golden brown and bubbly. Sprinkle with more swiss cheese if desired.

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium-high heat. Add shrimp. Saute 2 minutes on each side or until pink. Add pea pods. Cook 3 minutes. Add tomatoes. Cook 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add garlic, parsley, lemon peel. Serve immediately.

Melt together butter and marshmallows. Stir in peanut butter until smooth. Remove from heat and stir in oatmeal, raisins, nuts, and cranberries. Pat mixture into an 8x8 pan. Let cool. Cut into squares. Wrap individually in waxed paper.

Mix nuts with candied fruit in a large bowl. Sift together flour and baking powder. Mix with sugar and eggs in medium bowl. Stir into nut mixture. Pour into greased 13x9x2-inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan. To make icing, beat butter and milk until fluffy. Gradually add confectioner's sugar. Mix well until smooth and spread over cake. Refrigerate until serving time. Yield: 12 servings.

Melt the butter and fry the garlic and onion until soft. Add the chicken and cook through. Add the peanut butter and stir well to combine. Add the stock and curry powder and cook for about 5 minutes. Serve with rice.

In large saucepan, heat oil over medium heat. Add onioncook about 2 minutes or until golden. Add garlic. Cook 2 minutes. Add wine. Cook about 3 minutes until almost evaporated. Add bay leaf. Add flourcook about 2 minutes. Add milk. Stir until smooth. Stir in scallops. Cook until they are cooked through.

In a large saucepan or pot, heat the corn oil over medium heat. Add onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened about 5 minutes. Add parsnip and cook until tender about 15 minutes. Add water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Add ginger. Cook until parsnips are tender about 20 minutes. Add kale. Cook until tender.
I am going to make my own pesto with kale and walnuts. I am so inspired!
Great ideas! I love that you can do so much with Kale!
I love all these kale recipes. I want to make all of them!
I am a huge fan of kale, so these recipes are perfect! I love that there are so many ways you can incorporate it into your diet.
I love the kartoffelpuffer potato pancakes! What a delicious way to use potatoes!
I love that you can make pesto with Kale. It looks so delicious!
These look great. I love how versatile Kale is!
These recipes look amazing. I want to try them

Combine yogurt, garlic and lemon juice in a bowl and mix well. Marinate lamb cutlets in this mixture for a couple of hours in refrigerator. Brush lamb cutlets with some of the marinade and cook them in a grill pan or under a broiler until they turn golden brown in color and the meat is cooked through. Serve warm.

Place zucchini in a colander in the sink or a bowl in the refrigerator for 1 hour. Place zucchini in a food processor fitted with a steel blade and process until the zucchini is finely chopped. Place zucchini in a bowl. Stir in sugar, pineapple juice and lemon juice. Chill for 1 hour before serving. Makes 2 servings. Per serving: 75 calories, 0 g fat, 0 g saturated fat, 0 g cholesterol, 1 g sodium, 19 g carbohydrates, 2 g fiber, 1 g protein

Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook onion and jalapeno until soft, 5 minutes. Add tomatillo. Cook until soft, 5-10 minutes. Remove from heat. Blend in blender. Add sour cream. Season with salt. Cover & refrigerate until needed. Prepare avocados. Cut into 2-inch chunks. Peel & discard pits. Dice. Sprinkle with lemon juice. Serve avocado with chips. Serve salsa with chips.
Name: Mexican Green Sauce
Ingredients: tomatillo, fresh jalapenos, fresh cilantro, onion, garlic clove, fresh mint leaves, vegetable oil, vegetable broth, salt
Preparation: Boil the tomatillos and jalapenos in salted water until just tender, about 10 minutes, then drain. Place in blender or food processor with cilantro, onion and garlic and blend until smooth. Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Pour sauce

Prepare a large bowl with a little flour. Season the flour with garlic powder and pepper. Dust the chops in the flour mixture. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet on medium heat. Place the pork chops in the skillet. Fry until brown. Spread the brown mustard over each chop. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes per side or until the chops are cooked through. Serve.

Heat the oil and bacon in a large saucepan over moderate heat until the bacon is crisp. Remove the bacon with a slotted spoon and set aside. Drain off the fat from the saucepan. Stir in the onion, carrot, celery and bay leaves, and cook for 10 minutes until golden brown. Add the split peas and stir to coat with the fat from the bacon. Add the stock, bring to the boil then cover and simmer for 1 hour or until the split peas are very soft. Cool slightly then liquidise with a hand held blender or in a food processor to a smooth purée. Return to the pan over moderate heat with the bacon and the yogurt. Heat through without boiling, stirring until well blended. Serve with the crusty bread

Place stuffing in a bowl. Add enough turkey to moisten all the stuffing. Place in a baking dish. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Bake for 15 minutes or until thoroughly heated through. Place a patty of stuffing onto the center of each bun bottom and place a slice of cheese on top of each patty. Cover the top of each patty with the bun top. Place patties in the baking dish and bake for 15 minutes more or until the cheese is melted and buns are toasted. Pour the gravy around the edges of the buns and serve immediately.

Grease two 8-inch loaf pans or one 9-inch loaf pan. Sift together dry ingredients. Cream butter with sugar until light and fluffy. Add mashed bananas and vanilla. Alternate adding dry ingredients with banana mixture until just combined. Spread into prepared pans. Bake at 350 degrees F for 45-50 minutes. Cool 10 minutes. Remove from pans to wire racks.
I tried it last weekend with a few changes (I used one can of tuna in water, one can of corn, and a half a can of green beans instead of the vegetable medley). It was delicious! I’m so happy to have found this recipe!

Place breasts in a large slow cooker. Sprinkle with salt & pepper. Slice the onions & place in the slow cooker with the breasts. Pour in the chicken broth & the tomatoes. Add the cream of chicken soup & the cheese soup. Stir & cover with the lid. Cook on low for 8 hours. Remove the chicken & shred. Add back to the sauce with the cream cheese. Stir & cook for another 2 hours. Serve with tortilla chips.
name: slow cooker taco saladingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, onion, taco seasoning mix, canned corn, canned black beans, canned green chilies, taco shells, salsapreparation:Place breasts in slow cooker then sprinkle with salt & pepper. Add the onion then sprinkle with the taco seasoning & stir to coat. Cover & cook on low 4 hours. Remove the chicken & shred. Add the corn & beans. Stir to combine. Cover & cook for another 1 hour. Serve in

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Prepare the polenta as directed on package or as directed on recipe card. Add 1/4 cup cold water to the cooked polenta while stirring with a wooden spoon. Let the polenta cool until it is thick enough to spread out on a pizza stone or a well greased cookie sheet. Spread out the polenta to about 1/2 an inch thickness using a spoon. Top the polenta with your favorite pizza toppings and bake for 20 minutes or until the toppings are heated through. Let cool slightly before cutting into slices.

Preheat oven to 375f. Brown bacon until crispdrain. Cook potatoes until tender in boiling water or in microwavedrain. Add soupmash with potatoes. Combine with remaining ingredients. Spread in 2-quart casserole dishbake uncovered 40 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Heat a non-stick frying pan over a medium heat. Season the chicken with salt and pepper. Dust with the paprika. Add the olive oil and then the garlic cloves. Cook for 1-2 minutes until the garlic starts to turn golden. Add the brandy and allow to boil for 1-2 minutes until the liquid has evaporated. Turn the heat down to low and add the chicken stock, bay leaf and parsley sprig. Cover the pan with a lid or foil and leave to simmer for 20 minutes. Remove the lid and check that the chicken is thoroughly cooked. Remove the bay leaf. Season to taste. Serve with plain white or brown rice.
Brown ground beef in skillet. Add onion and pepper. Cook 5 minutes. Add tomatoes. Cook 3 minutes. Add rice, chili powder, salt, and cumin. Cook until rice is done. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Boil 2 cups of water. Add the couscous and cook for about 10 minutes or until tender. Drain off any excess water. In the meantime, heat the olive oil in a small frying pan. Add the capsicums and zucchini, cooking for about 5 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Add the sun-dried tomatoes. Drain off any excess liquid. Add the parsley, walnuts, couscous, lemon juice and salt. Mix gently.

Cook the zucchini in a skillet with a little butter until tender. Put in a casserole dish. Brown the sausage in the same pan. Drain the fat. Mix the zucchini with the sausage, flour, onions, cottage cheese, eggs, garlic salt and half the mozzarella. Pour this mixture over the zucchini. Top with the remaining cheese. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

Put all the dry ingredients into a large bowl and mix well. Stir in the dates and nuts and then mix well again. Pour into a greased loaf tin and cook in a pre heated 170 degrees c / 160 degrees c fan forced oven for about 1 hour or until the loaf is done. Cool in the tin for about 10 minutes then turn out onto a wire rack.
Slice thinly and serve with butter or jam or whatever you like on your bread.

Mix first four ingredients in a large bowl at least two hours in advance of serving. Slice bananas. Layer a glass bowl with the following three times in this order: vanilla wafers, sliced bananas, and the mixture of the first four ingredients. Top with remaining cool whip. Chill for several hours before serving.

Crush Oreos to fine crumbs and add to a 9×13 casserole dish or pie plate. Melt butter and pour over crumbs to coat evenly. Freeze while you make filling. In a large bowl, mix ice cream, chocolate syrup and sweetened condensed milk until well blended. Stir in vanilla. Spread filling over crumbs and freeze 1 hour or until set. Spread Cool Whip over filling and garnish with additional Oreos if desired.

Cut the chicken breasts in half and pound them with a heavy skillet or mallet until each piece is about 1/4 inch thick. Place the breadcrumbs in a shallow bowl. Beat the eggs with the salt and pepper and pour them over the crumbs. Dip the chicken pieces first in the egg mixture and then in the crumb mixture to coat. In a skillet over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the chicken pieces and cook until browned on both sides and cooked through, about 10 minutes total. Transfer the chicken to a platter and keep warm in a 200 degree oven. Add the garlic to the skillet and cook until the garlic is golden brown and fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the lemon juice and parsley and stir well. Pour over the chicken and serve immediately.

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat wine until boiling. Reduce heat to simmer and add the onion, shallot, mushroom, and vegetable stock. Simmer for 10 minutes, or until the liquid is reduced by half. Transfer the skillet to the oven for 30 minutes, or until the mushroom is tender. In a small bowl, whisk together the cornstarch and water until smooth. Stir into the skillet and continue cooking for another 2-3 minutes, until thickened. Season with salt and pepper.

Rub inside and outside of each chicken breast with a mixture of olive oil and lemon juice. Set aside. Combine the lemon juice, soy sauce and garlic in a small bowl. Mix well. In a medium-sized bowl combine the olive oil and garlic. Mix well. Rub the mixture over the entire inside and outside of each piece of chicken. Place the pieces on the grill and cook 4 to 5 minutes per side or until the internal temperature of the chicken is 165 F. (Do not overcook.) Remove from the grill and brush the soy sauce mixture over each piece.

Brown the bacon in a skillet over medium heat, remove to paper towels, and set aside. In a separate skillet heat the oil over medium heat. Add the vinegar, reduce heat to low heat, and simmer for about 2 minutes. Add the diced red onion to the skillet and cook until the onions are translucent. Set aside to cool for about 15 minutes. In a small bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise and the red wine vinaigrette. Add the diced roquefort cheese. Whisk to combine. In a large bowl, toss the butter lettuce with the vinaigrette. Add the diced roquefort cheese, dried cherries, and the cooked bacon pieces. Toss to combine well. Serve immediately.

Combine all ingredients except fish in bowl. Mix together well. Place fish in bowl and cover with mixture. Marinate for 20 minutes. Meanwhile prepare a pan with some olive oil. Remove fish from bowl and pat dry. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs and bake uncovered until done. Serve with capers and lemon.

Cut the tops off the tomatoes and scoop out the seeds. Cut the tomatoes into cubes and place in a saucepan. Add the sweet peppers and the onion and cover with the juice from the cans. Add the garlic and oregano. Bring to a boil and then lower heat and simmer for 25 minutes. Mash the vegetables to create a thick sauce. Add the dried basil and fresh ground black pepper.

In a medium-size sauté pan over medium heat, melt butter. Add onions and cook slowly until browned, about 15 minutes. Stir in brown sugar and cook for 1 minute to dissolve the sugar. Add the stock and bring to a simmerseason with salt and pepper and cook until the liquid is absorbed and the onions are soft and slightly glazed, about 20 minutes more. Fold in the craisins and continue to cook until the liquid is evaporated and the mixture is thick and glazed, about 15 minutes longer. Add the cooked rice and stir to combine thoroughly.

Dice olives and green peppers. Place in small bowl. Heat oil in large skillet over med heat. Season steaks with garlic powder and black pepper. Cook until brown and tender. Add tomatoes, olives and green peppers. Stir in onion soup mix and water. Heat to boiling. Cover and simmer 10 minutes. Season with thyme. Serve over rice.
Brown bacon and onion. Drain. Add all other ingredients except beans. Cook 5 minutes. Stir in beans. Cook another 5 minutes. Serve over mashed potatoes.
Melt almond bark. Add the rest of the ingredients. Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper. Cool. Store in airtight containers.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add sausage and cook for 2-3 minutes or until browned. Stir in onion. Reduce heat to medium-low. Add bell peppers. Cook 4-5 minutes. Remove from heat. Add cheeses to sausage mixture. Set aside. In medium bowl beat eggs with milk. Add sausage mixture. Stir in pastry shells. Place in 13x9-inch pan. Bake 350° for 35-40 minutes or until knife inserted in center comes out clean. Let stand for 15 minutes. Yield: 10-12 servings.

Combine cookies and cream cheese in food processor until crumbs form. Add sugar and process until well mixed. Add eggs and lemon juice and process until well mixed. Pour batter into unbaked 9 inch pie shell. Bake for 20 minutes. Cool. Spread with cherry pie filling and refrigerate. Cut into wedges to serve.

Beat butter and brown sugar in a bowl. Add egg. Sift dry ingredients together. Stir in fruit and nut. Press into a greased shallow pan. Bake for 45 minutes at 160 deg celcius. Cool slightly before removing from pan. Makes 30.

Combine whole milk and low-fat milk with 3/4 cup of powdered milk, and bring to 180 F. Cool to 110 F and add 1/2 cup of yogurt starter and stir well. Pour into a container and refrigerate for 12 hours or longer for better flavor. Remove from fridge and allow to ripen for 1 hour. Store in fridge up to 2 weeks.
Yogurt is very rich in calcium and protein, which are needed for healthy bones and strong teeth.
Yogurt is a dairy product produced by the fermentation of milk by various species of lactic acid producing bacteria.
It is made by first fermenting milk, usually with the help of bacteria (most commonly Lactobacillus delbrueckii subsp. bulgaricus and Streptococcus thermophilus).
The milk is then usually strained to remove the whey and produce a thicker consistency.
Flavorings and additives are often included as well.
Yogurt is sometimes used as a substitute for milk in cooking.

Pour sauce in crock pot. Add ravioli. Stir in Rotel. Sprinkle with Italian seasoning. Salt and pepper to taste. Cover. Cook on high for 4 hours or low for 6-8 hours. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and serve.

Spread brownie bar dough in greased 8x8x2 pan. Bake in 350 degree oven for 30 min. Let cool. Combine condensed milk and morsels. Drizzle over cool brownie bars. Sprinkle with flaked coconut. Chill until firm. Cut into bars.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Slice the turkey into bite sized pieces and place in a large bowl. Break the eggs into the bowl and add the cheese. Mix well and form into 10 to 12 patties and set aside. Brush the cut side of the buns with mayonnaise and lay face down on a baking tray. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until lightly browned. To assemble the sandwiches, place the patties in the center of the bun bottoms and top with 2 slices of pickle relish and 2 slices of onions. Top with the bun tops and serve immediately. Makes 10 sandwiches.

Saut onion in butter or margarine in large saucepan over medium heat until tender. Add ground turkey and cook until no longer pink, stirring to break up meat. Stir in mushrooms and cabbage. Add the carrot. Stir in water. Bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat. Simmer until tender, stirring occasionally, about 10 minutes. Stir in mushroom soup. Heat through. Stir in skim milk and parsley. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered in 400-degree oven for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Heat butter in skillet over medium-high heat. Add lemon juice and cooked mushrooms. Add salt and pepper to taste. Spread mayo on both sides of the bread. Add slices of tomato. Place the arugula leaves in the middle of the bread. Place the hot mushrooms on top of the arugula. Close the sandwich. Slice and serve.

Mix 1/2 cup of warm water with 2 tablespoons of sugar and 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Stir in 1 package of active dry yeast. Let stand for 5 minutes to allow the yeast to begin to actively foam.Add 3 cups of warm water, 5 cups of bread flour and 2 teaspoons of sugar to a large bowl. Pour in the mixture of water and yeast. Stir until the mixture forms a dough that is soft and sticky.Knead dough on a lightly floured surface for about 8-10 minutes, adding a little more flour as necessary if the dough is too sticky. Place the dough in an oiled bowl and let stand to rise in a warm place for 1 hour, or until doubled in size.Punch down the dough and divide in half. Form each half into a 1-pound loaf, and place the loaves on a lightly greased baking sheet or baking stone. Cover the dough and allow to rise again for 30 minutes, until doubled in size. Preheat o

Combine the sugar, buttermilk and butter in a heavy saucepan over medium heat. Cook until the mixture reaches the hard crack stage. Add the baking sodabeat with a wooden spoon until the mixture becomes very thick. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper. Let stand until firm.

Combine the butter and cheese in a mixer bowl until well mixed. Stir in the flour to make a dough. Roll the dough into a ball, wrap in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to 1/8 inch thickness. Cut out biscuits with a 2 inch round cutter. Place biscuits 1 inch apart on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Top biscuits with poppy seeds, if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Slice pears and place in a baking pan. In a large bowl combine tarragon with 2 tablespoons of the mustard and 2 tablespoons of the oil. Season the chicken breasts with the remaining 1/4 teaspoon of the mustard and 1 teaspoon of the oil. Arrange the breasts on top of the pears and season with salt and pepper. Cover the pan tightly with aluminum foil and place in the oven. Roast for 30 minutes or until the chicken is done. Remove the pan from the oven. Sprinkle the breasts with the remaining 1 tablespoon of the tarragon-mustard mixture and the remaining 1 tablespoon of the oil. Pour the chicken stock in a 2-cup measuring cup and add the maple syrup to taste. Whisk the stock and the mustard together to make a smooth sauce. Pour the sauce over the breasts and pears and serve.
Mix together hot water with salt, sugar, garlic powder, onion powder, jerks seasoning. Dip whole chickens into brine. Cook as normal.

Soak dates in boiling water overnight or at least 6 hours. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Drain dates reserving water. In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, salt and sugar. Beat shortening into mixture until crumbly. Add the dates and egg mixturemix well. Add the vanilla. Turn into a greased 8-inch square baking pan. Pour enough reserved water over dates to cover them completelyset aside. Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until cake pulls away from sides of the pan. Cool on a wire rack. Serves 8.
Bring 3/4 cup water to a boil. Add datesreduce heat to medium-low and simmer until dates are soft, about 5 minutes. Mash dates with a potato masher. Remove dates from heatset aside.
In a large bowl, combine flour, baking soda, and saltset aside. Beat shortening into mixture until crumblystir in dates. Add eggs, one at a time, be

Blend all the above together in a food processor until smooth. Add a little more oil if needed. Add some Parmesan or Romano cheese to taste.
Wondering where to find the best Pesto recipes? Well, you're in luck. We've created an entire category dedicated to Pesto recipes. It's called Pesto Recipes. That's it. And this is just one of many categories we're working on to organize the Web's recipes. Don't forget to check out our other recipes categories.
We have recipes for Pesto from all over the world, and they're all here. And we add more each day. So check back often. Or better yet, sign up for our newsletter and we'll send you notifications each time we add a new recipe.
Do you have a recipe for Pesto? Then send it in! We'd love to post it here. We need the recipe in English. And we need photos. A link back to your site would be a plus too. Please send your submissions to: recipes@best-recipes.org.

In a large pot, heat the oil over medium high heat. Saute the onion and potatoes for about 5 minutes. Add the chicken thighs and cook until browned. Stir in the tomatillos and pickled pepper. Add the water, cover the pot, and simmer for about 20 minutes. Stir in the cilantro and serve over rice.

Place potatoes in shallow baking dish. Combine remaining ingredientsspread over potatoes. Bake at 450 degrees for 30 minutes or until crisp and golden. Serve warm.
The name says it all...Bacon Cheese Snacks!

Place chicken thighs in a large plastic bag. In a small bowl combine honey, lemon juice and yogurt. Pour over chicken. Add mint and seal bag. Refrigerate overnight. Remove chicken from marinade. Discard marinade. Grill or broil chicken until no longer pink. Serve hot. Serves 4.

In a medium bowl, beat together the cream cheese, eggs and sugar until smooth. Stir in the sour cream. Spoon cherry filling into the pie shell. Spread the filling mixture on top of the cherry filling. Bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool.

Put all ingredients in a food processor and pulse until smooth and creamy. If you like it smooth and creamy like the store bought kind you can do this by pureeing it for a minute or two. If you like it more like a chunky dip then you can just let the food processor pulse for a few minutes. It will be smooth but have small chunks in it. Either way is delicious. Serve it up with pita breads and veggies for a snack or appetizer. Makes about 2 cups.

In a large bowl, combine miso, mirin, wine and wasabi powder. Stir until miso dissolves. Add rice vinegar. Stir until blended. Place steak in a plastic bag. Add marinade and seal bag. Refrigerate at least 2 hours or overnight. Remove steak and pat dry. Heat skillet over high heat. Spray skillet with cooking spray. Cook steak 2-3 minutes per side. Remove from heat and let rest for 10 minutes.

Pre-heat oven to 375f. Spray 2 baking sheets with non-stick cooking spray. In a small bowl combine the sugar, chile powder, and chile powder. In a medium bowl combine the butter and honey. In another medium bowl combine the kosher salt and peanuts. Bring the honey mixture to a boil over medium heat. Boil for 2 minutes. Add the sugar mixture and continue to boil for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the peanuts. Spread evenly on the baking sheets. Bake at 375f for 25-30 minutes stirring occasionally until the nuts are golden brown. Cool and store in an air-tight container.

Heat half of the oil over high heat. Add eggs and break up with spatula. Remove from pan and set aside. Heat remaining oil and add spring onions. Add rice and mix well. Add eggs and combine well with rice. Add tomatoes and light soy sauce and mix well. Add sesame oil and season with white pepper. Serve immediately.

Soak gelatin in a little cold water to cover. Let stand 10 minutes or until softened. In a small saucepan combine gelatin with apple juice, stirring until dissolved. In a medium bowl combine mashed bananas and applesauce. Stir in gelatin mixture until evenly blended and thickened. Divide into 12 equal portions and place on waxed paper on a baking sheet. Refrigerate 2 hours or until firm. Unmold and cut each portion in half to make 24 pieces. Makes 24 servings. 20 calories each.

Spray 13x9x2-inch pan with cooking spraycombine all ingredients except fat-free cool whip in large bowlbeat until well combinedpour into panbake at 325f for about 40 minutes or until knife inserted near center comes out cleancool 15 minutesspread with fat-free cool whipserve warm or chilled.

Wash the fruit thoroughly and cut it into small pieces. Place it in a large pot with the water. Add the sugar and the salt. Bring to a boil. Let simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally to keep the fruit from sticking to the bottom of the pot. Remove from the heat, and skim the fruit to remove any scum that may have risen to the surface of the water. Put the fruit through a food mill or a sieve to remove the peel and seeds. Bring the mixture back to a boil. Add the rind of the oranges and lemons, and cook for about 10 more minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from the heat and allow to cool. Clean the jars and lids according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Pour the hot mixture into the jars. Cap the jars tightly and place them in the refrigerator. Allow the jam to cool completely before serving. Makes about 2 pints of jam.

In a large bowl, combine the soup, sugar, lemon juice, onion, 2 pounds ground beef, 3 eggs (2 large), 1/2 cup dry bread crumbs, 1/4 teaspoon each of caraway seeds and salt, 1/8 teaspoon each of black pepper and garlic powder. Shape the mixture into 1-inch meatballs. Brown the meatballs in 2 tablespoons butter in a large skillet. Add 1 can (10 ounces) cream of mushroom soup and 1/2 cup milk. Simmer over medium heat for about 45 minutes. Makes 4 servings.
Season roast with salt and pepper. Brown in hot oil with lemon juice and mustard. Sprinkle with nutmeg. Arrange vegetables around roast. Pour in broth. Bake uncovered for 3 hours at 375 degrees F.

Spread soft goat cheese on the baguettes. Sprinkle with rosemary, thyme, lemon peel and coarse ground black pepper. Drizzle with olive oil. Top with the smoked salmon. Sprinkle with more rosemary. Squeeze lemon juice over. Serve.

Heat oven to 400f. Combine all the ingredients except the shrimps and set aside. Rinse the shrimps, dry and rub with the mixture. Set aside for 30 minutes. Skewer the shrimps and grill for 3-5 minutes or until the shrimps turn pink. Garnish with chopped coriander. Serve with lemon wedges.

Boil 12 large eggs in a pot of water with the peppercorn. After cooking for 10 minutes, remove from heat and let sit in water for 10 more minutes. Cool completely in an ice water bath. Peel the eggs and cut them in half lengthwise. Gently remove the yolks with a teaspoon and place them in a medium sized mixing bowl. Mash the egg yolks with a fork and then stir in the capers, mayonnaise, dijon mustard, salt and sugar until the filling is smooth and creamy. Evenly fill the cut out centers of the egg whites with the filling. Sprinkle with a little extra caper for garnish.
Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Sift together dry ingredients. Cream together oil and sugar. Beat in eggs and milk. Add dry mixture alternately with bananas. Stir in raisins. Bake for 1 hour.

In a wok or frying pan over high heat, add water chestnuts and cook until crisp-tender. Remove from heat and drain on paper towels. In same skillet add vegetable oil and heat over high heat until smoking. Add snow peas and stir fry until just tender-crisp, about 2 minutes. Stir in broth and snow pea pods and heat through. Season with sesame oil and salt to taste. Serve hot.

In a bowl mix all the above ingredients except the oil. Coat the chicken pieces with the marinade. Cover and keep refrigerated for about an hour. Heat the oil in a frying pan. Put the marinated pieces in the pan. Cook them for about ten minutes on each side or until tender. Serve hot with plain boiled rice.
Wrap each date with 1/2 slice bacon and secure with a toothpick. Combine 1/4 cup goat cheese and 2 Tablespoons chopped almondsstuff into dates and serve. Makes 12.

Cut pork chops 1/4 inch thick. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Heat 1 inch oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add pork chops and brown on each side. Add vegetable oil, vinegar and juice and bring to a boil. Add brown sugar and ginger. Reduce heat and cook until pork is tender. Arrange pork chops on a platter. Top with orange sections. Serve immediately.

For each sandwich, spread outside of bread with melted butter. Top bread with blue cheese slices. On top of blue cheese, lay slice of cheddar cheese. Top this layer with ham slices and grapes. Top this with another layer of cheddar cheese and slice of blue cheese. Top this layer with another slice of bread. Butter outside of sandwich and place in non-stick skillet over medium heat. Cook for 2 minutes per side or until cheese is melted and toast is golden brown. Cut in half to serve.

Cook ground beef in a large skillet over med. Heat until no longer pink. Drain. Add salsa and heat for 1 minute. Fill each cup with meat mixture. Top with tostitos scoops. Sprinkle with cheese. Top with a dollop of sour cream. Serve with additional salsa.
name: nacho supreme pizzaingredients: pizza dough, shredded mozzarella cheese, tomatoes, chopped jalapeno peppers, chopped green bell peppers, red onions, black olives, pizza saucepreparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Roll out pizza dough. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 20 minutes. Top with remaining ingredients. Bake for 5 minutes.

Cook spam in skillet over medium heat until browned. Drain off excess fat. Stir in sour cream. Sprinkle with pepper. Add basil. Add dressing. Toss to coat. Cool slightly. Add tomatoes. Chill. Serves 8-10.
In a saucepan over medium heat, combine the milk, half-and-half, sugar, and cocoa. Cook until smooth, about 2 minutes. Stir in the vanilla and bourbon. Serve warm with marshmallows.

In food processor combine herbs, tarragon and marjoram. Add the garlic and process until fine. Add the salt, pepper and mustard. With the machine running add the oil in a slow steady stream. Add the vinegar and process until emulsified. Store refrigerated. Makes 1/2 cup.

In a medium saucepan, cover potatoes with water and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and cook for 20 minutes or until tender. Drain well and set aside to cool slightly. Mash with a potato masher. Add the remaining ingredients and continue to mash well until smooth. Serve immediately or store in an airtight container and refrigerate up to 1 day.
If you like this recipe you may like these others...
Name: garlic and herb potatoesIngredients: PotatoesOlive OilGarlicButterHerbsSalt and PepperPreparation: Cook the potato in a medium saucepan with the olive oil, salt and pepper over a low heat until tender. Drain well and return to the saucepan. Add the butter, garlic and herbs and mash well.
Name: easy mashed potato recipeIngredients: 1 lb potatoes1 stick of margarine1/4 c milk1/2 tsp salt1/2 tsp pepperPreparation
In large bowl mix steaks and spices. Drizzle olive oil over steaks. Grill steaks and turn frequently until desired doneness. Serve with favorite vegetables.

Bring stock to a boil. Add potatoes. Cover and cook until just tender. Meanwhile, steam asparagus until tender. Drain pasta. Add to potato mixture. Heat over low heat. Add butter. Add asparagus. Toss gently. Sprinkle with mint.

In large skillet over medium-high heat, add the butter and cook until melted. Add the chicken parts. Sprinkle with the ginger. Add the orange juice concentrate, the water and the rice. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat, cover and simmer for 20 minutes or until the chicken is tender. Garnish with green onion.

Combine the butter and 3/4 cup of the sugar in the top of a double boiler. Cook over hot water until the mixture is melted. Add the remaining 2/3 cup of sugar. In the meantime, combine the milk, flour, and cocoa in the top of the double boiler. Whisk well. Cook over the hot water until the mixture thickens and pulls away from the side of the pot. Remove from the heat. Remove the top of the double boiler from the stove and add the vanilla. Cool for 10 minutes. Beat the mixture with an electric hand mixer on medium speed until the mixture is smooth. Fold in the almonds and baking powder. Drop the mixture by spoonfuls onto waxed paper. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Yields 2 dozen.

In a large skillet over medium heat, cook the bacon until it is crisp. Remove bacon from skillet with a slotted spoon and set aside. Pour off all the fat from the skillet leaving a small amount to saute the potatoes. Peel the potatoes and cut into small chunks. Add the potatoes to the bacon fat in the skillet. Cook over medium heat until the potatoes turn a light golden brown and crisp. Stir in the bacon and cook until heated through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with fresh parsley before serving.

Drain the liquid from the canned salmon. Add the onions and mash the mixture with a potato masher. Add the cornmeal, flour, egg and mayonnaise. Add the remaining salmon liquid if needed and mix well. Shape into patties and fry in hot oil until golden brown on each side. Serve warm or cold. Serves 4.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Brown chicken in batches. Add celery, onion and green pepper and cook until crisp-tender. Stir in tomatoes and sauce. Add seasoning and water. Bring to a boil. Add shrimp. Heat to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes. Meanwhile cook rice according to package directions. Serve rice over jambalaya.

In a large saute pan cook peppers and onions in butter until tender. Add cajun seasoning. Add raw shrimp and cook until pink. Add cream and stir. Add cooked angel hair pasta and stir to coat. Salt and pepper to taste. Serves 4.

Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat. Saute onions until soft but not browned. Place onions in a bowl. Add ground beef to the skillet. Cook until browned. Add onions back to the skillet. Season with salt & pepper to taste. Divide ground beef mixture into 4 rye bread slices. Layer with american cheese and swiss cheese. Melt under broiler for about 2 minutes until cheese is melted.

Place roast in a large pot. Add water to cover. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 2 hours. Add vinegar and ketchup. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Add sugar, onion powder and pickling spices. Cover and let stand overnight. Strain liquid into a large pot. Stir in ginger snaps and string. Simmer 5 minutes. Remove cheesecloth and string. Add to roast. Bake at 325 for 2 hours. Remove from oven and turn roast over. Add ginger snaps and string. Bake another 2 hours or until done.
Preheat oven to 180c. Combine all ingredients except walnuts. Knead for 1 minute. Roll into a loaf shape. Sprinkle with walnuts. Bake for 40 mins. Cool. Serve.

Season chicken with salt and pepper. Roll the prosciutto around the breasts. Wrap the prosciutto with basil and cheese and place it on a baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and bake for about 30 minutes or until the cheese has melted and the prosciutto is crisp and golden brown.
Combine chicken pieces and lemon juice. Add pepper, cream of mushroom soup and onion soup mix. Heat through. Serve over rice, noodles or biscuits. Sprinkle with dill weed and paprika.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine dry ingredients. Cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. Add vanilla and nuts. Gradually add dry ingredients and mix well. Bake in 8x8x2 inch pan for 20-25 minutes. Do not overcook.

Dry fish on paper towels. Combine flour, cornmeal, onion salt and pepper in a shallow bowl. Heat butter in skillet until it melts. Dip cod in flour mixture and place in hot butter. Cook 2 minutes on each side until brown. Drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Cream together butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Add in vanilla and eggs. In a separate bowl sift together flour, baking soda, baking powder. Blend into creamed mixture. Stir in Andes mints. Drop by spoonful onto ungreased cookie sheet and bake at 350 for 8-10 minutes.

Peel the parsnips and slice them into thin chips about 1/4 inch thick. You will need about 12 ounces of chips for this recipe. Melt the butter with the water in a pan and bring the mixture to a boil. Add the chips and cook them until they are tender but still retain some bite, about 5-6 minutes. Stir in the lemon juice and season with the salt and pepper to taste. Blend the mixture in a blender or food processor until smooth. Serve warm as a side dish or on toast with poached eggs for a satisfying breakfast.

Combine the rice and flour in a large bowlbeat in the butter and eggs until well blendedstir in the cheese and cayenne peppershape into 2-inch ballsroll in the fresh bread crumbsplace on a baking sheetspray the tops with non-stick cooking spraybake at 350 for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Line a 9-inch pie pan with phyllo sheets, spraying each layer with cooking spray. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook the bacon until crispdrain on paper towels. Remove excess fat from skillet. Cook the corn in the skillet with the oil for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Combine the corn with the cheese, parsley, eggs, milk, and pepper in a bowlspoon into phyllo pan. Bake until golden brown, about 25 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large mixing bowl combine crumbs and brown sugar. Add butter and mix well. Press mixture evenly into a 15 x 10 inch jelly roll pan sprayed with baking spray. Bake for 12 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes. In a separate bowl combine cream cheese, sugar and rind until smooth and creamy. Stir in eggs and juice and mix well. Spread over cooled crust. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden and set. Cool completely and cut into bars.

In a small bowl combine sour cream and salsa. In another small bowl combine taco mix and cilantro. Skewer the chicken and dip the meat into the salsa mixture and then into the taco mix. Cook on the grill. Serve with salsa and sour cream. This is really great for parties. You can also add onion and peppers to the skewers if you wish.

Mix together the beef stock, garlic, ginger, chili, fish sauce, sugar, kaffir lime leaves and coriander leaves. Boil the beef stock until reduced by half. Add dumplings to the stock. Cook for a further five minutes. Serve immediately.

Peel the green beans and cut into pieces of 5 cm long. Peel the bacon and cut into pieces of 0.5 cm wide. Put the bacon and the green beans into the pressure cooker. Season with a little salt. Add enough water to cover the green beans. Close and cook for 10 minutes. Serve hot.
Name: Garden Green Beans
Ingredients: Fresh Green Beans, Fresh Mushrooms, Onions, Garlic, Olive Oil, Sliced Water Chestnuts, Italian Seasoning, Salt, Pepper, Parmesan Cheese
Preparation: Place beans in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer until crisp-tender. Meanwhile, in a skillet, saute mushrooms, onion and garlic in oil until tender. Stir in water chestnuts and seasonings. Heat through. Drain beans and stir into skillet. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.
Name: Arizona Beans
Ingredients: Red Kidney Beans

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Toss the onions with the butter until browned. In small bowl combine worcestershire sauce, brown sugar and ketchup. In another bowl combine the flour with the paprika and the salt and pepper. Dredge the chicken pieces in the flour mixture then dip in the sauce. Place the pieces in the baking dish with the onions. Cover and bake for 1 hour, basting the chicken with the sauce every 15 minutes. Uncover the dish and bake for another 30 minutes basting frequently.
Melt butter in a large pan. Stir in crumbs& sprinkle with coconut& nuts. Pour condensed milk over top. Sprinkle with remaining ingredients. Bake at 350 for 20-25 min. Cool and cut into squares.

Preheat griddle over medium heat. Mix together dry ingredients in a bowl. Combine with egg and buttermilk. Add 2 tbsp of oil and beat with a whisk until well combined. Fold in remaining 2 tbsp of oil until batter is smooth. Ladle batter onto heated griddle. Cook until bubbles break the surface of each pancake. Flip and cook until both sides are golden brown and cooked through. Serve with butter and syrup.
