Heat a large saute pan over medium heat. Add a small amount of oil to the pan. Brown the chicken breast on both sides. When the chicken is cooked through, remove from pan. Add butter to the same pan. Saute garlic and cajun seasoning. Add the chicken back to the pan. Add half and half and cream cheese. Simmer until sauce is heated through. Add cooked pasta to the pan. Add fontinella cheese. Toss to combine. Serve hot. Serves 6.

Combine cottage cheese, curry powder, green onion, and mango chutney in large bowl. Beat until smooth. Stir in cream cheese until well blended. Shape into ball and roll in dry roasted peanuts. If desired, garnish with raisins and coconut. Chill until ready to serve. Serve with crackers.

In a large skillet over med heat, cook onion in hot, melted butter until tender. Add in mushrooms and cook about 5 minutes or until mushrooms are tender, stirring occasionally. Transfer mixture to a greased 3-quart baking dish. Stir in the rice, soup, and consomme. Bake, covered, at 350 for about 1 hour and 15 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender, stirring once or twice. Let stand, covered, for 15 minutes before serving.

Melt butter and add flourcook until brown stirring constantly. Add milk and continue to cook stirring constantly until sauce thickens. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.
This recipe is a bit of an experiment for me. I really love the flavor of gorgonzola cheese and I like to have a cheese sauce to put over pasta or baked potatoes. This cheese sauce is a bit different than other recipes I’ve seen because it has a bit of an “herby” flavor from the shallot and tarragon. I also used heavy cream rather than milk. The flavor is strong and rich but not overpowering. It has a mellow flavor that is very pleasant to eat.
This white sauce is so easy to make and the flavor is amazing! I added some fresh herbs to the sauce and it made the flavor even more delicious! I served it over pasta with some grilled chicken and it was so good! The sauce is thick and creamy and the flavor is really good. I would definitely make this again!
The sauce is very creamy and

Cut steak into small strips. Broil steak 3 minutes. Sprinkle steak with fajita seasoning. Broil steak 3 to 5 minutes longer or until desired doneness. Top each chip with steak and cheese. Serve with nonfat sour cream and guacamole.

In a small saucepan, cook chicken in onion until cooked through. Add curry powder, cumin and pepper, stirring constantly until mixture is well blended. Add couscous, broth and peas, cover and remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with fork. Add raisins and serve.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Combine eggs and pumpkin puree. Add the other ingredients and pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake for 15 minutes at 425 degrees. Then lower heat to 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Cool and garnish with whipped cream.

Pour boiling water over prunes in a bowl and allow to soak overnight. In a saucepan, heat oil over low heat. Add prune soaking water, onion, capers, horseradish and salt and pepper. Cook over low heat for 20 minutes or until onion has softened. Turn off heat and stir in garlic. Cool before serving.

Combine the sugar and water in a small saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook until the sugar is dissolved. Remove from the heat and add the vinegar, stirring to combine. Place the beans in a medium bowl and pour the dressing over the beans. Toss to combine the dressing with the beans. Chill for at least 1 hour before serving. Serve with slivered almonds sprinkled over the top.

Scoop out the center of the camembert and place it on a small dish. Mix together the marmalade, ground cumin and the herbs and spoon the mixture into the camembert shell. Cover with pecans. Serve with crackers.

Heat 2 T. of the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the shallot and garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the spinach. Cook until the spinach wilts, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the remaining 1 T. of oil. Add the tomatoes, the sun-dried tomatoes and 1/4 t. each of the salt and pepper. Stir to mix. Add the pasta and cook for 1 minute to heat through. Sprinkle with the pine nuts and the cheese. Serve immediately.
Brown meat in oil. Add allspice. Add water. Simmer. Add all other ingredients. Simmer covered until meat is tender.

Place sugar, cornstarch, ground cloves and cinnamon in a sauce pan and stir until well mixed. Add orange juice and cider vinegar and stir until combined. Cook over medium heat until mixture becomes thickened into a syrup consistency. Stir in cocktail franks until fully coated. Simmer 15 minutes to heat through and glaze. Remove from heat and serve immediately on toothpicks.
Drain can of pork sausageadd to slow cooker. Combine all remaining ingredients in slow cookerpour over sausage. Cook on low 6-8 hours or until bubbly. Serve with cornbread.
Combine all ingredients in bowl. Add more olive oil if desired. Serve chilled.

Cream butter and cream cheese together well and add sugar gradually beating well after each addition. Add flour and salt, and beat well. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add almond extract and mace and beat well. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes and test with wooden pick. Remove and cool completely on rack. Spread with glaze and garnish with sliced almonds. Glaze: Cream butter and confectioners sugar together, add milk and mix well.

In a medium bowl combine walnuts with greek yogurt until well mixed. Add carrot and apple and mix. Add lime juice and honey to taste. Stir in gingerroot. Chill for at least 2 hours before serving. Serve in bowls topped with additional gingerroot.
Wow. You must really like apples. I'm not a big fan of them myself, but I can't help but respect all of the different varieties you have. I wish I could find some of these in my supermarket.
You are so lucky to be able to have so many varieties and so much freshness. I do not have access to all these varieties where I live.
I like apples. I also like all the pictures. It is so interesting to see how many different varieties there are. I had a hard time picking a favorite.
These look wonderful! I love the variety.
Sauté onion and garlic. Add white beans and cook. Stir in parsley. Add lemon juice, salt and pepper. Add diced pimentos. Serve hot or cold. Serves 6.

Cut off stems and caps from portabella mushrooms. Slice stems into thin strips. Slice caps into strips about 1/2 inch thick. Heat oil in large skillet over medium high heat. Add onion and saute until tender. Add mushrooms, cook for about 2 minutes. Add remaining ingredients. Stir well. Cook over medium heat until heated through. Serve over cooked angel hair pasta. Garnish with scallions.

Heat the butter and brown sugar in a large saucepan over medium heat until it comes to a boil. Cook for 1 minute and stir constantly until it comes to a hard boil and has thickened slightly. Pour over the cracker crumbs in an ungreased jelly roll pan and spread evenly with a spatula or back of a wooden spoon. Sprinkle with chocolate chips and bake in a preheated oven at 325 degrees for about 10 minutes or until bubbly and slightly golden brown around edges. Cool and break into pieces.

Combine flour, oat bran, cocoa, and salt. Add sweet potatomix until smooth. Stir in egg whites. Stir in pecans. Spread in greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 350f for 20 minutes. Cut into bars. Cool. Makes 12 bars.
Mix all ingredients in blender. Pour into glasses. Top each glass with whipped cream.

Peel the apple, then cut into small dice. Add the apple to a medium size pan with the brown sugar. Add the water and the cinnamon stick. Bring to a boil and simmer for about 10 minutes or until the apple is soft. Cool slightly, then blend the apple mixture with a handheld mixer until smooth. Beat the egg yolks with the sugar until thick and pale yellow. Add the egg mixture to the apple mixture and beat to combine. Pour the mixture into a 10 x 10 baking dish and smooth out the top with a spatula. Bake at 350F for 25-30 minutes or until the pudding is firm to the touch. Cool the pudding completely before cutting into squares. To serve, place a dollop of creme fraiche on each piece and top with a sprinkling of ground almonds.

Preheat oil in a deep fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Rinse fish under cold water, pat dry, and season with salt and pepper.Mix Bisquick with beer until a thin batter forms. Dip fish fillets into batter, then drop one at a time into hot oil. Fry fillets until both sides are golden brown. Drain on paper towels.
Beer Batter Fish
Beer Batter Fried Fish
Beer Battered Fish And Chips
Beer Battered Fish And Chips Recipes
Beer Battered Fish Recipe
Beer Batter Fish Recipe

Mix 1/2 cup of vanilla pudding mix with 1/4 cup milk to make a sauce. Mix it with the graham cracker and saltine crumbs and press into a 13x9-inch pan. Pour the butter brickle ice cream over the top. Beat 1/2 cup of cool whip with the remaining vanilla pudding mix and spread over the ice cream. Top with 1/2 cup of cool whip and 1/2 cup of miniature heath candy bars.

Steam cauliflower until tender, then drain well. In saucepan heat soup to boiling then add milk, stirring constantly. Pour over steamed cauliflower. In bowl mix breadcrumbs and parmesan cheese. Sprinkle on top of soup mixture. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until top is brown. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400. In a medium saucepan, bring milk almost to boiling. Add cauliflower and simmer over medium heat for 5 minutes or til cauliflower is tender when pierced with a fork. Drain well. Combine the milk, cornflour, egg, mustard powder and salt. Beat until smooth. Pour over the cauliflower and sprinkle with the cheese. Bake, uncovered for about 20 minutes or until the sauce is bubbly and thickened. Garnish with parsley if desired.

Cream together butter, peanut butter and brown sugar. Stir in egg and vanilla. Add flour and saltmix until combined. Spread into an ungreased 13 x 9-inch pan. Spread with grape jelly. Sprinkle with additional peanuts and chocolate chips. Bake at 350° for 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool completely. Cut into bars.

In a microwave safe bowl, combine butter, honey and cocoa. Microwave 30 seconds at a time until honey has melted. Remove from microwave and stir in peanut butter and vanilla until well mixed. Drop by spoonfuls onto wax paper. Let cool and harden.
Brown ground beef. Add water and bring to boil. Add vegetables and chestnuts. Boil 3 minutes. Add the seasoning pack from the noodles. Stir in the noodles and heat through.

In saucepan, combine sugar, corn syrup and water. Cook to boiling point, stirring occasionally. Remove from heatcool to 240 F on candy thermometer. Peel apples and dip in syrup. Place on waxed paper to dry. Cool completely before removing from waxed paper. Store in plastic bag.
Combine all ingredients. Form into patties. Grill to desired doneness. Serve in buns with lettuce and tomato.

In a nonstick skillet heat oil over med. Heat. Add pork and cook until desired doneness. Stir in refried beans and diced green chilies. Cook and stir 7 minutes. Spoon mixture on tortillas. Top with cheese. Fold bottom up, fold sides over. Garnish with salsa. Serve with sour cream if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Place all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup sugar, baking powder and salt into a large bowl and mix together with a fork. Add cold butter and cut with a pastry blender or fork until it resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in the egg and vanilla extract until just combined and knead a few times to bring together. On a lightly floured surface, pat into a 6-inch round and cut into 8 wedges. Transfer to a parchment lined baking sheet and brush the tops with the egg wash. Bake until golden and cooked through - 20 to 25 minutes. Sprinkle with white chocolate chips and dried cranberries and let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

Clean and wash urad dal. Soak for 2 hours. Drain water and keep aside. In a pan heat ghee/butter and add garlic paste and ginger paste. Sauté for a minute or two. Add chopped tomatoes and sauté for few minutes. Add chopped green chilies. Now add red chili powder and garam masala powder and mix well. Add drained urad dal and mix well. Add tomato puree and salt. Mix and sauté for few minutes more. Add fresh cream and mix well. Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and serve hot with rotis.

Spread each slice of bread lightly with butter on both sides. Place a strip of bacon on top of each slice of bread. Place a thin slice of banana on top of each piece of bacon. Sprinkle each piece of bread with cheese. Heat a large non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Place bread on the hot frying pan. Cook for 2 minutes on each side until the cheese has melted and the bacon is cooked through. Serve warm.

In skillet over medium-high heat, brown chops in oil about 5 minutes on each side. Remove from heat, cover and let stand 10 minutes. Cut off a small piece of each chop. Place back in pan and add barbecue sauce, cover and simmer 15 minutes. Combine applesauce with chili powder. Spoon half the mixture over each chop. Serve with remaining mixture.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl combine ground beef, ketchup, and eggmix well. Add breadcrumbs and mix well. Add soup, salt and pepper. Mix well. Place mixture into a 9x13-inch baking dishshape into a loaf. Bake uncovered 1 hour 15 minutes, or until well-browned and thoroughly heated through. Let stand 5 minutes before cutting to serve.

In a Dutch oven, saute garlic cloves and onion in olive oil. Add meat and cook till brown. Add apple, broth, ketchup and mustard. Bring to boil and simmer uncovered for 2 to 3 hours. Stir occasionally. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve over hot cooked rice or noodles.

Prepare graham cracker crust. Line bottom and sides of 9 inch pie shell. Mash bananas. Combine mashed bananas, cream cheese, lemon juice and sweetened condensed milk. Beat until smooth. Add vanilla. Spread over pie crust. Chill 6 hours or overnight. Top with whipped topping. Makes one 9 inch pie.

Sauté onions in a little fat. Add the chanterelles and continue sautéing them until they are golden brown. Add the paprika and a splash of aceto balsamico. Mix the flour with a little cold water and add to the sauce. Add a little more water. Let simmer for about 30 minutes. Add the sour cream. Garnish with parsley. Serve with boiled potatoes or bread.

Combine tomatoes with cilantro in a bowl. Squeeze lime and add to the mixture. Finely chop green onion and add to the mixture. Finely chop serrano and jalapeno peppers. Add to the mixture. Sprinkle in the red pepper and vinegar. Taste and adjust seasonings as desired. Serve with tortilla chips.

Chop cabbage very fine. Slice tomatoes. Slice corn from cob and remove as much water as possible from corn. Chop corn as fine as possible. Chop sweet peppers fine. Place all vegetables in a bowl. Add flour. Mix well. Heat oil in saucepan. Add flour mixture. Cook 2 to 3 minutes over medium heat. Add tomatoes, corn, sugar and salt. Add water. Cook 2 minutes. Add cider vinegar. Simmer 5 minutes. Cool. Add canning salt. Serve over ham.

Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Sauté the onion, carrot, and celery until softened. Add the vegetable bouillon granules and stir until the water dissolves. Add the lentils, water, orange juice, lemon juice, cumin, and salt and pepper to taste. Cook, uncovered, for 30 minutes or until the lentils are tender. Serve hot.

Cut the bell peppers into 1/4-inch strips. In a large bowl, toss together the grape tomatoes, bell peppers, roasted red peppers. Whisk together the olive oil, vinegar, cumin, salt, and pepper. Pour the dressing over the vegetables and toss to coat.

Heat olive oil in a deep skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions and fry until they turn a golden brown color. Add the lentils, stirring constantly, and fry for a few minutes. Add salt to taste and serve immediately.
I love lentils! They are so easy to cook and so healthy!
I love lentils but have never tried to cook them at home. Thanks for the great recipes!
I love them too! I will post more recipes soon!

Drain water from tofu and place in a food processor. Pulse until it resembles coarse crumbs or a smooth puree depending on how finely you like your frosting. Add the remaining ingredients and process until you have a spreadable frosting consistency. Adjust sweetness to your taste. Frosting will keep in the fridge in an airtight container for a few weeks.
Place scallops in 9x13 pan. Mix together the rest of the ingredients. Spread over top of scallops. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Turn oven off. Let stand for 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

Combine all veggies and spices together in a large skillet. Add onion and green peppers. Cook over medium heat for 3-5 minutes. Add tomatoes and cook for another 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Add white wine and lemon juice. Place fish in a baking dish. Spoon veggie mixture over fish and sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 425 for 10-12 minutes or until fish is flaky.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Line muffin tins with paper liners. Mix together dry ingredients. Combine wet ingredients. Add dry ingredients to wet. Add chips. Fill muffin cups. Bake for 20 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. Dust with powdered sugar.

In a heavy skillet with a lid, melt butter. Add onion and cook over medium heat until onion is soft and golden. Stir in brown sugar. Cover and cook over low heat until caramelized, about 45 minutes. Stir in chickpeas and lemon juice. Process with tahini and olive oil until smooth. Season with salt. Serve with crackers or pita bread.
Place brisket in a large plastic bag and add marinade. Refrigerate 24 hours. Brown brisket. Place in crock pot. Add vegetables. Cover. Cook 7 to 8 hours. Cut and serve. Serves 8-12.

Brown hamburger in a skillet until no longer pink. Stir in spaghetti sauce. Combine cottage cheese with sour cream. Spread 1/2 of meat mixture in bottom of skillet. Layer with 1/2 of the remaining ingredients. Repeat the layers. Top with remaining meat mixture. Cover and bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake until cheese is melted. Serve at once.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease 9x13 pan. Melt butter in medium pan. Saute onion and celery until tender. Add soup and water. Cook until mixture comes to a boil. Add milk. Add 1/2 can of soup to the mixture. Stir in sour cream and pepper. Arrange half of the chicken in the bottom of the pan. Top with 1/2 the ham and 1/2 of the swiss. Repeat layers. Top with remaining soup mixture. Bake for 45 mins. Stir in veggies and stuffing mix. Bake 10 more mins. Garnish with paprika if desired.

Cut bread into cubes and place in a large bowl. Add the onion and carrots and toss with the cubes to coat. In a smaller bowl mix together the lentils and zucchini. Heat the oil in a fry pan over medium heat and saut the lentil mixture for 2 minutes. Add the tomato paste and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Beat the eggs in a small bowl. Add the beaten egg to the lentil mixture and mix to combine. Stir in the corn kernel and the spices. Add the lentil mixture to the bread cubes and stir to combine. Transfer mixture to an 8x8" square baking pan. Cover and refrigerate overnight. The next morning preheat oven to 350F. Remove mixture from refrigerator and place in a bowl. Add the milk and stir to combine. Transfer to the prepared baking pan. Bake for 55 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes in the pan. Cut into 4 squares.

Brown hamburger and drain fat. Stir in onions and green onions. Stir in garlic. Add picante sauce and salt and pepper. Simmer until meat is cooked. Wrap in corn tortillas and top with cheese. Bake for 15 minutes at 350.

Steam the fresh green beans until tender. Combine the soy sauce, minced garlic and honey. Heat the canola oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir the honey mixture into the pan and stir to combine. Add the steamed green beans and stir to coat with the sauce. Cook for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with the chili-garlic sauce. Serve immediately. Serves 6.

Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake vigorously until very cold. Strain into 2 chilled cocktail glasses. Serve.
name: cranberry cosmoingredients: cranberry juice cocktail, 3 oz. vodka, 1 oz. triple sec, 1/2 oz. freshly squeezed lime juicepreparation:Pour all of the ingredients into a cocktail shaker half filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into two chilled cocktail glasses. Garnish with an orange twist.
name: cranberry martiniingredients: 1 oz. triple sec1 oz. freshly squeezed lemon or lime juice1 oz. freshly squeezed cranberry juice1 oz. vodka1 dash of grenadine1 oz. chilled champagnepreparation:Pour the triple sec and lemon or lime juice into a cock

Bring 2 quarts of cold water to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Remove from heat, add the tea bags and coversteep for 10 minutes. Remove the tea bags from the saucepan, stir in the orange juice and lemon juice. Stir in the honey until dissolved. Stir in the mint leaves and ginger. Chill until cold, at least 2 hours. Stir in the orange pekoe tea bags. Strain before serving over ice cubes in tall glasses. Garnish with lemon peels, if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare biscuits according to directions on package. Cut each biscuit in half. Spoon 2 teaspoons of the cream of chicken soup into bottom of each biscuit half. Top with 1 teaspoon cooked chicken and a sprinkling of the cheese. Top with 1/4 cup frozen mixed vegetables. Sprinkle each serving with 1/4 teaspoon each herbes de provence and onion powder and 1/8 teaspoon black pepper. Bake 15 minutes or until biscuits are golden brown. Makes 8.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line 9 by 13-inch baking pan with foil. In medium saucepan, cover potatoes with water and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes or until potatoes are just tender. Drain potatoes and allow to cool. In small bowl, combine yogurt and sour cream. In medium bowl, combine potatoes, cream cheese and remaining ingredients. Spoon mixture into prepared pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until heated through. Cool 15 minutes. Cover and refrigerate up to 24 hours. Before serving, sprinkle with bacon bits and Parmesan cheese.

In a large bowl stir together the flour, bran, low-fat mayonnaise, honey and salt until a soft dough forms. Knead the dough until it just comes together. On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough out into a 12-inch circle. Fold the dough in half, then roll it out again into a 12-inch circle. Fold again, then roll out a third time into a 12-inch circle. Gently press the dough into a 9-inch pie plate, being careful not to rip the dough. Trim the edges of the dough with a knife or pastry cutter, leaving about a 1/2-inch overhang of dough around the edge of the pie plate. Fold the overhang under itself, pinching it at the bottom of the plate. Crimp the edges with the tines of a fork or with your fingertips to decorate the rim of the pie plate. Prick the bottom and sides of the dough with a fork and bake the crust in the oven for 20 minutes or until the edges begin to turn golden brown
Mix together all ingredients except eggs. Add eggs and beat until smooth. Add a pinch of red pepper. Pour into sterilized jars. Process for 5 minutes in a hot water bath. Yield: 6 half pints.
Preheat the oven to 400. Place the kumara on a baking tray and toss well in the oil. Sprinkle the sugar over the top. Bake until the kumara is soft when poked with a knife. Sprinkle on the sea salt.

Combine the milk and butter in a measuring cup. Combine the starter and the milk mixture in the bread pan of the machine according to your manufacturers instructions. Add the dry ingredients to the pan in the order listed. Set the cycle to the basic cycle or use the preset for basic cycle for your machine. Press start. When the cycle ends, remove the pan from the machine and place the loaf on a rack to cool.
I know this is late but I just made this recipe. It turned out great! I added some raisins to it as well.
I am not sure what I did wrong but my loaf came out very dense and did not rise very well. It was very good just not the way I would like it to turn out. I will keep trying till I get it right!

Thaw frozen rolls according to package directions. Combine pudding mix and milk in small bowl. Stir in sugar and orange rind. Add butter and blend until mixture is smooth. Pour into 9 x 13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes. Cool slightly. Cut rolls into 1 inch strips. Cut roll strips in half. Spread each half with pudding mixture and top with a cranberry. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Drizzle with orange juice.

Soften double gloucester in a bowl of hot water (for about 45 minutes). Cut the bacon into small pieces and fry gently in a non-stick frying pan until just cooked. Remove the bacon from the pan and add the chopped onion. Fry until the onion starts to brown. Blend the double gloucester cheese with the cream in a food processor until smooth then add the black pepper. Mix the double gloucester cream with the cooked onion and the bacon pieces in a bowl. Serve with chives sprinkled on top and with crusty bread rolls or toasted pitta bread.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 12-cup muffin pan or line with paper cupcake liners. Mix together the flour, baking powder, ground nutmeg, and salt in a medium bowl. Set aside. In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla. Sift the dry ingredients into the creamed mixturestir just until combined. Stir in the chocolate chips and eggnog. Fill the muffin cups 3/4 full. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from the pan to a wire rack to cool completely. Serve warm or cold. Store in airtight containers for up to 2 days.
Mix soup and cream cheese in a saucepan. Heat over low heat until cheese is melted. Stir in rice and water. Cook until done. Add vegetables. Pour over cooked chicken. Serve in a bowl.
Place all ingredients in a microwave safe bowl. Stir thoroughly to mix well. Cook on high for 5 minutes. Stir again and cook for 5 more minutes. Serve with rice.

In a large pot bring nectar and water to a boil. Stir in sugar and lemon juice until sugar is dissolved. Add remaining ingredients and simmer for 10 minutes. Strain and serve hot with lemon slices and sugar cubes if desired.

In a large skillet, heat olive oil spray. Add garlic and saute over high heat until fragrant. Add tomatoes and wine. Bring to a boil. Add broth and herbs. Reduce heat and simmer for about 10 minutes. Season to taste. Place a boneless skinless chicken breast half on a plate. Spoon about 2 ounces of tomato sauce on top. Repeat with remaining chicken halves. Sprinkle with fresh parsley.

Prepare potato casserole as directed on package. Mix in mayonnaise, velveeta cheese, onion and seasonings. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees until cheese is melted. Sprinkle with bacon and olives just before serving.

Cook macaroni in boiling water for 6 minutesdrain and cool. In a medium bowl combine egg, sugar, lemon peel and nutmeg. Add cooked macaroni and stir until well coatedlet stand for 10 minutes. In a saucepan combine milk and raisinsheat until very hot but not boilingpour over the macaroni and stir until well mixedadd the vanilla and stir. Pour into a well-buttered 1-1/2 quart baking dishlet coolstir in sour cream. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until set. Let coolcut into squares and serve.

Heat the peanut oil in a wok until smoking. Add the garlic and ginger and stir for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add the baby bok choy and stir-fry for 1 minute or until just tender. Add the soy sauce, tapioca starch and water, stirring until the sauce thickens into a glaze. Remove from heat and add the chili oil. Serve immediately.

Cut spam into cubes. Add egg and milk. Salt and pepper. Add all purpose flour. Add cracker crumbs. Mix well. Drop by teaspoonful onto buttered baking sheet. Bake at 350F for 30 minutes. Turn over and cook 10 minutes longer. Drain on paper towel. Serve warm.
In a crock pot add all the above ingredients except the shells. Cook on low for 8 hours or high for 4 hours. Serve on the shells with the sour cream and cheese.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease a 9 x 5 loaf pan. In a large bowl combine brown sugar, egg, sour milk, vanilla extract, salt, and baking soda. Add flour gradually until well mixed. Add blueberries and nuts. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted in center of loaf comes out clean. Cool before slicing.

Melt butterscotch chips and frosting together and add peanuts. Stir until peanuts are coated with the butterscotch mixture. Stir in brickle chips. Pour into an 8x8 pan lined with foil or wax paper. Cut into squares. Makes about 24 pieces of fudge.

Crush the graham crackers into fine crumbs. Mix together with the peanut butter and powdered sugar. Press mixture into the bottom of a greased 8x8 inch baking dish. Melt the almond bark. Pour over the mixture in the 8x8 inch dish and spread evenly. Chill until set. Break into pieces or cut with a sharp knife.

Place kiwi fruits in the blender or food processor along with the sugar and lemon juice and process until smooth. Add carbonated water and process again until smooth and frothy. Serve immediately in tall glasses filled with ice cubes.

Soak the oats in the lemon juice for about 30 minutes or overnight. Add the milk, water and yogurt. Bring to a boil. Lower heat to medium-low. Simmer for 5 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Add the peaches, brown sugar and vanilla. Simmer for another 5 minutes. Serve warm.

Combine the first five ingredients. Spread onto a 12 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with remaining ingredients. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Serve with tortilla chips.

In a 2 quart pitcher, combine tea and water. Stir in sugar until dissolved. Cool to room temp. Divide tea mixture between 2 half-gallon freezer bags, pushing air out of each before sealing. Freeze overnight. To serve, remove 1 bag from freezer. Open and pour into a glass or pitcher. Add brandy and 1 cup of either lemonade or orange juice, whichever you prefer. Top with shaved ice. Serve and enjoy.

Slice the onions into 1/4-inch thick rounds. In a small saucepan over low heat, combine the water, olive oil and sugar. Cook until the sugar has dissolved. Add the soy sauce and balsamic. Add the Tabasco and parsley. Pour over the sliced onions and toss. Serve warm or at room temperature.

In large pot bring 1 cup of water to boil. Add 1 cup of white rice and 1 cup of calrose rice and stir. Add 1/4 cup of oil and 1/4 teaspoon of sea salt and stir. Put lid on pot and let cook for 30 minutes or until done.
Name : Rice With A Chilean FlairIngredients : Basmati Rice, Water, Onion, Vegetable Oil, English Cucumber, Tomatoes, Cilantro Leaf, Lemon Juice, SaltPreparation : Clean rice. Cover with plenty of water and boil until done. Drain and rinse with cold water. Saute chopped yellow onion in bottom of deep pot. When soft, add rice and salt and combine. Reduce heat to low and let simmer awhile. Prepare vegetable topping and let marinate. Dish rice and top with vegetables. This dish is very good with dal curry.
Name : My Mom S Famous White RiceIngredients : White Rice, Water, Butter, Olive Oil, Garlic Clove,

Mix the first 6 ingredients in a small bowl and set aside. Beat egg whites in a separate bowl and set aside. Cut the artichoke tops off and separate the leaves. Remove the hairy choke and slice the artichoke in half. Place the cut sides down in a shallow pan. Bake for 20 minutes. Drain the water from the bottom of the pan. Place the cooked artichokes in the bowl and mix gently. Spread on a serving platter. Spoon the dressing over the top. Garnish with fresh parsley. Chill before serving. Serves 4.

Spread 1 tablespoon miracle whip on each side of 4 slices of bread. Top with 1 slice of each of the meats and cheese. Cover with remaining slices of bread. Brush outside with butter. Broil until golden brown. Cut each into 4 triangles. Garnish each triangle with apple slices, red onion slices and celery leaves.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Cut the pork roast into bite sized pieces and place in a large dutch oven. Add green chilies and can of green chilies and juice. Add chili powder, cumin and oregano. Stir in diced jalapeno. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake in the oven for 1 hour. After 1 hour, add lime juice and stir well. Bake for 30 minutes more. Serve with tortillas, shredded lettuce, shredded cheese, and sour cream.
Bring stock to the boil. Add rice, stirring continuously. When the rice has softened, add peas. Cook for 10 minutes. Stir in the sausages. Add the cheese and garlic. Season.

In a large skillet, heat butter over medium heat. Add potatoes, onion, garlic and curry powder and saut for 10 minutes. Add salt, pepper, water and lemon juice. Cook 20 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Transfer to a crockpot. Cook on low 2 hours or more. Add cilantro before serving.

Place dates in a bowl and cover with boiling water. Let stand 10 minutes. Drain dates reserving liquid and finely chop dates in food processor or blender. Beat shortening with sugar in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in dates and reserved liquid. Combine the flour, baking powder, and saltstir into date mixture. Stir in walnuts and cinnamon. Fill 12 paper-lined muffin cups 2/3 full. Bake at 350 f for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool muffins in pan 5 minutes. Remove from pan and cool completely on wire rack.

Beat eggs and oil together until light. Add sugar and beat until well mixed. Add flour, baking powder and salt. Mix well. Add milk and beat again. Add orange juice and rind and mix well. Pour into greased tin. Bake for 30 minutes at 180°C. When cool, brush with icing and sprinkle with coconut.

Cut steak into 1/2-inch strips. Combine remaining ingredients. Soak steak in marinade for 24 hours in refrigerator. Pat dry, place on racks in uncovered shallow pans. Bake at 140 degrees for 2-3 hours or until dry. Makes 4 pounds. Makes 4 pounds of jerky

Preheat oven to 350 F. Spread the nuts out on a rimmed baking sheet. Toast for about 6 minutes. Combine the brussel sprouts and the olive oil in a large frying pan. Add the toasted nuts and lemon juice and zest. Toss. Season with salt and freshly ground pepper to taste.
Brussels sprouts are a member of the cabbage family. The vegetable is a winter annual crop. They are grown in the cooler areas of the world for the wintertime. The vegetable has an excellent nutritional profile.
Brussels sprouts are high in vitamin C and folate. They are also a good source of fiber. The vegetable has a mild flavor and is a great choice for those who don’t like the strong flavor of cabbage.
Brussel sprouts are a winter vegetable that is available in stores from November through January. The vegetable is typically sold in bundles of 10 or 20.
Brussel sprouts can be stored in the refrigerator for up to a week. The vegetable should be

In a small saucepan combine the orange juice, the apricot preserve and the cinnamon sticks. Heat slowly until the fruit is softened but not melted. Arrange the pears in a shallow dish with the halves cut side up. Spoon the hot glaze over the fruit. Cool in the refrigerator until chilled. Serve with a scoop of ice cream on the side.

Mix together the seasoned flour and eggs in a shallow dish. Heat the oil in a skillet. Dip the chicken strips in the egg mixture. Then coat with seasoned flour. Cook in the hot oil until brown. Remove from oil and place in a baking dish. Add the tortilla chips. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes. Serve with the favorite toppings.

Combine first six ingredients. Heat oil in skillet. Add chickencook 10 minutes or until no longer pink, turning once. Add orange juice and brown sugarcook and stir until bubbly. Add buttercook and stir until melted. Serve over rice or noodles.

Grease 25 x 30cm lamington tray. Crush Mars bars into fine crumbs. Add butter and stir until mixed well. Press into tray. Bake for 10 minutes at 180°C. Remove from oven and allow to cool slightly before adding topping. Combine peanut butter and icing sugar to form a smooth topping. Spread over base and sprinkle with cornflakes. Bake for 10 minutes at 180°C. Remove from oven and allow to cool before cutting into 24 pieces.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Combine dry ingredients and cut in butter. Add egg and yogurt and combine until dough forms. Turn out on a lightly floured surface and knead lightly until smooth. Cut into desired shapes and place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees f for 10-12 minutes or until done. Cool for 5 minutes then remove from pan and cool completely on wire rack.

Cut fennel bulbs in half lengthwise. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add fennel and cook until slightly softened. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Stir in tomatoes and their juices with wine, orange zest, vinegar and pepper flakes. Add chicken and cook until browned. Transfer to a serving platter. Toss parsley with a small amount of oil to coat evenly. Sprinkle over chicken. Serve with crusty bread.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Combine the sugar and cinnamon in a bowl. Peel the apples. Place one apple in the center of each puff pastry square. Top each apple with a 1/4 cup of the sugar mixture. Wrap each square with the puff pastrypress the edges together with your fingers. Place the wrapped apples on the baking sheet. Brush the pastry with the egg. Bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven. Serve the baked apples warm.

Preheat oven at 400f. Coat a baking pan with cooking spray. Sprinkle salmon with salt and pepper. In a small bowl, combine dijon, honey and water. Brush over both sides of fish. In a separate bowl, combine breadcrumbs, pecans and parsley. Sprinkle evenly on fish. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork.

Prepare pastry for double-crust 10-inch pie. Line deep-dish pie plate with pastryflute edge. Toss together blueberries, cinnamon, and flourspoon into pastry shell. Combine sugar and water in saucepanbring to boil over medium-high heat. Cook until mixture thickens and boils gently, stirring often. Remove from heatstir in lemon juice. Spoon hot syrup over fruitcover with top pastryflute edge. Bake in 375f oven about 55 minutes or until filling is bubbly and pastry is golden brown. Cool on wire rackstore in refrigerator up to 2 days. Makes one 10-inch pie.

Rinse the cranberries. Combine the cranberries and water in a medium-sized nonreactive pot and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes or until the cranberries have burst and released their juices. Remove the pot from the heat and add the sugar, Grand Marnier and orange zest. Stir well. Cool and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.

Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Cook chorizo until no longer pink. Stir in rice and cook until heated through. Stir in eggs and cook until just set. Stir in salsa and pepper. Top with cheese. Serve with tortillas.
This is the best Mexican Rice I ever had and I love Mexican rice!

Cut out the center of the tomatoes, leaving a shell about 1/2 inch thick. Stuff the shells with the rice mixture. Place the shells in a shallow baking dish. Sprinkle with the basil leaves. Drizzle with the olive oil. Season with the salt and pepper. Bake for 15 minutes or until the shells are heated through and the basil is crisp.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook onion and garlic until onion is soft, about 5 minutes. Add chili powder, cook until fragrant. Stir in beans, tomatoes with their liquid, green chilies, adobo sauce, salt and black pepper to taste. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes. Serve with your favorite toppings.

Combine chocolate chips and nuts in a bowl. Combine condensed milk, vanilla and salt in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Pour over chocolate/nut mixture and stir until smooth. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a waxed paper lined baking sheet. Allow to set. Melt chocolate in a double boiler over hot water. Dip tops of balls and place on waxed paper to set. Decorate with sprinkles.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Mix and sift together first 5 ingredients. Add to the egg mixture. Blend well. Drop by tablespoon on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 10 to 12 minutes until lightly browned. Makes 2-3 dozen.
Boil and mash the potatoes and put in a large mixing bowl. Add the remaining ingredients. Pour into a 9 inch unbaked pastry shell. Bake for 1 hour at 350 degrees.
Cut the tortillas into 2 inch wide strips. Wrap a strip around a slice of ham. Fry in hot oil until golden brown. Place the taquitos on a plate. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve with salsa and sour cream.

Season fish with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in large skillet. Add fish fillets. Cook until fish flakes easily with a fork. Remove fish from skillet. Combine bourbon, honey and lime juice in another skillet. Cook over medium heat until honey is melted. Add pecan halves. Serve fish over bourbon sauce. Garnish with lemon wedges and pecans.

In a large bowl, combine water, vegetable oil, lemon juice, honey, wheat germ, oatmeal, and flour. Knead on a floured surface until smooth. Cover and set aside for 15 minutes. Combine 1/2 cup water with yeast. Stir into dough mixture. Add enough bread flour to make dough stiff enough to handle. Knead again on a lightly floured surface until smooth. Add nuts and knead again until smooth and elastic. Place dough in a lightly oiled bowl, turning once to grease surface. Coverlet rise in a warm place until doubled. Punch down doughknead again. Shape into a loafplace in a lightly greased 8x4-inch loaf pan. Coverlet rise again in a warm place until doubled. Bake at 400 degrees for 35 minutes or until nicely browned and done. Remove from pancool on a wire rack.
The following recipe is a tribute to my friend Rita who used to own a restaurant called The Pecan Cottage in the

Combine vinegar, broth and sugar in saucepan and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer until sugar dissolves completely. Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken breasts until golden brown and cooked through (12-14 minutes). Reduce heat to medium-low, add vinegar mixture and chicken breasts. Stir frequently until chicken is heated through (1-2 minutes). Transfer chicken breasts to plate. To make glaze, remove skillet from heat and stir in juice and zest of one orange until combined. Spoon glaze over chicken breasts and serve.

In a large skillet brown the kielbasa. Crumble and add the tater tots. In a separate bowl combine the mozzarella cheese and seasoning salt. Sprinkle the mixture evenly over the kielbasa and tater tots. Place in the oven and bake until the cheese is melted.
I just made this recipe and it is delicious! I was looking for a simple recipe and this is perfect. I did not have whole wheat pasta so I used regular.
This was a very quick and easy recipe to make. I had all the ingredients and it was ready in 30 minutes. I used spaghetti instead of penne and it worked great.
This is a great quick and easy recipe. It was a hit with my family and I have made it many times since.
This is a great recipe for using up leftover pasta. It was quick and easy to make. I added more tomatoes than the recipe called for because I like the flavor of the tomatoes.
I just made this recipe and it is delicious! I was looking for a simple reci

Mix together the first 4 ingredients in a large bowl. Combine the last 3 ingredients in a small bowl. Form mixture into loaves and place in greased 9x13 inch pan. Bake for 1 hour at 350f. Uncover for 10 minutes and serve with spaghetti sauce for dipping.
Sweet potato loaf, loaf with caramelized apples, peanut butter and jelly loaf, spice cake loaf, white bread loaf, butternut squash loaf, pumpkin bread loaf, pumpkin spice loaf, loaf with pumpkin seeds, apple cinnamon loaf, banana bread loaf, banana cranberry loaf, bread pudding loaf, cinnamon raisin loaf, banana bread loaf, banana bread with walnuts, banana bread with nuts, banana nut bread with nuts, banana walnut bread with walnuts, banana bread with apples, banana bread with apples and walnuts, banana bread with pe

Bring water to boil in large saucepan over high heat. Add macaronistir well. Reduce heat to lowcook 8 to 10 minutes or until tender yet firm. Drainrinse with cold waterdrain wellset aside. Meanwhile, in 2-quart saucepan, cook butter over low heat until meltedstir in flour until well blended. Gradually add milkcook over medium heat until thickened and bubblystir in paprika, pepper and cheesecook 1 minute or until cheese is meltedstir in macaroni. Serve warm.

Slice the bananas into chunks and place in a bowl, mash them to a pulp using a fork. In another bowl add the sugar and buttermilk and mix well. Pour this mixture over the mashed up bananas and mix again until everything is well combined and thick like a pudding. Chill for at least an hour or overnight and then enjoy.

Place half the ham on the bottom of the pie shell. Sprinkle with half the cheese. Arrange onions on top of cheese. Layer with remaining cheese and ham. Beat eggs well. Add remaining ingredients. Pour over cheese. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 45 minutes. Cool slightly before cutting.
Ham sandwiches can be prepared in many different ways. Some sandwiches have the meat on the outside of the bread with cheese and lettuce inside. Other sandwiches are the opposite with lettuce and cheese on the outside with the meat inside. A simple sandwich is made of bread with lettuce and cheese on one side and meat on the other side. You can even add tomatoes or mayonnaise to the sandwich if desired.
A ham cheese sandwich is a sandwich that is made of two slices of bread with cheese and ham on one side of the bread and lettuce on the other side of the bread.
Ham cheese sandwiches can be made in many different ways. A common way is to use two slices of bread with cheese and ham on one

Preheat oven to 400f. Slice garlic thinly. Toss together potatoes and oil in a large mixing bowl. Spread in a single layer in a large shallow baking dish. Sprinkle with garlic and herbs, and toss to coat evenly. Bake, uncovered, until tender and golden, about 15 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley before serving. Serves 6-8.

Add all to bread machine pan in order listed above. Select dough setting and press start. When cycle is complete, remove dough to lightly greased cookie sheet. Cut into squares with a pizza cutter dipped in hot water or flour. Bake at 400 degrees F. for 10 to 15 minutes or until lightly browned on the edges. Makes about 12 muffins.

Combine strawberries and bananas in a blender. Process until smooth. Add the milk and lemon juice and process until well combined. Transfer the mixture to a large bowl. Mix in the yogurt and next 4 ingredients. Mix in the food coloring. Freeze in a shallow pan. Garnish with toasted coconut. Makes 15 servings.

Combine soy sauce, orange juice and brown sugar in a heavy 3-quart saucepan. Stir in garlic. Bring to a boil over high heat and boil 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in hot pepper sauce and rum extract. Stir in ginger. Cut chicken into 1 inch cubes. Add to saucepan. Cover and marinate in refrigerator 1 hour. Broil or grill 8 inches from heat 5-10 minutes or until cooked through. Serve over rice.

Peel the potato and cut into thin slices. Cook in a pan with the margarine until brown. Beat the eggs with milk and pour over the potatoes. Mix well. Heat the sour cream in a saucepan and add to the mixture. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Place the mixture in a casserole dish, sprinkle with breadcrumbs, and bake in a hot oven until the top is browned.

Spread margarine on 2 slices of the toast. Beat the eggs with dill and salt and pepper until well mixed. Melt 1 tablespoon of margarine in the skillet. Add the eggs and scramble. Remove to cool. Spread the other slice of toast with margarine. Spread one slice of toast with miracle whip. Top with the scrambled eggs, cheese and slices of turkey. Place the other slice of toast on top. Cut the sandwich into four triangles and serve.
Name: turkey avocado basil rosemary sandwich
Ingredients: Whole Wheat Bread Avocado Garlic Powder Lean Turkey Breast Radish Sprouts Fresh Rosemary Fresh Basil Leaf Light Mayonnaise
Preparation: In a small bowl, mash avocado, garlic powder and rosemary together with a fork, leaving the mixture slightly chunky but thoroughly mixed. Spread avocado mixture on one slice of bread, and mayo on the other. Sprinkle basil leaves over the mayo. Add turkey and sprouts.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Line baking pan with parchment paper or wax paper. In a large bowl combine the dry roasted peanuts, almonds, and walnuts. Beat the egg white until foamy. Gradually add the 1/2 cup of water and beat until stiff peaks form. Stir the peanut mixture and sprinkle with the pumpkin pie spice and salt. Gently stir the mixture and add the egg white mixture. Mix well and coat the peanut mixture evenly with the egg white mixture. Spread the mixture out on the prepared pan and bake for 45-60 minutes until lightly browned and crunchy. Let the coated nuts cool and store in an air tight container for up to 1 month.

Bring water and tomato sauce to a boil in saucepan. Reduce heat. Add beef and taco seasoning mix. Cook 4 minutes or until thoroughly heated. Stir in beans. Top with cheese. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes. Serve with tortilla chips.

Peel and slice onions. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over low heat. Add the onions. Cook until softened and browned. Add sea salt, balsamic vinegar, port and tomato. Reduce the heat to low and cook, stirring occasionally until thickened. Remove from heat. Add muscovado sugar and stir. Let the jam cool. Transfer to a glass jar. Store the jam in the refrigerator.
The best way to get the full flavour is to use it as a condiment.
name: sweet potato with roasted almonds and onionsingredients: sweet potatoes, olive oil, butter, chopped onions, sugar, roasted almondspreparation:Preheat oven to 325° F. Peel and cut sweet potatoes into 1-inch chunks. In a small bowl combine 2 tablespoons butter and olive oil. Place potatoes in a large bowl. Pour in butter mixture and toss to coat. Transfer potatoes to a rimmed baking sheet. Sprinkle with the remaining 2 tablespoons butter

Rinse and pat dry chicken. Rub with butter. Season with flour. In a small bowl combine soy sauce, garlic and sesame seeds. Heat oven to 425. Bake for 35 minutes. Turn chicken over and continue cooking for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve over rice and vegetables.

Mix sugar with cornflour and baking powder until crumbly. Add tapioca starch and mix well. Add egg and mix well. Stir in butter and flaked coconut. Roll into balls the size of walnuts and bake on a greased baking tray for 15 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool.
name: out of this world cookies
ingredients: white sugar, milk, butter, rolled oats, unsweetened dried shredded coconut, cocoa
preparation: Mix first three ingredients together in a sauce pan. Bring to a boil, remove from heat. Add the rest of the ingredients. Drop from teaspoon onto waxed paper. Let cool and serve.
name: cow pattie cookies
ingredients: white sugar, butter, milk, cocoa, salt, vanilla, oatmeal, coconut
preparation: Boil the first five ingredients for 5 minutes. Then add the last three ingredients. Stir. Remove from heat. While hot, drop by spoonful onto wax

Cream butter and sugar until light and creamy. Add vanilla essence. Sift flour and custard powder into mixture and beat until smooth. Add one or two drops of white chocolate to batter. Chill dough for 30 minutes. Roll into balls and place on baking tray. Flatten with the back of a fork and place one or two drops of white chocolate on top. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes or until lightly golden brown.
These were my favorite cookies growing up, they are now my son’s favorite cookies. I have made them for over 50 years!! They are simple to make, taste great!
We made these for a church activity and they were a big hit!! Very easy to make too!!

Heat vegetable oil in a medium-size nonstick frying pan over medium-high heat. Add brats to pan. Cook for 4 to 5 minutes per side or until browned. Remove the brats from the pan. Add the onions to the pan. Cook for 5 minutes or until the onions are soft and slightly browned. Add the sauerkraut. Stir the mixture to combine the brats with the sauerkraut. Add the beer to the pan. Stir the mixture and cook for 10 minutes or until the liquid has evaporated. Slice the hot dog buns in half. Place 1 brat on each half. Top each brat with some of the cooked sauerkraut mixture. Serve with spicy brown mustard.

Place crust on baking sheet and brush with oil. Spread with pesto and top with mushrooms and eggplant. Sprinkle with feta and red pepper flakes. Bake 15 minutes at 400f. Let stand 5 minutes. Cut into wedges.
Prepare chicken according to package instructions. Mix all remaining ingredients in a bowl. Add chicken to mixture. Mix. Refrigerate until serving time.

In small saucepan, combine sugar and water. Cook and stir over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Stir in cherries and remove from heat. Stir in cereal, chocolate chips, and nuts. Drop by spoonful onto wax paper.

Cream together the butter and the sugar. Add the eggs one at a time and mix well. Add the vanilla and the milk and mix well. Sift the flour and the baking powder together and add it slowly to the butter and sugar mixture. Mix well. Fill the cupcake papers about 1/2 full and place in a greased 18-cup cake pan. Bake at 350 degrees for about 20-25 minutes, or until lightly browned. Cool before frosting.

Soften cream cheese. Add lemon juice and beat well. Add crabmeat and mix gently. Add mayonnaise and beat well. Stir in remaining ingredients and chill well before serving. Serve with crackers or vegetables.

In large mixer bowl, blend together the Bisquick and milk until soft dough forms. Add sausage and mix thoroughly. Add cheeses and oregano and parsley flakes and mix well. Shape into 1-inch balls and place on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned and heated through. Makes 2-3 dozen. Serve warm or cold with your favorite dip.

Heat oven to 425f. Heat 1/2 cup butter in a 13x9-inch baking pan in oven until melted. Place potatoes in pantoss to coat with butter. Combine remaining 1/2 cup butter, breadcrumbs and cheesesprinkle evenly over potatoes. Bake 45 to 50 minutes or until potatoes are golden and tender.

Bring 6 cups of water to a boil. Add the grains and simmer for 25 minutes. Add salt to taste. Serve with milk and brown sugar.

Cook onion and carrots in 2 Tbsp. butter about 5 minutes or until tender. Add broccolicook 5 minutes longer. Combine bouillon powder, 2 tsp. garlic powder, 1/2 tsp. salt and 1/8 tsp. pepper. Add to vegetablesstir well. Cook 1 minute longer. Serve immediately.

Combine the first 5 ingredients in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Stir constantly for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add the peanut butter and stir until mixed. Add the oats. Drop by spoonfuls onto wax paper. Let cool.

Peel 4 medium or 3 large sweet potatoes and cut into 1 inch slices. Put the cut up potatoes in a pan with 1/2 cup water. Bring to a boil over medium high heat and cook 20-25 minutes or until the potatoes are fork tender. Melt 1 stick butter in a small sauce pan over medium heat. Add 1/2 cup brown sugar and 1/4 cup milk. Stir to dissolve the sugar in the milk. Add 1/2 teaspoon grated ginger and 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon. Bring to a boil over medium high heat for about 2 minutes or until slightly thickened. Take off heat and stir in 2 tablespoons of yogurt. Serve the potatoes with a dollop of the sauce. Garnish with a marshmallow if you want to be really bad.

Brown roast in bacon grease. Add onions and garlic. Cook 5 minutes. Add the remaining ingredients except the limes and cilantro. Bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer for 3 hours. Add cilantro. Serve with tortillas and lime wedges.

Peel potatoes and cut into 1/2 inch cubes. In a medium bowl, combine potatoes, mayonnaise, yogurt, lemon juice and celery seed. Mix well. Add blue cheese and dill pickle. Stir gently to combine. Sprinkle with walnuts. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until chilled. Garnish with celery leaves and serve.

Cook spaghetti according to the directions on the package. Drain and set aside. Saute the onion and broccoli in a little olive oil until tender. Stir in the sweet and sour sauce, the cooked spaghetti and the shrimp. Season with salt and pepper. Serve at once.

Heat oil. Add chicken thighs and stir-fry until golden brown. Add soy sauce, sugar, cornflour mixture and marmite. Bring to a boil and stir constantly until thickened. Add boiling chicken stock to dilute and thicken the gravy. Drizzle with honey. Serve hot with rice or noodles

Stir together bran, applesauce, egg and dates. Add sugar, margarine, flour and spices. Add water. Mix just until blended. Fill greased or paper-lined muffin cups 3/4 full. Bake at 375 for about 25 minutes. Cool in pans 10 minutes. Remove to wire racks to cool completely. Makes 12 muffins.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, add the wine, shallot, lemon juice and butter. Bring the mixture to a boil, reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes. Stir in the cream, lemon rind, salt and pepper. Serve over fish or seafood.

Preheat oven to 250 degrees. Rub each chicken piece with oil. Place in a single layer in a 9x13-inch baking dish. Combine the soy sauce, brown sugar, water and garlic clove in a large saucepan. Cook over medium heat for 2 minutes. Combine the ginger and almonds in a small bowl. Stir into the sauce. Pour over the chicken pieces. Cover the baking dish. Bake the chicken for 3 hours. Yield: 4 servings.

Fry bacon until crisp and cool. Cut into small bits and set aside. In a medium skillet, heat olive oil and saute onion until translucent. Add flour and stir to cook out for a few minutes. Slowly add stock and whisk to mix. Bring to a boil and turn off heat. Add mashed potatoes and bacon bits and stir until combined. Add cheese and stir to melt. Serve immediately.

Place flour and salt and pepper in shallow bowl. Combine remaining ingredients except oil and parsley and set aside. Dip fish into flour, shake off excess and saute in oil until cooked. Sprinkle with parsley and serve hot with rice and vegetables.
Place black tea bags and basil leaves in a pitcher or teapot. Add boiling water. Cover and steep for 5 minutes. Strain into the pitcher. Stir in lemonade concentrate. Serve over ice.

Prepare brown rice according to directions on package. Strain through a fine sieve to remove excess starch. Combine brown rice with buttermilk and egg, then bring to a simmer over medium heat. Stir constantly until the mixture thickens to a custard consistency (about 5 minutes). Remove from heat and stir in honey and unsweetened cocoa until well combined. Divide the mixture evenly into 4 small dishes or one large dish (8 x 8-inch). Top each serving with a few sweet cherries and a few shavings of chocolate. Serve warm with whipped cream.
Rice is an integral part of most meals in Asia. It is the main course or served as side dish or a condiment or even as a dessert. Rice is also a staple food all over the world from Africa to South America to Europe. Rice is a good source of B-vitamins which help to convert the carbohydrates in rice into energy. Rice is also a good source of iron, potassium, selenium and phosphorous which is essential for growth and development of infants. R
Brew the tea. Stir the chocolate syrup into the tea. Add splenda and coffee creamer. Stir well and pour into cups. Top each cup with whipped cream and chocolate shavings.

Cook the egg noodles until tender. In a large mixing bowl beat together the sugar and butter until fluffy. Beat in the eggs. Add the cooked noodles and the apples and toss together. In another small bowl toss the raisins and nuts. Place the noodles in an 8x8x2 inch baking dish. Arrange the raisins and nuts on top. Bake for 20 minutes. Drizzle the top with the orange juice.
Recipe of the Day - Creamy Spinach Dip - Creamy spinach dip makes the perfect snack for your Super Bowl party. Serve with pita chips or vegetables for an easy appetizer.
Recipe of the Day - Chicken Breast Rolls - Chicken breast rolls are great for lunch or dinner. Serve these flavorful chicken rolls with a salad or rice.
Recipe of the Day - Veggie Kabobs - Veggie Kabobs are so easy to make and so good for you. Make these kabobs for an easy appetizer or for dinner.
Recipe of the Day -

Preheat oven to 350F. Coat 8x8-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Season both sides of chops with garlic powder and sprinkle with flour. Heat oil in nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Brown chops for 2 minutes per side. Transfer to prepared dish. In the same pan, saute onions and mushrooms until tender. Add soup. Heat through. Stir in parsley. Spoon over chops. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 45 minutes.

Cook sausage and drain. In a separate skillet over medium-high heat add olive oil and cook sausage until browned and crumbled. Add tomatoes and simmer for 5 minutes. Add fettuccine and simmer for 5 more minutes. Stir in alfredo sauce and parmesan cheese and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Cook the chicken and shred when done. Add the corn and salsa. Mix in the taco seasoning. Heat through on high. Spoon into the tortilla and top with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for about 5-7 minutes. Serve with sour cream.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place the chocolate chips in a medium bowl and microwave on high for 1 minutestir until smooth and melted. Add the butter and vanilla extract, then mix together until smooth. In a separate bowl, combine the flour and sugar. Stir in the melted chocolate mixture until smooth. Fold in the walnuts and pour the filling into the unbaked pie crust. Bake for 12 minutes in the preheated oven, then reduce heat to 325 degrees F (160 degrees C). Bake for an additional 28 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the filling has set and the crust is golden brown. Allow the pie to cool for at least 1 hour before slicing and serving.
The first thing I need to do is to explain that my pie chart was in error. When I first put it up I thought I had done a good job in putting it together. I had been working on it for a couple of hours and I was pleased with the way that it turned out. I
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and ginger. Cook 1 minute. Add chicken and cook until done. Add mango and cook for 1 minute. Stir in teriyaki sauce. Serve over rice.

Sift dry ingredients together. Blend in shortening. Add milk. Beat until smooth. Add vanilla and eggs. Pour into pan. Bake at 375 until done.
"You can't make a good waffle without good batter."

In large shallow dish beat eggs with skim milk until blended. Add chunky peanut butter and cinnamon. Heat large skillet or griddle over medium heat. Coat with nonstick cooking spray. Dip each slice of bread in egg mixture, turning to coat both sides. Brown on each side in skillet until golden. Serve hot with honey or maple syrup.

In a small bowl combine green onions and lime juiceset aside. Sprinkle the salmon with thyme and rub with lime juice and teriyaki sauce to coat. Grill on a greased rack 6 to 8 minutes on each side or until done to your liking. Garnish with green onions and lime. Serve with rice or noodles.

Preheat oven to 400. Grease a 12-cup muffin pan or line with paper cupcake liners. In a large bowl whisk together dry ingredients. In a medium bowl whisk together wet ingredients. Add wet to dry and stir just until moist. Spoon batter into prepared pans. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until done. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan. Makes 12 large or 24 small muffins.

In a medium-sized pot or sauce pan over medium heat, heat coconut milk and curry paste until fragrant. Add sugar and fish sauce. Add the shrimp and stir-fry until cooked. Add the rest of the vegetables and stir-fry until just tender. Remove from heat and add basil and serve.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Pat the lamb dry with paper towel. Rub the meat all over with the oil. Sprinkle with the salt& pepper. Cover the lamb with the breadcrumbs& press to adhere. Roast on a rack in a shallow roasting pan for 1 hour. The temperature should be about 130 degrees at the thickest part. Remove from the oven & allow to rest for 10-15 minutes. Garnish with the chopped parsley & the garlic. Serve with potatoes or rice.

Melt the butter in a large microwave-safe bowl. Add the brown sugar and stir to blend. Microwave for 2 minutes, stirring every 30 seconds. Add the cinnamon to the butter/sugar mixture and stir well. Add the nuggets to the bowl and stir to coat well. Add the cranberries and nuts. Stir to coat well. Transfer the mixture to a large, microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on high for 2 minutes, stirring after one minute. Transfer to a microwave-safe dish and microwave on high for another 2 minutes, stirring every 30 seconds. Spread the mixture evenly onto wax paper to cool completely. Break into small pieces and store in an airtight container.

Heat oven to 400. Arrange red peppers in a single layer in a roasting pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until skins are blackened. Cool peppers and remove seeds and skins. Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Add red peppers and crushed red pepper. Cook 2 minutes. Add linguine and cook until al dente. Remove from heat and add cheese. Toss well. Season to taste.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and rinse. In saucepan combine oil, broccoli, salt and pepper. Cook onions and garlic in oil until tender. Combine fettuccine with onion mixture. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and parmesan cheese. Serves 4.
Combine the first four ingredients and mix well. Form into balls and roll in cheese. Melt butter and fry until golden brown. Serve hot.

Cook onion in oil in large skillet over medium heat until tender. Stir in meat and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until browned. Stir in garlic and cook for 1 minute. Stir in breadcrumbs and cook for 1 minute more. Stir in cheese and cook for 1 minute more or until cheese melts. Stir in milk and cook for 1 minute more. Remove from heatcool slightly. Stir in eggs. Combine well and shape into ballsroll in cilantro.
name: turkey meatballsingredients: ground turkey, fat-free evaporated milk, fresh garlic, dry breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, green onions, fresh parsley, egg, seasoning salt, black pepperpreparation:In a bowl mix all ingredients together. Mix and add in more bread crumbs if needed to hold together. Shape into desired size balls. Fry or oven-bake until completely cooked through. Use in you favorite recipes.
name: cream sauce for swedish meatballsingredients: cre

Prepare baking mix according to directions on box, adding half the butter and all the sour cream and baking mix as directed. Refrigerate while assembling quiches. In a large bowl beat remaining half butter and cottage and ricotta cheeses until smooth, then beat in remaining sour cream and baking mix as directed. Beat in eggs and seasonings. Divide dough into 24 even portions. Place one portion of dough in each of 12 lightly greased muffin cups. Spoon a small amount of filling into each. Top with swiss cheese. Bake at 190c for 16-20 minutes or until filling is set and golden brown. Cool for 2 minutes. Remove from pan and cool completely on wire rack before serving. Store in refrigerator. Makes 24 servings.

Melt butter. Add brown sugar, syrup and baking soda. Pour over popcorn and stir until well coated. Spread on waxed paper. Allow to cool for 30 minutes. Roll into 1/2 inch long rolls. Wrap each roll tightly in waxed paper. Store at room temperature in air tight container.

Mix prawns with soda water to cover. Set aside for 20 minutes. Drain prawns. Beat egg yolk with 1 tablespoon of water until frothy. Stir in 1 tablespoon of cornstarch and 1/2 teaspoon baking soda. Dip each prawn first into cornstarch mixture, then into egg mixture. Dip again into cornstarch mixture, then into beaten egg mixture. Dip once more into cornstarch mixture. Deep-fry in hot oil until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve with sweet-and-sour dipping sauce.

Place green onions in a small bowl and set aside until ready to use. Prepare the marinade by mixing together all the ingredients in a small bowl. Marinate the salmon in the marinade for at least one hour or as long as overnight. Heat a charcoal grill or a gas grill to medium-high heat or about 375 degrees F. Brush the grill rack with oil and place the fish on the grate and grill the salmon for about three minutes per side and then brush the fish with a light coat of the marinade as it grills and continue to grill until the fish is firm to the touch and flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve the fish topped with the reserved green onions and garnished with toasted sesame seeds.

Place frozen spinach in a steamer basket over boiling water. Cook uncovered 4-6 minutes or until heated through. Drain and cool slightly. Place in a bowl. Add toasted sesame oil, garlic and green onions. Mix well. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds and serve.
I have found that if you steam the spinach first then squeeze out all the water then you do not need any oil. I also use the frozen spinach that is already chopped up and just use the water from the bag to cook in.
This is great with some hot toasted bread.
I agree with you about steaming and squeezing out the water.
This is the best way I found to do this.
I just made this and it is amazing! Thanks for the idea!

In a large bowl, combine the milk, eggs and cocoa. Add the vanilla and whisk until well blended. Add the sugar and beat until the mixture thickens slightly. In a small saucepan over low heat, combine the cream with the gelatin. Heat until the gelatin dissolves. Remove the pan from the heat and beat until cool. Fold the gelatin mixture into the cocoa mixture. Pour into 8-10 shallow 1 1/2-cup ramekins. Place in a large shallow pan. Fill the pan with hot water to come about halfway up the sides of the ramekins. Bake at 350F for 20 minutes. Remove the pan from the oven. Let stand for 1 hour or until set. Run a knife around the edge of each timbale. Remove from the pan and place on plates. Serve topped with fresh whipped cream.

Melt butter over low heat. Stir in sugar and corn syrup. Add the peanut butter and mix well. Add the rice cereal and stir until well coated. Spread into a greased 9x13-inch pan. When cooled, cut into squares.

In a large bowl combine the granulated sugar and cinnamon. Set aside. In a small saucepan heat the evaporated milk over medium-low heat until it comes to a simmer but do not boil. Pour the heated evaporated milk into the large bowl with the cinnamon and sugar mixture and whisk until well combined. Add the vanilla extract. Pour the mixture into a large zip-top plastic bag or a large plastic container with a tight-fitting lid or a large bowl with a cover or a large pot with a tight-fitting lid. Add the chopped pecans. Seal tightly and shake until all the pecans are coated with the glaze. Spread the glazed pecans on a large baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes or until the glaze is set but the pecans are not darkened. Remove from the oven and let cool completely on the baking sheet.

In a pot, cook lean beef with button mushrooms in fat till meat is brown. Deglaze pot with boiling water and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add paprika to taste and boil for about 10 minutes. Add cornstarch to cold water to dissolve and thicken sauce. Add tomato puree to taste and boil for a few minutes longer.

Cut peel and remove seeds from mangoes. Mash mangoes in bowl. Add lime juice and nutmeg. Mix well. Combine remaining dry ingredients and stir into mango mixture. Pour into unbaked pie crust. Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes. Cool slightly. Serve with whipped topping.
Peel and slice mango and banana into chunks. Mix all ingredients except the peanuts together and place in a large serving dish. Garnish with chopped peanuts and serve immediately with spoon.

Dissolve yeast and salt in warm water. Add gluten and then remaining dry ingredients and mix to form a stiff dough. Knead on low for 8 minutes. Add chocolate chips and knead for 3 minutes more. Place in a lightly oiled bowl and cover tightly with plastic wrap or a towel. Let rise until doubled, about 1 hour. Punch down and divide into 4 equal parts. Form loaves and let rise 15 minutes more. Bake at 400 degrees F for 20 minutes or until golden brown and let cool on a wire rack before slicing.

Place frozen orange juice concentrate in blender container along with half-and-half, sugar and corn syrup. Place lid on container. Blend on high speed until mixture is smooth. Add grenadine to concentrate mixture and blend to mix well. Pour into tall glasses filled with ice. Top with whipped cream and garnish with maraschino cherry.

Crumble gingersnaps and set aside. In saucepan over low heat, combine butter and cookies. Cook until mixture resembles sand. Stir in pie filling and cook until heated through. Stir in milk and heat through. Cool. Spread into a pie dish. Freeze until firm. Top with ice cream and garnish with whipped topping.

Slice the French baguettes into half-inch slices and lay them flat. Melt butter in a skillet. Add the onions and rosemary. Saute the onions until soft and translucent. Season with salt and pepper. Place the onions over half of the baguette slices. Top with slices of cheese. Fold the other half of the baguette slice over the top. Press down the edges of the sandwich to seal in the cheese. Melt some more butter in the skillet. Place the sandwiches in the skillet. Cook for about 2 minutes on each side or until the cheese melts and the sandwiches are golden brown. Cut the sandwiches in half and serve.
In a large bowl mix together the tomatoes, green chili pepper, salt, and coriander. Serve with tortilla chips.
In a saucepan over medium heat combine the butter and flour. Whisk in the milk and cook until thick. Add the cream and chicken. Bring to a boil and cook until done. Serve over biscuits or rice.

Mix brownie mix, egg substitute and yogurt with water. Spread into 13x9-inch greased pan. Bake 20 minutes. Cool completely. Top with crushed graham crackers. Mix marshmallows and peanut butter together. Spread over top of graham crackers. Bake 2 minutes. Stir in milk chocolate chips. Cool completely. Cut into bars.
This is really good for dieting.
I made these for my 8 yr old grandson who is on a diet. He loves them.
I made these for my son who is on a diet. He said they were really good.
I'm going to try these for my son who is on a diet.

Preheat over to 350. Grease a jelly roll pan. Sift the flour, baking powder and salt together. Set aside. In a large bowl, beat together the eggs and the sugar until thick. Add the vanilla and the flour mixture, alternating. Add the milk and beat until smooth. Spread in the pan. Bake for about 20 minutes or until set and golden brown. Turn out onto a cookie sheet to cool. Meanwhile, make the glaze by beating together the cream and the confectioners sugar until thick. Beat in the flavoring. Spread evenly over the sponge. Garnish with strawberries.
Combine first 4 ingredients in large mixing bowl. Blend well. Pour into prepared crust. Freeze until firm. Top with remaining ingredients. Freeze 1 hour or until ready to serve.
In a bowl mix all the ingredients together except vegetable oil. Form into desired size balls. Fry or oven bake until completely cooked through. May use in your favorite recipes.

Boil together all vegetables and seasonings (except parsley). Cook for 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Mash all together to make a smooth puree and add flour and mix well. Pour in hot milk and stir until smooth, adding more milk if desired (I didn't need any). Add bouillon cubes and cook until it boils once again and is thickened nicely. Serve with parsley on top for garnish.

In a medium skillet or saucepan, saute onions and garlic cloves with a bit of oil. Add green peas and turmeric. Saut until peas are golden. Add water and bring to boil. Simmer 10 minutes. Add hot green peppers and salt. Simmer 5 minutes. Serve.

Peel celery root and cut into 1/4 inch cubes. In small bowl, combine mayonnaise and brown mustard and blend well. In medium bowl, combine cubed root with cubed apple and honey. Toss to coat. Add lemon juice, salt and horseradish to taste. Layer evenly in 4 glasses or bowls. Top with cheese and serve.
Blend together the ice cream, whipping cream, and fudge sauce until smooth. Layer the ice cream mixture in the glasses. Layer each one with the candy bars on top of the ice cream. Serve immediately.

Separate and brown sausages. Break up with hands into small pieces. Heat oil over medium-low heat in a dutch oven or large stock pot. Add ground beef. Cook until browned but not crumbled. Add onion and cook until soft. Add sausage mixture, tomatoes and paste. Bring to boilreduce heat to medium-lowcover. Simmer for 30 minutes or until thickened to desired consistency. Add basil and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve with spaghetti or pasta of choice.

Stir together oats, pudding mix and splenda in a large bowl. Beat together milk and almond extract in a small bowl. Pour the milk mixture over the dry ingredients and stir until well blended. Transfer into a 13 by 9 inch baking pan. Sprinkle with berries. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until the crust is golden brown. Cool before serving. Enjoy.
Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl. Cover and refrigerate until serving time. Serve in individual glass bowls. Garnish with lemon slices if desired.

Drain prunes and chop. Drain apricots and chop. Combine prunes, apricots, raisins, orange juice, orange zest, desiccated coconut and almonds. Chill for at least 1 hour. Form into balls and serve with whipped cream.

Combine the evaporated milk and the sugar in a 2 quart saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly until it reaches the soft ball stage (240f). Remove from the heat and stir in the salt and butter until smooth. Add the chocolates and stir until melted and blended. Add the marshmallow creme and pecans and mix until well blended. Pour into a buttered 9x13 inch pan and refrigerate until firm. Cut into squares.

In a heavy 3-quart saucepan, combine butter, sugar, evaporated milk and vanilla. Cook over medium heat until the mixture reaches a full rolling boil. Cook for one minute longer. Remove from heat and stir in the marshmallow creme until it is melted completely. Add the chopped pecans and the vanilla extract, stirring until everything is evenly combined. Remove the mixture from the heat, then stir in the chocolate morsels until they are completely melted. Spread the mixture out evenly in a 9-inch square pan that has been lined with waxed paper.
