Sprinkle the top of the fudge with the remaining chopped pecans. Allow the fudge to set up at room temperature for at least 30 minutes before slicing it with a sharp knife into 12 one-inch squares. Wrap the fudge squares individually in waxed paper or place them in airtight containers for storage.

Heat olive oil in sauce pan. Add onions and saute until browned. Add cashew butter and stir until melted. Add tamari and water and blend together. Simmer for 3-5 minutes. Serve over vegetables or mashed potatoes.

Saute the onion, celery, and garlic in the oil until the onion is soft. Stir in the broth, pasta, beans, carrot, peas, basil, oregano and bay leaf. Bring to a boil. Cover partially and simmer until the vegetables are tender and the pasta is cooked. Stir in the parmesan.

Mix all ingredients well and form into 2 inch balls. Chill for one hour. Remove balls from refrigerator and dip in beaten egg. Then roll in bread crumbs and fry in hot fat. Drain on paper towel. Serve hot. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c).Spoon half the prepared crust into a 9x13-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray.Sprinkle with 1/4 cup of the mozzarella cheese and 1/4 cup of the parmesan cheese.Top with the pizza saucesprinkle with 1/4 cup of the italian seasoning and 1/2 cup of the mozzarella and 1/2 cup of the parmesan cheese.Spoon on half of the pepperoni and sprinkle with 1/4 cup of the italian seasoning and 1/2 cup of the mozzarella and 1/2 cup of the parmesan cheese.Spoon on the remaining crust and sprinkle with the remaining 1/4 cup italian seasoning and 1/4 cup mozzarella and parmesan cheeses.Sprinkle with the remaining 1/2 cup mozzarella and parmesan cheeses.Bake for 25

Cook beef until browned. Drain fat. Stir in onion, diced tomatoes and paste. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Stir in water. Bring to boiling. Stir in pasta and cook until tender. Stir in cheese. Spray 8 x 12 inch casserole dish. Spoon mixture into dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Sprinkle top with croutons and Parmesan cheese if desired. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Combine the flour, garlic salt and pepper. Dredge the meat in the mixture. In large skillet heat the oil over medium heat. Brown the meat for about 3-4 minutes per side. Remove the meat from the skillet and keep warm. Pour off all but 2 Tablespoons of the oil. Add the onions and saute for about 5 minutes. Add the tomato sauce and the onion soup mix. Simmer for 1 minute. Return the meat to the skillet. Add the sour cream. Simmer for another 3-4 minutes. Serve over rice or hot rolls.

Place the sugar and water in a pot over medium heat and stir until the sugar has dissolved. Add the fresh mint and turn off the heat. Let the mixture steep for a few minutes. Strain the mixture into a large pitcher filled with ice. Stir in the grapefruit juice. Chill in the refrigerator before serving.

Peel russet potatoes and cut into 1 inch cubes. Melt butter in a skillet. Sauté onion until soft and add garlic powder, thyme, and seasonings to taste. Stir in potato cubes until all sides are well coated with butter mixture. Transfer to a 2 quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with Cheddar cheese and dot with butter. Sprinkle with parsley. Bake uncovered until tender, about 45 minutes.

Brown ground beef in a large skillet with onion. Add diced tomatoes. Add carrot, celery and potato. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer about 15-20 minutes until potato is tender. Serve on hot dog buns.

Remove husks and silks from corn. Pull back husks and place in a large bowl. Add mayo and cheese. Sprinkle with chili powder and mix. Add lime juice and mix well. Place corn in bowl and spoon mixture over it. Cover and let sit at room temperature for 1 hour. Remove corn from bowl. Pour any remaining liquid over it and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve with lime wedges.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray a baking pan with cooking spray. Place a slice of cheese on one side of each piece of bread. Lay fish sticks in a single layer in pan. Spread margarine over top side of one piece of bread. Place over fish sticks. Spread margarine over top side of other piece of bread. Place over fish sticks. Place both slices together. Bake until fish sticks are cooked through. Remove from oven. Cut into wedges to serve.

Cook the potatoes in the microwave for 10 minutes or until they are cooked through. Add sour cream, cream cheese, onion powder, pepper, sharp cheddar cheese, butter, and salt to the microwave safe bowl of the stand mixer. Mix for 3 to 5 minutes or until smooth. Add more cream cheese or sour cream if necessary. Serve warm.

In a medium skillet, saute onion and celery in butter until tender. Add mushrooms and cook for 2 minutes or until liquid is evaporated. Remove from heat. In a large bowl combine the first mixture with the bread crumbs, eggs and milk. Add the mustard, salt and pepper and mix well. Turn into a lightly greased 2-quart baking dish. Sprinkle with the cheddar cheese. Bake for 30 - 35 minutes or until set. Serves 4 - 6

Heat oil in skillet. Saute onion and zucchini. Add bouillon granules. Stir well. Add enough water to cover bottom of pan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer covered for about 15 minutes or until tender. Stir occasionally. Season with salt and serve with fresh parmesan cheese sprinkled on top.

In a crock pot combine the seasoning mix with the soup. Add the cream of mushroom soup and water and mix well. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix well. Cook on low for 8 hours. Serve with sliced avocados and sliced tomatoes on top.

In a large saute pan, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion, celery, carrot and garlic. Saute until vegetables are soft. Add sun-dried tomatoes and all other ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer until thick, about 30 minutes. Stir occasionally. Serve over your favorite pasta. Serves 4.

Place a 1-quart pitcher in the refrigerator for 20 minutes before serving to cool the yogurt. In a blender combine yogurt, milk, and ice cubes. Blend until smooth. Add 1 tablespoon triple berry burst cheerios and blend again until mixed. Pour into glasses and garnish with strawberries and additional triple berry burst cheerios.
Pineapple-Coconut Smoothies – A delicious combination of pineapple and coconut make these refreshing smoothies the perfect drink for a hot summer day.
Ingredient: 1 cup pineapple tidbits, 1/3 cup shredded coconut, 1 cup ice cubes, 1/3 cup fat-free milk, 1/3 cup lowfat vanilla yogurt, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon.
Prepare: In a blender combine pineapple, coconut, ice cubes, milk and vanilla extractblend until smooth. Stir in cinnamon. Serve

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour 2 loaf pans. Cream vegetable oil and sugar. Beat in egg whites, then add applesauce and bananas. Sift together flour, baking powder and salt. Add to creamed mixture alternately with applesauce. Fold in the dried apricots. Spread evenly in prepared pans. Bake 1 hour or until loaves test done. Cool in pans for 10 minutesremove to wire rack to cool.

Beat cream cheese until smooth. Add sugar, mix well. Blend in pineapple chunks. Fold in whipped topping. Spread in crust. Chill. Garnish with more pineapple chunks if desired.
Cracker Crust Pie
Graham Cracker Pie Crust

Mix the cornflour with the water. Add the garlic. Season with the spices. Coat the chicken pieces with the mixture. Leave to marinate in the fridge for 1 hour. Heat the oil in a pan. Add the marinated chicken. Cook for 4 minutes on each side. Add the water. Cover the pan. Cook for 10-12 minutes. Remove the cover. Cook for 2 minutes longer until the liquid has evaporated. Pour the yogurt over the chicken. Garnish with fresh coriander.

Cook chicken rice-a-roni according to package directions. Drain and set aside. In skillet, add ground turkey. Cook until browned. Add soup base and cook for an additional minute. Add frozen peas. Spoon into rice-a-roni. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Serve.

Melt butter and sugars in a large saucepan over a low heat. Stir to combine. Add milk and vanilla essence and stir again. Turn the heat up to medium and stir constantly until mixture comes to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 2 minutes or until mixture thickens slightly and coats the back of a spoon. Remove from heat and cool slightly. In a separate bowl, beat eggs with a fork until well combined and slowly add mixture to eggs and beat until combined. Slowly add the dry ingredients and milk and stir until combined. Pour mixture into a greased and lined 20cm square tin and sprinkle with milo and cereal. Bake in a preheated oven at 180 deg celcius for 30-35 minutes or until cooked when tested with a skewer. Allow to cool before removing from tin. Dust with icing sugar to serve.

Combine cream cheese and sour cream in a bowl. Mix in ketchup. Add remaining ingredients. Place on the bottom of a crock pot. Bake on low for 3 hours. Serve on top of the cocktail ryes.
name: reubens with stoneground mustard
ingredients: corned beef, sauerkraut, swiss cheese, stone ground mustard, dark rye bread, butter
preparation:Butter one slice of rye bread and place on non-stick skillet or griddle. Layer the corned beef, the sauerkraut and the swiss cheese on top of the corned beef. Spread the stoneground mustard on the remaining slice of rye bread. Place on top of the sandwich- mustard side down. Butter the top of the sandwich with the remaining tablespoon of butter and grill until golden on each side.
name: reuben s creamed corn
ingredients: half-and-half, chicken bouillon cubes, white pepper, sugar, frozen corn, butter, flour

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Toss together salmon fillets with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil, salt and pepper to taste. Spread the fish out on a sheet pan or cookie sheet. Roast for about 20 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through to desired doneness. While the fish is roasting, make the sauce. Whisk together the remaining olive oil, vinegar, honey, mustard, and sesame oil until well blended. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Pour the sauce over the roasted fish and top with the sesame seeds. Serve immediately.

Heat salad oil in a large skillet. Add onion and cook until tender. Add green chilies and cook until heated through. Stir in heavy cream and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 3 minutes. Stir in shredded cheese until melted. Stir in green bell pepper. Serve warm over tortilla chips.

In a large bowl, melt the butter in a small saucepan over low heat. When melted, add the marshmallows and mix well until melted. Remove from the heat, add the powdered raspberry jelly. Mix well. Stir in the popcorn. Form into 1-inch balls. Store in an airtight container.

Cook ground beef until cooked through. Drain fat. Dice bacon. Mix together beef, bacon, seasoning. On half of the pizza crust, spread beef mixture. Sprinkle with velveeta cheese. Top with other half of pizza dough. Roll up. Bake at 350 until hot and brown. Cut into slices. Serve with salad or french fries.

Cook macaroni according to package instructions. While cooking prepare tuna mixture by combining tuna with milk, margarine, green onions and parsley in a bowl. Add the tomatoes and mix. When the pasta is done, drain and add tuna mixture and the cheese. Stir. Serve immediately or refrigerate until serving time.
Cook bacon crumbly. Set aside. Slice turnips into thin rounds. Cook with bacon drippings for about 10 minutes or until almost tender. Add bacon. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

In a large bowl combine ground beef, oats, salt, pepper, dry mustard and onion powder. Add egg and mix with a fork until combined. Spoon mixture into a greased loaf pan. Bake in a 350 preheated oven for 45 to 50 minutes or until no longer pink inside. Remove from pan. In a small bowl combine ketchup, brown sugar and pickle juice. Spread over top of meat loaf. Return to oven for 5 minutes to set glaze.

Place beans in a bowl of cold water. Drain. Chop eggs into small pieces. Soak the olives in hot water to loosen the stuffing. Rinse and drain. Mince garlic. Heat oil in a skillet. Add garlic. Add parsley. Remove from heat. Stir in all other ingredients except olives. Gently stir in olives. Serve cold.

Scrub the potatoes well under cold running water and boil them until they can be easily pierced by a knife or fork. Drain the hot potatoes and place them back into the pan. Stir in the butter and heavy whipping cream until well blended. Add the cream cheese and beat until it is smoothly blended with the butter and cream. Add the chives and mix well. Serve at once.

Peel the ginger root and cut into thin slices. Place all the ginger slices and soya sauce into the blender to make the ginger paste. Heat the oil over medium heat until the oil is hot enough to fry the ginger paste. Place the ginger paste into the oil and fry it until the ginger paste turns slightly brown. Remove from the oil into a bowl. Add the sherry wine into the pan to deglaze the oil. Add the ginger paste back into the pan and stir-fry until the ginger paste turns into golden brown. Remove the pan from the heat and add the sherry wine into the pan to make the sauce. Add the pork fillet into the pan and stir-fry until the color changes to white. Add the button mushrooms into the pan and stir-fry until the mushrooms turn tender. Add the snow peas into the pan and stir-fry until the snow peas are cooked but still crisp. Add the red cabbage into the pan and stir-fry until the red cabbage is cooked but still slightly crisp. Add the water into the pan until the water covers the

In a small bowl, combine the tahini and 1/4 cup of the warm water and stir until smooth. Transfer to a small plate and set aside. In a large pot of boiling water, cook the pasta according to the package directions. Drain the pasta and return to the pot. Add the remaining 1/4 cup water and the peanut butterstir until combined. Stir in the soy sauce and rice wine vinegarcook over low heat for 1 minute. Stir in the tahini mixture and the remaining 1/2 tablespoon of oilseason with salt and pepper. Serve topped with the scallion and sesame seeds.

Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling water until al dente. Drain and rinse under cold running water to stop the cooking. Transfer the pasta to a large bowl and toss with the remaining ingredients. Serve immediately.

Preheat grill or grill pan over medium heat. Brush tomato slices all over with oil. Grill for 4 minutes per side or until lightly charred and beginning to brown. Remove from grillset aside. Combine dressing ingredients in small bowl. Combine salad ingredients in large bowl. Add dressingtoss until well blended. Arrange tomato slices in center of salad. Sprinkle with feta.
In a large bowl combine water and tomato paste. Stir until smooth. Add olive oil and stir. Add cream and stir until combined. Add garlic and stir. Add black pepper and stir. Add fresh basil and stir.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Divide dough into two equal pieces. Roll each piece into a 10-inch round. Place the rounds on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake at 425 degrees F for 7 to 8 minutes. Combine the oil and garlic in a medium bowl. Brush the tops of the crusts with the oil mixture. Sprinkle with the cheeses. Place the crusts in the oven. Bake at 425 degrees F for 10 to 12 minutes or until the crusts are lightly browned. Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan over medium heat, saute the asparagus and shallot in the oil for 10 minutes. Add the boursin and pepper. Stir. Top the crusts with the vegetable mixture and serve.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and add the butter. When the butter is melted add the chicken and cook until browned on both sides. Add the fresh mushrooms and the shallots. Stir in the salt and the pepper. Cook for about 10 more minutes. Transfer the chicken to a platter. Sprinkle with the grated cheese and put back under the broiler until the cheese melts. Serve warm.
name: paula deen's chicken georgia
Butter, Boneless Skinless Chicken Breast Halves Sliced Mushrooms Shallots Salt Pepper Mozzarella Cheese
Melt Butter Over Medium Heat. Add Mushrooms And Shallots And Sprinkle With Salt And Pepper. Cook 10 Minutes. Add Chicken And Cook 10 Minutes On Each Side Or Until Tender. Transfer Chicken To Platter And Sprinkle With Grated Cheese. Top With Mushroom Mixture. Cook And Let Stand 5 Minutes Or Until Cheese Melts.
name: baby food chicken
Butter Unble

Preheat oven to 375f. On a lightly floured surface, roll 1 puff pastry sheet to a 14-inch square. Cut out 14 squares with a 4-inch cutter. Transfer to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Melt 1 tablespoon of butter with 1/4 cup of white sugar in a small saucepan over low heat until dissolved. Stir in 1 teaspoon of rum and set aside to cool. On a lightly floured surface, roll the remaining pastry sheet to a 14-inch square. Cut out 14 squares with a 4-inch cutter and transfer to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Place the 14 squares from the first sheet on top of the 14 squares from the second sheet and press together to seal. Transfer the pastry to the refrigerator to chill for 30 minutes. Turn the sealed pastry over and brush the surface with the melted butter and cooled rum mixture. Bake for 2

In a medium mixing bowl combine the cooked chicken, parsley, lemon juice, flour, baking powder, eggs, and milk. Add the oil slowly until batter is smooth. Dip the chicken pieces into the batter and drop into the hot oil. Fry until golden brown and crisp. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot with dipping sauce.
Place all of the salad ingredients in a medium bowl. Add balsamic vinaigrette and toss well. Divide between two plates. Garnish each with 1 teaspoon crumbled gorgonzola cheese. Makes 2 servings.

Mix together salsa, cheese, sour cream, peppers and seasoning. Spray large shallow baking dish with cooking spray. Arrange chicken in dish. Sprinkle with seasoning. Spoon mixture over. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Serve with rice.

In a large bowl, mix together oats, walnuts and almonds. Heat the olive oil and maple syrup in a small saucepan over medium heat. Pour the liquid over the oat mixture and stir to combine. Spread the mixture onto two rimmed baking sheets and bake in the oven for 15 minutes. Stir the mixture and bake for another 10 to 15 minutes, until the mixture is toasted and fragrant. Remove the granola from the oven and sprinkle the pecans and sunflower seeds over the top. Stir to combine and return to the oven for another 10 minutes. Remove the granola from the oven and let cool to room temperature on the baking sheets. Mix in the raisins and dried cranberries and store in an airtight container for up to three weeks.

Preheat oven to 180 degrees celsius. Grease and line two 20cm square pans. Grate beetroot into a bowl. Add the brown sugar and pecans. Beat with a spoon until well mixed. Add the beaten eggs. Sift together the self-raising flour and cocoa. Add to beetroot mixture. Stir to combine. Spread into two pans. Bake for 40 to 50 minutes or until a skewer inserted comes out clean. Cool in pans for 10 minutes before removing to rack. Serve warm or cold.

Sprinkle chicken with pepper. Heat 1 tsp. of sesame oil in large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add chickensaute until no longer pink. Remove from skilletkeep warm. Stir remaining 1 tsp. of sesame oil and scallions into skillet. Add broth. Heat until simmeringstir in lemon zest and juice. Heat until boiling. Stir in cornstarch until thickenedremove from heat. Toss chicken with lemon mixture. Serve over rice. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.

Combine five-spice and kosher salt in a bowl. Rub onto all sides of lamb chops. Place chops in a heavy skillet. Add mango chutney and place over medium-high heat. Sear chops until a nice crust forms. Continue cooking to desired doneness. Serve with lime wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large bowl, mix together the oil, rosemary, garlic and salt. Arrange the chicken pieces in a large shallow baking dish, and pour the oil mixture over the top. Cover the dish with foil, and bake for 30 minutes. Uncover the dish and mix the onion into the oil mixture. Continue to bake until the chicken is no longer pink and the potatoes are tender, about 45 minutes more.

In a saucepan bring the water to boil. Stir in the quinoa. Cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 12-15 minutes or until all the liquid has been absorbed. Remove from heat, fluff with a fork, and set aside to cool. Meanwhile, in a small bowl whisk together the oil, vinegar, and Tabasco Sauce until combined. Whisk in the salt and pepper to taste. In a large bowl toss together the currants, cucumber, quinoa, and dressing until well combined. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

In a large pot over medium high heat brown meat in oil. Drain grease. Add broth, V8 juice, water, chili powder, salt, pepper. Bring to a boil. Cover- simmer for 1 hour or until meat is tender. Stir in diced chilies. In a medium bowl stir together sour cream and soup mix. Serve meat mixture over warm tortilla. Top each with sour cream mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 10 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Serve with lettuce, tomatoes, salsa.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a medium bowl combine 1/2 cup of the peach pie filling with the whole berry cranberry sauce. In a 9×13 inch baking pan spread 1/2 of the peach mixture. In a large bowl combine the rest of the peach pie filling with the butter, cake mix, eggs, nutmeg, cinnamon, and pecansmix well. Spread this mixture over the peach mixture in the baking pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a large saucepan over medium heat, bring water to a boil. Add quinoa, reduce heat to low. Cover, cook 15 minutes or until all water is absorbed. Remove from heat. Stir in tofu, parsley, basil, oregano, rosemary, garlic, and olive oil. Let sit 10 minutes to cool. Fill phyllo dough shells with tofu mixture. Sprinkle with pine nuts. Bake 20 minutes or until phyllo is golden. Serve warm.

Peel and mash the bananas. In a heavy-bottomed kadhai or pan, melt the butter and sugar. Add the powdered milk and water and bring to a boil while stirring continuously to avoid burning. Add the mashed bananas and lemon juice and stir until the mixture comes together and leaves the sides of the pan clean. Pour the mixture into an ovenproof dish and bake for about 20 to 25 minutes or until the topping is golden brown and the custard is set. Sprinkle with nuts and coconut flakes and cut into squares. Serve warm or cold.
banana is a fruit that is eaten raw or cooked. It is native to tropical regions of the world and is cultivated in many parts of the world. Bananas are high in potassium and are good sources of fiber and vitamins A, B, and C. They are also a good source of magnesium and iron. Bananas are available year-round and can be found at most grocery stores.
Banana is a tropical fruit that is native to the Americas. It is believed to have originated

Bring the water and sugar to a boil in a medium saucepan. Stir in the remaining ingredients and cook over medium heat until the polenta thickens and the mixture pulls away from the sides of the pan. Remove from the heat and stir in the flour. Refrigerate until ready to use. Peel the red bell peppers and cut them into thin slices. Heat the canola oil in a large skillet. Add the polenta slices and cook over medium-high heat for a few minutes on each side until crisp and golden. Serve with the red bell peppers and basil.
Mmmm. I am making fries tonight. These all sound really good. I think I will go with the potato fries with onion and chili. I love chili and potatoes together.
The best part of cooking is that you can eat what you cook.
I have been making baked potatoes for dinner lately. They are delicious. I like the skin. I like the little bit of salt and the butter. Mmmm.
I think I will try the baked potato with the chili. That sounds really good

In a large bowl, mash the russet potatoes with the butter. Add the cream and milk and beat with a handheld mixer until smooth. Season with the chives and thyme and the salt and pepper. Transfer to a greased baking dish. Bake the potatoes until they are heated through and lightly browned, about 20 minutes. Serve hot. Makes 6 servings.
Mix together first five ingredients. Spread over both sides of the chicken breasts. Bake uncovered at 375 for 20-25 minutes. Cook longer if desired.

In a large skillet heat butter over medium heat. Add onion and red bell pepper. Cook about 4-5 minutes. Add potatoes and cook for 10 minutes. Add eggs and cook until done. Serve with toast or tortillas. Add cheese if desired.
Mix together the first five ingredients. Add the jell-o. Let stand for 10 minutes. Chill until set. Add the orange juice and nuts. Mix well. Chill until ready to serve. Serves 10.

Cut eggplants in half. Scoop out seeds with spoon. Toss with honey, chili and olive oil. Roast on an oiled baking sheet in 350 degree oven for about an hour or until tender. Cool slightly. Garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve on rice or with toast or crackers.
Mix together. Spread on cake.

Cook linguini according to package directions. In a saute pan over medium high heat, combine olive oil, garlic and zucchini, and cook for 4 minutes or until zucchini is tender. Add pasta and toss. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Cook fettuccine as directed on package. Meanwhile, combine dressing, peas and 1/4 cup milk in blender container or food processor bowl and process until smooth. Reserve 1/4 cup sauce for garnish. Combine remaining dressing and 1/2 cup milk with remaining ingredients in medium saucepan and cook on medium-low heat 5 to 7 minutes or until thickened and hot. Drain fettuccine and toss with sauce. Sprinkle with reserved peas and garnish with remaining 1/4 cup dressing and parsley.

Whisk together the first four ingredients in a small bowl. Pat the pork dry and rub the mixture all over. Place in a shallow dish and refrigerate overnight. Bring the wine to a boil in a small saucepancook until reduced by half. Set aside. Remove the pork from the marinade and season generously with the rice wine and dark sesame oil. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heatadd the oil. Place the seasoned pork in the skillet and cook for 3 to 5 minutes on each side or until brown and cooked through. Stir the reserved marinade and pour the wine mixture into the pan. Cook and stir for 3 to 5 minutes or until sauce is reduced to a glaze. Transfer the pork to a serving platterdrizzle with sauce. Garnish with the cilantro.
Preheat oven 350 degrees. Pour can of sweetened condensed milk over hot cake. Add a layer of frozen whipped topping over the top of the cake. Sprinkle with crushed heath bars. Refrigerate. Serve.

In saucepan combine millet with water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Coverreduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes or until water is absorbed and grains are tender. In the meantime prepare the dressing by combining the remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Drain millet and spread evenly on a large platter or on 4 plates. Add beans and cucumber and toss to coat with dressing. Sprinkle with Feta and serve immediately.

Fry bacon, drain and place on slice of bread. Fry egg in bacon grease. Place fried egg on top of bacon. On other slice of bread spread mayonnaise and place american cheese on top of mayonnaise. Place american cheese slice on top of fried egg. Put it all together and enjoy.

In a large pot, bring 4 cups of water to boil. Add salt. Add cornmeal and stir continuously until thickened. Add flour and stir again until thick. Add milk and stir until smooth. Add vanilla and cinnamon. Add condensed milk. Serve.

Preheat oven to 180-degrees C (350-degrees F). Grease 2 x 9-inch loaf pans. Beat together butter, sugar, eggs and rind of one orange. Add fresh orange juice. Sift together flour, baking powder and salt. Stir into creamed mixture. Blend well and pour into loaf pans. Bake for 45-60 minutes or until done. Remove from pans and let cool. Cut into 24 slices. Store in an air-tight container at room temperature up to 3 days. Makes 2 loaves.

In large bowl, combine all ingredients except cheese and topping. Divide into four loaves. Place in shallow baking pan. Bake at 350 for 1-1/2 hours. Uncover and bake 15 minutes longer. Turn off oven. Spread topping over loaves. Let stand 15 minutes. Serve with rice.
name: chicken enchiladas with riceingredients: chicken breast, enchilada sauce, corn tortillas, monterey jack cheese, black olives, green chiles, cream cheese, green chile sauce, cream of chicken soup, green onionspreparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut chicken into small pieces. Mix chicken with enchilada sauce in bowl. In a separate bowl, combine chicken mixture with cream cheese and olives. Spread about 1/3 cup enchilada sauce into bottom of 13x9 pan. Place 4 corn tortillas in bottom of pan. Spoon 1/3 cup chicken mixture and sprink

Bring chicken broth and rice to a boil over med-high heat. Reduce heat to simmer and cover. Cook for approximately 20 minutes or until all liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat and add carrot, zucchini, almonds and sunflower seeds. Cover and let sit for 5 minutes. Stir in parsley and red pepper flakes. Serve immediately.
Combine first 3 ingredients and blend until smooth. Add flour and spice and mix well. Drop by teaspoon onto greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10-15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small bowl combine graham cracker crumbs, flour and baking powder. Combine sweetened condensed milk with melted butter. Stir in semi-sweet chocolate chips, butterscotch chips and flaked coconut. Stir in nuts. Press into a greased and floured 9x9 inch square pan. Bake for 20 minutes. Cool in pan on a wire rack. Cut into squares. Store in a covered container. Makes 2 dozen.

In a large bowl, whisk together lemon juice, 2 tbsp of olive oil and 1/2 tsp of black pepper. Place the chicken into the bowl with the lemon juice mixture. Let it sit for at least 30 minutes. Heat a grill pan to medium heat. Place the chicken onto the pan. Cook for 4 minutes per side. Brush the lemon mixture onto the chicken while cooking. Cook until the chicken is completely cooked through. Serve hot.
Name: Pantry Southwest Chicken Ingredients: Tomatoes And Green Chilies, Tomato Sauce, Black Beans, Onion, Corn, Chicken Breasts, Garlic Cloves, Cumin, Salt And Pepper, Olive Oil Preparation:In Olive Oil, Cook The Chicken Until Almost Done. Remove From Pan. In Same Pan, Add Onion And Garlic. Cook Until Onion Is Translucent. Add Diced Tomatoes With Chilis, Can Of Tomato Sauce, Can Of Black Beans, Corn, And Cumin. Return Chicken To Pan And Cook Until The Chicken Is

Bring water and salt to a boil in a saucepan. Stir in oats and reduce heat to a simmer. Cover and cook for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice and milk. Stir in apple and butter. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400. In a small bowl, whisk together oil and spices. Toss carrots with spice mixture and spread onto a baking sheet. Roast for about 20 minutes, turning once. Sprinkle with cilantro and lime juice before serving.

Combine salt and pepper to taste with 1 Tbsp. butter and 1 Tbsp. dijon mustard. Rub fish with this mixture. Bake at 425 degrees for 20 minutes. Combine remaining butter and remaining dijon mustard, the vermouth and the parsley. Drizzle over fish. Combine remaining ingredients and serve with fish.
Season chops and brown in a large skillet. Add beer and bring to a boil. Add rest of ingredients and simmer for 1 hour. Serve over egg noodles.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Cut mushrooms in half lengthwise. Spray a 9-inch by 13-inch baking dish with cooking spray. In a medium bowl stir together broth, milk, olive oil, salt, pepper, paprika. Toss mushrooms with broth mixture in baking dish. Cover with aluminum foil and bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes. Uncover and bake for 10 minutes longer or until mushrooms are tender. Serve hot.

Mix first five ingredients in medium bowl. Blend in 1 cup wine. Beat with a wooden spoon for 30 seconds. Spoon onto a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake in oven at 450 degrees for 8 to 12 minutes. Melt the butter. Add the last 1/2 cup of wine. Add the garlic power and the dried parsley flakes and heat till boiling. Brush on hot buscuits. May use more or less seasoning for taste.

Butter and line an 8 x 11-inch pan with foil. Combine the first 4 ingredients in a medium saucepan over medium heat and cook until mixture comes to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook, stirring frequently until mixture thickens. Remove from heat. Cool to room temperature. Beat the mixture until smooth and fluffy. Add the condensed milk and vanilla. Beat until smooth. Pour into prepared pan. Chill for at least 3 hours or overnight. Remove from pan and cut into pieces.
The first time I made these I added about 2-3 c. of raisins and it made them sweet and salty.
The caramels were good and the rum sauce was great. I have no idea how the recipe got a 5.
I made the corn and it was delicious. I also made the chocolate frosting and used it as a glaze for a cake.
I'm making the frosting for a cake. I can't wait to taste it. I love the way it looks too.
I made the strawberries with heavy whipping cre

Boil a pot of water. Drop the green beans in the boiling water for about 3 minutes or so. Then remove them from the water immediately to prevent them from becoming soggy. In the meantime, preheat your oven to 375 degrees. In a small bowl, add the garlic, honey, olive oil, salt, pepper, and the lemon. Mix it all together well. Drain the beans and add them to the bowl. Toss it together well. Take the yellow bell pepper and slice it in half. Add the bell pepper halves to the bowl and toss them around again. Then place them on a baking dish. Cook them for about 10 minutes or so. While the beans are cooking, take the basil leaves and chop them up into small pieces. Once the dish comes out of the oven, sprinkle the basil leaves on top. Toss it all together one more time. Then serve.

Pour 1 quart hot water over green tea bags in large saucepan. Steep 10 minutes. Remove bags and discard. In a large serving pitcher, combine spice, apple and cranberry juices, and sugar. Add tea and stir until sugar is dissolved. Reheat, if necessary. Serve warm with garnish, if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Blend mustard and juice. Add honey and brown sugar. Add seasonings. Dip each breast in mixture. Roll in flakes. Bake in a single layer in a shallow baking pan until brown. Serve in a platter. Garnish with fresh orange slices.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Scrub the skin of the potatoes with a brush under running water to remove any dirt. Poke a couple of holes with a knife tip into the top of each potato. Bake for 1 hour 15 minutes or until the potatoes are tender when pierced with a knife. While the potatoes are cooking combine the maple syrup and butter with the fresh thyme in a small bowl and whisk to combine. Remove the potatoes from the oven and drizzle the maple syrup over the tops of the hot potatoes. Serve immediately with a sprinkle of the fresh thyme on top.

Cook ground beef until browned. Stir in taco seasoning and water. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally until heated through. Spread half the refried beans over the bottom of a 13x9-inch baking dish. Sprinkle 1/4 of the shredded cheese over the beans. Spoon meat mixture evenly over cheese, spreading it out to edges of baking dish. Top with remaining cheese and green onions. Combine muffin mix and milk. Spoon over cheese, spreading to edges of baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until edges are golden brown.

In a heavy bottomed 4-quart pan mix flour, sugar, maple syrup & corn syrup. Cook over medium heat stirring constantly until mixture reaches 245-250 degrees on a candy thermometer (about 10 minutes). Remove from heat & stir in the milk & butter. Add the nuts & beat until well mixed. Pour into a 9x13x2-inch pan. Let cool until set & cut into squares.

In a medium saucepan combine the light brown sugar, evaporated milk, butter, vanilla extract and salt. Bring to a boil over medium heat while stirring to dissolve the sugar. Once boiling reduce to simmer, stirring occasionally, until reduced to about 1 cup. Remove from heat and cool to room temp. In the bowl of an electric mixer beat the reduced sauce until light and fluffy. Stir in the powdered sugar and beat until smooth. Use immediately or store in an air tight container at room temp for 1 week.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over med heat. Add turkey and break up into small pieces. Add onions and cook until meat is cooked through and the onions are tender. Remove from heat and mix in garlic powder and worcestershire sauce. Let cool for a few minutes. Meanwhile combine prepared horseradish and ketchup in a small bowl. In a large bowl, mix together the ground turkey mixture, egg and parsley. Shape into 12 1-in balls and place in a 9x13-in baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes or until meat is no longer pink and juices run clear. Top with ketchup and horseradish mixture. Bake for an additional 5 minutes until heated through. Serve with brown rice and steamed broccoli.

In a large saucepan, bring the water and sugar to a light boil. Cook and stir for 2 mins. Remove from heat and stir in the lime juice and watermelon juice until dissolved. Cool completely and pour into a large pitcher or punch bowl. Add ice cubes and orange juice. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate until chilled. Serve in tall glasses over ice. Garnish with mint if desired.

Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Brown the chicken well on both sides. Add the salt and pepper and cook until brown. Remove from the pan and set aside. Add the diced tomatoes to the pan and bring to a boil over high heat. Stir in the wine and cook until reduced by half. Add the chicken back to the pan and cook for another minute. Sprinkle with the mixed peppers and serve over hot polenta.

Divide beef into 8 portions. Place each portion in a crescent roll. Top each with a slice of american cheese. Drizzle with barbecue sauce. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Bake 10-12 minutes. Cool slightly. Roll up. Cut into 2-inch pieces. Serve with bbq sauce.

Brown ground beef in a skillet over medium heat. Drain excess grease away. Add onion and continue to cook until onion is translucent. Add tomatoes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add kidney bean and continue to cook until bean is hot. Let mixture cool before adding to individual bowls with remaining items. Mix together in bowl. Cover tightly with plastic wrap or foil. Refrigerate overnight or for several hours. Serve cold with Fritos corn chips. You can add salsa for an extra zing of flavor if you wish.

Slice the squash lengthwise into 1/4-inch roundsdiscard seeds if any. Bring a small pot of water to a boiladd squash rounds to boiling water, boil for 1 minute, remove from water, place in ice-water bath to stop cookingdrainplace squash rounds in a bowl, add melted butter and sprinkle with salt. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 160C. Cut the tomatoes in half lengthwise and place them face down in a roasting tray. Sprinkle with sugar and a little salt and drizzle with olive oil. Roast for about an hour until the tomatoes are soft but not breaking down too much (they should still keep their shape). Check periodically and turn the tomatoes over if they start to burn. Remove the tray from the oven and let the tomatoes cool down. Store in the fridge for up to a week or in the freezer for up to three months.

Mix butter and brown sugar until light and creamy. Add vanilla. Mix in plain flour and semolina. Work to a stiff dough. Chill for 1 hour. Roll into walnut-sized balls. Dip in egg white and roll in ground almonds. Place on a greased tray and bake in a preheated moderate oven for 10 minutes. Allow to cool on a wire rack.

Cook the zucchini in boiling water just until tender. Drain well and cool completely. Brown the ground beef with the onion and garlic and season with the cumin. Drain and return to the pan. Add the salsa and heat through. Stir in the zucchini and season to taste with salt and pepper. Cover and let simmer for 10 minutes. Serve over rice or noodles.
Drain and flake tuna with a fork. Combine with green onions and diced green chiles. Spoon mixture into shells. Top with cheese and serve with salsa.

Peel and slice peaches into 1/2-inch slices. Place into a small saucepan with the raspberries, brandy, granulated sugar, and gelatin. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat and cook until the mixture thickens, about 8 minutes. Pour the mixture into 6 small ramekins or custard cups. Let cool completely. In a small bowl, combine the almond extract and saltwhisk the lemon juice into the cream to prevent it from curdling and fold into the egg whites. Fold the whites into the cream mixture just until combineddo not over mix. Spoon the mixture onto the cooled peach mixture. Cover with plastic wrap and chill for at least 4 hours or up to 1 day. Serve cold.

In a small skillet, saute cabbage with wine until crisp-tender. Remove from heatstir in lemon juice. Cover and set aside until serving time. Heat olive oil in another skillet. Add onion. Saute until tender. Add applescook until tender. Add cooked cabbage mixturetoss to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350. Cut the sausages in half and place in a large casserole dish or oven proof pan. Layer the potatoes and the bell peppers around the sausages and sprinkle with olive oil, garlic and salt and pepper. Sprinkle the tops with the kalamata olives. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes or until the potatoes are tender and the vegetables and meat are nicely browned.
I'm a little bit of a control freak so I like to be able to control everything from the way the page looks to the way the links are set up and how the content is displayed to the visitors. I'm not that crazy about the blogging software that is out there right now and so I'm building my own. It's taking me a little longer than I thought but I'm getting there. In the mean time I'll just have to put up with the old Blogger look until I get it done and then I'll post what I've learned so other people can do it, too.
I've been working on my new web site.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a bowl. Crumble to desired consistency. Heat a grill pan or large skillet coated with cooking spray over medium-high heat. Add zucchinisaute 3 minutes. Add turkey mixture. Cook 3 minutes. Spoon about 2 tablespoons of mixture onto each of four whole wheat buns. Top with cheese and remaining bun.

Combine all dry ingredients in a large bowl. Cut in the margarine until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in milk, just until the mixture is smooth and forms a ball. Turn the dough out on a lightly floured surface. Divide the dough in half. Pat each portion into a 1/2 inch thick circle about 5 inches in diameter. Cook over medium-low heat for 10-12 minutes, turning once during cooking. Serve warm with jam or honey.

Heat oil in saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and celerysaute 5 minutes or until tender, stirring often. Add italian seasoning and salt and pepper to taste. Stir in broth and diced tomatoesheat through. Add tomato pastestir well. Add assorted fresh vegetables. Bring to a boil and simmer for 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Serve immediately or cool completely and refrigerate until serving time. Reheat and serve.

Bring potatoes to a boil in salted water until tender. Meanwhile, melt the butter in a pan over low heat. Add the cornflakes and stir until the flakes are lightly toasted. Mash the potatoes until smooth and add the cornflakes, milk, and cream. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve warm with a sprinkling of parsley.

Heat oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet or Dutch oven. Stir in onion. Cook and stir until tender (about 5 minutes). Stir in curry powder and cook for 30 seconds longer. Stir in water. Reduce heat to low, cover and cook 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Stir in chicken broth and milk. Cook 5 minutes longer or until mixture is heated through. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 13x9x2 inch pan or 24 cupcake papers. Make cake as directed on box but use yogurt in place of water. Cool completely before using. Cut cake into 12 pieces or 24 cupcakes. Place 2 pieces or cupcakes on each serving plate or in each cupcake paper liner. Top with about 1 tablespoon of yogurt. Top with 1 tablespoon of whipped topping and 1 tablespoon of pie filling. Garnish with fresh fruit and mint sprigs, if desired.

Saute flour and mustard powder together. Add butter. Add salt and pepper. Saute in the paprika. Add the chicken. Brown. Add white wine. Cook until wine has evaporated. Add water. Cook until tender. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 300 degrees f. Beat egg white and 1/4 cup water in a medium-sized bowl until frothy. Add sugar, beating until it dissolves, about 1 minute. Add the nuts and stir until coated. Spread on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes or until the coating is crisp and the nuts are fragrant. Let cool for 5 minutesthen stir in the cinnamon and salt. Store in an airtight container for up to 1 week.

In a large saucepan over low heat, melt the chocolate chips and butter until smooth. Remove from heat and add the frosting. Mix well. Add the nuts and marshmallows. Stir well. Pour into a greased 9x13 baking dish. Cool and cut into squares.

In a large skillet, cook bacon over medium-low heat until crisp. Drain off most of the fat. Add onions and saute until softened. Add garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add mushrooms, capers and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in hot pepper flakes. Add wine. Simmer for 2 minutes. Add spaghetti and saute for 2 minutes. Add chopped basil and stir. Serve immediately.

Combine the butter and brown sugar and cream until well blended. Beat the egg and maple syrup and mix with the creamed butter and sugar until well blended. Stir in the vanilla and flour until well blended and form into 1-inch balls and place on the cookie sheet. Sprinkle granulated sugar on top and bake for 8-10 minutes.

In large heavy skillet heat sugar & cornstarch over medium heat until it boils & thickens. Stir in kirsch. Boil 2 minutes. Add cherries. Heat through. Spoon into 6 serving dishes. Top with scoop of vanilla ice cream. Garnish with whipped cream & maraschino cherries.

In a bowl mix cottage cheese with eggs, all-purpose flour and sugar. Add whipping cream and lemon zest and mix again. Heat oil in a large skillet to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Form batter into 4-inch rounds, 1/4 inch thick. Fry in hot oil until golden brown on both sides. Drain on paper towels.

Cook potatoes in boiling water for 10 minutes until tender when pierced with a fork. Drain and cut into chunks. Cook bacon until crispdrain on paper towel. In a large bowl, mix half-and-half, potatoes, onion, bacon, seasonings, and butter. Pour into a greased 2-quart casserole dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Serve with milk or salad for a complete meal.
I am very excited to share this recipe with you all. My boyfriend came across a recipe for homemade mozzarella cheese on a blog a while back that he was super excited to try out. It was so good! So good that we made it twice within a week.
I like to make homemade pizza all the time but it just isn't complete without fresh mozzarella cheese on top. I have tried to find good mozzarella cheese at my local grocery store but have never been very impressed with any of them. So
Heat oil in skillet. Add water chestnuts and garlic. Saute 3 minutes. Add green beans. Saute 2 to 3 minutes. Mix in herb salad dressing mix and salt. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Heat the oil in a pan and saute the garlic and ginger for a few minutes. Add the prawns and saute until they turn pink. Stir in the honey and soy sauce and continue to saute for a minute. Serve on a bed of lettuce and sprinkle with sesame seeds.

Steam the lima beans in a large pot of water until crisp-tender. Drain the beans in a colander and set aside. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic powder and saute until the powder is lightly toasted. Stir the lima beans into the garlic powder and saute until the beans are lightly browned. Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the pimentos. Season the lima bean mixture with the sour cream, salt and pepper. Sprinkle with the chives to serve. Serve hot or warm as a side dish or main course. Serves 4.

Combine all ingredients except beer and mix well with fork or hands to form dough. If dough is too dry add more beer or ice cold water. Cover and let rise until doubled. Roll out dough and top as desired. Bake at 450 f until dough is browned, 10 - 15 min.

In a large bowl toss together the tenderloins and cornstarch. Heat canola oil in a large skillet to 375 degrees. Fry tenderloins for about 3 minutes or until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. In a medium bowl combine the tenderloins and all remaining ingredients except for the salad dressing. Serve with salad dressing for dipping.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cream the egg in the vegetable oil. Add the milk. Combine the flour, brown sugar, ground cinnamon, baking powder, baking soda and stir. Add the applesauce. Stir in the cheerios. Fill 2/3 of the way full. Bake for 15-20 minutes.
Slice the mozzarella. Top with basil. Top with sliced tomatoes. Season with red wine vinegar, salt and pepper. Drizzle with olive oil.

In a large mixing bowl combine the pumpkin, evaporated milk, eggs and sugar, mixing well. Stir in the pumpkin pie spice and vanilla extract. In a 9 by 13-inch baking dish place 1/2 of the cake mix. Pour the pumpkin mixture on top of the cake mix. Repeat with the remaining cake mix. Spread the melted butter over the top of the pumpkin mixture. Sprinkle with chopped nuts. Bake in a 350-degree oven for 25 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Remove from the oven and top with the whipped cream and caramel drizzle before serving.

Grease and line a 24cm square tin. Cream butter and yogurt together until fluffy. Add the raw sugar and beat well. Stir in the flour and baking powder and mix until just combined. Stir in the rolled oats and coconut. Spread the mixture into the prepared pan and sprinkle with the sultanas. Bake for 30 minutes until golden and just set. Cool completely in the pan. Cut into squares. Drizzle with honey to serve.

Spread a little margarine on each half of a mini pita pocket. On one half add the onion slices, then add the cream cheese. On the other half add the bacon and tomatoes. Put the two halves together. Then add a few slices of the jalapeno pepper.

Bring a large pot of water to a rolling boil. Add ravioli and cook for 2 minutes or until pasta is cooked through. While pasta is cooking in a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter with balsamic. Stir in walnuts. Remove pasta from water and drain. Add pasta to skillet with walnuts and balsamic. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Garnish with grated Parmesan.

Combine the long grain rice and the chicken stock in a medium size bowl or pot and cover it with a lid or plastic wrap and let it soak for 10 minutes. Heat a medium size sauce pan or pot over medium high heat and add the butter and garlic and saut for 1 minute and then add the parsley and remove from the heat and transfer to a bowl. Transfer the rice to the sauce pan or pot and stir in the lemon zest and salt and then the parsley mixture and then add the lemon juice and let it sit for 30 minutes and fluff with a fork and serve.

Brown ground beef in large nonstick skillet. Drain fat. Add peppers, onion, pasta sauce and broth. Cook for 10 minutes. Stir in tomatoes. Combine rice blend and water. Bring to a boilreduce heat to low. Covercook 20 minutes. Stir in cooked beef mixture. Cook for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese. Makes 6-8 servings.
I need a recipe for a cake. It has to have pineapple in it.
This is my grandmother's recipe. I hope you like it!
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.
Mix together cake mix, pineapple and eggs. Stir in coconut.
Pour into pans. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.
Combine topping ingredients and spread over warm cake. Cool in pans on wire racks.
Frost with whipped topping or ice cream.
I need a

Combine first three ingredients in a pot and bring to a boil over medium high heat. Reduce heat and cook to soft ball stage. Remove from heat and stir in tahini and vanilla extract. Chill for one hour before cutting into squares.

In a 3 quart pot over medium-high heat saute garlic and plum tomatoes for 10 minutes or until tender. Add pasta to boiling water and cook according to package directions. Drain and toss with the tomato mixture. Stir in the basil. Garnish with more basil if desired.

Butter a 9x13 baking dish. In a mixing bowl, combine brown sugar, hot water, and butter until mixture is smooth. Add sugar, baking powder, salt, milk, and flourmix well. Spread batter in prepared baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until brown on top and firm in the center. Cool on rack. Serve warm or cold with whipped cream or ice cream.

Puree canned chick-peas in a food processor until smooth. Add tahini, water, lemon juice, olive oil and garlic. Process until smooth. Fold in truffle oil. Serve with warm pita bread or vegetable crudites.

Melt butter and cream cheese together. Add flour and mix well. Add eggs one at a time mixing well after each egg is added. Stir in Kisses, coffee powder, and cocoa. Drop by teaspoon onto wax paper. Chill until firm. Roll in powdered sugar just before serving.

Heat oil in a medium pot over medium-high heat. Cook sausage until browned and broken up. Stir in garlic and cook 1 minute longer. Stir in broths and simmer 10 minutes. Add pasta and tomatoes. Cook 3 more minutes. Stir in spinach and simmer 1 minute longer. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Combine butter and Bisquick in a bowl. Using your fingers, mix until crumbly. Press into bottom and up sides of a 9-inch pie plate. Bake for 15 minutes. Cool completely. Beat together cream cheese and milk. Mix in cranberry sauce. Spread over crust. Spread with apple slices. Drizzle with apple juice. Top with chunks of applesauce. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes.

Mix together flour and baking soda. Add sugar and butter. Beat until smooth. Add eggs and vanilla and beat well. Add sour cream. Spread batter into a greased loaf pan. Mix together the mango and cinnamon and spread over the top. Bake at 350 degrees F for 1 hour. Cool on a wire rack. Makes one loaf.
This is an easy recipe for a simple mango dessert.
1. Combine the mangoes and the sugar in a blender. Puree until smooth. Pour into a bowl. Add the pineapple juice and the lime juice. Stir well. Add the lemon juice and stir. Chill until ready to serve.
2. To serve, pour the mixture into individual bowls. Sprinkle with the toasted coconut.
3. Serve cold or at room temperature.
Mix together flour and baking soda. Add sugar and butter. Beat until smooth. Add eggs and vanilla and beat well. Add sour cream. Spread batter into a greased loaf pan. Mix together the

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a small saucepan, combine 1 cup (250 ml) water and 1 cup (250 ml) blackberries. Cook over medium heat until berries are soft. Add 2 cups (500 ml) granulated sugar, 1/2 cup (125 ml) cornstarch and 2 tsp (10 ml) vanilla extract. Mix well. Pour into a greased 13×9-inch (33×23 cm) baking dish. In a medium bowl, combine 3/4 cup (180 ml) flour, 1 tsp (5 ml) baking powder and 1/2 tsp (2 ml) salt. In a large bowl, cream together 1/2 cup (125 ml) shortening, 1/2 cup (125 ml) butter and 1 egg. Add flour mixturebeat until smooth. Stir in 1 1/2 cups (375 ml)
Pour espresso in a cup or mug. Add milk and stir. Add a splash of Irish cream and a small splash of milk. Add 1-2 teaspoons of sugar (optional).

Chop the onion and garlic and mix with 1 teaspoon of oil and pepper. Arrange in a single layer on a baking sheet and roast in the oven for 25-30 minutes or until charred. Let cool and place in a jar or other container with a lid. Keep in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

Boil sweet potatoes in lightly salted water until tender. In blender container combine orange juice concentrate, butter, brown sugar and nutmeg. Cover. Blend until smooth. Add cooked sweet potatoes. Blend until smooth. Spread in greased 13x9x2-inch baking dish. Bake in preheated 350 degree F oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until bubbly. Sprinkle with dried apricot. Bake 15 minutes more. Let stand for 20 minutes before serving.

In blender combine 2 cups cold water and 1/4 cup sugar. Blend well. Add 2 cups diced watermelon. Blend again well. Strain liquid into another bowl or pitcher. Add 1/2 teaspoon lime juice and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Mix well. Serve cold and chilled with ice cubes. Serves 4.
Cube sweet potatoes into small pieces. In a large bowl, mix all ingredients. Pour into a shallow baking dish. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Stir once during cooking time. Serve.
Pour coffee into a warmed mug. Add irish whisky and stir well. Add cacao. Top with a collar of whipped cream and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 F. Grease and flour two 9" cake pans. Beat together the butter, eggs and sour cream. Add the cake mix and stir until combined. Add the spices and vanilla. Pour into the pans. Bake for 20 to 22 minutes. Let cool. In a bowl, combine the confectioner's sugar with the milk. Add the almond extract and vanilla. Add more milk if necessary. Ice the cakes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cook the chicken breasts according to package directions. Cut them into small pieces. Cut the green chilies into small pieces. In a large bowl combine the chicken, sour cream, soup and chilies. Stir together well. Layer the chicken mixture into the tortillas and roll up. Sprinkle on the cheese. Bake for 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foilspray with cooking spray.In a large bowl toss together the parsnips, sweet potato, apples, oil, honey, soy sauce, salt and pepper until well coatedspread onto the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes, stirring once or twice. Remove from oven and allow to cool for 10 minutes before serving. Serves 4.

Bring 2 cups of the water to a boil. Add the salt and peppercornsremove from the heat. Add the bay leaves and wild ricecover with a tight-fitting lid and let stand for 1 hour. Drain off the water. Heat a large skillet coated with cooking spray over medium heatadd the butter. Add the pecan pieces and the cayenne peppercook until toasted, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the syrup to the skilletcook until the liquid is syrupy. Serve the wild rice topped with the toasted nuts. Serves 4.

Sift the gluten flour and salt into the warm water. Add the sugar and stir to dissolve. Sprinkle the yeast over top and let stand for 10 minutes. Stir the mixture with a wooden spoon until it is smooth and elastic. Lightly oil two 10 x 15 x 1/2 inch jelly roll pans or baking sheets with olive oil. Turn the dough out onto the surface and roll out with your hands to the desired thickness. Place the rolled crusts on the jelly roll pans, cover with plastic wrap or a damp towel and let rise until doubled in bulk, approximately 1 hour. Preheat the oven to 450 f. Punch down the dough to deflate it, brush the crusts with olive oil, and bake until the crust is golden brown (20 - 25 minutes). Remove from the oven, brush with olive oil if desired, and top with sauce and toppings of your choice. Makes 2 12 x 17 inch crusts.

In medium saucepan over medium-high heat, combine splenda and water. Bring to boil and stir until splenda is dissolved. Reduce heat to low, add lime zest, lime juice, ginger, and simmer for 5 minutes to reduce the mixture to 1/4 cup. Transfer to a bowl with honeydew melon. Toss to coat, cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Garnish with lime slice or sprig if desired.
Cool off with these delicious summer recipes using the sweet taste of honeydew melon!
Spread each side of an english muffin with 1 tablespoon pesto. Top with sliced tomato and shredded mozzarella cheese. Broil until the cheese melts. Serve immediately.

Heat a frying pan over medium high heat. Brush margarine on one side of each of three slices of bread. Place a slice of bread in pan. Top with a layer of cheese. Place a second slice of bread on top of cheese, buttered side up. Fry sandwich until lightly browned on bottom, about 1 minute. Remove from pan and repeat with remaining sandwiches. Serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour two 8×4 inch pans. Sift together the flour and baking soda. Mix the brown sugar and treacle. Cream together the butter and sugar until smooth. Beat in the egg and the milk. Fold in the flour mixture. Fold in the oatmeal and spices. Pour into the prepared pans. Bake in the preheated oven until the top is golden and the toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, about 30 minutes. Cool in the pans for 10 minutes before turning out onto wire racks to cool completely.
Making your own granola is easy and inexpensive. This is my recipe for gluten free granola. I have made several variations of this recipe. The basic granola can be used in my recipe for oatmeal. You can also use it in yogurt or on fruit. This is a great way to get protein and fiber into your diet.
Pour the oats into a large bowl and mix in

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dishset aside. In a large bowl, combine frozen corn kernels with 3 cups whole milkset aside. In another bowl, combine 1 cup whipping cream with 1/2 cup granulated sugarbeat well with an electric mixer until thickened. In a separate bowl, combine 1 egg with 1/4 cup all-purpose flour, 1 tablespoon baking powder and 1/4 teaspoon saltmix well. Gently fold egg mixture into the whipping cream mixture. Add the frozen corn mixture to the egg mixturestir until blended. Pour mixture into prepared baking dishbake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven.
corn pudding recipescorn pudding recipescorn pudding recipescorn pudding recipescorn pudding recipescorn pudding recipescorn pudding recipescorn pudding recipescorn pud

Preheat oven to 350f. Mash bananas with a fork. Add applesauce, egg white, vanilla extract and peanut butter. Beat for 1 minute. Mix dry ingredients together. Add to banana mixture. Stir until combined. Spray a 9 x 5 inch loaf pan with cooking spray. Pour mixture into pan and bake for 50 minutes.

Place the cabbage and carrot in a large bowl. Add the mayonnaise, honey, chili and lime juice and season with salt. Stir well and allow to marinate for 20 minutes. Add the onions and cilantro and toss well. Serve in lettuce cups.

In a large bowl, combine pineapple, cranberry sauce, and cool whip. Add orange zest. Chill until partially set. Garnish with a dollop of whipped cream and a sprinkle of pecans. Serve on a lettuce leaf.

Wash and stem elderberries. Remove all stems and any green berries. Wash again. Measure 1 cup of elderberries and pulverize them with 1/4 cup of water in blender or food processor. Strain through cheesecloth, squeezing well to remove any liquid left behind. Measure 6 cups of water and place it in a large pot over high heat with elderberry liquid and stir well. Add 1 cup of sugar and 2 lemons (peels and all). Simmer for 5 minutes until liquid is reduced by 1/4. Add 2 1/4 cups fruit pectin and stir well. Bring back up to a full rolling boil and stir constantly for 1 minute. Remove from heat and skim off foam with metal spoon. Pour into hot sterile jars and seal. Process jars for 10 minutes in boiling water bath. Makes 16 half-pints.

Place 1/3 cup of corn flakes on plate. Put egg on plate on top of corn flakes. Dip each strip of chicken into egg mixture and roll in corn flakes. Heat oil over med-high heat in pan. Fry tenders about 3 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Place on paper towel to drain. Serve with mustard sauce.
Combine cream cheese and cucumber in a small mixing bowl. Add chives and fresh mint. Season to taste with salt and black pepper. Makes 12 slices.

Heat oil and saute onion and garlic till onion is translucent. Add tomato and saute till tomato breaks down and oil is released. Add water and bring to a boil and lower heat and simmer for 30 minutes or until pasta is cooked al dente. Add soy sauce, basil and pasta and heat for a few minutes. Garnish with parsley and serve with crusty bread and a nice green salad.

Combine Sour Cream & Chives Potato Mix and ground beef in a large bowl, mix well with fork. Pour into a 2-quart casserole sprayed with cooking spray. Top with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until heated through. Garnish with green onions.

Mix all dry ingredients in a bowl, then add 1 cup 7-up soda and sour cream. Let stand for 10 minutes. Drop by spoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375 for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Yield: 36

Dip breasts in flour and fry in butter until golden brown. Put breasts in a 1 1/2-quart casserole. In a small bowl combine soup, milk and ground ginger. Pour over chicken. Bake uncovered in a 375 degree oven for 40-45 minutes. Serve over rice or noodles.

Preheat oven to 180 degrees celsius grease a 20 cm deep round cake tin or 2 x 15 cm square cake tins. Sift together the flour and baking powder into a bowl and set aside. Cream together the butter and sugar for about 4 minutes until pale and creamy. Beat in eggs one at a time until just combined and then stir in the lemon juice and rind. Fold through the flour mixture until just combined and then stir in the milk. Spoon into prepared cake tin or tins and smooth out the top with a spatula. Bake for 40 minutes for a round cake and 30 minutes for a square cake or until golden brown and cooked through when tested with a skewer or until a skewer comes out clean from the center of the square cakes. Remove from oven and allow to cool for 10 minutes then turn out onto a wire rack and allow to completely cool before icing or decorating with fruit and icing sugar if desired. To make the syrup, place all of the ingredients in a small saucepan and bring to a

Heat olive oil over medium heat in a heavy pot. Add garlic and saute until lightly golden but not dark or burnt. Add tomatoes and let them simmer until soft and cooked through. Season with salt and pepper to taste and add fresh basil at the end and stir well.

Cook garlic in olive oil until lightly browned. Add tomato sauce. Add wine. Add half-and-half. Bring to a simmer. Add sun-dried tomato. Simmer for 3 minutes. Season to taste. Add penne. Toss until well coated. Top with basil. Sprinkle with parmesan.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spread pineapple with juice evenly in baking dish. Spread pie filling over pineapple. Combine cake mix and melted butterspread over top of filling. Bake for 45 minutes or until set. Meanwhile combine coconut and pecans for topping. Sprinkle over cake while warm.

Preheat oven to 180C/350F. Beat together the butter and caster sugar until light and creamy. Add the egg and vanilla and beat until combined. Sift the flour and fold into the mixture. Stir through the sultanas and the crushed cornflakes. Chill for 30 minutes. Roll into 1 inch balls and place on the prepared tray. Flatten to 2cm thickness. Bake for 15-20 minutes until set. Cool on the tray for 5 minutes. Transfer to wire racks to cool completely. Melt the milk chocolate melts and white chocolate chips according to the package instructions. Dip half of each cookie into the melted chocolate and place on the wire rack to set.
Name: peanut butter cookies with cornflakesIngredients: flour, peanut butter, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla extract, baking powder and saltPreparation: Cream peanut butter and butter together until smooth. Add the sugars and beat until creamy. Add the

Melt together the first four ingredients. Stir in the rest. Drop by teaspoons on waxed paper. Chill.
name: healthier no bake chocolate oatmeal cookiesingredients: sugar, cocoa, milk, salt, peanut butter, butter, vanilla extract, rolled oatspreparation: Mix sugar, cocoa, milk and salt in saucepan. Boil for one minute. Add peanut butter, butter, and vanilla to hot mixture. Stir until combined. Stir in oats thoroughly and drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper. Cool thoroughly before removing from paper.
name: west virginia skillet cookiesingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, dates, vanilla, rice krispies, pecans, shredded coconutpreparation: In a large saucepan over low heat melt butter. Add sugar, eggs and dates. Stir constantly until sugar is dissolved and mixture is thick. Remove from heat, stir in vanilla. Add rice krispies and nuts. Shape into small balls and roll

Soak dried butter beans overnight in a large bowl of water. Drain the butter beans and place them in a large pot of water. Add 2 tbsp of salt to the water to soften the skins of the butter beans. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until the butter beans are soft, about 2 1/2 hours. Drain the butter beans in a colander. Drain the cooking liquid into a bowl through a fine mesh strainer (you can reserve the cooking liquid for soup stock later), and set aside the cooking liquid to cool. Discard the solids from the strainer. Add the cooked butter beans to a food processor or blender. Add the rest of the ingredients to the butter beans and process until the mixture is smooth. Taste, and adjust seasoning to taste with additional salt and/or cayenne if needed. Transfer the hummus to a bowl, cover, and refrigerate until serving.

Sprinkle vegetables with italian dressing. Grill 6 to 8 minutes or until tender. Top with parmesan cheese and serve.
name: zucchini delightingredients: condensed tomato soup, lemon juice, sugar, garlic cloves, salt, zucchini, onion, bell pepper, mushroom, parmesan cheesepreparation:Combine soup, lemon juice, sugar, garlic and salt in large saucepan. Mix well. Add zucchini, onion, bell pepper and mushrooms. Mix well. Bring to a boil, reduce heat. Cover and cook 20 - 25 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender, stirring occasionally. Sprinkle with cheese.
name: zucchini medleyingredients: zucchini, mushroom, green pepper, onion, olive oil, garlic, salt and pepper, fresh parsley, tomato saucepreparation:Heat oil in a large fry pan, add the vegetables and garlic, salt and pepper

Mix honey, soy sauce and mustard in a small bowl. Spread honey sauce on both sides of each of the lamb chops and place in a plastic bag. Marinate in refrigerator 2 to 4 hours or overnight. Heat grill to medium high heat. Place meat on grill and turn once. Baste occasionally with sauce and cook until desired doneness. Serve warm

In a large saucepan bring the water to boil. Add the macaroni and cook until tender and drain well. In a medium bowl combine the cheese, eggs and milk. In a small saucepan over low heat combine the flour and paprika with the milk, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens and boils. Remove from the heat and add the egg mixture and mix well. Stir the cheese mixture into the saucepan and cook over medium heat until the sauce thickens and coats the back of a spoon, stirring constantly. Add the macaroni and stir until the macaroni is coated. Serves 8.

Cook bacon until crisp. Remove from pan. Crumble and set aside. Add onion and garlic to bacon drippings. Cook and stir for a few minutes. Add remaining ingredients, except for the reserved crumbled bacon. Cook and stir until hot. Serve over rice. Top with reserved bacon.

In a heavy pot over medium heat, melt butter and saute carrots and onion for 5 minutes or until softened but not browned. Add stock and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Add juice, lemon juice, and hot pepper sauce, and season to taste with salt and pepper. Allow mixture to simmer for 5 minutes more. Puree soup in blender. Add yogurt and reheat gently but do not boil. Serve with mint sprigs.

Boil sweet potatoes in enough water to cover. Drain when tender. Mash well. In a large bowl cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time then add the flour and vanilla. Mix well. Stir in the condensed milk and mashed sweet potatoes. Spread in a well greased 13 x 9 pan. Bake at 350 F for 30 minutes or until lightly browned. Sprinkle with nuts and drizzle with caramel topping if desired.

Mix pancake mix, water and cheese. Add jalapeno to taste. Pour onto hot griddle. Cook until bubbles form on the top. Turn and continue cooking on the other side. Flip back and forth until cooked through. Top with ranch salad dressing.

Sprinkle the chops with garlic powder and salt and pepper. Heat the oil in a large pan and brown the chops on both sides. Drain off the fat and pour in the white wine. Cook 1 minute and add the cinnamon and nutmeg. Simmer uncovered for 3 to 4 minutes. Pour in the applesauce. Heat through. Serve with noodles or rice.

Wash asparagus, trim off ends of stalks. Cut them into 1 inch pieces and place them in a double boiler with 1/2 cup boiling water and cover. Cook until tender, about 10 minutes drain and set aside. Blend flour with milk and bring to a boil. Add asparagus, salt and pepper to taste. Pour over toast. Sprinkle with parsley.

In a small bowl combine flour with salt and pepper. In another bowl add butter and heat over low heat until melted. Dip each scallop in flour then butter. Fry in a nonstick skillet until golden on each side. Serve with parsley sprinkled on top and a wedge of lemon for garnish.
Combine all of the icing ingredients in a bowl. Beat on high until thick and fluffy, about 3-4 minutes. Use immediately or refrigerate for later use.

Preheat oven to 350. Saute zucchini in butter in large nonstick skillet over medium heat until crisp-tender. Add spinach, cook 1 minute. Drain well. Cool 5 minutes. Combine ricotta and corn in small bowl. Beat in egg. Add zucchini mixture. Spoon into pastry shell. Sprinkle with feta and breadcrumbs. Bake until pastry is golden brown and filling is set.

Wash and trim the mushrooms. Slice the bok choy. In a nonstick skillet over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the garlic. Cook until tender. Stir in the mushrooms. Season to taste. Add the bok choy. Stir-fry until tender. Add the chicken broth. Stir until the bok choy is coated. Serve immediately.

Place 2 small red potatoes into a microwave safe bowl and pour a bit of olive oil over them. Sprinkle a few crushed garlic cloves over the top and microwave for 10 minutes or so. I dont use a microwave so i dont know exactly how long you should nuke them for. The olive oil will keep the potatoes moist. I also add some fresh herbs like basil or oregano to the oil. Its very simple to make. You can also add in a bit of italian seasoning if youd like. You can also cook them in the oven instead. Just wrap them in a bit of aluminum foil to keep them moist.

Combine sugar and corn syrup in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Bring mixture to a rolling boil and boil for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in half-and-half and vanilla. Let cool for 20 minutes. Add salt and creammix well. Pour mixture into an 8x8 inch pan lined with wax paper. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Cut into 1-inch squaresstore in an airtight container. Makes 3 dozen.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Season the mahi mahi with the lemon juice. In a bowl combine the olive oil, breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, dill weed, rosemary and pepper. Dip the fish in this mixture and place on a baking sheet. Bake for 15-20 minutes. Serve warm.
 chicken fried fishingredients: corn meal, flour, fish, eggs, oil for fryingpreparation:Mix corn meal and flour in a paper bag. Add fish. Add 2 eggs. Shake until all pieces are covered. Heat oil in frying pan. Place fish in hot oil. Fry for 5 minutes. Cook until golden brown on all sides. Drain on paper towels. Serve with tartar sauce.

In a large pot over medium heat combine the mussels and 1/4 cup of water. Steam 4 minutes. Remove pot from heat. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add the onion, red bell pepper, green bell pepper, and olive oil. Cook until vegetables are softened. Add the mussel stock and remaining water. Cook 1 minute. Add the mussels to the skillet. Cook another 4 minutes. Remove the pot from heat. Add the lemon juice, salt and pepper. Toss to mix. Serve over fettucine or other pasta.

Mix egg and milk. Dip each side of bread in egg mixture. Melt 2 tablespoons of butter in skillet over medium heat. Place bread slices into skillet and cook for 3 minutes per side or until lightly browned. Sprinkle with powdered sugar and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl, combine all ingredients. Shape into a loaf and place in a greased loaf pan. Bake for an hour, basting every 15 minutes or so.
I really love that first one. I like the fact that it looks like a meatloaf but with all the other stuff in it. I have the same problem when I'm making meatloaves. I usually end up adding so much extra stuff that it's really not even a meatloaf anymore.
I'm thinking we need more ideas for this one. We've got a long way to go before we have enough recipes to make a good collection. I'm going to have to keep this one in mind when I'm trying to come up with ideas for some of my other recipe categories.
I'm with you! I've always thought there was some sort of rule that said the meat had to be the star of the dish. It's kind of like the one that says there can only be one main dish per meal.
We're getting a little more variety now but we're still in

Soak cashews in water for 1 hour. Drain and blend with tahini, agave nectar and vanilla extract until smooth. Place mixture in a bowl and refrigerate for about 30 minutes. Scoop into balls about the size of a walnut and roll in sesame seeds. Roll balls in a bowl of hemp seeds for a slightly different texture. Store in refrigerator.

Bring water to a boil in saucepan or dutch oven over high heat. Peel the potatoes and cut them into large pieces. Add them to the boiling water and cook for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain them thoroughly and put them back into the pot over low heat. Mash them gently with the cream cheese, sour cream and butter. Season them with the seasoned salt and the pepper and add the fresh chives. Let the mixture cool until it is warm enough to serve but not piping hot.

Drain the artichokes and put them in a food processor. Process until almost pureed but with some texture. Add the chopped spinach and the rest of the ingredients and process until smooth. Pour into a 9 x 13 casserole dish or individual serving dishes. Sprinkle with parsley and serve with crackers or vegetables.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 9x13 baking pan with cooking spray. Arrange the tater tots in the pan. Sprinkle with green onions. Crumble bacon and sprinkle over the green onions. Cook the broccoli according to package directions. Stir the soups and sour cream together. Drain the broccoli well and combine with the soups mixture. Pour over the bacon and tater tots. Sprinkle the cheese over all. Bake for 30 minutes or until hot and bubbly.

Preheat oven to 350f. For sauce combine soup, mayo, lemon juice and curry powder in a bowl. In bottom of 13x9x2-inch baking dish layer frozen broccoli, chicken and sauce. Sprinkle with grated cheese and breadcrumbs. Bake for 30 minutes. Can be eaten plain or on top of rice.
