Cook the rice with the milk and sugar until it becomes thick. Pour into baking dish and let cool for about 15 minutes or until it is cool enough to handle with your hands without getting burned. Beat the eggs well, add the vanilla, sugar and raisins. Add the egg mixture to the rice mixture and add the spices. Bake at 350 degrees for about 35 minutes or until set.

Rub the potatoes with olive oil. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake for 1 hour at 350f or until done. Top with fresh chives and the seasonings of your choice. We tried taco seasoning, creole seasoning, and barbecue seasoning. I think the barbecue was the best.

Slice onion into thin strips. Chop green peppers into small pieces. Grind garlic into fine paste. Heat oil in a big pot. Add onion, green peppers, garlic paste and stir fry until it becomes light brown in color. Add red beans, water. Bring to boil. Add turkey. Reduce heat. Simmer until beans are cooked. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve with hot rice.
Soups are made of water and flavored with a variety of foods. The water is either a simple broth of water and meat, but can include any type of cooking liquid. There are two main types of soupsbroth based and cream based. Broth based soups are generally considered to be healthier than cream based soups. Soups can also have various thicknesses. Common thickening agents for soups include rice, grains, breads, fruits, pulses, and vegetables.
Soup can be served hot or cold. Soup was commonly served with the meal. In modern times, soups are generally served before the meal as a starter course. Soups are

Crumble the streaky bacon into a bowl. Cut the chicken breasts into 2cm cubes. Place them in a large bowl with the bacon, chives, thyme, sage, rosemary, pepper and parmesan. Mix well. Roll the mixture into 12 sausages, about 20g each, then press them into sausage shapes with a sausage maker or by hand if you don t have one.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Coat a large baking sheet with cooking spray. Place a large piece of foil on a work surface. In a small saucepan, melt the butter with the molasses. Let cool for 20 minutes. In a small bowl, combine 1 cup of the molasses mixture with the pepper and the juice of 1 lemon. Season the turkey with the remaining molasses mixture and the remaining 1 tablespoon pepper. Roll the turkey in the bacon, placing 2 or 3 strips around each breast. Arrange the filets on the baking sheet. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes, until the bacon is crisp. Remove from the oven and let stand for 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

Saute onion, celery and green bell pepper in oil. Add zucchini and cook for one minute. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds longer. Stir in tomatoes and cook for 15 minutes. Stir in tomato sauce, chili beans and seasoning and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Makes 5 servings.

Slice baguettes into 2-inch pieces. In a shallow bowl, whisk together eggs and milk. Dip bread in egg mixture, turning once to coat both sides evenly. In a separate shallow bowl, combine cinnamon and sugar. Dip coated bread into cinnamon-sugar mixture. In a skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add bread in batches and cook until golden brown, about 2 minutes per side. Remove from skilletset aside. In another skillet over medium-high heat, melt butter. Add applescook for 2 minutes or until tender. Add cheddartoss until cheese is melted. Add ciderstir until mixture comes to a boil. Return bread to skilletpour cider mixture over bread. Garnish with walnut pieces.

Combine water, sugar, soy sauce, and lime juice in small bowl or food processor. Blend well. Stir in chili pepper. Add more water if necessary to thin the sauce to a dipping consistency. Use immediately or refrigerate until ready to use. This sauce keeps for 3-4 days when stored properly.
Cook broccoli in broth according to package directions. Stir in couscous, seasoning, and water, cover and simmer until tender. Serve hot.
In a glass jug combine the hot water, mango nectar, lime juice, and tea bags. Steep for at least three minutes. Strain into a glass over crushed ice. Serve with a straw.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Cut each baking potato in half lengthwise and scoop out the pulp, leaving about a 1/4 inch thick shell. Mash the pulp with a fork and set aside. In a large skillet, brown the beef and drain off any excess fat. Stir in the onion powder, garlic salt, and beef brothbring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Stir the beef mixture into the mashed potato pulp, then season with the salt and pepper. Fill the hollow of each baking potato half with the mixture, then top each with a tablespoon of the shredded cheese. Bake until the tops are golden brown and the potato shells are fork-tender, about 45 minutes to 1 hour.

Cut chicken breasts into small cubes. Melt 3 tablespoons butter in a heavy saucepan. Add chicken and saute over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add the onion and saute 5 minutes more. Add the mushrooms and 1/2 teaspoon of the salt. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Add the water and sherry and simmer until the chicken is tender. Add the remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt and the paprika. Remove from heat and stir in the flour. Add the sour cream and mix well. Serve over pasta or rice.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the pasta and cook according to package directions until al dentedrain and keep warm. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the asparagus and cook until crisp-tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and set aside. Heat the remaining oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the shallot and cook until lightly browned, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the wine and cook until almost evaporated, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the chicken broth, the asparagus and 1/3 cup tarragon and cook until reduced to 1/4 cup, 1 to 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and add the salmon and remaining tarragon and stir to combine. Toss with the pasta and serve immediately.
Name: Chicken & Pasta Salad
Servings: 8Prep time: 10 minsCook time: 0 minsReady in: 10 mins.
2 cups cooked

Sift together flour, salt and baking soda. In another bowl cream the butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Blend in the flour mixture until crumbly. Stir in the oats and coconut. In a small bowl, combine the egg and vanilla. Add to the crumbly mixture and stir just until moistened. Drop by teaspoons onto wax paper-lined baking sheets. Bake at 350f for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned around the edges. Cool on baking sheets for 2 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely. Yields about 4 dozen.
Dice red onion and plum tomatoes. Drain canned corn. Combine all in a large bowl. Pour dressing over and toss to combine. Add freshly ground pepper to taste.

Heat the olive oil over a low-medium heat. Add the anchovies and garlic and cook until the garlic starts to brown. Add the diced tomatoes and herbs and cook for about 30 minutes. Add the salt and pepper and stir to combine. Add the tuna and cook for a further 5 minutes. Add the cooked pasta and toss to combine. Serve immediately.
Pour all ingredients (except for pineapple and orange slices) into a blender. Blend until smooth. Pour over ice in a highball glass and garnish with the pineapple and orange slices.

In 9x13 baking dish, melt margarine in skillet over medium heat. Add onion and green peppercook until onion is clear. Remove from heatstir in soup and milkpour into baking dish. Top with ham slices. Bake in 350 oven 25 min. In saucepan, mix together mustard and milkpour over casserole. Bake 5 min more. Top with chopped parsley before serving.
 cheddar apple ham sandwichingredients: light mayonnaise, mustard, liquid honey, multi-grain bread, cheddar cheese, ham, applepreparation:In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise, mustard and honey. Spread on one side of each slice of bread. Layer cheese on 4 bread slices. Top each with 2 slices of ham, apple slices and remaining bread. Cut sandwiches in half. Use any apple slices left to garnish.

Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat, add onion and cook for 5 minutes or until softened. Add garlic, spices, and cook for 30 seconds, stirring. Add sausages and cook for 2 minutes or until heated through, stirring frequently. Add sultanas, apples and coconut milk. Bring to the boil over medium-high heat. Simmer for 15 minutes or until sauce thickens. Serve over rice or pasta with coriander leaves.

Mix all ingredients together by hand or in mixer. Drop by teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheet or baking pan. Bake 20 minutes at 400 degrees or until lightly browned. Let cool before removing from pan. Makes 4 dozen.
Recipe: Coffee Cake
 coffee cakeingredients: butter, sugar, milk, eggs, coffee, baking powder, flour, raisins, nutspreparation:Cream butter with sugar and then add milk and eggs. Then add the coffee. Sift together the baking powder, flour and nuts. Add to the creamed mixture. Add raisins last and stir together quickly. Pour into a greased 9x13 inch pan. Bake in a 350 oven for 40 to 50 minutes or until lightly browned on top. Cool and dust with powdered sugar.

Melt butter in a large soup pot. Saut the leeks, onion, and potato. Sprinkle with some salt. Add beef stock. Bring to a boil. Lower the heat. Simmer for 30 minutes. Puree the potato-leek-onion mixture with the half-and-half cream. Stir. Season with white pepper and marjoram.

In large saucepan over medium heat, cook bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Discard all but 1 tablespoon drippings. Add onion to drippings. Cook and stir until tender. Stir in broccoli. Cook until crisp-tender. In blender container or food processor bowl, place half-and-half. Coverblend until smooth. Combine half-and-half mixture with cooked vegetables. Cook over medium heat until heated through. Makes 6 servings.

In a large skillet or wok heat oil over medium heat. Add the chicken and saute until no longer pink. Remove from the pan and set aside. Add the pineapple juice. Cook and stir until mixture is thickened. Add the soy sauce, brown sugar and green onion. Return the chicken to the skillet. Stir to coat evenly. Cook a minute longer. Serve with rice. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds if desired.

Sift together dry ingredients. Mix together liquid ingredients. Stir together dry and liquid until well mixed. Spray a 9 x 12 pan with cooking spray. Pour into pan. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes. Let cool completely. Ice with chocolate icing.

Season the chicken breast on both sides with salt and pepper. Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the bacon, cook until lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Add the chicken. Cook until the bacon is just crisp, about 3 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate. Add the garlic to the skillet, stirring until it is golden. Add the lemon juice and wine. Stir to scrape up the browned bits in the skillet. Add the stock. Bring to a boil. Return the chicken to the skillet. Reduce the heat to low. Cover. Simmer until the chicken is cooked through, about 5 minutes. Remove the chicken to a platter. Keep warm. Add the olives and tarragon. Simmer until the sauce thickens slightly, about 1 minute. Serve the chicken topped with the sauce.

Combine fruit and juice in large serving bowl. Let stand 15 minutes or until fruit is tender. Drain fruit in colander. Rinse and return fruit to bowl. Combine remaining ingredients in small bowl. Pour dressing over fruit. Toss gently. Serve immediately.

Preheat broiler. Grease a broiler pan. Spread 2 tablespoons pesto on each side of each fish slice. Sprinkle each piece lightly with salt and pepper. Place fish on broiler pan. Broil 2 inches from heat about 6 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Sprinkle fish with remaining 2 tablespoons pesto. Serve warm.

Place all the ingredients into a large saucepan and bring to the boil over medium heat. Reduce the heat and simmer gently until the chutney has a jam-like consistency and there is no excess liquid on the surface. Stir from time to time to prevent sticking. Spoon into hot sterilized jars and seal down. Label and store for 6-8 weeks before use.

Preheat oven to 350f. In large bowl cream butter until very light. Gradually beat in sugar and then egg and egg yolks. Dissolve vanilla in hot water. Cool to lukewarm. Combine with mixture and beat until light and fluffy. In small bowl sieve together flour and baking powder. Add gradually to mixture and blend well. Spoon into greased and floured muffin tins or 2 8-inch round layer cakes. Bake 15 to 20 minutes until light brown and center springs back to touch. Cool in pan 10 minutes and remove to cool on rack. When cool frost with white frosting made by mixing 1 1/2 cup powdered sugar and 2 teaspoons milk until smooth and spreadable. Yield: 3 dozen muffins or 2 8-inch round layer cakes.

In a large bowl combine pasta, celery, onions, dill, tuna, peas and 2 tablespoons mayonnaise. Add 1/2 cup mayonnaise to a small bowl. Add cider vinegar and pepper. Toss pasta mixture in mayonnaise mixture. Chill before serving.
1. Mix all ingredients together. Refrigerate for 24 hours.
2. Add 2 slices of bread to each serving.
3. Spread with 1/4 cup Tuna Salad.
4. Top with 1/4 cup chopped celery.
5. Top with 1/4 cup chopped dill pickle.
6. Add lettuce and tomato as desired.
7. Garnish with additional dill pickle.

Heat oven to 425. Coat a cookie sheet with nonstick spray. Place 4 flour tortillas on the cookie sheet. Sprinkle one-quarter of the chorizo over each. Sprinkle evenly with half the cheese. Top each with half of the scallions. Spoon an equal amount of plum tomato over each. Sprinkle evenly with white onion. Sprinkle each with a dash of cilantro and salt. Top each with a tortilla. Lightly coat both sides of the top tortillas with nonstick spray. Bake 6 minutes. Then turn over and bake 6 minutes more until lightly browned and crisp. Cut into wedges. Serve warm.

In a saucepan add water and tomatoes and bring to boil. Simmer for 20 minutes or until tomatoes are softened and sauce has thickened. Drain and cool. In a bowl combine sauce, lemon juice, garlic salt and pepper. Add fish and pine nuts and toss to coat. Refrigerate until serving time. Heat oil in skillet and cook fish until done. Serve fish over rice or pasta.

Cut corn from cobs. Combine all other ingredients in saucepan and bring to a boil. Pour over corn and mix well. Spoon into bags or freezer containers and freeze. To reheat, defrost and warm on stove or in microwave.

Heat olive oil and cook chorizo and peppers for about 5 minutes until chorizo is browned and peppers are softened. Add wine and simmer until the liquid is reduced by half and the peppers have begun to brown. Season with salt and pepper to taste and remove from heat. Heat a griddle pan to medium-high heat and grill the bread on both sides until the bread is lightly toasted. Pile chorizo mixture and shrimp onto the bread. Serve immediately.

Slice the mushrooms into quarters. Melt the butter over medium heat. When the butter begins to foam, add the sliced mushrooms and saut until they are tender and light brown. Sprinkle with a little salt and pepper and remove from heat. Whisk the flour into the hot fat until the mixture is smooth. Gradually add the chicken stock, whisking all the while, until the mixture is smooth. Bring to a boil over high heat, then turn off the heat. Whisk in the cognac, then the heavy cream, working quickly so the mixture does not curdle. Taste for seasoning and add more salt or pepper as needed. Garnish with a few minced parsley sprigs if desired.

Boil water. In large bowl, mix dry ingredients. Stir in hot water. Stir in oil and egg. Combine well. Form into a hot dog bun or a pattie. Fry until golden brown in hot oil. Serve with mustard or chili sauce.

Cook macaroni in boiling water for 10 minutes. Drain. Beat eggs in large bowl with milk. Add cooked macaroni, meat, onion, and pizza saucemix well. Add mushrooms, pepperoni slices, mexican cheesemix well. Spoon mixture into greased 9 inch pie plate. Bake in 375 degree oven for 30 minutes or until golden brown.

Combine cereal and peanut butter in a bowl. In a saucepan, combine the water and corn syrup. Bring to a boil. Pour the syrup mixture over the cereal mixture and stir to coat. Spread the mixture on a cookie sheet lined with wax paper. Refrigerate until firm. Drizzle the chocolate syrup on top of the mixture. Serve cold.

Drain artichokes and combine with oil and garlic. Cook over low heat 5 minutes or until tender. Cool slightly and chop fine. Combine with eggs and breadcrumbs. Add cheese and form into 1" balls. Roll into remaining breadcrumbs and refrigerate overnight.

Bring the water to a boil in medium saucepan over high heat. Add the white sugar and stir until the sugar is completely dissolved (about 3-4 minutes). Remove the pot from the heat and let it sit for about 2 minutes. Add the cocoa powder and stir until no lumps remain. Return the pot to the stove over medium heat and stir in the butter until it is completely melted and incorporated into the mixture. Add the eggs one at a time while constantly stirring the mixture with a wire whisk. Do not stop stirring until the mixture begins to thicken (about 10 minutes). Pour the mixture into an 8 inch by 8 inch glass baking dish or square ceramic dish. Bake for 20 minutes or until the edges of the fudge are set but the middle is still soft (it will be runny). Once it is baked remove the fudge from the oven and let it cool completely before cutting into squares. Serve chilled or at room temperature.
Cook rice until tender in milk with sugar and salt. Add eggs, beat until smooth. Heat slowly until mixture thickens, stirring constantly. Add vanilla, serve hot or cold with whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spread frozen potatoes into a 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with onion, cheese, Worcestershire sauce, red peppers, breadcrumbs, and black pepper. Bake for 20 minutes, or until heated through and bubbly.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add pasta and broccoli florets and cook until al dente. Drain and rinse with cold water to stop cooking. In a large bowl, combine cooked pasta with the remaining ingredients and toss to mix well. Let cool in the refrigerator for about 3 hours to allow the flavors to blend. Serve chilled.
In a large pitcher combine all ingredients except for midori and sweet-and-sour mix. Add midori and sweet-and-sour mix, stir. Refrigerate until chilled. Serve in iced glasses.
Place the vegetables in a small bowl. Mix together the remaining ingredients and brush the mixture over the pork. Grill over a medium heat until cooked through. Serve with a salad.

Heat oil and butter over medium heat. Add onion and saute until lightly browned. Add rice and cook 1-2 minutes. Add chicken stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 25 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in lemon juice and zest. Serve.

Combine cracker crumbs, parmesan cheese, and seasoned salt. Dip chicken into melted butter. Roll into cracker mixture. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes.
Boneless skinless chicken breasts, bread crumbs, dried parsley, salt, paprika, lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, crushed tomato.
Boneless skinless chicken breasts, bread crumbs, melted butter.
Boneless skinless chicken breasts, bread crumbs.
Boneless skinless chicken breast halves, butter, cracker crumbs.
Boil potato in milk. Mash and add cornstarch. Make into patties and dip in milk and then in breadcrumbs. Fry in hot oil.

In a heavy bottomed pan combine the sugar, vanilla pods, and water and bring to boil. Stir constantly until the sugar dissolves. Add the fresh figs and simmer for about 20 minutes, stirring often, until the figs are soft. Add the Limoncello, stir well and remove from the heat.

Place blueberries and water in pot over medium heat. Boil for five minutes. Blend using an immersion blender. Strain through a fine mesh strainer, pushing down on the fruit to get all the liquid out. Return the mixture to the pot over medium heat and add the apple juice and potato flour. Stir constantly until the mixture thickens and returns to a simmer. Remove from the heat and add the vanilla and sugar. Serve warm.

Grease a 9 by 13 pan and line with parchment paper. Beat together sugar and oil. Add eggs one at a time. Add pumpkin, mix until combined. Pour batter into pan and bake for 20 minutes. Cool completely. For frosting, combine cake mix and frosting. Spread frosting on cooled bars. Crush graham crackers and sprinkle over bars. Drizzle with melted butter. Cut into bars and serve.

Preheat oven to 375f. Grease a 9 inch square or round pan. In a large bowl, beat eggs, granulated sugar, milk, butter and vanilla until well blended. Add flour, salt and baking powder. Blend well. Stir in the berries. Pour into prepared pan and bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from the oven and cool for 10 minutes in the pan on a wire rack. Cut into 12 squares. Makes 12 servings.

Mix together the chocolate milk, cocoa, and sugar until completely combined. Heat the mixture in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir frequently. When the mixture comes to a boil, remove from the heat and stir in the vanilla and chocolate chunks.

Brown ground beef in a skillet with onions. Drain fat from skillet. Put in crockpot. Drain pork and beans. Put in crockpot along with tomato soup. Add butter beans. Stir in ground meat and onions. Add brown sugar. Cook on low for 6 to 7 hours. Serve with a dash of vinegar.

In a large saucepan, cover the potatoes with cold waterbring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer until the potatoes are tender when pierced with a knife, 12 to 15 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, heat the butter over medium heat until melted and the foam subsidesadd the garlic. Cook for 30 secondsdo not brown. When the potatoes are done cooking, drain them and add the lemon rindtoss to coat. Pour the hot garlic butter over the potatoestoss to blend well. Season to taste with the salt and pepper. Sprinkle the chervil evenly over the toptoss gently to blend. Serve immediately.

Combine the flour, sugar, baking soda and salt. Cut in the oil and egg until the mixture forms a soft dough. Divide the dough in half and wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 15 minutes. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Roll the dough out on a floured surface and cut into 10 circles. Place 1 teaspoon of filling in the center of each circle. Fold up and press the edges together. Place on a greased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Makes about 10 rolls.

Rub the spices over the pork and place in a plastic bag and refrigerate 12 hours. Heat the oil in a large heavy based pan and brown the pork quickly on all sides. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add the lemons and seasoning and cook for a few minutes. Add 150ml water and simmer for 10 minutes. Serve the pork with the sauce and lemon wedges.

In saucepan, combine sugar, butter and corn syrup. Cook over medium heat until boiling. Boil for 5 minutes without stirring. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and baking soda. Pour over popped corn. Store in airtight container.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Place lavender flowers in a small bowl and cover with hot water. Let stand 10 minutesstrain. In a large bowl, with an electric mixer, cream together the butter and sugar until fluffy and light. Add the egg and lavender extract and beat until combined. In another bowl, sift together the flour and baking powder and add to the creamed mixture with the lavender-infused water. Mix until just combined and roll the dough into 1-inch balls. Place on parchment paper-lined baking sheets and bake for 10 minutes or until the tops are golden brown and the bottoms are firm. Let cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes and then move to wire racks to cool completely. Dust with more lavender or confectioners' sugar.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Beat together eggs. Add soup mix. Add water. Stir well. Add meat. Add next 4 ingredients. Pour mixture into a lightly greased 9x5x3 loaf pan. Bake uncovered for 1 hour. Remove from oven. Pour ketchup over top. Bake an additional 25 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before cutting.

In a large saucepan, saute chopped onion and garlic in butter until tender. Stir in tomatoes and bring to a boil. Stir in coconut milk and parsley. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in beans and chili peppers. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in potato flakes and lemon juice. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in a heavy saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute until tender. Add the eggplant, cooking until tender. Stir in the tomatoes. Add the broth. Bring to a boil. Add the ravioli. Reduce the heat. Simmer for 5 minutes or until the ravioli are tender. Sprinkle with the basil leaves. Serve the soup topped with the Parmesan.

Place gingernut biscuits and macadamia nuts into food processor and process until finely chopped. Add butter and process until well combined. Remove from processor and knead until smooth and no longer crumbly. Roll into 1 ½ cm balls. Combine coconut and golden syrup and roll balls into coconut mixture until coated. Refrigerate until firm. Makes 30-40 balls.

Beat egg whites and salt until foamy, add cream of tartar and continue to beat until stiff. Beat in vanilla, almond extract and sugar. Fold in pecans and chocolate chips. Drop by tablespoonfuls onto wax paper. Refrigerate at least one hour before serving.

Heat a small amount of oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the pork chops. Sear them until they are lightly browned. Add the balsamic vinegar. Drizzle the cherry preserves over the top. Simmer until the liquid is reduced by half. Pour the juices over the top of the pork.
I can't wait to try the pork chop with mustard sauce capers.

Heat olive oil over med-low heat in a large skilletcook garlic powder and onion powder in oil 1 minute, stirring constantlystir in broth and orzobring to boilingreduce heatcover and simmer for 15 minutesuncoverstir in parsley flakescook 2 to 3 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and orzo is tenderserve immediately.

Melt the butter with the brown sugar. Remove from the heat and add the eggs, beating well. Add the dates and beat well. Add the vanilla extract and the rice crispies. Mix well and drop by teaspoonfuls onto a wax paper lined sheet. Chill well before rolling in the coconut.

Cut chicken breasts in half horizontally. Layer prosciutto and spinach on each half. Sprinkle with lemon juice and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Melt a little butter in a skillet and add the chicken. Fry until the meat is done. Pour a little broth into the skillet and cover. Cook for 20 to 25 minutes. Serve with a drizzle of olive oil and parmesan cheese.

In skillet, cook chopped vegetables until tender. Add meat. Cook and stir until meat is no longer pink. Add remaining ingredients. Heat through. Serve on toasted sandwich bread.
In several large kettles or dutch ovens, brown beef. Drain. In a large bowl, combine the next several ingredients. Divide evenly between pans. Simmer for 1 hour. Stir occasionally. Serve on buns with slices of cheese, if desired.
In a large skillet brown ground beef and onion over medium heat. Drain off excess fat. Stir in the remaining ingredients until well blended. Cover and simmer over low heat for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Serve hot on your favorite buns or bread.
In a medium skillet over medium heat, brown the ground beef, onion, and the green and red peppers. Drain off liquids. Stir in the garlic powder, mustard, ketchup, and brown sugar. Mix thoroughly. Reduce heat, and simmer for 30 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Brown

Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Add garlic. When garlic is brown, add eggs. Cook until firm. In 2 halves of an english muffin, layer 1/2 cup marinara sauce, 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese and 2 eggs. Top each half with other half of english muffin. Cook in microwave for 1 minute on high. Makes 2 servings.

Wash cucumbers thoroughly in cold water to remove any dirt or wax. Remove ends of each cucumber so that they are flat and clean. Dice the ends of each cucumber and add them to a large bowl or container. Slice each cucumber in half lengthwise. Layer them flat-side down in your container. Add instant minced onion to taste along with garlic cloves, mustard seeds, fresh dill to taste. Pour water over top of mixture, then pour cider vinegar over top of that. Add canning salt until taste is good to you. Cover your container and refrigerate for 24 hours. Serve at room temperature for best taste. Makes 2 gallons.

In a large saucepan, combine grapes and pineapple chunks. Add sugar and juice to taste. Cook over medium heat until heated through. Combine bananas with egg. Stir in flour. Add to hot fruit. Stir until thick. Remove from heat. Stir in lemon juice. Pour into 8x8 inch dish. Bake at 350 degrees F for 35 to 40 minutes. Serve warm.
Autumn is the season of mists and mellow fruitfulness.
I am a fruit. I am a vegetable. I am a nut.
I am a nut. I am a vegetable. I am a fruit.
I am a nut. I am a fruit. I am a vegetable.
Dip pork chop in egg white. Then dip in bread crumbs. Cook on a hot griddle until browned on each side.

Bring water to boil in a saucepan. Add rigatoni and cook according to package directions. Drain. Add sauce to hot noodles. Set aside. Meanwhile cook asparagus. When done remove from heat. Toss asparagus with noodles and top with sour cream. Drizzle with vinegar and sprinkle with green onion. Garnish with fresh basil. Serve immediately.
Cook asparagus in salted water until crisp tender. Drain. Combine dressing ingredients and pour over asparagus. Toss to coat. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Heat oil in wok over high heat until hot, add ginger and stir-fry 15 seconds. Add snow peas and stir-fry 3 minutes until bright green and crisp-tender. Add soy sauce and dark sesame oil. Continue stirring until heated through. Season with salt and black pepper.

Dissolve milk and flour together. Add salt, pepper and garlic powder. Heat until boiling. Stir constantly for 1 minute. Add cheese. Remove from heat. Add pimiento and potatoes. Cook until cheese is melted and potatoes are tender. Serve immediately.

Mix together hamburger meat, velveeta cheese and oregano in a skillet. Brown over med heat until meat is cooked through (about 8-10 minutes). Add in the rest of the ingredients. Cook uncovered until the meat is cooked through (about 10 minutes). Serve over hot cooked macaroni noodles.

Put the polish sausage, water, vinegar, and seasonings into a crock pot and cook for about 2 hours. Cook the hard-boiled egg for 10 minutes in boiling water. Remove the sausage from the crock pot and cut into small pieces. Then place the sausage back into the crock pot. Blend the flour with the milk and add it to the crock pot. Stir until it thickens and the egg has cooked through. Garnish with parsley and serve with hot French bread

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 2-quart baking dish. In a small bowl, combine vegetable oil, vinegar, lime juice, onion, bell pepper, and butter. Place a layer of fish fillets in the prepared dish. Pour half of the vinegar mixture over the fillets. Repeat layering procedure twice more. Bake in preheated oven until bubbly and brown on top. Serve with lemon wedges or lime wedges.

Combine all ingredients except fish fillets in a large saucepan. Bring to boil. Add fillets. Cover. Reduce heat. Simmer 10 minutes or until fillets are done. Remove bay leaf. Mash fish with a fork. Serve hot.

In a saucepan, combine 2 cups of water with 2 tbsp of margarine. Bring to a boil then add the noodles. Cook for about 10 minutes or until the noodles are soft and tender. Drain the noodles and put in a greased 2-qt baking dish or 9x13 inch pan. Combine the remaining margarine with the brown sugar and spread over the top of the noodles. Bake in a preheated 350-degree oven for 30 minutes or until the topping is lightly browned. Mix the eggs, vanilla, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and milk together in a bowl. Stir in the pecans and pour over the top of the kugel. Bake for another 30 minutes or until the custard is set. Serve warm or cold.

Place a square of cheese spread on the center of each crescent. Top with 2 slices of smoked salmon. Fill the center of the rolls with the spinach. Seal the rolls by pinching the sides of the dough together. Place the rolls on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350 for about 20 minutes or until the rolls are golden brown. Makes 12. Serve warm.

Heat the oil in a heavy 10-inch skillet. Add the meat and brown it lightly. Add the onions and garlic and stir-fry until the onions are soft. Add the soy sauce and brown sugar. Add the water. Bring to the boiling point. Turn the heat down to low. Cover the pan and simmer the pork until it is tender.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line muffin tin with liners or spray with non stick spray. Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, yogurt, butter, eggs and basil in bowl. Mix until well blended. Fold in cheddar cheese and ham. Spoon mixture into prepared muffin tin. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until lightly brown.

Place carrots in large pot of lightly salted water. Bring to a boilreduce heatsimmer until tender. Drain. Add apples. Combine brown sugar, margarine and cider. Add to carrots. Simmer 5 minutes. Stir in cranberries. Serve.

Cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the egg and mix well. Add the vanilla. In another bowl combine the dry ingredients. Add the dry ingredients to the creamed mixture alternately with the water. Add the nuts or raisins if using them. Mix well. Divide into four equal parts. Wrap each part in plastic wrap and refrigerate or freeze for later use.

In a large non stick skillet over medium heat heat oil. Stir in onion, garlic, mushrooms and saute for 5 minutes until liquid has evaporated. Whisk together eggs, salt, pepper and dried oregano until well combined. Pour into skillet over the sauteed vegetable mixture. Sprinkle with the shredded mozzarella cheese and continue to cook until egg is set about 1 to 2 minutes on each side. Cut into 8 wedges. Serve with pasta sauce on the side and a salad.
Brown bacon in large skillet. Add hash browns, green pepper and onions. Cook until crisp and tender. Add eggs. Cook until set. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve at once.

To make crust, combine flour and butter with a pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse meal. Press mixture into a greased 9x13 in. baking dish. Bake at 375° for 15 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.To make the topping, beat cream cheese and powdered sugar until smooth. Add Cool Whip and beat until smooth. Fold in pudding and spread over the cooled crust. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Combine brown sugar and butter. Cook over medium heat until thick and bubbly. Stir in graham wafers and almonds. Press into greased cake pan and bake at 350 until set and lightly browned. Cut into squares.

Cook spaghetti according to directions on package. Meanwhile, in a skillet over medium heat, fry bacon until crisp. Drain fat from skillet, reserving 2 tablespoons fat in skillet. Cook onion in reserved fat in skillet over low heat until tender. Add cooked spaghetti to skilletmix well. Add eggs, salt, pepper, and parsley. Stir until well blended. Sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese and serve at once.

In a large mixing bowl beat the butter with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in the sugars and egg. Add flour, oats, coconut and raisins. Shape into 1-inch balls. Place on wax paper. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Makes 40.

In large skillet, melt 1 tablespoon butter over medium heat. Add egg whites and fry until whites are set but yolks are runny. In another skillet over medium heat, fry ham until warm and lightly brown. On one slice of sourdough bread, layer 1 slice cheddar cheese, egg, ham and 1/2 of remaining cheddar cheese. Top with remaining sourdough bread and brush with butter. Brush melted butter on outside of sandwich and place in skillet used to fry egg. Brush melted butter on top of sandwich. After a few minutes, flip sandwich over and fry until golden brown and cheese is melted. Serve with sour cream if desired.

Melt butter in skillet. Add dried beef. Stir until dried beef is very crumbled. Add milk and pepper. Cook over medium heat until mixture thickens. Serve over hot biscuits or thick toast.
name: my favorite dried beef gravy for biscuits gravy
ingredients: dried beef, eggs, stuffed olives, flour, butter, milk, salt & pepper
preparation:Melt butter in skillet and stir in flour to make a roux. Add milk gradually until you reach desired thickness. Add dried beef, olives, salt and pepper. Stir in egg slices carefully. Serve over hot biscuits or thick toast.
name: easy hamburger stew
ingredients: lean ground beef, garlic, onion, potatoes, carrots, kernel corn, cream of mushroom soup, water, salt and pepper, worcestershire sauce
preparation:Saute ground beef, garlic and onion. Add potatoes, carrots and corn. Stir in soup, water and

Boil the potatoes in a large saucepan in enough water to cover by about one inch. Simmer over medium-low heat until just tender, about 10 minutes. Drain the potatoes and let cool. Peel the potatoes. Combine the shallots with the remaining vegetables in a large bowl and toss to combine. Add the potatoes and toss to combine. In a small bowl, whisk the horseradish with the vinegar and season with salt and pepper. Whisk in the oil and toss with the potato mixture. Adjust the seasonings if necessary. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease 1-1/2 quart casserole dish with margarine or butterset aside. Cook bacon until crisp and drain on paper towels. In medium bowl, stir together ham, cheeses, onion and bacon. In small bowl, stir together skim milk and Bisquickstir into cheese mixture until well blended. Beat together egg and waterstir into cheese mixture until blended. Spoon into prepared casserole dishbake for 30 minutes or until golden brown.

Mix the flour with baking powder and salt. Beat in the egg with a whisk or fork. Add the milk and mix until smooth. Add the dried parsley. If desired add dried onions or other seasonings. Spray the inside of the crock pot with cooking spray or add a teaspoon of butter to the crock pot if using the stove top method. Scoop the batter into the crock pot with a large spoon or ladle. Bake on high for 4 hours or low for 6 hours. Serve with gravy or your favorite toppings.
The recipes below are from the Sweet Treats section of the January 1999 issue of Food & Fitness Magazine.
name: baked applesingredients: apple (or other fruit), 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon (optional), 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg (optional), 1/2 teaspoon ground cloves (optional)preparation:Wash and core apples. Place in a shallow 1-quart baking dish. Sprinkle with c

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C). Grease a 12-cup muffin pan with cooking spray. In a large bowl, mix together flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, ginger and nutmeg. In a separate bowl, mix together egg beaters, pumpkin puree, yogurt, sugar-free maple syrup, oil, and milk. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring just until combined. Pour into prepared muffin pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 to 20 minutes, or until golden brown. Serve warm or at room temperature. Yield: 12 servings

In a skillet over medium heat, add 2 teaspoons of vegetable oil and saute onion and green pepper until soft. Add andouille sausage and brown. Add shrimp and cook until pink. Add remaining vegetable oil and stir in creole seasoning. Cook for 1 minute. Add chicken broth and reduce to simmer. Add Dijon mustard and red wine vinegar. Simmer 5 minutes. Serve over white rice.

Whisk together first six ingredients and let stand for 10 minutes. Whisk in the mayonnaise and vegetable oil. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Before serving, whisk in the cheese. Makes 2 cups.

In a small bowl combine olive oil, kosher salt and freshly ground pepper. Place each piece of trout in the bowl with the seasoning, turning to coat. Grill the filets for about 3 minutes on each side or until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve immediately with a squeeze of lemon.

Combine dry ingredients in a large bowl. Beat egg and milk together and add to dry mixture. Combine well. Dip apple slices in batter and fry in oil till brown on both sides. Drain on paper towel. Sprinkle with cinnamon sugar.

Heat the olive oil in the bottom of an earthenware pot. Add the ground beef and cook until browned. Drain off any excess fat. Add the onions and cook 2-3 minutes. Add the garlic, parsley and seasoning and cook until fragrant. Add the eggs. Cover the pot and cook until the eggs are set. Add the artichoke hearts and cheese. Garnish with the parsley. Serve with crusty bread and salad.

Cut bacon into small pieces and cook until crisp in small skillet over medium heat. Remove bacon with slotted spoon to paper-towel-lined platedrain all but 2 tablespoons drippings from skillet. Crumble baconset aside. In same skillet, melt margarine over medium heat. Add red onioncook and stir until tender. Sprinkle with bacon. Spread margarine over both sides of 4 bread slicestop with 1/2 cup shredded cheese. Cover with remaining bread slicesspread with remaining margarine. Grill 3 minutes or until golden brown. Cut into wedgestop with bacon mixture. Serve with additional shredded cheese, if desired.

Soak bread in milk for 20 minutes. Beat together the eggs, sugar, milk, liqueur and zest. Dip bread slices into the mixture, soaking both sides. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Brown the bread slices on each side, then transfer to baking dish to bake until cooked through.
Toast baguette. Mix together the remaining ingredients in a food processor and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve the mixture spread over the toast.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Grease 9-inch pie pan or 13x9-inch baking dish. Sprinkle chicken evenly with paprika. In a large nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray, heat butter over medium-high heat. Add mushroomssaute 5 minutes or until tender. Add garlicsaute 1 minute or until fragrant. Stir in brothbring to a boil. Add green onions. Reduce heatsimmer 3 minutes or until liquid is reduced by half. Remove from heatstir in 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, cheese, and onions. Spread mixture evenly over chicken. Bake 20 minutes or until chicken is done (170 degrees F) and top is browned. Cut into wedges to serve.

Saute the onions in the margarine until soft. Add the garlic and saute for one minute. Add chicken broth, carrots and potatoes. Cook for about 10 minutes. Add the seasoning and bay leaf. Cover the pot and simmer for about 15 minutes.

Place the roasted garlic in a food processor. Add in the potatoes and chicken stock. Process until smooth. Add in cream cheese and continue to blend until smooth. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve with a sprinkle of parmesan cheese.
Blend first three ingredients with ice cubes until smooth and frothy. Strain into tall glasses and sprinkle with grenadine. Garnish with pineapple slices and maraschino cherries.

Cut the russet potatoes into 1/2-inch cubes and place them in a large mixing bowl. Melt 3 Tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in the cubed potatoes and cook until golden brown, stirring occasionally, about 10 minutes. Stir in the chopped cabbage and cook for 5 to 8 minutes until tender, stirring occasionally. Season to taste with seasoning salt and pepper. Sprinkle the parmesan cheese over the top and serve.

In a large bowl, mix corn syrup, sugar and peanut butter until smooth. Add cereal and mix well. Form into a ball and flatten in the palm of the hand. Place in single layer on a cookie sheet. Chill for an hour. Melt almond bark in the microwave according to package directions. Drizzle over balls. Sprinkle with butterscotch chips. Allow to set. Store in an airtight container.
I made these cookies this afternoon to take to work tomorrow. I used walnuts instead of pecans. The cookies were very easy to make and tasted wonderful!
I made these cookies this afternoon to take to work tomorrow. I used walnuts instead of pecans. The cookies were very easy to make and tasted wonderful!

Place poblano chiles in boiling water for 10 minutes. Remove from water. Remove skins. In a large skillet, cook onion and garlic in olive oil until onion is translucent. Add chicken. Cook until chicken is almost done. Remove from heat. In a small bowl mix together seasoning salt, tomatoes, mushrooms and cheese. Add to the chicken. Stuff the poblano chiles with the mixture. Bake in 350° oven until cheese is melted. Serve with cooked rice.

Cut the chicken breast in half lengthwise, then place between 2 sheets of plastic wrap and pound to a 1/4-inch thickness. Heat a large skillet over high heat and add enough olive oil to coat the bottom of the pan. Add the chicken and cook until it is browned on both sides. Remove to a plate. Add the mushrooms and cook for a minute or two, until softened. Add the garlic and cook for another minute or two. Add the broth and the balsamic and cook for 1 minute. Return the chicken to the pan and bring to a simmer. Cover and cook for about 6 minutes. In a small bowl, mix together the sour cream and cilantro. Serve the chicken on the bed of lettuce with some of the sour cream mixture spooned over the top. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve immediately.

In a medium-size pot, combine water and sugars. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Add cranberries and continue to cook and stir until berries pop and mixture thickens to a glaze. Remove from heat and stir in dijon mustard and prepared horseradish. Let mixture cool. In a small bowl, stir together orange juice and cornstarch. Pour into pot and stir over medium heat until mixture thickens to a glaze. Remove from heat. Cool. Store in refrigerator. Makes about 5 cups.

In a blender or food processor combine broth, arrowroot, lime juice, sugar, and salt. Blend until smooth. Add the oil in a slow steady stream while the processor is running. Puree until mixture thickens slightly. Add the cilantro and blend until it is chopped.

Heat the olive oil in a saucepan. Add the garlic cloves and cook over low heat for 1 minute. Add the broccoli and stir-fry for 4 minutes. Add the salt and pepper and pour over the ziti. Add 3/4 cup of water and simmer for 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Remove all visible fat from necks. Place necks in baking pan. In small bowl, whisk together all remaining ingredients except chinese five spice powder and oyster sauce. Pour over necks. Bake uncovered for one hour and 15 minutes. Remove necks from oven and brush with oyster sauce. Garnish with chinese five spice powder. Serve with rice and green salad.

Unroll the crescent dough and separate on the perforations into individual triangles. Place sausage links on top of each triangle. Brush the sausages with butter. Sprinkle about 1 tablespoon pecan pieces over the sausage. Roll up the dough, starting at the short end. Brush the top with butter. Sprinkle with a mixture of brown sugar and honey. Bake at 400 degrees for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.
Place chicken in bottom of crock pot. Stir together remaining ingredients. Pour over chicken. Cover. Cook on low for 8 hours. Serve with tortillas and shredded cheese.

Cook cauliflower in water until slightly tender. Drain and arrange in 8x8 inch casserole dish. Sprinkle with bacon and cheese. Combine cream cheese with chives and spread on top of casserole. Bake uncovered in 325 degree oven for 15-20 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Cook bacon in skillet until crisp. Remove to paper towel-lined plate. Add onion to drippings in skillet and saute until tender. Remove from heat. Mix together bacon drippings, onions, sugar, vinegar, stock and seasonings. Stir in pecans. Place spinach in large bowl. Add bacon and onion mixture. Toss to coat.

Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heatadd carrots and saute until tender-crisp. Add rice, green onions, and chicken brothbring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer until all liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Fluff with fork. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with parsley if desired.

Cook squash in a microwave for 4 minutes. Split in half and scoop out seeds. Bring a pan of water to a boil. Cook the squash for 10 minutes. Add bacon and garlic and continue to cook for 3 minutes. Add parsley and remove the squash. Add pasta and cover with pasta water. Stir in bacon mixture. Add cheese and parsley. Serve with romano cheese.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onioncook until softened, about 3 minutes. Add barleystir until well coated with oil and onion mixture. Add white winecook until evaporated. Add stockbring to a boil. Reduce heatcoversimmer until barley is tender, about 45 minutes. Stir in peascook until tender. Remove from heatstir in cream cheese. Season with salt and peppergarnish with chives.

Melt the butter with the oil and fry the chopped onion and the sliced mushrooms for about 10 minutes until the mixture is soft. Add the celeriac and cook for 5 minutes. Add the parsley and season with salt & pepper. Remove from the heat. Cool to lukewarm. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Line 12-muffin cups with paper liners. Place 1/4 cup of the vegetable mixture in the bottom of each liner. Break an egg into each cup. Place in the preheated oven and bake for 10 minutes or until the egg is cooked to your liking. Serve immediately.

In a 12-inch nonstick skillet or 9-inch pie plate heat oven to 350 degrees. Beat together the eggs, milk, mustard, and 1/4 teaspoon of each of the salt and pepper. Set aside. In a small bowl combine the croutons, ham, fontina, and roasted red pepper. Spoon into the skillet. Pour over the egg mixture. Bake until set. Sprinkle with green onion. Serve with a side salad.
Preheat broiler. Combine soup and milk and bring to a boil. Add garlic powder, seasoning and green onions. Spoon over toast and top with mozzarella and parmesan. Broil until cheeses are melted.

Cook the noodles according to the package directions (usually 7-10 minutes). Drain the noodles well. Spread the cooked noodles in a greased 9x13 inch baking pan. Beat together the sour cream, milk, cheese, brown sugar, eggs, cranberries and spices in a large mixing bowl until smooth. Pour the mixture over the noodles. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until lightly brown on top. Cool for 10 minutes before cutting into 2-inch squares.

Place the chicken breasts in a large zip-lock bag and add the onion flakes. Add the water and pour in the remaining ingredients. Seal the bag and marinate in the refrigerator for 1-2 hours. Remove from the bag and bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes. Cook until juices run clear. Serve over hot wild rice.

In a deep 8-inch square baking dish, combine soup mix and water. Drizzle with oil. Sprinkle with garlic powder. Place chicken in baking dishsprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake at 375 degrees F for 20 minutes or until tender and no longer pink. Meanwhile, cook potato and carrots in boiling water until tenderdrain. Combine potato and carrots with soup mixture and cooked chickenstir well. Serve warm. Makes 6 servings.

Slice the potatoes in half lengthwise. In a large bowl, combine all the ingredients except the feta cheese. Add the potato halves to the bowl. Toss to coat evenly. Transfer to a 2 quart baking dish. Sprinkle with feta cheese. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees F for 50 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Serve warm.
What a great collection! I love all things with lemon - especially the olives.
This is a great collection of recipes! I love the sound of the pasta and the marinated olives.
Olives are one of my favorites. I can eat them just about anytime. Great collection of recipes.
Great collection! I love olives!
I love olives. I am glad to see that there are so many recipes with olives in them. I will have to try the pasta recipe.
I love olives. I have a few different ways I love to eat them but these recipes look delicious.
I love olives and the lemon rice sounds like a perfect meal

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, combine the couscous and the leeks. Drain the liquid from the leeks. Stir in the cheddar cheese and season to taste with the olive oil and pepper. Transfer the mixture to a greased 8-inch square baking dish. Bake for about 20 minutes, until browned. Serve warm.

In a 5-qt slow cooker layer half of the potatoes, 1/4 of the ham, 1/4 of the onion and 1/4 of the cheddar cheese. Repeat layers once. Add soup and seasonings to potato mixture. Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or on high for 2 1/2 to 3 hours. Check after about 6 hours. If needed, add 1/2 cup water and continue to cook until potatoes are tender.
In a screw top jar combine all the dressing ingredients. Cover. Shake well to mix. Toss together the lettuce, cashews, and cheese. Dress salad just before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Cut squash in half. Scoop out seeds and discard. Brush with olive oil and sprinkle with a generous amount of salt and pepper. Place cut side down on a baking sheet and bake for about 45 minutes, until tender when pierced with a knife. Meanwhile cook pasta in a large pot of boiling water until al dente. Stir in garlic and cook for 1 minute more. Stir in the squash and cook for 1 minute more. Stir in 1/4 cup of the breadcrumbs and the remaining 1/4 cup of breadcrumbs and the remaining 1/4 cup of breadcrumbs and the remaining 1/4 cup of breadcrumbs and the remaining 1/4 cup of breadcrumbs and the remaining 1/4 cup of breadcrumbs and the remaining 1/4 cup of breadcrumbs and the remaining 1/4 cup of breadcrumbs and the remaining 1/4 cup of breadcrumbs and the remaining 1/4 cup of breadcrumbs and

Preheat oven to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C). In 5-1/2-quart slow cooker, melt butter over medium heat. Sprinkle with Italian Salad Dressing Mix. Cook until bubbly. Stir in mushroom soup. Remove from heatstir in chicken, wine, and 1/2 cup cheese. Spoon into 13 x 9-inch baking dish. In small bowl, beat together remaining 2 tablespoons cheese and sour cream until well blendedspread evenly over top of chicken mixture. Bake uncovered at 200 degrees for 3 hours or until bubbly. Sprinkle with parsley.

Saute the garlic in butter until just golden. Add the sage leaves and cook until wilted. Add the stock and water. Bring to the boil. Remove from the heat. Beat in the eggs. Season with the salt and ground pepper. Serve with croutons or french bread. Top with the cheese.
Puree avocado with milk and sugar in blender until completely smooth. Pour into tall glass and serve immediately.

Preheat your grill and while you wait prepare a marinade. Finely chop rosemary and mint and place them in a bowl with garlic, lemon juice and a pinch of salt and pepper. Slice your lemons into wedges and place them into a bowl of cold water to soak for a couple of minutes and then drain them and set aside. Rub your prepared marinade onto your lamb chops and then allow them to rest for a few minutes so that the flavours can permeate the meat. Season them again with salt and pepper and place them onto a hot grill and turn them regularly until cooked to your liking. Remove from the grill and place them onto a serving dish and then drizzle over some more olive oil and sprinkle over some more chopped rosemary and mint. Serve them straight from the grill and serve them alongside your sliced lemons to squeeze over them before eating.

Cook potatoes until just tender. Drain water. Cool to room temp. Chop eggs. In a bowl combine all other ingredients. Add cooled potatoes and egg. Mix until evenly coated. Refrigerate 2 hours before serving. Best if refrigerated overnight.
Beat egg until light and fluffy. Blend in honey and sugar. Add soda. Stir in flour. Stir in cinnamon. Drop by teaspoon onto wax paper. Let cool and serve.

In a large bowl, cream together the butter and powdered sugar. Beat in vanilla. Add flourmix until blended. Divide dough into 12 equal portions. Roll each portion into a ball. In a small bowl, combine white chocolate chips and candy canes. Place one ball of dough in bottom of each paper cup. Top each with about a teaspoon of the chocolate mixture. Top with another ball of dough. Repeat until each cup is full. Cover and refrigerate until set. Makes 12 snowballs.

Beat eggs and salad oil together until light and foamy. Add water and mix well. Stir in pudding mix until smooth. Fold in nuts and cinnamon. Spread batter in a greased and floured 12-cup bundt pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 to 60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool for 15 minutes in pan and then invert onto a serving plate to cool completely. Dust with confectioner s sugar before serving. Serves 12.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Unroll crescent rolls into 4 rectangles. Press up sides slightly. Press perforations together. Layer smoked sausage and cheese. At this point you can make it ahead and refrigerate for up to 24 hours. Beat together eggs, milk, salt and pepper. Pour mixture over the dish. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes. Let cool 10 to 15 minutes. Serve.

Melt butter in ovenproof crock pot. Cook onion over medium heat until lightly browned. Sprinkle with thyme and season with salt and pepper. Add potatoes. Sprinkle with sea salt and pepper. Pour in vegetable stock and thyme sprigs to cover potatoes. Cover crock pot and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or high for 4 to 6 hours until potatoes are tender and cooked through. Remove thyme sprigs. Sprinkle with swiss cheese. Cover and cook for 5 more minutes or until cheese has melted. Serve with crusty bread and a fresh green salad.

Bring 4 quarts water to boiling in large pot. Add 1 Tbsp. salt. Stir in capellini. Cook 1 minute. Drain capellini, reserving 1 1/2 cups cooking liquid. Heat oil in heavy medium skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and saute until golden. Stir in reserved cooking liquid. Season to taste. Add capellini and cook 2 minutes. Serve in bowls topped with parsley and parmesan.

Melt the butter in a saute pan over medium heat. Add shallot and saute until translucent. Add turnip and saute until turnips are tender. Add the juice and zest of an orange, stirring until combined and heated through. Season with salt& pepper. Serve hot.

Tear off woody ends from asparagus and discard. Steam the spears until just tender (about 3-4 minutes). Remove from pan and set aside to cool slightly. Combine all dressing ingredients and whisk until smooth. Pour over asparagus and gently toss to coat evenly. Serve at room temperature.

Follow directions on cookie mix bag and add raisins and miniature semisweet chocolate chips. Bake in easy bake oven. Cool on cooling rack.
The No Bake Cookies Recipe is free to use at your leisure. You can also find other free recipes like No Bake Cookies Recipe on our Recipe Page.

Cut the top off each loaf of italian bread. Hollow out the inside of each loaf leaving about 1/4" of the inside of each loaf. Reserve the inside of each loaf. In a large pot add the italian vegetables. Pour the spaghetti sauce over the vegetables. Cook together. Cut the meatballs in half. Place the meat balls in the bottom of the loaf of italian bread. Place a layer of the vegetables in the bottom of each loaf. Continue adding the vegetables until you have used up all the vegetables. Sprinkle the top of each loaf of italian bread with the mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes until the cheese is melted. Serve hot.

In a saucepan combine the ketchup, picante sauce and brown sugar and bring to a boil. Stir in the lemon juice and set aside to cool. Peel and devein the shrimp leaving the tails intact and thread them onto skewers. Thread the peppers onto the skewers alternating with the shrimps and brush with the sauce. Grill for about 10 minutes, brushing with the sauce and turning frequently. Serve warm or at room temperature with a garnish of fresh coriander sprigs and lime wedges.

Cut off the stems of 18 dates. Stuff with 2 tsp of peanut butter, 1 tsp of sugar and a slice of almond. Repeat. Place on waxed paper or aluminum foil until set.
name: peanut butter banana and date sandwiches
ingredients: whole wheat pita bread, peanut butter, pitted dates, honey, bananas
preparation:Ligtly toast the pita pockets and cut each in half crosswise. Spread the inside of each pita pocket with 2 tbsp of peanut butter. Sprinkle the chopped dates over the peanut butter, dividing them equally. Drizzle with honey. Divide the banana slices among the pita pockets. Close the sandwiches, pressing them slightly to adhere.
name: shirley s stuffed celery with nuts
ingredients: cream cheese, walnuts, milk, celery
preparation:Put cream cheese in a bowl in the microwave for 45 secs
Combine all ingredients in a food processor. Process until smooth. Transfer to a serving bowl. Serve with tortilla chips.

Peel apples and slice. Put the apples in a pan with a little butter. Season with a little sugar, pepper and nutmeg. Cook till tender. Peel and cook the sweet potatoes. When cooked, mash with a little butter. Add the apple mixture and combine well.

Combine the flour, cinnamon, soda and salt. Set aside. Beat the eggs. Add the oil and sugar and beat until light and fluffy. Add the dry ingredients and mix well. Add the mangoes and mix thoroughly. Spoon into two greased loaf pans. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Brush with lemon juice. Cool for 10 minutes and then remove from pans to cool completely.
Name: Bread Machine Mango Bread Ingredients: Unsalted Butter, Sugar, Eggs, Coconut Milk, All-Purpose Flour, Baking Soda, Mango, Sour Cream, Vanilla Essence, Walnuts Preparation: Preheat oven to 180c degrees. Butter loaf pans. Cream butter and sugar. Add eggs. Beat well. Sift dry ingredients together and add to butter mixture. Add coconut milk. Mix well. Add mangoes, sour cream and vanilla, combining well. Add nuts,

In a large bowl, combine the chicken, sunflower oil, garlic cloves, fresh coriander and sugar. Season with the cumin, coriander, soy sauce and chilli pepper to taste. Refrigerate for 1 hour to marinate. Thread the chicken onto skewers alternating with the tomato cubes. Brush the skewers with the marinade. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees C (350 degrees F). Place the skewers onto an oven tray and bake for about 20 minutes until the chicken is cooked through. Serve hot with lemon wedges.

Melt butter in large saucepan. Add onions and cook until golden brown. Add potatoes and cook 5 minutes longer. Add lobster meat, cover with cold water, bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes. Add milk, light cream, salt, and pepper. Simmer 5 minutes longer. Serve in soup bowls with crackers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Peel and slice apples. Cook in a sauce pan with sugar and water. Add maple syrup and simmer for 5 minutes. Pour into pie crust. Top with rolled oats and melted butter. Bake for 45 minutes. Serve warm with whipped cream.

In a large pot of boiling water, cook the macaroni for 7 minutes until tender yet firm. Drain well. Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan melt the butter over medium heat. Gradually add in the flour, stirring constantly with a whisk. Cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Slowly pour in the milk and stir until smooth. Add the cheddar cheese, stirring until smooth and well blended. Stir in the cooked macaroni until it s evenly coated with sauce. Pour into a 9x13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with more cheese if you want. Bake for 30 minutes until hot and bubbly.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat the first three ingredients together with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in the vanilla and the next three ingredients in that order until blended. Sift the dry ingredients and fold into the batter. Divide the batter among the prepared cups. Bake the cupcakes for 18 to 20 minutes, or until they spring back when lightly touched in the center and a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from pans and cool on wire racks for 10 minutes. Cool completely before icing.

Cook the rice in the crockpot according to the package directions. In a small saucepan, bring the broth to a boil. Add the rice to the crockpot. Stir in the green onions. Cover the crockpot. Cook on high for 3 hours. Stir in the mushrooms and the almonds. Cover the crockpot. Cook on low for 1 hour. Serve the rice topped with the cranberries.

Combine the spinach with the vinegar, garlic, oil and red onion. Let stand for about 15 minutes. Stir well and arrange on 4 plates. Top with feta cheese and roasted red peppers. Sprinkle with walnuts. Serve with warm pita bread.

Cut round steak into serving pieces and season flour with salt & pepper. Dredge meat in seasoned flour. Add vegetables to slow cooker and place meat on top. Combine liquids & stir well. Cover & cook on low 8-10 hours. Remove meat and shred. Put meat and vegetables back in slow cooker & stir in cornstarch and noodles. Cover & cook 30 minutes longer.
Prepare jello according to package directions. Stir in juice and cranberries. Cool slightly. Fold in cream and pour into mold. Chill until firm.

Line the bottom of an 8 x 8 glass baking dish with the cake squares. In a small bowl mix the coffee with the sugar. In a large bowl mix the cream cheese with the heavy cream until smooth. Add the coffee mixture to the cream mixture and mix well. Pour the mixture over the cake. Refrigerate 4 hours or until set. Just before serving, place a chocolate bar in the center of each serving. Melt the chocolate bars in the microwave. Spoon some of the melted chocolate over each bar.
Tiramisu is a traditional Italian dessert that can be found in many of the finest restaurants. The translation of Tiramisu is "pick me up." The dessert is made of a layer of coffee soaked lady fingers. The coffee soaked fingers are layered with a mascarpone cream (which contains egg yolks). The mascarpone is then topped with a layer of chocolate shavings. The dessert is then refrigerated.
Tiramisu is one of the most popular desserts in the world. It is a rich
In a large microwavable bowl add water, baking soda and tea bags. Microwave on high 4 minutes. Remove from microwave and let steep until cool. Stir in sugar and serve over ice.

Mix 7-up and miniature marshmallows in a large bowl and stir until well blended and completely dissolved. Add the boiling water, stirring constantly and let stand for 5 minutes. Add the jello and stir until completely dissolved. Fold in the crushed pineapple and cool whip with the mayonnaise. Spoon into a 10-inch serving bowl or 9x13 inch pan and refrigerate for several hours or overnight. Garnish with chopped nuts and serve cold or at room temperature.
Making a quick and easy recipe that is just as good as the original takes some skill and the ability to improvise. For most of us, who are just learning how to make our own recipes, it is important that we learn how to make something as good as what we can buy in the store so that we have something that we can use as a benchmark for when we make something similar in the future. This is particularly true of recipes that are not quite as popular in the US as they are in other countries such as Japan.
The original recipe for making Green Jello was developed by a Japanese cook named Y

Saute onion and garlic in vegetable oil until soft. Add poblano chiles, breaking them into small pieces. Add vegetable stock. Simmer until chiles are soft. Purée with an immersion blender or in a regular blender in batches. Return soup to pot. Add yogurt, cheese, cilantro and salt. Serve hot.

Cut shortening into the flour mixture until it is the texture of coarse meal. Gradually add the milk and stir until dough is formed. Pat out into a round shape, roll out and place into a pie pan. Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes or until golden brown.

Peel and slice potatoes in half lengthwise. Sprinkle with seasoning salt. Melt olive oil in pan, add potatoes, cut side down. Cover with lid or foil and bake at 375 for 15 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and broil until cheese is bubbly. Sprinkle with garlic powder and pepper to taste.

Combine sugar, water & cream of tartar in saucepan over low heat. Beat yolks till they turn thick & pale. Beat in brandy & sugar mixture. Cook over low heat until thickened. Remove from heat & beat in butter & vanilla. Cool before using.

Melt the oil in a frying pan over a medium heat. Fry the potato chips for 3-4 mins on each side or until they're lightly brown and crisp. Beat the egg and milk together and pour into the pan. Sprinkle with the cheddar and cook over a medium heat for 1-2 mins or until the egg is just set. Serve immediately with ketchup.

In a large bowl mix flour, baking powder and salt. In a small bowl beat milk with the eggs and stir in the melted shortening. Add this mixture to the dry mixture. Knead lightly on a floured board. Roll out 1/4 inch thick and cut with a large round cutter. Fry in deep fat to a light brown color on both sides. Drain on paper towels. Dip in honey or drizzle with honey or sprinkle with powdered sugar or sprinkle cinnamon and sugar. Makes about 4 dozen balls.

Place the potatoes in a saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring to a boil and let cook until tender. Remove the potatoes from the water and let them cool. Peel them and crush them into a pulp. In a small bowl combine the almonds, flax seeds, bouillon cube and 1/4 cup of the potato pulp. Add the onion and mix well. Add the olive oil and the remaining pulp and mix well. Add the salt and pepper to taste and continue to mix well. Roll the mixture into balls and place on a plate. Refrigerate until ready to use. These can be frozen or used the same day.

Remove any loose surface skin from scallops. Sprinkle both sides with salt and pepper. In a large nonstick skillet over medium high heat, heat oil and butter until foam subsides. Add scallops and cook for 1 1/2 minutes per side until golden brown. Remove from pan and serve.

Mix cake according to package directions. Divide batter evenly between two greased and floured 9-inch round baking pans. Bake at 350 degrees F for 25 minutes. Cool in pans for 5 minutes. Remove from pans and cool on wire racks. While cake is baking make filling. Beat sour cream until thick. Add almond extract and water. Mix well. Spread filling over one layer of cooled cake. Top with second layer of cooled cake. Spread icing over top and sides of cake. Garnish with whole almonds if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Cut off top and bottom of each onion, then slice off outer layer. Place in a large bowl and toss with spray. Season with thyme, salt, and pepper. Add vinegar. Roast 20 minutes. Remove from oven. Allow to cool to room temperature.

Saute onion until tender. Add chopped tomato. Cook 5 minutes. Add dried basil. Beat eggs, water and seasonings together. Pour over vegetable mixture. Heat through. Serve immediately. Garnish with cheese.

Heat butter in saucepan over medium heat. Stir in corn and cook until tender. Stir in carrots. Cook until tender. Stir in green and red pepper. Cook and stir until tender. Sprinkle with oregano and basil and marjoram. Salt to taste. Serves 4.

Bring large pot of lightly salted water to boil. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. In large bowl combine all ingredients except cilantro. Mix well and pour into 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Sprinkle with cilantro. Bake at 350 for 25-30 minutes.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Slice the zucchini into rounds. In a bowl, combine the cooked rice, green onions, eggs and breadcrumbs. Divide the rice mixture into 8 equal portions and flatten each portion into a round about 3-inches in diameter. Place the rounds on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until they are lightly golden and crisp on the bottom.Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the zucchini rounds and fry until golden brown on both sides, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Drain the zucchini on paper towels and season with salt and pepper to taste.Top each rice cake with a little zucchini and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and drizzle with a little pesto sauce and serve with a squeeze of lemon.

In a large bowl, combine the boiled eggs, celery, bacon, and green onions. In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Add the dressing to the egg mixture and toss to coat. Top with parsley before serving.

In a medium bowl combine broth, sour cream, both kinds of mustards and cornstarch. Heat a skillet over med-high heat. Season the chops with salt & pepper and brown both sides. Place browned chops in the bowl of sauce and refrigerate for 30 minutes. When you are ready to serve heat up the chicken broth mixture. Spoon over the top of the chops. Garnish with parsley.

Combine the water and cornstarch in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir until the mixture comes to a boil. Cook for a couple of minutes and remove from the heat. Whisk in the heavy cream. Let cool to room temperature. Whisk in the rum and maple syrup. Serve with fruit and enjoy!

Cut round steaks in half and pound to 1/2-inch thick. Combine garlic, crumbs and egg. Mix well. Pound steaks to 1/4-inch thick and top each steak with a slice of bacon, a slice of hard-boiled egg and a few sprigs of chopped parsley. Roll up steaks and secure with toothpicks. Combine romano and mozzarella in bowl. Sprinkle over braciole. Arrange in a greased 13x9-inch pan. Bake uncovered 35 minutes at 375. To make sauce combine 2 cups water and 1 can (28-ounce) tomato juice in a saucepan. Add 2 tablespoons butter and 2 tablespoons minced fresh garlic. Bring to a boil. Cook for 20 minutes. Serve over braciole.

Cook the noodles according to the package directions. Drain in a colander. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the turkeycook for 5-7 minutes or until browned. Add the scallions, ginger, soy sauce, crushed red pepper flakes. Heat through. Stir in the water chestnuts. Add the noodles. Toss to combine. Serve hot.

Melt oil in heavy skillet over medium heat. Cook onion until translucentadd ham and thyme. Cook until ham is heated through. Stir in soup and milkheat through. Spread noodles evenly in 2-quart casserole dishpour soup mixture over top. Top with cheesecover dish with foil. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes. Uncoverbake until bubbly. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in large pot. Saute onions and garlic until softened. Add tomatoes, basil, broth and seasonings. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer for 30 minutes or until vegetables are tender. In a small bowl whisk together heavy cream and cornstarch until smooth. Pour into pot, stirring constantly to thicken. Turn off heat. Garnish with additional basil leaves, if desired. Serve with cooked rice.

Cut 6 inches from butter end of each spear, leaving 2 inches of green tops. Place spears in boiling water for 2 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain and rinse under cold water until cool. Combine butter and almonds in small saucepan over low heat until butter melts. Remove from heatstir in lemon juice and salt and pepper to taste. Gently toss warm spears in butter mixture and sprinkle with almonds. Serve immediately.

Cook tortellini as directed on package. Cut pepperoni into slices. Slice green olives lengthwise into quarters. Slice black olives lengthwise into quarters. Thread tortellini, pepperoni, green olives, black olives & cheese onto toothpicks for kebabs. Drizzle with italian dressing before serving.

Grease 8x8 baking dish. Layer sliced apples in the baking dish. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Pour the cranberry sauce over the apples. Combine the oats, flour, brown sugar and butter. Sprinkle over the sauce and fruit. Sprinkle with the nuts. Bake at 325 degrees for 45 minutes. Serve warm. Serves 8.

Heat the oil in a large stockpot over medium-high heat. Add the cabbage, pork, soy sauce, gingerroot, and salt. Stir-fry for 5 minutes. Add the chicken broth, green onions, and noodles. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Simmer for 2 minutes. Stir well. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350f. Lightly grease a 9 inch pie plate. Melt margarine in a skillet over medium heat. Add cheddar cheese and flour. Cook until the flour is bubbly. Add milk all at once. Continue to cook until it boils. Remove from heat and set aside. In a separate bowl whisk together eggs. Add the milk mixture and mix well. Add the onions. Stir in the tomatoes. Pour into pie crust. Bake for 45 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes. Cut into wedges. Garnish with chives.

In a large pot, bring water to a boil. Add the noodles and cook according to package directions. While the noodles are cooking, brown the sausage in a skillet. Drain the fat. Add the cooked noodles to the skillet with the sausage, onions, and garlic. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Drain artichokesreserve marinade in a small bowl. Combine marinated artichokes, onion, cheese, mayonnaise, marinade and cayenne in a medium bowlspread on cocktail rye bread slices. Bake at 375 degrees F for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Makes 4 servings.
Combine carrots, mayonnaise, cream and cinnamon. Mix thoroughly. Add raisins and garlic powder. Refrigerate 2-4 hours.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl combine mustard and honey and mix well. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Coat each breast with the mixture and place on a baking sheet. Top each piece with three cracker crumbs. Bake for 35 - 40 minutes until done. Serve with steamed rice.

Mix together first 4 ingredients. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Add margarine & continue to boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and add chocolate & coconut. Pour into a greased 15x10x1 inch baking pan. Sprinkle with corn flakes & nuts & let cool & cut into squares.
A list of all the people, who've contributed to the project so far.
Gloria B. Hays has been collecting recipes for many years and has hundreds of them in her collection. She has cooked and baked for her family and friends for years and has enjoyed her time in the kitchen doing this.
Gloria's cooking and baking style is very eclectic and she is always trying new things. Her husband and daughter are both very good cooks and enjoy the kitchen as much as she does.
Gloria and her family love to entertain and they usually have guests in their home at least once a week.
Gloria is a member of the American Society of Cooking Instructors and has been a cooking instructor for over 10 years. She is

Preheat oven to 425f. Place bacon on a baking sheet. Roast about 15 minutes or until crisp. Remove bacon from baking sheet and place on paper towel to drain fat. Cut vegetables into 1/2 inch chunks. Mix with bacon in a large bowl. In a separate bowl, mix garlic, parsley, salt and pepper. Pour over vegetable mixture and toss well. Spread mixture in a single layer on baking sheet. Bake 30 minutes until browned and crisp. Serve.

Cut avocados into 1/2-inch dice. Mix sour cream with Roquefort cheese. Dice scallions. Add them to avocados. Add green pickled jalapeno peppers. Add paprika to taste. Serve with blue corn tortilla chips.
