Heat sauce. Add chicken and veggies. Cook until heated through. In a 3 quart casserole dish, layer half the ravioli. Top with half the sauce mixture and half the mozzarella. Add another layer of ravioli. Top with remaining sauce mixture and mozzarella. Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes. Serves 6.

In a crockpot combine the frozen vegetables, onion and garlic powders and milk. Cook on low for 4 hours. Add the pork and beans and the cheese spread. Cook another 2 hours. Serve with crackers.
I've been looking for this recipe for years. I've made it twice and it's always been a hit.

Mix salsa and ketchup together. Add taco seasoning and oil. Heat in microwave for 3-5 minutes or in skillet until hot. Let cool. Chop mango. In tortillas, add salsa mixture and chicken or shrimp. Add mango and coleslaw. Roll up and drizzle with sour cream. Serve with extra salsa.

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the olive oil, add the bell peppers and bottled garlic, season with the pepper flakes and cook for about 10 minutes, or until the bell peppers have softened but not browned. In a small bowl, combine the water and sage, then add it to the skillet with the bell peppers. Cook for 5 minutes, then add the tomatoes and the beans. Bring to a simmer, cover partially and cook for 20 to 30 minutes more, or until the beans are tender. Stir in the parsley and serve immediately.

Melt butter over low heat in a heavy saucepan. Stir in flour, increasing heat if necessary until mixture gently bubbles. Cook 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove pan from burner and add milk, stirring constanly as mixture thickens. Season with salt and pepper.

Spread each half of each slice of bread with a thin layer of mayonnaise. Spread a thin layer of mustard on one slice of bread. Layer ham, bacon, eggs, tomatoes and blue cheese. Sprinkle with lettuce. Roll up. Slice in half. Serve.
What to do with the leftover cooked ham.
There are many ways to use it up.
Ham is very versatile.
I can think of two right off hand.
Make a ham salad sandwich or make ham salad to go with crackers.
I use leftover ham in sandwiches.
I also make a ham salad.
It is also very good on crackers or toast.
If you have a recipe that you would like to see featured on the blog please send it to me.
It can be as simple as a sandwich.
Send it to me at [email protected]
Or you can leave the recipe in the comments below.
I will be posting it on the blog.
You can leave the recipe in the comments.
I will add it to the blog.
If you have any questions about

Heat oven to 425 degrees. Place chicken in a 13x9-inch baking dish. Combine red onion, apples, balsamic vinegar, honey, and gingerroot in a medium bowl. Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon of salt and a few grinds of black pepper. Pour over the chicken. Bake 25 minutes. Turn the chicken over. Bake 10 minutes longer.

In a bowl combine the milk with the flavoring and brown sugar. Pour into a greased 1-1/2-quart casserole dish. Layer the fruit on top of the custard. Combine the dry ingredients and sprinkle over the fruit. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes until golden brown. Serve warm.

Combine all ingredients in a heavy duty saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove from heat and stir until smooth. Pour into a 9 x 13 inch pan and sprinkle the nuts on top. Cool and cut into squares.

Peel and slice bananas and place on wax paper to freeze 1 hour or until firm. Place a layer of chocolate in a plastic bag and melt in microwave for 30 seconds to 1 minute. Dip frozen banana in chocolate and roll in coconut flakes to cover. Place on a cookie sheet and freeze until firm. Slice chocolate bars in half and dip frozen banana in chocolate and sprinkle with chopped nuts and colored sprinkles. Place on wax paper and freeze until firm. Crumble granola cereal and place on wax paper and freeze until firm. Place a layer of chocolate in a plastic bag and microwave for 1 to 2 minutes until melted. Dip frozen banana in chocolate and roll in cereal and freeze until firm. Slice chocolate bars in half and dip frozen banana in chocolate and sprinkle with chopped nuts and colored sprinkles. Place on wax paper and freeze until firm. Slice chocolate bars in half and dip frozen banana in

Pound out the chicken breasts to flatten. Season each with a little salt and pepper. Cook the chicken in a skillet sprayed with non-stick cooking spray over medium-low heat until no longer pink. Place each breast onto a baking sheet and top each breast with 2 tablespoon of barbeque sauce, 2 tablespoon cheese and 2 tablespoon crisp bacon. Place into the oven and bake until the cheese has melted. Spread mayonnaise on each croissant. Top the croissants with chicken and serve.

Prepare broccoli according to package directions. Melt butter in a large skillet. Stir in green onions. Add orange juice. Heat until mixture begins to boil. Add orange zest. Sprinkle in cornstarch. Cook until thickened. Stir in broccoli. Add water as necessary to get the desired consistency. Season to taste.
cut off tops of bread. Spread mayonnaise on one side of each. Top with salsa. Layer with avocados & cheese. Place on broiler until cheese melts. Top with shrimp. Put on top.

Dice bacon into small pieces and cook over medium heat until crispy. Add onion and bell peppers. Cook until tender, about 3 minutes. Add garlic and cook for one minute more. Stir in remaining ingredients except for the broth. Simmer for 15 minutes. Stir in broth, cover, and simmer 2-3 hours or until beans are tender. Remove bay leaf before serving.

Cut watermelon into chunks. Put it into blender with 1/4 cup of water and blend on high for 1 minute or so. Add another 1/4 cup water and blend again for 1 minute or so. Add the seltzer water and blend on high for 1 minute or so. Add the splenda and blend on low for 30 seconds or so. Pour into 4 glasses and garnish with lime slices or wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl, combine first four ingredients. Coat chicken with cooking spray. Sprinkle with spice mixture. Bake uncovered for 1 hour or until no longer pink. Pour white wine over. Bake 25-30 minutes longer until juices run clear. Serve over rice or pasta.

Wash the beans well. Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Drop the beans into the water and cook until they are crisp-tender (about 5 minutes). Drain the beans and plunge them into icy water until they are cool. Squeeze the juice from the lemons into a large salad bowl. Add the pepper and the beans. Toss lightly and serve.
This is a great recipe for using up leftover rice or pasta (even if it’s stale). You can also use left over rice from Chinese or Indian restaurants (or your own).
Tastes great when made into patties for sandwiches or burgers or used as stuffing for tomatoes or lettuce leaves.
The key is to cook the rice or pasta until it’s very dry before adding the other ingredients. If it’s too moist you’ll have to add more bread crumbs.
Place the cooked rice or pasta in a large bowl and let it cool completely.
In the meantime make the dressing.
Combine the mayonnaise, lemon
Peel and slice apples. Combine with the rest of the ingredients in a large bowl. Pour into pie shell. Bake at 400f for 30-40 minutes. Let cool before slicing.

Cook egg noodles in boiling water for 8 to 10 minutes or until tender. Drain well. Combine first 5 ingredients. Stir in chicken. Heat through. Spoon into 2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with olives. Top with noodles. Drizzle with remaining milk. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup cheese. Cover. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Uncover. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 teaspoon curry powder. Bake uncovered 5 minutes longer or until heated through.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 10 inch square pan. Cream 1/2 cup butter and 1 egg until fluffy. Stir in 2 cups cake mix until crumbly. Press into prepared pan. Bake 10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Spread 1/4 cup butter over hot cake and sprinkle 1 cup sugar over the top. Return to oven until topping is golden brown. Remove from oven. Immediately sprinkle 1 cup sliced fresh peaches over warm cake. Sprinkle 2 tbsp cinnamon over top of cake. Spread 8 oz cream cheese over cake. Cool completely before serving.

Brown polish sausages in oil in large skillet. Add cabbage, carrots, golden raisins, sugar, salt, vinegar and water. Cover and simmer for 1 hour or until vegetables are tender. Add parsley before serving.
Place wonton wrappers on ungreased baking sheetbrush with cooking spray. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup cheddar cheesesprinkle with 1/4 cup swiss cheese. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes or until golden brown.

Preheat pan. Grease with oil. In a bowl combine oil, sugar, vanilla, and eggs. Stir in flour a little at a time. Stir until smooth and thick like a thin cake batter. Drop by spoonfuls onto hot pan. Flip over after 3 minutes.
name: rose s world famous pancakesingredients: eggs, milk, flour, baking powder, sugar, saltpreparation:Preheat griddle. Beat eggs and milk together. Add dry ingredients and beat well. Pour on griddle. Cook until bubbles appear and flip over.
name: john f kennedy wafflesingredients: butter, sugar, egg yolks, egg whites, buttermilk, salt, cake flour, baking powderpreparation:Cream butterand sugar add yolks. Add sifted dry ingredients. Add milk. Fold in whites. Pam iron.
name: rich pancakes and wafflesingredients: eggs, milk, flour, baking powder, salt, butter, vanilla, nut
In a bowl combine 1 cup white sugar and 1 cup powdered milk. Blend well. Add 2 teaspoons margarine. Add 2 cups boiling water. Stir until blended. Allow to cool before using.

Cut onions into quarters and saute in oil until golden brown on all sides. Remove from skillet. Chop pineapple into chunks. Cook in pan with onions. In a small pan, combine vinegar, sugar, and water. Cook until sugar has dissolved. Pour over onion/pineapple mixture. Cook for 10 minutes until liquid has thickened. Pour into sterile jars, and seal. Process in boiling water for 10 minutes.

Beat together margarine, eggs, oil, sugar until creamy. Blend in flour, baking soda, vanilla and nuts. Drop by teaspoon full onto waxed paper on cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Do not overbake.

Sift together first 6 ingredients. Cut in shortening. Add molasses, water, and egg. Mix well. Spread in well greased 8 inch square pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes. Cool in pan on rack. Cut into squares.

Prepare cake mix according to instructions on box. Mix eggs with oil and add to cake mix and mix well. Pour into a greased and floured jelly roll pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 to 18 minutes. Meanwhile prepare the filling by mixing together the water and the pudding mix and let set up for a minute or two. Then mix in the milk and the vanilla. Take the cake out of the oven when it is done and let cool for about 5 to 10 minutes on a wire rack. Spread the pudding on the cooled cake and spread it evenly and smoothly all over the cake. Then refrigerate for 3 hours or overnight. When you are ready to serve, spread on the cool whip all over the cake and serve!

In a food processor or blender, combine the egg yolks, dry mustard, minced garlic cloves and wine. Process until smooth and thick. With the motor running, gradually add the saffron threads and cayenne. Add the pastis and continue to process until smooth. Transfer the mixture to a bowl. With a whisk or electric mixer, slowly add the olive oil in a thin stream until the mixture is emulsified. Stir in the lemon juice and season to taste with salt. Refrigerate.

Preheat grill for medium heat. Spray grill with cooking spray. Lay the fries on the grill. Cook 5 minutes per side or until slightly charred. Spray a baking dish with cooking spray. Arrange fries in dish in a single layer. In a small saucepan, melt butter over low heat. Whisk in 1/4 cup of the cheese until smooth. Pour over fries. Top with green onions. In a small bowl, stir together remaining cheese, half-and-half and paprika. Spread over potatoes. Bake uncovered 20 minutes or until hot and bubbly.
Au gratin is a French term literally meaning "by or with gratitude" which refers to the browning of cheese or breadcrumbs on foods such as macaroni or potatoes, by broiling or baking in an oven after the food has been doused with stock or white sauce.

In a large saucepan combine water and sugar. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Add the cranberries, apples and spices. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the vinegar and simmer for an additional 5 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Add the raisins and stir well. Serve cold or refrigerate.

Mix cream cheese and powdered sugar with electric mixer until well blended. Add melted chocolate and mix until smooth. Stir in vanilla and nuts. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Form into 1 inch balls. Roll into coconut or candy sprinkles. Store in refrigerator.

Place the broth in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the carrots and turkey, cover and simmer until the turkey is heated through and the vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in zucchini. Add rice and thyme and simmer until rice is tender about 30 minutes. Stir in Alfredo sauce. Serve with oyster crackers.
Soup is one of the best meals you can give your kids for lunch or dinner. They are full of nutrients, they are easy to digest and they are full of flavour.
There are so many different varieties of soups out there but I decided to pick out 20 recipes that are easy to make so that you can prepare them for your kids as soon as possible.
These soups are made with healthy vegetables, they are full of proteins and they are easy to prepare because they are made with just one pot.
These 20 recipes are not only easy but they are full of nutrition as well so that you can make them for your kids as often as you want.
Name: easy creamy

Beat eggs and sugar together until light and creamy. Add in the whole milk, vanilla extract and ground nutmeg. Whisk all together. Pour mixture into unbaked pie shells and bake at 400 degrees fahrenheit for 45 minutes or until a knife inserted into the middle of the pie comes out clean. For a yellow color to the pie, add 1/2 teaspoon of yellow food coloring to the mixture before adding the milk.

Mix the vanilla extract and the white sugar together in a large bowl. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Stir in the heavy cream, butter, and vanilla extract until well combined. In a separate bowl combine the flour and the brown sugar together until well blended. Stir into the sweet potato mixture until well blended. Pour into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with the chopped pecans. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 45 minutes. Serves 6.
Praline Sweet Potatoes And Apples
Creamy Pralines
Sweet Potatoes With Pecan Praline Streusel
Bourbon Brown Sugar Sweet Potatoes
Emeril's Crunchy Pralines
Praline Sweet Potatoes

Soak beans overnight or at least 8 hours. Drain and wash beans. Add enough water to cover beans and put into crock-pot or heavy pot. Bring to boil then reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 1-2 hours or until tender. Add water as needed. Add remaining ingredients and cook on low 1-2 hours more or until apples are tender and mixture is thick and creamy. Add more water if desired. Serve with biscuits or hot rolls.

Cook pasta as directed. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Spray with cooking spray. Add onion and cook about 3 minutes or until tender. Add tomatoes, honey and italian herb seasoning. Cook until heated through. Add beans and toss well. Drain pasta and toss with beans and pasta. Top with parmesan cheese.

Mix kosher gelatin with boiling water and stir until dissolved. Allow to cool slightly and fold in pound cake cubes. Gently fold in cream cheese and powdered sugar. Spoon into small glasses or dessert bowls and chill for several hours or until firm. Just before serving, top each serving with a dollop of lemon-flavored whipped topping and a sprinkling of lemon peel.
Name: lemon pieIngredients: graham cracker crust, marshmallows, milk, whipped cream, chocolate bar, lemon juice, lemon peel, confectioners' sugarPreparation: make crust. Melt marshmallows with milk in double boiler. Let cool. Fold in whipped cream and grated chocolate bar. Spread in pan and refrigerate.Name: vanilla icebox pieIngredients: graham cracker crust, vanilla wafer crumbs, cream cheese, sweetened condensed milk, coconutPreparation: make graham cracker

Mix cake mix according to package directions. Spread into greased jelly roll pan. Bake at 350F degrees for 12 minutes. Cool completely. In a small bowl, combine pecans and butter. Crumble over cooled white cake. In a large bowl, mix cream cheese, sour cream and powdered sugar until smooth. Stir in lemon rind. Spread over crumbled white cake. Chill for at least one hour. Makes about 60 squares.

Mix all the ingredients except water in a bowl. Add the water slowly until the dough forms a soft dough. Knead for a few minutes. Cover and set aside for 30 minutes. Heat a deep skillet. Slice seitan into 1/2 inch thick slices. Cook until browned. Remove from pan. Add sliced vegetables. Cook for a few minutes. Add water or vegetable stock. Cover pan. Cook until the vegetables are cooked. Add seitan. Cook until the seitan is heated through. You can add your favorite vegetables.
Dissolve pudding in water. Mix cake batter according to directions on box. Add water/pudding mixture, pumpkin, pumpkin pie spice. Pour into 12-cup bundt pan. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes. Cool.

In a 4 to 5 quart pot, combine soup mix and 8 cups water. Bring to a boil. Add the spam and cook until heated through. Stir in the rest of the ingredients. Simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and let stand for 10 minutes. Serve hot.
These recipes are from the cookbook "Ramen Noodle Cookbook" by Barbara Beery.

Grease a 9 x 13 baking dish with butter. Beat together the eggs, milk, vanilla and salt. Dip each slice of bread in the egg mixture, then place on top of each other in baking dish. Melt the butter with the brown sugar. Pour over the bread slices. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes, or until browned on top. Serve with maple syrup.

Preheat oven to 400 f. Scrub and peel 12 large carrots. Cut into 1" lengths. Place in a bowl, add cumin seed, brown sugar and olive oil. Mix to coat. Roast for 40-50 minutes or until tender. Remove from oven and let cool. Place in a food processor. Add cumin, ginger and tahini. Process to make a smooth paste. Add water a bit at a time until you get a spreadable consistency. Season with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Lightly spray a 13x9 baking dish. Separate crescent rolls. Layer dough on bottom and sides of dish. Press together. Spread American cheese slices on bottom. Beat eggs and milk. Pour over cheese. Sprinkle onion on top. Bake 15 minutes. Sprinkle with salt. Bake 5 more minutes. Serves 8.

Brown ground turkey in large skillet with cover. Drain fat. Stir in taco seasoning and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes. Stir in stewed tomatoes and corn. Simmer 5 minutes. Stir in rice. Cover and simmer 5 minutes more. Top with cheese and heat through.
1 cup finely shredded cabbage, 1 can of mushroom soup (10 1/2 oz), 2 cups grated cheddar cheese, 1/2 tsp garlic powder, 1/2 tsp onion powder, 1/2 tsp thyme, 1/2 tsp oregano, 1/2 tsp basil, 1/2 tsp parsley, 1/2 tsp dried sage, 1/2 tsp dried thyme, 1/2 tsp dried rosemary, 1/2 tsp dried marjoram, 1/2 tsp dried tarragon.
1 cup of finely shredded cabbage, 1 can of

Place the butter in an ovenproof skillet. Heat over medium heat until the butter melts. Add the eggs. Stir occasionally until the eggs are just set. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Stir in scallions. Let the eggs cool in the skillet. Meanwhile, chop the tomato. When the eggs are cool, spread them on the pita bread. Top with the tomatoes, scallions and feta. Sprinkle with the oregano. Serve immediately.

Combine all the remaining ingredients except the mustard in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Remove from heat, allow to cool to room temperature, and refrigerate for 1 hour. Place the chicken breasts in a shallow dish, and pour the mixture over the breasts. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 24 hours. Remove from the refrigerator 15 minutes before baking. Place the breasts in a shallow baking dish and pour the marinade over the top. Cover the dish with foil. Bake at 325 for 1 hour 30 minutes or until the internal temperature of the chicken is 165 degrees. Uncover the dish for the last 15 minutes of the cooking time to allow the top to brown. Serve hot with rice.

Drain and flake tuna with a fork. Combine with spring onions and breadcrumbs. Stir in creamed corn, chili powder and parsley. Beat together eggs and salsa. Add to mixture and mix well. Pour into a greased loaf pan. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before cutting into slices.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare a 9x13 inch pan with cooking spray. Beat cake mix, banana, oil, eggs and almond extract until well mixed. Spread batter into the pan. Sprinkle chocolate-covered English toffee bars over the top. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Cool completely. Frost with buttercream icing.
The cakes in this section are really easy to make.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Bake pie shells for about 10 minutes or until set. Mix all the remaining filling ingredients. Spoon into shells. Bake until the filling is set, 55 to 65 minutes. Let cool for at least 4 hours before slicing. Serve with whipped topping.
1. You should prepare your pies the day before, or at least the day before you plan to serve them.
2. Before you put the filling in the shells, make sure that you have a pan underneath to catch any leaks.
3. After you remove the filling from the oven, let the shell cool completely before adding the topping.
4. If you are baking more than one shell at a time, be sure that the shells are spaced evenly apart to ensure even cooking.
5. The best way to cut a slice of pie is to use a sharp knife and turn the pie plate so that you get a nice clean edge.
6. Always have a dish underneath the plate to catch any juices that might leak out of the pie.
7. If you

Place pollock in a skillet and sautee in butter. Add lemon juice and water. Cook for 3 to 5 minutes or until pollock flakes easily with a fork. Turn off heat and add breadcrumbs and paprika. Stir until blended. Serve immediately.

Combine the lentils and vegetable stock in a pot and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer until the lentils are tender but not mushy. Add the red bell peppers and bay leaf. Continue to cook for another 10 minutes. Remove the bay leaf. Pour the lentils and the vegetables into a large bowl and cool slightly. Add the spinach and lentil mixture to the bowl. Add the yellow onions and parsley. Add the olive oil and balsamic vinegar to the lentil mixture and toss. Season with the sea salt and freshly ground pepper. Serve warm.

Heat the pine nuts in a small heavy-bottomed frying pan over low heat until golden. Set aside to cool. Mix the leaves of the spinach and arugula together. Cut the pumpkin into small pieces. Toss the pumpkin pieces with the mixed leaves. Add the pine nuts, cherry tomatoes and the crumbled feta cheese. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Bring a large pan of water to the boil. Add the pasta and stir. Cook for 7-8 minutes or until al dente. Drain and return to the pan. Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a wok or large frying pan until smoking. Add the garlic and chilies and saut until crisp. Add the pasta and stir to combine. Season with the black pepper. Garnish with parsley and serve immediately.
In a skillet or wok, heat oil. Add onion and saute until soft. Add the sugar snap peas and cook 2 minutes. Add the steak and the seasonings. Cook 10 minutes. Serve over cooked rice or noodles.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In medium bowl, mix together flour, Splenda, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Set aside. In small bowl, mix butter and Splenda with buttermilk. Mix thoroughly and set aside. In another bowl, beat eggs and vanilla together until well blended and set aside. Combine egg mixture with butter and buttermilk mixture and mix together thoroughly. Stir in flour mixture just until moistened. Fold in strawberries. Spoon into 12 muffin cups. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown. Cool in pan for 5 minutes before removing to wire rack to cool completely. Makes 12 muffins.
Spread pear with mustard. Toast bread. Top with watercress and pear. Sprinkle with stilton.

Wash and dry the figs. Preheat the oven to 400F. Combine 1/2 cup of flour, the ground cinnamon, salt, and the basil in a shallow bowl. Beat the eggs in another shallow bowl. Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat, then dip each fig halfway in the eggs, then in the flour mixture, and set aside on a baking sheet. Repeat with remaining figs. Bake for 15 minutes or until browned.
Cut avocados in half. Remove pits. Scoop out pulp. Add to other fruits. Combine remaining ingredients. Add to fruit mixture. Chill. Serve in bowls. Top with croutons.

Sprinkle fish with salt. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle pan until hot. Rub fish with mustard then place on the pan and cook for about 3 minutes on each side. Meanwhile make the sauce. In a small bowl, combine the mustard, lemon zest, thyme leaves and the mustard seeds. In a large bowl whisk together the mustard mixture, garlic, lemon juice and 1 tsp water. Add the fish to the sauce and toss gently to coat. Serve the fish with the sauce poured over.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Peel carrots and cut them into 1/8-inch thick slices. Spread out on baking sheets. Bring the butter and honey to a boil in a saucepan over medium heatpour over the carrots and stir to coat. Bake for 20 minutes, or until the carrots are tender and the sauce has thickened. Sprinkle with the chopped walnuts before serving.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour two 8 inch layer pans. Sift the dry ingredients together. Cream the shortening and sugar together. Blend in the milk and the egg yolks. Sift in the dry ingredients alternately with the milk, ending with the dry ingredients. Beat the egg whites to stiff peaks and fold into batter. Pour into prepared pans and bake 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool in pans 10 minutes then invert onto wire rack to cool completely. Prepare the frosting by beating the butter until smooth and creamy, then mix in the vanilla and the confectioners' sugar and beat until light and creamy. Spread frosting between layers and on top and sides of cakes.

In a small bowl combine the first 4 ingredients. Mix well. Spread the mixture over 1 side of each roll. Top with cheese slices. Bake in a shallow baking dish at 400 degrees F for 10 minutes. Top with tomatoes and serve.

Line a 9 inch pie pan with oreo pie crust. Place in freezer while making ice cream. In a bowl, combine coffee ice cream and hot fudge sauce. Spoon mixture into the crust and freeze until ready to serve. Garnish with whipped cream.

Preheat the oven to 375 F degrees. Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper. Mix all the dry ingredients together in a small bowl. Melt the margarine in the microwave until it is liquefied. Add the sugars and beat until well blended, then add the egg and beat until the mixture is fluffy and lighter in color. Add the flours and beat on low speed until just blended. Stir in the peanut butter. Drop the batter by spoonfuls onto the cookie sheet. Bake the cookies for 6 minutes on each side. Allow them to cool on the cookie sheet for 5 minutes before removing them to a wire rack. Note: I usually use a scoop to drop the batter onto the cookie sheet. They are about 2 inches in diameter. The first time I made them they were too soft so I added 1/4 cup of sorghum flour and the recipe was perfect. I also add some white chocolate chips to the batter when I make them for my husband. I use my own recipe for the cookie sheet liner (see above) which makes clean up so

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Unroll the crescent rolls and press into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish pinching seams together. Bake 5 minutes. Remove from the oven and sprinkle the top with pieces of brie cheese. In a small bowl, combine the apricots and preserves. Spoon half the mixture on top of the cheese. Sprinkle with the cranberries and the almonds. Spoon the remaining apricot mixture over the top. Bake an additional 8 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the crust is golden brown. Cool 5 minutes and cut into squares.
Prepare lemon gelatin as directed on box. Refrigerate until nearly set. Add yogurt and lemon rind. Mix well. Refrigerate until nearly set. Sprinkle with ground ginger just before serving.

Prepare broccoli. Heat oil in skillet over high heat. Add gingerroot. Cook until fragrant 1-2 minutes. Add broccoli. Stir-fry until crisp-tender 2-3 minutes. Add orange zest and juice. Cook until thickened 1-2 minutes. Season with tabasco sauce. Garnish with chives.

Cook and drain the broccoli in a pot of boiling water until soft enough to mash with a fork. Drain and mash. In a large bowl combine all remaining ingredients. Mix the broccoli into the mixture. Pour into a greased 8 x 8 inch baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees Fahrenheit for 40-45 minutes or until knife inserted in the center comes out clean.

Peel the potatoes and grate them with the yellow onion. Squeeze out the liquid from the grated vegetables by hand or cheese cloth into a large bowl. Combine the grated vegetables with the breadcrumbs, flour, salt, white pepper, garlic powder and baking powder in the large bowl and mix well with your hands or wooden spoon. Make a well in the center of the mixture with your hands, add the 2 eggs and mix well again with your hands or wooden spoon. Shape into patties about 1/3-inch thick with a scoop or by hand. Heat the oil over medium high heat. When the oil is hot, fry the patties in batches until golden brown about 3-4 minutes per side. Remove from oil with slotted spoon or skimmer and drain on paper towels. Serve immediately with your favorite topping or enjoy them plain.

Preheat oven to 275. In a large skillet brown meat and onion in oil. Drain. Combine beer and liquid smoke in a large bowl. Add meat and liquid to bowl. Add spices. Mix well. Pour into 9x13x2 pan. Bake uncovered for 3 hours. After 2 hours stir and add cornstarch and cold water. Bake for an additional 30 minutes. Let stand for 15 minutes before serving. Serve with hot biscuits. Makes 10-12 servings.

Boil water. Cook zucchini until tender. Drain. Place in bowl. Add garlic and olive oil. Blend well. Cook onion in remaining water until tender. Add to zucchini. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve on bun with sour cream. Top with dill.

Place eggs in a bowl and cover with boiling water. Let stand for 15 minutes. Remove eggs and run cold water over them. Peel and chop into quarters. Place in a quart jar. Combine remaining ingredients and pour over eggs. Seal jar and refrigerate for 24 hours. Can be stored in jar in refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Prick potato skin with a fork at intervals to allow steam to escape during baking. Bake in preheated oven until tender, about 1 hour. Meanwhile, fry onions in 1 tablespoon oil until soft. Combine ketchup and remaining oilstir in onions. Cook until mixture is thickened into a sauce. Set aside to cool. Cube chicken breasts and stir into ketchup mixture. Sprinkle with coriander leaves and black pepperset aside to cool completely. When potato is baked, split open. Stir ketchup mixture into potato, sprinkle with light soy sauce. Top with cheese and bake until cheese is melted, about 5 minutes longer.
Heat margarine in pan. Saute onion, garlic, and seasoning. Add vegetables. Cook until crisp-tender. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat grill to medium-low. Cut pineapple in 1/4-inch-thick rings. Combine maple syrup, brown sugar, and cinnamon in medium bowl until smooth. Add pineapple. Turn until all sides are coated. Arrange on grill. Grill 4 minutes per side or until lightly browned and heated through. Garnish with mint sprigs, if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Combine mayonnaise, milk and basil in bowl. Add 1 teaspoon oregano and 1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes. Season with salt and pepper. Cut cucumber lengthwise in half. Scoop out seeds and thinly slice. Place in large bowl. Pour mayonnaise mixture over cucumber slices. Toss to coat. Chill for 1 hour. Serve with crackers.

Blend all the sauce ingredients together. Bring broth and water to a boil in saucepan. Add bean sprouts and cook for 3 minutes. Add sauce and simmer for 1 minute. Add the garlic and green onion. Serve hot or warm. Garnish with the sesame seeds.
1. How would you describe the difference in taste between regular and toasted sesame?
2. Which of these dishes sounds the most appealing to you?
3. Have you ever used sesame in cooking or baking? If so, what was it for?
4. Have you ever eaten at an oriental restaurant that served food from China or Japan? If so, which dish did you like the best?
5. Have you ever been to China or Japan? If so, what did you eat there?

Sift flour with cinnamon, salt, baking soda and set aside. Combine molasses, brown sugar, oil, egg substitute and lemon rind in medium bowl. Stir in flour mixture. Pour into greased and floured 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan. Bake for 60 to 70 minutes at 350 degrees f. Cool on wire rack for 10 minutes then spread yogurt on top of hot loaf. Cool completely on rack before slicing.

Slice sausages. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add sausages. Saut til browned. Add celery. Saut 2 minutes more. Add coleslaw mix. Stir in mustard, salt, sage, and garlic salt. Stir until well mixed. Add pasta. Stir until heated through. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Boil the sweet potatoes in a pot until tender. Meanwhile, saute red onion and garlic in vegetable oil in a skillet until the onion is translucent, then add turmeric, red pepper flakes, and curry paste. Saute for 1 to 2 minutes longer. Add coconut milk, bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes longer. Fold in spinach, cook until wilted. Serve over the boiled sweet potato. Garnish with cilantro leaves if desired.
name: easy special supper potatoes
ingredients: potatoes, water, sweet onion, garlic clove, butter, dill weed
preparation:Boil potatoes, onions and garlic, dash of salt, till potatoes are soft. Drain. Add butter and dill. Salt and pepper to taste. Stir. Serve.
name: sweet and sour german spinach
ingredients: bacon, frozen spinach, on

Mix flour, sugar, and self-rising flour together in a bowl. In another bowl mix the skim milk, vanilla essence, and egg yolks. Mix in the egg yolks to the dry mixture. Sift in the flour mixture to the egg yolk mixture to make a batter. Mix in the egg whites to the batter to make a smooth batter.

Cook turkey and onion until turkey is browned. Add mushrooms and cook 1 minute. Drain and cool. Beat egg with water. Combine all ingredients except for zucchini and mushrooms. Combine and mix well. Add zucchini and mushrooms. Form into loaves. Bake at 375 for 45 min.

In a small saucepan melt the butter over medium heat. Add the onion, ginger and garlic. Cook until the onions are clear. Add the spices. Cook until spices are fragrant. Let cool. Spread on flat bread and eat.

Heat the oil in a large frying pan. Add the sprouts and cook for about 2 minutes. Add the green peppers, celery and onions, season to taste with salt and pepper. Continue to cook for another 2 minutes. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease & flour two 9 inch round cake pans. Sift together flour, salt & sugar. Beat in the butter. Add the eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. Add the vanilla & mix well. Add the blueberries. Divide the batter between the two prepared pans & bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until done. Cool on a wire rack.

In a large bowl, cream together the sugar and the margarine until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg, the mint extract, and the flour. Fold in the chocolate chips. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 8-10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until lightly browned around the edges. Cool for 2 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks to cool completely. Store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line baking sheets with silpat or parchment paper or lightly grease with cooking spray. In a medium saucepan, bring brown sugar and butter to a boil over medium-low heat. Stir constantly until mixture thickens, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool for 5 minutes. In a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed, beat the cooled brown sugar mixture with the egg until smooth. Beat in vanilla extract. In a small bowl, mix together flour, baking soda and saltgradually beat into the brown sugar mixture. Fold in 1 cup bittersweet chocolate chunks. Drop by heaping teaspoons 1 inch apart onto the prepared baking sheets. Bake until set, about 10 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.
If you want to see how others made these cookies you can see them on the original post here.
These all look so delicious and fun! I am going to have to try them!
Those are so cool! I am

Cream together shortening and sugar. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Sift together flour, baking powder, and salt. Stir into creamed mixture just until blended. Stir in coriander. Drop by teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees f for 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from cookie sheet. Cool on wire racks. Serve on a platter.

Combine pasta, sour cream and cheese in large bowl. Mix well and refrigerate 1 hour. Just prior to serving, combine dressing and milk in small bowlmix well. Add vegetables and toss gently. Add basiltoss again. Chill until ready to serve.

In a medium bowl, combine flour, sugar, and butter. Mix well. Pat into a greased 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with pecans. Combine cool whip and powdered sugar in a bowl and mix well. Spread over crust. Combine cool whip and powdered sugar in a bowl and mix well. Spread over crust. In a medium bowl, combine pudding mix and milk. Mix well. Spread over top. Sprinkle with flaked coconut. Cover and chill for 1 hour.

Dip each chicken breast in egg and then roll in bread crumbs. Melt margarine in a skillet and saute chicken until brown. Pour in spaghetti sauce. Cook on medium heat for 20 minutes. Remove chicken and top with mozzarella and parmesan cheeses. Sprinkle on parsley. Return to skillet. Cover and cook 5 more minutes. Serve over hot spaghetti.

Preheat a barbecue to high heat. In a small bowl, combine the garlic with the oil and rosemary sprigs and season generously with the cinnamon and tabasco. Place the steaks in a single layer in a dish and pour over the marinade. Turn the steaks and pour over any remaining marinade. Cover and set aside for 20 minutes to marinate. Remove the steaks from the marinade and pat them dry. Sprinkle them lightly all over with salt and pepper. Place on a clean and well-oiled barbecue rack and grill for 4-5 minutes on each side for medium or until cooked as desired. Serve with the lemon juice and zest sprinkled over them and any remaining marinade.

Mix dry ingredients in a large bowl. Make a well in the middle of the dry ingredients. Add the egg. Then pour the liquid mixture into the well and stir until it is blended. Add the oil and stir until blended. Add the buttermilk gradually and stir until it is blended in. Drop the batter by large spoonfuls on a hot griddle. Cook until golden brown on each side. Serve with maple syrup, jam or fruit.
Rated 4 out of 5 by MamaB from Very Good! This is a great recipe! We've made it a few times and we all love it!
Rated 5 out of 5 by AKMOM from Amazing! This is the best pancake recipe I have ever found! I am so thankful for this website!
Rated 4 out of 5 by cfunk1984 from Good, But Not Perfect I made these this morning. I really like them, they are light and not too sweet, as most pancakes tend to be. However, I agree that they need to be cooked longer than most recipes for pancakes

Mix soy sauce, garlic, mustard and pepper in a bowl. Melt butter in a skillet over medium-high heat. Dip chicken into soy mixture. Cook in skillet until brown and done. Drain. Melt 1/4 cup butter in a small bowl. Stir in cracker crumbs. Spread 1/4 of crumb mixture over a plate. Add 2 tablespoons soy sauce. Press chicken wings into soy sauce. Then press into crumb mixture to coat. Repeat with remaining crumb mixture. Chill wings for at least 2 hours or overnight. Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add wings. Fry until brown and crisp. Remove from oil. Place in a serving bowl. Garnish with gingerroot. Serve with additional soy sauce.

Mix together corn, red onion, fresh parsley, zucchini, all-purpose flour, salt and fresh ground black pepper. Add 1 cup soda water. Mix well to form batter. Heat oil to 375 degrees. Pour batter by tablespoonfuls into hot oil. Brown on each side, about 2 minutes. Drain on paper towel. Serve immediately.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Chill for several hours before serving. Serve with tortilla or cracker chips. Makes 1 cup.

Cook the vegetables separately in boiling water until tender. In a large pan heat the butter until it is very hot. Add the carrots and mushrooms. Saute until the carrots are bright orange. Add the broccoli. Add the cooked pepper. Season with the salt and pepper. Add the cilantro. Serve.

Mix all together except yeast. Dissolve yeast in 1/4 cup warm water. Mix into dry ingredients and place in a container with lid. Store in refrigerator. Feed once a week by mixing 1/2 cup of room temperature milk or water with 1/2 cup of room temperature flour. Do not stir. Stir only to mix. This will feed for 4 days or so. You can store this for as long as 18 months but it is best to discard if not fed every 4 days or so.

Brown hamburger. Add diced onion. Add shredded hash browns. Add eggs. Add cheddar cheese. Mix. Put in pie crust and bake at 350 for 25 minutes.
Name: Sausage BallsIngredients: ground sausage, cheddar cheese, panko crumbs, butter, garlic salt, and eggsPreparation: Brown sausage. Mix everything together. Form into balls and place onto a cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.
Name: Hidden Cheeseburger Roll UpsIngredients: ground beef, sour cream, tomatoes, lettuce, mayo, mustard, cheddar cheese and rolls (halves)Preparation: Cook ground beef. Add sour cream and tomato. Spread on roll and add lettuce, mayo and mustard. Top with cheddar cheese. Roll up and enjoy.
Name: Mac and Cheese CasseroleIngredients: elbow macaroni, cheddar cheese, evaporated milk and butter
Place all in crockpot. Stir well. Cook on low for 8 hours. Serve with tortilla chips.

Boil the pasta according to the package. In a separate pan heat the oil. Add the garlic and saut until the garlic turns golden. Add the lemon juice and the chicken. Stir until the chicken is cooked. Add the pasta and the broccoli. Mix well. Add salt and pepper according to taste. Serve hot.

Melt butter in a large heavy skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until soft and translucent. Add the carrots, honey and vinegar. Cook for about 5 minutes until the vinegar is absorbed. Add the spices and stir for a few seconds. Add the raisins and cook for another 3 minutes. Serve warm or cold. Serve with pork or poultry.

In a large pot, bring the water to a boil. Add the rice and cook for about 10 minutes. Stir in the bay leaves. Add the sausage and cook until the sausage is lightly browned. Stir in the tomato paste and continue cooking for about 5 minutes. Add the lima beans, olive oil, onion, garlic, white pepper and continue cooking for about 10 minutes. Serve with the green onions.
Cut mushrooms into 1/4-inch slices. Heat oil in skillet. Add garlic, mushrooms and seasonings. Saute over medium heat until mushrooms are browned and liquid evaporates. Serve over toast.

Mix cake according to directions. Add apricot nectar, butternut flavoring, extracts and eggs. Beat well. Bake as directed. Sprinkle with powdered sugar before serving. Drizzle with lemon juice if desired.
Slice the bread in half horizontally. Spread with cottage cheese. Sprinkle with tomatoes and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Wash the spinach thoroughly and remove the thick stems. Melt the butter in a heavy-bottomed pot. Add the flour. Stir with a wooden spoon and cook for a few minutes. Add the broth and the seasonings. Cook for a few minutes and add the spinach. Simmer for 10 minutes. Whisk the eggs together in a bowl. Add the eggs to the pot and stir. Heat through. Serve immediately.

Mix mayo, mustard and adobo. Place in shallow dish. Dip each breast half in mixture. Cover with bread crumbs. Place on baking sheet. Bake at 350* for 20 minutes. Mix remaining adobo and salsa. Serve with salsa mixture.

In a saucepan combine cream of chicken soup and broth. Add chicken and heat to boiling. Add pepper and garlic salt. When done add sliced mushrooms. Serve over cooked pierogi with melted butter on top.

Cook the macaroni in boiling water until tender but firm. Drain off water and return to pan. Add cooked bacon, potatoes and onion, with nutmeg and parmesan cheese. Mash until smooth then add whipping cream. Stir until smooth and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Combine water, salt, and orange juice in large saucepan. Bring to boil. Stir in ricecover. Reduce heat to low. Cook 20 minutes. Stir in marmalademix well. Remove from heat. Fluff with fork. Sprinkle with almonds and scallions. Serve chicken on top of rice.

Place the cooked chicken in a bowl with the green onion and parsley. Toss gently to mix. In another bowl whisk together the olive oil, fresh lemon juice, garlic powder, salt. Pour over the chicken mixture and toss gently to coat. Serve with pita bread.

Combine everything but the lamb together in a shallow dish and stir well to combine. Add the lamb and turn to coat evenly. Cover and refrigerate for 4 to 8 hours. When ready to cook, preheat broiler or grill to medium high heat. Remove the lamb from marinade, discarding excess marinade and place on grill. Cook for about 4 minutes per side or until done to your liking.

Combine the dressing in a jar with a lid. Shake until well combined. Add the cabbage and mix well. Put the dressing in the refrigerator for at least an hour. Just before serving add the onions, butter, almonds and sesame seeds. Mix well. Add a little extra dressing if necessary.
Melt unsweetened chocolate with butter and sugar. Stir in egg yolks and vanilla. Fold in flour and walnuts. Pour into greased 9x13 pan. Bake 25 to 30 min. at 350. Cool and cut into bars.

In a large pot of boiling water, cook potatoes until tender. Drain potatoes and rinse under cold water to cool. Combine potatoes and onions. Combine all dressing ingredients. Toss potatoes and onions with dressing. Sprinkle with blue cheese.

In a saute pan, saute the garlic cloves in olive oil over medium heat for about 1 minute. Add the squash and saute until golden brown. Add the onion and saute until translucent. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve as is or over pasta, rice, etc.
In a small bowl combine olives, romano cheese, parmesan cheese, lemon juice and extra virgin olive oil. Blend well. Add anchovies and capers and blend thoroughly. Serve with crackers or bread.

Place ribs in a 5-quart crockpot. In a bowl, stir together the remaining ingredients until well blended. Pour over the ribs. Cook on low for 6 hours or until the meat is tender. Discard bay leaves. Serve on a bed of cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 15x10x2-inch baking dish. Layer half of the bread cubes, and sprinkle with half the sausage and half the cheese. Beat the eggs, milk, and seasonings until blended. Pour over the top, and sprinkle with the remaining sausage and cheese. Bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven. Serve immediately.
Beat eggs and add creamer and raisins. Mix well with rice. Bake in greased casserole dish for 35-45 min. at 350 degrees. Sprinkle with ground nutmeg and cinnamon before serving.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, heat syrup and sugar until boiling. Remove from heat and stir in peanut butter and vanilla. Pour over cereals. Stir in peanuts and chocolates. Spread on wax paper. Let cool. Store in airtight container.

Combine all ingredients in a medium sized bowl and whisk together until well blended. Melt 1 teaspoon of the butter in a 9" round pan over medium heat. Pour in the egg mixture. As the omelet begins to set in the center, sprinkle on the ham and spring onions and continue to cook until the center is set and the top is golden brown. Cut the omelet into wedges and garnish with a slice of tomato. Serve immediately.

Mix the sugar and egg until light and fluffy. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well. Pour into a well greased 10 x 15 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Let cool before serving with ice cream or whipped cream.

Pre-heat the over to 375f. Lightly oil a baking dish and place the fish in the dish. Drizzle with a little olive oil and sprinkle with garlic salt and a little seasoning salt. Pour about a tablespoon of italian dressing over the top and bake until done which will take about 10 minutes or until the fish is flaky. Serve with lemon wedges and steamed broccoli or a green salad for a quick and easy meal.

In a large saucepan, combine chicken, rice, soup mix, water, onion, garlic salt, pepper and butter. Bring to a boilcover and reduce heat. Simmer for 20 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in parsley. Makes 4 servings.
Beat the cream cheese in a bowl with a wooden spoon until it is smooth. Add the meat, the jam, and the mustard and mix thoroughly. Serve with ritz crackers.

Bring the vinegar to a boil and remove from heat. Add the water and stir until dissolved. Add the salt and stir until dissolved. Add the garlic and stir until dissolved. Add the dill and stir until dissolved. Let cool to room temperature and add the cucumbers. Stir to coat the cucumbers with the brine and refrigerate for 24 hours before serving or storing in airtight container for up to 4 weeks.

Mix up the mac & cheese. Follow directions on the box. Fry the veggies in a skillet with margarine until tender. Add the meat. Add the pasta mixture to the skillet and stir in the milk, cheese, garlic powder and seasonings. Stir until hot and thickened.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut the pears in half and core. Combine the brown sugar and flour in a shallow dish. Spread the raspberries on the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish. Arrange the pears over the top. Sprinkle the topping mixture over the top of the fruit. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes in the preheated oven, until the topping is lightly browned. Serves 10.

To prepare the dried sage, place in a small pot with the olive oil over medium heat for 30 seconds. Remove from heat and let steep for 20 minutes. Strain and discard the olive oil. Place the ground lean pork in a large mixing bowl and add the rest of the dried herbs and spices along with the salt and pepper and sugar and red pepper flakes and egg yolk and thyme and mix thoroughly with clean hands. Divide the mixture in 8 portions and form into small oval shaped patties. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet and add the patties to brown on both sides. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350f. Butter and flour two 8x4x3 inch loaf pans. Cream butter and sugar together. Beat in eggs one at a time. Stir in almond extract. Combine flour and baking powder, sifting together. Gradually add to butter mixture alternating with water. Fold in ground almonds. Divide batter between pans. Bake for about an hour or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool on racks.

Mix together old-fashioned oatmeal, peanut butter and vanilla in large mixing bowl. Beat together brown sugar and milk in saucepan until smooth. Pour over peanut butter mixture and stir well. Let stand for about 15 minutes. Drop spoonfuls of mixture on wax paper or greased cookie sheet. Let stand until hard. Store in covered container in refrigerator or freezer.

Heat olive oil in pan and add sliced onion and garlic. Once the onion and garlic starts to soften add the bacon and mushrooms. Cook for 5 minutes. Once the bacon and mushrooms have started to brown add the chicken. Season with black pepper. Cook for 5 minutes. Turn the chicken over and add the thyme and the double cream. Let it simmer for 5 minutes. Serve with the bacon and mushroom mixture.

Heat oven to 375 F. Place chicken in large baking dish. Combine hoisin sauce and apricot jam in small bowl. Spread mixture evenly over chicken. Cover dish and bake 40 minutes. Stir lemon rind into sauce. Spoon sauce over chicken. Sprinkle with cilantro and green onions.

Heat the milk in a saucepan until very warm. Pour into a large bowl. Add the brown sugar, butter, and yeast. Let stand 5 minutes or until foamy. Add the flour and salt. Turn onto a floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic. Form into a ball and place in a lightly oiled bowl. Turn to coat. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk (1 to 1 1/2 hours). Turn out onto a floured surface and divide into 10 equal pieces. Roll each into a 16 inch rope and twist into a pretzel shape. Place 2 inches apart onto a lightly greased baking sheet. Beat the egg whites until stiff. Brush with egg white and sprinkle with coarse salt. Bake for 15 minutes or until brown. Serve with mustard and assorted cheese.

Place in a 13 x 9 pan buttered or sprayed with a non-stick cooking spray. Arrange cereal in a single layer. Pour maple syrup over top. Bake at 350 degrees F for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and sprinkle with peach slices. Let cool 20 minutes before serving. Serve with milk.
Combine first 3 ingredients in a blender. Process until smooth. Serve immediately.

In a medium saucepan, combine the cornstarch, water, and sugar. Bring to a boil. Cook and stir for about 3 minutes. Add the strawberries and cook and stir until the mixture thickens. Remove from heat and cool. Spoon the filling into the pie shell. Cover with whipping cream. Chill for at least 2 hours before serving.

Pour rum into an 8-ounce glass filled with ice. Add cinnamon stick and stir to mix. Top with sparkling apple cider to fill glass. Add a dash of lemon juice to taste.
The New York Times Book Review, February 15, 2015.

Brown sausage. Drain and crumble. In a large skillet cook onion, green pepper and celery until tender. Add the water. Cook the soup mixture 5 minutes. Add the rice and cook over low heat until all liquid is absorbed. In a greased 1 1/2 qt. casserole bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Add the bread crumbs and butter. Bake 5 more minutes.

Cream butter and brown sugar. Add flour and salt. Add oatmeal and baking soda and mix well. Chill for one hour. Shape into balls and put 1-2 inches apart on greased baking sheet. Bake at 375 for 8-10 minutes.

Sift together flour, 2 Tbsp sugar and salt. Beat together eggs and 1/2 cup milk. Add to dry ingredients alternating with butter. Add 2 Tbsp flour and 1 Tbsp milk last. Stir in blueberries. Heat griddle to medium heat. Drop batter onto griddle with small spoon. Cook 3-4 minutes or until lightly browned. Turn to brown the other side. Serve with sour cream or whipped cream. Makes about 18 blini (3 inch)

In large saucepan, bring water to boil and add pasta. Cook according to package directions. While pasta is cooking, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add garlic, crushed red pepper flakes and saute 1 minute. Add crushed tomatoes. Add salt and pepper and reduce heat. Cover and simmer 20 minutes. Add sausage and break up with wooden spoon. Continue cooking 5 minutes. Stir in vodka. Remove from heat. Stir in heavy whipping cream. Toss with pasta and sprinkle with parsley.
Saute bacon until crisp. Add broccoli florets and cook until tender-crisp. Add chives to bacon mixture. Stir in pine nuts. Makes 6 servings.

Place chops in skillet with margarine. Add parsley and saute until lightly browned. Sprinkle with flour and curry powder. Stir until well blended. Stir in bouillon granules. Add milk and wine. Cover. Simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in apple. Serve over rice.

Cream together cream cheese and butter until light and fluffy. Add powdered sugar and vanilla and beat until smooth and fluffy. Beat in coconut and chocolate chips. Chill dough in refrigerator at least 1 hour or overnight. Roll into 1-inch balls. Place on wax paper lined baking sheet and refrigerate at least 30 minutes to firm up dough before rolling in coconut.

Roll out the pizza dough to form 12 inch square. Cut the dough into 2 inch squares. Place 1 cube of salami on the corner of each square. Roll the dough around the salami cube and pinch the ends to form a knot. Place the knots on a baking sheet. Brush the tops with beaten egg. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Drizzle with spicy brown mustard.
Name: Chicken Fajitas Ingredients: 1 (12-ounce) package chicken fajita strips 1 (4-ounce) can chopped green chilies 1 can mild salsa 1 (20-ounce) can black beans 1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese 1 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese 1 (14 1/2-ounce) can refrigerated pizza crust 1 tablespoon chili powder Preparation: Preheat oven to 350F. In a skillet, cook chicken strips and ch

Mix first 3 ingredients. Add water and eggs and mix until blended. Chill for 1 hour or overnight. Shape into 1-inch balls and roll in chunky peanut butter. Place on waxed paper on a tray and refrigerate overnight. Makes 2 1/2 dozen.
name: no bake chocolate cookie barspreparation:Beat milk and cocoa until smooth. Add the other ingredients and mix well. Spread in a 13x9x2 inch pan. Chill until firm. Cut in squares. Makes 24.
name: crunchy cookie dough barsingredients: graham cracker crumbs, margarine, white sugar, brown sugar, corn syrup, milk, vanilla, butterscotch chips, pecanspreparation:Crush graham crackers. Combine with margarine and sugars. Mix in corn syrup and milk. Add vanilla and stir until well blended. Add chips and nuts. Press into 9x13 pan. Chill. Cut into bars.

Combine flour and seasonings. Beat egg white until foamy. Dip each onion ring in egg white mixture. Coat in seasoned flour. Place in single layer in sprayed shallow pan. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes or until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a 9 x 5 inch loaf pan or 2 8-inch round cake pans. In a medium bowl combine the flour, baking soda and saltstir well with a whisk. In a large bowl beat the egg until frothy. Beat in the buttermilk, oil and bananasmix well. Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredientsmix just until blended. Pour into the greased pan(s). Sprinkle with the nutspress gently into the top of the batter. Bake at 350 degrees f for 50-60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean. Let the bread cool in the pan(s) for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. Makes 1 loaf or 2 8-inch cake layers.

Mix the cornmeal and dry seasonings in a shallow dish. Beat the egg and buttermilk and set aside. Dip the drumsticks into the buttermilk mixture and then into the cornmeal mixture to coat thoroughly. Place the drumsticks in an ungreased 15 x 10 baking dish and bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes or until cooked through. Serve with warm honey mustard for dipping or barbeque sauce if desired.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add onions, stirring frequently until tender, about 3 to 4 minutes. Beat eggs in large mixing bowl until well blended. Stir in tomatoes and cilantro. Add onions and cheese to eggs. Cook onion-cheese mixture over low heat, stirring constantly until eggs are set but still moist. Turn off heat and stir in tortilla chips until evenly distributed. Makes 4 servings.
Mix together parmesan and margarine. Sprinkle with paprika and italian seasoning. Bake 5-10 minutes until crisp.
Combine lime juice. Sugar. Tomato. Cucumber. Onion. Green chili. Coriander. And fresh mint. Stir. Season to taste with salt. Serve chilled.

In a large skillet, cook the meat, onions, and green peppers until browned. Drain. In a 2-quart casserole, combine the meat mixture, rice, tomato sauce, hot water, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and sugar. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir occasionally.

Melt butter in small saucepan over medium heat. Add minced garlic. Stir until combined and remove from heat and set aside to cool slightly. Place 1/2 stick butter in a small bowl and set aside to soften. Cut each slice of white bread in half lengthwise. Brush cut sides with melted garlic butter and place in a single layer on a baking sheet. Sprinkle with a little garlic powder and italian seasoning. Bake for 5 minutes, turn over and bake until crisp and browned, 5 to 10 minutes more. Remove from oven and sprinkle with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Serve hot.

Place the sweet potatoes in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce to low and simmer until potatoes are tender. Drain and mash until smooth. In a medium bowl mix together butter, sugars, eggs, milk, nutmeg and vanilla. Stir in sweet potatoes. Pour into prepared pie shell and bake at 350 for about 1 hour or until a knife inserted in the middle comes out clean. Let pie cool before serving. Serve with whipped cream.

Combine butter and icing sugar in a bowl and beat until light. Add flour and salt and beat until combined. Add almond extract. Divide dough into two pieces, wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate at least one hour. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Roll dough to about 1/4 inch thick. Cut into 1 inch pieces. Bake on ungreased cookie sheets for 10 minutes. Cool completely on wire racks. Dip in chocolate or almond bark.

Sauté green onions and bacon until bacon is cooked. Remove from heat. Blend eggs with milk and add to frying pan with bacon and green onion. Cook until omelet is firm to touch and then place brie cheese and pecans on the top. Broil for 1 to 2 minutes and serve.

Sprinkle steak with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Combine orange juice, garlic, cilantro and chiles in small bowl. Reserve 1/3 cup of this marinade. Combine reserved marinade with remaining marinade. Add beef and turn to coat. Cover and let stand at room temperature for 1 hour. Prepare barbecue (medium heat) brush grill rack with oil. Remove beef from marinadediscard marinade. Grill beef to desired doneness. Thinly slice beef across the grain. Toss sliced beef with reserved marinade and remaining marinade. Serve with cilantro sprigs.
These are recipes that are for Flank Steak. You may also browse other recipes by using the recipe search box.

Place cinnamon stick, cloves and cardamom pods in bottom of saucepan and pour over 1/2 cup boiling water. Cover and steep for 10 minutes to infuse spices with flavor. Drain and discard the liquid and spices from the pan. Melt 2 tsp of the oil and 1/2 tsp salt in the pan and cook the basmati rice for 2 minutes stirring continuously to coat the rice with the oil. Add the cinnamon stick, cloves, cardamom pods and cumin seeds and cook for another 2 minutes. Add the chicken stock and the remaining oil and bring to the boil. Cook for 20 minutes and stirring occasionally. The rice will have absorbed all the liquid and the rice will be soft and fluffy with the cinnamon stick and cloves visible as bits of spiced rice. Serve hot with the cinnamon stick and cloves sprinkled over the top and drizzle with the remaining oil.

Beat together the sugar, oil and eggs until they are well blended. Sift together the flour and baking soda. Add this to the mixture and mix until just combined. Pour into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until done. Cool completely and cut into 9 pieces. Serve with whipped cream and strawberries.

Cook the bacon in a frying pan until the fat is rendered. Remove the bacon from the pan and keep the fat. Add the brussels sprouts to the fat and cook until tender and browned. Add the apple and cook for 2 minutes. Add the red wine vinegar to the pan along with the apple juices. Cook for 2 minutes more. Add the bacon. Season to taste. Serve hot.

In mixer bowl beat together eggs and sugar. Mix in sour cream. Add spice cake mix and beat well. Add pudding mix and beat until smooth. Fold in pecans. Pour into greased and floured 10-inch tube pan. Bake at 350 for 45-50 minutes. Cool on wire rack and dust with confectioners sugar. Serve with buttercreme frosting.
Chill a large pitcher for 3 hours or overnight in the fridge. Combine all ingredients in a large pitcher and stir to combine. Add fruit to pitcher. Serve in glasses over ice.
Mix together the 1st 5 ingredients. Add the mayonnaise and milk and mix well. Add buttermilk, lemon juice and vinegar and mix well again. Chill before serving.

Melt butter in saucepan. Add carrot and onion. Cook and stir till tender. Add flour. Cook and stir till smooth. Add paprika, dry mustard, cubes and 1 cup water. Cook and stir till boiling. Remove from heat. Add milk and water. Add cheese. Heat till smooth. Makes 4 servings.
Broccoli Cheese Soup (Recipe)
recipe: broccoli cheese soup
1 c. (1/2 lb.) broccoli, chopped fine
2 c. (8 oz.) shredded Cheddar or Monterey jack cheese
1/2 t. garlic salt (or 1 t. garlic powder)
In 2-quart saucepan, saute chopped onions in 2 tbsp. margarine until goldenadd broccoli and cook 5 minutes more. Stir in 1 c. of the milk. In medium saucepan, combine remaining milk and 1/2 c. flour. Cook over low heat until thickenedstir into broccoli mixture. Stir in Cheddar
In medium bowl combine cream cheese and dressing mix until blended. Stir in chicken and barbecue sauce. Serve with crackers or veggies or whatever you like.

In a large saucepan, bring the water and sugar to a boil over high heat. Add the cranberries and cook for about 2 minutes, until the berries begin to pop. Reduce the heat to low and add the cointreau and orange zest. Continue to cook for about 10 minutes longer. Cool to room temperature. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 400. Beat together egg and splenda. Add yogurt and combine. Add in the dry ingredients. Spoon into muffin cups and sprinkle with a little more splenda and cinnamon. Bake until golden brown. Makes about 6 muffins.
This page was last modified 01:23, 28 March 2007.

Preheat the oven to 375. Spray a 2-quart baking dish with the oil cooking spray. In a large bowl, toss the apples with the brown sugar and cinnamon. Add the rice krispies and mix well. Spoon into the prepared baking dish and bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until golden. Serve warm.

Cream the butter and sugar. Add the eggs one at a time, beating the mixture well after each egg is added. Stir in the pineapple and lemon juice. Fold in the bread cubes. Pour into a greased 13 x 9 cake pan or baking dish. Bake, uncovered, at 325 degrees until set.

Line two cookie sheets with wax paper. In a large heavy-bottomed pan over low heat, melt the butter. Add the sugar and stir until the mixture boils. Add the almonds, stirring constantly for about five minutes until they are lightly browned. Pour the mixture onto the wax paper lined cookie sheet and spread it out evenly to about a half inch thickness. Cool until set, about an hour. Melt the chocolate over low heat and spread evenly over the almond layer. Cool until set. Break into pieces and enjoy!

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add olive oil to pan. Add garlic and red pepper flakes. Cook until fragrant. Add the shrimp and sprinkle with sea salt. Cook until the shrimp are firm and pink, about 3 minutes. Toss in the lemon juice and the dry sherry. Continue to saute until the liquid has reduced to a syrup. Stir in the paprika. Transfer to a serving platter. Sprinkle the parsley over the top. Serve with crusty bread.
Brown turkey with onions. Add soy sauce and pepper. Cook rice in boiling water. Add turkey mixture to rice. Stir in onion soup mix. Add veggies to the top. Bake for 20 minutes.

Brown beef in skillet. Stir in water, barbecue sauce, mustard and onion flakes. Bring to a boil then reduce heat to simmer for 10 minutes or until rice is tender. Remove from heat and stir in cheese. Add dill pickles to each serving as desired.

Preheat oven to 350. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the oil and saute the chicken on all sides. Remove the chicken from the skillet and add the balsamic vinegar and orange juice to the pan. Bring to a boil. Add the chicken stock and the rosemary. Cook, uncovered, until the liquid is reduced by half. Add the chicken and butter. Season with salt and pepper. Place the chicken in a baking dish and bake for 15-20 minutes.

Chop onion. Slice cabbage. Heat oil in skillet. Add onion. Cook until translucent. Add beef and cook until no longer pink. Add bay leaf and cook for 1 more minute. Add the water. Bring to a boil. Add the carrots. Cover and simmer until the cabbage is tender. Remove bay leaf. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Cook vegetables in nonstick pan until tender. Add rice to pan. Heat until rice is hot. Stir in cheese. Heat until melted. Divide rice mixture among tortillas. Top each tortilla with 2 tbsp. salsa. Wrap tortillas around filling and serve. Makes 4 servings.

Spread one slice of bread with strawberry preserves. Sprinkle a little cinnamon over the preserves. Top with a slice of oven-roasted turkey breast and then a slice of cheese. Spread the other slice of bread with more strawberry preserves and sprinkle more cinnamon over it. Top with the other slice of cheese and then the other slice of oven-roasted turkey breast.

Blend together milk, butter, oil, eggs and sugar until smooth. Add flour, salt and baking powder and mix until smooth. Add poppy seeds. Turn out onto a floured board and knead lightly. Divide the dough into 20 equal pieces. Flatten with your palm then roll each piece into a ball shape with your fingers. Place on a greased cookie sheet and bake at 350 for 30-40 minutes until golden brown.
Saganski in english. Saganaki in english. Saganaki in english. Saganski in english. Saganski in english. Saganski in english. Saganaki in english. Saganaki in english. Saganaki in english. Saganaki in english. Saganski in english. Saganaki in english. Saganaki in english. Saganaki in english. Saganski in english. Saganaki in english. Saganski in english. Saganaki in english. Saganski in english. Saganaki in english.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cut haddock into 2 fillets. Rinse fillets. Dry well with paper towels. Spread fillets with lemon juice. Spread a little butter and a little garlic powder over fillets. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Spread a little white wine over fillets. Put in a baking pan. Spray the fillets with pam. Bake 20 minutes or until done. Serve with mashed potatoes or rice.

Combine all the ingredients in a bowl. Mix well until blended. Cover and refrigerate for 4 hours or overnight. Serve with crackers or bread.
name: cheese and spinach fettuccine
ingredients: fettuccine, frozen chopped spinach, milk, cornstarch, butter, salt, parmesan cheese, blue cheese, parsley
preparation:Cook fettuccine as label directs. Adding spinach for the last 5 minutes of cooking. Drain. In saucepan, mix milk and cornstarch until smooth. Add butter and salt. Cook on med-hi heat, stirring, until mixture boils. Stir in parmesan and bleu cheese. Add to drained fettuccine. Toss to coat well. Sprinkle with parsley.
name: spinach feta orzo
ingredients: garlic clove, red pepper, olive oil, orzo pasta, chicken broth, dry white wine, fresh spinach, feta cheese, salt
preparation:Saute

Place the black peppercorns, cinnamon sticks, green cardamom pods, and whole cloves in the boiling water. Simmer uncovered for about 10 minutes. Add the tea and simmer for another 10 minutes. Remove the spices and discard them. Add the milk and honey and simmer for an additional minute or two until the milk is hot. Serve hot or cold. Serves 4.
I have always wondered about what tea they drink on Star Trek - Voyager - I just got a glimpse when they drank the spice tea on the episode where Tuvok had his eyesight restored. This is it!
The mint julep sweet tea sounds great - it's going to be hot tomorrow and I want to have something cool to drink!
Mint Julep sounds great!! I think I will make that today!! Thanks for the recipe!
I think I'll have to try the "Persian Love Tea." I love the flavor of rosewater and have had rosewater tea at a restaurant that I've wanted to replicate for the longest time.
The spice coffee

In a medium bowl, combine the honey, mustard, and pepper. Add the chicken, turning to coat. Place the coated chicken on the foil-lined baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes or until the juices run clear when the thigh is pricked with a fork. Makes 4 servings (serving size: 1 piece of chicken and 1/4 cup of onions).

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine dry ingredients in a bowl. Make three holes in dry mixture for next three liquid ingredients. Pour vanilla into 1st hole, vinegar into 2nd and oil into 3rd. Pour water over all. Mix with fork or wire wisk just until well blended. Pour into two 9 inch pans coated with cooking spray. Bake for 25 - 30 minutes. Cool completely in pans on a wire rack.

Cream shortening and sugar, add milk, vanilla, baking soda, baking powder and salt. Beat until creamy. Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites (they are stiff if they hold their shape when dropped from the spoon onto the floor). Fold in the flour. Drop by spoonful on greased cookie sheet. Bake 10 minutes at 400 degrees. Makes about 6 dozen.

Combine all in a heavy-bottomed pan over low heat. Stir often until all is melted and mixed through. Remove from heat. When slightly cooled, beat with electric mixer until smooth. Pour into buttered dish and let set in refrigerator. Cut into squares.

Combine coconut milk and sugar in small saucepan. Heat over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Add vanilla bean. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Cool. Combine papaya and onion in bowl. Toss lightly with chicken breasts. Place in greased casserole dish. Pour coconut mixture over chicken. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Serve with rice.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion, garlic and thymesaute until onion is transparent. Add broth and bring to a boil. Add orzo. Reduce heatcover and simmer for about 15 minutes or until orzo is tender. Stir occasionally. Add chicken. Simmer about 4 minutes. Stir in Parmesan cheese. Stir occasionally until cheese is melted. Season with pepper.
Combine fennel bulb with oranges in a bowl. Drizzle with oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add smoked salmon and green onions. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Place the ham hocks in a pot with the water and bring to a boil. Add the onion, bay leaf, oregano and pepper. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 2 hours or until the ham hocks are tender. Remove the meat from the bones and return the meat to the pot. Add the beans to the pot and heat through. Serve hot with crusty bread.

Beat cream cheese until smooth. Add condensed milk and beat on medium speed for 3 to 4 minutes, or until well blended. Add lemon juice and vanillabeat until well blended. Pour mixture into crust. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 6 hours before serving. Remove from refrigerator 1 hour before serving. Top with cherry pie filling and refrigerate for 30 minutes before serving.

Combine cream cheese, mayonnaise, dill seed, dried parsley flakes, garlic powder, dried basil. Mix well. Place carrot, celery rib, and dried parsley flakes into a bowl. Spread carrot mixture onto each tortilla. Roll up. Slice into 1 inch pieces. Makes 36 pieces.

Cook plums with jelly in a saucepan over medium heat until fruit is tender. Beat eggs with sugar in a bowl. Melt butter in a skillet. Pour egg mixture into skilletcook over medium heat until thickened (about 4 minutes). Remove from heatstir in cinnamon. Spread polenta in a greased baking dish. Top with plums. Pour egg mixture over plums. Bake uncovered at 325 for 15-20 minutes until set. Garnish with vanilla yogurt and chopped berries.
Beat together cream cheese, condensed milk, and vanilla extract. Add Realemon juice to taste. Fold in cherry pie filling. Pour into baked graham cracker crust. Sprinkle with toasted almonds. Chill.

Peel eggplant. Chop eggplant in food processor until smooth. Transfer to a bowl. Add all remaining ingredients. Mix well. Serve with pita bread or crackers.
This recipe contains potential food allergens and will effect people with Eggplant, Garlic, Natural Sweeteners, Lemon, Pea, Onion allergies.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 13x9 pan. In a bowl mix together the sugar and eggs. Blend in the melted butter and vanilla. Stir in the flour and salt. Stir in the nuts. Spread into pan. Bake for 25 minutes. Cool and cut into bars.
Cook rice as directed. Strain and add frozen peas, olive oil, parsley flakes, salt and pepper. Mix well. Reheat rice and serve.

Place apples and blueberries in a buttered 13x9 baking dish. Combine the sugar, flour, salt and cinnamon. Cut in butter until mixture is crumbly. Sprinkle over fruit mixture. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes or until bubbly.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chickencook and stir until no longer pink. Cut into bite-sized pieces. Cook rice as directed on package. Add broth to rice mixturecook 3 minutes. Add chickencook 2 minutes or until hot. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining ingredients. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine first 4 ingredients in a large bowl. Beat at medium speed with an electric mixer until well blended (about 2 minutes). Combine flour, cocoa, baking soda, and saltstir into butter mixture. Stir in Hershey s Kisses. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 350 degrees F for 10 minutes or until set (do not overbake). Cool on baking sheets 2 minutesremove to wire racks to cool completely (about 10 minutes). Store in an airtight container at room temperature. Yield: about 4 dozen.

Melt butter over low heat in a medium saucepan. Add brown sugar & stir until completely melted and smooth. Pour mixture over unbroken matzos & stir until coated with syrup. Pour on wax paper & spread out. Sprinkle with chocolate chips & let set until hardened (about 1 hour). Break into small pieces & enjoy.

Cook bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Add tomatoes and cook until softened. Add kale and cook until wilted. Add onion and cook for about 2 minutes. Add bacon and tomatoes. Toss to combine. Add raisins. Toss to combine. Add vinegar and toss. Season with salt and pepper.

Cook the onion and garlic in the oil in a saucepan over a medium heat for 4 minutes until softened and beginning to brown. Add the rice and stir for 1 minute. Pour in the stock and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat, cover and simmer for 15 minutes until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender and fluffy. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the lemon rind and herbs. Cover the pan for 5 minutes to let the flavors infuse and serve the rice immediately.

Whisk together first three ingredients. Transfer 1 tablespoon glaze to small bowl. Mix in rice vinegar and set aside.
