Brush 1 side of salmon steaks generously with half of glaze in medium bowl and place salmon steaks, glazed side down, onto barbecue. Grill until glaze is slightly charred, about 4 minutes. Brush top side of salmon steaks with remaining glaze in medium bowl. Turn salmon over and grill until second side is slightly charred and salmon is just opaque in center, about 5 minutes longer. Transfer salmon to plates and drizzle reserved glaze in small bowl over salmon and serve.

Put 2 cups water in large pot. Add cardamom pods, fennel seeds, ginger. Simmer until spices are fragrant. Remove pods and seeds. Add 1/2 tsp honey to each cup. Add ice to each cup. Stir in 1 tsp honey to each cup. Add 3 fresh mint leaves to each cup. Makes 2 servings.

Wash zucchinis and slice off the ends. Scoop out the seeds and discard. In a skillet, saute the zucchinis for 1 minute in a little olive oil. In another skillet, saute the onion and garlic until they begin to brown and the onion is translucent, about 10 minutes. Add the tomatoes and simmer until the sauce thickens a little. Add the seasonings and the bread crumbs and mix well. Add the zucchinis and toss lightly with the sauce. Divide the zucchinis evenly between the halves, stuffing them full of the mixture. Top with the parmesan cheese and bake for 45 minutes uncovered at 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Serve with salad or garlic bread.

In a saucepan over high heat, bring the white wine to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer until reduced by half. Remove from the heat and add the butter and lemon juice. Season with cayenne pepper and salt and pepper to taste. Divide the broccoli florets between four individual serving plates. Spoon the sauce over the top of the broccoli and serve.

Heat the olive oil. Add the garlic and stir. Add the zucchini and stir. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the cooked pasta and mix well. Season with salt and pepper. Add the ricotta cheese. Cook for a few minutes. Serve with grated parmesan cheese.

Bake cake in 9-inch springform pan. Cool completely. Crumble. Blend ricotta cheese with extract, sugar. Add milk and beat until smooth. Spread over crumbles. Chill at least 8 hours. Remove sides of pan. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Cut the avocado in half. Remove pit. Sprinkle with salt. Place face down on cookie sheet. Bake for 15 minutes or until soft. Remove avocado from oven. When cool enough to handle remove skin from avocado. Dice. In a blender or food processor, combine all remaining ingredients. Blend until smooth. Serve with tortilla chips.

Cook beef and onion together. Drain fat. Add garlic and green chilies. Mix together soup and mushrooms. Add to meat mixture. Stir in corn. Top with corn chips. Pour over enchilada sauce. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.
Boil potatoes until tender. Drain and return to pan. Mash well with garlic and butter. Add chipotle and milk and stir. Heat until warmed. Garnish with parsley and paprika.

In a medium size bowl combine the tomatoes, tomato sauce. Onion. Apple cider vinegar. Sugar. And salt. Mix well. Chop the bell pepper and jalapeño peppers. Add to the salsa. Add the chili powder. Mix well. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Serve with tortilla chips.
This is the best ever salsa.
I'm going to try this recipe, but I'm going to use canned green chilis instead of jalapeños. My son has allergic reactions to those little devils.
I made this for the first time last night. It was so good that I was afraid to eat it. I was worried that it would be too spicy but it wasn't at all. I have to say this is the best salsa I have ever had. I will be making this again and again.
Made this for the first time today. It was sooo good. I'll have to use less salt and pepper next time though. I like salsa to be more mild.
Made this for the first time tonight

Bring to boil the water, unsweetened apple juice, salt and apple pie spice in a medium pot. Add the rice and stir well. Bring to boil again. Add the cinnamon sticks, cover the pot and let simmer until the liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Fluff the rice with a fork before serving.

Preheat oven to 350f. In small bowl stir together preserves and 1 tsp. cinnamon. Lightly brush 12-inch skillet with oil. Place 6 biscuits in skillet. Spread with 1/2 cup preserves mixture. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup pecans. Repeat with remaining 6 biscuits. Bake 20 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 300f. Bake 15 to 20 minutes longer. Remove skillet from oven. Top with whipped cream. Sprinkle with remaining 1 tsp. cinnamon. Serves 6.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Spray 13x9-inch pan with cooking spray. In small bowl, combine rosemary and next 4 ingredients. Rub over both sides of chicken. Place in pan. Bake 40 minutes. Meanwhile in small bowl, combine broth, sun-dried tomatoes and cornstarch. Bring to boiling over medium-high heatcook and stir 2 minutes or until thickened. Serve with chicken and beans.

Mix lemon gelatin in 1 cup boiling water. Stir in 1 cup sugar and 1/2 teaspoon of pumpkin pie spice. Stir in 2 1/2 cups cold water and pour into a 9x13 glass baking dish. Chill in refrigerator for 4 hours or overnight. When ready to serve, stir in canned pumpkin and cool whip. Garnish with pecans and serve chilled.
Combine first six ingredients. Rub into the chicken. Bake at 350 for one hour. Serve hot. May serve over rice or noodles. Enjoy.

Peel cucumbers. Cut in half lengthwise. Scoop seeds out of center. Chop. Combine in large bowl with onion. Combine mustard, sugar, salt and pepperstir into cucumber mixture. Coverrefrigerate 2 hours or overnight.

Cut the steaks into 1 1/2 inch cubes. Combine the flour and the seasonings. Dredge the steaks in the flour mixture. Heat the oil in a large skillet. Add the onions and saute until tender. Add the garlic and saute 1 minute. Add the broth and bring to a boil. Add the tomatoes and the green chilies. Add the cubes and simmer until tender, about 1 hour. Makes 6 servings.

Heat oven to 350. In 10-inch skillet, cook bacon over medium heat until crisp. Remove to paper towelscrumble. In bacon drippings, brown pork chops for 2 minutes on each side. Remove from panset aside. In same pan, saute onion and garlic in bacon drippings until tender. Stir in soy sauce, lemon juice and honeyheat through. Return chops to pansprinkle with chili powder and curry powder. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until chops are no longer pink and juices run clear. Garnish with bacon.

Sift flour, sugar, salt and baking powder together in a mixing bowl. Work in shortening until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add eggs and milk. Mix just enough to form a ball of dough. Roll out to 1/8 inch thick on a lightly floured board. Cut into squares using a pastry cutter or pizza cutter. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Let cool on wire rack. Melt butter in skillet. Add sugar, milk, and oil. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Add cinnamon, nutmeg, vanilla. Let cool. Spread filling on each pastry. Roll up. Place on a waxed paper-lined baking pan. Chill overnight. Remove from refrigerator 1 hour before serving. Dust with confectioners sugar before serving.

In a small bowl, combine first 5 ingredients. In a large bowl, combine hoisin mixture and chicken. Marinate in the refrigerator for 8 hours, turning once. Thread chicken and vegetables alternately onto four 12 inch skewers. Broil 4 in. From heat for 2-4 minutes or until chicken juices run clear and vegetables are tender. Serve immediately with pineapple chutney.

Combine lime juice, orange juice, garlic, cumin, thyme, cilantro, bay leaves in large zippered bag. Add roastmarinate in refrigerator 24 hours. Remove roast from marinade and pat dry. Heat olive oil in heavy-bottomed skillet over med-high heat. Add roast to skilletcook until browned on all sides. Reduce heat to lowadd water to pancover. Cook until roast is tender, approximately 2 hours. Remove roast from pancover with foil. Whisk together reserved marinade and cornstarchstir into pan juicesbring to boil over med-high heat. Cook 2 minutes or until sauce thickens. Slice roast across the grainserve with sauce.

In a skillet, heat oil and brown the pork chops on both sides. Add soup. Stir in the rice. Add the juice and season with salt and pepper. Cook on low until the liquid is absorbed. Remove chops and stir in green onions. Serve.

Heat olive oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant but not brown. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Toss cubes with garlic mixture and sprinkle with salt. Spread out on a baking sheet and toast until lightly browned and crisp, about 15 minutes. Keep in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days.

Combine the brown sugar, sour cream and mint sprig in a bowl. Chill for a few hours to blend flavors. Just before serving, arrange the green grapes on a serving platter. Spoon the mixture over the grapes. Garnish with additional mint sprigs if desired.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add pork. Brown well on all sides. Add all remaining ingredients except cilantro and cook until well browned. Reduce heat to medium-low heat and simmer until tender. Season with cilantro. Serve with tortillas, sour cream, guacamole and salsa.
Combine the first four ingredients in a punch bowl. Add ice. Squeeze the lime over the mixture. Stir in the bourbon. Garnish with lime wedges and a sprig of mint.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease and flour muffin tin. In a bowl mix together oats and 1 1/2 cup of the flour. Set aside. In another bowl combine sugar and 1 1/2 cup of the flour. Add oil and salt. Beat with electric mixer until smooth. Add egg. Beat for 2 minutes. Stir in milk and vanilla. Add dry mixture in thirds and beat after each addition. Stir in raspberries. Fill muffin cups 3/4 full. Bake for 18 to 20 minutes or until done. Let cool on wire rack.

Place the walnuts and pine nuts in the bowl of an electric food processor fitted with the metal blade and process until finely chopped. Add the oil and continue to process until combined. Add the cheese, nutmeg and seasonings and process until well combined. Add the heavy cream and process until smooth and creamy. Serve with fresh pasta or on toasted bread.

Combine coconut milk, red curry paste and nam pla (fish sauce) in a small bowl. In a wok or deep frying pan over high heat, add beef and cook 2 to 3 minutes on each side. Add onions and cook 1 minute. Stir in red curry sauce and bring to boiling. Simmer until beef is tender, about 30 minutes. Stir in basil and cook 1 minute. Serve over rice.

Place 1 tbsp of granulated sugar in bottom of 6 mugs. Add 1 tsp of ground cinnamon to each mug. Slice 2 biscotti diagonally and arrange in each mug. Pour 1/2 cup of espresso into each mug. Add 1 tbsp of vanilla bean paste to each mug. Add 1 tbsp of ricotta to each mug. Top with 1 tbsp of cocoa powder and dust with ground cinnamon. Serve warm.

Cream butter and sugars together until smooth and creamy. Beat in egg. Blend in vanilla and m&m bits. Add flour and baking soda. Stir in milk chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoons onto cookie sheets. Bake at 350 for 8-10 minutes. Let cool on wire racks. Store in air tight containers. Makes about 5 dozen cookies.
Combine vinegar, oil, cumin, salt, pepper in a small bowl. Toss with rice. Add avocado. Mix in tomato and beans. Add cilantro. Serve cold.

Beat eggs with heavy cream. Add dill, salt and pepper. Melt real butter in a large skillet over medium high heat. Pour in eggs. Cook for about 1 minute. Add the shredded cheese. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes more or until eggs are set. Flip and cook other side. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. In a large bowl combine the sweet potatoes, eggs, 2 tablespoons butter, 1/4 cup half-and-half and vanilla. In a medium bowl combine the flour, brown sugar, 1/4 teaspoon salt and the remaining 1 tablespoon butter until crumbly. Sprinkle over the potato mixture. Stir until evenly distributed. Spread into a 2-quart casserole dish. Bake for 1 hour or until top is golden brown. Sprinkle with nuts and bake for 5 minutes longer or until nuts are toasted.

Combine mustard and jam in a small bowl. Brush tenderloin with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place tenderloin on a grill pan. Grill until browned, about 5 minuts per side. Spread mustard mixture evenly over tenderloin. Grill until no longer pink. Serve warm.

Heat oven to 375 degrees. Mix sherry wine & sour cream. Place half of mixture in shallow bowl. Place breadcrumbs in another shallow bowl. Heat oil in heavy skillet over medium high heat. Add chicken breasts. Cook for 3 minutes. Turn and cook for 3 minutes. Place in casserole dish. Pour sherry mixture over top of chicken. Top with breadcrumbs. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with cracker crumbs. Bake 5 more minutes.
name: japanese style sesame chickeningredients: chicken breast, sesame oil, ground ginger, onion powder, garlic powder, sesame seeds, soy saucepreparation:Use the sesame oil to coat a wok or nonstick pan. Add chicken and cook over low heat until almost cooked through. Mix the ginger, onion powder, garlic powder, and sesame seeds in a small bowl. Sprinkle over chicken and saute over medium-high heat. Turn

Preheat oven to 180c. Wash the strawberries and dry them well. Toss with the brown sugar to coat the strawberries evenly. Spread the strawberries in a single layer on a baking tray. Roast for 20 minutes until the sugar has caramelized and the strawberries are soft. Cool. To serve, spoon a dollop of chantilly on a plate and arrange the strawberries around it. Drizzle with the caramelized syrup if desired.
Dissolve pudding in boiling water. Add gelatin and stir until dissolved. Add enough cold water to make 2 cups. Combine all in a 9 x 13 pan. Chill until firm. Fold in the coolwhip.

Butter the outsides of the slices of rye bread. Butter the slices of swiss cheese. Place a layer of sauerkraut on each slice of bread. Place a layer of corned beef on each slice of bread. Top with slices of the swiss cheese. Butter the top side of the sandwiches. Place in a preheated 350 degree oven for 15 minutes or until the cheese is melted.

Preheat oven to 200 degrees C. Place tomatoes and garlic in a large baking dish. Roast 25 to 30 minutes or until garlic is golden and tomatoes are very soft. Cool slightly. Remove garlic. Place tomatoes and garlic in a food processor. Process until pureed. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add ham and mushrooms. Cook 1 minute or until mushrooms soften. Add the red pepper and onions. Cook 3 minutes or until crisp-tender. Add garlic and basil. Cook 3 minutes or until garlic is golden. Stir in the chicken. Cook 5 minutes or until no longer pink. Add the sauce and mozzarella. Cook 2 to 3 minutes or until melted. Serve immediately over hot pasta. Serves 6 to 8.

Combine the first five ingredients in a bowl and cut in the butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in the sugars. Add the vanilla, eggs and chocolate chips and mix well. Shape into a 12-inch circle on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 F for 20 minutes. Let cool on a wire rack. Cut into wedges. If desired, sprinkle with additional chocolate chips.

Mix together first 3 ingredients. Gradually add oil, whisking until smooth. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Toss together celery and leaves, apples and walnuts in large bowl. Add dressing and toss well. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 375. In a large skillet, brown ham until crisp. Add onion and peppercook and stir until tender. In a small bowl beat eggs with seasoning salt and pepper. Stir in milk. Pour over ham mixture. Cook and stir until eggs are set. Remove from the heat. Spoon into the pitas. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 3-5 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Cut each pita in half and serve.
Mix first three ingredients in a small bowl. Add liquid smoke to taste. Crumble salmon into spread. Toss in chopped green onions. Serve with crackers.

Beat together the cream cheese, milk, and parmesan cheese until smooth. Stir in the bacon, parsley and onions. Roll the crescent roll dough out into a 12 inch square. Brush half of the cheese mixture over the dough. Roll the dough up into a log starting at the shorter side. Cut the log in half then cut each half into 8 pieces. Place the pieces cut side down on a baking sheet and bake at 375 for 10 minutes or until golden brown.

Season both sides of chicken with salt and pepper. In a large skillet heat oil and brown the chicken on both sides. Remove chicken from pan and saute onions and pepper in oil left in skillet for 2 to 3 minutes or until onion is translucent. Return chicken to pan along with dressing mixture and simmer until hot. Serve with rice and garnish with chopped parsley if desired.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (160 degrees C). Line a jelly roll pan with aluminum foil. Grease foil with vegetable oil.In a large mixing bowl, combine the chocolate chips with the yellow cake mix. Add the sour cream, vegetable oil and eggsbeat until smooth. Fold in the powdered sugar and vanilla extract until just combined. Pour batter into prepared jelly roll pan.Bake in the preheated oven for 40 to 45 minutes, until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let stand for 10 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack to cool.Whip the vanilla instant pudding mix with the sour cream until smooth. Spread over cooled cake while still warm. Cut into squares. Serve with powdered sugar to garnish.

In a large mixing bowl, cream together cream cheese and blueberry pie filling until smooth and well blended. Spread cheese mixture evenly between two slices of French bread. Beat egg and milk together and dip both sides of sandwich into mixture and place in skillet that has been greased with vegetable spray or cooking spray and cook until brown and cheese has melted on both sides. Serve with maple syrup and sprinkle with cinnamon sugar.

Preheat oven to 400°F. Toss potatoes with 1 tablespoon of olive oil and a handful of rosemary and garlic. Season well with salt and pepper and spread in a shallow baking pan. Bake for 30 minutes until golden and tender. In a small bowl toss tomatoes with a handful of herbs and olive oil. Season lightly. Heat a large cast-iron skillet over medium high heat and add another tablespoon of oil. Sear lamb chops for 3 minutes a side or until brown and just cooked through. Spoon tomatoes over potatoes and arrange the seared lamb chops on top. Top with feta cheese and olives and serve hot.
Name: turkish lamb chopsIngredients: Onion, salt, olive oil, fresh thyme leave, lamb loin chops, salt & freshly ground black pepper, lemon wedgePreparation: Sprinkle the onion with the salt. Squeeze the juice out of the onion and discard it. Add the oil and thyme

Bring water to a boil in a saucepan. Add the green tea leaves and spearmint and simmer for about 10 minutes. Turn off heat and let stand for an additional 10 minutes. Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a pitcher. Stir in the sugar and serve over ice.
tea with fresh mint is one of the most famous recipes in India and around the world. The recipe is very simple and you only need a few ingredients. It is very important to wash and clean the fresh herbs before you use them because they may carry bacteria. You can eat the tea as a light meal or as a dessert. You can also use it as a base for your healthy smoothies.
tea with fresh mint is one of the most famous recipes in India and around the world. The recipe is very simple and you only need a few ingredients. It is very important to wash and clean the fresh herbs before you use them because they may carry bacteria. You can eat the tea as a light meal or as a dessert. You can also use it as a base for your healthy

In a large pot, mix the milk and flour together over medium heat. Cook until the mixture thickens, stirring frequently. Add the shredded cheese and garlic powder. Stir until melted. Serve over vegetables or noodles.

In a 6-quart slow cooker, combine onion and garlic. Add oil and cook on low for 10 minutes. Stir in chicken and cook on low until chicken is done. Stir in broth and next 6 ingredients. Cover and cook on low for 3 hours or until done. Stir in cornstarch and water until blended. Add pepper and cilantro. Cover and cook on high for 15 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in cilantro.

Slice the tortilla in half. Place the turkey, cheese, lettuce leaf and tomato down the center of the tortilla. Fold the sides of the tortilla up and over the filling. Roll up the sandwich. Cut the wrap in half and serve.
name: peanut butter and jelly sandwichesingredients: bread, peanut butter, jelly, margarinepreparation:Cut the bread into halves. Spread the peanut butter and jelly evenly over the breads. Sprinkle the margarine over the breads. Put the breads together. Serve.
name: honey sandwichesingredients: bread, honey, margarinepreparation:Cut the bread into halves. Spread the honey and margarine evenly over the breads. Put the breads together. Serve.
name: hot cross bunsingredients: bread flour, active dry yeast, milk, water, sugar, margarine, nutmeg, eggs, vanilla extract, currantspreparation:In the bowl of a stand mix

In a blender or food processor, combine cream, horseradish and lemon zest. Process until smooth. Stir in lemon juice and season to taste with salt and fresh ground pepper. Serve chilled in a bowl. Place the oysters in the cream and refrigerate for 4 hours. Serve with chives.

Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper. In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the onion, red pepper, and garlic. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the carrots and cook for another minute. Add the rice and cook for 1 minute. Add the chicken stock and bring to a boil. Add the chicken breasts. Lower the heat, cover, and simmer for 12 minutes. Remove the chicken breasts to a plate. Increase the heat to high and stir in the parsley. Stir in the chicken breasts and heat through. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375f. Toss vegetables with 1tsp oil. Spray a 8-inch pie plate with cooking spray. Saute vegetables with garlic and herbs in a large pan over medium-high heat 5 minutes. In a small bowl combine remaining 1 tsp oil with milk. Beat in eggs with milk mixture. Add vegetables to pan. Spoon egg mixture evenly over vegetables. Bake 20 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese and bake until egg mixture is set and golden around edges 10 minutes. Cool 10 minutes. Serve warm.
i love this page... it is soooo pretty!!
i just love that china... i can't wait to see the rest!
I love that pattern! I can't wait to see what you do with it!
I love the new look! I am so happy for you!
The new look is wonderful! I'm so happy for you that you have a new home. Congratulations!
You have a wonderful collection of china. I look forward to seeing it all.
I'm not sure if you remember

Slice the french bread lengthwise. Spread with spaghetti sauce. Add some chili (without the beans) and sprinkle with some of the cheeses. Bake until cheese melts and crumbs are golden. Top with green onions and serve.

Put chicken into a large stockpot and cover with 2 gallons cold water. Bring to a boil over high heat, skimming off any foam that rises to the surface. Lower heat and simmer uncovered for 2 to 2 1/2 hours until the chicken is very tender. Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside to cool a bit. Strain the stock through a colander or cheesecloth lined sieve into a large bowl or another stockpot. When the chicken is cool enough to handle, remove the meat from the bones and discard the skin and bones. Cut the meat into bite-size pieces and return to the pot with the stock. In a separate pan over medium high heat, saute the onion, carrot and leek in a little olive oil until the vegetables are tender-crisp. Add the celery ribs and black peppercorns and saute for an additional minute or so. Stir the vegetable mixture into the stock and add the parsley and thyme. Bring to a boil and lower heat to a simmer. Cook for about another hour until the

Prepare barbecue (medium-high heat). In small bowl, combine butter with lime zest and lime juice. Season with chili powder and pepper. Grill corn for 12 minutes or until done, turning occasionally and brushing with butter mixture during last 2 minutes of cooking time. Serve with lime wedges if desired.

In a skillet heat cooking oil over medium heat. Place pork into hot oil, turning once to brown both sides. Place steaks into a 3 quart baking dish. Mix sour cream with enough milk to make a thin paste. Spread over pork steaks. Melt butter. Sprinkle corn flake crumbs over the top of the sour cream mixture. Bake uncovered at 350f for 30 to 40 minutes or until crumbs are golden brown and the pork is done through. Serve with mashed potatoes and green beans.
If you need a quick easy supper these are perfect!
I cooked up two of them and served it with a baked potato, baked beans (out of the can) and a nice fresh garden salad.
They were a big hit! It was quick to put together but still tasted like I had spent a lot of time making it!
We are having this tonight too!
I have one of those cookbooks that I got when I was a kid. I am not sure how old the book is but my mother has it too and she got it

Place 1 lemon wedge in each of 4 bowlssqueeze remaining lemon wedges over all. Add almonds and sprinkle with cheese. Add artichokes and season with salt and pepperdrizzle with oil and toss to coat. Garnish each serving with 1 or 2 garlic cloves.
Prep Time: 20 minutes Cook Time: 5 minutes Serves: 20 Note: For best flavor use fresh basil and lemon juice.
Prep Time: 30 minutes Cook Time: 30 minutes Serves: 4 Prep Time: 20 minutes Cook Time: 5 minutes Serves: 20 Note: For best flavor use fresh basil and lemon juice.
Prep Time: 45 minutes Cook Time: 30 minutes Serves: 6 Prep Time: 15 minutes Cook Time: 10 minutes Serves: 4 Prep Time: 45 minutes Cook Time: 30 minutes Serves: 6 Prep Time: 45 minutes Cook Time: 30 minutes Serves: 6 Prep Time:

Scald milk. Beat in eggs. In a large bowl, mix together flour, salt & baking powder. Pour in scalded milk & egg mixtureadd melted butter & beat until smooth. Spread mixture over hot griddle or skillet. Bake on medium heat until bubbles form on top & edges are golden brown. Turn over & cook until other side is golden brown. Cut into wedges & serve warm with butter & sugar.

Preheat oven to 400f. In a large bowl combine sausage, cheese and eggs. Stir together sour cream, mustard and onion flakes. Add to sausage mixture and stir to combine. Spoon mixture into 2 greased 8-inch round cake pans. Place biscuits on top of the mixture. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Garnish with sliced green onions. Serve with hot sauce, if desired.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Rinse mahi mahi with lemon juice, sprinkle with lemon peel and set aside for 10 minutes. Meanwhile combine garlic salt and pepper in a small bowl and stir to blend. Sprinkle both sides of the fish with the pepper mixture and set aside for 2 more minutes. Place fish in a shallow baking pan and bake until the fish flakes easily with a fork. While fish is baking mix together mayonnaise and white onion in a small bowl until well blended and set aside. To serve place the fish on a serving platter and top with the mayonnaise mixture. Garnish with lemon peel if desired. Serves 4-6 people.

Preheat oven to 375. Clean chicken inside and out. Combine remaining ingredients in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer for 5 minutes. Turn off heat. Stir in honey. Combine all in a large baking dish. Bake uncovered for 1 hour. Turn on broiler for 5 minutes. Remove from broiler and serve.
Tonight's dinner was a potluck at the church. I was the second to last to arrive. The first to last was the minister. He had a big bowl of spaghetti and a pot of spaghetti sauce. I had a pot of chili. I added my pot to his bowl. That was our contribution to the potluck. We ate what was left over. There were no leftovers.
A man came up to me after dinner. He said, "I'm not a big spaghetti fan, but I love the sauce in that bowl. Would you please tell me what was in it?" I told him. He thanked me profusely and went to

Lightly saute the mushrooms in the butter. Add the flour and stir over moderate heat until well blended. Gradually add the water, stirring constantly to blend well. Cook over low heat until thickened and smooth. Add the cream and salt and pepper to taste. Serve sprinkled with the parsley.

In heavy medium saucepan bring chicken stock and half-and-half to simmer over medium heat. Gradually add grits, whisking until smooth. Reduce heat to low. Simmer until thickened and creamy, about 15 minutes. Stir in jalapenos and cheese. Season with salt and black pepper. Serve with shrimp or chicken.

In a large bowl, mix the jellied cranberry sauce and marmalade. Add the ginger and the water. Stir well. Add the fresh cranberries and the walnuts. Serve chilled or at room temperature.
name: triple cranberry sauceingredients: frozen cranberry juice concentrate, sugar, fresh cranberries, dried cranberries, orange marmalade, fresh orange juice, orange zest, allspicepreparation:Combine juice concentrate and sugar in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat, stirring until sugar dissolves. Add fresh and dried cranberries and cook until dried berries soften and fresh berries begin to pop, stirring often. Remove from heat and stir in marmalade, juice, orange zest and allspice. Cool completely. Cover and chill at least 2 hours. Can be made 3 days ahead.
name: cranberry feta and walnut saladingredients: mixed salad greens, dried sweetened cranberries, feta cheese

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place seeds on baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes. Mix tamari, oil, garlic, onion and cayenne together. Toss seeds in sauce and place back in oven for another 10 minutes. Stir occasionally.

Season and brown the beef in a skillet. Add the consomme, wine, garlic, and onion salt, cover, and simmer for 1 hour or until tender. In a small bowl combine the cornstarch with a little cold water and stir into the mixture in the skillet until slightly thickened. Serve over rice.

Combine the first 4 ingredients in a small saucepanbring to a boil over medium-high heat. Stir in chili powder and pepperboil until mixture is reduced by about one third of its original volume (about 10 minutes). Remove from heatstir in pecans.

Sprinkle haddock with salt and pepper. Cook in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat for 2 minutes on each side until cooked through. Spoon about 1/3 cup salsa on each fillet. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup mayonnaise and 1/4 cup Monterey Jack. Broil 2 inches from heat for 2-3 minutes until cheese is melted. Serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 400f. Grease a 12-cup muffin tinset aside. Sift millet flour, all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt together in a medium-sized mixing bowl. Mix together dry ingredients by stirring with a spoon until mixed well. Mix together orange juice, oil, syrup and zest in a separate container by stirring with a spoon until mixed well. Add dry ingredients to liquid ingredients by stirring with a spoon until mixed wellmix until smooth. Mix in raisins by stirring with a spoon until mixed wellmix until raisins are evenly distributed throughout. Spoon batter into muffin cups by using an ice cream scoop (about 2 Tbsp.)drop 12 mounds of batter into tinset aside. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until muffins are golden brownremove from oven and let cool on wire rack for 5 minutes before removing muffins from tin. Muffins can be stored at room temperature for up to 3 days

For pie crust: In a medium bowl, combine 1 1/2 cups flour and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Cut in 1/4 cup butter until mixture resembles coarse meal. Add 2 tablespoons ice watergently stir. Press dough into a 9-inch deep-dish pie platetrim overhang. Cover and refrigerate. For filling: In a medium bowl, beat 1 1/2 cups cream cheese, 3/4 cup sugar and 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg until smooth. Add 3 egg yolks and 1 teaspoon vanillabeat until well blended. Pour filling into crustsprinkle with 1/2 cup walnuts. Cover and chill for 2 hours. Beat 3 egg whites in a medium bowl until foamy. Add 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon cream of tartarbeat until soft peaks form. Gradually add 1/2 cup sugar, 1 tablespoon at a timebeat until st

Prepare cake mix according to package directions. Stir in 2 cups pecans and 1 cup quick oats. Pour batter into a greased 9x13-inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely. Beat together powdered sugar, 1/4 cup oil, and 1 tablespoon milk at low speed with a mixerincrease speed to high, and beat until smooth. Spread frosting over cakesprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup pecans. Makes 16 servings.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Rinse under cold running water and drain well. Set aside to cool. Meanwhile chop grapes. Combine with remaining ingredients. Add cooled pasta and toss lightly. Refrigerate until serving time.

In a mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the pumpkin pie spice and vanilla extract. Blend well. In another bowl combine the flour and baking soda and stir with a fork. Add the dry mixture to the wet mixture and stir just until the dry ingredients are moistened and the mixture is smooth. Roll the dough into 1-inch balls and place them on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes at 350 degrees F or until the edges are lightly browned. Remove from the cookie sheet and cool on wire racks. Store in an air-tight container for up to 1 week.

Combine butter, sugar, egg yolk, flour, and orange peel in a medium bowl. Chill for 30 minutes. Shape mixture into 1-inch balls. Roll in finely shredded coconut. Freeze for 2 hours or until firm. In a medium bowl, beat together butter, egg white, flour, and salt. Shape into 1-inch balls. Roll in finely shredded coconut. Freeze for 2 hours or until firm. To serve, place one of each ball in a paper cup with a straw and serve as an ice cream sundae.

In a small mixing bowl stir together the cooking oil, milk, flour, sugar and salt until well blended. Pour into a 9-inch pie pan. Spread evenly with a spoon. Mix pudding mix and instant pudding with milk and spread over crust. Sprinkle with coconut and refrigerate until ready to serve. To serve, top with Cool Whip and shaved almonds.

Cook potatoes until tender then mash with butter and milk. Fry bacon until almost crisp and crumble. Fry onion in bacon grease until golden brown. Add egg, mashed potatoes, milk, salt and pepper to skillet. Cook until hot. Top with fried onion.

Season chops with fennel seeds and paprika. In a large frying pan, heat olive oil and add chops. Cook until browned. Add onion and saute for 2 minutes. Add wine and allow to cook for 2 minutes. Add broth and lemon juice. Cover and simmer 10 minutes or until chops are tender. Serve with rice or noodles.
Categories: Main Dishes, Pork Chops.

Spread each tortilla with cream cheese. Sprinkle with ranch dressing mix. Arrange spinach, ham, and tomatoes evenly on each tortilla. Fold bottoms up and sides in tightly, to form a package with an open top. Cut each wrap into 4 pieces. Serve at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350f. Melt 1/2 cup butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute until golden brown. Add zucchini and cook until crisp-tender. In a large bowl, mix together chicken, soup and sour cream. Add onion-zucchini mixture and stuffing mix. Spread into a greased 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Dot with remaining 1/2 cup butter. Bake for 40 - 50 minutes or until heated through.

In a large saucepan cook the beans in the chicken stock until tender. Drain and rinse with cold water. In a large saucepan heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and saute until tender. Add tomato puree, basil, and seasonings. Bring to a boil. Add cooked beans. Add pasta and simmer until tender. Ladle into bowls and sprinkle with parmesan. Serve immediately. Serves 6.
name: vegetarian casseroleingredients: egg noodles, canned peas and carrots, canned corn, canned green beans, canned asparagus, canned creamed corn, mushrooms, onion, garlic clove, celery, water, olive oil, italian seasoning, salt & pepperpreparation:In a 3 1/2 qt. baking dish, cook the egg noodles according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. In the same saucepan cook the vegetables according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water.

Place the flour, malt drink powder, light brown sugar and sultanas in the bread pan of your bread machine. Add the milk and golden syrup. Select the dough cycle. When the cycle ends, turn out the dough onto a lightly floured surface. Knead for two minutes and place the dough in the loaf tin. Cover and leave to prove for 1 hour or until doubled in bulk. Bake in the pre-heated oven for 25 minutes. Cool the bread on a wire rack.

In a large bowl mix skim milk, sugar, yeast and salt together in a large bowl. Stir in warm water. Mix in butter substitute or margarine and then 3 cups of the flour. Gradually add remaining flour until a soft dough forms. Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface. Knead until smooth and elastic. Place in a greased bowl cover with a clean cloth. Allow to rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk, about 45 to 60 minutes. Roll or pat the dough out on a lightly floured board or cloth to a 9-inch circle or rectangle. With a sharp knife or pastry wheel cut the dough into wedges or strips. Place on a lightly greased or parchment paper lined baking sheet. Cover with a clean cloth and allow to rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk, about 45 to 60 minutes. Bake in a preheated oven at 375 degrees for 8 to 12 minutes or until golden brown on the edges. Remove from the oven to a wire rack to cool. Store

Saute bacon in skillet until crispy. Remove bacon from skillet with a slotted spoon and set aside. Add chicken breasts to the bacon fat. Cook on both sides until no longer pink. Remove from skillet and set aside. Add cream of mushroom soup to the bacon fat in the skillet and heat through until bubbly. Add cooked mushrooms and bacon bits. Add half of the sour cream, half of the cream cheese, half of the soup mixture, and half of the chipped beef. Stir to combine. Add chicken breasts back to the skillet. Top with remaining sour cream, cream cheese, soup mixture, and beef. Refrigerate until ready to use. Serve over toast points or biscuits.

Butter 13x9x2-inch pan. In a large pot, combine butter, sugar and water. Bring to boil over medium heat. Stir in pecans and cook for 4 minutes until mixture bubbles and thickens slightly. Remove from heat. Stir in whipping cream and let stand until cool enough to handle. Spread in buttered pan. Cool. Cut into pieces.

In a wok or large frying pan, heat the butter over medium heat until melted. Add the shrimp, cook for 1-2 minutes, or until shrimps are pink. Add the onions and celery. Stir-fry until crisp-tender. Add the mushrooms. Stir fry until all vegetables are crisp-tender. Add the peas, water chestnuts, and soy sauce. Heat through. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Peel the sweet potato and carrots. Cut the vegetables into 1/2 inch cubes. Place the vegetables into a large bowl. In a medium bowl, melt the butter. Stir in the maple syrup and mix well. Pour the butter mixture over the vegetables. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with the ground nutmeg and pepper. Transfer the vegetables to a baking dish and bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, stirring halfway through the cooking time. Mash with a potato masher. Serve immediately.

Combine bread crumbs, corn flakes crumbs, salt, dry mustard, margarine in a large bowl. Stir in egg and milk, then stir in the cheese. Beat well. Lay out the slices of bread and spread with margarine, then sprinkle with a little corn flakes crumb mixture. Spoon the cheese mixture onto the bread. Top with meat and cheese of your choice. Bake at 450 degrees for 10-15 minutes or until the filling is set. Cut into sandwiches, if desired.

Peel banana. Mash with fork until smooth. Stir in marshmallows until melted. Fold in rice krispie crisps. Spread into a 9x13-inch pan lined with wax paper. Chill until firm. Cut into squares. Dip in melted chocolate. Sprinkle with crushed peanuts if desired.

In a 5 to 6 quart pan, cover the potatoes with water to cover. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until the potatoes are fork tender. Drain. Mash the potatoes with the butter. Add the sour cream. Add the dill weed, salt and pepper. Stir to combine. Serve immediately.

Trim ends of navel oranges and stand them on one end on a cutting board to make them stand up. Using a serrated knife, carefully remove the rind from the orange. Working around the orange with the tip of the knife, remove the white pith from the inside of the orange. Arrange orange on a platter and sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon. Pour orange blossom water over the orange and let stand for 30 minutes before serving. Place dried cherries on the rim of the plate and sprinkle with the toasted almonds and fresh mint. Serve immediately. Orange blossom water is available at Middle Eastern grocery stores and some supermarkets.

Preheat grill to medium heat. Oil the grill rack with nonstick cooking spray. In a medium bowl, combine the chicken, pesto sauce, sage, rosemary, salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes. Using your hands, mix until well blended. Grill the chicken for about 5 minutes per side or until done to your liking. Grill the bun until lightly toasted. Assemble the sandwich by spreading butter on the bun bottoms. Layer the chicken breast, mozzarella, tomato slices and basil on the bun bottoms. Top with the bun tops. Serve immediately or wrap in aluminum foil to serve later.

In a large bowl, stir together the oats, seeds, and almonds. In a saucepan over low heat, melt the butter and honey and whisk in the salt, vanilla and wheat germ. Add the mixture to the dry ingredients and stir until combined. Spread into an 8 by 8-inch baking pan and bake for about 15 minutes or until golden and lightly browned at the edges. Let cool in the pan on a wire rack and cut into squares. Wrap individually in plastic wrap and store in the refrigerator for up to one week. Will keep in the freezer in an airtight container for up to three months.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Mix well. Shape into a ball. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Serve with your favourite crackers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Mix together garlic, sugar, cinnamon, cumin and jelly in small bowl. Place tenderloin in shallow roasting pan. Brush with sugar mixture. Bake uncovered for 20 to 30 minutes or until done. Cut into thin slices. To serve, place a piece of bacon and 2 slices of pork on each plate. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Serve with mashed potatoes and green beans.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place a large baking sheet on oven rack. Lightly spray with vegetable oil. Cut a large slit in each breast and stuff with garlic, onion and herbs. Sprinkle with salt. Place on baking sheet. Roast 1 hour or until no pink remains in meat. Meanwhile, in small bowl combine lemon pepper and remaining oil. Brush over potatoes and roast for 30 min or until tender.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Place the peppers and garlic in a baking pan and cover with a lid or tin foil. Bake for 1 hour. When done, cool them down and chop them up. In a food processor combine the garlic and all the other ingredients and blend until smooth. Serve with crackers or pita bread.

In a medium saucepan combine the first 5 ingredients. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 2-3 minutes or until slightly thickened. Add milk and heat to boiling. Remove from heat. Stir in sour cream and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve over Brussels sprouts.

Boil pasta according to instructions. In a medium pan saute garlic cloves and rosemary. Add cinnamon and sugar. Add tomatoes and stir. Let it simmer for 20 minutes. Add pasta and stir. Sprinkle with pepper. Serve.

In a small bowl, combine the first three ingredientsrub over the chicken. In a large skillet cook the chicken in oil over medium heat until no longer pink in the center. Add the salsa and the corncook for 2 minutes. Stir in the cilantro. Serve on flour tortillas with cheese and/or lettuce and tomatoes if desired.

Bring half-and-half to boil in small saucepan over high heat until reduced by half. Remove from heat. Stir in margarine and garlic. Set aside. Cook pasta in boiling water until tender but firm. Drainrinse with cold water. Cut chicken into bite-size piecesset aside. In large nonstick skillet over medium heat, cook bacon until crisp. With slotted spoon, remove bacon from drippingsreserve drippings in skillet. Crumble baconset aside. In same skillet over medium heat cook onion in reserved drippings until tender but not brown, about 5 minutes. Stir in chickencook until thoroughly heated through, about 3 minutes. Stir in cooked bacon. Stir in reduced half-and-half mixture. Add pastatoss well to coat. Serve immediately. Serves 4.
Mix cream cheese and cocktail sauce together well. Add crab meat and shrimp. Blend well and chill overnight. Serve with crackers or chips.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 2 quart casserole dish. Steam cauliflower until tender, or microwave for 5 minutes. Drain and let cool. In a large bowl combine the cauliflower, soup, sour cream, and onion flakes. Mix together and spread into the prepared casserole dish. Sprinkle with cheese and pepper. Cover and bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Uncover and bake for 10 minutes longer, or until the top is golden brown. Crumble Ritz crackers on top. Bake for 5 more minutes or until the crackers are brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Mix pork sausage with all-purpose flour in a skillet over medium heat until evenly browned. Drain off excess fat.Add in onion. Cook for 5 minutes until tender.In a bowl, combine milk, thyme leaves, salt, and pepper to tastestir in pork sausage mixture. Heat to boiling over medium heat. Stir in diced tomatoessimmer until thickened, about 5 minutes.Spoon tomato mixture over warm biscuits and serve.

In a small saucepan, combine water and cornstarch. Bring to a boil. Add milk and cornstarch mixture. Cook until thick. Remove from heat and add artificial sweetener and mint. Cool and refrigerate until firm. Remove from mold. Cut into cubes. Serve with fresh fruit.

Preheat grill to medium heat. Beat egg with salt and pepper in shallow dish until blended. Dip one side of each slice of bread into egg mixtureturn to coat other side. Butter grill rack with butter. Grill bread until browned on both sides. Spread one side of each bread slice with 1/2 tablespoon mayonnaise and 1/2 teaspoon mustard. Top one slice with 2 slices cooked ham and 2 slices provolone cheese. Top with other slice of bread. Grill until cheese is melted and both slices are golden brown. Cut in half on an angle and serve immediately.

In a food processor with the metal blade, puree the green beans. Add the oil and puree. In a large saucepan, saute the onion in the remaining 1 tablespoon oil until golden. Add the puree and walnuts and stir. Add the eggs and mix well. Taste and adjust the seasonings. Serve at room temperature.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Grease 8×8 pan with cooking spray. Cut the bananas into 8 even pieces. Place the bananas into the pan. Mash the bananas with the back of a spoon. In a small mixing bowl combine the cocoa and the cinnamon. Sprinkle over the mashed bananas. In another mixing bowl combine the egg whites with the splenda. Beat with an electric mixer until foamy. Add the milk and continue beating until foamy. Add the oil and the protein powder and beat until the mixture is smooth. Pour the batter over the bananas and sprinkle the cocoa mixture over the top. Bake for 10 minutes. Let cool. Cut into 8 bars. Store in the refrigerator.
Pour espresso into a bowl or cup. Add ice cream and cinnamon syrup. Add hazelnut syrup to taste. Serve immediately.

Combine heavy cream and butter in a saucepan over low heat. Once they are warmed, stir in the chocolate. Stir until all the chocolate has melted. Remove from heat and whisk in the orange zest. Pour into a shallow dish or small bowls. Let cool at room temperature. Refrigerate until set.
The best thing about the holiday season is the abundance of fruit. While pineapples may not be as popular as pears or apples they are a great way to jazz up a recipe. Try these tropical recipes.
name: pineapple crumbleingredients: margarine, sugar, flour, egg yolk, pineapple juice, pineapplepreparation: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 1-quart baking dish. In a medium bowl, cream the margarine with the sugar. Beat in the egg yolks until smooth. In a small bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Beat the flour mixture into the

Beat the butter until fluffy. Gradually beat in the sugars. Beat in the eggs and vanilla. In a separate bowl combine the flour, baking soda and salt. Gradually add to the creamed mixture and beat well. Divide the dough into 3 portions. Flatten the dough portions to about 1/2 inch thick. Sprinkle each portion with the smarties candies. Roll the dough to form a log about 10 inches long. Wrap in foil or plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or until the dough is firm enough to cut. Heat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit. Cut the dough into 1/4 inch slices with a sharp knife. Place the slices about 2 inches apart on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake until golden brown about 10 minutes. Cool on the baking sheet for 2 minutes then transfer to wire racks to cool completely. Store in an airtight container for up to 1 week.

Cook peppers and onions in butter until tender. Beat the eggs and add to peppers and onions. Cook until egg is cooked through. Top with tortilla chips. Sprinkle cheese. Place under broiler until cheese is melted. Serve with sour cream and guacamole.

Bring a pot of water to a boil. When boiling, add the fava beans and cook for 3 to 4 minutes until tender. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the onion and cook for 5 minutes. Add the canadian bacon and continue cooking for 5 more minutes. Add the rice and cook for 2 minutes. Add the hot chicken stock 1/2 cup at a time. Continue to add stock until rice is tender. Stir in the bacon and the fava beans. Cook for 2 more minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Top with the Parmesan cheese.

Prepare green beans according to package directions. Meanwhile, heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and saute until tender. Add mushrooms and saute until tender. Drain beans and add to mushroom mixture. Toss to coat evenly. Serve immediately.

Slice tofu into cubes. Put them in a bowl and add a few squirts of mustard. Mix well to coat all sides. Put a few teaspoons of crumbs in a shallow dish. Dip each piece in the crumbs and then in the oil. Stick onto a skewer. Grill until golden and crispy all over. Serve with chili peppers for dipping.

Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain well. Butter 2 1/2-quart baking dish. Add the noodles and toss with the dressing and chicken. Add whipping cream and toss well. Sprinkle with the cheese and parsley. Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until heated through and bubbly. Serve immediately.
Combine first four ingredients in large pot. Cook until vegetables are tender. Add soup, milk, and Velveeta. Heat until cheese is melted. Serve in large bowls.

In a small bowl combine garlic, soy sauce, red wine vinegar, extra virgin olive oil and 1 teaspoon of the lemon-pepper seasoning. Rub the mixture over both sides of the meat. Season the lamb generously with remaining seasoning mixture and dried marjoram and refrigerate for 1 hour. Heat a heavy skillet over medium-high heat and add 1 tablespoon of the oil. When hot add half of the lamb and brown well. Turn and brown the other half of the lamb. Arrange meat in a single layer in a shallow baking dish. Cover tightly and bake for 1 hour in a 350f oven.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add ground chicken. Cook, stirring occasionally until it is no longer pink and cooked through. Remove from skillet and place in a medium bowl. Add shallot and garlic. Stir to combine. Add olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Allow to cool. Form into patties and place on a parchment lined baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Serve warm or refrigerate. Grill until browned and crispy. Serve on a bun with lettuce and tomato.

Place roast into a slow cooker. Sprinkle with taco seasoning mix. Pour diced tomatoes with chilies over top of roast. Add salt and pepper. Cover and cook on low for 7-8 hours or high for 4-5 hours. Shred meat with fork and serve on warm tortillas with toppings of choice.

In a small bowl combine the butter and garlicspray a shallow casserole dish with vegetable oil cooking spray. In a shallow dish combine the lemon juice, butter mixture, worcestershire sauce, lemon pepper and ground red pepper. Add the shrimp, turning to coat. Pour into casserole dish and bake for 15 minutes. Garnish with parsley. Serve with hot cooked rice or pasta. Yields 4 servings (about 3/4 cup per serving)

Preheat oven to 400 F. Wash potatoes well. Cut off both ends and slice in half lengthwise. Scoop out pulp leaving 1/2-inch thick shells. Melt olive oil in skillet over medium heat. Cook garlic for 1 minute or until tender. Remove from heat. Stuff each potato shell with tomato mixture. Sprinkle with cheese and basil. Return to oven for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Remove from oven. Serve immediately.

Cream butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Add vanilla and eggs, beating well after each addition. Sift together the flour, baking soda and salt. Mix into the creamed mixture. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoonfuls on to a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Cool on a wire rack before eating.

In medium bowl combine the first four ingredients. Cook and drain the bacon and crumble. Add the bacon and the remaining ingredients to the vegetables. Pour into the unbaked pie shell and bake at 425 degrees for 40 minutes or until brown. Let cool for 20 minutes and serve warm.

Melt butter in saucepan. Add onions and cook until tender. Remove from heat. Add crab meat and stir. Add cream. Cook over low heat. Add egg yolks and salt and pepper to taste. Pour into buttered baking dish. Cover with cheese. Place lemon wedge in center of dish. Bake at 350f for 15 minutes or until bubbly. Makes 6 servings.

In a medium sized sauce pan combine all ingredients. Heat to boiling and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in 1 cup of cooked long grain white rice to each cup of the black bean mixture. Spoon into greased casserole dish. Top with grated cheese. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes.
Bring a large pot of water to boil. Blanch the broccoli for 3 minutes. Drain. Combine the remaining ingredients in a large bowl. Add the blanched broccoli. Toss well. Serve warm.
Season the meat and add the juice, cover the meat and bake at 350 for 1/2 hour. Add the rice and pineapple when the meat is cooked. Simmer another 1/2 hour. Serve over rice.

Heat oven to 375. In a medium bowl combine the butter and the herbs. On a lightly floured surface roll out each biscuit to 1/4-inch thickness. Cut each biscuit in half. In a 13x9-inch baking pan layer half the biscuits, cut sides down. Sprinkle with half the butter mixturetop with remaining biscuits, cut side down. Sprinkle with remaining butter mixture. Bake 25 minutes. Serve warm with honey for dipping.

Heat a grill pan over high heat. Rub the fish with salt. Rub a small amount of salt and freshly ground black pepper on one side of the onion slices. Lay the onion slices flat on the hot pan. Cook until the onions begin to brown and caramelize, about 1 minute. Brush the fish with a light coat of sesame oil, and cook on the pan until it is lightly browned and slightly cooked through. Place the fish on the plate. Lay the green onions flat on the pan. Cook until the green onions begin to brown and caramelize. Place the green onions over the fish. Drizzle the mackerel with the remaining sauce and sprinkle with the remaining ginger and sesame seeds. Serve immediately.

Heat large saute pan to medium-high heat. Add the olive oil to the pan. Sear the shrimp in the pan until they are just opaque, about 3 minutes per side. Remove the shrimp from the pan. Add the bell peppers to the pan. Saut for about 3 minutes or until slightly softened. Add the garlic to the pan. Saut for about 30 seconds or until the garlic is slightly browned. Add the roasted red peppers to the pan. Saut for about 3 minutes or until the peppers are softened. Add the shrimp back to the pan along with the half-and-half cream and the pesto sauce. Add the parmesan cheese to the pan. Stir until well mixed. Serve with your favorite pasta, garnish with parsley and enjoy!

Peel and slice nectarines. In a large saucepan, combine sugar and water and bring to a boil. Add nectarines and boil for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and add cinnamon and almond extract. Let stand for 10 minutes. Pour into unbaked shell. Bake at 400 for 40 minutes. Cool 2 hours. In a medium bowl, beat heavy cream until stiff. Beat in powdered sugar and cinnamon. Spread over nectarines. Chill. Garnish with chopped toasted pecans and cinnamon.

Preheat oven to 400. Mix first five ingredients in a large bowl. Add buttermilk and raisins and mix until blended. Drop dough by level tablespoons onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake for 12-14 minutes until light golden brown. Serve warm.

drain canned pink salmon. 2 chop or grate onion and green pepper. 3 combine all ingredients in a bowl. 4 shape mixture into patties and roll in breadcrumbs. 5 fry patties in oil until brown. 6 serve on hamburger buns.
I have made this recipe for many years, always getting rave reviews. I use canned salmon and pink canned shrimp in the same amounts. I also use more pink peppercorns and a pinch of thyme.
I love this recipe! I use canned salmon and pink canned shrimp and I use a lot more pink peppercorns and a pinch of thyme. I have been making this recipe for many years and always get rave reviews. I think it is one of the best recipes ever!
This is a great recipe. I add more lemon than is called for and use pink salmon. I like to use a little bit of lemon juice in the cream cheese when I make the pate and some lemon zest as well.

Beat together eggs. Add cheese. In a skillet or pan spray with cooking spray. Pour egg mixture into pan. Cook over medium heat. Add salt and pepper. Cook until set. Cut into wedges. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375. Lightly grease a 9x5 loaf pan. Beat eggs with honey until well blended. Add applesauce and pumpkin. Mix thoroughly. In another bowl combine flour, baking powder, cinnamon and mixed spice. Add to pumpkin mixture and mix well. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 45-55 minutes or until well risen and golden brown on top. Cool in pan for 10 minutes, then remove to cool on wire rack. Makes 10 servings.

Beat together the eggs and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the sour cream. Fold in the dry ingredients just until blended. Pour into a greased 9-inch round pan. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 30 to 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes.

Mix water, salt, cornmeal, and flour in a heavy saucepan over medium heat. Stir constantly. Bring to a boil and cook, stirring constantly until thickened, about 10 minutes. Stir in the milkcook, stirring constantly until thickened, about 2 minutes more. Stir in the bananascook and stir 1 minute. Stir in the coconut extract and cinnamon.

Combine the grape jelly, ketchup, onion and vinegar in a 2-quart saucepan. Add dry mustard and brown sugar. Simmer 10 minutes. Add chicken thighs. Simmer 20 minutes or until the chicken is done. Serve over rice.

Heat a heavy skillet over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and wait for them to pop. Add the red onion to the skillet. Cook for 2 minutes until the onion begins to soften. Add the english cucumber to the skillet. Sprinkle with salt & freshly ground black pepper. Cook for 3 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a bowl. Add yogurt & mix well. Add the lemon zest & the garlic cloves. Toss to combine. Garnish with the dill.

Preheat oven to 350f. Heat oil in a dutch oven or other heavy pot over medium-high heat. Add chicken thighs in a single layer and brown until well browned about 5 minutes. Remove chicken from pot and set aside. Reduce heat to medium-low. Add onions to the pot along with paprika, caraway seeds and mushrooms. Cook until the mushrooms are well browned about 7 minutes. Add the chicken stock and tomatoes to the pot. Return the chicken to the pot. Cover and bake for 1 hour. Add the parsley and serve over cooked egg noodles or boiled potatoes.
Goulash is a delicious meal that is made with ground meat (often beef) and vegetables (such as tomatoes). It is a great comfort food that is easy to prepare and is sure to please even the pickiest eaters. Goulash is a great way to use up leftover meats, such as hamburger or chicken, and it can also be made with lamb or veal.
What does a Goulash taste like

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain and rinse in cold water. In a large bowl combine the macaroni, sweet onion and egg. In a small bowl combine mayonnaise, mustard and salt and pepper to taste. Pour over macaroni mixture and toss to coat. Just before serving stir in black olives and bacon bits. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours. Serve in lettuce cups.
Better than my Mom's!!! My Mom's family is from Italy and she is a great cook. I don't know if she used to use more mayo or more mustard in her recipe but I loved it so much that I just had to make it again. This time I used less mayo and more mustard. I love it and I'm sure your family will love this recipe too!
The directions do not state to add the dressing mixture until just before serving. I'm going to try to make it again but I won't add the dressing until serving time. It was really good but I think it could have been better if it was a little more tart.

Heat tortillas in a large skillet over medium heat until soft. Spread each tortilla with chocolate and raspberry. Top each with a sprinkle of sugar and cinnamon. Cook in a 400-degree F oven for 1 minute. Serve hot.

Halve and remove the yolks from the eggs to a mixing bowl. Mash the yolks with the other ingredients and stir together well. Spoon the mixture evenly back into the hollowed out whites and garnish with parsley.

Mix all the marinade ingredients in a bowl except the cilantro and garlic. Add the cilantro and garlic to the wings and coat it with the marinade. Store in refrigerator for several hours or overnight. Grill the wings until browned and cooked through. Serve warm with guacamole or sour cream.

Preheat broiler. Blend cranberry sauce, onion juice & blue cheese in bowl until smooth. Brush one side of each bread slice with butterplace on broiler pan. Broil until lightly browned. Spread with blue cheese mixturesprinkle with parsley. Serve immediately.

Mix jiffy corn bread and eggs together and add milk until a smooth batter forms. Heat oil in a 9x13-inch pan and place the hot dogs in the pan. Pour the batter around the hot dogs and place in a pre-heated oven at 350 degrees F until golden brown and the hot dogs are done.

In a large pot over medium-high heat, saute kielbasa and garlic cloves until the kielbasa is lightly browned and the garlic is lightly golden and crisp. Drain the kielbasa and reserve the fat. In the same pot, heat the oil over medium-low heat. Add the kielbasa and the beans and stir to combine. Add the stock and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes or until the beans are tender. Stir in the potatoes and kale and cook for 10 minutes more or until the potatoes are tender. Season with pepper and vinegar. Serve hot with a good bread or roll.
Mix all together. Pour into greased loaf pans. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.

Prepare a 9 by 13-inch pan by lining it with wax paper or parchment paper. In a large bowl beat together the egg whites and the vanilla extract. Gradually add the powdered sugar and the cocoa to the egg whites. Stir to combine thoroughly. In a small saucepan combine the light corn syrup and the rum or bourbon. Bring to a simmer on medium-low heat. Pour the hot mixture into the egg white mixture, stirring constantly to prevent scorching. Continue stirring until the mixture is cool enough to handle comfortably. Place the wafer crumbs on a plate. With wet hands roll the mixture into one-inch balls and place them on the wax paper. Chill for an hour or two. Roll the balls in the nuts. Store in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks.

Mix jello with hot water until well blended. Add cranberry sauce and nuts. Pour into 9x13 inch baking dish. Cover and chill until firm. Mix together sour cream and cool whip. Spread over top of firm layer. Chill until firm. Top with cool whip and sprinkle with nuts. Serves 6.
In a blender combine condensed milk, skim milk, evaporated milk, vanilla extract, strawberry syrup. Blend until smooth. Serve in an ice-filled glass. Pour the tequila down the inside of the glass.

Cream butter and sugar. Mix in vanilla and then add the flour. Stir in the chopped walnuts. Make small balls of dough and place them 1 inch apart on a cookie sheet. Chill for 1 hour or overnight before baking them at 350 degrees F for 10 minutes.

Melt the butter, add the brown sugar and stir until smooth. Add the salt and cook for 2-3 minutes over medium heat. Add the light corn syrup and cook until it reaches 240 degrees F. Add the evaporated milk and vanilla. Continue stirring until the mixture is smooth and reaches 240 degrees F. Remove from heat and pour into a greased 8"x8" pan. Chill until set.

Combine frozen berries and sour cream in a food processor or blender. Blend until smooth. Add 1/4 cup sugar and continue to process until smooth. Add cream cheese and blend until smooth. Add remaining 1/4 cup sugar and blend until smooth. Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 3 days. Serve with any fruit or vegetable. Serve with pretzels, crackers or celery. Serve with tortilla chips and/or pita chips. Serve with fresh fruit in the morning on toast or bagels or French toast. Serve with muffins or scones or quick breads. Serve with salmon or crab cakes or seafood cocktail or shrimp cocktail. Serve with salads or cold cuts or chicken or ham or roast beef or pork or turkey or lamb. Serve with vegetable soup or chicken noodle soup. Serve with pancakes or waffles or French toast or English muffins or hot biscuits or muffins or scones or quick breads or toast

Boil potatoes in lightly salted water until tender. Drain and cool. Combine all ingredients except lemon juice in a large bowl. Toss lightly and refrigerate until serving time. Stir in lemon juice just before serving.

Bring milk to a boil over medium heat in a medium saucepan. Stir in the flour and cook for 1 minute stirring constantly. Stir in prepared horseradish and stir until smooth. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Stir in hominy and pour into a greased 2-quart casserole dish. Combine the melted butter and Parmesan cheese and sprinkle over the top of the hominy. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes or until heated through and bubbly.

Boil potatoes until tender and drain well. Heat oil over medium heat and add caraway, cumin and cayennecook until fragrant. Pour over the potatoestoss. Season with salt and pepper to tastestir in the lemon juice. Serve chilled or at room temperature.
In saucepan combine flour and seasonings. Stir in lemon juice and water and bring to boil. Add meat and onions. Cook over low heat till done. Stir in olive. Serve with rice.

Cut white bread in half and spread with butter. Place a slice of cooked shrimp in center of bread and top with a dollop of mayonnaise and dijon mustard. Sprinkle with dill and top with fish roe and lemon wedge. Makes 2 toasts.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 13x9 inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. Slice the bread into 1/2 inch cubes. Place in dish. Pour the cocoa powder over the bread. Sprinkle with the cherries. In a saucepan, combine the milk and the sugar over medium heat. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Add the butter. Pour over the bread. Let stand 10 minutes. In a medium bowl combine the eggs and the egg white. Beat until smooth. Pour over the bread and milk mixture. Bake for 25 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with the morsel. Bake for 5 minutes. Remove from oven and cool for 1 hour. Place the whipped cream in a piping bag fitted with a star tip. Pipe onto individual plates. Top with a morsel and a cherry.

Cut up one can of condensed cream of chicken soup into 1/4-inch cubes. Put 2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Arrange the cubes evenly over the top. Mix plain breadcrumbs and 1/4 cup parmesan cheese and sprinkle evenly over the top. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup parmesan cheese and serve.

Place garlic and olive oil in medium pan over medium heat. When garlic starts to brown, add mustard and maple syrup. Stir to combine. Bring to boil and reduce heat to simmer for 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Place pork in pan and cover. Cook in oven for 12-14 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 145 degrees. Remove from oven and allow to rest for 5 minutes. Slice and serve.

Put the rhubarb in a saucepan with 1 tbsp of brown sugar, 2 tbsp of orange juice, and the flour and bicarbonate of soda in a small bowl. Add the rhubarb mixture to the bowl. Add the eggs to the mixture one at a time, beating between each addition. Heat the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat until melted, stirring occasionally. Add the melted butter to the rhubarb mixture. Pour the mixture into a baking dish and bake in the oven for 25-30 minutes. When the mixture is nearly cooked through, stir in the white chocolate chips until melted. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Place a small amount of the cream cheese in the center of each crescent round. Sprinkle each round with chilies and cheddar cheese. Fold in half and press edges together to seal. Place on ungreased baking sheet and bake for about 12 minutes or until golden brown and cheese is melted. Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Stir in flour and cook for about one minute. Slowly whisk in milk and cook over low heat for about five minutes or until thickened and smooth. Stir in remaining cream cheese and remaining chilies and stir until blended. Stir in parmesan cheese and season to taste with salt and pepper. Drizzle over cheese rolls and serve warm.
name: pepperoni pizza pinwheelsingredients: pizza sauce, shredded mozzarella cheese, pepperoni slices, crescent rolls, pizza peppers, pepperoni-style sausage linkspreparation:Prepare pizza sauce according to

Combine cherry pie filling and nestl toll house ultimates refrigerated chocolate chip lovers cookie dough with mixer until well combined. Spoon 1 tablespoon into each of 12 muffin cups coated with cooking spray. Bake at 375 12-15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool 5 minutesremove from pans to wire racks. Cream cheese, sweetened condensed milk, eggs, and vanilla extract with mixer until well blended. Drizzle over cooled cookies. Refrigerate 1 hour or until firm. Makes 12 servings (2 per serving).

Cut and rinse the leaves of the Chinese cabbage. Cut the leaves away from the thick stems. Cut the leaves into bite-sized pieces. Mix the salt and the cabbage together. Press the mixture down with the palm of your hands to release the juices. Let stand for 30 minutes. Squeeze the juice out of the cabbage with your hands. Let stand for 10 minutes. Drain the juice. In a bowl combine the chopped green onions, the garlic and the chili powder. Add the gingerroot and the salt. Mix well. Add the light soy sauce and the vinegar. Mix well. Add the sugar and the sesame oil. Mix well. Add the drained cabbage. Mix well. Transfer to a serving bowl. Cover. Refrigerate for 3 hours.

Cut grouper fillet into 1 1/2 inch cubes, about 8 cups. Soak in buttermilk overnight. Drain and roll in cracker crumbs, garlic salt and black pepper. Chill in refrigerator until ready to cook. In a heavy bottomed skillet heat canola oil over medium high heat until very hot. Fry nuggets until golden brown on both sides, about 1 1/2 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels. Serve with hot sauce or tartar sauce.

In saucepan combine garlic, butter, and flour. Stir over medium heat for a minute or two. Add the tomato juice and cook, stirring constantly for 1 minute. Stir in the milk. Add the chili powder and salt. Bring to a boil and boil for 1 minute. Add the cheddar and parmesan cheeses. Stir over low heat for 2 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth and creamy.

Sift the flour with the salt in a large bowl. Rub in the butter until it resembles fine bread crumbs. Add the egg to the flour and mix together to a soft dough. Add a little more milk if needed. Tip out onto a lightly floured surface and knead lightly to bring the dough together. Roll out to a thickness of 5mm and use a circular cutter to cut out 6cm circles. Gather up the scraps and roll out again. Repeat until all the dough is used up. Bring a large saucepan of water to the boil. Add a large spoonful of dumplings at a time and cook for 2-3 minutes or until they float to the surface. Lift out with a slotted spoon and drain in a colander. Serve with sausages or bacon and lentils with carrots.

Sauté onion in butter until tender. Add mushrooms and artichokes. Saute until mushrooms are golden. Stir in flour. Add half-and-half cream. Stir in broth. Add seasonings. Simmer 10 minutes. Serve with crackers.
Spread peanut butter on english muffin and sprinkle with ground cinnamon. Top with fruit and serve.

Prepare baking pan and place in over to heat at 350 degrees. Mix Bisquick, sugar and baking powder together. Add the milk and butter. Beat for one minute with an electric mixer until the dough is smooth. Add the egg and beat one more minute. Pour the mixture into the pan and place in the oven. Bake for 25 minutes or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.

In a small saucepan bring stock to a boil. Add carrots and boil for about 3 minutes. Add onion, garlic, gingerroot, thai paste and salt. Cook for 5 minutes. Puree in a blender. Add tofu and blend again. Garnish with mint.

Preheat oven to 400. Grease 13 x 9 x 2 inch pan. Combine taco seasoning with 1/2 cup water. Set aside. Cut chicken into bite size pieces. Combine with apricot jam. Place half the rice in the bottom of the baking pan. Top with half the chicken mixture. Cover with half the seasoning mixture. Layer with remaining rice and seasoning. Cover with remaining chicken. Top with remaining rice. Bake uncovered 1 hour 15 minutes or until chicken is done. Serve with pineapple-mango salsa.

In a saucepan, bring water to boil and cook potatoes until tender. Drain and cool. In a skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add green onions and cook until softened. Add potatoes, peas and sugar. Cook until heated through. Stir in cream and pepper. Serve immediately.
 sweet and sour peasingredients: frozen peas, onion, sliced mushrooms, butter, flour, half-and-half, salt, black pepper, sugarpreparation:Cook peas according to package directions and drain. Saute onion and mushrooms in butter. Blend in flour and gradually add half and half, stirring constantly. Cook until thick. Add remaining ingredients, mix lightly and heat through. Stir occasionally.
Cube white bread and mix with eggs, milk, dry mustard and cheese. Add sausage and mix well. Pour into 10-inch ovenproof dish. Bake at 400 for 45 minutes.

In a large pot with tight-fitting lid, combine the water, rice, and 2 cups of the milk. Cook over high heat, stirring often until the mixture comes to a full boil. Lower the heat to medium-low, cover the pot tightly, and simmer for 20 minutes or until the mixture has thickened and the rice is tender. Remove from the heat and add the remaining 2 cups of milk, the sugar, orange blossom water, cinnamon, and dates. Mix well and allow the mixture to cool for 20 minutes. Transfer the mixture into individual bowls or ramekins. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until chilled, at least 4 hours or overnight.

Halve eggs lengthwise. Place each half in a ramekin. Layer each half with about 1 teaspoon sour cream, 1/2 teaspoon salmon, 1/2 teaspoon cream cheese, 1/2 teaspoon chopped cilantro, and 1/8 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Top with remaining sour cream and cilantro. Serve with crackers.
Boil or steam the potatoes until tender. Saute green beans in olive oil. Add the potatoes and green beans, garlic cloves, crushed red pepper flakes, paprika and eggs. Heat through. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Cut cauliflower head into small pieces and place in large bowl. In saucepan over medium heat combine mashed potatoes, sour cream and chives. Stir in egg and parmesan cheese until combined and mixture is smooth. Pour mashed potato mixture over cauliflower pieces and gently toss until evenly coated. Spread evenly in baking dish and bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown and heated through. Serve with low fat sour cream and enjoy!

Heat olive oil in pan. Cook onion for 1 to 2 minutes. Add bell peppers and cook for another 1 to 2 minutes. Add garlic and cook 1 to 2 minutes longer. Stir in tomatoes. Cook until thickened. Add mozzarella cheese. Cook until cheese is melted. Serve over cooked pasta. Sprinkle with chopped parsley.

Slice mushrooms into strips or rounds. In a small frypan heat oil on medium high heat and sauté mushrooms for 5 minutes or until cooked, add bacon and cook for 2 minutes or until crispy. In a non-stick frypan on medium-high heat cook sausages for 5 minutes or until cooked. Turn heat down to medium and add tomato and cook for a further 5 minutes or until tomatoes are cooked. Make 2 holes in the sausages using a knife. Break eggs into 2 holes and place a lid on the pan. Cook eggs till whites are set and yolk is still runny, remove lid and continue cooking until eggs are cooked to liking. Serve on toast with mushrooms, tomatoes, bacon and a drizzle of olive oil.
I made this for my family on Sunday morning. It was a hit. I did not have any left over.
I used a 2 lbs pack of ground beef and made a half a batch of the mushroom sauce.
The sauce was good and it made a great meatloaf. My
Mix all ingredients well. Refridgerate at least 1 hour. Serve.

In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until softened, about 3 to 4 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for an additional 30 seconds. Add the cream and cook until the cream has reduced by half. Add the mascarpone cheese to the onions and cook until melted. Add the blue cheese crumbles and stir to incorporate. In a large pot of boiling water, cook the pasta according to the package directions. Reserve a cup of the cooking water. Drain the pasta. Add the onions to the pasta along with the reserved water. Stir to combine. Season to taste with the salt and pepper. Serve with the baby rocket leaves on the side for garnish.
