Put a large pot of water over medium heat. Add the egg to the water and mix in the olive oil and salt until it forms a ball in the pot. Carefully remove with a spoon and place on a tray covered in cornmeal or parchment paper. Carefully form into a rectangle. Bake for 20-25 minutes at 375 until the edges are golden brown. Serve with olive oil.

Preheat broiler. Spread refried beans over each tortilla chip. Top with a mound of cheese, and lay the chips in a single layer on a baking sheet. Heat under the broiler until the cheese is melted and bubbly, about1 minute. Top each chip with a dollop of sour cream. Serve at once.

Wash all vegetables thoroughly. Slice vegetables as thin as possible. Combine pickling salt, celery seed, and white pepper in a large bowl. Add vegetables. Mix well. Cover bowl with plastic wrap. Place in refrigerator for 2 hours. Drain vegetables. Combine white vinegar and white sugar in a large pot. Bring to a boil. Pack vegetables into 1-quart freezer bags. Fill with boiling vinegar mixture. Seal. Let cool. Freeze for up to 1 year.

Place all-purpose flour and fast rise yeast into the work bowl of your food processor. Pulse about 30 times to incorporate yeast into the flour. Add the hot water and olive oil, pulse to form a ball of dough. Turn out onto lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic. Cover with plastic wrap and let rest for 15 minutes. Roll out dough into 12 inch round. Add toppings and bake at 450 f for 15 - 20 minutes or until crust is crisp and cheese is melted.

In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add chopped spinach and cook 3-4 minutes or until wilted. Remove from heat and add parmesan cheese. Mix well. Beat together eggs and seasoned bread crumbs. Add to spinach mixture. Mix well. Form into 1 inch balls. In a large skillet over medium heat, add oil. Fry for 3-4 minutes until golden brown on all sides. Remove to paper towels. Serve with green onions. Makes 20-30 depending on size of balls.
I was looking for a recipe for a sweet potato and spinach dish. This recipe looked good but I have to say that it was terrible. It was very bitter and I couldn't get rid of the bitterness no matter how many times I washed the spinach or how much I cooked it. I wouldn't recommend this recipe.
This is a great dish for a brunch or light lunch. I used red pepper and it was delicious. I think it would also be good with artichokes added to the mixture.
This was pretty good.

Preheat oven to 180c. In a mixing bowl combine flour, baking powder and arrowroot. Set aside. Melt marge in saucepan. Add the sugar and vanilla extract. Stir until mixture is well combined. Add the water slowly until the mixture comes together. Remove from the heat. Add the flour mixture and mix until just combined. Cover the dough with cling wrap. Place in the refrigerator for at least one hour. Roll into small balls. Bake on lightly greased trays. Bake for about 8-10 minutes. Let cool before decorating. Decorate as desired. Makes about 50 small balls.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and place back into pot. Add butter, garlic and red pepper flakes. Saute until slightly brown. Add shrimp. Saute until pink. Add half-and-half. Add half-and-half. Cook for 30 seconds. Stir in basil. Remove from heat. Top with parmesan. Serve immediately.

Beat egg yolks until very light in color. Gradually add the condensed milk until thickened. Stir in zest and juice. Fold in egg whites with a rubber spatula. Pour into prepared pie shell. Chill at least 4 hours before serving. Garnish with whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 425. Beat first four ingredients in a small saucepan over medium heat until smooth and well blended. Place in refrigerator for 30 minutes. In a large bowl combine flour and milk. Add pumpkin and brown sugar mixture. Stir to blend. Pour into a 9 inch pie shell. Bake for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350. Bake 30 to 40 minutes or until done. Serve warm or cold.

Cream together butter and extract until light and fluffy. Beat in sugar substitute and eggs until light and creamy. Blend in salt and flour. Fold in nuts and oats and miniature chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees f. for 20 minutes. Cool on rack and store in tightly covered container.

Mix tuna with mayo, mustard, crushed red pepper flakes and garlic powder. Add jalapenos and mix thoroughly. Spread tuna mixture evenly over one slice of american cheese. Place 2 slices of jalapeno on top of the american cheese. Place the other slice of american cheese on top of the jalapeno slices. Place the sandwich in a pan or grill over medium heat until the american cheese is melted. Remove from heat and cut in half. Serve with chips.

Using a paring knife, remove the pith and peel from the oranges. Cut the peeled segments into bite-sized piecesset aside in a large bowl. In the bowl of a food processor, process the cumin, cayenne pepper, sugar, cinnamon, and salt until combined wellset aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, add the olive oil, carrots, lemon juice, and zestcook, stirring occasionally, until the carrots are just softened, 3 to 4 minutes. Remove the skillet from the heat, add the dates, and stir to incorporateset aside to cool completely. Add the dressing mixture to the cooled carrots and datesstir to thoroughly blend. Add the cooled fruitstir to incorporate. Refrigerate for 2 to 3 hours to allow the flavors to meldstir before serving. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in saute pan over medium heat. Add chicken and salt/pepper to taste. Cook until golden. Remove from pan and set aside. In the same pan, add shallots, garlic, rosemary and cook until fragrant. Deglaze with wine, cook until almost dry. Add honey, mustard, lemon juice and cook until thick. Spoon over cooked chicken. Garnish with pine nuts.
This is my favorite recipe book. I make a lot of recipes from this book. It is easy to find the recipe I want. I love the recipes in this book. It is easy to follow. I love this book.
The book has a great layout. The recipes are easy to follow. I love it.

Add enough water to cover beef brisket. Place brisket in crockpot with water. Add tomatoes, onion, salt, pepper, and sugar. Cook on low setting 6-8 hours or on high setting 3-4 hours. When cooked take out brisket and discard vegetables. Add enough water to cover sauerkraut and cook on low setting 10-12 hours or on high setting 4-5 hours or until tender. Take out brisket and discard vegetables. Add sauerkraut and onion to brisket juice. Cook on low setting 4-5 hours or on high setting 2-2 1/2 hours. When cooked take out brisket and discard vegetables. Serve hot with dark bread and steins of beer.
Mix all together except pecans. Bake at 350f for 15 min. Pour over 100 pecan halves, bake 5 min. more, chill thoroughly and serve on crackers or bagels.

Mix together sugar, flour and salt in a saucepan. Make a well in the center of the mixtureadd egg yolk and beat thoroughly with a spoon until well blended. Place pan over low heat. Stir constantly until mixture thickens and comes to a boil. Remove from heatstir in butter until melted. Add pineapple and juice, and cook over low heat until heated through. Pour into a serving dish or bowltop with whipped cream. Garnish with additional pineapple slices if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat together the Bisquick, milk, sour cream and egg until smooth. In a separate bowl combine the dill weed, salmon and swiss cheese. Gently stir into the batter and spoon into greased muffin cups. Bake at 350 for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Let set for 5 minutes before serving. Makes 12 muffins or 24 mini-muffins.

Cut english muffin in half. Place butter on the top half of the english muffin. Add cheese to the bottom half of the english muffin. Add the dried beef. Top with the bottom of the english muffin. Add worcestershire sauce to the top of the english muffin and spread mayonnaise over the english muffin.

Combine water, sugar, white wine vinegar, carrot, onion, white peppercorns, bay leaves and allspice berries in a large pot over medium heat. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Simmer uncovered for 1 hour. Remove bay leaves, then strain through a fine strainer into a large bowl or jar with a lid. Store in the refrigerator for up to 4 weeks. To serve, place 3 tablespoons in a glass and fill with cold water to taste.

Peel the potatoes and cut into 1/2 inch cubes. Place in a saucepan with enough cold water to cover by two inches. Add a tablespoon of kosher salt, bring to a boil and cook until tender. Drain in a colander. Mash the potatoes with the butter, cream, liquid smoke and season to taste with the peppers.
I can't believe how easy your recipes are. They're great!
I like your website. I just found it today.
I really like the way you have your recipes listed.
I just found your website. I am a very big fan of cooking shows on the Food Network. I was so happy to find a website like yours. I love the recipes!

Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and mix well with a spoon until thoroughly combined. Heat a small amount of butter in a skillet over medium heat until melted. Add a quarter cup of batter into the pan and swirl the batter around the bottom of the pan with a spoon so that it spreads into a nice even circle and cook for about 2 minutes until bubbles begin to form on the surface of the pancake. Flip the pancake and cook on the other side until done. Continue until all batter is used up and serve hot with butter and syrup.

In a large bowl, whisk together all ingredients except for firm tofu. Add tofu and stir well. Let sit for 2-3 hours in refrigerator. Drain and pat dry before using in any recipe that calls for marinated tofu.

Cook pasta as directed. Drain and rinse with cold water. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat olive oil and add carrot and broccoli. Saute until tender. Drain and place in a large bowl with pasta and cheese. Add salt and pepper. Mix well and serve.

Place a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add 1 tablespoon of the oil. When hot, add half of the mustard seeds. When they begin to pop (about 1 minute), add the onion, garlic cloves and 1 teaspoon of the salt. Cook for 3 minutes. Add the chicken stock and lemon juice. Simmer for 4 minutes. Add the brussel sprouts. Cover and cook for 10 minutes. Remove from the heat. Stir in the remaining tablespoon of oil and 1 teaspoon of the salt. Transfer to a serving bowl. Garnish with remaining mustard seeds. Serve hot. Serves 4.

Slice muffin into halves. Spread each half with the processed cheese spread. Sprinkle with seasoning salt and garlic powder. Top with a thin layer of mayonnaise. Sprinkle with crab meat. Broil until the top is lightly browned.

Combine first 4 ingredients and 1/2 cup water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat and cook for 5 minutes or until a thermometer registers 230f. Remove from heatstir in pecans and baking soda. Spread in a single layer on waxed paper to cool completely.
Preheat oven to 350. Rub oil and seasonings into chickens. Cut lemons into wedges and place on top of chickens. Place in oven and roast 1 hour. Remove from oven and allow to rest 5 minutes. Serve.

Combine brown sugar, pineapple chunks in juice, cider vinegar and spam in a 13x9x2 inch baking pan. Cook until bubbly and thickened over low heat, stirring occasionally. Stir in green bell pepper and cornstarch mixture. Cook and stir until thickened and clear. Pour over hot cooked rice or noodles and garnish with a pineapple ring if desired.

In large bowl mix together semi-sweet chocolate chips and butter flavor shortening. Heat water to boiling and pour over cereal and stir until completely coated. Add in crushed milk duds and stir until completely coated. Press mixture into 13 x 9 baking pan lined with wax paper or parchment paper. Cool and then cut into squares.

Put everything in a mixing bowl and stir till mixed. Then place it on a wax paper and let it cool before removing from wax paper. You can put anything you want on top of these cookies before putting them on the wax paper to decorate them. You can also cut them out with cookie cutters after they have cooled. They are easy and delicious. I usually eat the batter too and it is good.

Wash and clean chitterlings. Rinse and place in a large pot of water. Cover and bring to a boil. Add whole cloves and red chili pepper. Cook until tender. Drain and remove all fat. Mix with remaining ingredients. Form into patties and fry in oil. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cream shortening with sugars until light. Beat in eggs one at a time. Stir in buttermilk and vanilla. Sift together dry ingredients and add to creamed mixture alternately with milk. Blend well and fold in chocolate chips. Drop by spoonful onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Remove to wire racks to cool completely. Makes about 2 dozen large cookies or 3 dozen smaller cookies.
I have no idea why I haven't shared this recipe yet! I've made it a few times now and it is so good! It is really easy to make as well!
You could also add peanut butter chips or butterscotch chips, too!
1) In a large bowl mix together the cake mix and milk until dough forms.
2) Divide dough into 24 pieces (I usually do 12 per side). Roll into balls.
3) Place balls 2 inches apart on a greased cookie sheet and bake for 10-1

In a large bowl mix yeast, flour, sugar, and saltthen add milk and butter and mix until smooth. Cover and refrigerate overnight or for a minimum of 4 hours. In the morning, heat oven to 400 degrees Flightly brush the waffle iron with olive oil and pour batter into it, and bake until golden brown. Makes 4 large or 8 small waffles.

Cream butter and shortening together, add sugar and mix well. Beat in the eggs and then the flour, salt and spice mixture. Mix well. Pour into a greased and floured tube pan. Bake at 325 degrees for one hour or until done. Cool in the pan for ten minutes, then turn out on to a wire rack to cool completely. Mix the glaze and drizzle over the top of the pound cake. Let cool before cutting.
Brown meat in skillet. Add onion and celery. Stir in tomato juice. Bring to a boil. Add barley. Cover and simmer for 45 minutes. Add chili powder, salt and pepper. Serve with buttered rolls.

Preheat oven to 350. Cut rib roast into 3 or 4 ribs. Place rib rack on foil lined baking sheet and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add the fennel and prunes and place carrots around the ribs. Cover with foil and bake for 45 minutes. Remove cover and bake for an additional 15 minutes. Heat mustard and vodka in a saucepan over medium heat. When heated, pour over the rib roast. Return to oven and bake for 30 minutes uncovered. Remove from oven and let stand for 10 minutes. Serve with roasted potatoes and onions. Makes 2 servings.

Saute onion in oil in a large pot until tender. Add ground beefsaute until browned. Drain off excess fat. Stir in mushrooms and green pepper. Cook until tender. Stir in soup and pepper to taste. Bring to a boilreduce heat to simmer for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in noodles. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Top with shredded cheese. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

Bring 4 cups water to boil. Remove from heatadd tea bags and mint leaf. Steep 5 minutesremove tea bags and mint. Combine fruit in a large bowltoss with tea liquidlet stand 15 minutes. In a large pitcher, combine tea mixture, cider, and sparkling winestir until blended. Pour into glassestop with sparkling winegarnish with strawberries and mint sprig. Makes 10 servings.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat cook the chorizo until crisp. Drain on a paper towel-lined plate, reserving drippings in the skillet. Add potatoes, onion, and garlic to the drippings. Cook until tender, about 10-12 minutes. Meanwhile, make 4 shallow depressions in potatoes with the back of a spoon. Crack an egg into each well. Cover skillet and cook for 5 minutes or until the whites are firm but the yolks are still runny. Top with shredded cheese, if desired, and serve with flour tortillas and salsa on the side.

Preheat oven to 450f. Cut off the top 1/2 inch of each banana. Scoop out some of the banana flesh to make room for the topping. Spread some of the brown sugar over each banana. Sprinkle with the lime juice, rum, spices, and butter. Wrap each banana in foil. Bake 15 minutes. Unwrap and serve.

Preheat oven to 190 degrees C. Grease a 9 inch cake pan. Sift flour into a large bowl and add sugar, baking powder, salt, and butter. Whisk with a fork to combine. Beat eggs with milk and vanilla in a small bowl. Add to dry mixture with vinegar. Stir to combine. Fold in bananas. Spoon mixture into prepared pan and smooth out with a spatula. Bake for 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan 15 minutes. Run a knife around edge of pan and turn out onto a rack to cool completely. Whisk together sugar with water in a small bowl. Place on low heat and bring to a boil. Add chocolate, whisking constantly until smooth. Pour glaze over cooled cake and smooth with spatula. Cut into slices to serve.

Cook rotini pasta according to package directions. Drain pastaset aside. In a skillet saute onion and garlic until translucent. Stir in mushroomscook until tenderset aside. In a large bowl combine pasta, soup, milk, and onion/garlic/mushroom mixturemix well. Stir in tunagently fold into mixture. Transfer to a 2 quart baking dishtop with shredded cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes or until the center is bubbly and golden brown. Serve warm.

Saute onions, mushrooms and celery in oil. Add garlic. Sprinkle with flour. Slowly stir in broth. Add tomato paste and herbs. Simmer uncovered for 20 minutes. Add carrots and barley. Simmer for 1 hour. Season to taste with salt. Stir occasionally.

Cook beans in water or veggie broth until soft, about 1-1 1/2 hours. Drain. Add sour cream and juice of 1/2 lemon. Mash beans with fork until smooth. Stir in cumin, garlic, and 1/4 of red onion. Serve with remaining 1/4 of red onion.

Cut stems off chard and cut leaves into 3-inch pieces. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Saute onion for about 5 minutes. Add garlic cloves and cook for 2 minutes. Remove from heat, add chard leaves, toss to combine, return to heat. Cook until leaves are wilted but still have some color, about 4 minutes. Add figs, pine nuts, feta cheese, parsley, season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 2 days.

Place the elderflower heads in a bowl of water to cover and bring to the boil for 2 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold running water to cool down the flowers. Cover with boiling water and leave to infuse for 20 minutes. Strain through a fine sieve into a large jug and add the sugar and lemon juice. Cover with cling film and leave for 24 hours before adding the wine vinegar and chilling. Serve with ice or chilled.

The mechanic at the autoparts store said he would have to charge me $80 to tell me what it was but I didn't want to pay that much because I figured it was something I could do myself. Steam broccoli florets until tender. Squeeze and chop the garlic cloves. Transfer to a large bowl. Stir in the broccoli and season with salt. In a separate bowl, whisk together the vinegar, oil, cumin, sesame oil and hot sauce. Pour over the broccoli mixture and toss to combine. Toss in the nuts and cilantro and serve.
I have made this dressing for several years. I love it on chicken and use it on my potato salad. My husband likes it on his macaroni.
I made this recipe yesterday for lunch today. I didn't have enough cabbage so I added some green onions. It tasted great!
I made this recipe today and it was delicious. I couldn't find whole wheat crackers so I used whole wheat tortilla chips. I will make this again.
This is a great recipe for a quick side dish. I used shredded cabbage instead of broccoli. It was a big hit at a recent potluck.
I have never tried this recipe but I love

Combine chili sauce, brown sugar, vinegar, ketchup, onion, jalapeno peppers in a large non-aluminum pot over medium heat. Cook until it starts to thicken. Add worcestershire sauce, salt and bring to a boil. Add chicken wings. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour.
I don’t know about you but I always find the prospect of cooking a meal for a large number of people quite daunting. Even if I think I am confident of cooking the dish, I still don’t think I can do it justice because I have not tried it on a large scale before. Well, this is exactly how I felt when I came across this recipe for Chicken Rice Casserole from the Singapore Cookbook.
I decided to give it a try anyway. In the end I am glad that I did because the casserole turned out pretty well for my first time out and I have managed to serve it to my family without anyone complaining of lack of taste or quantity.
The recipe requires 4 kg of chicken (4 large pieces or 8 small pieces). This is a

Bake cake according to package directions. Cool. Cut into cubes. In a saucepan, combine pudding mix and milk and cook for 2 minutes until thick. Stir in pumpkin and brown sugar and cook 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in 1 cup whipped topping. Spread one third of the cake cubes into the bottom of a 9-inch pie plate. Spoon 1/3 of the pudding mixture over the cubes. Repeat twice, ending with the cubes. Cover with remaining whipped topping. Garnish with a dollop of whipped topping and a sprinkling of cinnamon. Serves 8-12.

In a small bowl, combine the sugar and 1 cup of water. Bring to a boil. Add the remaining 2 cups of water. Boil for 1 minute. Stir in the extract and citric acid. Pour into a 2 quart pitcher. Add ice to pitcher. Serve immediately. Makes 2 gallons.

Boil water in a large pot and add the carrots and potatoes to it. Cook until tender but not mushy about 10-15 minutes. Drain well and place the potatoes back into the pot over medium heat. Toss the potatoes with 1 tsp of the sea salt, 1 tsp of the cumin seeds, 1/2 tsp of the pepper, 1 Tbsp of the olive oil and 1 Tbsp of the white wine vinegar. Toss the potatoes until well mixed and place into a serving dish. Refrigerate until ready to serve or serve at room temperature.

Cook quinoa according to package directions. Meanwhile, wash and drain fruit. Combine fruit in a large bowl. In a small bowl, whisk together the yogurt and orange juice. Add salt to taste. Divide quinoa among serving dishes. Spoon fruit on top of quinoa. Spoon yogurt mixture over the fruit. Top with fresh mint.

Mix flour and salt together in bowl. Rub in butter until mixture resembles fine crumbs. Stir in beaten egg and enough milk to form soft pliable dough. Knead lightly on a lightly floured surface. Roll out thinly and cut with floured 2-inch cookie cutter. Brush lightly with milk. Arrange on a lightly greased tray and bake in preheated 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) oven until golden brown. Serve hot with melted butter and sprinkle with herbs of choice.
Slice portabella mushrooms very thin and saute in butter until tender. Add beef base and stir to blend. Add cream and heat. Stir in parmesan until melted. Serve.

Boil eggplant in lightly salted water for 20 to 25 minutes or till tender. Drain and mash well with margarine. Add corn and pimientos. Mix in beaten eggs. Spoon into greased casserole. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake in 375f oven for 40 minutes or till light golden brown. Let stand 10 minutes before cutting.

Heat the oil in a large soup pot and fry the onions and garlic until soft and translucent. Add the curry powder and the chopped sweet potatoes and saute for 1 minute. Add the stock and apple and bring to the boil. Simmer for 20 minutes until the sweet potatoes are tender. Blend the soup until smooth. Heat the milk until hot and add to the soup. Season and serve with some crusty bread.

In a small bowl, combine the first five ingredients. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the oil to the pan. Swirl to coat the bottom of the pan. Add the egg mixture. Cook until just set. Add the sweet chili sauce and the onions. Cook until the onions are wilted. Add the noodles. Stir until heated through. Serve immediately.

In a medium bowl combine the cake mix, orange juice concentrate, and almond extract. In a 9-inch pie plate spray with cooking spray. Pour in the mixture and spread evenly over the bottom. Microwave on high for 20 to 30 seconds. Sprinkle with the frosting. Serve warm.

Brown pork sausage in oil. Add onion, bell pepper and celery. Add berries and apple. Cook till vegetables are soft. Add flour and stir. Add enough broth to make a moist mixture. Add cornbread mix. Stir until well combined. Spray baking dish with cooking spray. Bake at 400 degrees until lightly browned. Serve in slices.
Combine all the ingredients in a food processor or blender. Blend for a few seconds and then add the olive oil slowly while the food processor is on. The mixture should be very green and smooth.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Slice potatoes to 1/2-inch thickness using a mandolin or very sharp knife. Toss in a bowl with bay leaf, horseradish, 1 tablespoon olive oil, and kosher salt and pepper to taste. Spread into a 13-inch by 9-inch baking pan coated with cooking spray. Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, until potatoes are crispy. Top with sour cream and chives, sprinkle with salt and pepper, drizzle with remaining olive oil and serve.

Mix the egg and milk in a bowl and set aside. Place a slice of ham on one half of an english muffin. Sprinkle with cheese. Top with another half of the muffin and egg mixture. Microwave for 45 seconds to 1 minute on high or until egg is cooked through. Cut into four pieces and serve.

Cut grapes in half and arrange on a plate or platter. Drizzle with honey and sprinkle with crumbled feta and fresh basil leaves. Drizzle with oil and season with freshly ground pepper to taste. Serve immediately.
Brown chicken in olive oil until cooked through. Add bell pepper, onion and zucchini and saute until tender crisp. Add pasta sauce and basil. Bring to boil. Serve on zucchini noodles or over pasta.

Put all the ingredients in a blender and process until smooth. Spread on dehydrator trays and dry overnight. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to two weeks, or in the freezer for up to six months. To make crackers, press into rounds using a cookie press or a large straw. Sprinkle with herbs of your choice and dehydrate for two hours at 140 degrees Fahrenheit or until the crackers have dried.

Bake sugar cookie dough according to package directions. Cool and frost with chocolate frosting. Add orange icing and decorating gel for eyes and beak and chocolates for feathers.
name: chocolate covered graham crackers with almondsingredients: graham cracker squares, chocolate chips, chopped almondspreparation:Place the graham cracker squares on wax paper. Place the chocolate chips on top of the graham cracker squares. Melt the chocolate chips with the double boiler method. Once melted pour over the graham cracker squares and sprinkle with the chopped almonds.
name: peanut butter crackersingredients: vanilla wafers, peanut butter, chocolate chips, confectioners’sugarpreparation:Break up the vanilla wafers into small pieces and put into a bowl. Add the peanut butter and mix well. Add the confectioners’sugar and chocolate chips and mix well. Roll the mixture into balls and put on

In a small bowl combine mayonnaise, parmesan cheese and anchovies. Add garlic and lemon juice and stir. Add a few drops of olive oil and blend well. Place in refrigerator while you grill the chicken. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Place the buns on the baking sheet and grill for a few minutes until toasted and golden brown. Combine the arugula and the grilled chicken in a large bowl and toss gently. Spoon the dressing over the top of the salad and toss to coat thoroughly. Serve immediately on the grilled buns.

In a large skillet over medium heat, brown the pancetta until crisp. Add the garlic, rosemary sprigs, and cook for 3 minutes. Stir in tomato, crushing it between your fingertips. Add 1 cup water and season with salt. Simmer until thickened, about 15 minutes. Stir in heavy cream and simmer 5 minutes longer or until sauce thickens slightly. Toss with penne pasta just before serving.
name: macaroni & cheeseingredients: macaroni noodles, milk, cheesepreparation:Combine noodles and milk in saucepan. Bring to boiling. Remove from heat. Stir in cheese until melted. Serve hot.
name: macaroni saladingredients: macaroni noodles, celery, carrots, onion, green pepper, hard-boiled eggs, mayonnaise, sugarpreparation:Cook macaroni noodles in boiling water until tender but firm. Drain well. Combine noodles, celery, carrots, onion,

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl mix together dry ingredients (except egg). Stir in honey & egg. Add milk & vegetable oil. Stir until well blended. Pour into greased 13 x 9 x 2 inch pan. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until knife inserted in center comes out clean. Cool slightly before cutting. Makes 16 servings.

In a large shallow bowl, combine the milk and egg. Add the cinnamon and vanilla and mix well. Dip the bread into the mixture. Fry the slices in a skillet in 1/4 inch of hot oil. Cook over medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with confectioners' sugar while still hot. Serve immediately. Serves 4.
name: healthier french toast
ingredients: eggs, milk, maple syrup, cinnamon, vanilla extract, bread, oil, powdered sugar, carrot, sweet potato
preparation:Combine eggs, milk, orange puree, maple syrup or honey, cinnamon, and vanilla in a large shallow dish. Dip bread until soaked on both sides. Cook in skillet over medium heat. Use a small amount of oil to keep the toast from sticking. Allow the first side to brown, then flip to brown the second side of the bread. Dust with powdered sugar or top with your favorite syrup

Cut potatoes into long slices. Boil water and add slices to boiling water. Cook until tender. Drain and toss with seasonings. Place in baking dish. Cover with barbecue sauce and sprinkle with mesquite. Bake for 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Spread the penne out into a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add the vegetable oil. Brown the ground chicken in the skillet until cooked through. Drain excess fat and set aside. In a saucepan on low heat add the tomato sauce, brown sugar, salt, pepper and garlic powder and stir until combined. In a baking dish add the chicken, tomato sauce mixture, and the cooked pasta. Stir until the pasta is fully coated with the sauce mixture. Top with the pine nuts and bake for 20 minutes. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Place crescent rolls on baking sheet. Bake for 8 to 12 minutes or until puffed and golden. Remove from oven. Cool 5 minutes. In bowl, combine soup mix, water and garlic. Stir well. Spread onto baked crescent rolls. Top with sour cream, spinach, artichoke hearts, water chestnuts and feta cheese. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Return to oven. Bake 10 to 12 minutes more or until heated through. Serve warm.

Mix first 5 ingredients in a small bowl. Add garlic and ginger. Mix well. Rub mixture over chicken pieces. Marinate in refrigerator at least 24 hours or overnight. Cook chicken pieces in a skillet on a stove top or in a slow cooker. Add coconut milk. Simmer at least 15 minutes. Add lemon juice and salt and pepper to taste. Serve over steamed rice. Garnish with chopped green onions and sprinkle with chopped coconut.

Beat together egg, butter and salt and pepper in a medium bowl. Stir in corn, ham, green onion and bacon bits. Place mixture in rice cooker. Set to cook on high for 2 hours. Stir every 30 minutes. Remove from rice cooker to a plate and serve.

Trim woody ends of asparagus. Heat vegetable oil in a large nonstick skillet over high heat. Add gingerroot and garlic and cook for 20 seconds. Stir in asparagus and cook for 1 minute. Stirring constantly, add the chicken broth, soy sauce and cornstarch mixture. Bring to a boil and cook until the liquid is thickened and the asparagus is tender, about 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the crushed red pepper flakes. Serve immediately.

In a saucepan, combine the sugar and cocoa, and slowly add the milk. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and add the eggs, stirring constantly. Return to the heat and stir constantly for 1 minute. Remove from heat and add the butter and vanilla. Pour into an 8x8 inch baking dish and bake uncovered for 45 minutes. Serve hot or cold.

Sprinkle the pudding rice into a large heatproof bowl. In a saucepan, combine the coconut milk, milk, lime rind and sugar. Stir over low heat until the sugar has dissolved. Pour the hot mixture into the bowl with the rice, stirring well to combine. Pour the mixture into a 1-1/2 quart casserole dish. Scatter the fruit on the surface. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until firm. Serve warm or cold.

In a medium sized saucepan on low heat, combine all the above ingredients except the garlic flakes. Stir occasionally until everything is completely dissolved into the tomato paste. Then add the garlic flakes. Taste and adjust the salt or pepper as needed.

In a large skillet or wok, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Cook the shrimp in the pan until they have just turned pink and are firm to the touch, about 1 minute per side, depending on the size of the shrimp. Add the garlic and cook until it turns golden brown, about 30 seconds. Add the white wine and cook until the wine is reduced by half. Add the salt and pepper and cook until the liquid is evaporated and the shrimp are cooked through and opaque. Stir in the parsley and lemon juice and serve immediately.

Combine first 3 ingredients. Add 3/4 cup cracker crumbs. Mix well. Shape into 2 patties. Dip into remaining cracker crumbs. Heat oil in skillet over medium high heat. Add patties. Fry until golden. Turn over. Fry other side until brown. Drain. Serve with gravy.

In a large bowl combine zucchini and onionsprinkle with garlic salt. In a small bowl combine egg and waterbeat until blended. Combine zucchini mixture and egg mixturemix well. In a 1-quart saucepan melt the butter and stir in the flour. Stir in the milk slowly. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Pour sauce over the vegetable mixture. Place in a greased 1 1/2-quart shallow baking dish. Sprinkle with the cheddar cheese. Bake in a preheated 375-degree oven until cheese is melted and bubbly.

Bring the milk to a boil in a saucepan. Add rice, sugar and cardamom. Cook until the rice is translucent and the mixture thickens. Add the almonds and rose water. Stir. Remove from the heat and add the nutmeg. Cool and serve with the strawberries.
What do you think of Almonds?

Cook pasta according to package directionsdrain. Brown beef in a large skilletdrain. Add spaghetti sauce and simmer for 5 minutes or until heated through. Stir in light cream cheese until meltedblend well. Stir in cooked pastatoss gently. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Makes 4 servings.

In a small saucepan, bring milk to boil over medium-high heat and remove from heat. Put chips and butter into a small bowl and microwave until just meltedstir until smooth. Slowly whisk in milk. Stir until smooth and glossy. Refrigerate until slightly thickened, 15 to 20 minutes. Spread on cake or cookie before serving.

Marinate shrimp in mixture for 2 hours. In a heavy skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add shrimp and stir-fry 2-3 minutes. Remove and set aside. Add sesame oil and stir-fry gingerroot until tender. Return shrimp to skillet and add chinese wine. Simmer 1 minute. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with sugar and serve over hot rice topped with fresh cilantro.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Cut sweet potatoes into bite sized pieces. Toss in a little olive oil and bake for about 10 minutes or until cooked through. Cook the rice according to package directions using chicken broth instead of water. Saute garlic and fresh thyme in 2 tbsp of butter until garlic is lightly golden brown. Toss in cooked chicken and combine with sauteed garlic and thyme. Stir in sweet potatoes and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with parmesan cheese to taste.

In a medium pot over high heat, combine water, salt and arborio rice. Stir occasionally until the water is absorbed. Pour in the milk and bring back to a simmer. Turn off heat. Meanwhile, in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, combine the half-and-half, egg yolks and 1/2 cup of the sugar. Mix until completely smooth. Pour the hot rice mixture through the sieve into the electric mixer bowl and stir well. Add the vanilla beans and stir until combined. Pour mixture into a buttered baking dish and bake for 45 minutes. Cool completely on a wire rack and refrigerate until cold. In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, cream the butter until fluffy and light. Add the remaining 1/4 cup of sugar and beat until combined. Beat in the confectioners' sugar until combined. Beat in the cream until combined. Spread the ganache over the top of the cold rice mixture. Refrigerate until well chilled, at least 4 hours or overnight. Serve chilled with whipped

Mix dry ingredients together. Cut in Crisco until mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in milk just until mixture is a soft dough. Bake on greased baking sheet at 425f for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Makes about 2 dozen biscuits.

Bring water to a boil. Add beef bouillon cubes and stir until dissolved. Add white onions and boil until tender. Add heavy whipping cream and stir until thickened. Add cheddar cheese and monterey jack cheese. Stir until melted. Serve in a bread bowl.

Bring to a boil 1 cup of water, add 1/2 teaspoon each of garlic clove and rosemary leaf. Cook for 1 minute. Let stand 1 minute to infuse flavors. Add maple syrup and whiskey to make glaze. Remove rosemary leaf from glaze before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Heat margarine in large skillet over medium heat. Add hash browns and cook and stir until lightly browned. Remove from heat. In small bowl combine soup, sour cream and onion. Pour over hash browns. Bake 40-50 minute or until golden brown. Sprinkle with cornflakes and serve immediately.

Place cherry tomatoes in medium bowl. Toss with olives. In a small bowl combine olive oil and vinegar. Pour over tomatoes. Sprinkle with basil. Toss gently. Season with salt to taste. Chill before serving.
Tomatoes are a superb source of vitamin A.

Peel and slice the potatoes. Place in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil and cook until potatoes are tender. Drain and return potatoes to the pot. Add the rest of the ingredients. Simmer until the potatoes are very soft. Stir in the green peas. Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serves 6.

Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until tender. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Add zucchini. Reduce heat to medium and cook 10 minutes or until tender. Stir in oregano and red pepper flakes. Stir in sauce and cook until hot. Sprinkle with cheeses. Serve immediately.

Mix potatoes with peas and corn. Season with salt and pepper. Heat butter until melted. Add potato mixture to butter and stir over med heat until thickened, stirring constantly. Combine broth with flour until smooth. Add to potatoes mixture, stirring constantly until thickened, about 1 minute. Cool. Cut tenderloin into 1 inch cubes. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in nonstick skillet over med. Heat. Add cubes and saute until brown on all sides. Drain. Place cubes over rice mixture in serving dish. Serve immediately.

Heat the oven to 200f. Beat the yolks with the water, add the salt, beat well. In a heavy saucepan mix the flour and milk with the beaten yolks. Cook over low heat stirring constantly until the mixture has thickened slightly and coats the back of a wooden spoon. Remove from the heat, add the melted butter, the egg whites beaten to stiff peaks and stir until blended. Spread the batter evenly on a greased baking sheet. Bake until golden brown, 30 to 35 minutes. Cool slightly. Roll into cylinders or fold into triangles to serve with jam or preserves.

Bring 3 quarts of water to a boil with 2 teaspoons of salt. Cook lo mein noodles for 5 minutes or according to package directions. Drain well. In a large pot add the oil. Add the pork loin. Cook until the meat is no longer pink. Add the remaining ingredients. Cover and simmer until the vegetables are tender. Remove from the heat. Serve in soup bowls.

Cut bread in half horizontally. Brush cut sides with butter. Place bread on hot grill. Cook until bottom half of bread is browned. Spread bottom of bread with mustard. Place onion slices on mustard and sprinkle with cheese. Top with second half of bread. Press down firmly and cook until browned and cheese is melted. Serve open faced.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Line a shallow baking pan with foil. In a small saucepan melt the butter with the cinnamon over low heat until the butter is melted and the cinnamon is fragrant. Add the pecan halves and toss to coat. Spread the nuts in the prepared pan. Bake until the nuts are lightly browned. In a large bowl, toss the spinach with the chicken. Add the strawberry slices and nectarines and toss gently to coat. Drizzle the salad with the dressing. Sprinkle with the toasted nuts. Serve immediately.

In a medium bowl combine the butter, flour, salt, pepper, and mustard. Mix well. Gradually add the milk to the dry ingredients. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until thickened. Remove from heat. Add the worcestershire and stir until blended. Add the cheese and stir until melted. Pour into fondue pot. Serve with sliced baguettes and fruit.

Place 3 scoops of vanilla ice cream into blenderadd 2 tablespoons of chocolate syrupcover and blend until smooth. Pour into large cocktail glassgarnish with a cookie crumb and coconut.
11) Mud pie is an American pie made of chocolate or vanilla custard pie filling sandwiched between two crumbly buttery cookie crusts. It is typically baked to make the filling set rather than being completely set as with standard custard pies.
12) Cookie dough is a mixture of flour, fat, and sugar that is used to make cookies. Cookies are small baked products that are popular in many countries.
13) Meringue is a type of frosting used in many different desserts such as pies, cakes, cookies, tarts, etc. It is usually made from egg whites whipped together until stiff peaks form. This helps to give meringue its characteristic texture. Meringue is very versatile because it can be used in place of other frostings such as buttercream or custard frosting.

Melt butter in pan. Mix in flour and seasonings. Stir in milk. Bring to a boil. Add peas and shrimp. Cook until done. Stir in parsley. Serve over noodles.

Mix all the ingredients in a large glass jar or bowl. Place the mushrooms in the marinade, cover tightly and refrigerate for at least 4 hours. The longer you let the mushrooms marinate the better they will be.

Combine the first four ingredients in a large plastic bag. Shake in the chicken pieces to coat well. Place in a single layer in a large shallow roasting pan. Sprinkle with the remaining seasoning blend. Bake in a 375 f oven for 1 hour, turning once after 30 minutes of cooking.

Preheat oven to 375f. Lightly grease 6-8 wells of a standard muffin tin. Combine dry ingredients and mix well. Combine wet ingredients and mix well. Add cornmeal and dry ingredients. Stir until just mixed. Add grated cheese and stir to combine. Fill wells halfway. Bake for about 20 minutes until golden brown. Serve warm.

In a large bowl combine all dry ingredients. Make a well in the center. Add wet ingredients. Stir to combine. Divide into 2 round loaf pans. Bake for 1 hour or until the loaves sound hollow when tapped. Cool 10 minutes in the pan then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.

Remove seeds and ribs from bell peppers. Brush inside of peppers with a little water. Brown ground beef with chili powder. Add barley and cinnamon. Stir to combine. Add enough water to make a sauce. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes or until barley is tender. Remove from heat and stir in salsa. Stuff peppers and sprinkle with raisins. Bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees. Serve with rice or corn muffins.
Puree all the ingredients together in a blender. Chill thoroughly before serving.
Boil one part hot water and one part cooked oats in saucepan until thick. Stir in cornstarch and sugar. Add nutmeg and vanilla and bring to boil. Cool and strain. Chill. Store in fridge.

Combine cream cheese and yogurt in a medium bowl and beat until smooth. Add sugar and lemon juice and mix well. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, arrange fruit on a plate and sprinkle with sugar cookie crumbs. Serve the fruit and cream mixture over the fruit. Garnish each serving with a cherry and mint sprig.
Prepare mash according to pack instructions. Beat with spoon until smooth. Heat margarine and curry powder in small saucepan until melted. Stir into mash. Serve with vegetables.

Dissolve the gelatin in the boiling water for about 5 minutes stirring constantly until dissolved. Add the alcohol, stirring to combine well. Pour into shot glasses or individual jell-o shot cups and refrigerate for 4-6 hours or until set. Serve chilled.
In a small bowl, combine butter, mustard, sugar, green onions. Rub mixture on both sides of fish. Grill fish for 6-8 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork.

Place the lemon slices into a large pitcher. Pour in the sugar. Pour in the water. Add in the lemon juice and stir. Let the mixture steep in the refrigerator overnight. The next day pour in the cold water. Serve over ice.

Preheat oven to 180 c. Sprinkle the chicken with the spice mix. Heat the oil in a large ovenproof frying pan. Add the garlic, chicken and orange juice and season well. Cover with foil. Bake in the oven for 1 hour. Add the honey. Cook uncovered for 10 minutes. Garnish with the orange wedges. Sprinkle with the fresh chives.
I love to make chicken with any fruit. I have made it with raspberries and it was awesome. I also made it with orange juice and it was really good. I never thought about making it with a citrus fruit. I will have to try this.
I like to make a quick casserole dish with boneless, skinless chicken breast. I cut the breasts into small pieces and cook them in a skillet. Then I mix together canned cream of celery soup, milk, dried parsley flakes, garlic powder, parmesan cheese, paprika. I mix this up in a bowl and add the chicken pieces. I pour it

Preheat oven to 175 degrees Celsius and line two baking trays with baking paper. In a large bowl mix the rolled oats, desiccated coconut and plain flour, then set aside. In another large bowl beat the brown sugar and golden syrup until light and fluffy, add the butter and beat until well combined. Stir in the bicarbonate of soda and water and mix until well combined. Pour over the dry ingredients and stir until well combined. Roll into teaspoon sized balls and place on the prepared baking trays about 4 cm apart. Flatten with the back of the spoon and bake for 10-15 minutes or until lightly golden. Cool on the tray for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. Store in an airtight container.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees f. In a medium bowl, whisk together brown sugar and butter. Add bacon to the mixture. Heat oven to 375 degrees f. Lightly grease baking dish with cooking spray. Line with fish. Dot with bacon mixture. Bake 30 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork.
I had to make this because I love bacon and egg sandwiches so much! I love this recipe because it's healthy and tasty.
I had to make this because I love bacon and egg sandwiches so much! I love this recipe because it's healthy and tasty. I made this for breakfast. I made some toast, scrambled some eggs, and cooked the bacon. I put it all together and it was delicious. I like that there were no strange or weird flavors. It was so good that my husband asked if he could have some.
Mix together crabmeat and mayonaise. Mix in the celery and onion. Add the dill and season to taste. Serve on crispy lettuce.

Salt cod fillets with sea salt and leave for one hour. Heat oven to 200 degrees C. Place fish fillets on a baking tray and bake for 5 minutes. Remove from oven and spread mayonnaise on top of fillets. Sprinkle with sea salt and bake for a further 5 minutes. Serve with a large bowl of salt and vinegar potato chips.

Wash and pat dry the breasts. Cut a slit in each breast and insert a piece of lemon rind. Season with salt and pepper, then dip in the yogurt and roll in the breadcrumbs. Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan over medium heat until hot. Fry the breasts for 3-4 minutes on each side until golden brown. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towels to drain. In a bowl, whisk the curry powder into the yogurt until smooth, then pour over the breasts. Serve hot with fresh coriander.

Rinse tenderloin and pat dry. Sprinkle with chili powder, paprika, garlic powder and salt and pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add tenderloin and brown for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Place tenderloin in crockpot. Combine remaining 1/2 cup broth and barbecue sauce in small bowl. Pour over tenderloin. Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or until tender. Transfer tenderloin to cutting board. Shred with 2 forks and return to crockpot. Stir in cider vinegar. Cook on low for 30 minutes. Serve in buns.

In a large bowl, beat together eggs, flour, baking powder and cottage cheese. Add cheeses and green chiliesmix well. Melt 4 tbsp. butter in an 8-inch square baking dish. Pour egg mixture into dishsprinkle with remaining 1 tbsp. butter. Bake at 375F for 30 to 35 minutes or until firm.
Melt butter. Whisk together flour and butter. Slowly add broth while whisking to make a smooth gravy. Add worcestershire and season to taste.

Cut head of cabbage in half lengthwise. Remove any outer leaves that are discolored or yellowed. Discard core of head. With your hands or a sharp knife, shred cabbage into a large bowl. Add butter to skillet. When melted, add shredded cabbage. Stir to coat with butter. Add Cheez Whiz and seasoning to taste with salt and pepper. Mix well. Transfer to 9x13 casserole dish. Bake uncovered at 350 for one hour or until bubbly.

Cream together the cream cheese and onion and then add the green pepper and sugar and vinegar and salt and lastly add the egg and mix well and refrigerate until ready to serve with crackers or chips.

Place meat and onion soup mix in crock pot. Add broth. Cover and cook for 5 hours or until meat is tender. Add mushrooms and simmer another hour. Add potatoes and simmer for a half hour more. Serve over mashed potatoes.
Mix together cake mix, pudding mix, oil, water and eggs. Bake according to directions on box.

Grate the cucumbers and red onion very finely. Add the mint, cayenne and garlic to taste. Beat in the yogurt until smooth. Let stand for at least 1 hour before serving to blend flavors. Serve on top or on the side of your favorite indian dish, or serve as a dipping sauce with naan bread.

In medium saucepan over medium heat, melt 4 tablespoons butter. Add flour and cook, stirring constantly until lightly browned. Add milk and continue to cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Stir in potatoes and cook until tender and lightly browned, stirring occasionally. Add salt, pepper and cheese. Stir to mix.
Mix butter and sugars. Add egg and vanilla and beat until creamy. Stir in dry ingredients. Add raisins and chocolate chips. Drop onto cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 12-15 minutes.

Cut ham into thin slices. Cut fresh pineapple into 1/2 inch cubes. Combine ham slices with half of the cubes in a bowl. Combine remaining cubes with remaining ingredients in another bowl. Spoon over ham. Toss gently. Refrigerate.
Beat eggs and mix in cottage cheese. Heat a skillet with butter, add mixture and cook until done, but not too firm. Serve on toast with chopped parsley sprinkled on top.

Melt margarine in skillet over medium heat. Add all vegetables and garlic to margarine. Cook until crisp tender. Drain. Stir in mushrooms and salt and pepper to taste. Heat to serving temperature. Combine buttermilk, cheese and parsley. Stir until melted. Serve over cooked noodles. Sprinkle with additional parsley.

Place berries in a large stockpot or dutch oven. Add water. Bring to a boil and cook at a gentle boil until berries begin to burst open. Drain through a colander lined with cheese cloth. Discard liquid and place berries and juice in a pot. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. Simmer over low heat for 1 hour or until berries are very soft. Add remaining ingredients. Simmer 15 minutes. Remove from heat and mash berries with a potato masher. Let cool. Transfer to a bowl and refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight. Serve chilled.

Mix together olive oil, seasonings, oregano, garlic and water. Place prawns in a non-stick pan and pour mixture over them. Turn heat to medium high and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side or until prawns turn pink. Serve with sour cream on top.

Combine vegetable stock, ginger, onion, garlic, carrots, bell peppers, water chestnuts, snow peas, bambo

Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (160 degrees C). Grease a 9 x 13 inch baking pan with nonstick cooking spray. Blend together the eggs, cream, water and seasonings in a large bowl until smooth. Add in the turkey bacon, onions, broccoli and cheese. Mix well. Pour into prepared baking pan, and bake for 60 minutes in the preheated over, or until golden brown and set. Let stand for 5 minutes before cutting into wedges.

Peel and seed the avocado. Cut it in half lengthwise and remove the stone. Scoop the flesh out and place it in a bowl. Add the lemon juice and mix it through. Season with salt and pepper and spread onto the slices of buttered bread. Toast the sandwiches under a grill for a minute on each side and serve immediately.

Mix together lemon pepper and vegetable oil in a shallow bowl. Toss chicken wings in oil mixture. Bake on baking sheet in preheated 400 degree F oven for approximately 20 minutes or until done. During last 10 minutes of cooking time, stir together mustard and honey in a small bowl. Cut each chicken wing into three pieces. Place in shallow dish. Drizzle with mustard mixture. Garnish with cilantro. Serve with warm tortilla chips.

In a large skillet, heat 2 tsp. butter over medium heat. Add garlic, basil leaves, lemon juice, and salt & pepper. Cook 30 seconds. Add linguinetoss well. Sprinkle with parmesan & chicken. Serve warm.

Soak rice papers in water for 2 to 3 minutes or until soft. Drain. Lay each sheet flat. Spread vermicelli noodles across the sheet to within 2 inches of the edge. Arrange mushroom slices and capers over the noodles. Top with cabbage and soy sauce. Lay smoked salmon over the cabbage. Sprinkle with ground black pepper. Fold up the sheet to enclose the filling. Cut into 6 pieces and serve with dipping sauce. Dipping sauce- combine all ingredients in a small bowl.
Incredible recipe. I'm going to make it again soon.
Delicious and easy recipe. I will make it again soon.
Mix the instant pudding with the milk. Mix in the sour cream and the cream cheese. Fold in the cherry pie filling. Pour into the pie shell and refrigerate overnight.

In a saucepan of boiling salted water over high heat, cook carrots just until crisp-tender, about 3 minutes. Drain and return to pan. Add garlic and cook 1 minute more. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. In same pan over medium heat, melt butter, then add jalapeno and cook 2 minutes more. Stir in preserves, brown sugar and mustard and cook for 2 minutes more or until thickened and bubbly. Add carrots and cook 1 minute more. Stir in lemon juice and rosemary and serve immediately.

The flavor of this is very good, but it's too sweet for us. I would not use a whole cup of sugar next time.

Marinate the fillets in the orange juice and add the sliced onion and carrot. Heat the cooking oil and fry the fillets with the onions and carrot. Add the garlic and cook till soft. Add the sugar and white pepper and cook for about 5 minutes. Serve with steamed rice.

Cut cabbage in half lengthwise. Remove core. Slice 1/2" thick. Melt butter in a 9 x 13 pan. Mix together cabbage slices and soup. Spread in pan. Bake 25 minutes at 375. Remove from oven. Combine sour cream, and melted butter. Spread over cabbage. Sprinkle with french fried onions. Bake 10-15 minutes at 400 degrees. Cut into 6 wedges.

Heat butter and balsamic vinegar together in a saucepan until hot. Add the spinach and toss to coat. Cook for 1 minute. Add the salt and pepper to taste.
Spinach is also good in pasta dishes. It is wonderful in lasagna or served raw on pizza. You can add it to soups and stews or cook it in soup to make it more creamy.
Spinach can be used in sandwiches. I like to add it to turkey sandwiches.
Spinach is also very good in salads. You can use it in any type of salad and it is especially good in fruit salads. You can make it into a smoothie or shake.
Spinach is also good in other foods. It is often added to omelets and quiches. It is also used in souffles and it is often used in potato dishes. It is even used in some cake recipes. It is also very good in dip or spreads and it is good in pizza dough.

In a large pan, saute the garlic in the olive oil until fragrant. Add the Boca and cook until browned and the liquid has evaporated. Add the vegetable broth and the mixed mushrooms. Simmer for about 10 minutes or until the liquid has reduced and the mixture is thick. Stir in the pasta and the water and cook until the pasta is done. Season with the garlic powder, cumin, paprika and salt and pepper. Serve with the vegan sour cream.

Heat oil in skillet. Cook celery, green pepper and onion until tender. Add hamburger and kielbasa. Cook until no longer pink. Drain fat. Add cream of chicken soup and french onion soup. Cook until heated through. Mix in rice and cream of mushroom soup. Season to taste. Bake in covered casserole dish at 350 for about 40 minutes. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

In a large bowl, mix sweet potatoes with olive oil, cumin, salt and pepper. Spread onto a baking sheet and bake at 350 degrees F until crisp, about 20 minutes. Transfer to a large bowl. In a separate bowl, combine lime juice with remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil. Season with salt. Add black beans and oniontoss to coat. Stir into potatoes. Toss in cilantro. Serve warm or at room temperature.
Grease a 3-quart slow cooker. In a large bowl stir together all the ingredients. Pour into slow cooker. Cover and cook on low for 3 hours. Serve warm.

In a small bowl combine the first 5 ingredients. In a large bowl toss together the first 3 ingredients. Toss the sugar snap peas with the oil mixture and place on a large baking sheet or into a glass baking dish. Bake for 15 minutes. Stirring occasionally. Remove from oven and sprinkle the top with the remaining 2 teaspoons of thyme. Place back in the oven for another 10 minutes. Stirring occasionally. Remove from oven and season with salt and pepper. Let sit for a few minutes before serving.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Sprinkle pork with 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Place pork in a greased 11- x 7-inch baking dish. Combine barbecue sauce and next 4 ingredientspour over pork. Bake 1 hour. Cool slightly. Cut pork into 1/4-inch-thick strips. Combine bell peppers and onions in a bowltoss with remaining 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Divide pork and vegetables evenly among tortillas. Roll up tightly. Serve with barbecue sauce.

Beat eggs with sugar and seasonings until thick. Blend in the cornstarch. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until mixture becomes thick and clear. Remove from heat and beat in the cream style corn and heavy cream. Pour into a 2-quart casserole dish sprayed with cooking spray and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until firm. Serves 6 to 8.

In a large pot, add the olive oil and saut the leeks and garlic until fragrant. Add the potatoes, broth, beans, rosemary, and season with the salt and pepper. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for about 30 minutes or until the potatoes are cooked through. With an immersion blender, puree the soup in batches. Serve hot.

Slice red onion thinly. Pour rice wine vinegar over sliced onions and let sit for 15 minutes to 1 hour. Drain well. Mix remaining ingredients together in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Pour over onions and cook for 1 minute to heat through. Let cool before serving.

In a small sauce pan over low heat, melt butter. Stir in marshmallows until fully melted and blended. Remove from heat. Stir in green food coloring until desired color is achieved. Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper and form into clusters. Sprinkle with corn flakes and red cinnamon candies. Refrigerate until firm. Enjoy.
 candy cane popcorn ballsingredients: corn syrup, vanilla extract, peppermint extract, salt, popcorn, peppermint candiespreparation:Combine syrup, extracts and salt in medium saucepan over low heat. Stir until smooth and heated through. Add popcorn and peppermint candies and stir until completely coated. Form into balls and place on wax paper on cookie sheet. Chill until firm. Store in airtight container.

Cook the rice according to the package instructions. Stir the raisins into the cooked riceset aside to cool. Combine the condensed milk, butter and vanilla in a large bowl. Stir until smoothstir the rice mixture into the condensed milk mixture until completely combined. Add the cinnamon, stir well. Spread into an 8-inch square baking dish. Bake at 350F for 20 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Serve warm or cold with cream or ice cream on top.
Melt together butter and brown sugar until smooth. Add walnuts, cracker crumbs and chocolate baking squares. Press into greased 9x13 pan. Chill until firm. Cut into 1-inch squares.

Brown the ground beef in a large skillet. Drain the excess fat off. Add the tomato sauce, water, barbecue sauce, dried onions flakes, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder and hot pepper sauce. Cook at a low boil for 20 minutes.

In a large bowl combine the first eight ingredients. Spoon the mixture into the center of each cabbage leaf and fold in the sides. Arrange the folded cabbage leaves in a buttered baking dish. Combine the sauce ingredients in a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Pour over the stuffed cabbage. Cover and bake for one hour. Uncover and continue baking until the sauce is thickened and the cabbage is tender.

In a bowl combine the meatloaf mixture, 1 egg, 1 cup bread crumbs and 1 cup vegetable juice cocktail. Add parsley and salt and pepper to taste. Press half the mixture into the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish. Place half the ham slices in rows on top of the meat. Top with remaining meatloaf mixture. Top with remaining ham and remaining bread crumbs. Beat remaining egg and pour over top of the loaf. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until the egg is set. Cut into squares and serve.

Separate the eggs and beat the yolks until light and fluffy. Add the milk and beat again until smooth. Stir in the sugar and nutmeg. Cook over low heat, stirring until thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. Do not let it come to a full boil or it will curdle. Stir in the rum and the vanilla. Pour the mixture into a 1-quart heat proof container and let it cool at room temperature. Then refrigerate it for 2 hours before serving.

Brown the ground beef in a skillet over medium high heat until thoroughly cooked. Add the onion and garlic and saute until tender. Add the rest of the seasonings and cook for 2 minutes. Add the tomato sauce and cook for another 2 minutes. Serve over rice or pasta and top with cheese.

Heat oil in large pot over medium high heat. Add onion and cook 3-4 minutes or until translucent. Add tomatoes and cook 5-7 minutes. Add herbs and chili flakes and cook 2 minutes more. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in parmesan.

In a saucepan over medium heat, combine sugar and water. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Add popcorn and stir until well coated. Pour into 9 x 13 inch pan. In a double boiler over hot water, melt chocolate and condensed milk until smooth and pour over popcorn mixture. Sprinkle with butter. Let stand for 30 minutes before breaking into pieces. Store in airtight container.
Peel and seed chiles. Chop very fine. Saute in olive oil with onions. Add chicken bouillon. Add corn kernel. Add sour cream. Cook until hot. Serve with corn chips.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the green bell pepper, red onion, and green onion. Cook until softened. Add the corned beef. Cook until the meat is no longer pink. Add the potatoes. Cook until the potatoes are crispy. Add the Worcestershire sauce. Add the broth. Stir until the mixture is well combined. Serve with eggs.

In a medium bowl stir together cooked rice, milk, sugar, eggs, raisins and vanilla. Mix well. Grease an 8-cup baking dish or 2 1-cup ramekins with butter. Pour the mixture into the dish or ramekins. Sprinkle with the orange zest, cardamom, cinnamon and nutmeg. Bake for 35 minutes or until the top is golden brown and the pudding is set. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Wow! There are so many different ways of making this simple dessert! I will have to try them all! Thanks!
Great list of recipes! I have some brown rice so I think I will try the Rice Pudding for One recipe.

Place brie in a small baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly - about 10 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with the basil and garlic. Drizzle with oil and serve hot.
Mix together fruits. Drain pear halves. Pour into 2-quart casserole. Stir in remaining ingredients. Cover tightly. Bake at 350 degrees F. for 1 hour. Serve warm.

Spread mayonnaise on one side of each slice of bread. Place the lettuce on the bottom slice of bread. Place the tomatoes on top of the lettuce. Next add the cooked bacon on top of the tomatoes. Next add the slices of smoked ham on top of the bacon. Now add the slices of the cooked turkey on top of the ham. Lastly you will add the other slice of the bread.

Heat olive oil in a large oven proof pot. Brown the chicken on all sides. Add onion, capsicum and paprika. Saute for two minutes. Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric and boiling water. Cover with lid. Place in oven for one hour. Stir in rice. Cook for ten minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.
Toast bread. Spread with butter. Sprinkle with sugar and serve with warm milk.

Mix 2 pks. Of swiss choc. Cake mix in large bowl with vegetable oil and eggs. Stir in 3/4 cup cola. Pour batter into two greased 10 in. tube pans. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Meanwhile combine 1 pkg. Choc. Instant pudding with 1 1/2 cups cola. In a small bowl. Cool cake in pans for 10 minutes. Turn out onto wire racks. Cool completely. Pour cooled cola mixture over each layer. Refrigerate for 4 hours or until set. Spread each layer with 1/2 cup frosting. Frost top and sides. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Store in refrigerator.

Cook onion in a medium skillet over medium heat 5 minutes or until tender. Add peppers and cook 2 minutes. Stir in turkeycook 3 minutes or until no longer pink. Drain any excess fat. In a 2-1/2-quart casserole combine turkey mixture, sweet potato, baked beans, and soup. Spoon into a 13 x 9-inch baking pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with cheesebake 2 minutes longer or until melted. Serve with crackers or a loaf of bread.

Drain the sauerkraut and mash it well. Stir in the caraway seed, tomatoes, and dressing. Arrange the bread on the bottom of a buttered baking dish. Spoon the sauerkraut mixture on top. Layer the corned beef and swiss cheese on top. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes.

In a small saucepan over low heat, melt butter with 1/4 cup of water until butter is melted and water is steaming. Remove from heat. Stir in sweetened condensed milk until smooth and well blended. Stir in chocolate until melted. Remove from heat. Stir in kahlua. Stir in brewed coffee until well blended. Stir in miniature marshmallows until well blended. Serve in a fondue pot with dipping fruits of choice.

In a large bowl combine the first six ingredients. Spread into a 9x13-inch baking dish. In a medium bowl combine the dry cake mix and nutssprinkle over the top. Bake at 350 degrees for 40-45 minutes. Cool. Frost with Whipped Topping. Refrigerate overnight. Cut into bars.

Cook broccoli in boiling water until tender-crisp. Drain and set aside. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heatadd onion. Cook and stir 3 to 5 minutes or until tender. Combine the cooked broccoli, sour cream, mayonnaise and garlic powder in a medium bowl. Stir in the cooked onions. Spoon half of the mixture into a greased 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with 1 cup of the cheese. Top with remaining mixture. Sprinkle with remaining 1 cup of the cheese. Cover with cracker crumbs. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until heated through.
Mix carrot, raisins and peanut butter. Spread on bread slices. Cut into triangles.

Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Place chili sauce in a large roasting pan. Lay meat in pan. Pour cola over meat. Add ketchup and mix well. Add french onion soup mix. Cover with foil and cook for 3-4 hours. Serve with potato salad.

Cook chicken. Cool and cut into cubes. Cook rotini according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. In large bowl, toss chicken, romaine lettuce and cherry tomatoes. Add dressing and toss well to combine. Divide mixture onto 4 plates. Top with feta cheese and croutons. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 375f. Mix breadcrumbs and cheese in small bowl. Dip zucchini in beaten eggs then in crumbs to coat. Place on baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown turning once halfway through baking time. Serve warm. Makes 4 servings. Serves 4.

Mix together egg whites and cornstarch. Sprinkle over fish. Dip in sweet rice flour and shake off excess. Heat oil in a heavy skillet over medium heat until shimmering. Cook 3-4 minutes on each side. Remove from skillet and drain on paper towels.

Mix all ingredients together. Place in piping bag. Pipe mixture onto the base of the pastry case. Leave a little room at the top. Roll up and press the edges together. Cut in half. Sprinkle with icing sugar. Serve with sliced fruit.

Grease 9x13-inch pan with vegetable oil. In medium bowl combine dry cake mix and instant pudding mix, beat with wire whisk until smooth. In small bowl beat together water, rum, oil and eggs. Stir into dry ingredients until well blended. Spread half the batter in prepared pan. Sprinkle with chopped pecans. Top with remaining batter. Bake at 350 degrees for 45-50 minutes or until top is lightly browned and toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool completely before serving.

Preheat oven to 200C. Line 2 large baking trays with parchment paper or grease and flour trays. Sift the flour into a mixing bowl and add the baking powder and salt. Cut the butter into small pieces and rub into the flour mixture until it is crumbly and resembles breadcrumbs. Add the sugar and stir to mix through. Make a well in the centre and add the egg and milk. Stir until the mixture comes together. Bring together into a soft dough and knead gently for 30 seconds or so until it is smooth and pliable. Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface until it is about 1/2 cm thick and cut into desired shapes. Place onto the prepared trays and bake for 15-20 minutes until lightly browned on top and golden on the bottom. Cool for 5 minutes before serving warm or allow to cool completely.

Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil. Add sugar snap peas and boil for 3 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions and saut for 2-3 minutes until softened. Add sugar snap peas and saut for 3-5 minutes until crisp-tender. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with fresh mint leaves and serve warm or cold.
You can purchase Snap Peas at retail grocery stores and farmers markets.
Sugar snap pea pods can be stored for up to a week when placed in a plastic bag or paper towel in the refrigerator. Pea pods should be stored upright to prevent bruising.

Cream margarine. Add sugar and beat until light and fluffy. Add eggs and beat until light and fluffy. Add peanut butter and mix well. Add flour, oat bran, baking powder, and baking soda. Mix well. Roll into balls. Bake at 350 degrees until golden brown.
100% satisfaction guaranteed or your money back!
