Beat egg and milk together in a large bowl. Place crumbs in another bowl. Soak each steak in egg mixture, then roll in crumbs. Heat oil in fry pan to 350 degrees F. Cook steaks until browned and done through. Drain on paper towel. Serve with your favorite vegetable.

Butter a 2 quart baking dish. Tear challah into small pieces and place in the prepared baking dish. In a medium bowl beat together the eggs, whole milk, vanilla extract and cinnamon. Beat in the nutmeg. Pour the mixture over the challah pieces. Cover and place in the refrigerator overnight or at least two hours. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Sprinkle the top of the bread pudding with the pecans. Serve warm topped with maple syrup.
In my kitchen is the most delicious bread I've ever made. It's my mom's famous cinnamon swirl bread. I've made it several times before but this time I made it for my friend's bridal shower and it turned out great. I made it the night before and it was still moist and fresh when I put it on the table. I was pretty proud of myself for that one.
I made two loaves. I gave one loaf to my friend and I got to take the other home. I just wanted to take another picture before

Cook refried beans according to package directions. Let cool and put on a flat plate. Heat corn tortillas in microwave or fry on stove top in a little oil till browned. Let cool and cut in half lengthwise. Assemble your tacos with beans and top with cheese. Heat for 15 seconds in microwave. Assemble and serve with salsa and sour cream and a squeeze of lime.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add turkey and stir. Add ginger and garlic and cook until browned. Add hoisin sauce and cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Add carrots, red pepper and cucumber and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Place on bed of lettuce and garnish with green onion. Serve with lime wedges for squeezing over.
In large skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Add chicken. Cook for 2 minutes on each side. Transfer to crock pot. Add remaining ingredients. Cook covered 4 to 5 hours on low.

Sprinkle pork chops with pepper. Brown on both sides in oil in a skillet. Pour soup into the skillet. Add milk, water and rice. Cook 50 minutes. Stir occasionally. Remove chops. Add cornstarch to thicken gravy. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 375. Drain and squeeze out any extra liquid from the spinach. Chop the spinach and place in a bowl. Add the cream cheese, mayo and sour cream. Mix well. Add the chopped artichoke hearts and mix well. Pour into a 9x13 casserole dish. Sprinkle the mozzarella cheese over top. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve with tortilla chips.
Loved the taste. I did add a little bit of milk. I also added a little bit of jalapeno and green chilies. I'm not a fan of the texture of the tofu so I added some chicken.
I used to make this recipe using lite sour cream and fat free mayo. It was so delicious. I have since lost the recipe. I really would love to have it back. If anyone could help me out I would greatly appreciate it. Thank you.
I was able to find the recipe in the July 2003 issue of Taste of Home magazine.
I really like this recipe.

Spray 9 x 13 baking dish with cooking spray. In medium bowl combine sour cream and soupstir well. In another bowl combine salsa, onion, and pepper. Layer half the hash brown potatoes into baking dishspread with half the sour cream mixturetop with half the salsa mixturesprinkle with half the cheese. Repeat layers. Bake in 350 oven for 25 minutes or until heated through. Unmoldsprinkle with breadcrumbsdrizzle with melted butter. Serve warm with sour cream on the side if desired.

Heat oil in skillet over medium high heat. Saute onion 5-7 minutes or until tender. Add cola. In a cup combine cornstarch and cold water. Stir into skillet mixture and bring to a boil. Cook and stir 1 minute or until thickened. Stir in ketchup and seasonings. Place chicken in skillet. Cover and cook over low heat 10 minutes or until done. Serve with noodles if desired.

Bring 3 cups water to a boil. Add 1 cup of rice and 1/2 tsp. salt. Cook 20 minutes. Melt 3 Tbsp. butter in a frying pan. Add 1 cup rice, 1/2 cup of cooking water and 1/2 cup of milk and 1/2 tsp. salt. Cook until heated through. Remove from heat and stir in 1/4 cup of Parmesan cheese and 1/4 cup of parsley. Serves 4.

Butter one side of each tortilla. On one tortilla place brie cheese slices, a couple red onion slices, 1 mango slice, 1 serrano pepper slice. Fold in half. Repeat with remaining tortilla. Cook on each side until cheese is melted. Cut into wedges and serve with sour cream and cilantro.
Wow! I'm so excited to try these. Thanks!

Mix together turkey breast and beans. Heat oil in large skillet. Add garlic and jalapeno and saute 1 minute. Add tomato paste and cook 30 seconds. Add turkey mixture and cook 5 minutes or until thoroughly cooked. Add 1/2 cup water. Cook 5 minutes or until mixture thickens. Top with cilantro and serve with guacamole.
Combine mix with milk. Add egg substitute and oil. Fold in berries. Spoon into greased or paper lined muffin cups. Bake at 400 f for 20 to 25 minutes. Makes 12.

Separate wings at joints. Pat dry. Cut wings into serving pieces. In large pot, heat oil over medium-high heat. Brown wings in batches in oil for 5 minutes per side, stirring occasionally. Drain well. Combine flour and seasonings in paper bag or large bowl. Shake wings in bag to coat evenly with flour mixture. In small saucepan, combine water and cornstarch. Stir over low heat until thickened and clear. Stir in green bell pepper and onion. Add to wings in pot and stir to coat with sauce. Heat through. Serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In large bowl, toss onion with garlic. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add onion mixture. Cook 5 minutes or until onion is translucent. Stir in broccoli. Cook 5 minutes. Remove skillet from heat. Stir in half-and-half. Beat together eggs, half-and-half mixture, gruyere cheese and nutmeg. Pour into pie shell. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until knife inserted 1 inch from center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes before cutting.
Mix crumbs, milk, onion and egg in a bowl. Add salmon, salt, pepper, basil, garlic powder and butter. Form into patties and fry in hot oil until golden brown and cooked through.

Heat oven to 350 degrees f. Spray 8 x 12 glass baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. In 12-inch skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add chicken and cook 6-8 minutes or until browned, stirring occasionally. Stir in pasta saucebring to boil. Cook 1 minute or until thoroughly heated. Spread half of pasta mixture in baking dish. Top with chicken, remaining pasta mixture and 1/2 cup mozzarella cheese. Bake uncovered 15-20 minutes or until hot. Sprinkle with remaining mozzarella cheesebake 1-2 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl, whisk together vinegar, syrup, mustard and 1/4 teaspoon of salt. In a large bowl, combine the greens. Add the dressing to the greens and toss well. Arrange the greens on 4 individual plates. Top each portion of greens with an apple slice. Sprinkle the nuts over the top of each portion. Top each with 1/4 cup of cheese.
name: spinach apple and pecan saladingredients: olive oil, cider vinegar, prepared mustard, sugar, salt, fresh ground black pepper, golden delicious apple, red onion, fresh spinach, pecanspreparation:In serving bowl, whisk oil, vinegar, mustard, sugar, salt and pepper until thick. Add apple and onion. Toss until apples and onions are covered with dressing. Place spinach on top, then pecans. Just before serving, toss.
name: apple cheese saladingredients: red apples, fresh lemon juice, celery, swiss cheese, mayonnaise,

Mash the sweet potatoes with a potato masher. Add the butter and continue mashing until the mixture is smooth. Add the corn kernels. Then add the spinach. Add the onion. Add the cardamom. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add honey to taste. Serve the mashed potatoes with the snap peas.

Mix together yogurt, mayonnaise, garlic, milk and seasoning. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Just before serving toss tomatoes and avocado with the dressing. Arrange bibb lettuce leaves on plates. Fill with tomato mixture. Crumble over bacon pieces.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).In a bowl, mix together lemon juice, mayonnaise and horseradish. Lay the salmon fillets in a greased shallow baking dish. Spread evenly with the mayonnaise mixture. Bake for approximately 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Remove from the oven and spoon a little butter over each piece of fish. Sprinkle evenly with fresh breadcrumbs. Return to the oven for another minute or until the breadcrumbs are golden brown.

In a small bowl combine the brown sugar and cornstarch. Set aside. In a separate bowl mix together the ketchup, mustard and vinegar. In a shallow bowl combine the brown sugar mixture and honey mixture. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the water, garlic and spareribs to the skillet. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 2 hours. Add the brown sugar mixture to the skillet and simmer for 1 hour. Remove the ribs to a platter and cover with the glaze. Bake at 350F for 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly spray a 9×13 inch baking pan with cooking spray. Mix brownie mix, water, and egg substitute in a bowl until combined. Spread the batter evenly into the prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 35 to 45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 5 minutes. Remove from the pan to wire rack to cool completely. Once cooled, break the brownie mixture into pieces and place on a waxed paper lined baking sheet. Melt the chocolate and shortening in a double boiler over low heatstir until smooth. Stir in the powdered sugar and vanilla extract until smooth. Drizzle over the brownie pieces. Allow to set at room temperature before serving.
name: fudgy peppermint browniesingredients: butter, unsweetened baker’s chocolate, peppermint extract, evaporated milk, vanilla extract, powdered sugar

Preheat oven to 500 degrees F. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Marinate fish in bowl for 20 to 30 minutes. Lightly oil baking pan. Place fish in pan and bake until cooked through. Sprinkle fish with additional herbs and spices, if desired. Makes 16 servings.

Mix cornstarch with 1/4 cup of cold orange juice in small bowl. Add the rest of the orange juice and the remaining ingredients to the cornstarch mixture in a saucepan. Stirring frequently. Simmer until thickened. Cool to room temperature. Stir in sour cream. Refrigerate until serving time. Garnish with orange section and orange rind twists.

Heat oven to 350. In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add the sugar. When bubbling, add the heavy whipping cream. Stir until the mixture boils. Add the frozen corn kernels. Boil for 2 minutes or until the kernels are tender. Stir in the cracker crumbs. Turn into a 2-quart baking dish. Top with the cubed cream cheese. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden. Top with the white pepper. Serves 4.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook corn in the oil for 3 minutes. Add the onions and cook for another 3 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for another 3 minutes. Add the tomatoes and green chilies. Cook for another minute. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.
