Marinate chicken with all ingredients for 6 hours or overnight. Thread onto skewers. Grill.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour 10 inch tube pan. In a large bowl combine the cake mix, the egg and the egg whites. Stir in the apples and the caramel topping. Pour into the prepared pan and bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven, or until toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on wire rack. Serve with caramel topping or vanilla ice cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line muffin cups. Beat together the butter, sugar, and egg. Stir in the flour, cocoa powder, and baking powder. Fold in the milk and chocolate chunks. Spoon batter into muffin cups. Bake for 20 minutes or until tops are firm. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pans. Cool completely before frosting.Frosting:Melt butter in a small saucepan. Remove from heat and stir in the confectioners' sugar. Stir in the semisweet chocolate chunks. Spread evenly on cooled muffins.

Preheat oven to 400f. On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough to about 1/4 inch thickness. Place the dough on a large baking sheet. Spread pizza sauce evenly over the dough. Arrange mushrooms, onion and green peppers over pizza sauce. Arrange plum tomatoes over the top. Sprinkle the mozzarella and cheeses evenly over the top. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Sprinkle with basil and olives. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl, stir together flour, salt & brown sugar. Stir in cocoa & coffee until blended. In another bowl, beat together eggs & vanilla. Gradually stir egg mixture into flour mixture. Add butter & beat until well blended. Spray 2 qt baking dish with non stick cooking spray. Pour batter into dish. Bake for 30 minutes or until center is set when gently shaken. Let cool completely. To prepare the sauce, in a small bowl, combine sugar & 2 tbsp water & stir until smooth. Add coffee & stir. Pour over cooled pudding & allow to stand for 15 minutes or until set.

Cut beef into cubes. Brown lightly. Add onions. Add potatoes. Add enough water to cover. Add carrots. Bring to a boil. Add more water if necessary. Salt to taste. Cook until potatoes are soft. Serve with brown or white rice.

Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling water for 8 to 10 minutes or until tender but firm to the bite, stirring occasionally. Drain in a colander set in the sink. Combine the pasta and sauce in a large bowltoss well to coat evenly. Stir in the asparagus and hamtoss to coat evenly. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheesetoss well to distribute evenly. Serve immediately or cover tightly and refrigerate for up to 2 days. Reheat in the microwave or in a large saucepan over medium heat. Serve topped with additional parmesan cheese if desired.

Combine all spices in a bowl. Mix with the lamb. Divide into 4 equal portions, and shape into patties. Heat a grill to medium-high. Cook the patties for 2 to 3 minutes per side for medium-rare. Serve on the bun with the arugula.
1. Combine the flour, baking powder, sugar, egg and milk in a bowl. Mix well.
2. Heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium heat.
3. Add a spoonful of the batter to the pan. Cook for 2-3 minutes, until golden.
4. Flip the pancake over and cook for 2-3 minutes more.
5. Repeat with remaining batter to make 8 pancakes.
6. Serve warm with sugar and lemon juice.
Combine the flour, baking powder, sugar, egg and milk in a bowl. Mix well. Heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add a spoonful of the batter to the pan. Cook for 2-3 minutes, until golden

Bring a large saucepan of salted water to a boil. Add asparaguscook 2 minutes or until crisp-tender. Remove with a slotted spoon to a bowl of ice waterlet cool 5 minutes. Drain well. Cut into 3/4-inch pieces. Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add shallot and garliccook 1 minute, stirring frequently. Add flourcook 1 minute, stirring frequently. Slowly stir in broth. Bring to a boilcook 4 minutes or until thickened slightly. Stir in asparagus. Cook 2 minutes or until heated through. Stir in half-and-halfcook 2 minutes or until slightly thickened. Stir in thyme and pepper. Ladle into bowls. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375. Cut apples in half. Place in a 9x13 pan. Add water to cover apples. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Add brown sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg. Simmer until apples are tender. Drain and set apples aside. Make a topping by combining the flour, nutmeg, cinnamon and butter. Spread over apples. Bake for 30 minutes. Serve warm.

Soak the marshmallows in hot water to soften. Mash with a fork. Mix with the cherries. Add the vanilla and cream and mix well. Add the condensed milk and mix well. Add the pineapple and lemon juice and mix well. Place the mixture into the pie crust and refrigerate for 2 hours or until set.

Heat olive oil in a saute pan and saute chili, ginger, garlic and shallots. Add white wine and simmer until reduced. Add crab meat and simmer until heated through. Remove from heat. Add linguine to pan. Toss with parsley and lime juice. Serve hot.
Spaghetti is a long thin form of pasta. It is made of wheat and water and sometimes eggs. It is typically about 23-26cm long. The word is Italian for "spun paste".
In its original form, spaghetti is a dried pasta, usually sold in an uncooked, flattened, cylindrical, plastic container, and made of durum wheat flour mixed with water or eggs.
Spaghetti is normally served plain or topped with a tomato passata or tomato purée with cheese (grated Parmesan and/or Pecorino) or sauces such as Bolognese or carbonara.
Spaghetti is the name of several Italian pasta dishes.
Spaghetti is the most common pasta dish. It is normally served plain or

Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil. Add the beans and cook until bright green and crisp-tender but still slightly firm to the touch, 2 to 3 minutes. Transfer to an ice water bath to stop the cooking. Drain the beans well. Toss with the remaining ingredients. Serve at room temperature.

Mix the chicken with half the canola oil and refrigerate 1 hour. Heat the remaining oil and fry the chicken 10 minutes on each side. Add the tomatoes and cook 5 minutes. Stir together the remaining ingredients and pour over chicken. Heat through and serve over rice. Garnish with cilantro and peanuts.

Combine sugar, water, lemon juice in a medium bowl. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Set aside while making the sauce. In a saucepan, combine the jam, lemon juice and cornstarch. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Stir constantly until the mixture thickens enough to coat the back of a spoon, about 3 minutes. Stir in the reserved sugar mixture until smooth. Bring the sauce back to a boil. Stir in the sliced or pureed strawberry. Boil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from the heat and cool.

Sautee the roasted red peppers in the butter over medium heat for 5 minutes. In a bowl combine the cream cheese and the fat free sour cream and mix thoroughly. Add the lump crab meat and mix. Add the seasoned bread crumbs and mix. Add the red peppers to the cream cheese/crab mixture. Fill the poblano peppers with the mixture. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees.

In a heavy skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the ground turkey and brown the meat. Add the garlic cloves and saute for 30 seconds. Add the green pepper and onion and saute until the vegetables are tender. Drain the water from the tomatoes. Add the water to the turkey and vegetables. Season with the oregano, basil, parsley and red pepper flakes. Cover the skillet and simmer for 20 minutes. Add the spaghetti sauce and stir well. Continue simmering 10 minutes more. Serve with the spaghetti. Top with parmesan cheese.

First prepare the pastry. Cut the bacon into small pieces and fry in a pan with the onion. Add the garlic and stir for a few seconds. Add the eggs and stir well to mix in the bacon and onion with the eggs. Then add the parsley, the capers and the tasty cheese. Season with salt and pepper and cook for a few minutes. Roll out the pastry to fit the dish you are using. Put the mixture into the pastry case and cover with the pastry lid or top. Crimp the edges to seal in the filling. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot or cold.

In a large mixing bowl, combine the hashbrowns and butter and mix well. In a second large mixing bowl combine the remaining ingredients and mix well. Spread the creamed mixture over the potato mixture and sprinkle with the corn flakes. Spray a 13x9x2-inch baking dish with cooking spray and spoon in the mixture. Bake uncovered for 35 minutes or until bubbly. Cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease a 9" x 13" glass baking pan. Mix together apple juice, flour, sugar and cinnamon in medium bowl. Add fruit and stir until well blended. Spoon mixture into the baking pan. In a small bowl combine the oatmeal, brown sugar and pecans. Cut in the butter until the mixture is crumbly. Sprinkle the topping over the fruit. Bake for 45 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.
Cranberry is an evergreen shrub that is native to North America, Europe, and Asia. It produces a small red fruit that is used to make juice, jams, jellies, and other products. The fruit has a tart taste and is often used in combination with other fruits or vegetables in recipes. Cranberry is also used in traditional medicines to treat urinary tract infections and other ailments.
Cranberry is a popular fruit that is used in many recipes. It is often used in juices, jams, jellies, and other products. Cranberry ju

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In large bowl of electric mixer beat butter until creamy. Add sugar and continue beating until light. Add dates and beat until well blended. Stir in salt and vanilla. Divide mixture evenly among 12 rice crispy treat squares. Bake on greased cookie sheets until firm, about 10 minutes. Remove from ovensprinkle coconut over warm bars. Let cool in pan on wire rack. Break bars apart.

In a large bowl, combine the vinegars, dry mustard, sage, basil, dill and salt. Blend well with a wire whisk until thickened slightly and well blended. Slowly pour in the canola oil in a slow steady stream, whirling until dressing is smooth. Store, covered, in the refrigerator. Serve at room temperature.

Heat oil over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook, stirring occasionally until golden. Add brown sugar and cook until caramelized. Add mustard seeds and cook briefly. Add balsamic vinegar and cook until reduced by half. Add sweet chili sauce and vinegar and cook until thick. Remove from heat and let cool. Will keep in the fridge for up to two weeks.
Mix all dry ingredients in large bowl. Add the sour milk, egg, apples, spices and butter. Mix well. Pour into pie crust and bake at 350 degrees for one hour or till set. Cool slightly before serving.

Prepare rice according to package directions. Meanwhile in a 9x13 inch baking dish place the chicken and pineapple. Add the carrots. In a bowl combine the teriyaki sauce and the rice wine vinegar and pour over the chicken and pineapple. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink.

Combine cream cheese and whipped toppingmix until smooth. Gradually add sweetened condensed milk and lemon juice. Add vanilla. Beat until smooth. Pour into prepared pie crust. Chill for 2 hours. Garnish with whipped topping and serve chilled.

Heat oil and add chicken tenders and brown. When brown, sprinkle with onion soup mix. Add broth and bring to a boil. Add rice and let cook. Stir in cream of mushroom soup and cook until tender. Add thyme. Add broccoli.

Rinse artichokes. Trim off tips of outer leaves. Cut off top 1/3 of each. Rub artichokes with olive oil. Grill over medium high heat (or steam) until tender. When done, remove from grill or pot. Remove leaves. Place a slice of lemon in the center of each. Divide shrimp between all the artichokes. Top with dill. Serve warm.

Toast the orzo in a large saute pan over medium-low heat. Add the broth and bring to a boil. Cover and reduce the heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes. Add the mushrooms and pine nuts. Stir until the pine nuts are golden and the mixture is thick. Season with the parsley, salt and pepper. Serve hot.
name: pasta primaveraingredients: cooked farfalle pasta, diced tomato, green onion, basil leaves, garlic, red bell pepper, black olives, chicken breasts, green beans, zucchinipreparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Melt the butter in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the green onion, basil, and garlicsaute for 1 minute.Add the tomatoes and tomato juice. Bring to a boil. Add the bell peppers and olivescook for 2 minutes. Add the zucchini and green beanscook for 3 minutes.Add the cook

In a deep skillet or wok over high heat, add peanut oil and stir fry the shrimp until they are pink all over. Remove the shrimp from the pan and set aside. Add the gingerroot to the pan and saute until fragrant and lightly browned. Add the soy sauce and the hoisin sauce and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add the shrimp and toss to combine. Add the lemon juice and toss well. Serve immediately.

Mix dry ingredients together in large bowl. Add water, then add milk and mix well. Roll into ball and flatten on cookie sheet. Cut into wedges. Bake 15-20 minutes at 400 f degrees. Cool on wire rack. Serve warm.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Line a 9x11 pan with foil or wax paper, leaving some overhang on two sides so you can lift the brownies out of the pan easily once they are done. Melt the butter with the brown sugar and stir until smooth. Add the egg yolk, vanilla and saltstir well to combine. Beat the flour into the mixture. Pour into the pan and bake until the edges are lightly golden, about 20 minutes. Sprinkle the chocolate chips over the warm brownies, then sprinkle with the nuts. Let sit for about 5 minutes to let the chocolate soften slightlythen gently lift the brownies from the pan, using the foil or paper as handles. Cut into bars.

Combine the pretzels and the nuts in a very large bowl. In a saucepan combine the butter, brown sugar, corn syrup and salt. Cook over medium heat until mixture comes to a full rolling boil. Remove from heat and immediately pour over the pretzels and nuts, stirring until all are coated with the syrup mixture. Spread on a greased baking sheet, separating the pieces with a spoon. Bake at 250 for one hour or until mixture is firm and dry. Remove from oven, stir again and allow mixture to cool. Store in an air tight container.

Cut brie into serving sizes. Combine nuts, kahlua, brown sugar, extract, and kahlua in small saucepan. Cook over medium heat until thick. Spread mixture over brie. Sprinkle with additional nuts. Refrigerate. Serve with crackers or bread.

Preheat oven to 350 f. Prepare the crust by melt the butter and add the graham crackers in a food processor. Blend until the crackers are finely ground. Press the mixture into a 9x13 inch pan. Bake in preheated oven for about 10 minutes. While the crust is baking, blend the eggs, icing sugar and vanilla in a large bowl until smooth. When the crust is done baking, remove from oven and let cool slightly. Pour the egg mixture into the pan and bake for about 25 minutes. After the torte has baked, let cool completely. In a small bowl mix the cool whip and vanilla extract. Spread onto the torte. Top with sliced bananas. Garnish with chocolate syrup or melted chocolate.
Pound the chicken breasts to 1/2 inch thickness. Dip in the flour. Brown in the skillet. Add the soup and mushrooms. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Top with paprika. Serve over cooked noodles.

Sift flour and salt into a large mixing bowl. Rub in butter and add caster sugar. Add lemon rind and beat until smooth. Add vanilla and milk. Beat well. Pour into 20 x 20 cm/8" x 8" square baking pan. Bake in oven for 20 minutes. Beat water, lemon juice and sugar until thick. Pour over hot pudding and return to oven for 10 minutes. Serve warm.
Cut wings into thirds. Roll in flour, then into egg. Then into taco seasoning mix. Fry in oil till golden brown. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce. I use salsa.

Heat oil in a heavy saucepan. Add onions and cook over medium heat until soft. Add garlic, ginger, green chili pepper, cumin, and salt. Stir and cook for another minute. Add the lentils and cook for 30 minutes. Add lime juice. Garnish with cilantro. Serve with rice.
Place 1 cup couscous in a medium bowl. Pour boiling water over toplet stand until liquid is absorbed. Add remaining ingredientstoss. Cover and let stand for 3-5 minutes. Serve.

Place 1/2 cup apple juice in medium saucepan. Sprinkle bouillon granules over juice and stir. Cook and stir over medium heat until bouillon dissolves. Add remaining 1/2 cup juice and stir. Add chicken breasts and simmer over medium heat until no longer pink. Remove chicken and shred into bite-sized pieces. Set aside. Cook remaining liquid in saucepan until reduced to 1/4 cup. Add cornstarch and stir until thickened. Add ground nutmeg and stir to combine. Add shredded chicken and apples. Fold in raisins and celery. Serve warm over mixed greens.

Peel parsnips & boil in water until tender. Drain off & return to pot. Combine juice& sugar in saucepan & heat until boiling. Remove from heat & pour over parsnips. Let stand while juice cools. Spoon into serving dish & top with slices of orange.

Combine brown sugar, crushed pineapple with juice and chipotle chiles in adobo with adobo sauce, nutmeg, ginger and cornstarch until smooth. Place the ham in an 8x8x2-in. baking dish. Pour the pineapple mixture over the ham and bake for 50 minutes. Broil for 2 to 3 minutes or until the glaze is caramelized. Remove from the oven and let cool for 10 minutes before slicing into 1-in. pieces. Serve with warm buns or rolls and if desired, coleslaw or potato salad.

Roll out crescent rolls on a lightly floured surface to a rectangle about 7 inches by 5 inches. Press preserves into the center of the crescent rolls. Cut the top off the round of cheese so you can spread it open like a book. Spread the cheese with preserves to cover the inside of the cheese completely. Close the cheese back together like a book. Wrap the cheese and crescent rolls together completely in plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before baking. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Bake the cheese for 18 to 20 minutes, or until the cheese is hot and bubbly and the crescent rolls are golden brown.

Place the chopped strawberries and mint leaves in the bottom of a shaker. Muddle well. Add sugar, lime wedges, rum, and ice. Shake for 10-15 seconds. Strain into a highball or collins glass filled with ice. Garnish with a strawberry and a sprig of mint.
I love how you have so many different versions of this drink! Thanks for sharing!
I love Mojitos! I can't wait for it to get warmer so I can enjoy one on my patio!
I love mojitos but I've never tried making one...I'm not good at making drinks that are shaken...I always manage to break the shaker lol!
I've never tried making one before but I'm going to have to try!

In a saucepan over medium heat, combine the nonfat dry milk and the protein powder. Gradually add the cocoa and the sugar substitute. Stirring constantly, cook until mixture boils and thickens. Remove from heat. Stir in the salt. Serve in individual cups or mugs.
The first time I ever had hot chocolate was at a restaurant in New York City. It was the best I ever had, but it was also the last time I ever had it. I have been looking for a recipe to try that is as good as that first time I had it. I have been trying out all different kinds of recipes and I am still not happy with the results. I was hoping that this one would be the one. It was not. It was good but not great.
This recipe is a good one. It has a nice flavor and is easy to make. The only problem is that it is not very thick. It is more like a thin soup. I like it but I am not sure if I would make it again.
I had to make this for a party. It was very good but I did not get a picture of it because I was so busy.
Cut zucchini in rounds. Grill until tender or lightly brown. Transfer to bowl. Add mint, lemon rind, olive oil, minced garlic cloves, and black pepper, toss gently until combined.

Peel the potatoes and cut them into chunks. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, cover the potatoes with water by two inches. Bring to a boil then reduce the heat to low. Cook until tender. Drain and set aside to cool. Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, combine the olive oil and the onions and cook until caramelized. Sprinkle the sugar over the onions and stir to coat them. Add the balsamic and the mustard and stir to combine. Add the honey and the orange zest and stir to combine. Add the thyme and remove the pan from the heat. Set the potatoes and the caramelized onions aside and let them cool slightly. In the same saucepan that you used for the potatoes, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the potatoes and toss to coat them in the oil. Add the caramelized onions and toss to combine. Season with the salt and pepper. Garnish with fresh thyme leaves.

In a bowl whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. In a small bowl combine butter and sugar. Combine egg, milk, and vanilla in another bowl. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and pour in the egg mixture. Stir the mixture gently with a whisk just until the batter is smooth.

In a small saucepan or a microwave safe bowl, melt the baking chocolate with the butter. Set aside. In a small bowl, combine the white sugar and white flour and stir until well blended. Add the nuts if desired. Add the salt and vanilla extract and stir well. Add the egg and mix well. Add the melted chocolate and mix until well combined. Spread the mixture into a greased 9 x 13 inch baking pan. Bake in a 350 degree F oven for about 25 minutes or until firm and starting to crack at the top. Allow the brownies to cool and cut into small pieces before serving. Store in an airtight container and refrigerate any remaining brownies for up to a week.

Toss steaks in cornstarch and set aside. In a skillet, heat oil and saute gingerroot and garlic until tender, 2-3 minutes. Add broccoli and carrots and saute for 4 minutes longer. Stir in broth and bring to a boil. Add steaks and cook until desired doneness, about 4 minutes for rare to medium-rare. Remove steaks and set aside. Add teriyaki sauce to pan and stir well. Serve over rice. Serve with additional teriyaki sauce if desired.

In large skillet, melt the butter over medium-high heatsaute the pepper until crisp-tender. Remove from the skilletset aside. In the same skillet, saute the sauerkraut and carrot until tender-crisp. Sprinkle with pepper. In a small bowl combine the apples, wine, and cornstarchmix well. Stir into the skilletbring to a boil. Cook, uncovered, until the liquid is reduced by half (about 3 minutes). Stir in the pepper. Serve over the ribs.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Peel off the green bell pepper, red bell pepper, plum tomatoes, garlic, and any other vegetables you would like to include. Wash them well to remove any dirt, wipe them with a damp paper towel, and place them in a large bowl. Drizzle with the olive oil, sprinkle the vegetables with the sea salt and the freshly ground pepper, and toss the vegetables well to coat them with the oil. Spread the vegetables out onto a large baking sheet (or two smaller baking sheets), cover them with aluminum foil, and bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until the vegetables are tender-crisp. Serve immediately.

Cook pasta in plenty of boiling water until just tender, then drain. Place in a 1.5 litre ovenproof dish. Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a non-stick frying pan and cook the vegetables over a moderate heat until just tender. Stir in the passata and simmer for 1 minute. Remove from the heat. Stir in the bacon, oregano and basil. Season. Spread over the pasta. Sprinkle over the mozzarella and Parmesan. Bake for 10 minutes or until melted and golden brown. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Cut the fennel bulbs into quarters. Heat the olive oil in a medium pan and add the cut up fennel. Sear until the fennel is lightly browned and then add the water and turmeric, cover and cook until the fennel is soft. Add the pepper and the salt to the pan and cook until the liquid has evaporated. Meanwhile brown the chicken thighs and then add to the pan with the fennel. Cook until the meat is cooked through (about 5 minutes). Serve over cooked pasta or rice and enjoy.

Combine butter, sugar and cinnamon. Combine until crumbly. Press into a pie plate. Bake in 350 degree oven for 5 minutes. Remove from oven. Spread cream cheese in center. Roll up sides and press edges together. Fold in half and roll again. Refrigerate for 3 hours. Cut in half. Layer with lime cool whip and fresh fruit.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Mix together german chocolate cake mix and sweetened condensed milk. Spread half of the mixture into the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle with 1 cup of chocolate chips and 1 cup of miniature marshmallows. Drop remaining german chocolate mixture by spoonfuls onto marshmallow/chocolate chip layer. Top with remaining chocolate chips and miniature marshmallows. Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and cool in pan on wire rack for 10 minutes before cutting into bars.

Prepare brownies as directed on package. Spread batter in 13x9-inch pan. Bake and cool. Combine 1 box of cake mix and 1 box of brownies. Add 3 tablespoons vegetable oil and 2 eggs. Mix well. Sprinkle half the batter over cooled brownies. Sprinkle with half the chocolate chips. Spread remaining batter over. Sprinkle with remaining chips. Bake 10 minutes. Cool. Dust with powdered sugar.

Cook pasta until done. Drain pasta. Blend together ricotta cheese, nutmeg, and chili flakes. Add pasta, spinach, tomatoes, garlic salt, herbs, and chili flakes. Mix well. Transfer to a 2 qt. Baking dish. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 30 minutes. Garnish with Parmesan cheese if desired.
In a large bowl combine lettuce, olives, grapefruit slices and avocado. Serve over greens.

Prepare cake according to package directions. Bake in an 8 inch square baking pan. Cool completely. Prepare instant pudding according to package directions. Spread over the cooled cake. Sprinkle with the poppy seeds. In a small bowl combine the powdered sugar with enough lemon juice until desired consistency is reached. Spread over the top of the cake. Chill at least 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Rub butter over entire surface of each bird. Combine marmalade and orange juice and brush over both sides of each bird. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place in a large roasting pan. Roast for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, place garlic cloves and 1/2 cup water in a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Strain and discard garlic. Pour remaining water into a small bowl. Sprinkle 1 teaspoon rosemary over each bird. Drizzle 1 tablespoon of water over each bird. Bake until juices run clear when meat is pierced with a knife. Remove from oven and brush with marmalade glaze. Sprinkle with remaining 1 teaspoon rosemary. Baste again with glaze and return to oven for 10 minutes.
The dish is easy and fast to make. It is a nice change from the standard chicken dinners. I used a little bit more than the amount of the glaze.
This

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Heat milk and water to boiling in saucepan. Remove from heat and stir in sugar and butter until melted. Let cool slightly. Separate biscuits. Spread with brown sugar mixture. Roll up and place in buttered 9-in. square pan. Beat together the egg and vanillabrush over rolls. Sprinkle with pecans. Bake for 30 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve warm. Makes 8 servings.

Rinse the quinoa in a fine mesh sieve. Add the water, cinnamon sticks, almond milk, honey, cinnamon sticks, and salt to a large saucepan over high heat. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and cook until the liquid has been absorbed about 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Fluff the quinoa with a fork. Add the apricots and pistachios. Drizzle with the orange blossom water.

In a bowl mix bisquick, sugar, baking powder and cornmeal. Add milk and beat until smooth. Add eggs and beat for 2 minutes. Spray 8x8 pan with non stick spray. Pour batter into pan and bake at 400 for 20 minutes. Cool 5 minutes then invert onto plate. Cut into 2x2 inch squares.

Cut fish into 4 inch portions. Sprinkle fish with herbes de provence, lemon juice, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Sprinkle with onion and parsley. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Drizzle fish with olive oil. Bake uncovered on a baking sheet for 20 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 180 C (350 F). In a bowl, combine first 4 ingredients. Peel bananas. Slice into 1/4-inch rounds. Arrange on baking sheets. Bake 10 minutes. Combine remaining ingredientsdrizzle over bananas. Bake 5 minutes longer.

Combine all ingredients except egg white in blender container. Blend until smooth. Pour into ice-cream freezer can or container. Place can or container in freezer for 8 hours or until frozen solid. Pour mixture into food processor. Pulse on high speed for 1 minute or until smooth. Fold in beaten egg white until completely combined. Return to freezer container and freeze overnight or until firm.

In a pitcher or large bowl combine first 6 ingredients and chill for 1 hour. Just before serving, add vodka and lemon juice. Stir to combine. Serve over crushed ice in tall glasses. Garnish with cucumber slices.

Rinse rice thoroughly for 2 minutes under running water. Drain well. Put 5 cups of water, rice and pandan leaves into a heavy stockpot. Simmer over medium heat for approximately 40 minutes. Add palm sugar syrup and continue to cook until most of the liquid has evaporated. Season with a pinch of salt. Remove from heat, allow to cool. Serve at room temperature, topped with a swirl of fresh squeezed creamy coconut cream.

Rinse beans in a strainer. In a medium saucepan over medium heat combine the dry bean with 2 cups water. Cook for about 30 minutes or until the bean is tender. Drain the cooked beans reserving the liquid. In a heavy-bottomed saucepan, combine the cooked bean with the cooking liquid, the butter, the salt and the sugar. Bring to a boil, lower the heat to medium-low and cook for 10 minutes or until the bean has a thick texture. Serve with thick-sliced bacon. Garnish with parsley.

Sprinkle salt and pepper on both sides of chicken breasts. In an 8 x 8 dish, arrange sliced swiss cheese on each breast. Combine soup with water and butter, pour over chicken. Sprinkle with stuffing cubes. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes.

Combine cocoa, 1/2 cup of the sugar, cornstarch and milk in large saucepanbring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Cook 3 minutesstir in remaining 1/4 cup sugar, butter and vanilla extract. Cool slightlyprocess in blender or food processor until smoothpour into individual dishes or freeze in an 8 x 8 inch dish until firm enough to cut into squaresremove from freezer 5 minutes before servingtop with whipped cream if desired. Makes 10 servings (1/2 cup each).
name: old fashioned chocolate pudding
name: very easy rich and creamy chocolate pudding
name: vanilla sauce for bread pudding
name: chocolate pudding deluxe for pies trifles etc
name: chocolate pudding low fat
name: peanutty chocolate pudding
name: sugar free holiday nog
name: chocolate blender pudding
chocolate blender pudding

Beat together cream of coconut, evaporated milk, sweetened condensed milk and the egg substitute. Chill for 1 hour or overnight. Add cinnamon and nutmeg to taste. Stir in vanilla and rum. Pour into glasses. Sprinkle with additional cinnamon or nutmeg if desired. Serves 6.

Mix kool-aid and sugar in a blender container. Add cold water and blend until sugar is dissolved and mixture is smooth. Fill a tall glass 2/3 full of the mixture and top with ice cubes. Stir gently and serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 250C/480F/Gas 9. Rub the lamb with the garlic and 2 tablespoons of the olive oil. Place a large piece of foil on the work surface. Place half of the lamb in the middle and wrap it up like a parcel. Repeat with the remaining lamb. Place the lamb on a large baking tray and bake for 1 hour. Remove from the oven and brush the lamb with the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil and the lemon juice. Bake for a further 2 hours, basting the lamb every 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and leave to cool a little before cutting into thin slices. To serve, tear the lamb into bite-sized pieces and toss together with the dill and cinnamon and cumin.
I would like to make a dish that calls for 12 oz. of cooked chicken liver. I have found that I can buy them cooked in cans. I have also found frozen chicken liver, but I'm not sure

Preheat oven to 250 degrees. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. In a large bowl combine the egg whites and cream of tartar. Beat until soft peaks form. Gradually add the sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time. Beat until stiff peaks form. Add the cocoa and vanillamix well. Add the chocolatemix well. Drop the batter by spoonfuls onto the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 1 hour. Store at room temperature.
Chocolate and cherries are a classic combination. This smoothie puts it all together in one delicious glass.
1. In the jar of a blender, combine the cherries, yogurt, milk, cocoa, and ice cubes. Blend on high speed or ice crush setting for 30-60 seconds, or until smooth. Stir in the honey, if desired.
2. Pour into a glass. Serve immediately.
3. Makes 2 servings. Each serving has 267 calories, 1 gram (g) of fat, 29 g of carbohydrate,

Peach Squares 2 C. flour 1/2 tsp. salt 1/4 C. butter, melted 1 egg 1 1/2 C. milk 2 T. cornstarch 2 C. peaches 2 T. sugar 1/2 C. pecans Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Combine flour, salt & butter. Add egg & milk. Bring to boil over medium heat, stirring constantly until thick & clear. Add peaches & sugar. Spread into 8x8 baking pan. Sprinkle with pecans. Bake 20 min. Cut into 8 bars.

In a small bowl, combine blue cheese, butter, and green onion. Spread mixture in the center of each cracker. Broil in the oven until the tops of the crackers are lightly browned and the blue cheese mixture is melted. Garnish with the tomato slices and bacon bits.
I need more recipes like this, i love to cook and i love to eat so this is great.
The recipes are sooooo easy to make, they are great!
I love recipes that are easy to make.
I like this recipe because it’s so easy to make.
My favorite recipe is the tomato bacon chowder recipe.
I think the spinach dip is a great recipe to try!
The broiled blue cheese and bacon tomatoes sound good!
I would love to try the Baked Chicken Spaghetti recipe!
I think the tomato bacon chowder sounds great!
I love the broiled blue cheese and bacon tomatoes!
I am a big fan of tomatoes so I like the Broiled Blue Cheese and Bacon Tomatoes best.
Pound beef to desired thickness. Dip into soy sauce mixture and roll in mixture. Marinate in refrigerator overnight. Grill over charcoal and baste with mixture during cooking time.

Melt margarine in 2-quart saucepan. Saute onions and celery until tender. Add broccoli. Bring to a boil. Add broth and milk. Cook over medium heat about 5 minutes or until heated through. Remove from heat. Stir in velveeta cheese product until melted. Correct seasoning with salt and pepper. Serve hot.
Name: Broccoli Cheese Soup Ingredients: Onion, margarine, flour, salt, white pepper, chicken broth, milk, broccoli, cheddar cheese, celery Preparation: Saute onion and celery in butter in saucepan over medium heat until tender. Add flour, and salt and pepper, cooking and stirring until mixture is smooth and bubbly. Add broth and milk, stirring constantly until mixture comes to a boil and begins to thicken. Add cooked broccoli, stirring until all is heated through. Remove from heat and stir in cheese until melted and smooth. Name: Easy Cheesy Broccoli Soup Ingredients: Fro

Boil the frozen spinach for 15 minutes. Drain then squeeze out any excess water. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well. Set aside for 15 minutes. Brush 2 sheets of phyllo with butter then lay the rest one on top. Cut each sheet into 6 rectangles. Place a tablespoon of the filling on the bottom half of each rectangle. Fold the top half over the filling then fold in the sides to make triangles. Bake for 15 minutes at 350f. Serve hot with a lemon wedge.

Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add lamb neck pieces and cook for 3-5 minutes or until the lamb changes color. Add chili powder, tomatoes and stock. Cover and simmer over low heat for 1 hour. Season with pepper. Serve with spaghetti or other short pasta shapes and sprinkle with chopped herbs.
Pre heat oven to 350 degrees. Beat oil, water and sugar. Add banana and mix. Sift dry ingredients. Add to wet. Pour into greased pan. Bake for 40 minutes. Let cool.

Chop the watermelon into chunks. Place into the freezer for one hour. Pour the frozen limeade into the blender. Add the watermelon, sugar and tequila. Blend until smooth. Place ice in the bottom of the glasses and pour the mixture into the glasses. Garnish with a lime slice.

Cut the stems off the mushroom caps. Melt the butter in a skillet over medium high heat. Add the shallots and sauté until golden brown. Add the garlic clove and continue cooking until the garlic is golden brown. Add the mushroom stems and stir fry until the liquid evaporates. Add the fresh herbs and season with salt and pepper. Place the caps upside down on the work surface. Divide the filling among the caps, place the cap on top of the filling and press down firmly on the top of the filling. Garnish with fresh parsley and chives and place the tartlets in the freezer for 30 minutes or until the tartlets are firm. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Bake the tartlets for 15 minutes until golden brown.

Cut bread into 1/2 inch thick slices. Spread each slice of bread with mayonnaise. Arrange apple slices and red onion on each slice of bread. Sprinkle each slice of bread with walnut pieces. Top each slice of bread with a piece of blue cheese. Sprinkle lightly with sea salt and fresh ground black pepper.

Melt butter in a medium-heavy skillet over medium heat. Mix in the next six ingredients. Saut for 30 seconds and add shrimp. Saut shrimp until they are opaque in centre, about 3 minutes, turning occasionally. Stir in parsley and serve over rice or pasta.

Spread one side of each rye slice evenly with the thousand island dressing. Lay the sauerkraut across the bottom half of each piece of bread. Top each sandwich half with 2 slices of the cooked and sliced corned beef. Top each sandwich with a slice of swiss cheese. Place the sandwich halves together so that the dressing side is facing up. Wrap each sandwich in plastic wrap or foil. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Cut each sandwich in half diagonally. Serve warm.

Beat together peanut butter, margarine, brown sugar and eggs until smooth. Add flour, baking powder and cinnamon. Roll into 1-inch balls. Put 1-inch apart on baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes at 350 degrees. Melt kisses in microwave for 20 seconds, then press into center of warm cookie ball. Cool completely and roll in powdered sugar.

In a small saucepan, boil the water. Remove from the heat, add the spinach and cover the pan. Let the spinach sit for 1 minute. Drain and squeeze the excess water from the spinach. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the onion and saute for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add the garlic and saute for 1 more minute. Add the spinach, peanuts, curry powder, cumin, and ginger. Cook, stirring constantly, for 1 minute more. Remove from the heat and add the salt and cayenne pepper.

Peel potatoes and cut into 1" cubes. Place potatoes in a large saucepan with cold water to cover by 1". Bring to a boil over medium-high heat and cook until just tender, about 15 minutes. Drain well and return to the saucepan off the heat. Mash the potatoes with a potato masher or fork until they are light and fluffy. Stir in heavy cream and butter. Season with salt and black pepper and stir to blend well. Stir in the spinach until wilted and just blended throughout the potatoes. Serve immediately.
Spread hoagie roll with a thin layer of mayo. Spread with a thin layer of sweet mustard. Layer with alfalfa sprout and bacon. Top with a slice of ripe tomato. Serve immediately. Makes 1 sandwich.

Combine all ingradiants except chops in a medium bowl. Place chops in a zip-top plastic bag. Add the ketchup mixture to the bag. Close the bag securely. Turn the bag to coat the chops. Refrigerate overnight. Remove the chops from the bag. Discard the remaining marinade. Grill or broil the chops until cooked through. Serve with rice.

Place teabags in a quart pitcher and cover with boiling water. Let stand for five minutes, then remove teabags and pour liquid through a strainer into a pitcher. Stir in sugar and lemon juice until dissolved. Add cranberry-strawberry drink and stir well. Refrigerate until chilled before serving over ice cubes.
The tea bags are easy to carry and the price is very reasonable.

Beat the eggs with the vanilla, heavy cream and milk until smooth. Soak the bread in the egg mixture for 30 seconds on each side. Grill the bread on both sides until golden brown. Serve hot with a dusting of sugar and a drizzle of honey or a favorite jam or jelly.

Peel and cut into pieces and boil potatoes until they are soft enough to mash with a fork. Add a little more water if they get too dry. Mash well with a potato masher and add butter, half-and-half, salt and pepper to taste. Stir well. Serve hot.
I love to make these potatoes for a special meal. It's my favorite way of having them.
I made a double batch of these yummy potatoes and had to share my recipe with you all. I love potatoes any way you make them.
These potatoes are so good that I have never had leftovers!
This is a favorite in our home. We have it with every big meal, like Thanksgiving, Easter or Christmas.
Mix sour cream with tomato. Add chopped onions to mixture. Mix in Velveeta cheese until melted. Stir in hot pepper sauce until blended well. Refrigerate overnight. Serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat a lightly greased skillet over medium-high heat. Add the tofu. Cook for 3 minutes. Add the mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes. Add the sun-dried tomatoes and cook for 2 minutes. Add the olives and cook for 2 minutes. Add the turmeric and cook for 1 minute. Serve hot.

Heat oven to 325 degrees. Grease and flour 2 9x5 loaf pans. In a large bowl, cream together butter and 1-1/2 cups sugar. Beat in eggs. In a small bowl combine 2 teaspoons lemon peel and 1 tablespoon lemon extract. Add to butter mixture and beat until combined. In a small bowl sift together flour, baking powder and salt. Gradually add to butter mixture and beat until well blended. Stir in pecans. Divide batter into prepared pans. Bake 1 hour and 5 minutes or until golden and done. Cool in pan 5 minutes. Remove from pans and cool on wire racks. Drizzle with glaze, if desired. Lemon Glaze: Combine 1/2 cup powdered sugar and 1/2 teaspoon lemon extract. Stir until smooth. Drizzle over cooled bread. Makes 2 loaves.

Combine the first 4 ingredients in a small bowl. Place the ribs in an aluminum foil pan and pour the sauce over the top. Cover with foil and bake at 225 degrees for 4 hours. Remove from oven and turn the ribs. Cover again and bake for 3 hours more. Remove from the oven. Drain the ribs and pat dry. Preheat the broiler. Sprinkle the ribs with the ketchup and broil 1/2 inch from the heat until the ketchup is sizzling. Turn and broil the other side. Serve immediately. Garnish with the chopped green onion.

Wash the berries well under cold running water. In a large bowl toss the berries with the orange juice and red wine vinegar. Allow to sit for 5 to 10 minutes or until the juice has been absorbed into the fruit. Stir in the sugar and the honey.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. In a shallow bowl combine breadcrumbs and sesame seeds. In another bowl combine oil, teriyaki sauce, and gingerstir until blended. Dip each cutlet in oil mixture and roll in breadcrumb mixture. Place in an 11- x 7-inch baking dish. Bake uncovered for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and drizzle with remaining 1/4 cup teriyaki. Bake another 10 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with rice and vegetable.
Chop the cabbage and the onions and grate the bell peppers. Mix all together with the other ingredients. Add more paprika to your taste. Serve with your favorite hot or cold meal.

Preheat oven to 190C/375F. Grease a loaf pan with cooking spray or butter. Mash bananas and set aside. Cream oil and sugar together. Beat in the egg and then beat in the mashed bananas. Mix in the flour and baking powder. Fold in the chopped nuts and the raisins or dried fruit. Pour into loaf pan and bake for about one hour or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Let cool for five minutes before removing from the pan. Brush with butter or margarine or drizzle with cream cheese frosting.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Spray a baking dish with cooking spray. Lay chicken breasts in dish. Pour wing sauce over chicken breasts. Sprinkle breadcrumbs over top. Bake for 45-55 minutes or till done. Serve with ranch dressing.

Preheat oven to 275 degrees. Place the pork in a crock pot. Add the barbecue sauce, root beer, dry onion soup mix, salt and black pepper. Cook for 8 hours. Serve with a hamburger bun and pickle.
I've been wanting to try this recipe for a long time and just finally got around to making it. I can't believe how good it is. It was really easy to make too! I'm not a big fan of mushrooms but they went great with the dish! I did add a little more Worcestershire sauce because my husband loves it. I will be making this again and again. Thanks for posting this recipe!
I love this recipe and have made it many times. I always add some minced garlic to the onions before adding the pork. I also add a little extra Worcestershire to the cream of mushroom soup. The gravy is to die for!
I was excited to try this recipe but after making it I was disappointed. It was bland. I was worried that I didn't drain the can

To make the tuna, combine the first five ingredients in a large bowl. Stir in enough mayonnaise to moisten. To make the french toast, whisk the eggs together in a shallow dish. Put the milk in another shallow dish. Dip each slice of the bread in the milk, then in the eggs and then in the milk again. Cook in a lightly greased frying pan until golden brown on both sides. To assemble the sandwiches, spread one side of each french toast slice with the tuna mixture. Top with the other slice of french toast and enjoy!

Mix together 1 cup butter (softened), 1 cup Crisco (softened), 1/2 cup powdered sugar. Beat until smooth. Add 1/4 teaspoon vanilla. Add 1/4 to 1/2 cup milk until desired consistency. Add desired food coloring. Spread on cake. Decorate as desired.

Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Add dijon mustard and thyme leaves. Heat until mustard is warm. Remove from heat. Stir in parsley and salt. Let cool slightly. Using tongs, place slices of ciabatta into mustard mixture. Remove from mixture and place on baking sheet. Bake for about 10 minutes or until toasted. Allow to cool.

Bring 2 cups water and 1 cup sugar to a boil in a large saucepan. Add cornreturn to a boil. Reduce heatcover & cook for 20 minutes or until kernels are tender. Combine 1 tbsp curry powder & 1 tsp red pepper flakessprinkle over corn. Transfer corn to a lightly greased 15x10x1-in. baking pan. Fold 3 sheets foil crosswise into 12x8-in. squaresplace over cornfold ends tightly to seal. Bake at 400° for 20 minutes or until heated through. Cut foil to allow steam to escape. Unwrapserve warm or chilled. Makes 4 servings (1/4 cup each).

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray or grease 9x5 loaf pan. Combine flour, sugar, cinnamon, walnuts in large bowl. Combine apples with remaining dry ingredients in separate bowl. Add milk, eggs and melted butter to apples mixture. Stir to combine. Add to dry mixture. Stir just until moistened. Batter will be thick. Pour into prepared pan. Bake 1 hour or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes in pan before turning out onto rack to cool completely. Cut into slices to serve.

Cook chicken breasts in a skillet until no longer pink. Cut into strips. Toss chicken with 1/2 cup teriyaki sauce. Cut mixed salad greens into bite-sized pieces. Place in a bowl. Toss with dressing. Add sliced water chestnuts, green onions and pineapple. Pour remaining 1/4 cup teriyaki sauce over the top of the salad. Add olive oil. Serve immediately.
Heat olive oil in skillet. Sprinkle with seasoning salt. Dip each breast in seasoning. Fry until browned. Serve.

Place fish in shallow bowl. In a small saucepan, melt 3 tablespoons of butter and stir in 1/4 cup vinegar. Stir in tarragon and garlic. Bring to simmer. Pour sauce over fish. Microwave on high for 3 minutes. Turn fish once and microwave another 2 to 3 minutes. Serve fish with cooked rice. You may also want to add some sliced fresh tomatoes.
Cut olives in half lengthwise. Combine all ingredients in a small bowl. Stir to coat well. Cover and refrigerate for up to 2 days. Drain well before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place hot dog buns on a baking sheet. Top hot dogs with pizza sauce and mozzarella cheese. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and bake for 10 to 15 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

In a large skillet cook the beef with the onion and pepper over medium-high heat until the beef is browned. Drain the fat from the meat mixture. Stir in the spaghetti, broth, basil, oregano, salt and pepper. Cover the skillet with a lid or foil. Reduce heat to low and cook for 10-12 minutes or until the pasta is tender and the liquid is absorbed. Stir in the parsley and serve immediately.
Mix catfish nuggets with eggs and seafood seasoning. Form into patties. Dip patties in flour and then dip into the cornmeal mixture. Fry in hot oil until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Salt and pepper the chicken pieces and brown in the vegetable oil. Add the tomatoes. And broth. Bring to a boil and then cover and bake for 1-1/2 hours. Add the beans and heat for 10 minutes. Serve over rice.

Mix stocks together in a small pot. Simmer gently on low for 5 minutes or until stocks are reduced to about half their volume. Stir in clam juice, white port and white pepper. Remove from heat. Add scallops and let cook for 1-2 minutes. Stir in green onion tops. Serve warm with crackers or bread cubes.
In a large bowl combine 1/2 cup of water and 2 1/2 tablespoons of yeast. Let stand for 1 minute until mixture is foamy. In another bowl combine 1 1/2 cups of flour, 2 1/4 teaspoons of baking powder and 1/2 teaspoon of baking soda. Add yeast mixture, stirring well. Coverlet stand for 10 minutes. In another bowl combine 2 cups of flour, 1 1/2 teaspoons of baking powder and 1/2 teaspoon of baking soda. Gradually stir in 2 1/2 cups of milk until blended. Beat until smooth.

In a large skillet, brown meat and celery. Add onion. Cook, stirring constantly, until onion is tender. Add vegetables and stir until heated. Stir in tomato sauce. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer, uncovered, for 12-15 minutes or until thickened. Combine water and instant potato flakes in a small bowl. Stir in milk. Add to meat mixture. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Spread into an 8-in. square baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake, uncovered, at 425 F for 20-25 minutes or until heated through and top is bubbly. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 1-2 minutes longer or until melted. Serve with a tossed salad.
Dip chicken into beaten egg. Let excess drip off. Then coat with breadcrumbs mixed with cheese. Place on greased baking sheet. Bake 400 degrees for 30 minutes.

Mix together first 5 ingredients in large bowl. Stir in nuts and eggs until well blended. Pour batter into greased and floured 9 x 13-inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes or until center is set. Cool slightly before spreading with glaze. For glaze: combine all glaze ingredients in small bowl. Stir until smooth. Drizzle over warm cake. Yield: 10 servings.

Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain pasta and place it back into the pan. Add pancetta and stir until the fat is rendered. Add olive oil and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add sea salt and ground pepper. Add egg yolks and stir until the eggs are cooked. Add cream and stir until it is heated through. Add Parmesan and stir until melted. Add cooked pasta and stir until coated. Serve immediately.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Rinse with cold waterdrain well. Meanwhile in a medium bowl combine remaining ingredients except feta cheese. Drain cooked shrimpcut in half. In another bowl combine shrimp and pastaadd Italian dressing mixturetoss well. Spoon into platessprinkle with feta cheese.

In a small saucepan, combine the orange juice, lemon juice, honey and brandy. Heat to boiling over medium heatboil 1 minute. Cool. Peel the bananas and apples. Slice the bananas into rounds. Cut the apples into slices. Add the dried apricots to the liquid mixture. Cover and refrigerate 1 hour. Add the banana and apples. Stir in the crystallized ginger. Refrigerate overnight.

Cook potato in microwave until soft. In small bowl combine potato, chives, lemon juice, egg whites, egg yolks, and seasonings. In an 8-inch skillet heat butter over medium-high heat until foaming. Add potato mixture to hot skillet. Cook until bottom is set, about 2 minutes. Reduce heat to medium. Shake pan to spread potato mixture over skillet bottom. When bottom is golden brown, flip omelette over. Cook until golden brown. Cut into wedges to serve.
Put all the ingredients in a slow cooker and stir well. Cover and cook on low for 7 to 8 hours or on high for 4 to 5 hours. Serve as is or add your favorite toppings such as nuts.

Cut the bread into slices. Butter one side of each slice of bread and put on a cookie sheet. Layer bread with slices of cheese, then ham, then an egg. Add another slice of bread on top of the egg, buttered side down. Repeat with remaining slices of bread. Bake for 10 minutes at 350 degrees. Turn the oven off, leave the oven door closed for 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Serve warm.

Mix 1 can of condensed milk with 1/2 cup of water in a saucepan. Stir well over low heat until bubbly. Do not boil! Place fillets into a baking dish and pour 2/3 of the mixture over them. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until the tops turn light brown. Sprinkle remaining mixture on top. Bake for 5 minutes more until top is light brown. Let sit for 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Sift together the flours and spices. Beat egg whites until stiff. Combine flour mixture and egg whites. Add buttermilk and stir. Add oil. Drop by teaspoons onto greased baking sheet. Bake 5 to 7 minutes. While doughnuts are baking, mix the powdered sugar and spices. Roll the hot doughnuts in the powdered sugar. Serve hot.
In food processor combine basil, olive oil, walnuts, garlic, cheese and butter. Blend to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with pasta or your favorite dish.
Mix all together well. Store in refrigerator until ready to serve. Add ice cubes before serving.

In a large saucepan, combine the sugar, vinegar, water, cloves, cinnamon sticks, salt and allspice. Cook over medium heat until the sugar dissolves. Add the pineapple and stir until the fruit is coated. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 40 minutes. Remove from the heat. Using a slotted spoon, transfer the pineapple to a serving bowl. Discard the cloves, cinnamon sticks, allspice and any leftover liquid. Sprinkle the red food coloring over the pineapple. Cover. Refrigerate until serving time. Serve cold.
Cook the sausages in a skillet until browned. Add the vegetables. Cook until tender. Add the mushrooms. Season with salt. Stir to combine. Serve on hoagie buns.

In a large bowl combine the potato and steak. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well. Spread into a greased baking dish and bake at 350 degrees F for about 1-1/2 hours or until heated through and the top is browned. Serve warm.

Preheat dehydrator to 145 degrees. Combine the first 3 ingredients. Divide the mixture into 4 portions. Place 1 portion of the mixture in each tray of dehydrator. Dehydrate for 6 hours. Mix the remaining 3 ingredients and sprinkle over the top of each chip. Dehydrate an additional 2 hours.

In a small saucepan, melt 1 tbspn butter. Saute mushrooms and green onions until tender-crisp. Stir in dry mustard, lemon juice and worcestershire sauce. Heat to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes until slightly thickened. Stir in remaining 1 tbspn butter. Spoon sauce on top of steaks or serve on the side. Garnish with fresh parsley sprigs.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Mix together sherry, soy sauce, sugar, sesame oil, and water. In a baking dish, place ribs with meat side down. Pour liquid over ribs and cover tightly with foil. Roast for 1-1/4 to 1-1/2 hours or until tender. Remove from oven and carefully discard bones from ribs, leaving meat attached to bone. Drizzle with more soy sauce if desired.

Bring the water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Add the quinoa. Cook over medium heat until the water is absorbed. Add the kale and cook for 5 minutes or until tender. In a small bowl whisk together the lemon zest, juice, and pine nuts. Add the scallions. Drizzle the walnut oil over the pilaf. Top with the goat cheese and the toasted pine nuts. Serve immediately.

Season mahi with cajun seasoning and cayenne pepper. Bake for 10 minutes at 400 degrees f. Meanwhile, combine the fruit with balsamic vinegar and brown sugar. Place in a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and cook for 20 minutes. Serve mahi with fruit salsa.
Cook and stir shrimp with olive oil and seasoning in a large skillet over medium heat until pink. Add pasta to skillet and cook 5 more minutes or until pasta is tender. Stir in lemon juice and serve.

In large bowl combine the sugar and oil. Beat in the eggs and stir in the mashed banana and the vanilla. In another bowl combine the flour, baking soda and saltstir into the banana mixture just until dry ingredients are moistened. Gently fold in the strawberries. Spoon into greased muffin cups. Bake at 400 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown. Makes about 12 muffins.

Place fish in a deep bowl and pour on enough boiling water to cover. Sprinkle with ginger and lemon juice. Cover and set aside for 10 minutes. Cook rice in separate pan until tender. Drain and return to pan. Combine with ginger-lemon-water mixture and drain fish. Serve in bowls over rice with vegetables.

Preheat oven to 350. Coat a baking tray with nonstick spray. Arrange the fillets on the tray in a single layer. Sprinkle the coconut evenly over the top and drizzle the mayonnaise over it. Spread the mayonnaise evenly and sprinkle the honey evenly over the top. Bake the fillets for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, make the sauce. In a small bowl, combine the lemon juice, mustard and curry powder. When the fillets are baked, turn the oven off and remove the fillets to a serving platter. Spoon the sauce over the top and sprinkle with the salt.
Cod Fish Steaks are very easy to make and is a very good meal. I hope you will like it.
Cod fish steaks are very easy to make and is a very good meal.

Combine semolina, jaggery, water and salt in a pot, bring to a boil. Cook till it thickens. Add the cashews and dates at the last minute. Remove from flame and pour into a serving bowl. Garnish with cardamom powder and cinnamon stick. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Spray a baking dish with cooking spray. Slice baby potatoes in half lengthwise. Toss with olive oil and garlic. Season with Italian seasoning to taste. Place in prepared baking dish, cut side down, and bake 15 minutes until golden brown.

In large bowl, combine orange juice, onion, garlic and steaks. Marinate in refrigerator overnight or at least 4 hours. Remove steaks from juice and pat dry with paper towels. Heat skillet over high heat and when hot add soy sauce and beer to make sauce. Place steaks in pan and cook over high heat to medium rare, 3 minutes per side. Transfer to platter and drizzle with pan juices. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve immediately.

Pour espresso into the cup of a demitasse. Add milk to fill the cup about halfway. Pour caramel syrup into the cup until it almost reaches the top of the cup. Add the shot of apple schnapps. Stir with a long spoon to combine all the flavors and make sure the schnapps does not float to the top of the cup.

Combine 1/4 cup lemon juice with 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon and 1 teaspoon salt in a bowl. Add 2 tablespoons olive oil in a steady stream, whisking until dressing is emulsified. Set aside. Peel and cut each orange into 8 wedges. Cut 6 ounces of radishes into thin matchsticks. Thinly slice 1 red onion. Toss together in a large bowl with the dressing until coated. Add the remaining 1/4 cup lemon juice, the garlic clove and the mint. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate up to 2 hours.
In large kettle or dutch oven cook meat and onions. Add tomato soup. Heat to boiling. Add potatoes. Cook 15 minutes or until potato are tender. Serve over rice. Garnish with green beans.

In a mixing bowl beat butter until smooth. Add honey and beat well. Add bananas and beat until smooth. Add egg white, vanilla and mix well. Sift flour and milk and beat well with mixture. Form into a ball and place in fridge for 1 hour. Roll into balls and press with thumb to flatten. Place in fridge for another hour. Roll in pure icing sugar before serving.
Beat all ingredients well. Bake in a greased tray for 30-35 minutes at 375f. Let cool before cutting.

Cook meat and taco sauce in skillet over medium heat until meat is no longer pink and sauce is well-blended. Lay a tortilla down flat and sprinkle 1/3 of the blue cheese and 1/3 of the spinach. Sprinkle 1/3 of the red pepper flakes and 1/3 of the meat over the top. Fold sides in and roll up. Heat in the microwave for 40 seconds. Sprinkle the remaining ingredients over the top of the rolled up tortilla. Cut into 8 wedges and serve.

Melt butter over low heat. Add prosciutto, basil and olive oil. Stir until prosciutto is golden brown. Cut prosciutto into 1 1/2" squares. Wrap 1 piece around each scallop. In a medium skillet heat 1 tablespoon butter. Cook scallops until light brown. Remove from skillet. Add wine to skillet. Cook until reduced. Add cream. Stir until thickened. Add scallops to sauce. Remove from heat.

Beat the evaporated milk with a rotary beater until soft peaks form. Add the lemon jelly crystals and beat until dissolved. Fold in the cream cheese. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Layer the parfait glasses with the creamed milk, canned peach halves and almonds. Top with lemon juice, chill for 4 hours. Serve chilled.
peach pie - bake a pie crust according to package directions. add canned peach slices to crust. stir together 1/2 cup brown sugar and 1/4 cup flour and sprinkle over top of pie. bake 15 minutes at 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake 40 to 50 minutes longer or until crust is golden.
peach chiffon pie - combine 1 1/4 cups flour and 1/4 tsp salt. blend into 3 eggs beaten until foamy. stir in 1 1/2 cups granulated
Brown chicken in olive oil. Add zucchini and potatoes. Season with garlic salt. Wrap in foil. Cook at 350 for 1 hour. Unwrap and top with parmesan. Return to oven until cheese is golden and bubbly.

Cook the turkey and carrots until done and set aside. In a medium size pot add the white rice and the turkey stock. Cook the rice for 45 minutes or until all the liquid is absorbed. Remove from the stove and let sit for 5 minutes. Add the eggs and mix well. Add the carrots and turkey and mix well. Serve warm.

Cook ground beef in skillet until browned. Drain fat. Stir in taco seasoning mix. Add tomatoes, peppers, onion, pasta. Mix well. Refrigerate for a few hours. Pour onto serving platter or individual plates. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Cover tightly with plastic wrap. Let stand at room temperature 2 hours before serving. Just before serving add crushed doritos. You can also add black olives. You can add canned corn if you prefer. I use only a portion of a can of drained corn. You can use more if you like.

Melt the butter in a 10-inch heavy skillet over low heat. Add the mushrooms, shallot, salt and pepper. Cover, cook over low heat for 3 minutes. Uncover and cook until the mushrooms are tender, about 5 minutes longer. Stir in the madeira, then bring the mixture to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat and boil gently until the liquid is almost evaporated, about 5 minutes more. Stir in the cream and cook until the sauce is thickened slightly, about 2 minutes more. Stir in the pecans.

Over low heat, melt chips in heavy medium saucepan. Add sugar and continue heating and stirring until melted. Remove from heat. Add vanilla. Serve in bowl. Melt marshmallows in microwave and stir into melted chips. Serve with fresh fruit.

Cream sugar, eggs and milk. Sift together flour, baking powder and salt. Add to creamed mixture. Stir until just combined. Fold in crushed pineapple. Heat oil to 375f. Drop dough by teaspoonfuls into hot oil. Fry until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Combine powdered sugar and milk. Dip warm doughnuts into glaze. Let stand until glaze hardens. Makes about 2 dozen.

Mix sugar, dates and milk in a pan over low heat. Stir until smooth. Remove from heat. Stir in butter, nuts and vanilla. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto wax paper. Chill.
name: date nut barsingredients: egg, margarine, sugar, pitted dates, pecans, rice krispies, vanillapreparation:In electric skillet set at 300 degrees, cook butter, sugar, dates and egg until gooey and thickened. About 7-10 min. Add pecans and vanilla. Then add rice krispies. Mix well. Cool until slightly warm. Form into balls & roll in powdered sugar. Makes 50-60 small balls.
name: west virginia skillet cookiesingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, dates, vanilla, rice krispies, pecans, shredded coconutpreparation:In a large saucepan over low heat melt butter. Add sugar, eggs and dates. Stir constantly until sugar is dissolved and mixture is thick. Remove from heat,

In a saucepan combine brown sugar, orange rind, allspice, and cinnamon stick. Stir in half-and-half, then add coffee. Heat until hot but do not boil. Remove from heatstir in chocolate pieces until melted. Spoon equal amounts of coffee mixture into 4 cups. Top each with whipped cream. Garnish with orange slice and cinnamon stick. Makes 4 servings.

Boil the octopus for 20-40 minutes until done. Drain. Combine the olive oil, vinegar, onion, oregano, salt and pepper in a bowl. Toss the octopus with the dressing. Refrigerate overnight. Drain off excess liquid and serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 10×15-inch pan with cooking spray. Place ham in the pancover tightly with foil. Bake at 350 degrees F for 1 hour. Meanwhile, mix together mustard, Guinness Stout, brown sugar, cinnamon, and parsley sprig in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heatstirring frequently. Remove from heat, cover, and let stand until ham is ready. Remove the ham from the oven and remove the foil. Pour the glaze over the ham, cover the pan tightly, and place it back in the oven. Bake for another 1 hour and 15 minutes or until a meat thermometer reads 150 degrees F. Remove from the oven, let the ham rest for 10 minutesslice and serve. Garnish each serving with a sprig of parsley.
I know this is an older post but I just found it while searching for a recipe for my mother-in-law’s Christmas dinner. She lov

Mix garlic, soy sauce, salt and water in a small bowl. Place in a large resealable plastic bag or shallow dish. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the round steaks and sear 2 to 3 minutes on each side or until browned. Remove from the pan. Discard the oil. Place the garlic mixture in a large measuring cup or bowl. Whisk in the cornstarch until smooth. Pour the mixture into the skillet with the browned round steaks. Cook until the liquid thickens. Stir in the green pepper, onion, mushrooms and sliced almonds. Cook until the vegetables are tender crisp. Serve immediately.

Cut the chicken breast into 1/2-inch slices and place into a 1-quart baking dish. Combine the olive oil, lemon juice and cream cheese and pour over the chicken slices. Sprinkle with salt and herbs to taste. Bake at 350F for 25 to 30 minutes. Serve as an appetizer or as a side dish to fish or poultry dishes.

Cook the okra in a large pot of boiling water for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain the okra and add to the other ingredients. Mix well and serve.
The book includes a chapter devoted to the various salad dressings and sauces used in Greek cooking. This is a unique feature as many recipes call for these basic sauces without explaining how to make them.
There are two sections devoted to vegetables – one for those grown in Greece and one for those grown elsewhere. The section for vegetables grown in Greece includes recipes for dill beans, fava, lemon potatoes, olive oil potatoes (a very flavorful dish), orzo pasta with green beans and tomatoes (orzo with vegetables), and eggplant with feta.
The section for vegetables grown elsewhere includes recipes for artichokes, asparagus, broccoli, carrots, cauliflower, cucumber, green beans (there are three recipes), green onions, leeks, mushrooms, okra, squash (there are three recipes), tomatoes (there are several recipes), zucchini

Mix the cherry jello with boiling water. Add the rum and triple sec. Fill your cups with the mixture and place them in the freezer for at least 4 hours. Melt 1 cup of the white chocolate in a double boiler. Let the chocolate cool slightly. Add the powdered sugar and mix together. Pour the chocolate mixture into a plastic bag and snip off a corner. Drizzle the chocolate onto the frozen shots.

Melt butter in a large skillet. Add onions and celery and saute until tender. Add mushrooms. Cook until tender. Add salt and thyme. Blend in water and bouillon cube. Cook until mixture comes to a boil. Stir in uncooked rice. Cover and simmer for 45 minutes. Serve.
The rice is a great source of energy and a healthy alternative to wheat and other carbohydrates. In India, the consumption of rice is increasing by the day. However, the consumption of rice has been decreasing in many other parts of the world due to its high calorific value.
The caloric value of the rice is 200 kcal per 100 grams.
Rice is a cereal grain that is widely grown in the tropics and subtropics. It is the world's most important staple food. The nutrients in the rice are vitamins B1 (thiamine), B2 (riboflavin), B3 (niacin), B6 (pyridoxine), folic acid, calcium, iron, magnesium

Beat eggs with salt. Gradually beat in flour until a soft dough forms. Knead for one minute. Cover with plastic wrap. Roll out on lightly floured board. Cut into strips about 1/2-inch wide. Boil in salted water until tender. Drain. Toss with melted butter. Add parsley. Serve immediately.

In a medium bowl combine the Spanish olives, garlic cloves, dried red chili, black peppercorns, bay leaves, salt, lemon, and parsley. Toss well to combine. Cover and let marinate in the refrigerator for 1 to 2 days. Drain well. The olives can be served immediately. They re also delicious served at room temperature.
name: olives with garlic herbs and chiles
ingredients: green olives, extra virgin olive oil, balsamic vinegar, garlic cloves, basil, orange zest, lemon zest, crushed red pepper flakes
preparation:Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Stir well. Marinate for at least 12 hours or up to 3 days in refrigerator. Drain thoroughly. Serve at room temperature.
name: marinated olives with lemon and fresh herbs
ingredients: green olives, fresh thyme, fresh parsley, fresh rosemary, garlic cloves, lemon juice, fresh ground pepper, olive

Heat the olive oil in a frying pan and gently fry the onion until soft. Add the rice and fry for a further 3-4 minutes. Add the passata and cook for a further 4 minutes. Add 250ml stock. Cook on a low heat for 30 minutes or until the stock has been absorbed. Add the remaining stock, 100g of the parmesan cheese and the pesto. Stir well. Toss in the chopped artichokes. Spoon into a serving dish. Scatter the remaining parmesan cheese on top. Bake for 15 minutes until golden. Serve at once.

In a 1-2-gallon saucepan, bring wine, orange, cloves, cinnamon sticks, bay leaf, brown sugar to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat and simmer 20 minutes to blend flavors. Discard all but 1 cinnamon stick, bay leaf and clove. Ladle wine mixture into 8 heatproof cups or mugs. Garnish each mug with a cinnamon stick and 1/2 orange slice. Top each mug with 1 tbsp brandy. Serve warm.

In a large bowl combine all ingredients except the ketchup. Mix well with hands. Shape into a loaf. Bake in a 350f preheated oven for one hour. Add ketchup and bake for another 15 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before slicing.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a large bowl, combine the chicken with the garlic, onion, crushed red pepper flakes and sesame oil. Mix well and marinate in the refrigerator for 15 minutes. Coat a baking dish with cooking spray. Add the marinated chicken to the baking dish. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven. Stir in the low sodium soy sauce. Return to the oven for an additional 5 minutes. Remove from the oven. Stir in the lemon juice, parsley, coriander and sesame seeds. Serve over cooked rice or noodles.

Heat oven to 350f. Grease a 13x9-inch baking pan. Place bread in the bottom and sprinkle with sausage and cheese. Beat eggs, milk, salt and pepper with a whisk. Pour over the bread mixture. Bake 40-45 minutes or until eggs are set in the center and lightly browned. Serve with your favorite toasting bread.
Place thighs in crock pot. Add broth, lemon rind and juice. Add mustard and garlic. Cook for one hour. Add onion and cook for one hour. Add figs and cook for one hour. Serve over rice.

In a 9 by 13 inch pan, combine chicken, oil and spices. Arrange in a single layer. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until done. Meanwhile, combine remaining ingredients. Toss with spinach. Top chicken with spinach mixture and sprinkle with cilantro. Bake 5 minutes longer. Serve over rice.
I made this for dinner tonight and the family loved it. We are on a low sodium diet so I omitted the chile and added extra cumin. I also used 4 boneless skinless thighs instead of breasts and browned them in a skillet before adding to the rest of the recipe. The rice turned out a little bland and next time I would use more vegetables. But all in all this will be a keeper.

Cook bacon in skillet until crisp. Remove to drain on paper towel. Sauté green onion and garlic in bacon fat. Add mushrooms. Stir in soup. Add sour cream. Cook over low heat for a few minutes. Stir in bacon. Add pepper to taste. Serve over hot cooked pasta.

Rinse fish fillets under cold running water. Drain and pat dry. Mix together all other ingredients. Coat fillets with mixture. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Bake at 350f for 1 hour. Serve over rice or noodles.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl, combine soy sauce, honey, garlic powder, green pepper, sliced mushrooms, onion flakes, boneless chicken. Bake for 35 minutes in a 9×13 pan. Serve with a side vegetable or salad. I serve it over rice.
Mushroom rice is sooooo yummy.
I’m hungry just looking at that photo.
I love mushrooms, but I don’t think I’ve ever made a recipe that specifically calls for them. I’ll have to give some of these a try!
I have a recipe for a salad that uses canned mushrooms and it is so good! I will try a few of your recipes!
I love to eat mushrooms but I have never tried to make any dishes using them…I will have to give one a try!
I love the smell of mushrooms when they are baked, but my kids don’t like them, so I never make them anymore.
I love adding sliced mushrooms to my

Blend together custard and powder and set aside. Blend together butter, margarine and powdered sugar. Add custard and blend well. Fold in flour and baking soda. Drop by spoonful onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350f for 15 minutes. Cool on wire racks.

Cook rice according to package directions. Drain and cool. Combine rice and beans in large bowl. Add salsa, corn and chicken. Stir gently to combine. Fold in 1 cup of the cheese. Toss to mix. Place mixture in center of each tortilla. Sprinkle remaining 1/4 cup cheese evenly over top. Roll up tightly and wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate until serving time. Serve with sour cream and garnish with additional cheese and cilantro.

In a medium saucepan, stir together the milk and oats. Cook over medium heat until thickened (about 5 minutes). Add the raspberries. Reduce heat to low. Cover. Cook for an additional 5 to 8 minutes or until oats are tender. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with the pecans and brown sugar. Serve immediately.

In a large pot of boiling water add in the macaroni and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until the macaroni is al dente. Rinse with cold water to stop the cooking process. In a large bowl combine the macaroni, butter, milk, condensed cream of mushroom soup and 1 cup of the cheese product. Mix until the mixture is smooth. Transfer the mixture to a 9×13 inch casserole dish. Combine the remaining 1/2 cup of the processed cheese product with the remaining 1/4 cup of the butter. Melt this mixture in a double boiler until smooth. Pour this mixture over the macaroni mixture and spread it to the sides of the casserole dish. Sprinkle the remaining 1/2 cup of the processed cheese product over the top of the casserole dish. Bake for 30 to 45 minutes or until the top has a golden brown color and the top has melted slightly.

Place chips in a plastic bag and crush with a rolling pin. Combine chips with parsley flakes and crushed crackers. Beat egg in a bowl. Dip the chicken in the egg then into the cracker mixture, coating well. Shallow fry at 375 degrees f for about 10 minutes, turning once, until done. Makes 4 servings.

In a large pot over medium heat, add the ground chuck and brown well. Drain well. Add the water, bouillon cubes, mushroom soup, salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and cook for 15 minutes. Cook the egg noodles according to package directions. Stir in the cooked noodles to the soup mixture. Serve immediately in individual bowls garnished with sour cream.

http://www.savorthefood.com/recipe/11849/parmesan-bow-ties
http://www.savorthefood.com/recipe/11857/creamy-beef-and-macaroni
