Separate egg whites from yolks with an egg separator, or carefully crack them into a bowl without breaking the yolks. In a shallow bowl or dish large enough to hold the egg whites and the almonds, whisk the egg whites and salt until stiff peaks form. Add the cumin and paprika to the egg whites and whisk well to combine. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and evenly spread the almonds on the paper. Sprinkle with the cumin mixture and toss well to coat. Bake for 20 minutes, tossing the almonds once halfway through baking, or until they are crisp and lightly browned. Store in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks at room temperature.

Heat oil in a heavy-based frying pan. Add shallots, garlic and lemongrass. Stir and saute for about 2 minutes. Add in the chilies. Stir and saute until they just begin to turn dark. Add in the rest of the spices. Stir and saute for a minute. Add in the fish and the fish sauce. Turn the heat down to low. Cover and let simmer for about 10 minutes. Turn the pieces over and cook for another 10 minutes. Add in the lime juice and turn off the heat. Serve immediately.

Place seaweed in a small bowl and cover with cold water to cover. Let stand 20 minutes or until seaweed has softened. Drain seaweed in a colander. In a small bowl, combine rice vinegar, sugar, and soy sauce. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Add seaweed and cucumbertoss to combine. Coverchill at least 3 hours or overnight.

Beat egg with 1 tablespoon water. Combine breadcrumbs, 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepperstir well with a fork. Dip each chicken piece into egg mixturedredge in breadcrumb mixture, turning to coat. Place breaded chicken pieces on a baking sheet coated with cooking sprayspray the top sides. Bake at 400 degrees for 25-30 minutes or until no longer pink. Meanwhile, combine roasted peppers, 1/4 cup oil, italian seasoning and 1/8 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Cook and stir until fragrant (about 1 minute). Stir in feta cheeseset aside. Discard any remaining breadcrumb mixture. Cut each chicken breast into 4 slicesserve with sauce. Makes 4 servings.

In a large bowl combine the apple, pear and the grapes. In another bowl combine the mayonnaise and honey. Season with cinnamon and salt and pepper. Pour the dressing over the fruit and toss. Chill until serving time.

Mix together flours, sugar, powdered milk, cinnamon, apple and sultana. Add water slowly to form a soft dough. Turn out onto a floured surface and knead lightly. Roll out to 2cm thickness, cut out with floured cutter. Brush with milk, sprinkle with sugar. Bake at 190 c for 20 minutes or until golden brown.
name: apple muffinsingredients: butter, milk, sugar, flour, eggs, vanilla extract, baking powder, salt, chopped apple, walnuts (optional)preparation:Combine all the dry ingredients in a bowl. Add the butter and mix until crumbly. Beat the eggs then add the milk and vanilla extract. Beat in the dry ingredients. Fold in the chopped apple and nuts (if using). Grease the muffin pan and fill each compartment 2/3 full of batter. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.
name: apple pie in a muffin paningredients: butter, milk, sugar

In a large microwave safe bowl add evaporated milk and sugar. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Add fresh lemon juice and mix until combined. Add white chocolate chips and mix until melted. Add marshmallows and mix well. Add white almond bark and mix until all is well blended. Transfer to a 9x13 inch dish. Refrigerate until set. Once set use your hands to roll into one inch balls and roll in a bowl of coconut. Keep in refrigerator.

In a medium saucepan, combine pineapple preserves, orange marmalade and lemon juice. Stir until smooth and add water to thin if desired. Bring to a boil and cook 1 minute or until thickened. Stir in cornstarch and water mixture until smooth. Add cooked shrimp and heat through. Serve over rice.

Cut the potatoes into small cubes and drizzle with the olive oil. Sprinkle with the sea salt, fresh ground pepper and fresh oregano. Bake for 30 minutes. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Toss the chicken in the oil. Season with the sea salt and fresh ground pepper. Arrange the chicken on a shallow baking dish. Cook the chicken for 30 minutes. Serve with the sweet potatoes.

Preheat the oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4. Remove the giblets from the cavity of the chicken and set aside to make the stuffing. Toss the potatoes, parsley, garlic and herbs in the stock and season with black pepper. Divide the stuffing between the cavities of the chickens and arrange the legs so that the breast is facing upwards. Tie the legs together with string and place the chickens on a large baking tray. Roast the chickens for 20 minutes then reduce the heat to 160C/320F/Gas 3 and continue to cook for another hour. Serve with seasonal vegetables and a glass of crisp white wine.

Wash the spears of asparagus. Pat them dry. In a large bowl combine the lemon juice and oil. Add the spears. Stir to coat. Cover and refrigerate 2-6 hours. Arrange the asparagus on a lightly greased broiler pan or on skewers. Broil 5 inches from the heat about 4-6 minutes or until done. Serve warm or at room temperature.

In a large skillet saute onions and red pepper in oil until tender. Add chicken broth and cook until liquid is reduced to about 3 tablespoons. Add chicken broth and cook until liquid is reduced to about 3 tablespoons. Add rice and cook according to package directions. Stir in chicken. Add lemon juice and parmesan cheese. Serve in a bowl with artichokes.

To make marinade, combine all ingredients. Slice prosciutto into 1/2 inch strips. Place 1 tablespoon of marinade into bottom of each of 4 individual serving dishes. Arrange 3 to 4 oysters over marinade. Top with 1 slice prosciutto. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and chives. Serve immediately.

Boil the macaroni with the peppercorns. Drain and rinse. Combine the mayonaise, salad dressing and pickle relish. Mix in the celery and onion. Add the macaroni and the eggs. Add the shrimp and mix well. Chill for at least 4 hours. Serve on lettuce.

Wash and dry the berries. Place in a blender and process until liquefied. Add milk and splenda and process until mixed thoroughly. Pour into popsicle molds and freeze at least one hour before serving.
Mix all ingredients except potatoes together and roll into small balls. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Serve with mashed potatoes or mashed cauliflower.

Place dry ingredients in a large bowl and add butter, oil, eggs, and milk. Stir until well blended. Add corn, parsley, and cheese. Stir to combine. Place mixture in a greased bread pan or in a loaf pan sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. Bake for 40-50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Let cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans. Cut into slices and serve warm.

Bring a large pan of lightly salted water to the boil. Add the pasta and cook according to the package instructions. When 2 minutes of cooking time remains, add the haddock. Cook for a further minute. Drain well. Heat the oil in a frying pan over a low heat. Add the onions, cook for 2 minutes. Add the tomatoes, cook for 1 minute. Stir in the haddock, capers, creme fraiche, lemon zest and juice. Cook for 1 minute or until the haddock is heated through. Serve on top of the cooked pasta, sprinkled with the spinach.

Combine the pancake mix with the ground flax seeds and cinnamon. Add the whole milk and kefir and whisk the mixture well. In a separate bowl combine the flour and baking soda and set aside. In a small bowl combine the coconut oil and milk and beat until smooth and combined. Add this mixture to the pancake mix mixture and stir well to combine. Let the batter rest for a few minutes while you heat a non-stick pan over medium-low heat. Spray the pan with coconut oil spray to help prevent sticking. Use a 1/4 cup measure and pour the batter into the pan and let it cook for 2-3 minutes or until bubbles appear around the edges and the top of the pancake is no longer shiny. Flip the pancake over and allow to cook for an additional 1-2 minutes or until it reaches the desired doneness. Serve with real maple syrup and fresh fruit such as blueberries and strawberries.

Combine graham crackers and butter in a food processor and pulse until the mixture resembles fine crumbs. Add the coconut and pulse until combined and the mixture holds together when pinched between your fingers. Press the mixture into the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch pie plate. Bake for 10 minutes or until lightly golden and firm to the touch. Cool on a wire rack.

Brown ground beef. Add onion and garlic. Cook until meat is done. Drain any excess fat from pan. Add chili powder and garlic powder. Add hash browns. Stir until browned. Add cheese. Heat through. Spread meat mixture over 8-inch tortilla. Add salsa to taste. Garnish with fresh tomato. Roll up and cut in half. Serve with salsa and tabasco brand chipotle pepper sauce.

Boil potatoes with salt and pepper. Once done, mash them up with marjoram and turmeric. Serve hot.
name: dry potato sabjiingredients: potatoes, mustard seeds, hing, chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric, fenugreek seeds, salt, oil, cilantropreparation:Heat oil in a wok. Add mustard seeds, cover to avoid splatter. After seeds crackle, add potatoes and hing. Cook 1 minute. Add chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric, salt, and fenugreek seeds. Stir well. Reduce heat to medium. Cook, stirring occasionally, until potatoes are crispy and tender. Stir in cilantro.
name: easy special supper potatoesingredients: potatoes, water, sweet onion, garlic clove, butter, dill weedpreparation:Boil potatoes, onions and garlic, dash of salt, till potatoes are soft. Drain. Add butter and dill. Salt and

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Add onions and red bell peppersauté until tender about 4 minutes. Add sugar, garlic and cuminsauté until aromatic about 30 seconds. Stir in beansadd 3 cups of water. Bring mixture to a boilreduce heat and simmer for about 10 minutes until thickened. Stir in vinegarcook until heated through about 2 minutes.

Combine chocolate and butter in medium sized saucepan. Cook over low heat until melted. Remove from heat and add Splenda. Stir until Splenda is dissolved. Cool slightly. Beat together the egg yolks and vanilla. Add to chocolate mixture and beat until well blended. Beat egg whites until frothy. Add cream of tartar and continue beating until egg whites are stiff. Fold egg whites into the chocolate mixture. Pour into greased 11 x 17 inch jellyroll pan. Bake 20-25 minutes. Cool completely in pan on wire rack. Cut into squares. Makes 36 servings.

In a small bowl combine soup and sour cream. In a small dish combine corn flakes with cheese and pepper. Dip the chicken in sour cream mixture, then coat with flakes. Place in a greased 9x13 inch dish. Pour remaining sour cream mixture over top. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes.

Combine sausage and crumbs. Add eggs and mix well. Shape into 1 1/2 inch rounds. Dip into egg mixture and coat with crumbs. Fry in hot butter. Arrange in a baking dish. Mix apples with onions and sprinkle over sausage rings. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven for 15 minutes. Garnish with parsley.
Slice the loaf in half lengthwise. Spread mayo on both sides and top with turkey, cheese and any other toppings you like. Roll up and enjoy!

Cut the chicken into serving size pieces. Heat the butter in a small skillet, add the onion and cook until golden. Add the garlic and cook for another minute. Add the wine to the skillet and cook until the liquid is almost all evaporated. Season with a little salt and a little fresh ground black pepper. Add the dijon mustard, the sour cream and the parsley. Place the chicken breasts in a baking dish. Spoon the sauce over the top. Sprinkle the chicken evenly with the parsley. Bake in a preheated 400f oven for 20 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9×13 inch baking dish. Spread spaghetti sauce into prepared dishtop with tortellini. Sprinkle with minced clams, parmesan cheese and mozzarella cheese. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes in preheated oven. Meanwhile, prepare Alfredo sauce according to package directionsmix into cooked spaghetti sauce and tortellini mixture just before serving.
Combine all the ingredients in a food processor or blender and blend until smooth. Store in a covered jar in the refrigerator for up to 3 weeks. Makes 3 cups.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Scrub potatoes thoroughlydo not peel. Cut into 1/2 inch thick slices. In a 13 x 9 baking dish combine the potatoes, onion, salt, and peppertoss to coat. Sprinkle with the thyme and drizzle with the butter. Bake for 15 minutes, then sprinkle with the cheese and continue baking until the cheese is bubbly, about 20 minutes longer. Sprinkle with parsley and serve immediately.

Spray a 2 quart casserole dish with cooking spray. Layer 3 tortillas in the bottom of the dish. Spread 2 cups of sour cream over the tortillas. Add the next 8 ingredients. Repeat layers 2 more times. Sprinkle the remaining 1/2 cup of sour cream over the top. Top with 1 cup cheddar cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until heated through. Let stand for 5 minutes. Serve with lettuce for garnish.

Slice onions into 1/8 inch thick slices. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add bacon and cook until crisp. Drain bacon on paper towels and chop. Discard all but 2 tablespoons of bacon grease from skillet. Add onions and cook over medium heat for 2 minutes. Stir in tomato juice and water. Cook over medium heat for 2 minutes. Add remaining ingredients and cook over medium heat for 15 minutes or until onions are tender. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Arrange in a 1 1/2 quart casserole. Bake uncovered in a 350degf oven for 45 minutes or until bubbly. Serves 6.
I love the sound of this! I'm going to make it with a few changes. Instead of mayonaisse, I will use greek yogourt. Instead of milk, I will use buttermilk. Instead of cider vinegar, I will use rice vinegar. Instead of green onions, I will use leeks. Instead of d

Heat oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over medium heat. Add chicken and cook until browned and cooked through. Remove chicken and set aside. Add mushrooms and cook over medium heat until they release their liquid, stirring occasionally. Stir in broth. Bring to a boil. Return chicken and cook until heated through. Stir in sour cream and dill. Season with salt and pepper.

Wash turnip greens well and cut them into 2 inch lengths. Put them in a large pot of boiling water with a little salt. Cook them for 15 minutes or until tender. Drain them, reserving a cup of the cooking liquid. Set the greens aside while you prepare the dressing. Heat the drippings in a skillet. Add the onion and saute it for a few minutes. Add the vinegar, sugar and 1/2 cup of the cooking liquid from the greens and cook for about a minute or until the dressing is the consistency of gravy. Pour over the greens and toss to blend well. Serve hot.

In a large bowl, combine the zest and juice of the limes. Add the chicken pieces. Mix well. Place in a large plastic bag. Add the vegetable oil, pepper, basil and salt. Seal the bag and mix again. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken pieces. Cook for 3-4 minutes per side. Add the mushrooms to the pan. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Add the wine. Stir to combine. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the butter. Cook for 2 minutes more or until the chicken is done. Remove from the heat. Serve over cooked rice. Garnish with green onions.

In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, the 2 tablespoons of beer, the parsley, green onions, 1/2 teaspoon of salt and the 1/4 teaspoon of pepper until smooth. Add the chicken drumsticks to the batter, coating them completely, and shaking off any excess batter. Fry the coated drumsticks in the hot oil until golden brown, about 5 minutesturn them and fry on the other side until crispy and cooked through, about 5 minutes longer. Remove from the oil with tongs and drain on paper towels. Season with salt and pepper.

Cook the elbow macaroni in a large saucepan according to package directions, drain. While the macaroni is cooking, brown the ground beef in a large skillet. Drain the fat. Add the mild green chilies. Cook the green chilies 1-2 minutes. Add the can of chili beans. Stir. Add the can of tomatoes. Stir. Add the can of tomato sauce. Stir. Add the can of water. Stir. Add the can of tomato paste. Stir. Add the can of chili con carne. Stir. Add the can of kidney beans. Stir. Add the can of pinto beans. Stir. Add the can of black beans. Stir. Add the can of corn. Stir. Add the can of green chilies. Stir. Add the can of diced tomatoes. Stir. Add the can of diced green chilies. Stir. Add the can of black olives. Stir. Add the can of sliced mushrooms. Stir. Add the can of whole green chilies. Stir. Add the

Remove any wilted or yellow leaves from the stems of the Brussel Sprouts. Trim off the bottom leaves and slice Brussel Sprouts in half crosswise. Heat 1 Tablespoon of extra virgin olive oil and 1 Tablespoon of balsamic vinegar in a frying pan on high until the mixture boils. Add the Brussel Sprouts and stir the mixture around until the Brussel Sprouts are coated in the mixture. Simmer for 2 minutes and add more balsamic vinegar and olive oil if necessary. Season with the seasoning to taste and serve hot.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onionsaute until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in garliccook 1 minute more. Stir in chickencook until no longer pink, about 4 minutes. Stir in refried beansheat through. In separate bowl combine 1/2 c. cheese, enchilada sauce, cumin and saltstir until smooth. Dip each tortilla into sauce mixtureevenly coat both sides. Place 1/2 c. filling on eachroll up. Place seam side down in 9 x 13-inch pan coated with cooking spray. Spoon sauce mixture evenly over enchiladas. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 c. cheesebake at 350 for 20 minutes or until heated through. Serve with sour creamgarnish with lettuce, tomatogreen onion if desired.

Saute the onion in butter in an 8-inch square oven-proof casserole dish. Add the potato cubes. Drain the bacon, crumble and add to the potatoes and onion. Cook for 5 minutes or so. Meanwhile, break the eggs into a bowl with the milk. Season with salt and pepper. Pour the egg mixture into the casserole dish. Sprinkle the cheese evenly over the top. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Serve hot.

Cook bacon until crisp. Remove and drain. Crumble bacon and set aside. Brown onion in bacon grease. Add soup and water. Bring to boil. Add spaghetti and cook according to directions. Remove and drain. Stir in bacon. Serve immediately.

In a large saute pan over medium high heat, heat oil for 30 seconds. Add the onions. Cook until the onions are translucent, about 15 minutes. Add parsley and chives, cooking for another 1-2 minutes. Remove from heat. In a medium bowl combine cooked onions with cream cheese. Add salt and pepper to taste. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Spread on crackers or serve with fresh vegetables or fruits.

Cut baking potatoes in half lengthwise and rub with oil. Bake in 425F oven until done. Split open with fork. In skillet over medium heat, melt 2 tablespoons oil and saute onion until tender. Blend in water, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Spoon over potatoes. Makes 4 servings.

In a large bowl combine the butter, brown sugar and lightly beaten egg. Mix together the dry ingredients. Add to the wet ingredients and mix well. Press into a 9-inch pie plate. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Cool completely. In a large bowl beat together the cream cheese and sweetened condensed milk until well blended. Stir in the crunchy peanut butter. Gently fold in the Cool Whip. Spread evenly over the cooled crust. Chill for 2 hours or until firm. Garnish with chopped peanuts if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cook pasta in boiling water 8 minutes or until tender, drain. Heat evaporated milk, cheddar cheese, cayenne pepper, and salt in a medium saucepan over low heat until cheese is almost melted stir in pasta and heat through. Spoon into a 1 1/2 quart casserole dish coated with cooking spray, sprinkle with bread crumbs, and bake at 350 degrees f for 25 minutes or until bubbly.

In a large pot cook ravioli according to package directions. Drain. Add butter, garlic, and spices. Toss to coat. Add lemon juice. Mix in parmesan. Serve immediately. Garnish with chopped green onions if desired.

Combine chicken broth and leeks in a 2 quart casserole. Cover and simmer 20 minutes. Add oatmeal. Stir until thick. Add water to desired consistency. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Garnish with parsley. Serves 4-6 people.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add pasta and cook until al dente. Drain pasta and return to the pot. Add garlic and toss. Add oil and parsley. Add anchovies and stir. Add water and toss. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve.
Combine all ingredients in large bowl. Mix well with wooden spoon. Chill 1 hour before serving. Makes 2 servings.

Peel and wash potatoes. Cut into bite-size cubes. Boil in salted water until potatoes are soft when pierced with the tip of a knife. Meanwhile, mince scallions. In a medium bowl combine milk, salt, pepper and mace. In a small bowl combine butter and cheese. Mash potatoes into milk mixture. Stir in scallions. Add butter-cheese mixture. Serve warm with crisp bacon bits or crumbled blue cheese on top.
name: baked brie en crouteingredients: brie cheese, butter, flour, baking powder, saltpreparation:Cut the brie in half to expose the center of the wheel. Place brie on a serving plate or platter. In a small bowl, stir together the butter with the flour until a crumb forms. Sprinkle with salt to taste. Pour the butter mixture over the brie and spread evenly over the top of the brie. Bake at 350 for 12-15 minutes or until the cheese is bubbly and the
Mix together lime juice, lemon juice and orange juice, add sugar cube and ice cubes to shaker. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass and top up with ginger beer. Garnish with sprig of mint.

Slice the top off a large head of garlic and place in a small bowl. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and cover with olive oil. Let sit for 1 hour. Strain and set aside. In a blender combine the olive oil and cream cheese until smooth. Add the goat cheese and blend until smooth. Add the milk and blend until smooth and creamy. Add the garlic and blend until smooth. Add the Parmesan and black pepper and blend until smooth and creamy. Add the chives and blend until incorporated. Store in a sealed container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

Thaw the frozen vegetable mix and cook according to package directions. Meanwhile, combine mushroom soup and cream cheese spreadstir in croutons and seasoning. Spread into bottom of an ungreased shallow baking pan. Top with vegetablesbake uncovered at 350 for 20 minutes.

In a large skillet, brown beef. Drain fat. Stir in onion, sauce, water and corn. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer 8 to 10 minutes or until noodles are tender. Sprinkle with cheese. Let stand 2 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Peel and slice the apples and place in a bowl. Slice the radishes and place in a bowl. Add the sour cream and mix well. Toss in the dill and mix well. Add the lemon juice and season with salt and black pepper to taste. Chill and serve.

Cut the watermelon flesh into 1" cubes and puree them in a blender or food processor. Pour into a large container and stir in the sugar and the water. Stir well and store in the refrigerator for 1 hour or longer. Serve over ice cubes. Garnish with a slice of lime or lemon if desired.

Boil pasta. Cook broccoli in boiling water for about 5 minutes or until tender crisp. Drain well. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir in garlicsaute until golden brown. Add broccolistir-fry until heated through. Add pasta and toss well. Sprinkle with cheese.

Wash the rice thoroughly. Place rice in a pot with the water and the cloves. Bring to boil then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 40 minutes until rice is tender. Wash the potatoes then cut into small pieces. Heat oil in a pan. Add onion and cook till light brown. Add the potatoes and stir fry for a few minutes. Add the cumin seeds and the cloves from the rice. Fry for a few more minutes. Add the lentils. Fry for another 5 minutes. Drain the rice. Add the potato mixture to the rice and mix. Add the turmeric to the rice mixture. Serve with a sprinkling of chopped coriander.
Cut steaks into 1/4 inch thick slices. Dip in flour. Brown steaks in oil. Add onions and jalapeno. Stir in garlic and salt. Cook and stir until tender. Spread over kaiser rolls. Sprinkle with tomato.

Melt the butter in the microwave or on the stove. Add the eggs and the milk, stirring well with a fork. Cut the bread into cubes and add to the mixture with the hot water. Stir well. Spoon the mixture into individual serving dishes. Bake at 375 degrees until golden brown. Mix the honey and the hot water together and drizzle over the top of the baked bread. Sprinkle the ground cinnamon over the top of the bread and honey mixture. Put in the oven for 10 more minutes to heat the honey. Serve hot.

Drain the onions from the dip. Whisk in milk. Combine with baking mix. Let stand 5 minutes. Stir in parsley. Drop by teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto an ungreased baking sheet. Bake in a 350 oven until lightly browned, 10 to 12 minutes. Serve hot. Makes 2 dozen.

Preheat grill to medium-high. Rub ribs with olive oil. Season ribs with salt and pepper. Grill ribs for 20 minutes or until they are slightly charred. Remove ribs from grill and brush with barbecue sauce. Return to grill until ribs are tender and cooked through.

Divide dough into 4 equal portions. On each piece, sprinkle 2 tablespoons of cinnamon and 2 tablespoons of granulated sugar. Roll into balls and place on greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes or until golden. Meanwhile, in small saucepan combine the margarine and the milk. Cook and stir over medium heat until margarine melts. Add the powdered sugar and the vanilla. Stir until smooth. Remove the rolls from the oven and brush with the glaze. Cool 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Cut sesame seed rolls in half. Spread 2 tablespoons of giardiniera on each half. Layer cheese, artichoke hearts and peppers on one half and spread with 1/4 cup dressing. Top with other half. Broil sandwich for 3-4 minutes or until cheese is melted. Cut in half and serve warm.

Cook sausage over medium heat until brown and done. Drain reserving drippings in a small dish, setting sausage aside. In a large skilled heat drippings over medium heat add ranch dressing. Saute until hot but not brown. Crack eggs into dressing and stir gently until scrambled. Spoon onto plates, top with sausage, salsa, beans and cheese if you wish. Garnish with green onions if you wish.

In a large skillet over medium heat, place the oil and chicken breasts. Cook until brown on both sides. Add the can of soup, corn, milk, and ricecook until heated through. Serve on a plate and top with grated cheese.

Slice the onions in half and separate the rings. Slice the cucumbers into thin rounds. Place the onion rings in the base of 4 glasses. Add the cucumbers, then the yoghurt, then the green coriander. Season to taste and refrigerate for at least 3 hours. Sprinkle each serving with tabasco sauce.

Dissolve gelatin in hot water. Stir in 3 cups ice water. Add milk powder and sugar. Stir until mixture thickens. Add oil. Cool to room temperature. Beat with mixer until stiff. Refrigerate. Unmold and spread over cake or pie. Decorate with fruit. Makes 4 cups.
I thought the Lemon Salad was a little too tart for my taste.
I liked the Creamy Lemonade Jello but it was too sweet for me.
I liked the Creamsicle Ice Cream and the Mountain Dew Salad.
I really liked the Mountain Dew Salad. I also liked the Creamsicle Ice Cream.
I loved the Mountain Dew Salad and the Creamy Lemonade Jello.
I liked the Lemon Jello but it was too tart for my taste.
The Berry Vanilla Ecstasy sounded good and I would like to try it.
The Berry Vanilla Ecstasy sounded like it would taste good and I would like to try it.

In a large saute pan over medium heat, add a tablespoon of the olive oil. Add the garlic and saute for a couple of minutes until lightly golden. Add the chickpeas to the pan, and stir for a minute or two. Add the remaining tablespoon of olive oil. Add the salt and pepper. Add the spinach and the lemon juice. Toss with the spinach and chickpeas, and heat through. Serve in the pita bread.

In a small saucepan combine the vinegar, sugar, soy sauce, and tomato paste. Stir over low heat until the sugar is dissolved. Add the tamarind paste. Add 1 tablespoon of the water to dissolve the paste. In a small bowl dissolve the cornstarch in the sherry. Stir the cornstarch mixture into the tomato mixture. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Boil for 1 minute. Remove from the heat and allow to cool slightly. Serve with meats or vegetables.

In a large bowl combine cream cheese and buttermix until smooth. Add milk and the chicken breastsmix well and let stand 30 minutes to allow chicken to absorb flavor of cream cheese mixture. Cook the dry fettuccini according to the package directionsdrain well and toss with the chicken-cream cheese mixtureset aside. In a medium skillet, saute the garlic and onion powder in the butter until brownedadd the heavy whipping cream and parmesan cheesecook and stir until the cheese is melted and the mixture is smooth. Combine the cheese mixture with the chicken-fettuccini mixtureadd salt and pepper to tasteserve immediately.

Melt butter in a heavy saucepan over medium heat. Add oil and swirl to coat. Add onions and garlic and cook until soft and translucent. Add ground cumin and stir until it darkens slightly. Add parsnips and fennel. Add the broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until vegetables are tender. Puree in batches in blender until smooth. Return to the pot and stir in the cream. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Mix gelatin and boiling water in a small bowl and stir until dissolved. Let cool for 10 minutes. Cut watermelon into chunks. Using a blender or food processor, puree melon into a slurry. Stir melon puree into gelatin mixture and refrigerate 30 minutes or until slightly thickened. In a small bowl, combine sugar and 1 1/2 tbsp fresh lemon juicestir well. Pour 1/2 cup of mixture into each ice pop mold. Fill with watermelon mixture and refrigerate at least 6 hours or overnight before serving.

In a saucepan, combine the water and the red cinnamon candies. Cook over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil. Stir in the milk and the mix. Cook until mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in the whipped cream. Top with a cinnamon stick.
I love the idea of adding a cinnamon stick to a mug of hot cocoa.
I’ve made this before. It’s so delicious. The chocolate is a bit bitter from the added coffee.
This recipe is similar to a recipe I’ve made before. It’s delicious and not too sweet.
This recipe is a great way to make a single serving of delicious hot cocoa.
This recipe is a great way to add a little something extra to your mug of hot cocoa.
This recipe is a great way to add a little something special to your mug of hot cocoa.
This recipe is a great way to add a little something to your mug of hot cocoa.
This recipe is a great way to add a little something special to your cup of hot cocoa.

Spread a thin layer of sour cream and cream cheese mixture onto the bottom side of each bread slice. Add salmon and sprinkle with lemon peel. Spread with the remaining sour cream mixture and top with the cucumber slices. Garnish with dill sprig.

In large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Saute garlic until golden. Add shrimp and cook until pink. Add remaining ingredients except parsley. Bring to boilreduce heat to simmercovercook until shrimp are done to your likingstir occasionally. Remove from heatstir in parsleyserve over cooked pasta or rice.

In a small bowl combine ketchup with mayonnaise and brandy. Set aside. Clean and de-vein prawns. Cut lettuce into wedges. Peel and seed avocados. Cut into halves. Gently scoop out flesh of each half to make a cup. Fill half of each cup with prawns. Spoon a little mayonnaise mixture over prawns. Arrange lettuce wedges in a fan around each cup. Garnish with a whole prawn or lemon slice. Serves 4.

Heat oven to 375 degrees F. In a small bowl combine the sage with 1 tablespoon of the butter. Set aside. In a medium skillet, melt the remaining tablespoon of butter. Cook the onion for 4 to 5 minutes or until it is beginning to brown. Stir in the garlic and cook 1 minute longer. Remove the pan from the heat. Peel the potatoes and cut them into 1/2-inch cubes. Place the cubes in the skillet with the onion mixture and toss to coat evenly. Sprinkle the sage mixture over the potato mixture and toss again. Place in a 2-quart casserole or baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes or until the potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork. Serves 4 as a side dish or 2 as a main course.

Melt butter in a skillet over medium high heat. Add lemon juice and stir. Add carrots and cook, stirring frequently for about 3 minutes. Add mustard and cumin. Stir and continue to cook another 3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

Wash and chop leeks finely. Sweat in hot melted butter in a casserole dish with flour mixed with chicken stock. Cook the leek mixture on low heat for 10 minutes. Add spinach and cook for 3 minutes more. Add nutmeg and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

In a resealable plastic bag or a shallow dish, combine the lemon juice, shoyu, oil, Worcestershire and the garlicadd the steaks and turn to coat. Marinate in the refrigerator for 2 to 3 hours. Grill the steaks until done to taste, about 5 minutes a side for medium-rare. Grill the green onion until lightly browned. Toss the green onion with the dill and celery seed. Serve with the steaks and the marinade.

Combine the bulgar wheat with 2 cups of water in a medium pot and bring to a boil. Cook for 15 minutes or until the wheat is tender and the liquid is absorbed. Let the bulgar cool to room temperature. In a large bowl combine the parsley, tomatoes, onion, and bulgar. Add the lemon juice and oil and toss. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350. Place chicken in 15x10x1-in. baking pan sprayed with cooking spray. In small bowl, combine flour and next 5 ingredients. In another bowl, combine apple juice and next 6 ingredientspour over chicken. Bake uncovered 1 hour 10 minutes or until chicken is done and sauce is thickened and bubbly. Serve over rice. Yields 2 servings.
Tear the mozzarella ball into small pieces and arrange on a serving platter. Arrange the tomato slices on top of the mozzarella. Garnish with basil leaves and drizzle with oil and vinegar mixture.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cut english muffin half into 4 triangles. In a small bowl combine mayonnaise and creole seasoning and set aside. In a medium skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add crabmeat and creole seasoning and stir to combine. Cook for 2 minutes stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in half of the cheese and let stand until slightly cooled. Spread each english muffin half with 1-2 tablespoons of the mayonnaise mixture. Top with 1/3 cup of the crab mixture. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese and bake 10-12 minutes or until melted and golden brown. Serve hot.

Peel potatoes then cube them into small pieces. Cook in a pot with boiling water until soft. Add bacon and cook until crisp. Drain liquid and add polenta to potatoes. Mix well with onion, bacon and cheese. Salt to taste. Cook on low heat with a little olive oil in a heavy pan until a smooth consistency is achieved. Serve hot as a side dish or main meal with a side of greens or salad.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9×13 inch baking pan. Melt the baking chocolate in a double boiler. Mix together the butter and sugar in a large bowl until creamy and smooth. Add the melted baking chocolate and mix until the chocolate is melted and the mixture is smooth. Add the egg and vanilla extract and mix well. Combine the dry ingredients in another bowl and add to the cream mixture until just moistened. Stir in the walnuts and pour into the prepared pan. Bake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the edges begin to pull away from the side of the pan and the top is springy. Cool completely in the pan. Cut into squares and serve.

Heat oil in heavy large pot over medium-high heat. Add onionsaute until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add ricestir to coat. Add stock. Bring to boil. Coverreduce heat to lowsimmer until liquid is absorbed, about 15 minutes. Add turmericstir. Coversimmer until liquid is absorbed, about 5 minutes. Add tomato saucestir. Coversimmer until liquid is absorbed, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Add harissastir to combine. Let stand 2 minutes. Fluff with fork. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan, combine cabbage, apple, potato and apple cider. Bring to boil and cook for 10 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Drain mixture into a colander placed over a large bowl. Add apple cider vinegar, caraway seed, sugar and 1/4 teaspoon each of salt and pepper. Toss to combine. Serve hot or cold.

Wash beets well and cook them in a pot of boiling water until tender. Drain water from pot. Cool the beets slightly then peel off skin. Cut into chunks or slices as desired. Place the chunks or slices into a bowl. Add the cider vinegar, beet juice, sugar, cloves, cinnamon sticks, and salt to the bowl and stir to combine well. Cover bowl tightly with plastic wrap or with a lid that fits tightly onto the bowl. Refrigerate for 1 to 2 days before using.

Mix all the marinade ingredients together in a small bowl. Reserve 1/2 of the mixture. Place the remainder of the mixture in a zip top bag. Add the tenderloin. Marinate for 30 minutes. Drain the tenderloin and place the marinade in a small bowl. Add the corn starch and water and stir. Heat the vegetable oil in a pan or wok over medium-high heat. Stir-fry the tenderloin in the heated vegetable oil until browned. Add the marinade to the pan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until the liquid is reduced to a syrup. Brush the glaze over the tenderloin. Serve hot.

Cut cooked ham into small bite-sized pieces. In a small bowl combine mayonnaise, dijon mustard and worcestershire saucemix until well combined. Fold in ham pieces. Stir in pickle relish until evenly blended. Fold in chopped pecans. Season with pepper to taste. Chill until ready to serve. Serve on crackers or bread.

Combine first four ingredients in bowl. Use pastry blender to cut in shortening & butter until mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in white vinegar. Add just enough of ice water to moisten dough enough to form a ball. Gather dough into a ball. Divide dough into four equal portions. Flatten each portion into a disk. Wrap each disk in plastic wrap & refrigerate at least 30 minutes or up to overnight.

Beat butter until light and fluffy. Gradually add sugars and mix well. Beat in eggs one at a time until well blended. Stir in vanilla extract. Mix well. In a separate bowl combine flour, baking soda, saltstir into butter mixture. Stir in macadamia nuts and white chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoonful onto greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 for 8-10 minutes or until set and lightly browned. Cool on wire rack.

Cook the fruit in a large pot until it is tender and the liquid is syrupy. Measure the fruit and add an equal volume of sugar. Cook until thick, stirring carefully to prevent scorching. Remove from the heat, add the other ingredients, and stir until cooled. Fill sterilized jars, cover, and process in a boiling water bath for ten minutes to seal.

Combine all meatball ingredients except for the spaghetti sauce and mix well. Form into balls and place on a baking sheet. Bake at 350 F for 15 to 20 minutes or until cooked through. While the meatballs are baking, prepare the spaghetti. Cook the spaghetti according to package directions. Drain the cooked spaghetti and place the cooked spaghetti back into the pot with the remaining sauce. Heat the sauce and spaghetti together. Serve the baked meatballs with the heated spaghetti and sauce. Makes 12 servings.

In a large mixing bowl stir together sugar and cornstarch until smooth. Stir in 1 cup of the heavy cream to make a smooth paste. Stir in remaining cream and kahlua. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly or until mixture comes to a boil and thickens. Serve warm over ice cream or other desserts.

Fry onion in butter until soft. Add spinach. Cook until done. Stir in yogurt. Add salt and pepper. Top with parmesan cheese.
Fried chicken breast in batter served with mashed potatoes and gravy or rice.
Fresh tomato slices with a thin layer of bread and melted mozzarella cheese in between.
Mozzarella sticks, chicken tenders, onion rings, mushroom caps, breaded jalapeños, and zucchini sticks served with marinara sauce for dipping.
Mozzarella sticks, chicken tenders, onion rings, mushroom caps, breaded jalapeños, and zucchini sticks served with marinara sauce for dipping.
A small deep-fried pizza served with a side of marinara sauce.
Fresh mozzarella balls deep fried in a light tempura batter served with a side of marinara sauce for dipping.
Fresh mozzarella balls deep fried in a light tempura batter served with a side of

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Butter each slice of bread. Line bottom of a 2 quart baking dish with bread. Layer half the slices of corned beef on top of the bread. Top the meat with the sauerkraut and then the remaining meat. Top with the remaining bread slices. In a small bowl combine the dressing and the mustard. Spread evenly over the sandwiches. Top with the shredded swiss cheese. Bake for 20 minutes or until the bread is golden and the cheese is melted.

In small bowl, mix first 4 ingredients until smooth. Divide dough into 6 equal portions. Shape each portion into 1-inch ball. On work surface, roll 1 ball into 3-inch circle. Wrap around stuffed olive and pinch edges together. Repeat with remaining balls and olives.Place on greased baking sheet. Bake at 400 for 10 to 12 min or until golden brown. Cool 5 minserve warm. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat over to 375F. Grease a 13x9-inch pan. Combine contents of cake and corn bread mixes. Add eggs, milk and water. Beat until smooth with a wire whisk. Spoon mixture into prepared pan. Bake about 25 minutes or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted in center of pan comes out clean. Cool completely and cut into squares.

Place a small piece of butter on each slice of french bread and place in the microwave for about 10 seconds until it melts. Brush the melted butter over the whole slice and sprinkle with the herb seasoning. Grate the parmesan cheese and sprinkle on top of the slice of bread. Bake in a preheated 400 oven for about 10 minutes or until the crust is brown and crispy and the cheese is melted and bubbly.

Spread butter on one side of bread. Spread baked beans with molasses evenly over buttered side of bread. Top with bacon. Add american cheese. Top with other slice of bread. Spread with mustard. Grill in skillet till bread is golden brown. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375f. Place steaks in a ziploc bag with the seasoning and shake to coat. Remove excess seasoning. Brown the steaks in a skillet with a little olive oil. Place them in a 9x13 baking dish and cover with the rest of the sauce. Bake in the oven for 1 hour. While the steaks are baking, saute the spinach in a skillet with a little olive oil, salt and pepper until it is wilted. Set aside. Slice the top off the portabella and remove the stem. Place the portabella in the oven as well. Clean the meat out of the portabella mushroom and chop the meat. Saute the chopped portabella meat with the chopped garlic and wine in the skillet with the spinach for 10 minutes or until it has reduced by half. Add the portabella to the baking dish and serve with the spinach.

Combine flour and pepper. Dip chicken in flour mixture. Melt margarine in a 9x13-inch baking dish. Add chicken and saute in margarine 2 minutes. Combine soy sauce and water and pour over chicken. Bake in 350 degree oven for 20 minutes. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.

Heat vegetable oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add onions and saute until translucent. Add cabbage and cook 3 minutes. Add vinegar and cook until tender, about 30 minutes. Stir in sugar and cook until glazed. Add apples and cook 3-5 minutes. Add broth and cook 10 minutes. Salt to taste.

Heat oil and saute onion for a few minutes until soft and transparent. Add the red wine and let evaporate for 2-3 minutes. Add the herbs and continue cooking for 2-3 minutes. Add the garlic, mushroom and black pepper and stir for 5 minutes. Add the parsley and mix all together. Blend the cream cheese with the balsamic vinegar and add it to the mixture. Mix and keep warm for 10 minutes before serving. Serves 4 as a starter.

Bake potatoes in their skin at 375 degrees for 1 hour. Remove from oven. Cut open and scoop out pulp. Combine pulp with sour cream, butter, bacon bits, scallions, cheddar cheese. Spoon mixture back into skins and replace in oven for another 15 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with a little green salad and garlic bread.
These potato salad recipes are so delicious and easy to make!
I have been looking for potato salad recipes for weeks now! Thank you!!

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Spray 13x9x2 inch baking dish with cooking spray. In large bowl stir together Bisquick, parmesan cheese and seasoning. Add chicken. Spoon over pasta sauce. Stir in frozen vegetables. Pour into dish. Dot with butter. In small bowl beat egg with fork. Brush egg over top. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered 30 minutes or until golden brown.
Wash cucumbers and peel if desired. Cut into small pieces. Mix sour cream with vinegar, sugar and onion. Pour over cucumbers and chill for at least 30 minutes before serving.

In blender container, combine creamer, ice cream and milk. Blend until smooth. Add brewed coffee and blend until smooth. Add whipped cream and blend until smooth. Pour into glasses. Serve immediately. Drizzle with chocolate syrup, if desired.

Cut off the bottoms of the asparagus spears. Put the spears in a saucepan and cover with boiling water. Simmer until the spears are tender. While the asparagus is cooking, heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until soft. Add the garlic and cook for a minute or so more. Add the cooked asparagus and pour in the chicken broth. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low. Cook for 10 minutes. Add the milk and thyme. Cook for an additional 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Blend with a hand-held mixer or in a blender. Serve hot.

Cook udon noodles according to package directions. Drain. In a small bowl, combine cabbage, mushrooms, red pepper, shrimp, onions, bean sprouts and noodles. In another bowl, combine teriyaki sauce and water. Pour over salad. Serve.

Heat oil in a skillet, add onion. Saute until soft. Add flour and stir for 1 minute. Add stock and cider, bring to a boil. Add chicken. Simmer until done. Add apricots and walnuts. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve.
Rub steaks with spice mixture. Heat oil in heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Add steaks. Cook for 4 minutes per side for medium. Let stand for 5 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.

Prepare the clams in the usual way. Meanwhile heat the olive oil in a pan and saute the shallots, then add the garlic. Stir for a minute then add the chopped tomatoes. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the wine. Cover the pan and cook for 1 minute then remove the lid. Add the cream. Season with salt and pepper. Add the clams to the pan. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Serve the clams on individual plates. Sprinkle with basil leaves. Serve with bread.

Preheat a grill on high heat. Split the tomatoes in half lengthwise and scoop out seeds. In a large bowl combine orzo, green onions, basil leaves, goat cheese, salt & freshly ground black pepper and mix well. Stuff the tomato halves with the mixture, dividing evenly among the four halves. Place the halves on the grill cut side down. Grill 5 minutes on each side or until the orzo is tender & the cheese is melted and golden brown. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese before serving.

Combine first 4 ingredients. Rub into ribs. Place ribs in slow cooker. Cover with water. Cook 5 hours. Remove ribs from cooker. Shred with fork. Heat tortillas and add shredded pork. Garnish with fresh cilantro stem, diced red bell pepper, and diced avocado. Serve with homemade salsa.

Cook the udon noodles according to the package instructions. Drain and rinse under cold water until cooled. In a small bowl combine the peanut butter and egg. Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil and mix until smooth. Heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil in a medium skillet. Add the noodles and stir until heated through. Add the peanut butter mixture and stir until smooth. Season with salt to taste and serve immediately.

In a small saucepan, combine all ingredients, except tea bags, and bring to a boil. Allow to simmer for three minutes. Strain. Pour liquid into serving cups with one tea bag and allow to steep for three minutes or to desired strength. Serve hot.

Prepare dressing by mixing all dressing ingredients. Coat chicken with dressing. Wrap each piece of chicken in 1 slice of bacon. Grill chicken for 5 minutes. Grill vegetables for 3 to 4 minutes. Serve chicken with vegetables and drizzle with balsamic glaze.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Cut cabbage in half lengthwise and remove core from each half. Cut each half cabbage in half again and cut each quarter in half again to make 8 equal wedges. Peel zucchini and cut into 1-inch slices, and cut carrots into 1-inch rounds. Slice garlic cloves thinly.Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook garlic until lightly browned, about 1 minute. Add cabbage and stir-fry until wilted and lightly browned on bottom, about 2 minutes. Transfer cabbage to a 9x13-inch baking dish.Toss together zucchini and carrots in the same skillet and cook until lightly browned and crisp-tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in teriyaki sauce and cook until heated through, about 1 minute more. Season vegetables with pepper. Pour mixture over cabbage wedges and bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes.
thank you

In a large bowl combine rice, green peppers, onions, and black olives. In a separate bowl combine remaining ingredients. Pour over rice mixture and stir to combine. Garnish with tomato halves. Serve immediately.
In saucepan, bring hot water to boil. Add tea bags. Let stand 2 minutes or to desired strength. Remove tea bags. Stir in sugar, milk and spices. Serve in cups with lemon wedges as garnish.

Grate the brussels sprouts using a mandolin or food processor fitted with a slicing blade. In a large bowl, combine the shaved sprouts and nuts. Whisk the lemon juice and olive oil together, then pour over the slaw mixture. Add the cheese and toss to combine. Season to taste with pepper. Serve immediately.

Bring 1 inch of water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add the beets. Simmer until beets are just tender, about 15 minutes. Drain the beetswhen cool enough to handle, rub with a paper towel to remove any excess moisture. In a large bowl, combine the beets with the sugar snap peas. In a small bowl, whisk together the mustard, vinegar and oil. Pour over the beets and snap peas. Sprinkle with the dill. Serve at room temperature or chilled. Makes about 4 servings.

In a large pot, combine water and lamb shank. Bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer until meat is tender, about 1-1/2 hours. Remove meat and set aside to cool. Slice meat into thin strips across the grain of the meat. In a small bowl, combine yogurt, butter and garlic cloves. Stir in mint leaves and set aside. Place meat in a shallow dish and pour sauce over it, cover and refrigerate for 3 hours or overnight. Remove from refrigerator and place meat in serving dish. Serve cold. Garnish with mint leaves.

Peel and cut the red potatoes in large chunks. Pour into a medium-sized pot and fill with enough cold water to cover potatoes by 1 inch. Bring to a boil and cook for 20 minutes or until potatoes are very tender when pierced with a knife. Drain and let cool slightly. While potatoes are cooking, peel and coarsely chop the yellow onion and garlic cloves. Melt butter in a large saute pan over medium heat and saute onions until soft and slightly brown, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook for about 3 minutes longer. Add celery and cook until tender, about 3 minutes more. Pour into a blender or food processor and let cool for 10 minutes. Add 1/2 cup of the half-and-half and 1/2 cup of the chicken bouillon and blend until smooth, adding more of both if necessary. Return mixture to saute pan and heat over medium-low heat until hot. Add remaining 1 cup half-and-half and stir until smooth. Add buttermilk and salt and pepper. Add potatoes and mash thoroughly

Heat milk in large saucepan over medium heat to 185F. When hot, stir in yogurt and cream. Let sit 20 minutes. Strain through fine sieve lined with cheesecloth. Let drain 2 hours. Place in bowl. Stir in salt. Serve with blueberries and honey.

Prepare cake mix according to package directions for 9x13 inch pan. Bake as directed, cool completely on wire rack. Make frosting: Beat together all frosting ingredients until smooth. Beat in enough food color to achieve desired color. Frost top of cooled cake as desired.
name: white chocolate cheesecakeingredients: cream cheese, vanilla bean paste or extract, vanilla bean seeds, heavy cream, eggs, almonds, white chocolate chipspreparation:preheat oven to 300 degrees f (140 degrees c) and grease a springform pan. put almonds in a blender and pulse until finely ground. combine ground almonds, cream cheese and vanilla extract in a bowl. mix until smooth. beat together heavy cream and eggs in a bowl. fold into cream cheese mixture. pour mixture into springform pan. bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour. turn off oven and leave cheesecake to cool in oven for 1 hour. remove chees

Cut the eggs in half lengthwise and remove the yolks to a mixing bowl. Mash the yolks with the spicy brown mustard and lemon juice until smooth and blended. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well. Divide the mixture evenly among the egg halves. Garnish with paprika if desired. Chill for one hour before serving.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook pasta according to directions. Drain well. Meanwhile, beat the eggs in a large bowl. Add the other ingredients to the bowl, except the pasta, and mix well. Add pasta to the bowltoss well to coat. Refrigerate until serving time.
Combine salsa and cream cheese in a bowl. Add beans and stir until smooth. Layer with cheeses, olives and tomato. Chill. Serve with tortilla chips.

Cut the bread in half lengthwise. Butter each half with mayonnaise. Arrange ham on both halves of bread in a row along the bottom of each half. Arrange bacon on top of ham in a row. Season with salt and pepper. Arrange thin slices of meat on top of bacon in a row along the bottom of each half of bread. Arrange cheese on top of meat in a row. Arrange tomatoes on top of cheese in a row. Arrange lettuce on top of tomatoes in a row. Season with salt and pepper. Break an egg onto each half of bread on top of lettuce in a row along each half of bread. Fold each half of bread over the filling to make a sandwich. Serve immediately.
This is a simple recipe for a quick healthy breakfast. It is a great way to use up leftover rice or quinoa. You can use any type of fruit that you like in this recipe.
The Best Easy Peasy Breakfast Recipe - Easy To Make And Tastes Great!
This easy breakfast recipe is one of my favorites! It is so simple to make that you

Cook the rice as directed on the package, then drain it. In a large bowl, whisk together the pudding mix with the egg yolks. Then whisk the egg yolks into the pudding mixture. Add the sugar, butter, milk, rice, coconut, and vanilla extract to the bowl and whisk until smooth. Pour the mixture into a 2-quart baking dish, cover with foil or plastic wrap, and refrigerate for 2 hours or until set. Beat the egg whites until frothy. Gradually add the powdered sugar and beat until the egg whites are stiff. Spread the meringue on the set pudding and return to the refrigerator for 1 hour or until set.

Slice potatoes 1/2" thick. Saute onion in butter until tender. Mix together the cheeses and the seasoning salt and pepper. Mix the onions and the cheeses together with the potatoes. Melt bacon grease in a casserole dish. Put the potato mixture in the dish. Sprinkle with chives. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot.

Boil small red potatoes in water with 1/4 teaspoon of salt for about 20 minutes, or until tender. Drain potatoes and mash with cream cheese, buttermilk, green onion and herbs. Stir in enough additional milk to reach desired consistency.

In a medium bowl mix together all the stuffing ingredients except for the mushrooms. Fill each mushroom cap with the stuffing. Place on a baking sheet and sprinkle with the parmesan cheese. Bake at 400 degrees for 18 minutes, until hot. Serve warm.

Toss together potatoes and apples in medium sized bowl. Heat oil in large skillet over medium high heat. Add onion and cook until soft, about 3 minutes. Add parsley and stir. Add potato and apple mixture and cook until tender, stirring often. Season with salt and pepper. Combine with jarlsberg. Spoon into center of each tortilla. Fold over each side and roll to enclose. Seal with butter. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden. Serve with apple butter.

Heat butter in a large skillet over medium heat until it browns slightly. Turn off the heat. Place the baguette in the skillet to warm slightly. Spread both sides of the baguette with the mustard. Top one side of the bread with the ham and the other side with the roast pork. Place a slice of the cheese on each side of the sandwich. Sprinkle the sandwich with the pickles. Close the sandwich and let it stand for 5 minutes. Slice the sandwich in half. Serve warm.

In a large bowl combine 2 cups velveeta cheese, 2 cups milk and 1 can (10 ounces) cream of mushroom soup. Add 1 can (6 ounces) tuna drained with 1/2 cup milk, 1 teaspoon pepper and 2 teaspoons salt to the bowl. Stir in 12 ounces elbow macaroni. Pour into 9x13-inch pan. Cover with foil. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. In a small bowl combine 1 cup velveeta cheese with 2 teaspoons milk and 1 teaspoon margarinemicrowave 1 to 2 minutes or until smooth. Spread over top of hot casserole. Sprinkle with saltine crackers. Bake uncovered at 350 for 15 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Combine wine, grapefruit juice and Grand Marnier in a large pitcher. Chill for at least an hour. Just before serving add pineapple juice. Stir well and serve over ice.
Mix together all ingredients. Place in a zip-lock bag. Add pork loin and seal bag. Marinate overnight. Grill, bake or pan fry. Serve with rice or pasta.

Cook the chicken in a skillet or fryer until no longer pink. Remove from pan. In a 13X9 inch baking dish add the cooked rice and the broth. Stir to combine. Add the remaining ingredients except the chicken and the tortilla chips. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover tightly. Bake for 25 to 35 minutes or until the rice is tender. Stir in the remaining 1 cup broth and the chicken. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover tightly. Bake for 5 more minutes. Sprinkle with the tops of the chips. Let stand for 10 minutes. Serve with the remaining 1/3 cup tops of the chips. Serve with the remaining 1/3 cup tops of the chips.

Mix together flour, salt, milk, water. Add vanilla. Whisk in eggs. Pour into a 9x12 inch pan. Bake in a water bath in a 300 degree oven for 1 hour. When done let cool completely. Spread with butter cream. Cut into squares. Dust with confectioner's sugar.

Preheat oven to 180c. Line the base of a 22cm springform cake tin with greaseproof paper. Put the graham crackers into a food processor and blitz until you have fine breadcrumbs. Add the butter and process until you have a fine mixture. Press into the base of the cake tin and place in the oven for 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and leave to cool. Using an electric mixer, beat the cream cheese until smooth. Add the sour cream and continue beating until smooth. Add the granulated sugar and the lemon juice and continue beating until smooth. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add the heavy cream and beat until the mixture is smooth. Pour the mixture into the base of the cake tin and bake for 1 hour. Remove from the oven and cool on a wire rack. Once cool, refrigerate overnight. When ready to serve, remove from the tin and decorate with sultana.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch pan. In a large bowl, beat together the yellow cake mix, eggs, oil, and water until just moistened. Spread half of the mixture into the prepared pan, sprinkle evenly with the graham cracker crumbs. Spread the remaining batter over the top. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Sprinkle the top of the warm coffee cake with the brown sugar and walnuts, and spread evenly. Bake for another 10 minutes. Cool on a wire rack before serving.

Melt butter and saute onion and celery until transparent. Stir in flour and cook 2 minutes stirring all the time. Stir in milk. Bring to the boil and simmer 3 minutes. Stir in sweet corn and peas. Season with pepper and herbs. Divide mixture into 3 ovenproof dishes. Top each with a can of tuna, then sprinkle with cheese and breadcrumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes until golden brown.

Put the ingredients in the bread pan according to the manufacturers instructions. Set the crust on medium and program for the basic cycle. Press start. At the end of the baking cycle, immediately remove the bread from the pan and place it on a rack. Let cool to room temperature before slicing.

In a bowl mix all ingredients except the vegetables and cheese. Spread in a greased pie plate. Top with tomatoes, onions and cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes. Let set for a few minutes before cutting.

Place smoked sausages in a 1-quart baking dish. Add the apples and onion. Toss to mix. Add the red cabbage, brown sugar, salt and black pepper. Pour apple juice over everything. Cover with foil and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Uncover and bake for 15 minutes longer or until cabbage is tender. Stir well before serving.

Cook the chorizo in a frying pan for about 3-4 minutes until it starts to go crispy. Add the onion, lentils, parsnips and stock then simmer until everything is very soft. Add the lentils and coriander and blend until smooth. Season to taste with the chili flakes and serve with a dollop of yogurt on top.

Cook fettuccine according to package directions. Drain. Place in large serving bowl. Sprinkle over anchovy fillets. Add garlic and lemon juice. Toss to blend. Add mayonnaise and cream. Toss to blend. Add tuna and lemon rind. Toss to blend. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve immediately.

Slice tart apples thinly and place in a bowl. Add brown sugar and butter and toss until well coated. Sprinkle with cinnamon and toss again. Place in a baking dish and bake at 350 for about 45 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent burning. Serve with ice cream or as a side dish for pork or chicken.

Cook the ground beef with the barbecue sauce. Heat the ketchup until hot and pour over the meat mixture. Simmer until hot and bubbly. Stir in the cheese to melt. Serve on buns with lettuce and tomatoes, if desired.

Prepare pudding according to package directions. Cool slightly. Dissolve gelatin in 2 cups hot water. Add pudding and cool. Fold in cool whip. Chill 2 hours. Makes 10 servings.
"A delicious twist on the traditional lemonade."
Dissolve Jell-O in 2 cups hot wateradd Mountain Dew. Cool slightly. Whip Jell-O and pudding together and fold in Cool Whip. Chill 4 hours.
Prepare pudding according to package directions and cool. Dissolve Jell-O in 2 cups hot water and add Mountain Dew. Cool slightly. Whip Jell-O and pudding together and fold in Cool Whip. Chill 4 hours.
Mix all ingredients together well. Pour boiling water over mixture. Stir shortly. Let stand overnight. Strain mixture and then bottle. When you wish to drink it, add the concentrate to water to taste.
In a shaker filled with ice. Combine all ingredients. Shake

Mix together yeast, sugar, salt, water and milk. Let stand for 10 minutes. Add eggs, butter, 3 cups of flour. Knead until smooth. Add more flour if necessary. Let rise until double. Roll into 14 balls. Flatten balls into 5 inch rounds. Heat oil. Fry until golden. Sprinkle with sugar. Serve.

Muddle mint and sugar together in the bottom of a tall glass. Add cold water and stir until the sugar is completely dissolved and the mixture is light green. Fill glass with crushed ice and top off with ginger ale. Garnish with a slice of lemon.
