Bring water to boil. Add green beans and cook 4 minutes or until crisp-tender. Meanwhile, melt butter in a small saucepan over low heat, stirring constantly until golden brown. Remove from heat, stir in basil, oregano and lemon rind. Pour butter mixture over the beans. Toss well and serve immediately.

Slice the okra into 1/2" pieces. In a skillet over medium high heat add the okra and canola oil and saute until they are limp but still bright green. Add the yellow onion and garlic and saute for a minute or two until the vegetables are soft but not browned. Add the tomatoes and cook another minute or two until the tomatoes are soft but not mushy. Add the red pepper powder and cook 30 seconds more then add the coriander and cumin powders and cook for another minute or two then add the turmeric and cook for 30 seconds more. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve over rice and garnish with cilantro.
In a large bowl combine the cranberries, sugar and pineapple. Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours. Fold in the marshmallows and stir in the cream. Serve chilled. Garnish with additional marshmallows.

Carefully cut off the top of a ripe tomato to make a lid for the egg. Carefully remove the seeds from the tomato with a teaspoon and wash it under cold water. Drain it and pat it dry with paper towel. Break the egg into the tomato using a spoon. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add a small amount of light cream and a few sprigs of fresh herbs. Replace the top of the tomato with the lid. Place the filled tomato on a small dish. Sprinkle with ham pieces and grated tasty cheese and bake for 5 minutes in a hot oven. Remove the lid, spoon the egg yoke on to the toast and replace the lid of the tomato on top of it. Serve immediately.
Boil potatoes. Drain and add soy sauce and sugar. Cook until potatoes are soft and juicy. Serve with chopped garlic and sesame seeds. Add chopped scallions and sesame oil just before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Halve and seed the squash. Place the cut side of the squash on the baking sheet. Bake in the oven for 20 minutes or until the skin is brown and the flesh is tender. Cut the roasted halves into wedges. In a small bowl, stir together the butter and zest. Season the roasted squash with salt and pepper and drizzle with the lemon zest butter. Garnish with lemon wedge and sprinkle with nutmeg.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Saute shallots and garlic until soft. Add frozen peas and cook until just tender. Add prosciutto and parsley. Season with salt and pepper.
name: peas chickpeas and cuminingredients: chickpeas, peas, garlic cloves, cumin, butter, black pepperpreparation:Melt butter in a pan. Add garlic and cumin and saut for 1 minute. Add chickpeas and saut until heated through. Add peas. Season with black pepper and serve hot.
name: sauteed peas and celeryingredients: olive oil, red onion, celery, frozen peas, celery leaves, salt, pepperpreparation:Heat oil in skillet on med, add onions, cook until soft. Add celery, cook until crisp tender. Increase heat to med hi, add peas. Cook until peas are heated through. Stir in celery leaves, salt and pepper.
name: hostess peas with mushroomsingred

Place flour in food processor. Cut butter into small pieces and add to processor along with sugar, salt, soda. Pulse until mixture resembles coarse meal. Sprinkle with ice water, 1 tsp at a time, pulsing until dough forms ball. Divide into 2 parts. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour or freeze for up to 1 month. Roll out to 1/4" thickness on floured surface. Cut into rounds with 2-1/2" cookie cutter and place on ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 350 for 12-14 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from pans to cool on wire rack. Fill with cream cheese or jelly filling. Makes 40-48 cookies depending on the size of your cutters.
Boil the potatoes in water until tender. Drain and place in a large bowl. Add the milk and whisk in the cream cheese until smooth. Add the sauerkraut and onion. Stir in the kielbasa. Season to taste.

Combine orange juice, broth and honey in a large skillet. Bring to a boil over high heat and cook 3 minutes or until thickened. Stir in cornstarch and return to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and cook for 3 more minutes. Stir in oil and butter and cook for 1 minute more or until sauce is slightly thickened and shiny. Add carrots and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes or until crisp-tender, tossing occasionally. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Cut russet baking potatoes into even-sized pieces and place in a medium bowl. Add warm water and let stand until potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes. Drain and pat dry with paper towels. In a medium bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, oregano and kosher salt until well blended. Toss potatoes with oil mixture until evenly coated and spread on baking sheets in an even layer. Bake until potatoes are golden brown and crisp, about 30 minutes. Serve immediately. Makes about 12 servings.

Prepare and cool 1 box vanilla instant pudding. Mix 1 box chocolate instant pudding and milk. Refrigerate. Combine 1 box white chocolate instant pudding with 1 can cool whip. In a trifle dish, layer chocolate pudding with angel food cake. Top with cool whip and dark chocolate chips. Spread with cream cheese and top with dried cherries. Garnish with more chocolate chips and cherries. Cover and chill.

Heat olive oil in skillet. Add onion and garlic. Saute over low heat until tender. Add the remaining ingredients. Heat through. Warm tortillas and make burritos with the cheese. Good with salsa and sour cream.

Saute the onions and garlic in the olive oil until soft and lightly brown. Add the tomatoes and bring the mixture to a boil. Cook about 20 minutes. Add the other seasonings and cook another 15-20 minutes. Cool. Place in a freezer container and freeze. Thaw and reheat to use with pasta or as a pizza topping.

Boil red potatoes in water until soft. Cool them slightly. Cut them lengthwise in quarters. In a bowl combine the other ingredients. Add the potatoes. Toss until evenly coated. Put in single layer on baking sheet and bake at 400f for one hour stirring every 15 minutes to prevent burning.
Melt butter. Stir in hot pepper sauce. Add garlic powder. Stir in worcestershire. Cool. Makes 1 cup.

In a small bowl stir together mayonnaise, oregano, garlic powder until blended. Spread mayonnaise mixture on one side of each tortilla. Spread on turkey breast, cucumber, pepper. Roll up each tortilla tightlyslice in half.

Halve the eggs lengthwise and remove the yolks to a small mixing bowl. Mash the yolks with the cream cheese and salad dressing until smooth. Add the relish, hot sauce, and seasonings to taste and stir until combined well. Spoon the mixture back into the egg halves and garnish with a little more cajun seasoning and fresh ground pepper.

In a large skillet, brown ground beef with onion and garlic. Drain fat. Stir in bacon, salsa and chili powder. Simmer for 1 minute. Spoon mixture evenly over the top of 2 biscuits. Top each biscuit with a slice of cheese. Place foil over biscuits and bake for 10-15 minutes or until biscuits are golden brown and cheese is melted.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 2 loaf pansset aside. Cream butter and sugar in a large mixing bowl until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time. Combine 1/4 cup water, 2 tablespoons buttermilk, 2 tablespoons butter, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 1 teaspoon lemon juice and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Sift into the egg mixture, alternating with the flour. Beat well. Mash bananas with a fork to break them up. Add them to the batter with the baking soda. Pour into prepared pansbake for 1 hour.

Heat the olive oil in a wok or fry pan and add the garlic and onions. Stir fry over a medium heat for 3-4 minutes. Add the diced tomatoes and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add the white wine and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add the prawns and scallops and cook for 2-3 minutes until the prawns are pink and cooked through and the scallops are firm. Garnish with spring onions and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cut squash into 2-inch pieces and place them in a shallow roasting pan. Add 1/2 cup of water to pan and cover tightly with foil. Roast for 30-45 minutes until tender. Combine olive oil with rosemary and cook for 1 minute in a small sauce pan over medium heat. Add onion and saute for 2-3 minutes. Stir in garlic and cook another minute. Add the water from roasting pan to the sauce pan and mix until sauce is smooth. Remove squash from pan and place in a bowl. Pour sauce over squash and toss with parmesan cheese and seasonings (nutmeg and salt).

Combine first five ingredients in large bowl. Beat with electric mixer until smooth. Stir in flour, soda, and salt. Divide dough into four parts. Shape into balls, then flatten into disks. Wrap in wax paper. Refrigerate for 4 hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Roll each disk into a circle about 8 inches in diameter. Place about 60 miniature peanut butter cups on each circle. Fold edges up over cups. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 15 minutes or until edges are golden brown. Cool completely on wire rack before cutting into wedges.

Cook the orzo according to package directions. Cut the zucchini into small cubes. Cook in a saucepan over medium heat until tender crisp. Drain the tomatoes and cut them into small pieces. Cook the zucchini in a saucepan over medium heat until tender crisp. Drain the tomatoes and cut them into small pieces. Saute the garlic in the olive oil until golden. Stir the vegetables into the garlic mixture. Add the cooked orzo. Season with salt and pepper. Makes 6 servings.

Drain the apples and reserve the liquid. Cut the vegetables into small bite-sized pieces and mix together with the celery seeds and the liquid. In a separate bowl mix the sour cream, mayonaise and seasonings. Add the dressing to the vegetables and mix well. Refrigerate and serve chilled.

Cook the sausages in a frypan with a little olive oil. When brown add the onions and the garlic. Add the stock and the wine. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Add the kale and the beans. Simmer for 10 minutes. Serve with crusty bread.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees f. Place dough on a pizza pan. With your fingers or a rolling pin, press the dough into a 12-inch circle. Bake for 8 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with radicchio leaves. Spread the blue cheese on the pizza. Scatter the mozzarella on top. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with rosemary. Bake for 2 minutes. Remove from oven. Top with the sausage. Sprinkle with figs. Bake for 5 minutes. Remove from oven. Slice and serve.
In a mixing bowl, whisk the olive oil into the mustard until slightly thickened. Add the lemon juice, salt and pepper and mix well. Add the vegetables. Toss to coat all the vegetables. Top with cheese to serve.
Cube cheese. Add to milk and stir until melted. In blender jar add jalapenos and juice. Blend till minced. Add to melted cheese. Add garlic and salt. Serve with

In a small bowl, mix together all dry ingredients. Store mixture in an airtight container.
1/2 cup (1 stick) butter 3/4 cup chopped celery 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder 1/2 teaspoon dill weed 1/4 teaspoon onion powder 1/2 teaspoon red pepper 1/4 teaspoon ground mustard 1/2 teaspoon ground sage 1/2 teaspoon ground thyme 1/2 teaspoon ground rosemary 1/4 teaspoon ground allspice 1/8 teaspoon ground cloves 1/8 teaspoon ground ginger 1/2 teaspoon cayenne 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper 3/4 cup chopped carrots 1 1/2 cups long grain white rice 1 1/2 cups water 1 tablespoon chopped parsley Salt to taste Directions In a medium bowl, mix together rice, cumin, garlic powder

In a saucepan combine all ingredients except bacon and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer and let cook for about 10 minutes or until sugar is dissolved. Add lettuce in a large bowl and toss. Add cooked bacon and toss. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 300 degrees. In a large bowl, combine oats and pecans. In a small saucepan, combine oil and honey. Heat until boiling and then pour over oat mixture and stir well to combine. Add cinnamon and vanilla and stir to combine well. Spread on a baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes. Stir well and bake another 30 minutes until golden brown. Remove from oven and add dried mixed fruit and stir to combine well. Store in airtight container or ziploc bags.

In a saucepan, combine all ingredients except cornstarch and pineapple juice. Cook and stir cornstarch and water until thick and bubbly. Add this mixture to pineapple juice. Serve over ice cream or with cake and fruit.
Pina Colada Recipes Recipe Categories
Pineapple Juice (21 recipes)
Pineapple Cream (5 recipes)
Pineapple Cream (5 recipes) Pineapple Juice (21 recipes)
Recipes > Juice > Pineapple Juice > Pina Colada Recipes

Sauté onion and garlic in olive oil. Add eggplant and continue to sauté until tender. Add wine and cook until wine is absorbed. Add diced tomatoes and continue to cook until thick. Add parsley and parmesan cheese and heat through. Serve over pasta and sprinkle with fresh ground pepper.

In a medium skillet over medium-high heat, heat the oil. Add the garlic, stirring to cook for 1 minute. Add the tomatoes. Stir to cook for 3 to 4 minutes or until skins begin to split. Add the pine nuts. Stir to cook for 1 minute. Remove from the heat. Stir in the red wine vinegar. Season with the balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Peel and core the pears and cut into 1/2 inch slices. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the brown sugar and cook, stirring constantly, until sugar is bubbling and caramelized around edges of pan, about 10 minutes. Stir in the cream cheese and cook until it is smooth, about 2 minutes. Stir in the honey and cook until it is smooth and blended with the cream cheese mixture, about 2 minutes. Stir in the lemon juice and vanilla and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat and simmer until mixture thickens slightly and coats a spoon, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the water and cinnamon. Gently stir in the pecans. Pour into a 13 x 9 inch baking dish and bake until hot and bubbly. Serve with sliced pears on the side.

Combine all ingredients in a heavy saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring often, until thick and bubbly. Cool and refrigerate. Store in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks. Makes about 2 1/2 cups.

Saute garlic and crushed red pepper flakes in oil until fragrant. Add fusilli and toss until lightly coated. Add broth. Bring to a boil. Add broccoli. Simmer 3 minutes or until pasta is tender. Sprinkle with cheese.
Mushrooms, Broccoli, and Onion Tortellini.
 mushrooms, broccoli, and onion tortellinipreparation:Cook pasta according to package directions. Add 1/4 c. of the mushrooms during the last 2 minutes of cooking time. Meanwhile, cook onion and remaining mushrooms in butter until tender. In a small bowl, combine the soup and sour cream. Drain pasta. Add the mushroom mixture, soup mixture, and broccoli. Toss to coat. Place 1/3 c. pasta mixture in each tortellini cup. Top with Parmesan cheese.

Place flour and seasonings in a plastic bagshake to mix well. Place milk in a shallow bowl. Eggs in a second shallow bowl. Dip each slice of pickle into the flour and then into the milk and finally into the eggs. Place the coated pickle slices into a skillet containing hot oil and fry until brown and crisp. Sprinkle lightly with cayenne pepper. Serves 4.

Whisk together lime juice, oil, salt and pepperadd corn and jalapeno, toss and set aside. Combine feta and walnuts, and toss lightly to combineadd to corn mixture and toss gently to combine. Chill until serving timeserve topped with cilantro leaves.

In a large bowl beat together the eggs, flour, baking powder, salt. Stir in the curd cottage cheese, then the shredded cheese. Mix well. Melt the butter in a large skillet. Add the mixture. Cook for 5 minutes over low heat, stirring constantly. Pour into a 13x9-inch pan. Bake at 350-degrees F for 30 minutes. Cut into squares. Serve warm.
Blend the flours with water in the food processor until smooth. Heat oil in skillet. Pour mixture into hot oil. Fry until golden brown. Serve with any dish.

In a saucepan over medium heat combine apple cider, tangerine juice, pomegranate juice and spices. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 3 minutes. Remove from heat and add tangerine. Serve immediately in mugs. Garnish with tangerine if desired.

Combine applesauce, splenda, pudding mix and egg. Beat until smooth and creamy. Combine with remaining ingredients until well blended. Drop by tablespoons onto greased cookie sheets. Bake at 350f for 10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned.

In a bowl combine mayo, cheeses, bread crumbs, garlic, lemon juice and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Stir until well blended. Clean the stem end of each tomato. Stuff with the mixture, mounding it on one side of each tomato. Place on aluminum foil. Drizzle with olive oil, sprinkle with the remaining salt and pepper, and wrap the foil around the tomatoes. Grill the tomatoes over a low flame until soft and the cheese is melted, about 15 minutes. Serve with basil sprigs or crumbled basil.
In a small saucepan, melt butter. Stir in rosemary and tarragon. Add salt and pepper to taste. Stir in lemon juice. Makes 1 cup. Keep refrigerated for up to 2 weeks.

Combine sweetened condensed milk and chocolate syrup in a small saucepan. Stir well and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer and cook for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in whipping cream. Cover and refrigerate for 4 hours or until thickened. Add the marshmallows and chocolate chips. Stir until the mixture is smooth and marshmallow have completely melted. Stir in the peanuts. Freeze. Serve.
Hard boil the egg, then chop them in half. Slice the dates and place on a plate with the egg halves. Add in honey to taste, then drizzle over the egg halves and sprinkle with cinnamon.

Heat a medium pot over medium heat. Add olive oil. Saute celery and onion for 5-6 minutes. Add garlic and cook for 2 minutes more. Add asparagus, chicken broth and wine. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 15 minutes. Puree soup until smooth. Add whipping cream and season to taste. Add lemon zest and lemon juice. Serve immediately.

Sauté the ground pork with scallions and bamboo shoots. Add the sherry and continue to sauté. Add the soy and sugar. Continue to stir until the sugar is completely dissolved and the mixture has thickened. Remove from heat and let cool. In a separate bowl whisk the egg white and cornstarch together. Add the egg mixture to the cooled meat mixture. Stir gently to combine. Fill wonton wrappers with the mixture. Tie the wonton with string and boil in water until tender. In a separate bowl stir together the hoisin sauce and soy until smooth. Serve the wontons with the sauce.

Clean and trim the asparagus. Combine all the remaining ingredients together and set aside. Cook the asparagus according to your preferred method. When it is done, place it on a serving plate and pour the dressing over it. Serve at once.
Soak vermicelli for 15 minutes then drain well. Melt butter in a large skillet over low heat and add vermicelli and basmati rice. Cook for 10 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Add salt to taste.

Combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix until well mixed. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
Happy new year to you too! Hope you had a great time with your family.
Hey! I love your blog! It's so cute. I'm following!
Hope you have a great 2010 filled with lots of love and laughter.
Your blog is so sweet.
You can stop by my blog if you like.
That's a lot of recipes. I am going to have to try some of those!
Happy 2010! I just posted some recipes that you may like!
I want to try your Oreo recipe! Happy New Year!!

In large bowl, beat egg whites with baking powder until stiff peaks form. Gradually beat in sugar and soda crackers. Drop by tablespoons onto greased cookie sheets. Bake at 200 degrees for 30 minutes or until lightly browned. Spread with sweetened whipped cream. Arrange strawberries in center. Sprinkle with pecans. Serve immediately.

Combine flour and salt in a food processor or stand mixer. Add the unsalted butter and pulse or process for 15 seconds or so, until mixture resembles coarse meal. Slowly add ice water through the feed tube in 1 tablespoon increments, stopping before mixture comes together into a ball. Turn dough out onto a clean surfacepat into a ball. Wrap tightly in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or up to 2 days. Unwrap, roll out on a floured surface to desired thickness, and proceed with recipe.

Combine the milk and water in a medium saucepan. Heat to boiling over medium heat and remove from heat. Stir in the butter until melted and combined. Add the sugar and beat with a mixer at medium speed until fluffy. Add the dry milk and beat until smooth. Stir in the cocoa and beat until blended. Fold in the nuts. Pour into a lightly greased 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Chill until firm. Cut into squares.

Chop the cucumbers and mangoes and combine with the cooked shrimp and the diced fresh dill. In a separate bowl combine the vinegar, stevia, and mustard. Mix well and then pour over the mixture of the cucumbers and mangoes with the cooked shrimp. Mix thoroughly and then refrigerate until ready to serve. To serve, add a teaspoon of hot sauce to each serving and serve over a bed of romaine lettuce leaves.
You can also use grated carrot instead of the cucumbers.
I am not sure what you mean by "can also use grated carrot". Are you saying you can use both?

Mix the dry ingredients together in a large bowl. Combine the beaten eggs with the milk and melted butter in a small bowl and stir into the dry ingredients until just moistened. Stir in the canned pumpkin until well blended. Spray the waffle iron with nonstick cooking spray. Pour the batter into the iron and cook according to the manufacturer's directions until the waffle is brown and crisp. Serve immediately or keep warm in a low oven. Serves 2.
name: john f kennedy waffles
ingredients: butter, sugar, egg yolks, egg whites, buttermilk, salt, cake flour, baking powder
preparation:Cream butterand sugar add yolks. Add sifted dry ingredients. Add milk. Fold in whites. Pam iron.
name: cinnamon apple waffles
ingredients: flour, salt, cinnamon, baking powder, sugar, eggs, milk, butter, apple
preparation:Sift flour, salt

Place the rhubarb in a medium sized saucepan and combine with the water and the sugar. Cook over medium heat until the rhubarb is tender. Add the strawberries and stir in the mint. Serve over pancakes or waffles.

Mix sour cream and honey together in a large bowl. Beat in eggs until smooth. Combine the dry ingredients in a separate bowl. Sift into honey mixture and mix well. Cover and let stand 15 minutes. Stir in pecans. Drop by teaspoonful onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire racks. Makes about 1 1/2 dozen 3-inch cookies.

Combine green chili, jalapeno, monterey jack cheese, wonton wrapper and avocados. Mix well. Divide the mixture into 12 equal balls. Lightly coat each ball with seasoning salt. In a medium bowl stir together the green onions. Lime or lemon juice. Mayonnaise. Ground coriander. And seasoning salt. Spoon the mixture evenly into each wonton. Arrange wontons on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes until wontons are golden brown. Serve with sour cream. Garnish with green onions.

Cook potatoes according to package directions or boil them in salted water until they are soft. Mash them while they are still warm. Add the cream cheese, sour cream, garlic, salt and pepper to taste. Mix well and add more garlic if desired. Add more sour cream if the mixture is too dry or more milk if it is too thick. The amount of sour cream or cream cheese depends on how much you like this kind of mashed potato. If you like them really creamy use more sour cream or cream cheese. If you prefer them less creamy use less sour cream or cream cheese. Use 2 or 3 cloves of garlic or use garlic powder instead of fresh garlic. Serve them warm with your favorite dish.

Combine all of the above ingredients in a small bowl and mix well. Brush over the chicken. Grill the chicken over a medium heat for 10 minutes each side or until cooked through. Serve with salad and rice.

Preheat oven to 375f. Lightly spray 10-inch oven proof skillet with olive oil. Whisk together egg substitute, skim milk, lemon zest, kosher salt& pepper. Heat skillet over medium-high heat. Cook asparagus until bright green about 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in canadian bacon. Cook until heated through about 2 minutes. Stir in cheese. Add egg mixture. Cook until almost set. Transfer skillet to oven. Continue to cook until set about 10 minutes. Cut into wedges to serve.
Frittata is an omelette-like egg-based dish from Italy. It is prepared by beating eggs with other ingredients and cooking them in a skillet.
The word "frittata" comes from the Italian verb friggere, meaning "to fry".

Heat the oil in a large heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat. Add the carrots and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add the onions and stir-fry until golden brown, about 6 minutes more. Remove from the heat and set aside. Preheat the oven to 375F degrees. Cook the rice according to the package instructions. In the same heavy-bottomed pot, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the curry paste and stir-fry until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in the tomatoes and cook until the mixture thickens slightly, 2 to 3 minutes more. Stir in the chicken stock and bring to a boil. Stir in the rice, carrots, and onions. Reduce the heat to low and add the turkey and cilantro. Cover the pot and transfer it to the oven. Bake for 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. In a large bowl combine first six ingredients. Beat well. Stir in egg and milk to make a smooth batter. Stir in red pepper and chives. Turn out onto a lightly floured surfaceknead a few times to make a soft dough. Roll or pat into 1/2 inch thick rounds. Place 1 inch apart on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot with butter or ketchup if desired. Makes 48 to 60 hush puppies.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f (190 degrees c). Cut up white bread into cubesset aside. In a large skillet, combine ground sirloin, mushrooms, pepperoni, oregano, garlic powder, salt, and eggs over medium-low heat until meat is brownedremove from heat. In a medium bowl, combine cubed bread, meat mixture, and enough milk to moistenmix well. Pour into a 9x13-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake at 375 degrees f (190 degrees c) for 45 minutes, until cooked through. Top with ketchup before serving.

Cream butter& sugar together& beat in egg& flour until dough forms. Roll into 12 balls& place in greased mini-muffin pan& flatten slightly with bottom of glass dipped in water. Bake at 375 degrees f for 10 minutes or until puffed up& cooked through.

Season pork chops with salt and pepper to taste. Brown both sides in 1 tablespoon butter or cooking spray. Place stuffing mix in a bowl, add soup and milk and stir to combine. Cover chops with stuffing mixture and place into a casserole dish. Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until juices run clear. Serve with green beans or vegetable of your choice.

Mix pancake mix, garlic powder and cayenne pepper together and add milk to form pancake batter. Grease muffin pans and pour batter into cups 3/4 full. Bake at 400 degrees F for about 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. In the meantime mix together 2 Tablespoons of mayonnaise and 2 Tablespoons of milk together. When the pancakes are done, pour the milk and mayo mixture over the top of each pancake and sprinkle shredded cheddar cheese on top of that. Bake at 350 degrees F for 2 to 3 minutes or until melted and bubbly. Let stand 1 minute. Serve warm.

Cook shrimp in butter and oil until pink and opaque. Remove shrimp from pan and set aside. In the same pan add zucchini and cook until tender-crisp, about 5 minutes. Add chicken broth and simmer until liquid is reduced by half. Add shrimp and heat through. Season with salt and pepper and red pepper flakes if desired. Add parsley and toss gently to combine. Serve with pasta.

In large bowl combine butter, granulated sugar, light brown sugar and vanilla until creamy. Beat in egg and flour. Shape into 1 inch balls and roll in nuts or bark. Place on ungreased baking sheet and bake 15 to 20 minutes at 350 degrees Fahrenheit until lightly browned on bottom. Remove from oven and cool 2 minutes on baking sheet before removing to wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat oven to broil. Brush chicken with olive oil and season with seasoning and pepper. Grill on medium high heat for 3 minutes each side. Place on broiler pan under broiler for 5 minutes per side. Baste with the oil and seasonings every 3 minutes until done to your liking. Serve with a side of biscuits.

Mix together first six ingredients until well blended. Place beef in a plastic bag or shallow glass container. Pour marinade over meat. Seal bag or cover container. Refrigerate 3-6 hours. Grill over medium heat. Baste meat frequently with marinade. Cook 10-12 minutes per side or until meat reaches desired doneness. Cut across the grain to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine first 3 ingredients in a large saucepan. Bring to boil. Remove from heat. Stir in black beans. Cool. Pour into greased 2 quart baking dish. Combine remaining ingredients in a medium bowl. Stir until blended. Top beans with dressing. Bake 15 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve with lettuce and tacos if desired.

Soak beans overnight. Add smoked hocks, cover with water, and simmer 6 hours. Drain the hocks from the liquid. Add vegetables, sugar, seasonings, and hocks. Cook 2 hours longer. Serve with hocks.
 chicken tortilla soupingredients: chicken stock, black beans, corn, red bell peppers, cilantro, lime juice, chicken breast, garlic, black pepper, sea saltpreparation:Bring the chicken stock to a boil. Add the black beans, corn and red bell peppers. Cook for about 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Remove the cilantro leaves from the stems. Puree the mixture until smooth. Taste for seasoning. Add the chicken breast. Puree again. Heat the soup through. Add the cilantro leaves and serve with lime wedges.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add halibut fillets. Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon of ginger garlic powder. Cook 1 to 2 minutes. Turn halibut over. Cook until fish is opaque. Add wine. Boil to reduce. Add remaining ginger garlic powder. Add green onions. Cook 1 minute. Add chicken broth. Cook 1 to 2 minutes or until liquid is almost evaporated. Add sugar substitute. Toss to coat. Serve immediately.
Preheat oven to 325f. Rub butter over chicken pieces. Place in shallow baking dish. Combine remaining ingredients, pour over chicken. Cover tightly with aluminum foil. Bake 1 hour.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Saute bacon in large skillet. Remove bacon from skillet. Add butter, onions and cook until clear. Remove from heat. In a large bowl combine all remaining ingredients. Add the bacon and sauted onions. Pour into 1 quart casserole dish. Bake for 1 hour 15 minutes. Stir halfway through. Serve hot.

In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugars. Add eggs and beat well. Beat in flour and baking soda. Stir in oats. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto greased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 for 10-12 minutes. Cool on wire racks. In a small saucepan combine white chocolate chips and dried apricot. Heat over low heat until melted. Drizzle over cookies. Cool before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix the cake mix with the egg and add the oil. Mix well and pour into an ungreased bundt pan or loaf pan and bake for 25 minutes or until done. Cool completely. Dissolve the Jello in the boiling water and add the cold water and stir until dissolved. Pour over the top of the cooled cake and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight until set. Mix the Cool Whip with the raspberry preserves and spread on top of the cooled Jello and refrigerate for at least one hour before serving.
i have made this recipe with canned mandarin oranges and i think it is very good. i hope you enjoy it as much as i do.
i have made this recipe with canned mandarin oranges and i think it is very good. i hope you enjoy it as much as i do.

Grate the bread finely with a hand grater or in a food processor. Beat the eggs in a bowl, add the milk, the breadcrumbs, the sugar, the cinnamon and the almonds. The mixture should be rather liquid. Heat butter in a frying pan and pour in a tbsp of batter for each pancake. Fry on both sides for about 3 minutes each side. Serve with cherries or jam, or with honey and a dollop of sour cream.

In a large bowl, combine the toasted oat cereal, corn Chex, and the salted peanuts. Set aside. In a microwave-safe bowl, heat the chips and oil on medium-high for about two minutes, stirring once. Microwave on high for about ten seconds. Stir until smooth. Pour over the cereal mixture and mix well. Spread onto wax paper-lined baking sheets. Cool. Break apart. Store in an airtight container.

Heat the olive oil in a small nonstick skillet. In a large bowl, beat the eggs and milk. Add the salt and cumin and beat again. Add the salsa and stir. Spoon 1/4 cup of the egg mixture into each of the 4 skillets. Cook over medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes, or until the bottom of each frittata is lightly browned and the eggs are just set. Sprinkle the cheese over each frittata and cook for 1 minute more, or until the cheese is melted.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl combine the flour, baking powder and salt. In a large bowl beat the brown sugar and butter until creamy. Beat in the egg whites. Add the dry ingredients alternately with water. Stir in the chips. Spread into a greased 13x9-inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes or until done. Cool on wire rack. Makes 24 servings.
Boil potato until tender. Mash with margarine and honey. In separate saucepan saute onions until soft. Add potato mixture. Heat thoroughly. Add curry and green peas. Cook until heated through.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Beat butter in an electric mixer until creamy. Add sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg and cloves. Beat until smooth. Add cream and beat until just combined. Roll the dough out to 1/8-inch thickness on parchment-lined baking sheet. Use a 2 1/2 inch round cookie cutter to cut out dough circles. Place circles on baking sheet, leaving 1/2 inch between them. Bake for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oven and allow to cool completely. Remove rings from parchment paper. Cut each ring in half. Place one apple half on each ring, cut side down. Roll up dough around the apple halves, pinching the dough together to seal the edges. Repeat for remaining rings. Roll the rings in sugar until coated on all sides. Place back on baking sheet and bake for an additional 10 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool completely. Store in an airtight container for up to 2 days.
Mix dry ingredients and beat eggs. Add liquid mixture to dry and stir well. Heat griddle. Add butter and spoon on pancake mixture. Flip when bubbles appear. Sprinkle with sugar. Serve hot.

Place tomatoes in a bowl. In a small bowl combine the garlic, olive oil, herbs and seasonings. Add to the tomatoes. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Serve at room temperature.
I have no idea why you would have a problem with this. I just cut and paste it from their site and then re-wrote it all in a format I was more comfortable with.
What is a problem with this?
It's fine but I don't see any reason for you to have put the copyright notice at the bottom. I just think it's better to post it with a link to their site.
I just did a quick look through their site and there are a number of recipes that I'll try myself. I'll also try a few of their recommendations for restaurants that I can visit next time I'm in Dubai.
I've noticed that a lot of Middle Eastern cookbooks I've seen in bookstores don't have as much about vegan cooking as I would like to see in a book devoted to that area's cuisine. I'd love to see some Middle Eastern vegan
In large bowl mix together all except feta cheese. Add to mixture. Toss with feta cheese. Serve on bed of fresh greens.

Cook burgers to your liking. Drain off excess fat. Add bean sprouts to burgers. Pour in soy sauce. Cook until done. Serve as is or topped with lettuce and tomato.
name: easy hamburger stewingredients: lean ground beef, garlic, onion, potatoes, carrots, kernel corn, cream of mushroom soup, water, salt and pepper, worcestershire saucepreparation:Saute ground beef, garlic and onion. Add potatoes, carrots and corn. Stir in soup, water and seasonings. Cover and simmer until veggies are tender. Serve over steamed white rice.
name: dressed up burger pattiesingredients: ground beef, dry breadcrumbs, salt, pepper, egg, onion, beef broth, fresh mushrooms, water, cornstarchpreparation:Mix first 5 ingredients. Shape into patties. Cook and brown patties, add onion, broth and mushrooms. Cover and simmer 10 minutes. He

Combine olives, garlic, rosemary, thyme and red pepper flakes in a bowl. Toss to coat. Spread evenly in a single layer in a glass baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil. Cover tightly. Bake in a preheated 350 degree F. oven for 45 to 55 minutes or until the olives are tender.
 olives with garlic herbs and chilesingredients: green olives, extra virgin olive oil, balsamic vinegar, garlic cloves, basil, orange zest, lemon zest, crushed red pepper flakespreparation:Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Stir well. Marinate for at least 12 hours or up to 3 days in refrigerator. Drain thoroughly. Serve at room temperature.

In a shallow bowl or pan combine the lime juice, honey and cilantro. Add the chicken breasts. Turn to coat all over and marinate at least 1 hour. Preheat the grill. Remove the chicken from the marinade. Discard the marinade. Cook the chicken until it is no longer pink and the juices run clear. Serve hot. Serve over rice. Garnish with more cilantro.
Saute onion in oil till lightly browned. Blend in flour, salt and pepper, nutmeg. Add meat, water and tomatoes. Stir well. Cook till mixture thickens. Serve over toast.

Place a slice of canadian bacon and a slice of cheese on a english muffin. Break an egg into a cup and pour over the bacon and cheese. Add a sprinkling of salt and pepper. Bake at 350 until the egg is cooked through. Spread onions on the english muffin. Drizzle with grainy mustard and serve.

Prepare your favorite crust recipe. Place in a 9 x 13 pan. Layer on top with chicken, mixed vegetables, and condensed soup. Top with a second crust. Bake at 450 for 35 to 40 minutes, or until golden brown. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 350. Spray 10 inch tube or bundt pan with non stick spray. Blend 1/2 cup sugar, nonfat sour cream and egg substitute. Set aside 2 tablespoons of mixture. Blend remaining mixture with cake mix. Stir in applesauce and almonds. Pour into pan. Bake. Sprinkle reserved mixture over top. Bake 1 hour or until toothpick comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes. Drizzle with icing. Mint sprig optional.

In a large mixing bowl, combine the dry ingredients and mix well. Add the eggs and the buttermilk and blend well. Add the bacon drippings and the cracklings and blend again. Pour into a greased 11x7x2 inch pan and bake for 45 minutes at 375 degrees F.

Place pretzel twists in one shallow baking pan. Toast in oven until lightly browned, stirring once. In another shallow baking pan, spread Chex cereal. In a small bowl combine brown sugar, cardamom, honey and water. Microwave on high for 2 to 3 minutes or until hot, stirring once. Stir until smooth. Pour over pretzel twiststoss until well coated. Spread Chex over pretzel twiststoss to coat with cardamom glaze. Spread coconut over Chextoss to coat well. Sprinkle with cranberriestoss to coat well. Cool completely on waxed paper. Store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease and flour a 9 x 13-inch baking pan. Mix the dry ingredients. Stir in the pineapple and egg. Add the butter and mix well. Spread into baking pan. Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes. Drizzle with cream and sprinkle with nuts.

Heat oven to 350F. Place 2 cups cracker crumbs in a small bowl. Dot with 3 tbsp butter. Bake 5 minutes. Sprinkle on poppy seeds. Heat remaining 2 cups crumbs in a skillet over medium heat. Add 2 tbsp butter. Stir constantly until golden. Stir in poppy-seed mixture. Place chicken in a 2-quart casserole. Add 1 cup soup and 1 cup milk. Pour cracker mixture over the top. Bake for 30 minutes. Serves 4.

Bring water to boil in tea kettle. In a large tea pot place tea bags, mint sprigs, and lemonspour boiling water over all. Cover and let steep for 5 minutes. Strain tea through mesh strainer into large pitcher. Into pitcher pour pineapple juice, lemon juice, and mint sprigs. Serve over ice in tall glasses, garnished with mint sprigs if desired.

In a large bowl, combine the olive oil, garlic, and salt. Add the onion and bell pepper and toss to coat. Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, for about 8 minutes, or until the vegetables are lightly browned and softened. Add the butter and continue to cook for about 2 minutes. Remove the vegetables from the heat and stir in the corn. Cover and chill at least 3 hours before serving. Just before serving, stir in the basil and toss well to combine. Serve chilled.

Wash and place in large pot with water. Cook on low for 1 hour. Drain and set aside. Slice ham into strips. In frying pan saute onions and garlic. Add serrano ham. Add broad beans and stir. Add olive oil. Season with salt. Serve.

Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper. Place chocolate chips into a double-boiler (or a bowl set over a pan of simmering water). Heat chocolate until smooth. Pour onto prepared cookie sheet. Sprinkle with nuts and dried berries. Refrigerate until set. Break into pieces. Store in an airtight container. Makes 4 1/2 pounds.
This is a great site for recipes. It is a real time saver for people who like to cook.

Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the peppers, onion and garlicsaute until the vegetables begin to soften, about 5 minutes. Add the chicken breastsaute until it is no longer pink in the center, about 5 minutes. Add the basil. Stir to combine. Remove the mixture from the heat. Drizzle with the vinegar and toss to coat. Serve.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine the sugar and 3 cups of water. Stir until the sugar dissolves. Remove from the heat and add the remaining 4 cups of water. Stir and let cool to room temperature. Dissolve the gelatin in the cooled mixture. Stir in the almond extract. Pour into a large bowl and refrigerate until set, about 3 hours. In a blender or food processor, combine the pineapple and lemon juices and the Sprite. Puree until smooth. Pour into the set gelatin mixture. Refrigerate at least 2 hours until set. Garnish with the pineapples.

Wash beans. Cut off ends, cut into 3-inch pieces. Cook bacon in large skillet over medium heat until crisp. Transfer bacon to paper towel-lined plateset aside. Add onion to skillet and saute until golden brown. Add beanssaute until crisp-tender. Season with salt & pepper. Add buttertoss until melted & well coated. Top with crumbled bacon.

Combine pretzels and butter in a bowl. Microwave until butter is melted and pretzels are evenly coated (about 1 minute). Press pretzel mixture into a 9-inch pie plate and chill for 30 minutes. Combine strawberries, limeade concentrate and tequila in a blender or food processor and puree until smooth. Add orange juice and vanilla. Pour mixture into cooled crust and freeze for 30 minutes. Remove from freezer 30 minutes before serving. Beat ice cream and pretzels together. Top pie with ice cream mixture and serve.
Combine all in a slow cooker and cook over low for 6-8 hours.

In a large skillet brown ground beef. Add the onion and saute until tender. Drain off fat. Add stuffing mix and stir well. Add the condensed soups and water. Simmer until hot. Stir in vegetables and mushrooms. Spread in a greased 9x13 inch pan. Bake uncovered at 375 degrees for 1 hour. Serve hot.

Preheat outdoor grill for high heat. Lightly oil crust. Toss tomatoes with olive oil and arrange on crust. Season tomatoes with salt and pepper. Distribute escarole evenly over tomatoes. Scatter mozzarella on top. Top with olives and drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Place on preheated grill and cook until crust is browned and cheese has melted, about 4 minutes per side. Remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes. Serve with parmesan cheese.

Heat the oil over medium heat. Add onion. Cook 5 minutes. Stir in garlic until fragrant. Add broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer 15 minutes. Add beans and tomatoes. Bring to a boil. Add macaroni. Simmer until pasta is tender. Add oregano. Stir in spinach. Serve immediately.

Cook the pasta according to the package directions. While the pasta is cooking, combine the oil and garlic in a small bowl. Heat the oil in a large saut pan over medium heat. When oil is hot, add the garlic and saut until fragrant and golden brown. Add the fresh basil and cook until wilted. Add the avocados and cook for 1 minute. Add the cooked pasta and toss to coat. Add the tomatoes and toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Sift oatmeal, flour, baking powder, salt & set aside. In another bowl beat eggs & milk. Add honey & oil. Combine dry & wet. Add ½ cup of pomegranate. Heat pan. Cook 1 spoonful per pancake. Top with yogurt & honey. Garnish with pomegranate. Serve with lemon wedges.

Remove husks from corn on the cob and set aside. In a small saucepan combine butter and oil over medium heat until melted. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a small bowl combine breadcrumbs and parsley. In a medium bowl beat egg whites until foamy. Dip each ear of corn into egg whites, letting excess drip off. Coat with breadcrumb mixture, pressing to adhere. Place in an 8 x 8 inch baking dish sprayed with cooking spray. Bake until golden brown, 30 to 35 minutes. Remove from oven. Drizzle with garlic oil and serve immediately.

In an 8-inch square pan combine the 2nd to the top layer of the ingredients. Freeze for 2 hours or overnight. In a blender, combine the remaining 3 ingredients with the frozen layer to make the fizz. Serve in margarita or wine glasses with maraschino cherries as garnish.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 2 quart baking dish. Layer the hard boiled eggs in the bottom of the baking dish. Melt 1 1/2 cups of margarine in a small saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in the flour until smooth. Slowly add the half and half, whisking constantly until thickened. Add the seasonings, stirring constantly until well blended. Pour the mixture over the eggs in the baking dish. Sprinkle the cheeses evenly over the top. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the mixture is bubbly and the cheese is golden brown. Serve hot.
Mix all ingredients together in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil and boil for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Store in an air-tight container in the refrigerator.

Boil the potatoes until they can be mashed. Mash them with a fork and add farina (or cornmeal). Mix well. Add flour, salt and egg to the mixture. Mix well. Make small balls out of the mixture and boil in a large pot until they rise to the surface. Take out the dumplings with a slotted spoon and serve hot.
name: easy special supper potatoes
ingredients: potatoes, water, sweet onion, garlic clove, butter, dill weed
preparation: Boil potatoes, onions and garlic, dash of salt, till potatoes are soft. Drain. Add butter and dill. Salt and pepper to taste. Stir. Serve.
name: rutmus
ingredients: potato, turnips, butter, cream, salt and pepper
preparation: Boil potatoes until tender. In second pot boil turnips until fork tender. Drain well. Combine all ingredients in mixer. Blend until smooth. Serve hot.
name: german potato kraut soup
ingredients: water

Place the water into a saucepan on high heat. Add ginger and bring to boil. Add tea leaves and boil for 3 minutes. Strain tea. Add the milk and sugar. Stir. Top with whipped cream and serve immediately.

Saute olive oil, shrimp and mushrooms until done. Add tomatoes, chili peppers and garlic. Heat through. Add heavy cream and parmesan cheese. Toss with hot linguine. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serves 2.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine water and fruit. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Cool slightly and add tapioca. Stir well and continue to cook until tapioca is translucent. Add orange juice and cinnamon. Stir. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours. Serve hot or cold.

Cream together margarine and sugar. Beat in egg and applesauce. Combine dry ingredients and add to creamed mixture. Stir in raisins and nutmeg. Drop by teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 10-12 minutes until lightly browned. Let cool on cookie sheet for 5 minutes. Remove to cooling grid and cool completely before icing. icing:Mix confectioner's sugar and milk until smooth. Spread on cooled cookies and let dry. Makes about 4 1/2 dozen large cookies.

Cook pasta according to package directions. While pasta is cooking, combine the cashews, garlic and 1 tablespoon of water in the microwave on high for 30 seconds to 1 minute. Let cool. In a bowl, combine the pasta, cashew mixture, soy sauce and rice wine vinegar. Add the sesame oil and red pepper flakes to taste. Toss to combine. Taste and add salt and pepper to taste. Add the water if you find the dressing too thick. Serve topped with the reserved cashews. Serve at room temperature.

In a Dutch oven cook the onions in olive oil until golden brown. Add the lemon juice, chicken stock, honey, soy sauce and lemon rind. Cover and simmer 15 min or until the onions are translucent. Remove from heat. Add the rice to the pot. Cover and cook over low heat for 20 minutes or until the rice is done. In a separate pan brown the chicken thighs in olive oil. Cook over medium heat until browned on all sides. Add the browned thighs to the pot with the rice. Continue to cook uncovered over low heat for 5 minutes or until the chicken is done. Serve immediately with lemon wedges.

Fill glass with ice cubes. Into glass add pineapple juice, vanilla vodka, baileys irish cream, butterscotch schnapps and grenadine. Stir lightly to mix and top with brown sugar. Garnish with pineapple chunk and maraschino cherry.
Combine all but pickling salt in a large saucepan and bring to a boil. Add pickling salt and boil 5 minutes. Pack in hot jars. Seal.

Drain and coarsely chop the celery and green onion. Mix with the mayonnaise and stuff the tomatoes. Chop the bacon and mix with the shrimp. Stuff the tomatoes with the bacon shrimp mixture and the chopped celery and onions. Sprinkle with parsley. Chill.

Mix all dry ingredients together in a large bowl. Beat together butter, eggs, orange juice and milk in a smaller bowl. Add the dry ingredients slowly to the wet mix. Chill for 1 hour. Shape into 1 inch balls on wax paper. Bake in preheated 375 F oven for 12-15 minutes or until edges are lightly brown.

Preheat the oven to 350 F (175 C). Mix together the first 5 ingredients. Stir in the brown sugar. Add the butter and honey and mix well. Form into 24 balls the size of a walnut. Roll the balls in the coconut and place on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown on the bottoms. Cool on wire racks. Recipe can be doubled.
Recipe number: 2154. Submitted by Patty on 04-Dec-2005.
Recipe number: 2154. Submitted by Patty on 04-Dec-2005. This recipe has been viewed 11795 times.

Cut tempeh into thin strips and place in a bowl with olive oil and tamari. Marinate at least 30 minutes or overnight. Mix together remaining ingredients in a separate bowl, toss together with tempeh strips. Serve over greens.
Boil zucchini in water until tender. Drain and cool. In a bowl combine zucchini with chopped tomatoes, bread cubes and parmesan cheese. Toss lightly. Season to taste. Serve warm.

Prepare shrimp by cutting off shell and deveining. Mix all ingredients in a bowl. Stuff each shrimp with the mixture. Place in a pan and cover with aluminum foil. Bake in a 375 degree oven for 25 minutes. Serve over rice.

In a large bowl stir together the first five ingredients. Using a pastry blender or two knives cut the cold butter into the flour mixture until the mixture looks like coarse meal. In a small bowl beat the egg with the buttermilk. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredientsgradually add the egg-buttermilk mixture stirring just until blended. Turn the dough onto a lightly floured board. Knead dough gently just until it forms a ball. Flatten the dough into a round about 1/2-inch thick. Using the palm of your hand press a shallow well in the center of the dough circle. Fill the well with the raisins. Gently pull the dough up around the raisins to form a ball. Place the loaf on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for about one hour or until the loaf is golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped on the bottom. Makes one loaf.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain. Fry bacon until crisp. Add potatoes, red onion, rosemary. Cook until tender. Beat eggs and water. Add to potatoes. Cook over medium heat until set. Sprinkle with cheese. Broil for 1 minute.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Toss potatoes with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Bake in oven for 15 to 20 minutes. Cut potatoes into wedges and sprinkle with malt vinegar. Serve immediately.

Cream butter and honey. Add beaten eggs. Sift together flour, baking powder, and salt. Add alternately with milk. Add nuts and fruit. Bake in buttered tube pan in moderate oven (350 degrees F.) until done. Ice when cool.

Combine all of the ingredients in a food processor or blender. Process until smooth, scraping down sides of bowl as needed. Transfer to a bowl and chill at least 1 hour before serving. Serve with warm pita chips or crudites. Makes about 2 cups.

Heat the oven to 450 F. Melt 2 tablespoons butter in an ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and saute until fragrant. Add the cayenne and 1/2 teaspoon each kosher salt and black pepper and stir. Add the chicken and saute until brown on both sides. Add the lime juice, orange juice and lemon juice. Add 2 tablespoons each of water and 1/2 teaspoon each kosher salt and black pepper. Stir and simmer for 1 minute. Add 1 tablespoon of parsley and transfer to the oven. Cook until done. Remove from oven and sprinkle with remaining parsley.

Cut pancetta into 1/2-inch pieces and place in a medium skillet over medium heat. Cook until pancetta is crisp and golden brown, 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from pan and set aside. Heat olive oil in the same skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until translucent, 2 to 3 minutes. Add garlic and crushed red pepper and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds longer. Add tomato puree and cook, stirring often, until puree thickens slightly, 4 to 5 minutes more. Add cooked pancetta back to the skillet and stir in pasta, tomato puree mixture and salt and pepper to taste. Cook until pasta is tender and sauce has thickened slightly, 3 to 5 minutes more. Top with pecorino and serve immediately. Serves 6.

Combine first four ingredients in a shallow bowl. Dip the chicken in the egg and then in the bread crumb mixture. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the butter until melted. Place the breaded chicken in the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side until browned. Top with spaghetti sauce and mozzarella and bake for an additional 2 minutes or until the cheese is golden brown and bubbly.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Butter a 9 x 13 pan and set aside. Boil the potato cubes in salted water for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain them and return the potatoes to the pan. In the same pan over medium heat, add the butter. Stir in flour and continue stirring until the mixture is bubbly and slightly brown. Pour in the whipping cream and milk stirring constantly until the mixture is thickened. Pour over the potatoes in the pan. Sprinkle with the breadcrumbs and the shredded cheese. Bake in the preheated oven until the potatoes are browned and the sauce is bubbling on top, about 30 minutes. Serve immediately or refrigerate overnight before baking. Bake 30 - 40 minutes on top of stove.

Grill steak to desired doneness. Remove from grill. Cut into strips. In a large skillet heat oil. Add strips and cook until no longer pink. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add mushrooms and onions. Cook and stir 5 minutes or until tender. Place 1/2 cup mixture in center of each of 4 tortillas. Top with 2 tablespoons cheese. Fold in half. Cook in nonstick skillet over med. Heat. Cook 2 minutes each side or until crisp and golden brown. Cut into wedges and serve with guacamole and sour cream.

Slice the eggplants into rounds. Sprinkle them with salt. Cover and let them stand for at least 1 hour. Drain off the liquid from the eggplants. Dip them in sour cream. Dip them in the egg wash. Roll the sour cream dipped rounds in sesame seeds. Bake at 350f for 35 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350. Brown pork in large skillet. Place in crock pot. Add remaining ingredients. Cook on low 6 hours. Shred with 2 forks. Warm tortillas. Serve in tortillas with toppings.
Combine all in a pot, cover with water, bring to a boil. Simmer for 1 hour or until veggies are tender. Serve over white rice.

Divide cookie dough into fourths. Knead each fourth with the other ingredients until well blended. Roll each quarter out until 1/4 inch thick. Use cookie cutters to cut the shapes out. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Cool and frost with vanilla frosting.

In large bowl, combine 4 cups of caramels and 1/4 cup of whipping cream. Microwave on high for 2 minutes or until smooth and creamy. Stir in 1/2 cup of whipping cream and 1 tablespoon of rum. Microwave on high for 30 seconds or until smooth and creamy. Pour into crockpot and heat on low for 2 hours or until smooth and creamy. Stir often during last 1 hour of cooking. Serve warm or cool with fruits, cookies, cakes, etc. Store covered in refrigerator for up to 4 days.

Cut chicken into bite size pieces and brown in butter. Add shallots and garlic. Cook until onions are translucent. Add marsala wine and cook until it has reduced to about half of original amount. Add mushrooms and cook until they are wilted. Add flour and stir until all liquid has been absorbed. Add the cooked chicken and warm through. Serve over hot cooked rice.
name: pantry southwest chickeningredients: tomatoes and green chilies, tomato sauce, black beans, onion, corn, chicken breast, garlic cloves, cumin, salt and pepper, olive oilpreparation:in olive oil, cook the chicken until almost done. remove from pan. in same pan, add onion and garlic. cook until onion is translucent. add diced tomatoes with chilis, can of tomato sauce, can of black beans, corn, and cumin. return chicken to pan and cook until the chicken is done. serve with hot cooked rice.
name: yummy chicken marsalaingredients: chicken, but

Combine all dry ingrediants in large bowl. Store in an air-tight container at room temp or in refrigerator. Mix 1 1/2 cup with 1/2 cup hot tap water. Or use 1/2 cup of mix with 1 cup of milk or water and 1/2 cup melted shortening or margarine.
Name: Eggs and ham quicheIngredients: 2 tbsp all purpose flour2 tbsp sugar1 tsp ground nutmeg3/4 cup milk1 1/2 cups grated cheese1/2 cup ham1/4 cup chopped green onions2 tbsp butter2 eggs1/2 cup whipping cream1 pie crustPreparation: Mix together the flour, sugar, nutmeg and milk and beat with an electric mixer until smooth. Sprinkle in the cheese and ham and mix well. Pour into pie shell and dot with the butter and the green onions. Beat the eggs and cream and pour over the filling

In a blender or food processor, combine watermelon, strawberries, kiwi, peach, lime juice, honey, mint leaf, and lime peel. Process until smooth. Put into a bowl and add the preserves. Chill for 1 hour. In a small saucepan over medium-high heat, combine the pork with the soy sauce and 1/4 cup water. Cook until just cooked through, about 1 minute. Slice the meat into small pieces. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, combine the oil with the onion. Cook until the onions are soft, 5 to 7 minutes. Add the garlic and cook until golden, about 30 seconds. Add the meat and cook until browned. Add the salsa mixture and cook until the meat is heated through. Serve with tortilla chips.

Heat oven to 180C. Grease a 20cm x 30cm lamington tin. Cream together the butter and sugar until light. Add eggs one at a time. Add milk and then mix in the oranges. Sift together the self-raising flour, bicarbonate of soda and ground ginger. Stir into the mixture. Spoon into the tin. Bake for 40 minutes or until the top springs back when lightly touched. Leave to cool in tin for 10 minutes before turning out. Cut into slices to serve.

Boil the water and add the fish and the onion. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add the potatoes and boil for 15 minutes more. Pour the fish stock and boil for 10 minutes. Season with the salt and pepper and add the lemon zest. Cook the noodles in boiling salt water. Drain and add to the soup. Add the noodles and the fish and garnish with the lemon slices. Serve hot with crusty bread.

Cut each slice of bread into 3 even slices. Press slice of bread into each muffin cup. Cut cheese into small cubes. Top each slice of bread with 2 pieces of cheese. Fill with beaten egg substitute. Sprinkle with black pepper. Garnish with chives if desired. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes or until done.

Wash the new potatoes and then cut them into small pieces. Peel and slice the garlic cloves. In a saucepan over medium heat, heat the olive oil. Add the garlic and sauté for 1 to 2 minutes. Add the potato slices and sauté for 5 to 6 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add chopped parsley and serve warm.

Place cookies in food processor or blender. Blend until crumbs. In a large bowl, beat cream cheese and mascarpone until smooth. Beat in eggs one at a time. Beat in crumbs. Pour into 9×13 inch pan. Bake 45 minutes. Serve at room temperature or chilled. Garnish with sliced oranges.

In a medium size skillet, heat butter over medium heat. Add garlic cloves and cook until lightly browned. Cut off top of each tomato and scoop out pulp and seeds into a small bowl. Pour garlic into bowl with pulp and seeds. Reserve 1/4 cup of pulp and seeds for breadcrumb topping. Return pulp and seeds to skillet and cook 5-6 minutes until slightly thickened. Remove from heat and stir in sugar and basil. Pour pulp into baking dish and top with remaining breadcrumbs and cheeses. Bake 25-30 minutes until heated through and breadcrumbs are golden brown.

Peel the potatoes and cut them into wedges about 1/2 inch thick. In a deep bowl or other container large enough to hold all the potatoes, combine the milk, egg and shortening. Stir the mixture until the shortening has dissolved. Put the flour in a shallow bowl or plate and add the salt, pepper and msg. Beat the mixture well with a fork or whisk until there are no lumps and the mixture is smooth. Combine the flour with the paprika, garlic powder and the remaining salt in another shallow bowl or plate. Dip the potato wedges in the flour mixture, then in the milk mixture, then back into the flour mixture again. Carefully place the wedges in the hot oildo not crowd them. Cook the wedges until they are golden brown, turning them often so they brown evenly. Remove the wedges from the oil with a slotted spoon and place them in a paper towel-lined bowl or plate to drain the excess oil. Serve hot or at room temperature with any KFC meal. Serves 4-6 people.

In food processor bowl fitted with the metal blade attachment, place flour. Add 1/2 cup of the warm water and stir to combine (the water will form a ball). Add yeast and sugar to the flour mixture and stir until combined. Add remaining water and oil and pulse until mixture forms a ball. Pulse for 5 seconds more to knead. Transfer to lightly floured work surface and knead briefly until smooth (dough should not be sticky). Divide into 2 equal pieces, form into balls and place on lightly oiled baking sheet. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise until doubled about 45 minutes to 1 hour.
Shape meat into 4 patties. Cook in a skillet over medium heat until brown on both sides. Serve on buttered white bread with yellow mustard.

Cook bacon in a small skillet over medium heat until crisp. Drain bacon on paper towels and crumble. Arrange lettuce in a large serving bowl. In a small bowl combine the bacon, bean sprouts and eggs. Stir in the rest of the dressing ingredients and toss with the lettuce.

Cook the penne according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large saucepan, saut the onion in 1 tbsp. of the butter until tender. Add the bacon and cook until crisp. Add the turkey and the broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the remaining 1 tbsp. butter and the cheese. Cook until the cheese is melted. Add the cream and the pasta. Season with the basil, salt and pepper. Makes 6 servings.

Heat wok over high heat until hot. Add oil. Add chicken and brown for 2 minutes on all sides. Add the curry paste and cook for 1 minute more. Stir in the coconut milk, water and nam pla. Cook until the liquid comes to a simmer. Add the eggplants and continue cooking until they are tender. Season to taste. Stir in the basil. Serve the curry over rice. Garnish with the palm sugar.

In a large bowl, combine brown sugar and rum until well mixed. Add the squash, turning to coat evenly. Cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 350f. Place the squash on a baking sheet. Bake until tender when pierced with a knife or skewer, about 1 hour.
Prepare cake mix as directed on box. Combine powdered sugar, water, vegetable oil, and lemonade concentrate in a bowl. Drizzle over prepared cake. Garnish with fresh strawberries, if desired.

Separate 1 large egg. Add the whites of 1 large egg to a small bowl and beat until frothy. Add a tablespoon of agave nectar and continue to beat until well blended. In another bowl, add 1/4 cup almond flour, 1/4 teaspoon sea salt and 1/4 teaspoon baking soda. Stir well and add the remaining 3 tablespoons of agave nectar and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract and stir until well combined. Add the wet ingredients to the dry and combine. Heat a small nonstick pan over medium heat and add a small amount of grapeseed oil. Drop batter in 1/4 inch sized dollops and cook until the bottoms are lightly browned and the tops start to look bubbly, about 2 minutes. Flip and cook until golden brown, another 1-2 minutes. Repeat with remaining batter. Serve immediately.

Slice the pineapple and mango into thin rounds and cut the bananas into small pieces. Peel and dice the papaya. Add all the fruit into a bowl and pour the nectar over the fruit. Add the lime juice and stir gently until the fruit is coated with the nectar. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

In a medium pot of boiling water, blanch the Brussels sprouts for 2 minutes. Drain and pat dry. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, melt the butter. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant. Add the vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Add the Brussels sprouts and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Season to taste with nutmeg, salt and pepper. Transfer to a serving bowl, drizzle with the walnut oil and sprinkle the cheese on top. Serve warm.

Pour 2 tablespoons cream of coconut and 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg into a blender. Add 3/4 cup milk and 3/4 cup cold brewed coffee and blend until frothy. Pour into 4 mugs and serve immediately.
name: mocha almond french pressingredients: ground coffee, freshly ground peanut butter (or other natural nut butter), ground chicory, milk, almond extractpreparation:Heat 1 cup whole milk and 1/2 cup half-and-half just until bubbles appear around edges of pan. Add 1 tablespoon ground peanut butter or other nut butter. Remove from heat and stir until melted and smooth. Set aside to cool. To make coffee, combine 2 tablespoons ground chicory with 12 tablespoons ground coffee and 2 tablespoons freshly ground peanut butter or other natural nut butter in a French press coffee maker. Press down plunger and pour coffee into 4 cups. Fill cups with 1/2 cup cooled pe

To prepare the beans, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds until fragrant. Add the sage leaves. Saute until crispy. Add the water. Bring to a boil. Add the beans. Cook until tender. Drain. Mash to desired consistency. Add 1/4 teaspoon of each salt and pepper. Stir to combine. Makes 3 servings.

In a large pot melt the butter and salt. Stir in the marshmallows until melted and smooth. Stir in the vanilla. Remove from heat. Stir in the cocoa powder. Stir until thoroughly blended and mixture is thick and sticky. Stir in the cocoa krispies until evenly coated. Press into a 9x13 pan and chill until set. Cut into squares.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine all ingredients except for beans and rice in a baking dish. Bake in oven for 20 minutes. Remove from oven. Top with beans and rice. Serve with tortillas.

Mix all ingredients together and refrigerate for several hours. Serve with crackers.
Strawberries are a rich source of vitamin C, folic acid, fiber and potassium. Raspberries are also low calorie and are high in antioxidants, which help prevent heart disease and cancer. They are also rich in fiber which helps lower LDL or "bad" cholesterol levels.
Cashews are rich in vitamin E which helps boost your immune system, selenium to help prevent cancer and phosphorus which helps build bones.

Preheat oven to 325f. Lightly grease and flour a 10x5x3 inch loaf pan. Sift together the flour, sugar and salt. Beat the eggs into the bananas. Stir in the oil and vanilla. Stir in the bananas. Stir in the oats and nuts. Stir in the flour mixture until well blended. Spoon the batter into the pan and bake for 1 hour. Cool 5 minutes before removing from pan to a rack to cool completely.

Cook rice according to directions, except do not add butter or margarine. Drain well and add apple juice and margarine. Mix well. Add dry onion soup mix and stir well. Refrigerate at least 4 hours before serving.

Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the lemon juice and zest. Let the mixture boil for 5 minutes. Stir in the oregano. Pour over the chicken and bake for 25 minutes. Turn the chicken over. Bake for 10 minutes more.

Dust scallops with a mixture of ground cumin, black pepper, and chili powder. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add scallops. Cook scallops for 2 minutes. Turn scallops over. Cook another 2 minutes. Remove scallops. Drain off any excess oil. Add rice. Cook and stir until rice is done. Stir in tomatoes, jalapeno, lime juice, and cilantro. Serve scallops over rice.

Mix oil and pudding together until smooth. Add bisquick and egg and mix well. Drop by spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until lightly browned.
name: buttermilk biscuitsingredients: butter, milk, lard, flour, baking soda, baking powder, saltpreparation:Mix together dry ingredients. Cut in lard and butter until the mixture is the consistency of coarse meal. Add milk and mix to a soft dough. Roll and cut to desired size. Bake at 450 degrees for 12-15 minutes.
name: cinnamon rollsingredients: margarine or butter, milk, brown sugar, egg, salt, flour, yeastpreparation:Dissolve yeast in milk and set aside to rise. Cream margarine and brown sugar until light and creamy. Add the egg and beat well. Stir in the yeast mixture and beat until smooth. Stir in the 2 cups of flour and beat

Line cookie sheet with wax paper. In large pot combine brown sugar, corn syrup & vanilla. Cook over low heat until syrup forms. Pour onto wax paper & let cool. When cooled, break into pieces & roll in hands until it sticks together & forms a ball. Let cool & break into pieces again. Repeat until candy forms a ball & sticks to wax paper. Place in fridge for 10 minutes & remove from wax paper. Wrap in plastic wrap & store in refrigerator or freezer.

Beat together the cream cheese and sugar. Add the eggs one at a time and beat well. Add the vanilla. Pour the mixture into 12 muffin cups that have been lightly sprayed. Bake at 350F for 15-20 minutes or until firm. Cool for 20 minutes. Top with the blueberry pie filling. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Sprinkle both sides of steak with peppercorns and salt. Dip each side into vegetable oil to coat. Grill steak over medium heat for about 30 seconds on each side (for rare). Let rest for 10 minutes before slicing thinly across the grain. Combine all other ingredients in a blender or food processorblend until smooth. Garnish with orange slice and a few drops of red food coloring.

Boil water in medium-size saucepan. Add sweet potatoes and cook 15 minutes or until tender. Mash until smooth. Cool. Beat egg yolks with shortening in large mixing bowl until light and fluffy. Add sweet potato mixture and beat well. Add salt to taste. Spread mixture on wax paper to cool. Fold in marshmallows. Place in greased 13 x 9 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool completely and cut into squares. Roll in cereal before serving.
