I am so excited to have found this recipe! My aunt made them for us when I was a child in the 1950's, but I have never been able to

Cook potato and onion in broth. Cook beef. Drain. Add tomatoes. Stir. Add rice and macaroni. Cook for 15 minutes. Add veg-all. Cook for 5 minutes. Serve.
name: grandma s hamburger helperingredients: ground beef, onion, celery ribs, diced tomatoes, pasta, onion soup mix, cheddar cheesepreparation:Saute onion and celery in water or chicken stock, set aside. Brown the ground beef, drain. Add onion and celery back in. Add can of diced tomatoes, a can of water and the pasta. Bring to boil, simmer uuntil pasta is soft and water is gone. Mix in onion soup mix. Mix in cheddar cheese. Serve.
name: janie s hamburger soupingredients: hamburger, onion, v8 vegetable juice, water, tomato soup, mixed vegetables, italian seasoning, salt, ground black pepper, pastapreparation:Saute onion. Brown ground beef

In a sauce pan combine broths, onions, water chestnuts and pepper. Cook until tender but not mushy. Add chicken breasts and cook until done. Stir in peas and heat through. Serve over rice or noodles. Garnish with green pepper rings.
Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. In a skillet brown meat. Drain. Add crushed tomatoes, water, vegetables. Bring to a boil. Add pasta. Add milk and cheese. Stir until melted. Serve.

Beat yogurt and next 3 ingredients in a bowl. Dip fillets in yogurt mixture. Place yogurt coated fillets in a greased 13x9 inch baking dish. Combine remaining 3 ingredients and pour over fillets. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily. Sprinkle with additional parmesan cheese if desired. Serve with rice or pasta.

Soak the sun-dried tomatoes in boiling water for 20 minutes. Drain and pat dry. Cut into small pieces. Crumble cheese. In a small bowl combine cheese, tomatoes, and walnuts. In a medium bowl mix together the sour cream and mayonnaise. Add the cheese mixture and mix well. Chill until ready to serve. Garnish with additional cheese and tomatoes.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Heat olive oil in a cast iron skillet on med-high heat. Add chicken. Brown on both sides. Transfer to a baking dish. Drizzle with honey, balsamic vinegar, and lemon zest. Bake 15 minutes or until chicken is done. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve with rice.

Mix sugar and cream until smooth. Cook until candy thermometer reads 250 degrees F. Remove from heat. Add butter and salt. Beat until well blended. Pour onto waxed paper. Allow to cool. Break into pieces.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line a large sheet pan with aluminum foil. Peel the potatoes and cut into thin french fry-like slices. Toss slices with maple syrup, cinnamon, ginger and nutmeg. Drizzle with a little more maple syrup if desired. Spread the fries out on the aluminum foil lined sheet pan and bake for 20 minutes, turning halfway through to cook evenly on each side. Serve hot with a side of ranch dressing for dipping.
i have a sweet tooth! these all look so good!
i love the sweet potato pancake recipe! i just made some this past weekend and they were so delicious!
I love sweet potatoes and have been wanting to try some of those recipes!

Preheat grill to medium heat. Cut bread in half lengthwise and rub with garlic cloves. Brush lightly with olive oil and grill until lightly toasted. Tear tomatoes in half. Combine with basil, olive oil and salt. Divide among the bread halves and serve immediately.

To make sauce, heat a large pot over medium heat. Add tomatoes with their juices. Simmer uncovered for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Use an immersion blender to puree the mixture until smooth. Season with oregano, basil, salt and black pepper. Sauce will keep in an airtight container in the refrigerator for 3 days.

Beat butter and sugars together. Add egg and beat well. Add flour and soda and mix well. Chill dough 2 to 3 hours and then roll out to 1/8 inch thickness and cut with cookie cutters into shapes of your choice. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes. Makes 10 to 12 dozen depending on size.

In large bowl, beat eggs well. Add sugar. Beat until thick. Add milk. Add chocolate and beat until melted. Add butter. Beat well. Stir in vanilla. Pour into pie crust. Arrange slices of apple in crust. Sprinkle with nuts. Refrigerate.
Combine in a large mixing bowl and stir. Chill 1 to 2 hours before serving with tortilla chips. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

Place one slice of buttered bread on plate. Add some mayonnaise and some mustard. Add some paprika. Add some vinegar. Add some salt. Add some pepper. Add some butter. Add some cornichons. Add some paprika. Add some vinegar. Add some salt. Add some butter. Add some cornichons. Add some paprika. Add some vinegar. Add some butter. Add some cornichons. Add some paprika. Add some butter. Add some cornichons. Add some paprika. Add some butter. Add some cornichons. Add some paprika. Add some butter. Add some cornichons. Add some paprika. Add some vinegar. Add some butter. Add some cornichons. Add some paprika. Add some vinegar. Add some butter. Add some cornichons. Add some paprika. Add some vinegar. Add some butter. Add some cornichons. Add some paprika. Add some vinegar. Add some butter. Add some cornichons. Add some paprika. Add some butter.
Saut carrots and onion in oil. Add kung pao sauce and soy sauce. Bring to a boil. Add red pepper flakes and edamame. Cook until heated through. Serve over brown or white rice.

Spread a thin layer of ketchup and mustard over the crust. Add the condensed bean soup. Top with onions. Cut the frankfurters into slices and arrange on the top of the bean soup. Top with cheddar cheese and bake until bubbly. Makes 1 pizza.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook sausage in boiling water 10 minutes. Drain. Heat a large saucepan over medium heat. Add sausage, onion, celery, and carrot to pancook 5 minutes or until tender. Add chicken broth, marjoram, and bay leaf. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer 2 hours. Add peascook 10 minutes or until thick. Serve in bowls.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Whisk the oil, chili powder, cumin, paprika, coriander, salt and pepper together in a small bowl. Spread the mixture onto a rimmed baking sheet, and toss with the chickpeas to coat evenly. Roast in the preheated oven until browned and crispy, about 40 minutes, tossing every 10 minutes to prevent burning. Cool on the baking sheet. Transfer to an airtight container to store, or sprinkle over salad or soup.

Drain eggs and let them cool completely. Carefully slice each egg in half lengthwise and remove yolks into a bowl. Mash yolks with a fork. Add all remaining ingredients except chives. Mix until blended and mold into each egg half. Garnish with chives before serving.

Cook pasta according to directions on package. While pasta cooks, combine garlic, crushed red pepper flakes, olive oil, anchovy fillets and parsley in a small bowl or serving dish. Transfer pasta to large bowl. Pour sauce over pasta and toss to coat. Season with black pepper and serve immediately.

Spread graham cracker crumbs in a 9 inch spring form pan. Combine margarine and sugar and melt together. Blend in eggs and vanilla. Add cream cheese and blend well. Pour into pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and let stand for 5 minutes. Spread with cherry pie filling. Refrigerate. Makes 10 servings.

Cook milk and butter over medium heat until butter is melted. Stir in flour until smooth. Stir in cheeses until melted and smooth. Stir in frozen spinach until thawed. Fold in other vegetables and chestnuts. Spread in a 13 x 9 inch glass baking dish. Bake 15 minutes or until bubbly and golden. Cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Combine sugar and milk in saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil. Stir until a soft ball forms. Remove from heat and stir in peanut butter and butter. Stir until smooth. Pour into greased 8x8 pan. Chill until firm. Cut into 1-inch squares.

Cream together the butter and eggs. Add vanilla and frozen pineapple concentrate and stir until combined well. Combine the flour and baking soda and add to the butter mixture, stirring well until combined. Add the oats and pineapple chunks. Add the crushed pineapple and coconut and stir until evenly distributed throughout the dough. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto lightly greased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until edges are slightly brown. Cool on wire racks. Makes 48 1-inch balls.
Name: Pina Colada Cake Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups all purpose flour 1/2 cup sugar 1 1/2 cups milk 1/2 cup oil 1 package (1/4 ounce) vanilla pudding mix 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened 1/2 cup plus 1 cup cool whip 1 can (20 ounces) crushed pineapple, drained 1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons co

Preheat oven to 350 F.In a large bowl, combine the flour, oats, baking powder and salt. In a smaller bowl, combine the peanut butter and milk. Add the brown sugar to the peanut butter mixture. Add the peanut butter mixture to the dry ingredients. Stir just until combined. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto parchment paper. Bake for 15 minutes. Allow to cool on the pan for a few minutes. Then remove from the pan. Allow to cool completely on wire rack. Makes about 2 dozen cookies.

Combine the water, gingerroot, cinnamon stick, cloves and coriander seeds in a pan. Bring to a boil then turn down heat to medium low. Cover and let simmer for 30 minutes. Remove gingerroot. Strain liquid through a fine sieve into a pitcher. Remove cloves and cinnamon stick. Stir in honey. Let cool. In a small bowl combine the star fruit slices and brown sugar. Toss well. Place star fruit mixture in a single layer on a foil lined baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Drizzle honey liquid over fruit. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Add oil to a large roasting pan. Toss in cauliflower florets. Roast for 25 minutes or until tender. In a food processor or blender add the roasted cauliflower florets, water, salt and white pepper. Blend until smooth. Garnish with parsley.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small saucepan, combine the maple syrup, lemon juice and cinnamon. Bring to a boil over high heat. Remove from heat and set aside. Beat the eggs in a medium bowl. Blend in the syrup mixture. Add the salt and the vanilla. Pour into an unbaked 9-inch pastry shell. Bake for 1 hour and 30 minutes. Cool before cutting. Garnish with walnut pieces.

In a large skillet, saute the chicken in oil until no longer pink. Stir in the soup, water, ranch dressing mix, and garlic salt. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in sour cream. Serve over red potatoes.

Grease an 8 inch square pan with butter. In a large bowl combine the first five ingredients, then beat well. Add the vanilla, then the dry ingredients and beat until just combined. Stir in the apples and nuts until evenly distributed. Pour batter into the pan and spread evenly. Bake for about 25 minutes in the preheated oven or until a cake tester inserted into the centre comes out clean. Remove from oven and cool on a wire rack. Cut into squares and serve.

Heat oil on stove for deep frying at 375 degrees. Mix together egg, water, cornstarch and flour. Put in small amount of sugar. Heat oil until hot enough to test with a wooden chopstick or metal spoon. Add egg mixture to oil little by little to form egg rolls until all are done. Remove from oil and let cool on paper towel.
Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, beat eggs, cream, mustard, sun-dried tomato & olives in a large bowl. Drain pastatoss with egg mixture & parmesan. Top with basil.

1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease 36 miniature muffin cups or use Pampered Chef Mini-Muffin Pan. 2. In a large bowl, beat butter at medium speed with an electric mixer until smooth. Add cream cheesebeat until smooth. 3. In a small bowl, combine flour, 1/2 cup brown sugar and 1/2 teaspoon saltmix well. Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixturemix well. Press the dough into the bottoms of the cups using the back of a measuring cup or a small spoon. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. 4. In a medium bowl, beat 1/4 cup brown sugar and the egg until smooth. Beat in the vanillaset aside. 5. In a large bowl, combine the chopped pecans and 1/4 cup melted buttermix well. Spoon the nut mixture evenly over the baked crusts. Top with the egg mixture. B

Wash barley and put into pot with cold water and cinnamon stick. Cook for about 40 minutes until the barley is soft. Then add sugar and lemon juice and cook another 10 minutes. Add raisins and wine and cook for another 10 minutes.
Today is my favorite holiday, Christmas eve. It is for me the most joyous time of year. It is when I remember my childhood. It is when I remember being with my family. It is when I remember being with my brother and my sister and my mom and my dad and my grandparents and my uncle and my aunts and my cousins and my best friend who lived upstairs from us. And it is when I remember how I felt when I was with them all.
I remember how I felt when I was with my best friend who lived upstairs from us and how I felt when I was with my grandpa who was visiting us and how I felt when my brother and I were singing Christmas songs and how I felt when my grandpa gave us Christmas presents. And I remember how I felt when we were all together at my grandpa's house and how I

Combine all the ingredients in a blender and puree. Place fish in a deep baking dish and pour the marinade over the fish. Marinate in the refrigerator overnight or for up to 48 hours. Grill for 2-3 minutes per side.

Heat 1 cup of water in a teapot. Add 1 cinnamon stick (optional). Remove from heat when water reaches steaming point. Add 3 tablespoons of Irish whiskey to each cup. Stir in 1/4 teaspoon of lemon juice and 1 teaspoon of honey. Serve warm in a mug.

Preheat oven to 375f. Lay out one sheet of puff pastry. Spread the preserves evenly over the pastry. Top with the brie round and press in place. Lightly beat the egg white and brush it over the puff pastry, preserves and brie. Roll up the pastry and place in an 8 x 8 x 2 inch baking pan. Crimp the edges and brush with more egg white. Bake for 15 minutes or until the pastry is golden and puffed. Cut into slices. Serve warm.
Dice zucchini and carrots. Mix lettuce with zucchini and carrots and add feta cheese and cherry tomatoes. Dressing: 1 tbsp olive oil and 1 tsp apple cider vinegar with some salt and black pepper.
Combine first 3 ingredients in a blender and process until smooth. Stir in yogurt and honey. Serve in tall glasses and top each glass with 1 tablespoon toasted pistachio nuts.

Brown ground beef with onions and green pepper in dutch oven. Add whole tomatoes and crushed tomatoes and water to cover. Simmer uncovered until beef is done. Add diced tomatoes and diced green peppers. Add seasoning mix. Simmer uncovered until peppers are tender.
name: 15 minute chili
ingredients: ground turkey, onion, pinto beans, kidney beans, stewed tomatoes, chili powder, cumin, salt, salsa
preparation:In a large pot, brown meat with chopped onion. Drain grease, if necessary. Add beans, tomatoes, garlic, chili powder, cumin, salt and salsa to meat mixture. Cook until heated through. Serve with cornbread, cooked pasta, cooked rice, or on top of a baked potato. Sprinkle with cheese if desired.
name: dads sausage peppers and onions
ingredients: red bell peppers, green bell pepper, onion, garlic cloves, italian sausage, parmes
Combine espresso coffee and salt in large bowl. Whisk well to blend. Add remaining ingredientsstir well to blend. Store in airtight container in a cool, dry place up to 1 month.

Soak dried cod overnight in a bowl of water. The next day, rinse off the cod (if you like it that way) and place in a large pot with enough cold water to cover. Bring to a boil and then simmer for 1-2 hours until soft. Drain the cod and set it aside for the time being. To make the brewis, melt a small pat of butter in a frying pan over medium heat and add a small amount of chopped onion and a pinch of salt. Stir until onions are translucent. In a small bowl, combine about 1/4 cup of water with enough flour to make a thick paste. Pour into frying pan with onions and stir until thickened. Add more water if needed. Then add more onions and continue stirring until mixture becomes a smooth creamy consistency. Cook for about 15 minutes until mixture turns golden brown. Serve with slices of soft white bread spread with butter (or margarine).

Heat milk, water and oil until very warm (120-130). Dissolve yeast in it. Combine 2 cups of the flour with the yeast mixture and beat until smooth. Beat in 1 cup of the sugar, 1/4 tsp. Salt and 1/2 tsp. Nutmeg. Beat the rest of the ingredients together and stir into the yeast mixture. Beat until smooth. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic. Divide the dough into 20 equal parts. Roll each part into a ball and place on a lightly greased sheet. Let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk (1-2 hours). Bake at 350 for 10-15 minutes. Cool on racks.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add broccolini and cook until crisp-tender, about 6 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add mustard, mayo, salt and pepper. Set aside. Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Spread mayo mixture over rye bread slices. Top with broccolini mixture and sprinkle with cheese. Broil until golden brown. Serve warm.

Saute the onions and mushrooms in a skillet. Add ground beef and seasoning mix. Cook until the meat is browned. Stir in tomato paste and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in parsley and sour cream. Serve over egg noodles.
Pour all ingredients except soda water into a cocktail glass half-filled with ice cubes. Fill the glass with the soda water. Garnish with a slice of lemon or orange.

Heat a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add the butter to the panwhen melted, add the chicken-apple sausages and brown on all sides, about 8 minutes total. Transfer to a plateset aside. Reduce the heat to mediumadd the onions to the pan and cook, stirring occasionally, for about 8 minutes or until lightly browned. Stir in the light brown sugar, the salt, and the peppercook for about 3 minutes, stirring constantly. Stir in the thyme, garlic, the dark beer, and the bourbonbring to a simmer. Return the chicken-apple sausage to the pancoverreduce the heat to medium-lowcook for about 1 hour or until the liquid is reduced by half. Serve in bowlsgarnish with the parsley.

Rub both sides of steak with coarse black pepper and sprinkle with salt. Heat skillet and add garlic and oil. Add steak to skillet and cook on high heat for 3 minutes. Turn and cook for another minute. Pour brandy over steak and ignite with match. Cook over high heat for 1 minute. Serve with white rice and vegetables.

Cut pineapple into cubes and remove core. Chop bell peppers into 1/2 inch cubes. Cut the chicken breast into strips. Toss together the pineapple and bell peppers. In a large bowl combine the mango chutney, orange juice, vanilla and nutmeg. Add the chicken strips and toss to coat. Thread the vegetables and chicken on the skewers. Place the kabobs in the microwave and cook on high for 4-5 minutes. Flip over and cook for another 4-5 minutes. Serve with the mango chutney.

Combine olive oil, green onions and amaretto in a bowl. Add the shrimp and marinate for 30 minutes. Place the coconut milk and heavy cream in a saucepan. Heat until boiling. Add sugar and extracts. Add the shrimp. Heat gently for 2 minutes or until warm. Serve over white rice and garnish with green onions.
I've been looking for a good Jamaican recipe and this one is it. It's excellent and so easy to make!
This was delicious. It's a simple recipe with fresh tasting ingredients. I had it with white rice.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the beef, onions and garlic and saute until the beef is no longer pink. Stir in the diced tomatoes and artichoke hearts. Simmer for about 3 minutes. Season with the basil, salt and pepper. Spoon the beef mixture into a 1 1/2-quart baking dish. Sprinkle with the cheese. Bake for 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl combine sour cream, mustard, horseradish, and salt & pepper to taste. Spread 2 slices of bread with this mixture. Top with cheese. Arrange beef slices on top of cheese. Cover with remaining bread. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and bread is lightly toasted. Let stand for 5 minutes. Slice into halves. Makes 4. Serve with alfalfa sprouts and lettuce.
In a large saucepan cook spinach and onion in oil until onion is wilted. Add the lentils. Stir to combine. Add salt and pepper. Cook until tender. Add cumin. Serve over rice or couscous.

Cut the cheese into 3/4-inch cubes. Put the cubes into a small bowl. Melt the butter in a small saucepan over low heat. Add the cheese cubes to the pan. Add the brandy. Stir to combine. Pour into a 10-inch ovenproof skillet. Broil the cheese 6 inches from the heat for 2 to 3 minutes, until the top is lightly browned. Sprinkle with the lemon juice. Serve hot.
Combine all ingredients except pineapple. Shape into 1-inch balls. Brown in hot oil, turning once. Add pineapple and juice and cook 5 minutes longer. Serve over rice.

Combine rice and water in microwaveable bowl or plate. Cook until water is absorbed. Stir in vegetables and onioncook 5 more minutes. Stir in bacon, soy sauce and tomato saucemicrowave until heated through.

Preheat oven to 400f. In large bowl, mix together oil, lemon rind, 1/2 tsp each salt and pepper. Add potatoes and toss until coated. Spread out evenly on baking sheet. Bake 30-40 minutes, stirring occasionally until tender. Stir in remaining 1/4 tsp each salt and pepper. Add parsley. Serves 6.

Spray large casserole dish with spray. Arrange wonton skins in single layer in dish. Whisk together the egg, oregano and water until blended. Spoon into center of each wonton skin. Sprinkle with pecorino cheese. Bake uncovered in 350 degree oven about 20 minutes or until filling is set. Serve with a simple salad or as a side for grilled meat or fish.
Slice bread in half. Layer stuffing on bottom half. Place breast on top of stuffing. Top with cranberry sauce. Pour gravy over top. Place top slice of bread on sandwich. Serve.

Melt butter in medium skillet over medium high flame. Add onions and cook until tender. Stir in brown sugar and cook until bubbling, stirring constantly. Add whiskey and flour and stir until smooth. Cook until thickened and bubbly. Stir in broth and simmer until thickened. Slice ham and arrange on platter. Spoon sauce over ham and serve immediately.

Beat whipping cream until soft peaks form. Beat in white chocolate until smooth. Add sugar and beat until stiff. Fold in cream cheese until smooth. Spread into 4 ramekins. Garnish with blueberries. Chill for at least 2 hours.

Cook beef and drain fat. Combine beef with 2 envelops of taco seasoning. Divide evenly among individual plates. Top with lettuce, tomato and avocado. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve with sour cream and ranch dressing.

Cut shortening into the flour until mixture resembles fine crumbs. Stir in salt. Mix well with hands. Beat egg lightly with lemon juice. Stir into mixture until moistened. Gently knead dough into smooth ball. Wrap in plastic wrap and chill for 2 hours before using.

In a small bowl, combine the onion, kidney beans, black beans, corn, tomato sauce, diced tomatoes with green chilies, 1/3 cup water, and taco seasoning. Cook over medium heat until hot. Place the chicken breasts in a 5-qt. slow cooker. Pour the bean mixture over the chicken. Pour the remaining 1 1/2 cups water into the slow cooker. Cover. Cook on low for 6-8 hours or until the chicken is tender. Remove the chicken breasts from the slow cooker. When cool enough to handle, shred the chicken. Toss the shredded chicken into the slow cooker. Stir in the Tabasco sauce. Cover. Cook until heated through. Serve over rice.

Combine all ingredients except salmon fillets in a medium bowl. Add fish and marinate for 10 minutes. Prepare grill or broiler. Remove fish from bag. Grill or broil 6 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Baste fish occasionally with marinade.
The salmon filet was delicious. I put the filet on the grill for about 4 minutes per side and it was done. The glaze was not overpowering and did not burn off while the filet was on the grill. The glaze was sweet and delicious. I will make this again.
I will not eat any fish that is not wild caught. Salmon is a fish that can be farmed. I do not think you should be recommending farmed fish.
This was delicious! I made it with some rice. I will definitely make again!
I just made the Sweet Orange Salmon with the recipe for the Brown Sugar Glaze. It was excellent! I used the glaze as the topping for my Orange Beef recipe and it was wonderful!

Heat olive oil in a sauce pan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Saute until soft. Add diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, and water. Bring to a simmer. Add chicken and cook for 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Remove chicken from soup. Shred chicken and return to soup. Stir in cream. Serve with grated cheese.
Soup is a general term for foods of a fluid consistency that are served warm or cold. Soups may be served with or without garnish (a decorative piece of food) or accompanying eating utensils. The word derives from the French soupe, which in turn derives from the Latin suppa. The French term comes from the Old Provençal word soupe (soup), which came from the Old French soupe (soup), which came from the Latin suppa (soup).
In common parlance, soups are divided into two main groups: clear soups and thick soups. The established French classifications of clear soups are bouillon and consommé. Thick soups are classified depending upon the type
Combine brie and mustard. Spread over toasted baguette. Top with strawberries. Mix dressing ingredients. Toss with spinach and serve. Serve the salad on the side.

Heat olive oil over medium heat. Saute garlic. Add prosciutto and saute until browned. Stir in the diced tomatoes. Add penne pasta. Sprinkle with basil and top with parmesan cheese.
name: fusilli with tomatoes spinach and prosciuttoingredients: fusilli, baby spinach, diced tomatoes, extra virgin olive oil, salt, crushed red pepper flakes, garlic clove, prosciutto, parmigiano-reggiano cheesepreparation:Cook pasta according to package directions, omitting salt and fat. Place spinach in a large colander. Drain pasta over spinach. Place pasta mixture in pan. Add tomato, oil, salt, pepper, and garlic. Toss well. Add prosciutto. Toss gently to combine. Sprinkle with cheese.
name: spaghetti siracusaniingredients: olive oil, garlic, chopped tomato, anchovy fillet, capers, olives, basil leaves, spaghettipreparation:Heat oil and add

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the ham slices and fry until they are crisp and brown. Add the coffee and simmer until the coffee is reduced to about 1 cup. Season with the black pepper to taste.
name: cinnamon-roasted hamingredients: honey, cinnamon, clovespreparation: Preheat oven to 275°F. Place ham in an 11x15-in. baking dish or roasting panbake for 45-50 minutes or until heated through. Remove from ovendrizzle with honey. Combine the remaining ingredientspour over ham. Bake uncovered for 15 minutes or until glazed.
name: country-style hamingredients: pork shoulder butt (ham) cooking spraypreparation: Preheat oven to 375°F. In a shallow roasting pan, combine the pork, sage, cloves, peppercorns, bay leaves and salttoss to coat evenly. Spray
Combine pineapple juice and brown sugar in a saucepan and cook over medium heat until mixture thickens. Remove from heat and stir in butter. Add cloves and cinnamon sticks. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Cut onions into 1/2-inch rings. Mix onions and rosemary togetheradd carrots and garlic. Pour oil over all and stir until well coated. Place on a baking sheet in a single layer and bake for 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Place first 4 ingredients in a saucepancover and simmer for 15 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink in center of thickest part. Meanwhile, in a small bowl mix together cornstarch with 1 tablespoon cold water until smooth. Stir in remaining cold waterset aside. Add remaining 3 cups water to chicken mixturemix well. Stir in parsley. Combine egg whites and remaining cornstarch in a small bowlbeat until stiff peaks formgradually stir in soup mixture until blendedcook, stirring constantly, until thickened. Serve hot with fresh parsley sprinkled on top if desired. Serves 4-6. Calories per serving (using 2% milk) 128.

Cut chicken into small pieces. Beat egg and milk together. Coat the chicken with the mixture of egg and milk and then dredge with breadcrumbs and paprika. Add sour cream to the onions, just enough to moisten them. Heat 1/2 cup oil and deep-fry the chicken until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve with the onions.

Melt butter in heavy large pot. Add onions and salt. Cook over medium heat, stirring often until soft and golden, about 20 minutes. Add flour and cook 2 minutes. Add wine, bring to a boil. Cook 1 minute. Add beef stock and reserved onions. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer, uncovered, stirring occasionally until slightly thickened, about 20 minutes. Stir in wine and cook until slightly thickened, about 15 minutes. Add more wine if necessary. Ladle into bowls. Top with swiss and bake until cheese is melted.

In a saucepan over medium heat, combine sugar and water. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute. Remove from the heat and let cool completely. Puree strawberries, lemon juice and light corn syrup in a blender until smooth. Strain through a fine strainer into the saucepan with the cooled syrup. Add the Champagne and stir well to combine. Refrigerate for at least one hour. Line a cookie sheet with waxed paper or parchment paper. Scoop out the popsicle mixture and place in the center of the paper. Wrap the paper around the mixture and freeze for at least two hours or overnight. Unwrap the popsicles and serve immediately.

In a large skillet, cook the potatoes and onions in oil till golden. Add the carrots and mushrooms. Cook a minute or so more. Add the sausage and cook till browned. Add the soup and water and mix well. Add the stock powder and stir till dissolved. Heat through but do not boil. Serve over mashed potatoes or rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cook the hot sausages according to package directions. Cut each sausage diagonally in half. Heat a heavy skillet over medium heat, add the butter and the grapes and cook, stirring until the grapes just begin to pop. Add the balsamic vinegar and cook for one minute, stirring to combine. Divide the grapes among two serving dishes and top with the sausages. Makes two servings.

Place pearl barley in a saucepan with 4 cups water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer. Cover and cook until tender. Drain. Cool. Add raisins and sugar. Combine peaches and prune in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Add barley mixture. Cook until heated through. Serve over ice cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine pretzels, cayenne, 2 tablespoons canola oil and water in a large bowl. Toss to coat. Spread evenly onto a baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes or until pretzels are crisp. Meanwhile, combine remaining 2 tablespoons canola oil, mustards and vinegar in a medium bowl. Mix well. When pretzels are done baking, toss them in the mustard dressing. Let stand 10 minutes. Drizzle dressing over chicken. Broil 2 minutes. Serve over pretzels. Serve with a green salad.

Mix dry ingredients together. Add wet ingredients. Blend well. Pour about 1/4 cup of batter on a hot griddle (medium heat). Cook for 2-3 minutes on each side until light brown. Sprinkle with sugar if desired.
Beat eggs. Add sugar, corn syrup and butter. Add nuts. Bake in unbaked pie shell at 400 for 25 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place the cut up potatoes on a baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil. Place the head of garlic in the center of the potatoes. Place the onions on top of the garlic. Add the chopped rosemary. Roast the potatoes for 45 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with salt. Remove the garlic head from the pan. In a small bowl whisk together the mustard and the vinegar. Add more mustard to taste. Pour the dressing over the potatoes. Serve.

Saute the mushrooms and the beef in the butter. Season with beef roast seasoning and flour. Add water and cook until thick. Add the cooked beef and simmer for 10 minutes. Serve over the egg noodles with sour cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Brown bacon in a skillet over medium heat. In a large bowl, mix together the eggs, milk, salt, dry mustard, pepper, and cheddar cheese. Set aside. Spray a 10x14 inch baking dish with cooking spray. Place tater tots in baking dish in a single layer. Pour egg mixture over tots and stir to coat well. Bake in preheated oven until eggs are set, about 30 minutes.

Combine first six ingredients in a mixing bowl and stir well. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake at 400 degrees for 40 minutes or until set. Sprinkle with pecans and bake for an additional 10 minutes or until light brown in spots.

Prepare the crust first. In a saucepan, bring water to a boil. Add gelatin and stir until dissolved. Add milk and cook until it thickens. Remove from heat and let it cool. In a bowl, beat together the butter, cream cheese and lime zest until smooth. Stir in the yogurt and milk. Add the gelatin and mix well. Chill until ready to use. Spread the crust with the filling and top with whipped cream. Garnish with a dollop of the filling and a mint leaf.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray 9-inch pie plate with nonstick baking spray. In medium saucepan melt butter. Stir in caramel topping and heat until blended. Stir in 1/2 cup of the bisquick. Beat remaining 1/4 cup bisquick with milk and sugar. Pour caramel mixture into pie plate. Pour batter over caramel. Sprinkle pecans over batter. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes until golden brown. Cool for 20 minutes. Cut into wedges.

In a saucepan combine sugar, butter, onions, thyme leaves, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, reduce heat to low and simmer until onions are tender, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat, stir in vinegar, let stand 10 minutes. Serve on warm toast points or over lettuce with a bit of cheese on top.

Remove any yellowed outer leaves of the cabbage, and save these leaves to use later for lining the jars. Cut the cabbage head into quarters. Remove the core of the cabbage by cutting out the hard stem with the largest leaves still attached at the top of each quarter of the cabbage. Cut the leaves off the core. Cut the leaves away from the hard stem as you would for coleslaw. Chop the leaves into smaller pieces. Put the chopped leaves into the pot. Add the white vinegar, sugar, pickling salt, and boiling water. Boil for 5 minutes to soften the leaves. Pack the sauerkraut into hot jars. Leave 1 inch headroom for the kraut to expand during the fermenting process. Wipe the rim of the jar with a dampened cloth. Screw the lid onto the jar. Check the lids for leakage by turning the jars upside down. If any liquid leaks out around the lid, the lid is not properly seated. Tighten the jar lids further. When all the jars have been prepared, place them in the pressure cooker canner. Bring

In 10-inch skillet cooked onions in 1 tablespoon of butter over medium heat 5 minutes or until tender. Add 3/4 cup milk. Cook 1 minute. Add 3/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Whisk in 1/4 cup of frozen corn. Stir in 1 1/2 cups of frozen hash browns. Cook over medium heat 5 minutes. Add 1/2 cup of shredded cheddar. Stir in 4 large eggs. Cook over medium heat 5 minutes or until egg mixture is set. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon fresh basil. Serve with additional cheddar.

Slice steaks about 1/2 in. thick. Pound each steak to tenderize. In small bowl combine garlic cloves crushed to a paste with lime juice. Add salt & pepper. Rub into both sides of each steak. Heat oil in skillet over medium high heat. Add onions & saute until golden. Add steaks & brown on both sides. Reduce heat. Add garlic mixture & cook 3 minute. Turn steaks. Add parsley & serve.

Combine the first 6 ingredients well. Divide the mixture into 4 portionsshape each portion into a rectangular log. Divide the salmon into 4 portions. Press a portion of the log into the middle of each salmon portion to cover the salmon completely. Place the salmon portions on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 F for 30 minutes or until the salmon flakes easily with a fork.
Bring cola, brown sugar, lemons to a simmer over medium heat. Stir to combine. Remove from heat, add fresh ginger to taste and serve in a tumbler with a slice of fresh ginger on the rim.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a small heavy saucepan combine first 5 ingredients. Cook over low heat, stirring often, 20 to 25 minutes or until mixture comes to a boil and forms a thick paste that coats the back of a spoon. Place in 13x9 inch baking dish. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until top is shiny and bubbly. Cool. Serve warm or cold. Store in refrigerator for up to 3 weeks. Makes about 3 cups.
Combine yogurt, honey and cinnamon in a bowl. Spoon into 4 serving bowls. Top with peach slices. May also serve with granola, almonds or other fruit.

Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Remove the stem and seeds from the cloves of garlic. Finely chop them. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the chopped garlic and the chopped fresh herbs and cook until the mixture is fragrant and the herbs are just wilted, about 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and transfer to a large bowl. Stir in the olive oil, then add the chopped herbs and the fresh herbs to the mixture. Using a pastry brush, brush the top of the ciabatta with olive oil, then sprinkle with the chopped fresh herbs. Drizzle with olive oil and bake the ciabatta until golden brown and crisp on the outside and the inside is hot and soft, about 10 minutes. Serve with the butter.

Combine first four ingredients. Add beans and mix well. Combine next four ingredients and add to bean mixture. Beat until well blended. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake in preheated oven at 400 degrees for 45 minutes. Cool and serve.

Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray and arrange the wedges in a single layer. Roast until the flesh is tender and the skins are brown in spots, about 40 minutes. Sprinkle with brown sugar substitute, chili powder and cayenne. Toss and return to the baking sheet. Roast for 10 minutes. Toss and bake for 10 minutes more. Sprinkle with ketchup and serve.

Peel and cook turnips in a large pot of water until very tender. Mash coarsely with a potato masher. Stir in soda cracker crumbs. Set aside to cool. Add egg and blend thoroughly with a wire whisk. Add evaporated milk and blend thoroughly. Add seasonings and cheese. Mix well. Place in a greased crock pot and cook on low 3 to 4 hours or on high 2 to 3 hours. Remove from crock pot. Cool 30 minutes to thicken. Spoon into individual dishes and chill. Serve cold. Garnish with paprika if desired.

In a large bowl cream the sugar and butter until light and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. In a separate bowl combine the flour and cider vinegar. Add the vinegar mixture to the creamed mixture and beat just until combined. Pour the mixture into unbaked pie shells and bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Reduce the heat to 325 degrees and bake for an additional 30-40 minutes. Let the pies cool before serving. To make the topping combine the sugar and cornstarch and beat until smooth. Add the vanilla and milk and bring to a boil. Cook and stir until thick and pour over the cooled pies. Let cool before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine frozen dough rolls with 1/4 cup brown sugar and 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon. Press mixture into a greased 9 x 13 pan. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until lightly browned. While rolls are baking prepare pudding mix according to package directions. Stir in 2 tablespoons milk. Stir in the remaining 1/4 cup brown sugar. Pour over rolls and top with chopped nuts and cherries. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 300 degrees. In a large bowl, combine the first six ingredients and mix well. Spread in a single layer on a baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes, stirring every five minutes until the mixture is golden brown and crisp. Remove from oven and stir in vanilla and salt. Cool completely and store in an air-tight container.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). In a skillet cook bacon until crispdrain on paper towels. In a large bowl combine hash browns, bell peppers, cheddar cheese and bacon. In a small bowl combine the eggs, milk and seasoningsmix well. Add the egg mixture to the hash browns and toss gently to combine. Pour into a greased 1 1/2-quart baking dishbake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven.

Boil potatoes until tender, drain water and mash potatoes. Stir in sour cream and soup. Stir in cheese and mix well. Spoon into a greased baking dish. In a separate bowl mix together corn flakes and melted butter and sprinkle over potatoes. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes or until potatoes are heated through.
name: potato cakesingredients: potatoes, lemon peel, scallions, green peppers, eggs, bread crumbs, butter, cooking oilpreparation:Peel potatoes and grate them. Mix with scallions, lemon peel, green peppers, and eggs. Shape into cakes and roll in bread crumbs. Heat oil and fry the cakes until golden brown. Drain and serve with tartar sauce or sour cream.
name: potato ballsingredients: potatoes, onions, butter or margarine, sour cream, bread crumbs, seasoningspreparation:Mash potatoes with the other ingredients and form

Combine pork ribs and water in large heavy bottomed pot over high heat. Add garlic and onion. Bring to boil. Add tamarind soup mix. Lower heat and simmer until pork is tender. Add bok choy, daikon radish, and tomatoes. Simmer until vegetables are tender. Add potatoes. Season with salt. Simmer until potatoes are tender. Serve hot.

Peel and dice the sweet potatoes. In a saucepan melt the butter. Add the ground cinnamon, orange juice,. And salt and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer. Stirring frequently,. Cook for 20 to 30 minutes or until the potatoes are tender when pierced with a knife. In a small bowl beat the eggs together with the southern comfort, the pecans,. And the brown sugar. Pour the egg mixture into the saucepan with the potatoes. Cook, stirring constantly, for 5 minutes or until the mixture is thickened.

Beat eggs until light and lemon colored. Add sugar gradually and beat until fluffy. Add butter and vanilla. Add crushed pineapple and flaked coconut. Pour into unbaked shells and bake at 350 degrees F. for 45 minutes or until golden. Cool. Serve chilled.

Boil the water for the pasta. Saut the shrimp and garlic in the olive oil until the shrimp is almost cooked through. Add the diced tomato. Add the lemon juice. Add salt and pepper and cook until the sauce thickens. When the pasta is cooked, drain it and add it to the sauce. Toss and add the dill. Serve with a sprinkling of feta cheese.

Heat the oil in a wok or large non-stick pan. Add the garlic and chiles and stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add the ginger and stir-fry for another 30 seconds. Add the ground pork and stir-fry until brown. Add the fish sauce and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes. Add the green onions and cilantro and stir-fry until the mixture is evenly coated. Serve hot.

In pressure cooker combine all ingredients. Place in pressure cooker. Cook 45 minutes. Remove meat to a plate. Remove fat from pan. Return meat to pan. Include cooking juices. Simmer 15 minutes. Serve with your favourite vegetables.

Line 15 paper lined miniature muffin cups with foil. In a small saucepan combine the cocoa powder and 2 tablespoons water. Heat until it is smooth. Cool slightly. Melt chocolate. In a large mixing bowl beat egg whites at high speed until frothy. Add brown sugar and salt. Beat at high speed until thick. Beat in cocoa mixture. Add oil. Beat until glossy. Fold in chocolate. Spoon mixture into paper lined cups. Place in refrigerator until firm. To remove from cups, gently pull up foil. Cut with a sharp knife. Store in an airtight container.

Heat the broth to boiling in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook the asparagus until crisp-tender. Drain the asparagus, reserving 2 tablespoons of the broth. In a small bowl combine the broth and the butter until melted. Stir in the cashews until coated. Arrange the asparagus on a plate and spoon the butter mixture over the top.
asparagusA very healthy vegetable with many health benefits that you can serve at any meal or any time.
Asparagus is one of the most popular vegetables grown worldwide, it is available all year round, however the best time to eat them is between April to June when they are at their best. They are a very good source of folate which is essential for a healthy nervous system and a good source of vitamin A & C, iron, magnesium and fibre. It also helps to lower cholesterol levels and is a very good source of antioxidants such as glutathione.
Asparagus is one of the most delicious vegetables
In a food processor, process all ingredients. Transfer to a bowl. Chill for about an hour or until firm. Serve with bread or crackers.

Saute garlic and oil over medium-high heat. Add stock. Cover and simmer until vegetables are tender. Uncover and add cayenne. Stirring to blend. Add pasta. Cover. Remove from heat. Stirring often. Add dry sherry and stir. Serve topped with cheese.

Saute the garlic and the onions with the olive oil and the thyme. Add the rice and stir for about 5 minutes. Add the chicken broth and the green onions and cook for another 10 minutes. Fluff the rice with a fork and serve with the chicken.

Boil macaroni as directed on package. Drain well. While macaroni is hot, add the sliced ham, egg yolks, cheese, sour cream and salt and pepper. Mix well. Place in baking dish and bake for 30 minutes in 350 F oven. Sprinkle with parsley before serving.

Soak the chickpeas overnight. Drain and rinse well. Heat the olive oil and saute the onion and garlic until soft. Add the rice and stir until coated with the oil and garlic. Add the chickpeas and stir until coated. Add the water and saffron. Simmer for 20 minutes. Add the tomato puree and cook for a few minutes more. Stir in the lemon juice and season with pepper.
Potato and cheese bake
Potato and cheese bake

Rinse and chop collards. Boil ham hock in water for 30 minutes. Drain. In a large skillet, saute chopped onion in 2 tbsp. Oil. Add sugar, salt, red pepper flakes and garlic powder. Cook for 10 minutes. Add the cooked collards to the mixture. Add enough liquid from boiling ham hock to just cover the mixture. Simmer for 30-40 minutes or until tender. Remove hocks from broth. Shred the meat from the bone and stir in. Add the vinegar and liquid smoke to the broth. Serve over the cooked collards.

Chop onion. Add onion to saucepan. Saute onion for 3 minutes. Add spinach. Add rice and saute. Add tomato paste and mix well. Add water. Add chicken stock cube and dissolve. Add salt and pepper. Cook till rice is tender. Serve with beef or chicken dishes.

Blend corn with butter and bouillon cubes until smooth. Add sugar and seasoning and continue to blend. Heat and serve.
I was very impressed with this recipe and so was my family. I've never had cream corn before so I wasn't sure what to expect but this recipe was excellent! I made it last night and served it with baked chicken and steamed broccoli. I've made it again today and will be making it again tonight with baked chicken and steamed vegetables. It's so good I couldn't resist sharing it with others and will be making it again this week! Thanks so much for this recipe and I hope you post more of them soon!
I am so glad that you liked this recipe! Thank you for your comment!

Preheat oven to 190C. Grease a muffin pan and set aside. Sift together the flour and baking powder. Set aside. Beat the eggs and oil together. Beat in the sugar and the yoghurt until smooth. Stir in the amarettinis and plums. Add the dry mixture and mix well. Spoon into muffin cups and bake for 15-20 minutes or until golden and a skewer inserted comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack.

Place the slices of bread on a baking sheet. Spread a layer of boursin on each slice. Sprinkle the tomatoes over the boursin on one side of the bread. Season the other side of the bread with salt and place on top. Bake for 5 minutes or until the boursin is melted. Remove from the oven. Slice in half and serve.
name: asian eggplant sandwichesingredients: eggplant, asian sesame oil, soy sauce, ginger, scallion, red pepper flakes, sourdough bread, mayonnaisepreparation:Cut eggplant into 1/2 inch cubes. Toss in a bowl with 1 1/2 T. sesame oil and 1 T. soy sauce. Roast at 350 for 30 minutes. Chop ginger. In a separate bowl mix 1 T. mayonnaise and 1/2 T. sesame oil. Slice sourdough bread into 1/2 inch thick slices. Spread with the mayonnaise mixture. Arrange 2 T.
Combine rice, ginger glaze and pickled ginger in a bowl. Form into balls and roll in sesame seeds. Serve.

Brown ground beef with onion and garlic. Add seasonings. Cook until browned. Oamc- allow to cool completely, then wrap and freeze. To serve, thaw completely if frozen and cook as desired.
Sirloin tacos. Slow cooker taco meat. Chili mac. Sloppy joes. There are a lot of reasons to learn how to brown a pound of ground beef.
This quick and easy recipe for browning a pound of ground beef is one of my go-to recipes. It takes a few minutes to prep but you can set it and forget it. That's a win-win for me.
Place the ground beef in the bottom of a large skillet.
Add the onions to the ground beef.
Turn the heat to medium-high.
Stir the onions and meat around every few minutes.
When the meat is browned, drain it into a bowl.
Add the seasoning to the meat and stir it in.
It's important to add the seasoning as soon as you drain the meat because it will absorb the flavors.
This is great

Bring vegetable stock to a simmer. Add onions and saut until translucent. Add garlic and cook for another minute. Add button mushrooms and tomatoes and cook until tender. Blend until smooth and set aside. Heat olive oil in a fry pan and add tomato paste. Slowly stir in tomato sauce and cook until it has thickened. Add basil leaves and simmer. Remove from heat and stir in tapenade.

Clean the fresh white mushrooms. Add the mushrooms on the boiling water for 2 minutes. Remove the mushrooms from the boiling water and set aside for cooling. Cut the mushrooms into pieces and set aside for later use. Beat the egg with the milk. Mix the egg-milk mixture with the Italian style breadcrumbs. Dip the mushrooms into the egg-milk mixture and then dip the breadcrumbs on the mushrooms. Fry the mushrooms for 2 minutes on the oil over the low heat until the coating is brown. Serve the sauteed breaded mushrooms with pasta or rice.
Combine first three ingredients in small bowl. Add remaining ingredients except lettuce. Toss lightly. Spread lettuce leaves with dressingtop with salad. Sprinkle with chopped nuts.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large saucepan combine the sugar, flour, cocoa, and salt, stirring well. Slowly add the milk while stirring constantly until mixture thickens. Add the egg yolks, one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Stir in the vanilla and the butter. Pour into prepared pie shells. Bake for 20 minutes or until center is set. Cool on wire racks. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly coat 12x17x1 inch jelly roll pan with cooking spray. Combine first 3 ingredients in medium bowl, beat with wire whisk until well blended. Combine flour and next 3 ingredients in a separate bowl. Add flour mixture and 1 cup of milk alternately to egg mixture, beginning and ending with flour mixture. Beat until blended after each addition. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake 15 minutes or until puffed and set in center. Cool 10 minutes on wire rack. Remove from pan. Cool completely on wire rack. Makes 18 - 1 inch thick round waffles.

Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onions. Cook until the onions are tender. Add the artichokes and spinach. Cook, stirring often, until the spinach wilts. Stir in the cream cheese. Cook over low heat until the cheese is melted. Stir in the sour cream. Add the tabasco sauce to taste. Pour into a 2-quart baking dish. Sprinkle with the cheeses. Bake for 20 minutes or until the top is bubbly. Serve hot with crackers.

Preheat oven to 350f. For sauce combine soup, mayo, lemon juice and curry powder in a bowl. In bottom of 13x9x2-inch baking dish layer frozen broccoli, chicken, and sauce. Sprinkle with grated cheese and breadcrumbs. Bake for 30 minutes. Can be eaten plain or on top of rice.

Peel and cut up your potatoes and place in a large pot with enough water to cover and add a couple pinches of salt to taste. Boil for 20 minutes or so or until a fork can easily pierce your potatoes. Drain them and place them in a large bowl and then add a generous amount of butter and half-and-half cream and begin to mix. Add about 1/3 cup of sugar and then season with your choice of steak seasoning or just regular salt and pepper to taste. Then add some garlic powder and mix. You can add some chopped garlic or even a little bit of minced onion if you want to for more flavor and mix again until you have a smooth texture. Serve hot and enjoy!

Remove any visible fat. Soak for 10 minutes. Drain. Blanch for 5 minutes in boiling water. Drain. Combine water, oregano and 1 tsp. salt in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to medium-low. Cook until the liquid is reduced by half. Remove from heat and add lime juice. Add the pork skins to the oregano mixture. Return to low heat and simmer until the meat is tender and the skin is translucent. Drain and serve with lime wedges.

Stir boiling water into gelatin in large bowl at least 2 minutes until completely dissolved. Add sugarstir until dissolved. Add fruitstir until blended. Spoon into 2 glasseschill until set. Top each glass with 1/2 cup ginger ale just before serving.
In a large saucepan over low heat, combine butter and cream cheese and let soften until the cream cheese is completely melty and blended. Add the remaining ingredients and stir to combine and serve.

Cut onions into thin slices and place in a large saute pan. Add garlic cloves and saute until golden brown. Remove from heat and set aside. Roll out dough into rounds. Place one round of dough in the center of a cookie sheet. Brush with olive oil and sprinkle with garlic salt. Spread 1/3 of the caramelized onions and sprinkle with 1/2 the cheeses. Top with fresh basil and remaining cheeses. Bake for 15 minutes or until the crust is browned and the cheeses are bubbly. Cut into wedges and serve.
I made a batch of this tonight and it was so good! I used the recipe that you had listed and I am definitely going to make this again!
I will be trying this soon!

Heat oven to 425 degrees F. Melt butter in a 13 by 9-inch baking dish. Combine salsa con queso, onions, hash browns and 1/2 cup of the sour cream. Spread mixture over butter. Sprinkle with the remaining 1/2 cup sour cream and the cheese. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. Serves 4-6.
Combine veal and pork in a mixing bowl. Add egg and milk. Add cracker crumbs. Shape into small patties. Fry in hot oil until browned on both sides.

Combine all the marinade ingredients in a bowl and stir well. Place the wings in the marinade bowl and toss well to coat evenly on all sides. Marinate the wings for 30 minutes in the refrigerator, turning occasionally to coat evenly on both sides. Remove the wings from the marinade and drain off the excess liquid. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the marinated wings and brown evenly on all sides for about 10 minutes. Place the browned wings in a baking dish large enough to hold them in a single layer. Pour the remaining marinade into the baking dish over the wings and bake for 30 minutes at 400 degrees Fahrenheit or until the skin is crisp and golden brown. Serve hot.

These look yummy! I’m definitely going to have

Spread 2 tablespoons pureed chiles on 1 side of each bread slice. Layer 2 slices cheese, 2 tomato slices, red onion and cilantro leaves on each sandwich. Spread 1 tablespoon pureed chiles on outside of bread. Cook sandwiches in a skillet or griddle over medium heat until golden brown on both sides. Spread 1 tablespoon pureed chiles on outside of bread. Cook sandwiches in a skillet or griddle over medium heat until golden brown on both sides. Serve sandwiches warm.
In a large pot, add all ingredients except the whipping cream and crouton. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer. Stir in whipping cream and cook for 10 minutes. Serve with crouton.

In small saucepan over medium heat combine brown sugar, water and butter. Stirring frequently until sugar has dissolved. Add cinnamon, nutmeg, vanilla and stir for 1 minute. Add syrup and stir. Add the fresh pineapple slices and cook for 30 seconds or until pineapple is slightly heated through. Serve in shallow bowls or over vanilla ice cream.

Place water in bowl of electric mixer. Sprinkle in sugar and yeast and allow to dissolve. Add herbs and flour and beat on low to combine. Turn out dough onto lightly floured surface and knead until dough is smooth and elastic, about 5 minutes. Place dough in greased bowl. Cover with plastic wrap or clean kitchen towel and let rise in warm place for 1 hour, or until doubled in bulk. Punch down dough and divide into 2 equal balls. Place on lightly floured surface and shape each ball into rectangle. Fold dough into thirds like letterpress edges with finger to seal. Turn over and repeat. Place dough on greased baking sheet and let rise for 20 minutes. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes or until golden. Remove from oven and brush top with oil. Cool on wire rack.

Sprinkle the pork chops with the salt and pepper. Brown in the butter and oil. Sprinkle with the blue cheese and melt. Top with applesauce.

Put flour and salt in mixer bowl. Gradually add canola oil while running mixer at medium speed until well mixed. Gradually add ice water and continue mixing until dough forms ball. Turn dough out onto floured board and knead lightly. Roll to desired thickness and cut into shapes or strips. Bake at 400 degrees F for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Makes enough for 12 muffins.

In a medium bowl, combine the shallots, vinegar, sugar, salt, and pepper. Let the mixture sit for 20 minutes to allow the flavors to blend. Add the chicken broth and stir to combine. Set aside. In a medium saucepan bring the chicken broth to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer the broth for 10 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and strain the broth into a bowl. Discard the garlic cloves and chicken. Add the olive oil to the broth. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add the parsley to the broth and stir to combine. Serve the broth warm or cold with the chicken.

Prepare crescent rolls according to package directions. Heat oven to 350 degrees. Separate triangles. Place about 1 rounded teaspoon apple mixture on each. Roll up loosely. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Curve slightly. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown. Drizzle with glaze. Glaze: combine cornstarch with 3 tablespoons water in small saucepan. Bring to a boil. Stir in sugar and cinnamon. Stir until mixture thickens. Stir in orange juice. Cool 5 minutes. Stir in butter. Drizzle over warm crescents.

Heat oven to 425 degrees F. Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Add sweet red pepper and saute until crisp-tender. Remove from heat and stir in brie cheese and bacon until melted. Place in baked tart shells. Whisk eggs, whipping cream and cayenne pepper in a bowl. Pour into shells. Bake for 25 minutes or until eggs are set. Serve hot or at room temperature.

In a large bowl combine graham crackers and margarine. Mix well. Pat evenly into a 9x13-inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Cool completely. Spread cool whip over bottom of crust. In a separate bowl combine lemonade and ice cream. Mix well and spread over whipped cream layer. Garnish with strawberries. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
 mint-berry slushyingredients: frozen limeade concentrate, frozen apple juice concentrate, frozen lemonade concentrate, fresh blueberries, fresh mint leavespreparation:Combine limeade and apple juice concentrate. Scoop out plum flesh with a spoon or a melon baller. Put the flesh into a small bowl. Mix in the cream cheese. Spoon into a plum skin. Sprinkle with sunflower seeds and pumpkin seeds. Stick with a toothpick. Serve and enjoy.

Heat oil over medium-high heat in wok or large skillet. Add broccoli, celery and mushroomscook 4 to 5 minutes or until crisp-tender. Stir in tamari, garlic and gingercook 1 minute or until fragrant. Stir in brothbring to boil. Cook 1 minute or until slightly thickened. Stir in cornstarch mixture until blended. Stir in peppercook until heated through. Serve over rice.

Boil broad beans in salted water for about 5 minutes or until they are soft. Drain. Heat oil in a frying pan and fry the garlic for 30 seconds. Add the beans and tomatoes and saute for 1 minute. Add the gnocchi and toss until evenly coated. Remove from heat and sprinkle with basil and cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish. Combine 2 cups corn flakes, 1 cup oatmeal and 1/4 cup flour in a food processor. Process until corn flakes and oatmeal are very finely ground. Add 1/3 cup honey. Pour mixture into baking dish. Bake 12 minutes. Beat 3 eggs with 1/4 cup milk. Pour over corn flake mixture. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup chopped nuts and 1/2 cup dried apple. Bake 20 minutes more. Cool. Cut into 36 bars. Yield: 36 bars.

Heat the oil in a wok or skillet over high heat. Add the onion and the ginger and stir-fry until the onions are softened and golden brown. Add the garlic and corned beef and stir-fry until the corned beef is heated through and the liquid is almost evaporated. Add the bok choy and soy sauce and stir-fry until the bok choy is wilted and the sauce has thickened. Add the noodles and stir-fry until the noodles are heated through and the liquid is almost evaporated. Add the chicken broth and stir-fry for 30 seconds. Garnish with chopped green onions and serve immediately.

Cut french bread into 1-inch thick slices and place on baking sheet. In a small bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Brush both sides of the french bread with the mayonnaise mixture. Broil until golden-brown, turning once. Serve immediately.

Fry the chili peppers in the oil until dark brown. Cut into small strips. Cook the red onion in the remaining oil for about 10 minutes. Add the tomatoes. Add the creme fraiche and double cream and bring to the boil. Add the cheese and remove from the heat. Serve with the chili and onion strips and with the tortilla chips.
Mix beef, egg and breadcrumbs. Make into patties. Heat oil in pan. Fry patties until brown. Add gravy. Cover. Cook another 5-10 minutes. Serve with fresh vegetables.
Melt butter in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and corn and saut for 5 minutes. Add remaining ingredients. Cook for 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

Heat butter in skillet over medium high heat until melted. Add new potatoes (cut into small pieces) and sprinkle generously with salt and pepper. Saute until golden brown all over. Add parsley and toss.

Cook the first four ingredients in a medium to large pot over medium heat for about 15 minutes or until the onions are soft. Add the remaining ingredients and bring to a boil. Simmer until the potatoes are tender. I like to use an immersion blender to blend the soup until smooth. You can also use a food processor. Serve immediately.

In a 12 inch frying pan, cook bacon over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon. Cut bacon into small pieces. Add garlic and onion to fat in pan. Cook until onion is tender. Add tomatoes. Stir well. Add bacon. Add pasta. Cook for 2 minutes. Stir in parmesan. Season to taste. Serve immediately.

In a bowl add the flour, salt & freshly ground black pepper. Dip the pork chops in the flour mixture to coat both sides. Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the chops for 4 minutes on each side or until golden. Remove the chops from the pan & set aside. In the same pan, combine the cloves, sour cream & water. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the balsamic vinegar & bay leaves. Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes or until slightly thickened. Pour the mixture over the chops. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

This is the story of one of my favorite people and why I am the way I am. This is the story of how I was changed by my grandmother.
I was born in North Carolina in a hospital called Carolina Women’s Hospital. This was the hospital that my grandmother was a nurse at for most of her life. She was a nurse at Carolina Women’s Hospital for over thirty years and she was the head nurse at Carolina Women’s Hospital for most of her career as a nurse there. She started off working at Carolina Women’s Hospital as a nurse when she was only seventeen years old. She was very young when she started her career as a nurse at Carolina Women’s Hospital and she worked there for over thirty years. In a large bowl combine the barbecue sauce, honey and onion. Mix well. Add the flour 2 tablespoons at a time until the mixture becomes thick enough to coat the back of a wooden spoon. Mix in the yellow mustard to desired taste. In a slow cooker combine the beef short ribs, barbecue sauce mixture and enough water to cover the top layer of the ribs. Cover the slow cooker with lid and cook on high for 3 hours or until the beef is very tender and can easily be cut with a fork. Serve with potato salad or baked potatoes.

In a small bowl, mix hollandaise mix with water according to directions on package. In a small bowl, combine lemon peel, rosemary, seasoning salt and olive oilmix well. Rinse basil leaves under cold waterpat dry with paper towels. Cut each leaf in half. Place the basil in a large resealable plastic bagadd oil mixtureseal bag. Grill salmon 4-5 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Top each fillet with basil halves and lemon slicessprinkle with lemon peel. Serve immediately.

Brown the beef in a little fat. Add the rest of the ingredients, except the rutabaga. Cover and simmer for 1 1/2 hours. Add the rutabaga to the pot, cover again and simmer for another 45 minutes or until the rutabaga is tender.

Brown hamburger. Add onions and diced tomato. Add taco seasoning according to package. Add water- cover. Bring to boil. Add ramen noodles. Cook according to package. Remove from heat- add cheese. Let stand for 2 minutes. Divide ramen mixture among 4 ramen bowls. Top with tortilla chips- sour cream- salsa.

Prepare pancake mix according to the instructions on the box. Add milk, egg, vegetable oil, Oreo cookie crumbs, and bananas to the batter. Cook as you would regular pancakes. Top with strawberry syrup and vanilla frozen yogurt. Garnish with fresh strawberries.

Stem rhubarb and cut into 1/4 inch pieces. Stir together rhubarb, sugar, orange zest and juice, jalapeno and shallots. Simmer uncovered until rhubarb is soft. Cool. Cut into 1/2-inch pieces. Thread rhubarb onto skewers alternating with pieces of chicken. Season with salt and pepper. Grill over medium high heat until chicken is no longer pink in center. Serve with lemon wedges.

Cook beans for 2 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain and cool under cold running water. Drain. In a medium bowl, combine diced tomatoes and olive oil. Add balsamic vinegar and mix well. Add beans and toss to coat. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Saute the ground beef and onion in skillet. Drain the fat from the meat mixture. Add the rest of the ingredients to the skillet and stir well. Pour into a greased crock pot and cook for about 8 hours on high or about 10 hours on low heat. Serve over steamed rice or in buns if you prefer. Serves a crowd.
Combine all ingredients in a small bowl. Stir to mix well.

In a large frying pan over medium heat, combine water, lime juice, garlic powder, soup mix & oil. Cook 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add vegetables. Cook 2 minutes. Add cooked chicken. Cook until vegetables are heated through. Serve over hot cooked rice. If desired garnish with avacado slices.

In a skillet, heat olive oil. Saute the white onion until tender. Add the dried oregano and ground cumin. Cook for 1 minute. Add the lemon-pepper seasoning and cook for 30 seconds longer. Add the garlic clove and cook for 30 seconds longer. Add the diced chicken breast and cook until no longer pink. Add the salsa and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the black olives and cook for 2 minutes longer. Remove from the heat and stir in the shredded cheddar cheese. Spoon the mixture onto the tortilla shells. Garnish with the additional olives, if using.

Boil farfalle according to package directions. Drain. Heat 2 Tablespoons olive oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add garlicsaute 1 minute. Add green beans. Cook, stirring occasionally, until tender. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining 1 Tablespoon olive oil. Add tomatoes. Cook until thickened. Add farfalletoss. Add basil. Serve sprinkled with feta cheese. Garnish with chives.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, melt 4 tablespoons of the butter. Add the shallot, and cook for 1 minute. Add the mushrooms and cook, stirring occasionally, until they are tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Add the wine, increase the heat to high, and cook until almost evaporated. Reduce the heat to medium-low, add the garlic, and cook until it is tender. Add the pine nuts and cook until lightly browned. Add the sour cream and stir until it is smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a bowl. Serve warm or cold.

Drain pork and beans and combine with hot dog, onions and ketchup. Mix brown sugar and buttermilk together and add to pork mixture. Pour into greased 9x13 baking dish. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Remove from oven. Top with cheese. Bake uncovered for 10 more minutes.

Mix bisquick with dressing to form a crumbly dough. Heat oil in skillet. Dip each chop in dough, coating each side, then fry until golden. Remove from skillet, place in baking dish, and continue frying remaining chops. Remove from heat, pour over chops. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until done. Sprinkle with parsley for garnish. Serve hot.

Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Blanch the asparagus until tender about 2-3 minutes. Remove from the water and place in a bowl of ice water to stop the cooking process. Remove the asparagus and pat dry with paper towels. In a medium bowl combine the watercress, mayonnaise, sour cream, salt and pepper. Toss to combine. Divide the asparagus among 4 plates and top with watercress sauce. Serve immediately.

Combine rice with water in a large pot. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Lower heat, cover, and simmer until all the liquid has been absorbed and the rice is very tender, about 45 minutes. Remove from heat, cool slightly, transfer to a blender, and process in batches until smooth. Return to pot and add milk, vanilla extract, cinnamon and sugar. Heat over low heat until warm but do not allow to boil. Serve hot or chilled in tall glasses topped with whipped cream and cinnamon.

In a large 12 inch skillet heat oil over medium heat. Brown sausage, cut into 1 inch slices on all sides. Add potatoes and water to skillet, bring to a boil. Add vegetables and cook until tender. Reduce heat and add onion soup mix. Stir until well blended, simmering 5 minutes more or until potatoes are fork tender. Stir in sausage and serve.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saut the onion until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in the fennel bulb, garlic, red pepper flakes and escarole. Saut for 5 minutes. Add the garbanzo beans. Cook over low heat for about 10 minutes until escarole is tender. Season with salt and lemon juice. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Cook the elbow macaroni in boiling water until done. Drain and set aside. Heat up a frying pan with some oil. Fry up the ham until browned. Add the gouda cheese into the pan and stir. Add the elbow macaroni. In a separate bowl, mix the heavy cream with the bread crumbs. Pour the mixture into the pan. Stir the mixture for a few minutes until it’s all combined. Add a bit of black pepper and nutmeg. Stir again. Then pour the mixture into a greased dish. Bake for 20-30 minutes until golden brown. Serve.
Cut chicken into 1-inch cubes. Combine with 1/2 cup water. Mix soup, jam and rice. Spoon over chicken. Stir in 1/2 cup water and 1/2 cup chili sauce. Cover. Bake 45 min. Serves 4-6.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 9x5 loaf pan. Blend applesauce, sugar, and oil. Add egg, beat until smooth. Sift together dry ingredients. Add to applesauce mixture. Stir in nuts. Pour into loaf pan. Bake 50-60 mins or until golden. Cool 10 mins before removing from pan. Wrap, store at room temperature.

Combine beer, cheeses and flour in heavy large pot. Cook over medium-low heat, stirring constantly with wooden spoon until mixture is smooth, 6 to 8 minutes. Stir in mustard powder and pepper. Serve with cubes of bread.

In a small bowl, combine the chicken and the butter. Set aside to let chicken absorb the butter. Mix the yolks with the mayonnaise and tabasco sauce in a medium-sized bowl. Add the chicken mixture and mix well. Spoon into egg-white halves. Garnish with chopped celery and serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 2 hours.

Cut bread loaf into thin slices, about 1 inch thick. Place a slice of bread on a plate and spread it with a layer of mayo. Sprinkle with cheese and spread to cover with mayo and cheese mixture. Then top with a layer of chopped artichokes and a generous amount of minced garlic. Repeat process until loaf is gone, or until you get tired of making the layers. Serves 8 as an appetizer.

Mix together the sugar, oil, vanilla extract and chocolate syrup in a bowl until well blended. Pour batter into a baking pan and bake in the oven at 170°C for about half an hour or until the top is firm and springy. Cut into bars and serve warm or cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cream eggs, superfine sugar, vegetable oil, sour cream and orange juice until light. In a separate bowl, combine dry ingredients. Add to wet mixture, stirring just until blended. Pour batter into two greased 8-inch round pans. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutesremove from pans. Cool on wire racks. Combine the frosting ingredients in a bowl with an electric mixer. Beat until smooth. Spread frosting between layersspread top and sides of layers. Sprinkle top with chopped nuts.

Melt butter and saute onion. Stir in flour. Add milk and stir till smooth. Season. Pour in stock cube and bring to boil. Add haricot beans and simmer gently for about 10 minutes. Serve with parsley and sour cream.

In a small bowl, combine the vinegar, sugar, orange juice, and a pinch of salt and pepper. In a large bowl, combine the lettuce, pineapple, onion, and avocado. Add the dressing and toss well. Serve at room temperature. Makes 6 servings.

Cut the spaghetti squash in half and remove seeds and pulp with a spoon. Place cut-side-up in a baking dish with about 1/4" of water in the bottom. Cover and bake for about 1 hour or until the flesh is tender enough to pierce with a fork. Remove from oven and set aside to cool slightly while you prepare the topping. Melt the butter and saute the onions and red pepper flakes until the onions are translucent and starting to brown slightly around the edges. Add the fresh thyme and cook for 1 minute more. Remove from heat and stir in the sour cream and cheese. Set aside to cool a bit. Scoop the spaghetti squash flesh into a large bowl and add the topping. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Serve warm.

Combine juice, broth, and water. Add chicken breasts. Cover and simmer 20 minutes or until tender. Remove chicken from liquid. When cool enough to handle, cut into bite-sized pieces. Stir chicken into tortellini. Add seasoning mix. Add cheese. Heat through. Yields 6 servings.
