Marinate the fish in the olive oil and spices. Cook the pasta according to the instructions. Cut the tomatoes in half. Remove the seeds and the ribs from the fish. Arrange the fish and tomatoes alternately on the pasta. Sprinkle with capers and season well with salt and black pepper. Garnish with the cherry tomatoes. Sprinkle the pasta with the chopped herbs. Garnish with the finely grated Parmesan.

Dissolve gelatin in broth. Cool to room temperature. Whisk in red wine vinegar and onion juice. Beat egg yolk in large bowl with lime juice. Beat egg whites with salt and hot sauce until stiff. Add to yolk mixture with heavy cream and beat until smooth. Fold gelatin mixture into yolk mixture and then fold in the avocados. Chill until set. Garnish with diced avocados and fresh parsley or cilantro.

Combine heavy cream and superfine sugar in saucepan. Heat over low heat until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat and add the juice and zest of one lemon. Whisk in the powdered sugar. Divide between four ramekins and refrigerate overnight. Heat broiler. Sprinkle tops with powdered sugar. Broil for about 30 seconds. Serve immediately.

Clean the mussels by removing any beards. Combine the mussels, butter, garlic, tomato juice and chopped tomatoes in a large pot. Cover and cook for 5 minutes, stirring once. Add the wine, cover again, and cook for 3 minutes. Add the cream, season with pepper, lemon zest and parsley. Serve immediately with crusty bread.

Combine bacon, flour, cornmeal, milk, salt and pepper in a bowl. Mix to form a thick dough. Chill for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, cook green tomatoes in boiling water until soft. Drain. Mash and let cool. In a small bowl combine tomatoes, mayonnaise, vinegar and seasonings. Add green tomatoes and mix well. Chop bacon. In a frying pan, fry bacon over medium heat until crisp. On a lightly floured surface, roll dough out 1/8 inch thick. Using a 3 inch round cookie cutter, cut circles of dough. Place 1 teaspoonful of filling on each circle. Brush edges of circle with water. Place another circle on top. Press edges together to seal. Place sealed circles on a baking sheet. Bake for 25 minutes. Serve on sliced bread with lettuce leaf.

Prepare muffin batter as directed on package. Stir in mashed banana and egg. Spoon batter into 24 paper-lined muffin cups. Bake in 375 degree F oven 15-20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool 1 minute. Remove from pan to serve.

Place chicken breasts on a broiler pan. Brush both sides with olive oil. Combine lemon juice and herbs in a small bowl. Brush mixture over chicken and broil for 4 minutes. Turn over and broil 4 minutes longer. Brush with remaining mixture and broil 2-3 minutes longer.

Rinse the watercress thoroughly in several changes of cold water and drain in a colander or strainer. Blend together the watercress, walnuts, garlic and lemon zest in a food processor or blender until smooth. With the motor running, gradually add the olive oil in a stream until smooth. Add the Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper. Cook the pasta in boiling water for about 10 minutes or until just tender. Add the watercress pesto, cherry tomatoes, black olives and lemon juice. Toss well, then serve immediately.

Heat oil in large skillet. Add bacon. Cook until crisp and brown. Remove and drain. Add water, vegetables and oregano. Season with salt and pepper. Cover and cook until vegetables are crisp tender. Add kielbasa. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Serve over pasta or rice.

Make the brine by combining all the ingredients in a bowl and whisk until the sugar is dissolved. Put the shrimp in a large resealable plastic bag and pour the brine over them. Seal the bag and massage the brine into the shrimp. Place the bag in the refrigerator overnight. Next day, rinse the shrimp under cold running water and pat dry. Put the shrimp in a baking dish and drizzle with the olive oil. Sprinkle with the paprika and cayenne and mix to coat. Refrigerate for at least an hour or overnight. Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate. Cook the shrimp on the grill for about 3 minutes per side or until the shrimp are opaque. Remove from the grill and serve with the lemon wedges.

Cut off and discard the stem of each mushroom. Rub the cap with nonstick cooking spray and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast in oven at 450 degrees for 10-15 minutes or until tender. Serve with spaghetti sauce or marinara sauce.
name: portabella and onion topping for hamburgers ingredients: portabella mushrooms, spanish onion, garlic, olive oil, american cheese, red wine preparation:Heat oil in a non stick skillet. When burgers are almost ready, top with portabello mushroom mixture and a slice of cheese, continue grilling or broiling until cheese is melted.

Heat olive oil in a large pot. Add garlic and saute until just golden. Add salsa, refried black beans and broth. Stir to combine. Bring to boil and reduce heat to low. Add cooked black beans and cook for 15 minutes. Stir in sour cream and cilantro to taste.

Brown beef. Drain. Add cream of chicken soup and salsa. Simmer for 10 minutes. Spread in 9 x 13 inch pan. Top with crushed tortilla chips. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Serve with extra salsa.
Mix filling and cheesecake together in a large bowl and pour into pie crusts. Chill overnight. After chilling, top cheesecake with caramel and pecans.

In a large bowl, cream together butter and granulated sugar until smooth. Add the egg yolks one at a time and mix well after each addition. Stir in the vanilla extract and the baking powder. In a small bowl stir together the all-purpose flour and the saltstir the dry ingredients into the batter until just blended. Pour the batter into a pastry bag fitted with a 1/4-inch plain pastry tip. Pipe the batter onto the hot iron and spread out with a spatula to form a 5-inch round or cone shape. Bake until the edges begin to brown and the surface is setremove the iron from the hot plate and place on a cooling rack. Allow the cone or bowl to cool before serving.

Marinade chicken breasts 1 hour. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Heat olive oil in large skillet. Saute chicken breasts 2 minutes on each side. Bake 10 minutes. Combine remaining ingredients. Serve with marinated chicken breasts.

Mix first five ingredients in a large bowl and mix well with a fork. Add in vanilla and mix with a fork. Cook in a non stick skillet on med-high heat with 1 teaspoon of canola oil per pancake. Serve with low fat syrup, or fruit and 1 teaspoon of unsweetened applesauce.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).Peel and wash the parsnips. Cut the parsnips into 1/2-inch (1.5 cm) thick slices. Heat the oil and butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. SautÃ© the parsnips until lightly browned. Add the honey and salt, and stir well. Bake in the preheated oven until the parsnips are tender and the honey has thickened. Makes 4 servings.
Cook the bacon and crumble. Mix the mayonnaise with the prepared mustard until smooth. Spread onto slices of bread. Sprinkle with the bacon and the cheese. Cut into squares. Makes about 20 squares.

Peel potatoes and cut into cubes. Put into a saucepan with enough cold water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low and cook for about 20 minutes or until tender when pierced with a fork. Drain potatoes into a colander set over a bowl and let cool for a few minutes. When potatoes are cool enough to handle, return to saucepan and add butter, salt and pepper to taste. Mash well with a potato masher. Stir in sour cream and prepared horseradish. Serve immediately.

Chop red onion and jalapeno pepper. Mince garlic. Brown ground beef with onion and garlic in a large pot over medium heat until beef is no longer pink. Drain fat. Stir in cumin, kahlua, chicken broth, and grape tomatoes. Bring to a boil then simmer for 15 minutes or until tomatoes are tender. Serve in bowl garnished with green onions, sour cream, and tortilla chips.

In a skillet over medium heat, saute garlic and onion in olive oil for 2-3 minutes. Add chicken and cook until browned on both sides. Add salt and pepper. Add barley. Cover with stock. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer and cook until barley is tender. Sprinkle with parsley before serving.

In a saucepan combine sugar and milk. Bring to a boil and boil for 5 minutes stirring constantly. Remove from heat and add butter and vanilla. Stir until melted and smooth. Remove from heat and stir in marshmallows and chocolate stars. Spread into a greased 9x13x2 inch baking dish. Bake at 350 for about 10 minutes or until it starts to brown on top. Let cool completely and sprinkle with the chocolate chips and chopped nuts and refrigerate to set for about an hour. Cut into squares to serve.

In a sauce pan combine the dry ingredients. Gradually add milk. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook one minute, stirring constantly. Remove from heat& add egg yolks. Stir in vanilla & melted chocolate bars. Spread in pan. Chill.

Separate the eggs. Beat the whites until they stand in peaks then fold into the milk mixture. Pour into serving glasses. Whip the cream and top with a sprinkling of the grated nutmeg and a little grated chocolate. Serve with a little alcohol in the bottom of the glass.

Combine cilantro, almonds and jalapeno in food processor or blenderprocess until finely chopped. Add 1/4 tsp salt and 1/4 tsp pepper. With processor running, slowly add yogurt until mixture forms a paste. Add lime juice and process. Add olive oil, 1 Tbsp at a time until desired consistency is reached. Remove from processor, add remaining salt and pepper to taste. Slice flank steaks very thin across the grain. Place slices on platter. Drizzle with pesto. Garnish with cilantro.

Drain juice from crushed pineapple. Add crushed pineapple to can of coconut cream and stir well. Add 1 cup milk or water. Mix thoroughly and add marshmallows. Pour into a 9×13 pan and refrigerate for 2 hours. Mix together whipped topping and 1/2 cup coconut cream. Spread over top of creamy coconut salad. Garnish with remaining coconut cream. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Combine first 5 ingredients in a large mixing bowlbeat with an electric mixer on medium speed until fluffy. Beat in flour, baking soda and saltbeat until well blended. Stir in walnuts and gumdropsmix well. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire racks. Yield 3-1/2 dozen cookies.

Prepare pan. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly coat an 11 x 17 x 1-inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. Beat bittersweet chocolate and butter in a medium saucepan over low heat until melted and smoothstirring occasionally. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and cinnamon. Cool completely (about 10 minutes).Beat eggs and sugars in a large bowl until well blended. Stir in cooled melted chocolate mixture and vanilla extract until well blended. Stir in flour, baking soda and salt until just blended. Spread evenly in prepared pan. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool completely on a wire rack (about 2 hours). Cut into bars.

Brown burgers in skillet and place on grill. Grill onion slices until browned. Place onion slices on bottom of bun. Lay bacon on top of burgers, add slices of pineapple, sprinkle with salt and pepper, place on top of bacon and bun.
Put all the ingredients in a shaker. Shake well until combined. Pour into a glass filled with ice. Garnish with mint leaves and a tangerine slice on the rim.

Preheat oven to 375f. Line a baking sheet with foil and lightly grease foil with oil. In a small bowl combine brown sugar, cayenne pepper, and water until a paste forms. Remove the bacon slices from their packaging and pat dry with paper towels. Place the slices on the prepared baking sheet in a single layer and coat them with the brown-sugar mixture. Bake until the bacon is browned, about 30 minutes. Serve at room temperature.
I found a new site with great recipes for you to try. It has recipes for the grill, main dishes, sides, appetizers, sauces & spreads, soups & stews, casseroles & skillets, pizza & breads, pasta & noodles, salads & dressings, slow cooker, desserts & treats, cakes & cupcakes, cookies, bars & brownies and even recipes for the kids! The recipes are great for any time of year but especially good for summer! I found a recipe for grilled chicken pizza that I am
Combine all ingredients until blended and pour into two greased loaf pans. Bake at 350 for 45 min to 1 hour. Serve warm or cold with whipped topping.
In a large bowl, mix all the ingredients except the beef. Mix well. Add the beef and mix lightly. Form into patties and grill as desired.

Wash the vegetables well, then slice them up, put them into a large glass bowl, add the canning salt and the splenda granular to the bowl. Add 1/2 of the white vinegar and let it stand for 10 minutes or so, then add the remaining half of the white vinegar and stir it up well. Let it sit for 15-20 minutes and then add the remaining half of the splenda granular and stir it up well again. Then refrigerate for 24 hours before serving it.

Place chicken between 2 sheets of wax paper and pound until 1/4 inch thick. Dip into flour then milk and then crumbs. Fry in oil until golden brown on both sides. Combine soup and milk until smooth. Add to fried chicken and heat through. Top with swiss cheese and bake until melted. Serve on french bread.

Saute the onions and the veggie burger in olive oil over medium high heat in a pan until the veggie burger is golden. Add the chili and the tomatoes and stir. Add the coconut milk and the rice. Add the beans. Season to taste. Bring to a boil and let simmer until rice is soft. Serve with freshly grated cheese.

Combine vinegar, water and sugar in a heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium-low heat. Stir until sugar dissolves. Increase heat to medium-high and bring to a boilreduce heat to low and simmer until a candy thermometer reads 248F (120C). Add light corn syrup to mixturewhisk vigorously. Remove from heatlet stand 30 minutes or until cool and thickened.

Place the boiling water in a large bowl. Add the all-bran cereal and stir until softened. Add the white sugar and Crisco and mix well. Add the eggs and mix well. Add the buttermilk and mix well. Add the flour and mix well. Add the salt and baking soda and mix well. Pour batter into greased and floured 12 cup muffin pans. Bake at 375 for 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes before removing from pan.

Combine mashed potatoes with eggs and salt. Whisk thoroughly. Add cream of tartar. Bake in greased baking dish at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until light brown on top. Serve with butter.
name: mashed potatoes extraordinaireingredients: potatoes, cream cheese, sour cream, butter, onion powder, salt, pepper, paprikapreparation:Cook potatoes as usual in salted water until tender. Drain. Push through potato ricer. Add cream cheese in pieces. Add next 5 ingredients. Beat until smooth and fluffy. Scrape into a 2 qt casserole. Place dabs of butter here and there over the top of the potatoes. Sprinkle with paprika. Cover and heat in 350 f oven until heated through.
name: potato latkesingredients: potatoes, red onion, eggs, flour, salt and pepperpreparation:Shred potatoes and onions together. Squeeze in a towel until dry
Brown the meat in a large frying pan with a little olive oil. Add the remaining sauce ingredients to the pan and cook for 1 hour. Turn the meat once during the cooking time. Serve hot.

In a saucepan over low heat, stir together sugar substitute and butter until completely melted. Add the chocolate and stir until melted. Remove from heat. Cool 5 minutes. Stir in the vanilla and the liquid egg product. Beat the whipping cream with a wire whisk until stiff peaks form. Fold the whipped cream into the melted chocolate mixture. Chill for 1 hour or until set. Top with walnuts. Makes 4 servings. On no sugar added powdered sweetener.

Fry the bacon in a frypan and leave to cool. Chop up the bacon into small pieces and put it into a pot with the mince, celery and onions. Fry the mince until it has browned. Then add the rest of the ingredients and simmer for about 45 minutes or until the rice is cooked.
In a large bowl mash potatoes and peas. Add rice. Add egg. Add cheddar cheese and bread crumbs. Form into patties and roll in olive oil. Fry in hot pan until golden brown. Serve hot.
In a large bowl, combine the yogurt with the salt and pepper. Mix in the remaining ingredients. Cover and refrigerate. Serves 4.
Grease 13x9-inch baking dishmix baking mix, brown sugar and milkstir in apples and baconbake 20 minspread with cheesebake 10 min more

Cook bacon in a small skillet over medium heat until crisp. Remove from heatdrain well. Crumble the cooked bacon into small pieces. In a medium bowl combine the mayonnaise, basil, vinegar, mustard, salt, and pepperstir well. Set aside. Preheat the broiler with rack in the center position. In a large bowl toss the romaine lettuce with the canola oilspread in a single layer on a baking sheet. Broil for 5 minutes or until the lettuce is lightly browned. Remove from the ovenspread the tomatoes over the lettuce in a single layerdrizzle with the dressingtoss to coat well. Serve at once on the French bread slices. Makes 4 servings.

Cook the baby carrots in boiling water for 1 minute. Add the frozen yellow and green beans. Cook for 4-5 minutes or until tender. Drain. Cut the bacon into small pieces. In a large frying pan or skillet, cook the bacon. Add the vegetables to the bacon fat in the skillet. Saute until lightly browned. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Simmer over low heat for 1 minute. Serve warm.

In a large bowl combine brewed coffee, prune and flax seeds. Stir in canola oil, pure vanilla extract and sugar. In a medium bowl combine whole wheat pastry flour, cocoa and baking powder. Add to coffee mixture and mix well. Cover and chill at least 2 hours. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Roll into 1 inch balls and place on lightly greased baking sheet. Bake 10 minutes or until no longer shiny. Cool on wire rack.

In small saucepan combine dry milk powder and water. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in couscous. Cover and let stand 5 minutes. Stir in cherries and walnuts. Sprinkle with brown sugar and cinnamon to taste. Makes 4 servings.

Combine dry ingredients. Beat whites with mixer until stiff peaks form. Blend in remaining ingredients except for chips. Fold in chips. Turn into greased muffin pan. Bake 10-12 minutes at 350 or until edges are golden. Cool 1 minute then remove from pan. Makes 12 muffin-sized cakes or 24 smaller ones.

In a sauce pan, combine brown sugar, water and corn syrup. Bring to a boil over medium heat and boil for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in almonds and cereal. Pour mixture over ice cream and serve immediately.

Melt chocolate with butter in a saucepan over low heat, stirring constantly until smooth. Pour onto a parchment-lined baking sheet. Sprinkle nuts, dried cherries and toffee pieces over chocolate layer. Using the back of a spoon, lightly press the nuts into the chocolate layer. Let the chocolate set completely. Cut the chocolate layer into squares with a sharp knife.

Preheat oven to 350. In a large bowl combine Bisquick and cold water until well blended. Press 1/2 of the dough mixture into a greased 9x13 pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Spread with 1/2 of the meat mixture. Top with green pepper and tomato. Bake 30 minutes longer or until browned and done. Top with 1/2 of the remaining dough mixture. Spread with sour cream and sprinkle with 1/2 of the cheese. Bake 5 more minutes or until bubbly. Top with remaining dough mixture and remaining cheese. Bake 5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Cut into squares and serve with mayonnaise and additional sour cream if desired.

Mash bananas in a large mixing bowl with a fork. Sift flour into the bowl and add the other dry ingredients. Blend in the eggs one at a time with a fork then add the milk, melted margarine and the weet-bix stirring until just combined. Stir in the chocolate chips. Fill muffin cases 2/3 full. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Let the muffins cool for 10 minutes before removing from the tray. Makes 12 muffins.

Place tuna, vinegar, mustard, relish in a large bowl. Mix well. Divide rice between 4 lettuce leaves. Top each lettuce leaf with about 1/4 of the tuna mixture. Arrange the vegetables on top of the rice.
Break up coffee ice cube and put into a cup. Add a few scoops of the ice cream, a spoonful of the sugar then top with the whipping cream. Garnish with the chocolate shavings.

Mix first 6 ingredients in a large saucepan over low heat, stirring constantly until mixture boils and reaches 234f on candy thermometer. Remove from heat and add lecithin and vanillamix well. Spread in an 8x8-inch pan and chill until firm. Cut into bars or squares.

Melt baking squares and whipping cream in microwave. Add the butter and the vanilla and whisk until smooth and shiny.
I have a friend who makes the most amazing homemade chocolate candy every year for her family and friends. I would love to have this recipe!
I'd love to make these candy bars for Christmas. My favorite is the one with the pretzels and the one with the peanut butter cups!
I love that you're sharing this recipe! I'll be trying it out soon!
What a fun project! I love the idea of creating your own homemade candy! Thanks so much for the inspiration!
This is so cool!!!! I love candy bars!
I'm really loving these candy bars! They're so much fun to make and great for holiday gifts! Thanks for sharing your recipes and tips!
I love the candy bars that you made! They are so much fun! I really need to make some homemade candy this year!
Thanks for sharing these recipes. I want to make some candy bars for the holidays

Cream shortening and sugar. Add milk and mix well. Sift together dry ingredients and add to creamed mixture alternately with egg whites. Beat well. Bake in a 9 x 13-inch pan at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Prick with a fork and pour on warm maple syrup. Makes 24-30 pieces.

Saute onion and potatoes in vegetable oil. Add yellow curry paste. Add 3 cups of water and bring to boil. Add chicken and cook until done. Stir in coconut milk and cook until slightly thickened. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix flours, oatmeal and butter with a pastry blender. Add brown sugar and blend well. Add beaten egg. Mix well. Add mashed bananas and blend. Add milk and stir until smooth. Add salt and cinnamon and blend. Scoop into greased or paper lined muffin cups. Bake 30 minutes. Makes 12.

Place chicken in slow cooker. Combine remaining ingredients and pour over top of chicken. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours or high for 4-5 hours. Remove chicken from slow cooker and keep warm. In a small bowl, mix cornstarch and water to make a slurry. Stir into remaining liquid in slow cooker and cook uncovered for 5-10 minutes to thicken. Serve with chicken.

Peel and dice kohlrabi. Toss with scallions and red onion in a large bowl. Add cheese and mix well. In separate bowl combine mayonnaise and mustard and season with salt and pepper to taste. Toss with kohlrabi mixture and serve.

Place tomatoes in small bowl. Drain the juice from the can. Place the tomato juice in a small saucepan and boil over medium high heat until reduced by half, approximately 10 minutes. While juice is reducing, chop tomatoes in small dice. Cube onion. Chop garlic cloves. Melt butter in a large skillet. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened. Add garlic and cook an additional minute. Add the herbs. Add the chicken broth. Add the chicken and cook until browned on both sides. Remove from heat. Stir in the tomato juice. Spoon half of the mixture in the bottom of a greased casserole. Top with half the cheese. Spoon the remaining mixture over the cheese. Sprinkle the remaining cheese over the top. Bake at 375 F. for 25 minutes.

Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and mix well. Lightly grease a 2 quart casserole dish. Press the mixture into the dish. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 50 to 60 minutes. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Return to the oven and broil until the top is golden. Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting.

Sauté potatoes and onions in olive oil until lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Beat eggs in bowl with parsley, salt and pepper until foamy. Add to potatoes and onions in skillet, lower heat and cook for 3-4 minutes until set and bottom is golden brown. Turn omelette out onto plate and cut into wedges to serve.

In a large pot of boiling water add the potatoes and cook until they are tender. Stir in the sour cream, mash and season with the rosemary, butter, salt and pepper. Mash well to make a thick consistency. Serves 4 to 6.

Grease a 9 inch tube pan, set aside. In a small bowl, combine butter, garlic powder and mustardset aside. Unroll the canned biscuits and break into pieces. Combine the pieces with the butter mixture and place into the greased panset aside. In a small bowl, combine the egg yolks and milkstir well. Pour the egg mixture over the biscuit mixturestir gently to combine. Sprinkle the top with the Parmesan cheeseset aside. In a small bowl combine the melted butter and brown sugarstir until smooth. Drizzle over the Parmesan cheeseset aside. Beat the egg whites until stiff peaks formfold into the brown sugar mixtureset aside. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 35-40 minutesremove and let cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan.
If you have any problems with the registration process or your account login, please contact us. Have a nice day!

Cut the chicken breasts in half and pound flat with a meat mallet until they are about 1/4 inch thick. Dip the chicken in the egg wash and then into the bread crumbs to coat on both sides. In a skillet heat the butter until it is melted and the foam subsides. Add the mushrooms and saute until tender. Add the chicken and cook for a few minutes on each side until they are cooked through. Add the cream of mushroom soup and cook for another minute or so. Top with the mozzarella cheese. Put the skillet in the oven and bake for about 5 to 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Serve hot.
Mix together first three ingredients. Add salt to taste. Fry in oil over medium high heat until golden brown. Drain on paper towel.

Prepare the crust by mixing 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup sugar and 1/2 tsp of salt. Cut in 1/4 cup shortening and 4 tbsp of ice water until dough forms a ball. Chill in refrigerator for 30 minutes. On a lightly floured surface roll out the dough into a 12-inch round. Transfer the dough to a 9-inch pie plate and flute the edge. Bake at 400 degrees until the crust is golden brown, about 10 minutes. Combine the remaining 1/2 cup sugar and 2 tbsp of water in a medium sauce pan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Boil for about 2 minutes until the sugar dissolves. Add the remaining 1 cup of water and the lemon juice and bring to a boil for about 3 minutes. Remove from the heat and allow to cool until it is lukewarm (about 105 degrees F). While the custard is cooling, place the watermelon cubes in a food processor and pul

Place the fish in a large pan or dish that will fit it snuggly with the skin side down. Combine the mirin, soy sauce and the grated ginger and pour over the fish. Cover the pan with foil and bake for 30 minutes or until the fish is cooked. Turn the fish over and cook for another 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and place on a serving platter. Brush the fish with a mixture of honey and hot sauce (I use a bit of Tobasco) and sprinkle with chopped garlic and green onion. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with rice.

Heat oil in skillet. Add sausage. Brown sausage. Add vegetables. Add beans. Add red pepper flakes. Simmer for 10 minutes. Place sausage/bean mixture in 9x13 baking dish. In a separate bowl combine sour cream, mustard, black pepper, and salt. Spread over sausage/bean mixture. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes.

Roll out the puff pastry thinly. Cut it into strips and lay them out flatly. Spread the egg yolks and sugar mixture evenly on each strip. Drizzle with the milk, and sprinkle the flour on top. Bake at 350 F for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Meanwhile prepare the filling. Melt the heavy cream and unflavored gelatin. Stir in the egg yolks and vanilla extract. Spread the filling evenly on the pastry strips and bake for 15 minutes. Cool for 15 minutes and cut into squares. Serve at room temperature. Garnish with orange zest.

Combine apples and splenda in medium saucepan. Stir in lemon juice and cinnamon. Add water, cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Stir occasionally. Remove from heat. Stir in butter. Taste and adjust sugar. Add granola and milk. Simmer over low heat for 2 minutes. Serve immediately. Top with cream.

Mix together the dressing ingredients. Peel, pit and slice the peaches. Slice the cucumber. Toss together with dressing and refrigerate. Toss together the raspberries and mint. Drain off excess dressing and arrange the fruit mixture with the lettuce leaves. Arrange with the fruit mixture and serve.

Brown hamburger and drain. Cook spaghetti noodles according to package directions. Saute mushrooms and add to meat mixture. Add seasonings, butter and vegetable oil. Toss in noodles and serve. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve with a garden salad and garlic bread.

Pour the vodka into the triple sec and sour mix. Blend together and pour into cups. Pour the lime and lemon into a separate bowl. Stir together and pour into cups. Refrigerate for 1 hour.
Bring water to a rolling boil, then remove from heat. Stir together boiling water and powdered gelatin in a mixing bowl. Stir constantly until gelatin is completely dissolved. Stir in cold water and alcohol. Pour mixture into, individual shot-size plastic or paper cups. To make the jello easier to consume, buy plastic cups that also have lids. Pour the mix into the cup, add the lid, then turn it upside down prior to refrigeration. Place shots on a tray in refrigerator. Chill until firm. Refrigerate until served.
Pour the vodka into the triple sec and sour mix. Blend together and pour into cups. Pour the lime and lemon into a separate bowl. Stir together and pour into cups. Refrigerate for 1 hour.
Saute the sausage in olive oil. Add the green bell peppers and cook until tender crisp. Deglaze with the red wine and stir until the wine is almost evaporated. Add the salt and pepper to taste.

Bring the quick oats, butter, light corn syrup, brown sugar, and milk to a full rolling boil in a heavy bottomed pan over medium heat. Remove from heat and stir in the peanut butter until well blended. Stir in the milk chocolate chips. Pour mixture into an 8 x 8-inch pan and cool. Cut into squares.
Mix all ingredients. Chill. Add water. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 13x9x2 inch baking pan with cooking spray. Line pan with graham cracker squares. Melt butter and sugar in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Stir in pecans and vanillapour over the top of the squares. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Top with chocolate chips. Bake for an additional 2 minutes. Allow to cool completely and break into pieces.

Slice onions and saute in butter in a large pot. Add 2 cups of broth and bring to a boil. Add coca-cola and simmer for 10 minutes. Season with salt and vinegar. Cut a loaf of french bread into 2 inch cubes. Float in soup. Top with shredded parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until bread is toasted.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Spread sausage evenly in the bottom of a 13x9-inch baking dish. Unroll crescent rolls. Spread evenly over sausage. Sprinkle with hash browns and sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Mix together the cream, eggs, salt and pepper. Pour mixture over the hash browns. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake 35-40 minutes, or until golden brown. Serves 4 to 6.

In a 2-quart saucepan, thoroughly combine sugar and flour. With wire whisk, gradually stir in milk until smooth. Cook over medium-high heat, stirring frequently, until mixture has thickened and boils. Reduce heat to low. Cook 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and cool completely. In medium bowl, with mixer at medium speed, beat butter until light and fluffy. Gradually beat in milk mixture. Beat in cocoa. Beat in vanilla. Beat in the melted chocolate until smooth.

In a large skillet over medium high heat, add onions & green pepper. Cook until onions are tender crisp and pepper has softened. Add Italian sausage, crumbling as you cook it. Cook until browned. Add Alfredo sauce and mix well. Serve over pasta.

Cut up chicken in small pieces. Saute onion in margarine til brown. Add mushrooms. Add bouillon cubes. Add salt and pepper. Add chicken pieces and stir til brown. Then add in 3 cups of water. Cook til done. Remove from heat. Put in rice cooker. Cook till rice is done.

Combine all dry ingredients in large mixing bowl. Melt margarine and add other liquids. Add to dry ingredients and stir well. Add nuts and pretzel sticks. Spread evenly into roasting pan. Bake at 250 degrees for 1 hour or until brown and crunchy.
name: the chex mix challengepreparation:A few days before the Super Bowl, invite some friends over for a fun Super Bowl party. Set out bowls of Chex Mix (preferably red, white and blue), and a bowl of Cheez-It snack mix (preferably orange and blue). Have your guests sample both types of snacks and then vote for their favorite. If your guests are sports fanatics, they can even vote by wearing the colors of their favorite team. The winner gets bragging rights for the next year!
name: the cereal bowlpreparation:Using a medium size bowl, add the Chex Mix, cereal, pretzels and nuts. In a separate bowl, add the brown sugar, water and baking soda. Stir and let stand for

Marinate the chicken with the lemon juice, coriander, oregano, garlic cloves and olives for 4 hours. Skewer the chicken pieces with small wooden skewers. Thread the olives in between the chicken pieces. Thread the green olives in between the chicken pieces. Heat the olive oil in a deep heavy-based pan until very hot. Add the skewers and turn them around until all sides are browned. Add the lemon. Bring to the boil and cook for a further 3-4 minutes. Sprinkle with the parsley and serve immediately.

Heat olive oil in large skillet. Add garlic and cook over medium heat for 2 minutes. Add shallot and cook for 3 minutes. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Remove from heat. Add craisins and bacon and stir to blend. Sprinkle with feta. In small bowl, whisk lemon juice and balsamic vinegar. Pour over salad and toss to coat. Serve warm.

Slice a baguette on the diagonal into 1/2-inch pieces. In a heavy skillet over low heat, melt 2 ounces of bittersweet chocolate with 1 tablespoon olive oil. Place the bread pieces in a single layer in the skillet. Sprinkle with coarse sea salt. Cook until the bread is crisp on one side. Flip over with a spatula. When the bread is crisp on both sides, remove it from the skillet. Serve hot.
In a small bowl, mix the olive oil and crushed garlic cloves together. Spread the mixture onto the toasted bread, sprinkle with the oregano and salt to taste. Serve immediately.

Pre heat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a 9×13 inch baking pan with aluminum foil. In a saucepan over medium low heat, melt butter and combine with sugar and vanilla extract. Remove from heat and allow the mixture to cool. Stir in the eggs one at a time. Sift together the flour and cocoa powder and then stir into the chocolate mixture until just combined. Stir in the chocolate chips and spread the batter into the prepared baking pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the brownie comes out clean. Allow the brownies to cool completely before cutting into bars and serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a casserole dish with butter or margarine. Layer half the potato slices in the dish, then sprinkle with half the salt, white pepper, and onionrepeat layers. In a saucepan, combine the heavy cream and the remaining salt, white pepper, and onionbring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens and is just beginning to boil. Pour the mixture over the potato layer, cover with aluminum foil, and bake for one hour. Uncover, and bake an additional ten minutes.

In a large dutch oven or stock pot, saute meat until done. Remove meat from pot. Add the sausage to the pot. Cook the sausage until browned. Add the tomato paste and the vinegar and stir to combine. Add the meat back in to the pot and stir. Add the cabbage and stir to combine. Add the chili powder to the pot and stir to combine. Simmer the pot for 45 minutes to 1 hour, stirring occasionally. Serve over rice if desired.

Preheat grill to medium high. In a medium bowl, combine all ingredients except the bacon. Toss well. Place bacon slabs on grill and cook for 3-4 minutes or until bacon is crispy. Transfer bacon to paper towels to drain. Add bacon to the bowl and toss. Let sit for 10 minutes. Serve warm or cold.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Put potatoes in a bowl. Pour oil over them and toss until well coated. Add 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon cayenne. Roast in oven until tender when pierced with a fork. Meanwhile, toss lemon zest with black pepper in a small bowl. Add garlic to a large skillet over medium heat. Cook until aromatic, about 30 seconds. Add shrimp. Cook until opaque. Add parsley and cook for 30 seconds. Toss with the prosciutto. Toss the potatoes with 2 tablespoons of parsley. Divide among 4 plates. Top with roasted shrimp prosciutto mixture. Serve immediately.

Soak red radishes in brine mixture of water, rice wine and soy sauce in a sealed jar. Leave for about 5 hours. Drain and add a few fresh coriander leaves and a few granules of garlic. Serve as a side dish.

Bring broth to a boil in a medium saucepan. Stir in barley, reduce heat to low and simmer until liquid is absorbed about 20 minutes. Stir in tomatoes and seasonings. Bring to a simmeradd beans and chicken and cook for another 10 minutes. Top with shredded cheese and cilantro. Serve with cornbread or warm bread.

Melt 2 tablespoons of the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic cloves and shallotsaute for 2 minutes. Stir in the lemon juice, lemon slice, 1/2 teaspoon of the fresh herb, the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter, and the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Add the spinachcover and cook until the spinach is wilted. Stir in the shrimpcook for 2 minutes. Season to taste. Serve on toasted bread.

Brown the chicken breasts on a hot pan for a few minutes on each side. In a saucepan, combine the tomato puree, garlic cloves, paste, butter and coriander seeds, cook until the sauce thickens then add the cream and cook until thickened. Serve over the rice.

Cut bananas into slices. In large frying pan, melt butter over medium heat. Add bananas, cinnamon, rum, and vanilla extract to pan. Cook 5 minutes or until bananas are tender. In another pan, melt maple syrup over medium heatstir in pecans. Arrange bananas on waffle halvestop with pecans. Drizzle syrup over bananas. Garnish with whipped cream.

Mix the first 7 ingredients and blend into a smooth dough. Set aside 3/4 cup of the mixture for the topping. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a large bowl combine spinach with the pesto and cheese, mixing well. Spray the muffin cups with cooking spray. Divide the spinach mixture evenly among the 12 cups. Flatten the topping mixture over each muffin. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown on top. Cool for 5 minutes and then remove from the cups and serve.

Melt the butter in an 8-inch square baking pan or a 2-quart casserole dish. Add the rice and saute for 3 minutes or until lightly browned. Season with the salt and pepper. Add the consomme and stir well to combine. Add the water gradually, stirring constantly to avoid lumps. Bring to a boil and then simmer 20 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed. Spread the blanched almonds in the bottom of the pan to form a layer about 1/4-inch thick. Cover the layer of almonds with the cooked rice mixture. Sprinkle evenly with the remaining almonds. Bake the rice at 350 degrees F for 15 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Makes 4-5 servings.
