rice brown

In a saucepan, bring water and granulated sugar to a boil. Add the melba sauce packets and stir until melted. In a small bowl, combine melba sauce mixture with 1 pkg cool whip, kirsch liqueur, and fresh strawberries. Serve over the remainder of the cool whip.

Heat oil over medium heat. Add onion and cook until translucent. Add peppers and cook for a few more minutes. Add the frozen edamame. Cook for a few more minutes. Add the corn, chicken stock, parsley, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil and cook for a few more minutes until stock is absorbed.

In a small bowl, mix together cheese, herbs and pepper. Place 2 teaspoons of cheese mixture on each pastry triangle. Fold two sides of each triangle to middle and press edges together to seal. Beat egg with 2 teaspoons water and brush over pastry. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Place on a baking sheet and bake in a 400 degree oven for 12-15 minutes or until pastry is lightly browned. Cool.

Wash the tomatoes under running water. Cut into halves or quarters. Peel the avocados and dice them. Slice the mozzarella. Arrange the tomatoes in a decorative pattern on a plate. Scatter the diced avocados over them. Dribble over a little olive oil and season with the lemon juice. Sprinkle the mozzarella over the top. Garnish with the marjoram leaves.

Preheat oven to 350f. Line a 9x13x2-inch baking pan with wax paper, leaving overhang on 2 sides for easy removal of brownies later. Crush vanilla wafers in a plastic bag, using a rolling pin to help crush the cookies. Combine wafer crumbs, sweetened condensed milk and butter in a mixing bowl and mix until well blended. Press 1 1/2 cups of the mixture into the prepared pan and set aside. Combine all other ingredients in a heavy saucepan over medium heat, cooking until thickened to a smooth caramel sauce consistency, stirring constantly. Pour over the prepared crust. Top with remaining wafer crumbs. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until done. Remove from oven and sprinkle with shredded coconut and chopped pecans. Allow the brownies to cool completely in the pan on a wire rack before cutting into bars. Makes 32 servings.

Place 2 cups of yellow corn grits, 4 cups of boiling water and 1 teaspoon of salt into a large saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 30 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed. Add 4 tablespoons of butter and stir.
Heat grill to medium heat. In a large bowl combine all ingredients. Form into 4 patties and grill 6-8 minutes per side or until cooked through. Serve on buns with lettuce and tomato slices.

In saucepan boiling water and rice. Let boil for about 15 minutes or until water is absorbed. Meanwhile melt butter in 9 x 13 baking dish over medium heat. Stir in corn, onions and bouillon and mix well. Cook until onions are tender and mixture is lightly browned. Add cooked rice and stir to combine well. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes uncovered. Serve and enjoy.
Mix all ingredients in blender or food processor until smooth. Makes about 1 cup.

Beat together cake mix, oil, eggs and water. Blend well. Place 1 tbsp mixture on graham cracker square. Top with 1 tbsp morsels. Bake in a 350 degree oven until lightly browned on edges. Makes 24-36 treats.

In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the chicken in oil for 5 minutes per side or until no longer pink. Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces. Add watercover and simmer for 10 minutes or until no longer pink. Mix together the stuffing mix, cheese and milkspread over the top of the chicken. Bake for 10 minutes or until the stuffing is heated through. Garnish with fresh broccoli if desired. Serve as an entree or side dish.

Cut chicken into small pieces. Place in a bowl. Add garlic powder, pepper and season with salt and cayenne. Mix well. Form into small balls. Heat olive oil in a skillet. Add breadcrumbs to the skillet. Place meatballs in the skillet. Brown on all sides. Serve.

Line 13 x 9 dish with crushed vanilla wafers. Layer with sliced bananas and blueberries. In blender or food processor, combine all remaining ingredients until smooth. Spread over blueberries. Chill several hours or overnight. Top with remaining crushed wafers just before serving.

Brown the meat. Add cumin, and the juice of the pickled hot pepper. Add the rest of the ingredients. Spray a skillet with non-fat cooking spray. Add the meat mixture. Add a small amount of the mixture to each side of a flour tortilla. Top each side with cheese. Heat on medium until the cheese is melted. Cut into wedges. Serve warm.
Name: Sausage Con Queso Dip
Ingredients: Lean ground beef, hot Italian sausage, onion, mushroom soup, diced tomatoes with seasonings, Velveeta cheese, jalapeño peppers, hot salsa, tortilla chips
Preparation:Brown ground beef, sausage meat and onion. Drain fat. Add the rest of the ingredients. Simmer until the cheese melts. Serve warm with tortilla chips.
Name: Quick and Healthy Black Bean Quesadillas
Ingredients: Black beans, salsa, onion powder, dried oregano, cayenne pepper

In a large saucepan, heat 3 tablespoons olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the onions and saute until golden. Add the garlic and capers. Cook until fragrant. Add the crushed tomatoes, season with salt and pepper, and stir. Let simmer for 20 minutes. Preheat the oven to 375. Season the cod with salt and pepper. Lay it on top of the sauce in a baking dish. Sprinkle with the basil. Bake for about 15 minutes until flaky. Serves 4.

Boil water and milk in large pot. Add butter, onion soup mix, cornmeal, and yellow corn. Stir constantly until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in whole kernel corn, bell pepper, jalapeno peppers, and cheddar cheese. Serve with crackers or pita wedges.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile brown ground beef and onion in large skillet. Stir in remaining ingredientsbring to a boil. Cook until pasta is tender, stirring occasionally. Sprinkle with cheese. Cover and cook until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.
Hunger is a powerful motivator that drives people to find food even when the food is not healthy, as the researchers found when they asked study participants to recall their last unhealthy snack or meal. They found that the hungrier people were when they ate the food, the more likely they were to rate that food as tasty, satisfying and healthy.
"Even if the food is not nutritionally dense or healthy, people will still find it to be tasty, satisfying and healthy if they're hungry," said lead author Brian Wansink, professor of marketing at Cornell University. "This shows that when we're hungry, we tend to forget about healthy foods and go for unhealthy foods."
In the study, published online in the Journal of the American Dietetic Association on Sept.

Sift flour, coconut, baking powder, and salt into a large mixing bowl. Cut in butter with pastry blender or fork, just until mixture resembles fine crumbs. Combine egg and milk in a small measuring cupstir into dry mixture just until moistened. Stir in 1/2 cup of coconutspoon batter into 12 paper lined muffin cups. Sprinkle each muffin with remaining 1/2 cup of coconut. Bake at 375 for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in pan 5 minutes. Remove from pancool on wire rack. Dust with icing sugar if desired.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat 1 teaspoon of the oil. Add the chard leaves, 1 teaspoon of the salt and the garlic. Cook until wilted, 2 to 3 minutes. Transfer to a plate. In the same skillet over medium-high heat, heat 2 teaspoons of the oil. Add the squash halves. Cook until tender, turning once, 20 to 25 minutes. In a small saucepan over medium-high heat, melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of the oil. Add the remaining 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Add the chard and the gruyere. Cook until heated through. Spoon half of the chard mixture into each acorn squash half. Bake for 30 minutes. Broil for 2 minutes. Serves 2.

In shallow bowl combine mustard, juice and brown sugar. Add salt and pepper to your taste. Add chicken to marinadeturn to coat. Refrigerate 2 hours. Heat oven to 375. Heat oil in skillet over med-high heat. Brown chicken 2 minutes on each side. Place in shallow baking dish. Bake 20 minutes. Serve over rice.
In a medium bowl, beat cream cheese and salad dressing mix until well blended. Stir in cucumber and dill. Spread over bread and sprinkle with paprika. Cut into triangles and serve immediately.

In a large bowl, mix together the milk, eggs, sugar, vanilla extract, and salt. In a separate bowl mix together the cooked rice and light raisins. Add the rice mixture to the custard mixture in the large bowl. Mix well. Pour into an unbaked pie shell and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Cool thoroughly before cutting into wedges.
Cut bananas into thin slices about 1/4 inch thick and place in bowl. Mix peanut butter and honey together and pour over bananas. Sprinkle with coconut and serve.

Sauté vegetables in oil over medium heat for 3-4 minutes, or until tender. Remove vegetables from pan and place in bowl with remaining ingredients. Cool and pour into tortillas. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot with salsa and sour cream.

Drain split peas and put in a large pot with the rest of the dry ingredients. Add enough water to cover. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer until tender 45 minutes. Cool to room temperature. In a bowl combine flour and baking powder. Add a few tablespoons of water and mix well. Add to pot and cook until smooth. Heat oil in a frying pan. Drop batter into hot oil 1/4 cup at a time and fry until golden brown. Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Serve with spicy mango chutney.

In a small bowl combine the horseradish, vinegar and old bay. Place the shrimp in a baking dish and coat with the horseradish mixture. Bake until the shrimp is cooked through. Remove from oven. In a small pan cook the bacon until crispy. Drain and reserve the bacon grease. In a small pan saute the shrimp with a little olive oil until cooked through. In a small bowl combine the remaining olive oil and the balsamic. Toss the shrimp in the olive oil and balsamic mixture. Top with a piece of bacon and a slice of lemon. Serve with toothpicks.

Place the butter in a saucepan with the desiccated coconut and gently melt over a low heat. Remove from the heat and cool. In a large mixing bowl beat the eggs with the sugar until pale and creamy and then gradually add the caster sugar and beat until the mixture is thick and creamy and holds its shape when lifted in a spoon. Gently fold in the almonds and the desiccated coconut until well combined and place the mixture in a greased and lined 20cm springform cake tin and bake in the oven for 45 minutes or until golden brown and just set. Remove from the oven and leave to cool a little before removing the tin and spreading the jam over the top of the cake. Allow to cool fully before dusting with icing sugar to serve.
Coconut milk is the liquid that is found inside the coconut fruit and can be easily found in Asian grocery stores. It has a milky consistency and a rich and distinct flavor and is used in many Asian dishes, desserts and drinks such as Thai curries and Vietnamese coffee.
You can

Slice potatoes into small wedges. Slice onions into thin strips. Dice green bell peppers into small pieces. Cut tomatoes into small pieces. Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add potatoes and cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring frequently. Add green bell peppers, onions, roma tomatoes, cayenne pepper, salt and pepper. Continue to cook for 3-4 minutes stirring frequently. Break the eggs into a small bowl and add salt and pepper as desired. Pour in 2 tablespoons of olive oil into the skillet. Carefully pour in the egg mixture into the skillet. Turn heat to low and cook for 2-3 minutes until eggs are just cooked through, stirring gently to keep from scrambling. Serve immediately.

Remove stems from mushrooms and set aside. Toss nuts in oil until coated. Spread nuts out on a cookie sheet. Roast for about 10 minutes until they are a golden brown color. Remove nuts from cookie sheet. Saute onion in remaining oil until soft. Add garlic, rosemary and oregano. Stir. Add soy sauce and water. Bring to a boil. Add portabella stems. Simmer for about 10 minutes. Slice stems into strips. Spoon mixture into mushrooms. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Drizzle mushrooms with balsamic. Sprinkle nuts on top. Bake 5 minutes more.

Cut sirloin into bite-sized pieces, set aside. Heat 2 tblspns oil over medium heat in wok or large nonstick skillet. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds or until fragrant. Add nam pla (fish sauce), sugar, chili flakes and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add cornstarch mixture and stir until thickened. Return the beef to the wok, add the spinach and toss until heated through. Serve over hot cooked rice or noodles.

Combine flour, baking powder and salt in bowl. Cut in shortening until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in yogurt and cheese. Drop by level tablespoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden. Stir together melted butter and dried chives. Spread over warm biscuits.

Combine kool-aid and milk in saucepan. Cook until mixture comes to a boil. Turn off the heat and let stand for 10 minutes. Stir in the whipped topping. Spoon into the crust. Chill until serving. Top with additional whipped topping.
A few days ago, my family and I went to a local park and played there for a couple of hours. We were really having a lot of fun and we were all laughing a lot.
I was in the middle of a game of tag with my little brother and sister when we decided to go get some ice cream. We all went and got some ice creams and then we sat down and ate them.
This is the second time this month that I’ve been able to go play outside and have fun. Last week we went and played in the park for a couple of hours.
The last time I went to the park was two weeks ago. We went there to play with some of my cousins. It was a lot of fun.
I have been having a lot of fun lately. I went to the park last weekend with my family. I played with my little brother and sister

Remove stems from broccoli and cut florets into bite-size pieces. Cook in boiling water about 2 minutes. Remove from heat and drain. In a double boiler over hot water, melt the butter. Add the blue cheese, garlic and cream. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the broccoli and cook for 5 minutes more. Garnish with the walnuts and serve at once.

Boil potatoes until done. Mash them well. Add tomatoes, egg, salt and pepper to the mashed potato mixture. Heat olive oil in a frying pan. Pour the egg mixture onto the pan and cook for a few minutes on each side until golden brown. Cut the omelette into pieces and serve hot.

Wash and core apples and pears. Peel and slice apples and pears. Place in large mixing bowl. Add sugar and vegetable juice cocktail. Mix and refrigerate until serving time. Drain watermelon. Place in large mixing bowl. Add orange juice and sugar. Mix well. Drain grapes and add to watermelon mixture. Mix well. Serve fruit salad in individual bowls. Makes 6 servings.

Cut the smoked salmon into small pieces. Add the butter, cream cheese, shallots, fresh tarragon, chives and lemon juice to the bowl of a food processor. Process the mixture until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Refrigerate until ready to use. Spread the mixture onto fresh bread. Serve.

Put 1/2 cup vegetable oil in 10x13x2 glass pan. Pop popcorn in oil. Remove from pan when done and set aside. In a heavy 2 quart saucepan over medium heat add 1 cup margarine. Add 1/2 cup light brown sugar and bring to a boil. Stirring constantly cook for 2-3 minutes until sugar is melted. Remove from heat and add 1/2 teaspoon vanilla. Pour over popcorn and stir to coat. Spread mixture out on wax paper to cool. Store in an airtight container.

In a large saucepan, combine potatoes, butter, half-and-half, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-lowcook until potatoes are fork-tender, about 15 minutes. Stir in parsley. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet over medium-low heat, saute the onions in the oil until transparent. Add the potatoes, cover, and cook 10 minutes or until the potatoes are crisp-tender. Add the tomatoes, and continue to cook until the vegetables are tender. Stir in the cumin, cayenne, salt, and pepper. Add the green beans, cover, and cook 5 to 10 minutes longer or until heated through.

In a large bowl, combine 1 garlic clove, ginger, and 2 tablespoons soy saucemarinate the shrimp and scallops in the mixture for 15 minutes at room temperature or 1 hour in the refrigerator. Remove the shrimp and scallops from the marinade and thread onto 12 skewers. Heat a grill pan over medium heat and cook the kebabs, turning occasionally until they are cooked through and lightly browned, about 4 minutes per side. Serve with the remaining marinade as a sauce.

Melt the sugar and white corn syrup over medium heat. Stir until the mixture comes to a boil. Remove from the heat. Stir in the peanut butter until smooth. Add the cereal and mix well. Press into a greased 9-inch square pan. Cool before cutting into squares. Store tightly covered for up to 2 weeks.

Rinse fish steaks under cold running water. Pat steaks dry with paper towels. Combine cornmeal, salt and white pepper in a small bowl. Place steaks between 2 sheets of plastic wrappound gently with a meat mallet or rolling pin until 1/2-inch thick. Spray a 12-inch ovenproof skillet with butter-flavored cooking sprayheat over medium-high heat. When skillet is hot, add steaksfry 2-3 minutes on each side until golden brown. Transfer skillet to ovenbake 10 minutes, or until fish is firm and flakes easily when tested with a fork. Sprinkle with fresh lemon juice. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a small baking dish with butter. Layer potatoes in dish with ham, alternating layers. Sprinkle with parsley. Pour melted butter over potatoes, stirring lightly with fork until all potatoes are coated. Bake uncovered for 1 hour, or until potatoes are golden brown and heated through. Sprinkle with more parsley before serving.
Mix all ingredients together except buns. Form into four patties. Fry or grill until done to desired doneness. Serve on burger buns with lettuce, tomatoes, mayo as desired.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper. Add to pan and brown on all sides. Add water to pan and scrape up any browned bits from pan bottom. Add vinegar, soy sauce, sugar, red pepper flakes and bring to boil. Cover pan, reduce heat to low and simmer 30 minutes. Uncover and continue to cook until chicken is cooked through, about 15 minutes more. Add more soy sauce as necessary to keep the liquid from drying out during cooking. Garnish with green onions and serve over white rice.

Cut chicken into pieces. Mix with onion, lime juice and peppers in large bowl. Marinate in refrigerator overnight. Preheat oven to 400F. Heat 4 tbs. oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken and brown about 5 minutes per side. Remove to oven and continue cooking 15 minutes or until done. Serve with rice or baguettes. Makes 6 servings.

Heat olive oil in 5-quart pot over medium heat. Add onions and saute for 2 to 3 minutes. Add all remaining ingredients except sugar and simmer for 20 minutes. Turn off heat and use an immersion or regular blender to puree salsa. Taste. Add sugar to your liking. Serve warm or cold with beef empanadas, pork dishes, soups, stuffed sweet plantains, tortilla chips or plantain chips.

Prepare a marinade by mixing together the cinnamon, paprika, thyme, cumin, coriander, cayenne pepper, freshly ground black pepper and salt in a small bowl. Rub the spice mixture over the flank steaks. Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium high heat. Place the steaks in the pan and cook until the meat is browned. Transfer to a plate and keep warm while you make the sauce. In the same pan used for the steaks, add the remaining marinade. Cook until the mixture begins to thicken and then add the vinegar. Return the beef to the pan, turn the meat over and cook for another 2 minutes. Remove the beef from the pan and serve.

Heat olive oil in a skillet. Add garlic & cook until golden. Add the chicken & hot sauce. Cover & cook 5-10 minutes or until the chicken is done. Remove the chicken & set aside. Add butter to the skillet & let it melt. Add the parmesan & stir until melted & combined. Salt & pepper. Return the chicken to the skillet & toss to coat. Serve hot. Serves 4.

Combine sugar, oil and eggs in a large mixing bowlbeat well. Combine the dry ingredientsadd to the wet mixture and stir just until moistened. Stir in the nuts and fruit. Bake in a greased 13-in. x 9-in. pan at 350 F for 45-60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack. Sprinkle with powdered sugar if desired.

Preheat oven to 375. Line or spray muffin cups. In a small bowl, mix together the dry ingredients and set aside. In another bowl, cream together the butter and sugars. Add the eggs and beat well. Add the flour mixture and stir until just combined. Stir in the applesauce and carrots. Spoon the batter into the prepared muffin cups and bake for 25 minutes. Remove from oven and cool in the pans for 5 minutes. Move to wire racks to cool completely. Makes 12 standard-sized muffins.

Dust chops with flour. Heat 1/2 inch of oil in deep fryer or pan. Fry chops about 3-4 minutes per side or until brown and crispy. Remove from frying medium. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. In the same pan or fryer, add chicken bouillon cube. Stir and bring to a boil. Add 1/4 cup water. Boil. Stir and simmer for 2-3 minutes until thickened. Pour over chops and serve.

Combine plain flour, water and olive oil in a large bowl. Beat with an electric mixer until smooth, about two minutes. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured board and knead until smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes. Divide into six equal portions and shape into balls. Wrap in plastic and refrigerate for up to three hours. Preheat oven to 200 C (400 F). Brush each ball with some vegetable oil and sprinkle with some sugar and set aside to rise for 30 minutes until doubled in size. Roll each ball into a long oval shape with your hands or by rolling with a rolling pin until about 2 mm thick. Fold each oval over on itself to make a triangle shape and pinch to seal. Place on an oven tray lined with baking paper and brush with some more vegetable oil. Bake for 20 minutes until golden brown and serve immediately while still warm.

Wash and trim button mushroomsset aside. In a saucepan, bring chicken stock to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Add button mushrooms and cook covered 5 minutes or until tender. In a medium saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add garlic and saute until golden brownremove from heat. Add mushrooms and saute 1 minute. Serve hot over rice.
Name: Escargots Aux Champignons Ingredients: Butter Green Onion Garlic Cloves Parsley Salt Pepper Heavy Cream Dry Vermouth Mushroom Caps Snails Preparation: Pre-heat the Broiler. Cream The Softened Butter With All The Rest Of The Ingredients, Except The Mushrooms And Snails. Remove The Stems From The Mushrooms Caps. Stuff Each Mushroom Cap With A Snail. Cover Each Snail With A Spoonful Of The Butter Mixture. Broil Stuffed Mushrooms For Six To Eight Minutes.
Name: Italian Mushrooms In Vinegar Funghi Al Salamoia Ingredients

Preheat the oven to 375°. Lightly coat a baking sheet with cooking spray. Arrange the chicken on the pan, then sprinkle with the chili powder and black pepper. Bake for 20 minutes or until cooked through. While the chicken is cooking, make the salad. In a large bowl combine the salad greens. In a medium bowl, stir together the salsa and the dressing. Mix well. When the chicken is done, shred it and stir it into the salad. Top with the cheese and the chips.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Season tenderloin with olive oil, red pepper, garlic powder, sea salt, and fresh ground black pepper. Sprinkle with fresh parsley and rosemary. Bake for 45 to 60 minutes or until tender. Serve with fresh rosemary.

Cut the chicken into 2-inch pieces and sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon each of thyme and seasoning. Coat with flour and shake off excess. Heat oil in a large ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat. Brown the chicken on all sides, about 8 minutes. Transfer to a plate and set aside. Reduce heat to medium. Add onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add wine and bring to a simmer. Cook until slightly reduced, about 2 minutes. Add broth and scrape up browned bits from pan. Return chicken to pan. Bring to a simmer. Sprinkle with thyme and season with more seasoning. Cover and bake until chicken is tender and juices run clear when pierced with a fork, 40 to 45 minutes. Tent skillet with foil. Stir in the lemons and butter and heat through. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Cut each refrigerated biscuit into quarters, and then cut each quarter into quarters again. Spread each quarter with a thin layer of butter and a sprinkle of onion flakes and dill. Wrap each quarter in a slice of apple. Bake 10 minutes or until light brown.
In a large pot, combine beef broth, dry sherry, celery, and scallions. Bring to a boil. Add the mushrooms, water chestnuts, and peas and simmer for 2-3 minutes. Add the soy sauce and serve hot.

Remove the bottom from each heart. Remove the hard leaf tips and the tough outer leaves. Cut the remaining leaves into thin slices. Toss the slices with the oil and salt and pepper. Gently toss in the red capsicum and parsley. Sprinkle with the feta cheese. Serve immediately.

Combine mushroom soup, milk, pimiento, peas, tuna and cooked egg noodles in large bowl. Pour into a greased 2 1/2-quart shallow baking dish. Sprinkle with crumbs and butter. Bake uncovered at 350 for 20 to 25 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 10 minutes more or until cheese is melted. Makes 8 servings.

Wash and drain the lentils. In a heavy pan, add 2-3 tbsp of vegetable oil. Add ground cardamom and fry for a minute. Add sugar and continue to stir-fry till sugar is completely melted. Add washed lentils and stir-fry till the lentils start changing color and become slightly transparent. Add coconut milk and stir gently till all the coconut milk is mixed with the lentils and they are fully cooked. Add salt if desired. Serve with rice.

Brown Italian Sausage in hot pan with onions, peppers and garlic for about 10 minutes or until sausages are cooked through. Add marinara sauce and red wine to pan and let simmer for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. In a small bowl whisk together cornstarch and water until smooth. Add to pan along with cooked pasta and mix until well combined. Pour into 9x13 dish or similar sized baking dish. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake for 10 minutes or until cheese is bubbly and browned on top. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 375. Place cornflakes in a shallow bowl. Beat mayonnaise and buttermilk together in a small bowl. Combine 1/4 cup soy sauce with honey in another small bowl. Add the remaining 1/4 cup soy sauce and the butter to the cornflakes. Add the chicken and toss to coat evenly. Dip in the buttermilk mixture and coat evenly. Place in a single layer in a 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking pan coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with the pecans. Bake 45 minutes. In a small bowl combine the remaining soy sauce and honey. Brush the top of the chicken with the mixture and bake 5 minutes more.

Bring a pot of water to a boil. Slice the fish into 1-inch pieces. Add the dried fennel and herbs to a saucepan. Add some oil and sauté until soft. Add some boiling water from pot. Add the fish and parboil for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and add the remaining boiling water from pot. Add the ouzo and cognac. Place fish in a bowl or shallow dish. Sprinkle with lemon juice. Serve with some bread and butter.

Marinate breast tenderloin in italian salad dressing for at least 10 minutes. Heat a large skillet with 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Brown turkey on all sides. Add onion and green bell pepper. Sauté until tender. Add zucchini and sauté until tender. Add pasta and stir. Add oregano and season with salt & fresh ground pepper. Transfer to a serving dish and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Whisk ricotta into beaten eggs with a fork, season with salt and pepper to taste. Melt butter in a 10 inch ovenproof skillet over medium heat. When butter is foamy pour in egg mixture. Sprinkle basil over top. Bake in preheated oven for about 10 minutes, or until cooked through and set in the middle. Toast bread slices and spread with butter. Serve eggs with toast for dipping and tomatoes for garnish.

Cook spaghetti as directed. Meanwhile, brown ground beef and drain. Add onion and cook until tender. Drain off fat. In a small bowl combine ketchup, mustard and barbecue sauce. Add pickle relish and mix well. Drain spaghetti. Add beef mixture and ketchup mixture to spaghetti. Add cheese. Mix well and serve.

Brown onions in butter. Add water. Bring to boil. Add orange rind, orange juice, and salt. Reduce heat to low. Cover. Cook until tender. Add marjoram and thyme. Cook 2 minutes longer. Transfer to serving bowl. Fluff with fork. Serve.

In a double boiler, melt chocolate chips and stir until smooth. Stir in evaporated milk and salt. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla. Add butter and blend well until smooth. Place a layer of ice cream in an 8 inch by 8 inch pan. Pour a layer of chocolate over ice cream. Continue layering until all chocolate is used up. Top with another layer of ice cream. Cover with plastic wrap and freeze until ready to use. Cut into squares.

Cut pork into 1/2-inch-thick medallions. In a skillet over medium high heat, cook pork medallions for 2 to 3 minutes per side or until desired doneness. In a small bowl, whisk together lemon pepper, butter, lemon juice, worcestershire, dijon mustard and chives. Add medallions and toss to coat. Serve immediately.

Slice the peaches in half, remove the seeds, then slice the halves into bite-sized wedges. Combine the peach slices with the slices of yellow and red peppers. In a small bowl mix together the olive oil, lemon juice, salt and cumin. Add the cayenne to taste. Pour the dressing over the vegetables. Chill for 1 hour. Serves 4.
Pour the coffee into a large bowl. Add the milk, cocoa powder and granulated sugar and mix together. Pour into a glass and add caramel syrup.

Heat olive oil in a heavy saucepan. Saut onion and garlic until soft. Add mushrooms and cook 5 minutes longer. Sprinkle with flour and stir for one minute. Add white wine. Add stock slowly. Add cream. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add fresh chives. Serve with grated cheese.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Coat the inside of a 9 x 13 inch baking dish with oil. Cut off the corn kernels and toss with the oil. Pour into the baking dish. In a large bowl combine the cream cheese, yogurt, herbs and hot sauce. Season with salt and pepper. Pour this over the corn and bake for about 40 minutes. Serve with the toasted bread cubes.
In a small bowl, combine all ingredients. Whisk to blend. Refrigerate at least 2 hours to blend flavors.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly spray a cookie sheet with vegetable oil. In a large bowl, stir together the oyster crackers and vegetable oil until the crackers are coated with the oil. In a small bowl, mix together the black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder and sugar. Sprinkle the black pepper mixture over the coated crackers and gently toss. Spread the crackers out on the cookie sheet and bake for 40 minutes. Stir the crackers once while they are in the oven. Remove from the oven and immediately sprinkle with the parmesan cheese and dill weed. Allow the crackers to cool before serving.

In a large mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat flour, raisin bran cereal, brown sugar, baking powder, salt and ground cinnamon. In a separate bowl, combine the eggs, buttermilk and cooking oil, stirring just until well blended. Add the liquid mixture to the dry ingredientsstir just until moistened. Stir in the unsweetened applesauce. Cook the batter as you would regular pancake batter in a greased skillet over medium heat. Serve warm. Serves 4 to 6.
Sift together dry ingredients in large bowl. In small bowl beat egg yolk. Add butter to egg mixturebeat until well blended. Add to dry ingredientsmix well. In small bowl beat egg whites until stiff peaks formfold into batter.
Pour into greased 13x9x2-inch pan. Bake in 400°F oven 15 minutes or until done.
In a medium bowl, combine flours, sugars, baking powder, baking soda and salt

Peel potatoes and dice. In skillet cook potatoes and onions until soft. Add lasagna noodles and cook until tender. Drain. Mix in evaporated milk, butter, and cheese. Stir well. Spoon into pie shell. Bake in 350 oven for 40 minutes. Serves 8.
Melt the butter and pour into a 9x13 casserole dish. In a mixer combine the flour, milk and sugar and then add the fruit and pour it over the melted butter. Bake at 350 degrees for about one hour.
Saute hamburger and onion until browned. Add ketchup and seasoning. Stir in crumbs and applesauce. Mix well. Place in a 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 for one hour.

In a skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add onionssaute 1 minute or until crisp-tender. Add garlicsaute 30 seconds or until fragrant. Add porksaute 2 minutes or until browned. Add eggsstir-fry 1 minute or until eggs are set. Add ricestir-fry 1 to 2 minutes or until heated through. Add fish sauce, soy sauce and sugartoss to combine. Serve hot.

Cook bacon in medium skillet until crisp. Remove from skilletleave 2 tbsp bacon fat in pan. Add oysters. Cook 5 minutes or until edges begin to curl. Stir in pine nuts. Serve hot. Garnish with bacon and chives.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.Combine flour, baking powder, salt, and peppercorns in a medium bowl. In a large bowl, beat together the butter, sugar and eggs. Stir in the dry ingredients to form a dough. Knead in the romano cheese and milk. Divide the dough into two pieces, shape each into a log about 15 inches long and place on the prepared baking sheets.Bake the logs at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for about 40 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool for about 10 minutes. Slice the logs into about 1/2-inch rounds. Bake the biscotti at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for about 10 minutes per side, or until lightly browned and crisp.Remove the biscotti from the oven and allow to cool for about 5 minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

Heat 1 tbsp. butter in skillet. Add onion and saute until soft. Add 1 tsp. garlic salt and saute. Add shrimp and saute until pink. Add 1/4 tsp. black pepper. Add 2 tbsp. bell pepper to garnish. Serves 2.

Melt gelatin in hot water in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir in lime juice. Stir until gelatin has dissolved. Stir in whipped cream cheese until blended. Set aside until partially cool (about 30 minutes). Drain pineapple, reserving juice. Fold in pineapple, 1/2 cup of the pineapple juice and 1/2 cup of the soda into the gelatin mixture. Chill for 4 hours or until partially set. Fold in remaining soda. Chill for 1 hour or until firm. Garnish with whipped cream and pecans before serving.

In medium bowl combine frosting and extract. Add food coloring gradually until desired color is reached. Line baking sheet with waxed paper. Dip one side of each cracker into frosting mixture and place on waxed paper. Immediately dip other side into frosting mixture and place on waxed paper. Let set until firm. In microwave oven, melt chocolate according to package instructions. Drizzle over each cracker sandwich and let set until firm.

Brown ground beef with smoked sausage and seasonings (salt, pepper, etc.) Drain fat from pan and add baked beans. Simmer for 30 minutes. Drain black beans and add to pan along with minced garlic. Continue simmering for an additional 15 minutes. Serve over rice or mashed potatoes and top with chopped scallions or chives if desired.

Cream shortening and add sugar and vanilla. Add eggs one at a time and beat well after each one is added. Combine dry ingredients and add alternately with milk. Chill for at least an hour. Roll into small balls and flatten with a fork on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 8-10 minutes until light brown around edges. Let cool and sprinkle with cinnamon and powdered sugar.
Cinnamon Rolls- 4 cups flour 1/4 cup salt 1/2 tsp baking powder 1 tsp baking soda 1 tsp cinnamon 1/4 cup brown sugar 1/4 tsp cloves 1 1/2 sticks margarine 2 eggs 1 cup milk 1 package yeast 1 cup raisins 1 can frosting Mix all together, let rise for 1 1/2 hours. Roll 1/3 cup at a time onto floured board with rolling pin into 8"x12" strips. Sprinkle with brown sugar and raisins. Roll up into tight
Combine rice, water, natural-style peanut butter, wheat germ, wheat flour, millet flour, lemon, milk and sugar. Cook at 350 degrees F until thickened. Serve hot.

Blanch florets in boiling water for 3-4 minutes or until bright green but fork tender. Drain. Add broccoli to skillet containing olive oil and garlic. Cook over low heat until broccoli is hot. Stir in salt & pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Saute garlic and onion in olive oil. Add tomatoes and cook for about 5 minutes. Add green beans and fresh spinach and cook until wilted. Place fish in baking dish. Pour over sauce. Top with cheese and fresh basil. Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes.

In a large bowl combine the greens, egg, blue cheese, bacon bits and cheddar cheese. Arrange the tomatoes and onion on top. Slice the chicken and arrange on top. Drizzle with dressing and sprinkle with lettuce.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Mix together the flour and the seasonings. Dip the chicken in the flour mixture and brown in a skillet. Add the onion and mushrooms. Cook until tender. Add the evaporated milk and the water. Cover and place in the oven. Bake for 1 hour. Serve with noodles or over rice.

Sift dry ingredients together. Add blueberries. Make well in center of mixture. Combine egg and water. Pour into center. Mix together with fork until smooth. Heat skillet with oil or spray and pour batter in circles on griddle. Cook until browned. Turn over and brown on other side. Makes 12-18 pancakes.

Mix together brown sugar and butter. Stir in cereal. Press mixture into greased 11 x 17 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Pour caramel over. Sprinkle with nuts. Bake for another 12 minutes. Cool completely before cutting into bars.

Heat oil in rice cooker. Add shallot. Stir occasionally until it is softened. Add israeli couscous and chicken broth. Cover and let cook for 5-10 minutes on high heat until the liquid is absorbed. Check the rice cooker after 5 minutes and add more liquid if needed. Remove from heat. Fluff with fork. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in sauce pan. Add corn syrup and sugar. Bring mixture to a boil over medium heat for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add peanut butter and vanilla. Pour over cereal and mix well. Spread into 13x9 inch baking pan. Let cool before cutting. Makes 4 dozen.

Heat oil in heavy large pot over medium-high heat. Add onions and saute until tender, about 5 minutes. Add corn and next 4 ingredients and saute until chowder is thick and creamy, about 20 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Combine water and grits in saucepan and cook over low heat until grits are very creamy and smooth. Add the sugar and the cocoa and stir until blended. Add the butter and stir until melted and the grits are smooth and glossy. Serve with whipped cream or sweetened whipped cream or chocolate ice cream or chocolate sauce or chocolate sprinkles on top of each serving.

Mix dressing ingredients together in a bowl. Chop tomatoes, oranges, and cucumbers into 1/4 inch dice. Toss together with dressing. Cover and refrigerate until serving. Toss again just before serving. Garnish with fresh basil. Serves 6.

Combine crumbs with melted butter. Press into 9x13-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with coconut, then nuts. Melt semisweet chocolate and butterscotch together. Spread over nuts. Pour milk over all and bake at 350f for 25 minutes or until set. Cool on wire rack. Makes 24 bars.

Place chicken breasts in a 9x13 pan. In a blender mix together soups, broth, garlic powder, onion powder, basil, oregano, salt and pepper. Pour over chicken. Sprinkle with monterey jack cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Top with sour cream and sprinkle with remaining monterey jack cheese. Bake uncovered for another 15 minutes. Serve with tortilla strips.

Cook wild rice in a 2-quart saucepan according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, cook chicken in olive oil, stirring occasionally and turning once. Cook 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned on both sides. Transfer chicken to a plate. Add carrots to pan and cook 4 minutes or until tender. Add marmalade and 1/4 teaspoon pepper to pan. Cook and stir 1 to 2 minutes or until heated through. Add Dijon to pan. Cook and stir 1 minute or until blended. Add cooked wild rice and chicken to pan. Toss to coat. Makes 4 servings. Each serving has 382 calories, 33.6 grams protein, 4.6 grams fat.

Cut angel food cake into bite size pieces and place in 9x13 pan. Mix jello according to package directions and pour over cake. Place in refrigerator. After set, spread on top of cake and top with cool whip.

Slice refrigerated chocolate chip cookie dough into 16 slices. Line bottom of 13x9x2-inch pan with slices of chocolate chip cookie dough. Spread with 2 packages softened cream cheese. Sprinkle with 1/3 cup sugar and 1/3 cup chopped walnuts. Press remaining slices of chocolate chip cookie dough onto filling. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 35 to 40 minutes. Cool, then chill for 1 hour or more before cutting into 24 squares.

Soak the dried navy beans for 4 hours in enough cold water to cover by two inches. Drain the beans. Add fresh water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil and cook at a simmer until tender. About 2 hours. Skim off the foam that rises to the top. Add ham hock and cook for 15 minutes. Add the flour and mix well. Add the milk and vinegar and bring to a boil. Season to taste. Serve hot topped with sour cream.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Butter a 9x13 inch pan. In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form. In another bowl, beat the egg yolk with the granulated sugar until thickened, about 2 minutes. Add the butter, salt, and all-purpose flour and beat until smooth. Beat the egg whites into the mixture until combined. Turn into the prepared pan. Bake for 30 to 45 minutes. Check for doneness with a toothpick inserted into the centerif it comes out clean then the cake is ready. Let cool for 15 minutes, then remove from pan. While the cake is cooling, make the glaze. In a small saucepan, whisk the lemon juice and buttermilk over medium-low heat until thickened. Whisk in the hot water. Brush the glaze over the top of the cake. Let cool completely before cutting into squares to serve.

Dissolve orange gelatin in 1/2 cup boiling water. Add ginger ale and continue stirring until gelatin dissolves completely. Pour into mold and refrigerate until firmly set. Cut into cubes and garnish with peaches and pineapple tidbits.

Brew coffee as directed on package. Add amaretto. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon of the almond extract and 1/4 teaspoon of the vanilla. Top with whipped cream. Drizzle with remaining 1/4 teaspoon almond and 1/4 teaspoon vanilla. Garnish with candy sprinkles and cherries.

Heat the olive oil in a large heavy saucepan over medium heat. Add the onions. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the okra. Stir for 2 minutes. Add the garlic. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the tomatoes, ginger, grains of paradise, cardamom, and sugar. Cook for 1 minute. Lower the heat to medium low, cover, and cook for 15 minutes. Serve with rice or couscous.

Blanch the green onion in boiling water. Drain and rinse. In a bowl, combine the white rice vinegar, 1 tablespoon of salt and brown sugar. Add the shallots and the drained green onion. Let stand for 15 minutes. Drain before serving.

Combine first 6 ingredients in a small bowlbrush half of mixture over fish. Grill fish 6-8 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Brush with remaining glazesprinkle with lime wedge
In a saute pan, saute the onion and cilantro in the oil until tender. Add the garlic and jalapenosaute 30 seconds. Add cooked ricestir to mix well. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350. In large bowl, combine the first 7 ingredients. Spread half the mixture in a greased 9-inch square baking pan. Top with remaining half of mixture. Bake uncovered for 40 minutes. Top with bacon. Bake 3 minutes longer. Let stand for 5 minutes. Serves 4.

Combine all ingredients in a zip-top plastic bag and refrigerate 20 minutes or longer. Remove salmon from bagdiscard marinade. Preheat a gas or charcoal grill. Brush salmon with oilseason with salt and pepper. Grill 4-5 minutes per side or until salmon flakes easily when tested with a fork.
name: sweet potato and cheddar potato pancakesingredients: sweet potato, onion, all purpose flour, baking powder, sugar, butter, milk, cheddar cheese, green onionpreparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c). Grease a baking sheet or line it with parchment paperset aside. Peel sweet potatoes and boil until soft. Drain and mash potatoesset aside. Heat milk in a small saucepan over low heat until warm. Stir milk into mashed sweet potatoes until well blendedset aside. Combine all purpose flour, baking powder, and sugar in a large bowlstir in
In a blender, blend together all ingredients until smooth. Pour into tall glasses. Garnish with a slice of lemon. Serve cold.

In a large pot combine the sugar and corn syrup. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Attach a candy thermometer. Cook without stirring until the mixture reaches 280F degrees. In a small bowl combine the cream, butter, vanilla, salt and maple extract. Remove from heat. Add the cream mixture to the hot syrup, beating constantly with an electric mixer on medium speed. When cool enough to handle, form into 1 inch balls with your hands. Dip each ball into 1/4 cup of pecans. Place on a wax paper covered cookie sheet. Chill for 30 minutes. Makes 72 candies.

Cut broccoli florets from the stalk and set aside. Cut stalk into 1/2-inch slices and set aside. In a large stockpot, melt butter over medium-low heat. Add garlic and cook for about one minute, stirring constantly. Add flour and cook for about one minute more. Add half-and-half and bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat and simmer until the mixture thickens enough to coat the back of a spoon, about 5 minutes. Add the broccoli and the stalk pieces and cook for two more minutes. Add the salt and pepper and turn off the heat. Stir in the heavy cream and the parmesan cheese. Add the rotini and toss to coat. Serve immediately.

Combine the olive oil, onions and seasonings in a large saute pan. Cook over medium heat until the onions are caramelized. Remove from the heat and add the goat cheese. Mix well. Divide among the pita halves and sprinkle with parsley.

Heat oil in a skillet and saut the vegetables for 5 to 10 minutes. Add spinach and cook until it wilts. Add beaten eggs. Stir until scrambled. Add matzo meal and salt and pepper. Divide mixture into two oiled 4-oz. muffin cups. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes.

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Saute scallions and celery until tender-crisp. Stir in cream and tarragon. Cook until heated through. Stir in peas just before serving. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Mix together ketchup, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce, vinegar, lemon juice, and coffee. Brush mixture on chicken legs. Roast or barbecue to desired doneness. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Pound chicken to 1/4 inch thickness. Sprinkle with paprika and garlic powder. Bake 15 minutes or until done. Cool slightly. Combine celery, onion and hot sauce. Cut chicken into bite-size pieces and add to vegetable mixture. In a small bowl combine mayonnaise and milk. Add to vegetable mixture. Toss well. Add pasta. Toss lightly. Sprinkle with blue cheese dressing. Serve immediately.

Heat shortening in skillet to 375 degrees. Sprinkle with garlic salt and pepper and coat evenly with shortening. Add chicken pieces and cook 10 minutes or until done. Top with potato chips and bake at 350 degrees for 5 minutes or until crisp and golden brown. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl, stir together cranberries and sugar. Place in a shallow baking dish. Bake for 20-30 minutes. Remove from oven and stir in marmalade. Cool for 15 minutes. Add lemon juice. Stir in walnuts. Serve warm.

Heat butter in a saucepan and add onions. Sauté until onions are clear. Add sliced mushrooms and cook until soft. Remove from heat and add evaporated milk, stirring constantly until smooth. In a shallow bowl, mix flour and seasonings. Dip schnitzels into flour mixture until well covered on both sides. Fry schnitzels until golden brown on each side. Place schnitzels on warm plates. Pour mushroom sauce on top. Serve immediately.
Boil potatoes until tender. Drain. Mash potatoes. Mix all other ingredients together. Add potatoes to mixture. Stir until combined. Chill. Enjoy.

Combine sugar and butter, beat well. Add eggs one at a time. Add vanilla. Add bananas and mix well. Add buttermilk and mix well. Combine dry ingredients, add to mixture. Pour into greased and floured loaf pan. Bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour and 15 minutes. Cool and slice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place all of the vegetables except asparagus on a baking sheet. Toss with oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake in preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes, until vegetables are tender. Remove from the oven and toss with asparagus. Serve warm.

Preheat grill to high heat (450 degrees F). Toss the mayonnaise and mustard together in a small bowl until well combined. Place the tomatoes, the mayonnaise mixture, the flat-leaf parsley, the chives, 1/4 teaspoon of the salt and 1/4 teaspoon of the black pepper in a large bowl. Toss to coat well. Arrange the tomato mixture in a single layer on the grill rackplace under the preheated broiler. Broil for 2 minutes or until the tomatoes are glazed and starting to brown. Sprinkle the remaining 1/4 teaspoon black pepper and the cheese over the top of the tomatoes and serve warm. Serves 4 to 6.
Mix together ground beef, eggs, stuffing mix, dressing mix, onions and seasoning. Bake for 1 hour at 350F.

Melt together margarine, peanut butter and honey. Add salt and vanilla. Stir in rolled oats and raisins. Spread on cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10-15 minutes. Cool on cookie sheet. Store in airtight container.
Cut radishes into thin slices. Add thinly sliced red onion. Add the rice vinegar, sugar and salt. Refrigerate.

Beat together the flour, egg and salt with a fork until well blended. Add baking powder and beat for about 30 seconds or until smooth. Turn onto a lightly floured surface and kneed for about 2 minutes or until smooth and elastic. Divide the dough into two equal portions and wrap each portion in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Remove one portion from the refrigerator and roll out the dough using a pasta machine. Set aside and roll out the second portion of dough and set aside. Repeat until you have all the dough rolled out and ready for cutting. Using your favorite pasta cutters or a knife cut the dough into strips about 1/4" thick and 4" long. Toss with your favorite sauce and serve immediately or store for future use.

Noodles are a type of pasta that is made from wheat flour and water. They are typically served

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9x5 loaf pan. In a large bowl combine the flour, soda, salt. In a seperate bowl combine the butter and brown sugar, creaming well. Stir in the egg and mashed bananas until well blended. Stir the banana mixture into the dry mixture just until moistened. Stir in applesauce. Spread batter evenly in the prepared pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 45 to 50 minutes or until toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in pan 10 minutesremove to wire rack to cool completely. Makes 1 loaf.

Prepare jell-o as directed on the box using boiling water. Add pears and remaining ingredients. Cover and refrigerate over night.

For the dough knead butter with the flour. Add the egg yolk. Knead again. Take a piece of the dough. Roll it out thinly. Cut out the dough with a cookie cutter. Bake on a baking tray at approx. 200 ° C. For the icing mix the icing sugar with the vanilla sugar and a little bit of water. Add the lemon juice. Spread on the dough. Sprinkle with the rind of the lemon.
name: yellow angel food cakeingredients: egg yolks, cold water, salt, sugar, lemon extract, cake flour, cream of tartar, baking powderpreparation:
Beat water and egg yolks and salt for 15 minutes. Fold in sugar and lemon extract. Sift dry ingredients together 5 times. Fold into egg mixture. Bake as for angel food cake.
name: strawberry angel delightingredients: strawberry gelatin, boiling water, angel food cake, vanilla ice cream, straw

Preheat oven to 375f. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Cook chicken for 3-4 minutes on each side or until no longer pink inside. Add orange juice and mustard to skillet. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer uncovered for 5-10 minutes or until liquid thickens and is almost gone. Season with rosemary, salt and pepper to taste. Bake in shallow pan at 375f for 10-15 minutes or until heated through.

Mix sugar and cooking oil to dissolve oil and form a syrup. Add starch slowly to thicken syrup. Stir in rose water. Fill pastry bag with mixture. Twist end of bag to form shapes. Fry in hot cooking oil until golden brown. Remove from oil and drain on paper towel. Dust with sugar before serving.

Combine the lemon juice and garlic. Add the olive oil and mix well. Add the ginger and tarragon. Stir well. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place in a plastic bag or a glass dish. Add the chicken. Seal or cover. Refrigerate several hours or overnight. Grill or broil the chicken. Serve with vegetables and hot or cold pasta.

Heat oil in skillet over medium high heat. Add onion. Cook until softened. Add garlic. Cook one minute. Add tomatoes, salt and pepper. Cook until thickened. Pour into bowl. Break 2 eggs into skillet. Cook over low heat until whites are set but yolks are runny. Place 1/2 cup polenta in center of plate. Top with 1/2 of onion mixture and one egg. Repeat with remaining polenta, onion mixture and eggs. Top with cheese.

In a large stockpot over medium-high heat, melt the butter. Add the onion, celery, and flour, stirring continuously for about 2 minutes or until the vegetables have softened. Add the chicken stock and bring to a boil. Add the frozen corn. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the whipping cream and half-and-half. Stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm with fresh parsley sprinkled over the top.

Rub the outside of two glasses with the lemon peel to coat, then set aside. Add 1 mint leaf to each glass. Mash 1 sugar cube with the back of a spoon until it dissolves into the glass (this will sweeten your tea). Pour the tea vodka on top of this mixture. Add 2 1/2 oz of crushed ice to each glass. Stir the glasses to mix everything together. Pour 1 1/2 oz of crushed ice on top of the vodka mixture. Fill 1/2 of your glasses with sweet tea flavored vodka to make your BP Oil Slick. Add 1/2 of crushed ice to each glass. Stir to mix everything together. Top off each glass with 1 1/2 oz of crushed ice to make your BP Oil Slick. Garnish by adding lemon slice to each glass. Serve immediately.

Mix flour with pepper. Roll each breast in flour. Brown chicken in butter. Remove chicken. Add prosciutto. Add broth. Bring to a boil. Lower heat. Add chicken. Cook until chicken is tender. Add fontina cheese and parmesan. Serve over pasta.

Brown ground beef. Drain fat. Add in chopped onions and green peppers. Cook until tender. Add garlic and cook for 2 minutes more. Add in tomato paste and cook for 2 minutes. Add in remaining ingredients. Cook until heated through. Stuff rigatoni and bake at 375 for 15 minutes. Serve in individual dishes.

Drain the canned green beans. Heat butter and oil in a large saucepan. Add bacon bits and minced onion. Saute until bacon bits are crisp. Add the drained green beans and stir. Add salt and pepper and toss to combine. Cook over medium heat until heated through. Serve immediately.

Prepare cake mix as directed. Pour batter into a greased and floured 9x13x2 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center of the pan comes out clean. Cool completely on a wire rack. Beat together cream of coconut and cool whip until well blended. Spread over top of cake and gently press flaked coconut over cream filling. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
Spread some peanut butter on bread. Add carrot sticks for sushi "filling." Use raisins for "sushi rice." Roll it up!

Prepare a light coating for the pork chops. In bowl whisk together egg whites and cornstarch. In separate bowl combine breadcrumbs and pecans. In third bowl combine herbs. Dip chops in the egg whitesthen the herbsthen the breadcrumbs. Heat olive oil in frying pan over medium heat. When pan is hot add chops. Brown chops about 4 minutes per side. Drain chops and keep warm.

Place pumpkin puree and 1/2 cup water in saucepan. Bring to boil. Stir in oats, maple syrup, sweetener and salt. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered until thick and creamy, stirring occasionally. Serve warm. Makes 3 servings.
