In blender or food processor combine chilies and oil. Blend till smooth. Add spices and blend until well mixed. Add water if desired to thin to desired consistency. Store in airtight container in refrigerator.

Cook the rice in a saucepan with the milk and vanilla essence for 10 minutes. Pour the mixture into a large bowl and add the crushed pineapple and 2 tablespoons sugar. In another bowl, whip the cream until soft peaks form. Gently fold into the rice mixture and refrigerate for 1 hour. Spoon into dessert cups. Sprinkle with extra sugar.

Cook pasta according to package. Set aside. Melt butter and whisk in flour. Gradually add milk. Season with salt and pepper. Stir until thick. Add salmon. Add spinach and sun dried tomatoes. Cook until heated through. Top with cheeses. Bake at 350 degrees until heated through.

Halve and pit 4 peaches. In a small bowl combine 2 tablespoons of the sugar and 1/2 teaspoon of the extract and sprinkle over peaches. Let stand for 5 minutes. Serve with 2 scoops of vanilla ice cream, 1 tablespoon melba sauce and 1 cup of sweetened whipped cream per serving.
Peel and pit 6 ripe medium-size peaches. Slice each one into 6 wedges and place them in a large bowl. Sprinkle with lemon juice and 1 tablespoon of sugar and toss well. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Meanwhile, whisk together the remaining 1/2 cup of sugar and 1/2 cup of water in a small saucepan over medium-high heat until a soft boil is reached. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes or until thickened, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in 2 teaspoons of vanilla extract and 1/2 cup of chopped pecans. Pour the mixture over the peaches and toss well to coat evenly. Ch

Flour the chicken piece on both sides. Dip the floured chicken piece into the egg mixture and then into the crushed corn chips and Spike seasoning. Fry the chicken pieces in the oil until crispy and brown on both sides.
The best cooking blogs?
I’ve got a couple that I think are really cool. I love the Food Network and I love that they’ve got some great recipes that I can try out. I also really like the blogs that have a lot of pictures of food, because it makes it easier to imagine what it would look like if I were to make it myself.
I know I’m not the only person that feels that way, and I think that’s because food is something that’s very personal. When I look at a recipe or a picture of food, I feel like I’m there. I feel like I’m the person who is making the food. I feel like I’m the person who is enjoying the food. And that’s why I think the best food blogs have a lot of pictures of food.
I like the Food Network because I feel like I’m learning from them as

Melt baking chocolate and milk in double boiler. Stir until smooth. Stir in walnuts and coconut. Refrigerate until firm. Roll into balls and roll in additional coconut. Store in refrigerator or freezer.
In an old-fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Combine all ingredients. Shake to blend. Serve immediately. Garnish with whipped cream and toasted coconut.

Melt chocolate in double boiler over boiling water. Remove from heat and add margarine. Blend well. Add 2 cups of heavy cream, Karo light corn syrup and 2 tablespoons of sugar. Stir constantly until smooth and thick. Add 4 eggs well beaten and 2 tablespoons of sugar. Beat well with an egg beater. Add 1 cup of coarsely chopped macadamia nuts and blend well. Pour into a 9 inch pie shell. Bake at 350 degrees for 50-60 minutes. Cool. Makes one 9 inch pie.

Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain in colander. Melt bacon in small skillet until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Set aside. In a large bowl, combine the noodles, sour cream, cottage cheese, salt, pepper, and dill. Spoon into a shallow baking dish. Sprinkle with the bacon. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside. Cube chicken and saute in oil. Add red peppers and salsa. Cook until done. Add italian dressing and stir. Add chili powder and sour cream. Add pasta and mix well. Serve hot. Serves 4 generously.

Microwave 12 ounces of semi-sweet chocolate morsels on high for 2 minutes. Stir. Add 2 tbs. of orange liqueur and stir until smooth. Drop spoonfuls of mixture on a sheet of wax paper and allow to cool until set. Store in the refrigerator. Decorate with a spoonful of orange cream frosting and a few candy sprinkles.

In a large skillet or saucepan over medium heat, combine all the remaining ingredients except the pork chops. Bring to a boil and allow to cook for 5 minutes. While the mixture is cooking, season the pork chops with salt and pepper. Brown the pork chops on both sides on medium-high heat. Place the pork chops into the liquid mixture, cover, and allow to cook for 30 minutes or until the pork chops are completely cooked through. Serve over rice.

Place soymilk, water, sugar substitute, guar gum, coffee in a blenderprocess at high speed for 30 seconds. Stir in chocolate syrupprocess at high speed for 1 minute. Serve immediately in two glasses filled with cubes of ice.

Melt semisweet baking chocolate and butter together in a double boiler, or a bowl set in a saucepan of simmering water. Stir in powdered sugar. Cool slightly and beat in vanilla and eggs. Beat well and fold in the flour, mixing just until blended. Pour into a greased and floured 9 x 13 inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for about 20 minutes or until a knife inserted into the centre comes out clean. Cool completely before cutting into squares.
Chop the cherry tomatoes, white onion, and green onion. Chop the parsley and cilantro. Slice the jalapeno into thin coins. Add the remaining ingredients to a bowl. Toss the mixture and serve.

Place brats in a large saucepan. Add beer. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes or until the brats are browned and cooked through. Cool. Preheat oven to 350F. Cut the brats into 1/4-inch slices. Place the brats and the vegetables in a large baking dish. Add oil and salt and pepper to taste. Toss to coat. Bake for 25 minutes. Serve the brats on the rolls. Spread each roll with mustard. Top with the brats and vegetables. Serve immediately.

Put all but celery in a saucepan. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in celery and cook until tender. Remove from heat and stir in vinegar and sugar. Store in a jar and use as a condiment with hotdogs or hamburgers.
Brown ground beef with onions in large skillet. Drain fat off. In a medium bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Add meat mixture to bowl. Heat through. Serve on hamburger buns.

In a small bowl combine the flour with the baking soda and salt. Beat the butter with the egg and vanilla in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Stir in the flour mixture until the dough comes together. Shape the dough into a disk, wrap in wax paper and refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Divide the dough in half and place each half on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat. Flatten each piece into a 1 inch thick disk. Press a square of chocolate into the center of the dough. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven, until the edges are golden. Cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. Makes 24 cookies.
Name: Out Of This World Cookies
Name: Remarkable Fudge
Name: Out Of This World Cookies
Name: Granny's Fudge
Name: Ch

Preheat oven to 450f. Peel potatoes & cut into wedges or thick fries. Spray baking sheet with cooking spray or cover with rapid release foil. Combine paprika, garlic powder, & pepper & place in large ziploc bag. Drizzle margarine over potatoes & coat evenly. Place potatoes in bag & shake to coat. Arrange potatoes in single layer on baking sheet. Bake 35 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle with cheese & bake 5 minutes longer.

Rinse and drain the spinach and squeeze out any excess moisture. Mix the rest of the ingredients together in a small bowl. Add the spinach and toss to coat thoroughly.
I made this recipe tonight and it was very good. I used bok choy instead of spinach and left out the sugar. I will definitely make this again!
I'm making the broccoli ramen noodle salad today and can't wait to try it! I'm thinking of adding some chicken to it. I'll let you know how it is.
I made the broccoli ramen noodle salad and added chicken to it. I think it was really good. I'm not sure my husband would agree, but I loved it. I'll definitely be making it again.

Heat beer to boiling in saucepan. Gradually stir in cornstarch until smooth. Remove from heat. Add cheeses and stir until melted and smooth. Stir in dry mustard and worcestershire sauce. Transfer fondue pot to tabletop burner. Serve with rye bread cubes.

Sauté onion in melted butter until softened and beginning to brown. Remove from heat, add honey and lemon juice. Stir. Return to heat and add soy sauce, orange rind, orange juice, cornstarch and brown sugar. Simmer 2 minutes, stirring constantly, until thickened to desired consistency.

Rub pork loin roast with caraway seed, black pepper and salt. In a small skillet brown sugar and butter till melted and bubbly. Place roast in crock pot and pour liquid over top. Layer sauerkraut over the top. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours or until pork is tender. Remove from crock pot and slice into 1/2 inch slices. Serve with sour cream.
In a saucepan over medium heat, boil 3 cups water. Add the remaining ingredients. Simmer for 20 minutes or until tender. In a blender, puree the mixture until smooth. Heat over low heat. Serve warm.

Slice chicken breast into 1/2-inch thick slices. In bowl with fork, beat cream cheese until smooth. In another bowl combine mushrooms, italian seasoning and salt and pepper to taste. Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Unroll crescent doughseparate triangles and arrange in 9-inch square baking dish. Top each triangle with 1/2 teaspoon mushroom mixture and 1/2 teaspoon cream cheese mixture. Place 1 slice chicken on top of each mushroom mixture. Fold dough triangles up around each slice of chicken to enclose. Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Bake 15-20 minutes or until golden brown. Let stand 5 minutes. Serve warm

Preheat oven to 375. Combine sour cream and cheese in large bowlblend until smooth. Stir in broth. Add hash brownstoss to coat. Spoon into 13x9x2 inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Combine soup, butter and next 5 ingredients (butter through corn flakes) in medium saucepan. Bring to boil. Remove from heat. Spoon over hash browns. Combine corn flakes and parsleysprinkle over top. Bake uncovered 1 hour.
name: potato and ham casseroleingredients: cooked ham, russet potatoes, cooking oil, milk, garlic salt, butter or margarine, saltpreparation:Cook potatoes in cooking oil in saucepan. Mash and add ham, garlic salt and salt to taste. Add enough milk to make mixture smooth. Pour into greased casserole dish. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven for 20 minutes.
name: potato ham c

Prepare tapioca according to directions on package. Add prepared strawberry jello to tapioca. Cook until mixture thickens. Remove from heat and add vanilla pudding. Stir well. Fold in the cooled whipped topping. Fold in the strawberries. Refrigerate until firm. Top with additional whipped topping.

In a large bowl combine the beaten eggs and half-and-half. Dip the slices of bread into the egg mixture. Sprinkle each slice with some ground cinnamon and place it into a buttered baking dish. In a small saucepan combine the brown sugar and light corn syrup. Bring the mixture to a boil. Cook and stir until the brown sugar dissolves. Pour the sauce over the soaked bread. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until the sauce is bubbly. Sprinkle with a little confectioners’ sugar.

Cut cucumbers in half lengthwise. Remove and discard seeds. Cut a thin slice from bottom if necessary so they sit flat. In a bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Spoon into the cucumbers. Serve immediately.

In a bowl combine the cheese and seasonings. Form into 4 patties. Lay the patties on a parchment lined cookie sheet. Bake in a 325 degree F oven for 15 to 20 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Allow to cool. On a slice of bread spread a thin layer of mayonnaise. Top with a slice of tomato. Place a slice of the cheese patty on top and sprinkle with parsley. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve with crackers.

Slice carrots and onions into 1/2" pieces and place in bottom of a 4 to 6 quart slow cooker. Rub roast with salt and pepper and place over carrots and onions. Cover and cook on low for 9 to 10 hours or until meat is tender. In the last hour of cooking, stir together the water and cornstarch. Remove meat to a platter and pour liquid from the crock pot into a small saucepan. Bring to a boil and stir cornstarch mixture until thickened. Pour over the meat and serve with mashed potatoes or rice.

Mix the first 3 ingredients in a medium bowl. Add the coleslaw mix and mix well. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours before serving.
name: shrimp tomato coleslawingredients: baby shrimp, mayonnaise, sherry wine vinegar, onion, celery seed, salt, pepper, coleslaw, grape tomatoespreparation:In a large bowl, whisk mayonnaise, vinegar, onion, celery seed, salt and pepper until smooth. Add the cabbage, tomatoes and shrimp. Toss well until combined. Cover and refrigeratoe until well chilled. Serve chilled.
name: creamy coleslaw with bell peppers red onioningredients: mixed vegetables, carrots, bell peppers, red onion, celery seeds, mayonnaise, rice wine vinegar, salt and black pepperpreparation:In a large bowl, toss together all vegetables and celery seed. In a small bowl, combine the mayonnaise, vinegar, salt and pepper
Cook pasta in boiling water to desired degree of doneness. Drain. Add butter and garlic and toss until melted. Add parmesan cheese and toss to blend. Serve immediately.

Brown the chicken on all sides on a hot skillet. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside. In a saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter. Stir in the thyme and pepper until fragrant. Add the stock, sherry, cornstarch and mustard. Cook and stir until thickened. Add the chicken to the sauce, cover, and set aside to cook on low for 8 hours in the crockpot. Add the mushrooms for the last half hour. Serve over hot rice or pasta.
Wonderful Chicken Recipes that are simple to make!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. combine all but bacon in a bowl and mix thoroughly. shape into a loaf and place in a baking pan. cook for about 1 1/4 hours. spread with apple jelly and cook for another 10 minutes. remove from oven and add slices of bacon on top. pour applesauce over top and bake another 10 minutes. sprinkle with chili powder and serve.

Dissolve jello in boiling water. Stir in lemon juice, rind and apple juice. Chill until partially set. Fold in whipped topping. Spoon into dessert dishes. Chill until firm. Garnish with frozen raspberries.

Melt the margarine in a Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the onion and saute until tender. Stir in the flour and peppercook and stir for 1 minute. Gradually add the broth and milkstir constantly until the mixture comes to a boil. Add the clams and worcestershire sauce. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 1 minute. Pour the soup through a strainer into a bowldiscard the solids. Stir in the half and half. Beat the egg yolk in a small bowl with 1 teaspoon of the soup mixture. Add the egg mixture to the soup and stir well. Serve with toast rounds.

Combine lemon jell-o powder and 1/2 cup of the boiling water in a small bowl. Stir until jell-o is completely dissolved. Stir in the remaining 1/2 cup of boiling water. Chill 10 minutes or until jell-o has thickened slightly. Beat the cream cheese with the coffee syrup and the vanilla extract. Beat in the jell-o mixture. Chill until firm. Serve with whipped topping.

Bring water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Add wine and cook until reduced by half. Add soy sauce, pepper, and sugar. Stir to dissolve. Add shrimp and cook for 30 seconds. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature. Stir in sweet and sour sauce and mustard until well combined. Cover and refrigerate until well chilled.

Bring water to boil in medium saucepan and add spices and tea bags. Simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and add orange juice and lemon juice. Cool completely before adding lemon slices and serving.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees f. Wash potatoes well. Prick each potato with a fork, drizzle with olive oil and rub until coated evenly with oil. Sprinkle with coarse sea salt. Place in a single layer in a baking dish. Roast for 45 minutes or until done. Combine fresh herbs and sprinkle over potatoes. Serve immediately.

Spray one side of each tortilla with cooking spray. In large skillet saute onions in butter until tender. Add paprika, thyme, allspice and red pepper flakes. Add chicken and saute until no longer pink. Spread about 1/3 of the chicken mixture onto each tortilla. Sprinkle with remaining chicken mixture and 1/4 cup cheese. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup cheese. Fold over and place on baking sheet. Bake at 400 for 15 minutes or until crisp and brown. Cut each quesadilla into 4 triangles. Serve with peach slices.

Melt onion in lite olive oil. Add garlic. Sauté for a couple of minutes. Add wine and cook until it boils. Add broth and broccoli. Bring to a boil. Add cooked pasta and cook 1-2 minutes. Add parmesan cheese.

Place chicken in a bowl. Add jamaican jerk spice and toss. Heat oil in a skillet. Add chicken and saute until cooked through. Meanwhile prepare sauce. In small bowl combine orange juice and cornstarch. Add to skillet and cook until sauce thickens. Remove chicken from sauce and place in a serving bowl. Pour sauce over chicken. Garnish with parsley.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.Cut the squash in half lengthwise. Scoop out the seeds. Brush the squash halves with butter and sprinkle with salt and pepper.Place the squash halves cut side down on a baking sheet and roast until the flesh is tender and easily pierced with a fork. 45 to 60 minutes.Let cool. Scrape out the flesh with a fork and set aside.In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add the butter and olive oil. Add the sausage and brown it for 5 to 7 minutes. Remove from the pan and set aside.To the same skillet, add the minced garlic and saute for 1 minute. Stir in the breadcrumbs and the parmesan cheese. Continue to saute until the mixture is crisp and golden.Add the sausage back to the skillet and stir to combine.Mash the squash to a puree with a fork. Stir in the sausage mixture, the basil and the parmesan cheese. Serve at once.

Combine first three ingredients in a small bowl. Sift together the flour, baking powder and saltstir into the cornmeal mixture. In a large bowl, combine the egg and milkstir into the batter just until moistened. Spray a 9x13 inch pan with pam. Pour in the batter and spread out evenly. Bake at 375 for 35-45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack.

In a small saucepan over medium heat combine the butter, brown sugar, corn syrup and molasses and cook until smooth. Remove from heat and cool slightly. In a large bowl combine the flour, cinnamon, baking powder and salt. Add the butter mixture and beat until smooth. Fold in chocolate chips and coconut. Press into bottom and up sides of a 9-inch pie plate. Bake for 15 minutes. In a large bowl combine the eggs and Kahlua and beat until smooth. Pour over crust and bake for 30 minutes or until center is set. Chill thoroughly and serve with whipped cream and/or chocolate sauce.

Wash neck and boil for 1 hour with 1 1/2 cups water and 1 Tbsp. Salt and pepper. Stir in onion and pepper and continue boiling 30 minutes or longer until meat is very tender. Remove meat and cut into bite-sized pieces. Return meat to pot with 2 cups stock and cook for 5 minutes. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray a 9 x 13 inch baking pan with butter-flavored cooking spray. Mix eggs, heavy cream, mustard, 1/2 cup of the cheese together. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook the bacon until browned. Add the spinach leaves and tomato. Cook 1 to 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Spread 1 cup of the bacon mixture over the bottom of the prepared baking pan. Top with half of the egg mixture. Top evenly with remaining bacon mixture. Top with remaining egg mixture. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. Sprinkle evenly with basil. Cut into squares to serve.
I made a cheesy spinach strata for supper tonight. I have to say it was delicious. The strata recipe comes from the Taste of Home magazine. I found the recipe online. I just had to share it.
This recipe is very easy to make. I'll

Bring broth to a boil and then add pasta. Cook for 8-10 minutes or until pasta is al dente. Pour eggs over top and cook on low for 5 minutes or until egg mixture is set. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and parsley.
name: chicken gnocchi soupingredients: italian seasoning, boneless skinless chicken breasts, cannellini beans, baby spinach, italian gnocchi, diced tomatoespreparation:Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until soft, about 3 minutes. Add the italian seasoning, and cook for another minute. Add the chicken and cook until no longer pink, about 5 minutes. Add the cannellini beans and the water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the spinach and cook until wilted. Add the diced tomatoes and the italian gnocchi. Cook for 2 minutes. Serve immediately.
name: chicken noodle soupingredients: chicken

Wash and pat dry chicken breasts. Spray a large cookie sheet with cooking spray. Sprinkle bread crumbs on top of sheet. Brown both sides of chicken in sprayed skillet over medium heat. When cooked through, place on top of bread crumbs on cookie sheet. Sprinkle with seasoning salt. Cut laughing cow cheese into thin slices and place on top of chicken. Place thin slices of lean ham on top of laughing cow cheese. Place under broiler for 2 - 3 minutes until ham is heated through.

Cook onion in butter until tender. Add nonfat milk, spinach, cheddar cheese, sole fillets, and lemon juice. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.

Mix egg whites and salt until foamy. Add 1 tablespoon hot pepper sauce and beat until mixture is thick and glossy. Add remaining sauce and remaining ingredients. Beat until well blended. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper-lined baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes or until lightly toasted and dry. Cool. Store in an air-tight container for up to 3 weeks.
name: candied spiced nuts
ingredients: walnut halves, granulated sugar, water, orange zest, ground cinnamon, ground ginger, ground cloves, nutmeg
preparation:Combine all ingredients in a medium size heavy skillet. Heat over medium-high heat to boiling. Cook, stirring constantly, until all of the liquid is evaporated and nuts are coated and sugary. Transfer to a non-stick baking sheet. Break nuts apart while still warm. Let cool.
name: peppered almonds
ingredients: almonds, vegetable oil, sugar, ground black pe

In a large mixing bowl whisk together the light brown sugar, butter and whole milk until well mixed. Add the eggs and whisk until the mixture is well blended. Stir in the vanilla and lemon juice. Stir in the cinnamon and cayenne pepper. Heat the griddle or skillet over medium heat. Dip the slices of bread in the mixture and turn to coat both sides. Place the slices on the griddle or skillet and cook until the bread is golden. Serve with butter or syrup.
Place all ingredients in blender. Blend until smooth. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Spread mixture on crackers. Sprinkle with parsley. Makes about 1-1/4 cups.

In a large bowl combine light brown sugar, shortening and milk. Beat until smooth. Add vanilla and beat well. Combine the dry ingredients. Stir into creamed mixture. Stir in the oats and raisins. Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 for 10-12 minutes. Makes 3 dozen.

Heat olive oil in a large stockpot over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until tender. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant. Add the potato and cook until tender, stirring occasionally. Add the cauliflower, chicken stock, milk, nutmeg, salt and pepper to taste, and parsley. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes. Puree the mixture with a handheld blender until smooth.

Line a baking sheet with wax paper. Melt chocolate chips in double boiler or in microwave in a glass bowl on medium high 2 minutes stirring occasionally until smooth. Spread onto baking sheet, spreading to corners of baking sheet to cover as much of baking sheet as possible with the chocolate. Sprinkle with peanut butter chips, peanuts, and salted peanuts. Let stand a few minutes to set up slightly. Before the mixture becomes too hard to work with, place a handful of potato chips on top of the mixture. Cover with wax paper or plastic wrap. Roll mixture in the potato chip to coat. Continue dipping and rolling until all potato chip are used. Store in airtight container at room temperature for 1 to 2 days or freeze in zip lock bag for up to 1 month. Makes about 5 dozen.

Prepare this easy and tasty hot drink any time of year. It is particularly good on a cold winter day. Add a little extra milk for a thinner drink. Combine all the ingredients in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for one minute. Remove from heat and serve.

Heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat and saute garlic cloves and leeks until soft. Add potato and broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10-15 minutes or until potato is soft. Add beans and fresh parsleyheat through. Garnish with additional fresh parsley if desired.

Cook sausage in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat until browned. Remove from skillet. Add onions and peppers to the same pan. Saute until tender crisp. Add chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Add sausage back to pan. Cook for 5 minutes. Season with garlic, crushed red pepper flakes and oregano.

Combine all ingredients in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil and let cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly to prevent sticking. Cool to room temperature and refrigerate until cold. Store in a tightly covered container. Makes about 2 1/2 cups.
Baby Greens With Mustard Vinaigrette Recipe : This recipe is for those who like their salads on the simple side. You can make your own salad dressing for it or buy it ready-made if you prefer.
Coarse Ground Mustard Recipe : The longer this sits in the refrigerator the better it gets.
Not French Dressing Recipe : This is a very simple dressing that is very versatile.
Honey Berry Vinaigrette Recipe : This is a sweet/sour type salad dressing that is also a great marinade for meats, especially pork chops.
Traditional Deviled Eggs Recipe : These are the best deviled eggs ever.
Sweet Hot Mustard Recipe : This recipe is for those who like their sandwich

Heat 1 tbsp butter and 1 tbsp olive oil in a pan. Add onion and saute until softened. Beat eggs in a bowl. Stir in onions, remaining 1 tbsp butter and 1 tbsp olive oil, cheese, green bell peppers, red bell peppers, garlic powder and pepper. Pour into pan. Cook until almost set. Fold in half and brown other side.

Soak the chickpeas overnight. Drain and add to blender with the rest of the ingredients. Blend until smooth. Season with more lemon juice or more harissa. Serve with crackers or as a spread for vegetables.

In a small bowl or food processor combine yogurt, sugar, vinegar, and the seasonings. Allow to sit for 15 minutes. When ready to serve, whisk or process until smooth. For added flavor, add fresh herbs at the end.

Mix the flax seed with the dry items first. Beat the egg and egg whites until nice & fluffy. Add the other liquids gradually while mixing well. Add the flax seed mix slowly until mixed well. Preheat oven to 425. Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper and spray with pam. Divide the batter onto the parchment paper. Bake for 15-18 minutes until edges are slightly browned. Really good with jam or honey!
Mix first four ingredients. Bring to boiling. Beat in vanilla. Remove from heat and cool to spreading consistency. Spread onto toasted bread or rolls. May be kept in refrigerator for weeks.

Slice onion and green pepper into thin strips. Brown sausage in water for about 30 minutes till crumbled. Add red wine, tomato paste, onion, green pepper strips, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15 minutes or until desired consistency is reached. Serve on hoagie rolls with mayo.

Cream butter, brown sugar and vanilla together until fluffy. Roll out dough to about 1/4-inch thickness. Spread with butter, then brown sugar. Sprinkle with 1/2 of the nuts. Roll up to form a log. Cut into 12 rolls. Wrap in waxed paper. Bake at 350 for 20 to 25 minutes. Meanwhile, mix together remaining nuts, pudding and 1/4 cup mild until well blended. Remove from oven and immediately pour pudding mixture over rolls. Return to oven and bake for 5 minutes more or until lightly browned.
In a heavy saucepan over low heat, combine the pastina and cream. Add sugar and cinnamon and bring just to a boil, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and serve immediately.

In a small saucepan combine all the ingredients until the glaze is smooth. Baste the ham with the glaze before baking. When the glaze is almost dry brush the ham with the glaze. This glaze may be used for other meats also.

Peel bananas and slice into quarters lengthwise. In a saucepan melt butter over medium heat, add brown sugar and cinnamon and cook until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract and salt. Place the banana slices into the pan and stir until all the pieces are coated and the sauce is thickened and bubbly. Divide between two bowls and top with Amaretto liqueur and more cinnamon if desired. Serve immediately.
I love to eat banana chips and this is my recipe for them!
I found this on a site that said that it is based off of recipes from a cookbook called "The Slow Burn" and another site said it was from the cookbook "The New Slow Burn."
Melt butter in a large cast iron pan over medium heat.
Mix butter and brown sugar well and stir constantly.
Add vanilla and salt, stir well again.
Add peeled and sliced bananas and stir well.
Put the cast iron pan into the oven and let cook for about 15 minutes or until the sauce is thick.

Bring water to a boil. Add bouillon powder and stir well. Stir in orzo. Cook over low heat for 8-10 minutes. Drain and add butter. Mix well. Add garlic, lemon rind, lemon juice, cheese and pepper. Mix well. Garnish with parsley.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Lightly grease 13-inch baking sheet with vegetable oil. Arrange tomatoes on baking sheet and drizzle with 1 tablespoon olive oil and garlic cloves. Roast for 10 minutes. Add the balsamic vinegar and 1 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Roast for 8 more minutes and remove from oven. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 teaspoon pepper and garnish with basil leaves.

Combine dry ingredients and mix well. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Beat together buttermilk and eggadd to flour mixture. Stir just until dry ingredients are moistened. Fold in kiwi pieces. Pour into greased 9x5x3-inch loaf pan. Bake at 375 degrees F for 50-60 minutes. Cool in pan on wire rack for 5 minutes. Remove from pan to wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cook nuggets according to package directions. Put a generous amount of pasta sauce in a 13 by 9 inch baking dish. Arrange nuggets on top of pasta sauce. Sprinkle with mozzarella and parmesan cheeses. Bake 5-10 minutes until cheeses are melted. Serve on whole wheat pasta.

Spray a 2-quart shallow baking pan with cooking spray. Place breadcrumbs and herbs in shallow bowl. In a small bowl combine butter, pecans and the crumbsmix well. Spread pecans evenly over the bottom of baking pan. Place broccoli over pecanssprinkle with crumbs and parsley. Drizzle with dressing. Bake at 375 degrees for 20 minutes or until crumbs are browned and broccoli is crisp-tender. Sprinkle with parsley.

Pierce cocktail franks with toothpicks. Bake 10 minutes at 350 degrees in shallow baking dish. Mix together buttermilk biscuit mix with enough water to form soft dough. Roll dough into small balls. Place one ball atop each frank. Place in baking dish with franks. Sprinkle with cheese and bake 10 minutes more or until biscuits are golden brown. Serve with mustard.

Wash squash and slice off ends of stems. Cut each piece lengthwise into strips about 1/2-inch wide. In skillet combine onion and salt and sugar. Stir frequently. When onion is tender, add squash strips. Continue stirring until squash is soft. Stir frequently while stirring onion mixture to prevent burning. In bowl mix egg, flour, and baking powder with a fork until well blended. Stir into squash mixture. Heat oil over medium heat until hot enough to sizzle when a small piece of batter is added to it. With a teaspoon, drop batter by teaspoonfuls into hot oil. Fry until golden brown, turning once with a slotted spatula or fork. Drain on paper towels or brown paper bags. Serve with melted butter or margarine. Yield 10 to 12 fritters.

Brown hamburger with onions. Drain. Add soup and sauces. Mix well. Add green chilies. Add water. Cover. Simmer. Prepare tortillas according to package. Spoon meat mixture in each tortilla. Top with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees until cheese is melted.

In a 2-quart saucepan combine caramels and condensed milk over low heat, stirring constantly until caramels are melted. Stir in vanilla and raisinsremove from heat. Stir in butter until melted and smooth. Stir in chocolate until melted and blendedstir in walnuts until evenly distributed. Pour into a greased 8x8 inch baking dishrefrigerate until firm. Cut into squares with a sharp knifestore in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Prepare and bake french vanilla cake mix according to package directions for 9x13 inch pan. Bake 20 minutes. Meanwhile combine 2 cups blueberry pie filling with 1/2 cup water in large bowl. Beat with whisk until smooth. Pour over hot cake. Sprinkle with 2 tsp. of cinnamon. Bake 20 minutes. Serves 6.

Mix dry ingredients together and set aside. In a large bowl beat eggs until light and frothy. Gradually add beer and continue beating until blended. Stir in onions and cheese. Heat oil in a deep fryer to 375 degrees. Scoop a small ball of batter into hot oil and fry until golden brown. Drain and serve with ketchup.
 margaret s hush puppiesingredients: self-rising cornmeal, self-rising flour, onion, egg, milk, saltpreparation:Combine first three ingredients. Add egg. Gradually beat in milk. Drop by spoonful into hot fat. Remove when golden brown. Drain on paper towels.

Wash and clean mushroom caps. Chop stems. Fry stems in butter. Add onions and cook until tender. Combine cashews and seasoning mix. Stir in white wine. Spoon into mushroom caps. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes.
name: chicken stuffed with rice and vegetablesingredients: chicken thighs and breasts, celery, onion, parsley, rice, carrots, garlic cloves, broth, chicken bouillon cubespreparation:Wash and trim celery and onion. Cut chicken into serving pieces. Place in a large kettle. Add celery, onion, rice, carrots and garlic. Add 2 cups water. Bring to a boil. Add rice, carrots, parsley and bouillon cubes. Add remaining water and boil gently for 1 hour. Remove from heat and let stand for 30 minutes. Chill overnight.
name: chicken stuffed with chestnutsingredients: chicken breast, on

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c).Mix together walnuts and flour in a medium sized bowlset aside.Beat eggs in a shallow dishdip fillets in eggs and then in walnut mixtureset aside.Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.Add walnut-crusted filletsfry 2 minutes per side or until golden brown.Transfer fillets to a baking dishbake in the preheated oven for 5 minutes.Spoon soy sauce into a small saucepan over medium-high heatbring to a boil and stir in honey.Reduce heatsimmer 1 minute until slightly thickened.Serve fish with soy sauce drizzled over top.

Sift together the flour, mustard powder and garlic salt in a mixing bowl. Using a pastry blender or two forks, cut the butter into the dry mixture until it resembles coarse crumbs. Add the egg yolk and mix well. Stir in the fresh herbs and tasty cheese until just incorporated. Using a rolling pin, roll the dough out onto a lightly floured surface until it is about 1/4 inch thick. Cut into triangles with a sharp knife. Bake until golden brown.

Heat the oil in a pan and saute the celery and onions for 1 minute. Add the mushrooms and cook for another 1 minute. Add the rice and stir gently to separate it. Add the stock and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer on low heat for 20 minutes. Sprinkle the cheese on top and cover for another minute. Garnish with parsley.

Blend margarine, brown sugar, egg yolks, and flour until creamy. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gently fold into egg yolk mixture, then stir in chocolate chips. Pour into greased 8x8x2-inch baking dish and bake for 30 minutes at 350F (175C). Cool thoroughly. Peel oranges into thin strips, sprinkle with juice and zest. Cut slices into 2-inch squares. Place 1 square on each slice of cake. Makes 16 servings.

Beat together butter, lemon juice, zest, egg, powdered sugar until light and creamy. Add lemon extract, stir in flour, a little at a time. Chill dough for 1 hour or until firm enough to roll in balls. Roll into balls, dip in powdered sugar. Place on waxed paper and chill until ready to bake. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned.

Peel and slice the onion. In a medium saucepan, bring 2 cups of the water to a boil. Add the vinegar and the remaining 2 cups of water. Stir in the sugar, salt and hot pepper sauce. Boil for 5 minutes. Add the sliced onion. Boil for 1 minute. Remove from the heat. Transfer to sterile jars. Seal. Store for up to 2 months in a cool dark place.

Preheat oven to 350°F. Spray a 9×13 inch baking pan with cooking spray. In a medium bowl combine bisquick mix, granulated sugar and milk. Add apples. Spray bottom of prepared pan with cooking spray. Pour batter into pan. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Combine brown sugar, ground cinnamon, boiling water in a small bowl. Pour over baked batter. Let cool. Combine whipped cream, powdered sugar. Spread over cooled batter. Top with sliced apples. Serve.

Sauté onions in olive oil over medium heat until soft. Add the sweet onions. Saute for 1-2 minutes. Add the sausage, red peppers, potatoes, salt and pepper to taste. Saute for 10-15 minutes. Preheat oven to 425°. In a small bowl beat the eggs. Pour into the bottom of a greased 9x13 baking pan. Add the potato mixture to the top of the eggs. Bake for 20-25 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve hot.

Halve the eggs lengthwise and scoop out the yolks. Mash the yolks in a bowl with a fork. Stir in the mayonnaise, worcestershire sauce and mustard. Stir until smooth. Spoon the mixture into the egg whites and sprinkle with paprika.

Cook ground beef. Add salt to taste. Cook pizza crust according to box instructions, or bake in the oven at 375 for 10 minutes. Spread ketchup on crust. Cover with ground beef. Cover with thousand island dressing. Add pickle slices. Sprinkle with cheese. Top with lettuce, onion, and tomato slices.

Mix flour, black pepper, and olive oil. Coat chicken breasts with mixture. Bake in oven at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Remove chicken from oven. Add roasted red peppers and olives. Bake for another 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Add cooked dry pasta. Toss well. Serve chicken, red peppers, and olives on top.

Spray skillet with cooking spray. Combine sherry, mustard and cream. Cook over medium heat until reduced to 1/4 cup. Add scallopscover and cook about 3 minutes or until done. Stir in parsley. Serve over rice.

Remove the turkey breast from the oven. Pour off all but 1/3 cup of the drippings from the pan. Add maple syrup. Heat through. Add stuffing mix, pecans and apple. Mix thoroughly. Top the turkey or chicken with stuffing. Serve hot.

Heat 1 Tablespoon olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and saute until translucent and slightly browned. Add garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add dried chile powder and saute for 1 minute. Add beans and cook for 3-4 minutes. Add broth and bring to a boil. Add salt and pepper. Cover and reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add fresh cilantro. Serve.

Slice onions into thin rings. Cook bacon in a skillet and set aside. Put flour and 1/2 cup milk in the same skillet. Stir until smooth. Add the remaining milk and stir until thickened. Add the fish, bacon and onion. Season with salt and pepper. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 15-20 minutes or until firm. Serve.

Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line a 15x10x1-inch baking pan with foil, extending the ends of the foil over sides of the pan for easy removal later. Spray the foil with nonstick cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine the butter and brown sugar, and beat with an electric mixer on medium-high speed until well blended and creamy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Beat in the vanilla. Add the flour, baking powder, and saltmix just until combined. Spread the batter evenly in the prepared pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the hazelnuts and nutella in a small bowlstir until well blended. Spread the nut mixture evenly over the baked blondies. Let stand for 30 minutes or until set. To remove from the pan, lift the edges of the foil to help loosen the blondies, and then use

Mix graham cracker crumbs with sugar and melted butter. Press into an 8-inch square pan. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and set aside to cool. In a large bowl, beat together the cream cheese and flour until smooth. Blend in the eggs one at a time. Add the vanilla and beat until combined. Fold in the miniature peanut butter cups. Spread evenly over the graham cracker base. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 30 minutes. Serve warm with additional peanut butter cups on top.
Mix all together in crock pot. Cook on high for 4-6 hours or low for 8-10 hours. Serve over rice.

Mix together nonfat sour cream, cucumber and garlic in food processor till well blended. Cover pita breads with tomatoes and drizzle with cucumber sauce. Top each with 1 burger and sprinkle with feta cheese.

Brown lean ground beef with a little bit of oil or butter in a frying pan or dutch oven. Drain fat (if any) Add beef broth and water and bring to a boil. Add macaroni and simmer for about 8 minutes. Add condensed soup and salsa to the mixture. Heat thoroughly.

Cut the top off of each zucchini. Remove the seeds and pulp from each one and slice lengthwise. Melt the butter in a 13x9 baking dish. Layer half the zucchini in the bottom of the pan. Sprinkle with 1 cup of the cheddar cheese. Next layer half of the cream of chicken soup and 1 cup of the sour cream. Repeat with remaining zucchini and the remaining soup and cream. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Cover and bake for 1 hour at 350 degrees or until the zucchini is tender.

Mix cream cheese with crabmeat and green onion and garlic. Roll into egg roll wraps with a little egg wash on the edges to seal. Bake at 375f for 15 minutes or fry for 2-3 minutes. Serve with sweet and sour sauce.
Peel and dice beets. Cook in water until tender. Add sugar and spices. Let cool, then add vinegar and eggs and refrigerate overnight.

Bring water to a boil in a small pot. Remove from heat and add vinegar, rosemary and sugar. Let sit 3 minutes. Strain and refrigerate. Place the water and vinegar mixture in a large bowl with the eggs. Using an electric mixer, whisk until thickened. Add the mustard and lemon juice and mix well. Slowly drizzle in the olive oil while continuing to whisk. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to an airtight container and refrigerate. Serve as a dip with your favorite food.

Slice onion and place in jar. In saucepan, combine cider vinegar, water, sugar and crushed red pepper flakes. Heat to boiling. Pour over sliced onion in jar. Cool and refrigerate at least 24 hours before serving. In oven-proof fry pan, spread mayonnaise on one side of slices of bread. Place slices on cookie sheet. Bake until toasted on side with mayo. Spread spicy mustard on toasted side of bread. Top with slices of corned beef and sage derby cheese. Place in oven until cheese is melted.

Place chops between 2 pieces of waxed paper or plastic wrap and use a meat tenderizer to flatten them to 3/8 inch thickness. Sprinkle both sides with breadcrumbs and season with onion powder, salt, and pepper. Heat oil in a large skillet or saucepan. Add flattened chops and cook until brown on both sides. Remove from pan. In the same pan combine milk, soup, onion powder and seasoning. Heat until just bubbly. Pour mixture over chops and cook until heated through (about 5 minutes). Serve immediately.
In a small bowl combine onions, garlic, water and brown sugar. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add ketchup and stir. Add sesame seeds and cook for 3-5 minutes. Serve immediately over chicken.

Spray a large nonstick skillet with cooking spray. Cook burgers 4-5 minutes on each side or until heated through. Let stand 5 minutes to allow burgers to firm up. Meanwhile combine the spinach, onion, water and 1 tsp of the feta in a small bowltoss to coat. Serve burgers topped with tomatoes, feta and spinach mixture.

Remove fat from roast. Brown in bacon grease. Add onion soup mix, water and carrots. Cover. Simmer. Add potatoes. Simmer. Add frozen peas. Cook until tender. Makes 6-8 servings.

Clean asparagus. Snap off the tough ends. Cut into 1-inch pieces. Heat the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Saute the onion, leeks, and garlic in the butter until the onion is translucent. Add the asparagus. Saute until the asparagus is tender-crisp. Add the potatoes. Continue sauteing until the potatoes are tender. Add the chicken stock. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Simmer for about 10 minutes. Add the creme fraiche. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Ladle the soup into bowls. Sprinkle with parsley.

Preheat oven to 425. Toss together the cauliflower, mustard, garlic, lemons, salt and 1/2 cup of the oil in a large bowl. Spread mixture in a single layer on a large baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake at 425 for 15 minutes or until golden. Stir in remaining 1/2 cup oil. Sprinkle with dill. Serve immediately.

In a medium-sized pot, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add onions and cook for 2 minutes. Add rice and stir for 2 minutes. Add broth and salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and cover. Cook for 12-15 minutes. When the rice has absorbed all the liquid, take off the heat. Stir in the butter and nutmeg. Stir in the spinach and lemon juice. Let cool for 10 minutes. Mix in the Feta cheese.
brown the meat in a skillet (add water if necessary to keep from burning). drain grease. add remaining ingredients. simmer until blended. serve on buns or toast

Bring milk to a boil in saucepan. Add the cornstarch mixture, stirring constantly to prevent lumps from forming. Remove from heat. Add the cinnamon stick and whole cloves. Serve hot. Makes 4 servings.

Mix corn flakes and seasoning salt together. Press 1 cup of mixture onto each side of each piece of chicken. Combine milk and butter and dip each piece of chicken into the milk mixture. Place on baking sheet and bake for 1 hour or until juices run clear when the chicken is cut into.

Preheat oven to 175C/350F/Gas 3. Lay chicken fillets in a single layer on a shallow dish. In a bowl, beat together the egg and water. In another bowl, combine the flour and sesame seeds. Dip chicken breasts in egg mixture to coat. Then dip into flour mixture to coat. Set aside. In a shallow dish, combine breadcrumbs and oil. Dip each chicken breast in breadcrumb mixture to coat. Place chicken breasts on a baking tray. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Spread camembert cheese over chicken breasts. Bake for a further 3 to 5 minutes. Serve with cranberry sauce.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray 8x8-inch baking pan with nonstick cooking sprayset aside. In large saucepan, microwave fat-free caramel topping on high for 30 secondsstir. Continue microwaving for 30 seconds at a time until smooth and creamyset aside. In microwave-safe bowl, microwave marshmallows on high for 30 seconds at a time, stirring between heating times until marshmallows are softset aside. In medium bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs and fat-free chocolate syrupset aside. Place 1/3 cup of caramel in bottom of baking panset aside. Place 2 tablespoons of marshmallow mixture in bottom of baking panset aside. Layer 1/3 of the crumb mixture on top of marshmallow mixtureset aside. Place 1/3 cup caramel on top of crumb mixtureset aside. Layer 2 tablespoons of marshmallow mixture on top of

Cube the chicken breasts and put them in a large bowl with the cream cheese. Mix until well blended. Add the dressing, lime juice, and wing sauce. Stir well until completely combined. Spread into a casserole dish, sprinkle with the cheese, and top with the red pepper flakes. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Serves 10 to 12 as an appetizer.

Cream together butter & cream cheese. Add sugar & beating until well blended. Beat in vanilla & orange rind. Add egg yolk, beating until blended. Gradually add flour & salt to beaten mixture. Chill dough in refrigerator until firm. Roll out dough on a lightly floured surface to 1/4 inch. Cut with a snowflake cutter. Bake at 350 for 8-10 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Makes 5 dozen.

In blender container combine all ingredients except ice cubes. Blend well. With the blender running, add ice cubes one at a time through lid opening. Blend just enough to break up the ice cubes but not to make it too thick to drink. Serve immediately.
name: fresh banana berry shake
ingredients: bananas, strawberry, fresh orange juice, low-fat vanilla ice cream
preparation:Combine first 3 ingredients in a blender. Process until smooth. Add ice cream. Process until smooth. Pour into glasses. Serve immediately.
name: strawberry cheesecake shake
ingredients: fresh strawberries, cream cheese, skim milk, powdered sugar, strawberry ice cream
preparation:In blender container, combine all ingredients except ice cream. Blend well. Add ice cream. Blend until smooth. Serve immediately.
name: mop smoothies
ingredients: mango, orange, fresh pineapple, vanilla yogurt, honey
preparation:In blender

Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking. Add the red pepper flakes and cook until fragrant. Add the cabbage and stir-fry until crisp-tender, about 2 minutes. Stir in the garlic and cook until golden brown, about 1 minute longer. Stir in the rice wine, soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, and remaining 2 tablespoons oil. Bring to a boil. Stir in the sesame oil and gingerroot. Stir-fry until the liquid is absorbed. Remove from the heat. Stir in the toasted sesame seeds. Serve hot.

In 3-qt casserole dish, layer half the cubes of meat in the bottom. Top with half the cream of mushroom soup. Sprinkle with half the dry mix. Repeat layers. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Makes 6 servings.

Melt butter and add salt, flour and egg yolks. Cook over medium heat until thickens. Add powdered sugar and pecans. Beat until smooth. Chill overnight or freeze. Melt candy coating according to directions on package. Form mixture into balls about 1 to 1 1/2 inches in diameter. Dip balls into melted coating. Place on wax paper. Cool. Makes about 2 dozen balls.
Season meat with onion soup mix, add to crock pot. Add carrots, potatoes. Cook for about 8 hours. Add mushroom soup, water and pepper. Cook for another hour or so. Serve over steamed rice.

Combine plain yogurt and olive oil and marinate the lamb in this for 12 to 24 hours in the fridge. Remove from the marinade and pat dry with paper towels. Brush on the remaining marinade. Preheat a grill to medium-high heat. Grill the lamb until golden brown on all sides, and the internal temperature is 120 f on an instant-read thermometer. Remove to a cutting board and let rest for 10 minutes. Slice and serve. Serve the meat hot or cold. Makes 6 servings.

In a large bowl combine the spinach, pears, and walnuts. Toss to mix thoroughly and place in the refrigerator. In a small bowl mix together the orange juice, olive oil, and honeypour over the spinach mixture and toss to coat evenly. Just before serving sprinkle with the cheese and serve immediately.

Puree the yogurt and add the sugar and cardamoms. Put the puree through a strainer and chill overnight. Beat the yogurt with an electric mixer until frothy and whisk in the almonds and lemons. Chill and serve cold with a sprinkling of salt.

Combine the first 3 ingredients in a food processor bowl. Cover and process until smooth. Transfer to a small bowlcover tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate until serving time. Combine the remaining ingredients in a small bowlmix well. Sprinkle the mixture evenly over the steaks. Grill the steaks as desiredserve with the goat cheese sauce.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Lightly grease cookie sheets. Mix together brownie mix, 1/3 cup all-purpose flour, canola oil and water. Add eggs and mix until dough forms. Divide dough in half. Roll each half into a log about 10 inches long. Cut each log into 1/2-inch slices. Place about 2 inches apart on cookie sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until done. Remove from oven and place on wire racks to cool. In a small bowl, melt 1/4 cup chocolate chips and 1 tablespoon butter in microwave for 1 minute. Drizzle over the cookies. Sprinkle with nuts if desired. Makes 4 dozen.

Follow package directions for mixing the cookie dough. Roll into 1-inch balls of dough and place on ungreased cookie sheet. In a small bowl, combine the sugar, egg and melted butterstir well. Dip each ball into the egg mixture then into the cinnamon-sugar mixtureset aside on wax paper-lined baking sheets. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until the edges are golden brown. Cool for 1 minuteremove to wire racks to cool completely. Decorate with icing as desired.

Combine the first four ingredients and set aside. In another bowl, mix the last 4 ingredients together. Add the pudding mixture to the fruit and stir well. Refridgerate overnight. To serve: Layer the graham cracker crumbs in the bottom of individual serving dishes. Add half the pudding mixture and the crushed pineapple. Top with the whipped cream. Garnish with berries.
