Cut eggplant lengthwise and sprinkle with salt. Let stand until the eggplant has absorbed the juices. In a small skillet over medium heat, cook garlic in olive oil until golden. Add eggplant and cook until the eggplant is soft and browned. Remove from heat and set aside. In a blender, puree the eggplant mixture, balsamic and Tabasco sauce. Season with salt and pepper. Heat the olive oil in a saute pan over medium-low heat. When pan is hot, add the eggplant mixture to form patties. Cook 3-5 minutes per side or until browned and cooked through. Serve with fresh cilantro and balsamic vinaigrette.
name: creamy coleslaw with bell peppers red onioningredients: mixed vegetables, carrots, bell peppers, red onion, celery seeds, mayonnaise, rice wine vinegar, salt and black pepperpreparation: In a large bowl, toss together all vegetables and celery seed. In a small bowl, combine the mayonnaise, vineg

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Spray cookie sheet lightly with oil. In a medium bowl, stir together mayonnaise, dijon mustard, cayenne. In a small bowl, combine salt and pepper. Spread a thin layer of mayonnaise mixture on each cocktail rye. Top each with a small piece of turkey pastrami. Top each pastrami piece with a small piece of fontina cheese. Lay 4 slices of sauerkraut over each pastrami sandwich. Place sandwiches cut side down on cookie sheet. Bake for 4 to 5 minutes or until the edges are crisp. Cut each sandwich in half diagonally and serve. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium-low heat until melted. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract. In a large bowl, combine sugar, yogurt, butter mixture, eggs and mashed bananas. In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt. Mix into the egg mixture just until combined. Fill prepared muffin cups two-thirds full. Bake at 350 degrees f for about 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown and toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.
Brown beef and drain. Add remaining ingredients and simmer on low heat for about 2 hours. Serve over corn muffins.
Combine cranberry juice cocktail and grapefruit juice in a large pitcher. Add sugar and stir until it dissolves. Refrigerate until chilled. Add ginger ale. Garnish with orange slices.

Cream the banana with the oil until smooth. Add the rest of the wet ingredients. Mix the dry ingredients together. Add the dry ingredients to the wet ones. Stir until the dough is moist. Drop the dough by rounded teaspoons onto parchment paper-lined cookie sheets. Bake the cookies for about 10 minutes or until the edges are golden brown. Let cool for about 10 minutes before eating.

Place first 7 ingredients in a blender. Process until smooth and well mixed. Place salmon in a large zip-top plastic bag and pour marinade over the fish to coat both sides. Seal bag and refrigerate 3 hours or overnight. Preheat broiler. Place fish on a broiler pan coated with cooking spray. Broil 5 to 7 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve with peppers and lime zest.

Cook pasta and potatoes in water until tender. Drain and rinse with cold water. Place pasta and potatoes in a large bowl and add eggs. Add remaining ingredients except the peas and stir well to coat. Chill. Serve on lettuce if desired. Before serving add peas.

Preheat oven to 400. In a shallow dish combine breadcrumbs, garlic powder and pepper. Cut breasts into halves. Dip each breast in flour mixture coating evenly. In a large skillet cook breasts in butter over medium high heat until golden brown on both sides. Arrange on a baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. In a small bowl combine honey, lime juice and tabasco. Brush over cooked breasts. Serve with rice.

Prepare a medium hot fire for your charcoal grill. Oil fish and season with black pepper and paprika to taste and place on a hot grill. Cook fish about 4 to 6 minutes per side for rare to medium doneness. Remove fish from heat and let rest for 3 minutes before serving. While fish is resting combine all other ingredients in a medium bowl and mix until well blended. Drizzle over fish and serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan with margarine. Combine the soup mix and mayospread evenly on chicken breasts. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheeseroll up and place seam side down in prepared pan. In a bowl combine the breadcrumbs and melted buttersprinkle over chicken. Bake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from ovensprinkle with mozzarella cheese and return to oven for an additional 5 minutes. Serves 4-6.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Roll out phyllo pastry dough to 1/16 inch thickness. Place a layer of phyllo dough on top of each other to form a stack. Cut into 1-inch squares. Place roast beef in the middle of each square. Top with butter, parsley, chives and horseradish sauce. Fold pastry over to form a triangular shape. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown.

Slice the peeled bananas into thick rounds. Brush each piece of fruit on both sides with melted butter. Place the banana rounds on the grill. After 10 minutes, turn the rounds over. Brush both sides with honey, lemon juice and liqueur. Cook for an additional 5 minutes. Serve warm.
Brown chops with oil and onions. Add rice and vegetable juice to liquid in pan and let cook until rice is done and juice is absorbed.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Roll out each half of pastry and cut into 4 squares. Press each square into the bottom of 4 individual tart pans. Prick all-over with fork. Bake for 5 minutes. In large bowl combine spinach and half-and-half cream. Add eggs and beat well. Add salt and pepper to taste. Pour over crusts and sprinkle with cheese. Bake for about 30 minutes. Cool 10 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f (190 degrees c). Grease a 13x9x2 inch baking pan. Spread polenta evenly in pan. Cook over medium heat until mixture thickens and is easily scooped with a forkstir often. Remove from heat and cool for 10 minutes. Arrange mushrooms and garlic on top of polenta in an even layer and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Top with alfredo sauce and sprinkle with fresh basil and fontina. Bake until cheese is golden brownapproximately 5 minutes.
name: polenta primaveraingredients: water, yellow cornmeal, fontina, heavy whipping cream, parmesan cheese, salt, ground black pepper, primavera pasta saucepreparation:Grease 9-inch pie plate. Bring water to a boil in medium saucepan. Slowly add cornmeal over medium heat, stirring constantly, for 2 to 3 minutes or until slightly thick. Stir in fontina

Place one tortilla on plate. Layer with half the onion and half the cheese. Top with second tortilla. Heat in microwave oven for 30 seconds or until cheese is melted. Cut into wedges. Serve with salsa if desired.

Cream together the butter or shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg and then the milk. Stir in the remaining ingredients just until combined. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a hot, lightly greased griddle and cook until brown on each side and crisp. Makes 16 fritters.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large mixing bowl cream butter with splenda brown sugar blend until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time until fully incorporated. Combine the flour mixture with the baking soda and salt. Gradually stir into the creamed mixture. Finally stir in the morsels. Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto the prepared cookie sheets. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned. Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

Place eggs in a bowl. Beat them with a wire whisk until they are light and fluffy. Add milk and whisk again. Add sugar and salt. Place in a double boiler. Cook the mixture on medium heat until it is thick. Add the rice and maple syrup. Cook on medium heat for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and add the cream. Let stand for 5 minutes. Put into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Sprinkle with nutmeg.

Cream lard with sugar and raisins until light and fluffy. Add spices. Add eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. Beat in baking powder sifted with flour. Pour into greased 9 inch square pan. Bake at 375 for 25 minutes. Cool in pan 10 minutes then turn out on wire rack. Cut while warm.

Wash and dry the fruit. Cut the apricots in half. Cut the strawberries and raspberries in half. Add the fruit to a large bowl. Cut the jicama into small bite-size pieces. Add to the bowl. Cut the jalapenos into small pieces. Add to the bowl. Whisk together the dressing ingredients. Pour over the fruit and jicama and mix well. Sprinkle the sunflower seeds over the top and serve.

Cook the bacon and the onion in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp. Drain and set aside. Add the parsley and cook 1 minute. Set aside. Spray the skillet with low fat cooking spray. Cook the pasta as directed. Drain and add to the parsley mixture. Add the bacon and the onions. Stir in the creme fraiche until thoroughly blended. Garnish with the parsley if desired.

Bring sugar, orange juice and extract to a boil in a small saucepan over high heat, stirring to dissolve the sugar, 5 minutes. Reduce the heat to low and boil until the mixture becomes very thick and dark amber, about 10 minutes longer. Remove from the heat and stir in the nuts. Let cool completely and then stir in the almond extract. Store in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks.

Season the salmon fillets with the salt and fresh coarse ground black pepper to taste. Heat the cooking oil in a heavy skillet or saute pan until it begins to smoke. Add the fish and sear it on both sides for about 2 minutes per side. Remove the fish from the pan and transfer it to a platter. Squeeze lemon over the fish and serve immediately with the sauce of your choice.
Trim excess fat from pork. Rub with seasonings. Marinate in refrigerator for 24 hours. Bake at 250 for 4 hours. Turn oven to 350 for another hour.

Place potatoes in a saucepan of boiling water. Boil for 15 minutes or until tender but not mushy. Drain and allow to cool for 10 minutes. Peel the skin from the potatoes. Cut the potatoes in half lengthwise, then cut the halves in half again so you have quarters. Add the onions to the water left over in the pan from cooking the potatoes and cook for 3 minutes. Drain the water from the onions and add the potatoes, onions and herbs to a large serving bowl. Add the mustard and the low-fat mayo to the bowl. Add the eggs and toss gently to combine. Season with the salt and the pepper. Cover the salad and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Taste and adjust the seasonings before serving.

In a large mixing bowl combine corn and cucumbers. Add the onions and whip together with the miracle whip. Add the salt and pepper to taste and refrigerate for about an hour to blend the flavors. Serve chilled.

In a double boiler combine the chocolates, butter, sugar, egg, flour, baking powder, and salt. Stir until blended. Remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes. Divide into two 7-inch round spring form pans or two 8-inch square baking dishes. Place in a preheated oven at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool in pans for 10 minutesremove from panscool on wire racks completely before frosting.For frosting, combine all frosting ingredients in a medium saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, for 2 minutes or until blended and smooth. Pour over top of each cake. Serve warm or cold.

In a large mixing bowl combine the chocolate chips, half-and-half, and salt. Place in a medium saucepan and cook over low heat until the mixture is smooth and bubbly. Cool. In the meantime, whisk the egg in a small bowl until it is thick but still has a liquid consistency. In a large bowl beat the whipping cream until it forms stiff peaks. Stir the crème de menthe in the whipped cream. Fold the whipped cream into the chocolate mixture. Pour into small dessert dishes. Refrigerate until serving time. Garnish with whipped cream and sprinkle with the chopped chocolate.

Mix beef, refried beans, taco seasoning, salsa and sour cream in a large bowl. Press into a 9x13 baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Top with salsa, cheese and olives. Serve in warm soft taco shells.

Combine olive oil, garlic, thyme, oregano, vinegar, and white wine in a blender. Blend until smooth. Place fish in a large glass bowl. Pour marinade over fish. Cover. Marinate in refrigerator 1 hour. Remove fish from marinade. Sprinkle with cheese. Grill or broil 15 minutes.

Heat the oil in a saucepan and add the onion and cook until soft.Add the pumpkin and stir until coated with the oil and cook until soft.Add the stock and orange juice and cook until the pumpkin is soft.Puree the soup until smooth.Add the orange zest and juice and cook for a further 2-3 minutes.Add the sugar and season to taste and serve immediately or chill and serve later.Garnish with orange segments.
Soups are a great way to introduce veggies and flavors into your diet. Soup is so versatile that you can have a soup recipe for every day of the year and not repeat the same one. You can have soups as a starter or have it as a complete meal. It all depends on what you prefer and what works for you.
There are many different kinds of soups and they can be divided into many categories depending upon their main ingredient like the ones given below:
· Vegetable Soups
· Bean Soups
· Chowders
· Cream Soups
· Fish Soups
· Meat Soups
· Noodle Soups

Place caramels in small bowl. Add watermicrowave 30 seconds. Stir until smooth. Add peanut butter and continue stirring until well blended. Add oats and nuts. Stir well. Spread in 15x10x1-inch pan. Melt chocolate chipsspread over top. Cool completely. Cut into bars.

Brown the sausage with the cayenne pepper. Cool slightly, then crumble into a bowl. Mix the sausage with the baking mix, cheese, and butter. Roll into 1-inch balls. Place in a greased baking dish. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Cool slightly, then serve. Makes 6 dozen balls.

In a large bowl cream together the butter and 2 cups of the sugar. Add the sour milk, eggs, flour, soda, cloves, and cinnamon. Mix well. Fold in the raisins and currants. Pour into a greased and floured 9x13-inch pan. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool and spread with whipped cream or frosting.

In saucepan over medium heat, cook ham and mushrooms in butter until heated through and mushrooms are tender. Remove and keep warm. In same saucepan, cook eggs until done. Stir in mayonnaise and green onions. Spoon onto toasted bread and sprinkle with cheese and ham. Serves 2.

In a large bowl, combine all ingredients except fish. Arrange fish in a greased baking dish and cover with sauce mixture. Bake at 350 for about 25 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Yields about 4 servings.
Southern Style Catfish Cooking Recipes
Catfish has a mild taste that is enjoyed by many people. This tasty fish is typically fried, but there are many other ways to prepare it as well. Catfish can be baked, broiled, grilled, and steamed. It can also be used in soups and stews.
Catfish is a type of fish that is found in the rivers and lakes of North America. The fish is a popular food in the Southern United States and can be found in many restaurants in this region. Catfish is a good source of protein and contains omega-3 fatty acids, which are beneficial for heart health.
There are many different ways to cook catfish, but some of the most popular methods include frying, baking, and grilling. No matter how you choose to cook your catfish,

Cook the rice according to the package directions. Set aside to cool. Cut the chicken into bite-size pieces. Add the coleslaw mix to the rice. In a small bowl, combine the peanut sauce, soy sauce, and the water. Add the dressing to the chicken mixturetoss to coat. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Toss in the cilantro just before serving. Top with peanuts.

Pierce each chicken thigh with a few cloves of garlic. Sprinkle with Worchestershire Sauce. Combine lemon juice and olive oil in a shallow pan. Add chicken. Marinate for 30 minutes. Turn chicken over. Roast for 25 to 30 minutes. Baste with lemon pan drippings. Roast another 20 minutes. Turn again. Roast another 20 minutes or until done. Baste with pan drippings. Serve with rice or potatoes.

Cook the squash and onions in a small amount of water until tender. Strain and set aside. Butter a 9 by 13 inch pan and sprinkle half of the bread crumbs in the bottom of the pan. Spread the cooked vegetables and cover with the rest of the bread crumbs. Beat the eggs and milk together and pour over the top. Bake uncovered in a 350 degree oven for 30 minutes. Cut into squares. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 350. In a shallow dish, beat milk with eggsadd bread crumbs. Dip each chicken breast into egg mixture and then into crumb mixture. Place in a greased 13x9 inch pan. Bake, uncovered, at 350 for 40 to 50 minutes or until no longer pink. Spread pasta sauce over top of chicken. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 5 more minutes or until melted. Serve with pasta.
Pour sauce into 13 by 9 inch baking dish.
Stir in 4 tbsp of parmesan cheese.
Place the chicken breasts in the sauce, turning to coat them well.
Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes.
Remove from oven and uncover.
Sprinkle remaining parmesan cheese, and the mozzarella over the chicken breasts, and and continue baking for 5 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and cheese is melted.
Serve

Rub salt and pepper on both sides of each chop. Melt butter in frying pan and saute onion until translucent. Add mushrooms and sage. Cook until moisture is absorbed. Salt and pepper to taste. Beat egg whites until stiff. Stir breadcrumbs into egg whites and mix well. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stuff each chop with mixture. Brown on each side. Cover each with vegetable broth. Simmer on low for 30 minutes. Serve over rice or noodles.
I use 2 cans of cream of mushroom soup for these easy to make chicken casserole recipes.
I used to make this recipe all the time for my family when my daughter was growing up. We love it. I've made it with both white and brown rice.
I make these quite often for my family. I like the fact that they only have three ingredients.

Heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add green onions and stir-fry until limp. Add eggs, green peas and shrimpstir-fry until done. Add ricestir-fry until heated through. Add barbecued porkstir-fry until heated through. Add light and dark soy saucesstir-fry until combined. Garnish with green onions and serve.

Brown ground beef in skillet. Drain grease. Add onions and cook till onions are translucent. Stir in rice and spaghetti. Add broth to cover completely. Bring to a boil. Turn off heat. Cover tightly. Let stand 5 minutes. Fluff rice with fork. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.

Rinse the sprouts and cut them in half. Put them in a large bowl of ice water and let them soak for at least 30 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the mustard and vinegar in a small bowl. Slowly whisk in the oil until the dressing is emulsified. Season to taste with the salt and pepper. Drain the sprouts well and add them to the bowl. Add the pecans and toss well to coat. Serve at room temperature or refrigerate until ready to serve.

In a large nonstick skillet brown the beef with celery and onion, drain. Stir in the rest of the ingredients, mix well to combine. Simmer covered for 20 minutes, or until pasta is tender. Sprinkle with cheese and olives before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a 13 x 9 inch baking dish layer potatoes, onions, ricotta, salt, pepper, and garlic power. Pour the half-and-half over the top. Sprinkle with the cheese. Bake for 35 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Peel and slice the bananas into 1/2" thick slices and saute them in ghee and sugar for 1 minute. Add 1/2 cup water and simmer until the mixture becomes sticky and resembles halva. Add the almonds and cook for another minute or two. Add the cardamom and saffron and mix well. Transfer to a serving dish and garnish with almonds and pistachios. Chill well before serving.

Pour water into blender container with the powdered cocoa, sugar, and coffee. Blend until smooth. Add 1/4 cup ice cream. Blend until smooth. Add 1/2 cup ice cream. Blend until smooth. Pour into tall glasses, top with whipped cream and sprinkle with shaved chocolate or cinnamon.

Microwave tamales for about 2 minutes to soften them. Cut tamales in half. Add to leftover chili and heat through. Add the cheese and heat until melted. Stir in the sour cream. Top each tamale half with a little of the green onion. Serve over corn chips.
Heat oven to 350. Cut up the chicken and put in a bowl. Mix together the other ingredients and pour over the chicken. Cook 45-60 minutes or until done. Serve with potato wedges or baked potatoes.

Heat bacon drippings and brown bacon until crisp. Remove bacon and set aside. Saute onion in drippings until translucent. Add green beans and cook until crisp tender. Add vinegar and sugar to skillet. Simmer until hot and bubbly. Add bacon. Serve hot. Serve over hot rice.

Cut the green parts off of the garlic cloves. Wrap each garlic clove in a piece of bacon and secure with a toothpick. Wrap each bundle of bacon-wrapped garlic cloves in a slice of asparagus. Drizzle the garlic bundles in olive oil. Place the bundles in a lightly greased shallow baking dish. Roast until the bacon is crisp and the asparagus is tender, about 15-20 minutes. Sprinkle the roasted bundles of garlic with the parsley before serving.

Peel, seed, and slice cucumber into 1/4-inch thick slices. Set aside. Thinly slice carrots. Thinly slice red onion. Cut cherry tomatoes in half. In a large bowl combine the cucumber slices, carrot slices, red onion slices, cherry tomato halves, and cilantro. Toss gently to combine. In a small bowl combine the vegetable oil, rice wine vinegar, salt, and pepper. Add the dressing mixture to the vegetable mixture and toss gently. Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve. Garnish with additional chopped cilantro before serving if desired. Makes 4 to 6 servings.

Combine celery, chives and mayonnaise in a bowl. Add tabasco sauce to taste. Salt and pepper to taste. Fill each half of the avocado with the crab mixture. Sprinkle with lemon juice and garnish with fresh dill.

Melt margarine in skillet over medium heat. Add the onion & peppersaute for 3 minutes. Stir in the chicken, paprika, & peppercook & stir until the chicken is no longer pink. Pour in soup & cook until hot. Stir in the milk & biscuitscook & stir until biscuits are tender. Sprinkle with cheese.

Place potatoes and water in a pot and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender but not falling apart. Drain and allow to cool. Dice potatoes and scallions. Toss with sun-dried tomatoes and lemon juice. Add in ground cumin, olive oil and salt and pepper to taste. Chill before serving.

Saut the onions and garlic in the oil until tender. Add the chili powder and saut 1 minute. Add the squash and saut 1 minute. Add the quinoa and saut 1 minute. Add the tomatoes, beans and the remaining 1/2 cup of water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cover. Cook until the squash is tender. Add the cilantro. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve with tostadas if desired.

Cook the bacon until crisp. Drain the grease and add the bacon to a large pot. Add the onions and cook until translucent. Add the cabbage and cook for 10 minutes. Add the salt, cayenne, bay leaves, beer and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and cook for 40 minutes. Serve.

Combine the first 5 ingredients in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir to dissolve the honey. Add the apple and pears. Cook until fruit is tender, about 10 minutes. Stir in the whipped topping. Serve warm.

In a large skillet, saute the oil and garlic until fragrant. Add the ground beef and cook over medium heat until browned and crumbly. Drain off the fat. Add the beans, onion, and tomatoes. Cook 2 minutes. In a separate bowl, combine the chili powder and salt. Add the spice mixture to the chili. Stir well and heat through.
name: green chili stewingredients: green chilis, flour, water, green bell pepper, red bell pepper, onion, celery, broth, butter, black pepper, cumin, diced tomatoespreparation:First clean peppers. Remove seeds and stems. Chop peppers and set aside. Heat butter in a large pot over medium-high heat. Sauté peppers with celery and onion until tender. Add flour and stir to coat peppers. Gradually add broth and stir until smooth. Add tomatoes, pepper and cumin and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 20 minutes. Stir in green chilis. Cont

Place the sun-dried tomatoes in a cup. Cover with hot water and let stand for 1 hour. Drain and reserve liquid. Coarsely chop the tomatoes and set aside. Combine the oil, vinegar and lemon juice in a jar with a tight fitting lid. Add the tomato liquid and garlic. Cover and shake well to mix. Add the cheese and seasonings. Cover and shake again. Let stand for 2 hours. Store covered in the refrigerator. Shake well before using.

Combine sour cream and sugar. Add eggs and beat. Add vanilla. Stir in cream cheese. Spread evenly over bottom of graham cracker pie crust. Bake at 325 degrees f for 1 hour or until center is set. Cool and refrigerate.

Name: peanut butter cheesecake pieIngredients: peanut butter, graham cracker crumbs, sugar, cream cheese, eggsPreparation: In small saucepan, heat milk and peanut butter over medium heat until smooth. Cool. Beat cream cheese until fluffy. Blend in peanut butter mixture and egg yolks. Fold in whipped cream. Blend in graham cracker crumbs. Pour into pie crust. Bake at 350 degrees F for 40-50 minutes. Cool completely.
Name: chocolate mousse cheesecake pieIngredients: graham cracker crumbs, melted butter, chocolate

Cook pasta according to the package directions. Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic, and saute until it is golden. Add the wine and lemon juice. Bring to a boil. Add the tomatoes and salt. Cook for 5 minutes. Drain the cooked pasta and add to the sauce. Stir in the basil. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9-inch square baking pan or a 9-inch round baking pan with shortening. Slice the bread into 1-inch slices. Combine the eggs and half-and-half in a large bowl. Add the vanilla and spices and whisk well. Pour the mixture over the bread slices in the pan. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Remove from the refrigerator and bake for 30 minutes or until browned. Let sit for 5 minutes before serving.
This is an amazing site!
I have been looking for recipes for a long time and you have a great variety. Thanks!

In a small saucepan, combine milk, water, cardamoms, cinnamon, ginger, salt and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. In a large pot, bring milk to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes or until thickened slightly. Add sugar. Add almond extract. Pour into serving cups and garnish each serving cup with almond and ginger.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Beat together cream cheese and sugar in a large mixing bowl. Add sour cream and beat until blended. Add eggs, one at a time and beat until blended after each. Pour filling into the prepared crust. Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes. Lower temperature to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C), and bake an additional 30-40 minutes. Cool pie before serving.

Slice the onions into 1/2-inch rings. Heat butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onionscook for 5 minutes or until lightly browned. Add bouillon cubesstir well. Bring to a boilreduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes or until liquid is almost evaporated. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Transfer to an 8-inch square baking dishcover with aluminum foil. Bake in preheated oven for 35 minutes or until soft and golden brown. Remove from ovengarnish with parsley sprigs.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine berries, sugar, and lemon juice. Cook and stir until mixture begins to thicken. Add cornstarch and food coloring, then continue to cook and stir until mixture becomes thick and bubbly. Remove from heat and stir in cream cheese. Chill. Fill pie shell. Chill. Top with whipped topping.

In a medium bowl combine the tuna, carrots and celery. In a small bowl whisk together the mayonnaise and vinegar. Mix into the tuna mixture. Fill the tortillas with the mixture and serve.

This is an old family favorite of ours. It is so good and everyone loves it. It is so easy to make. It is great to use up those cans of tuna that you have sitting around. I love the taste of it.

Preheat oven to 350f grease a 9x13 pan. Prepare brownie batter according to package instructions (add melted butter). Bake for 15 minutes. Cool completely. In a medium bowl combine sweetened condensed milk, peanut butter and butter. Stir in the rest of the ingredients except for the nuts. Stir in nuts if desired. Spread over top of brownie layer. Cool completely in refrigerator. Cut into bars.

Saute olive oil and garlic in pan until garlic is golden. Add ground cinnamon and cumin, then cook for 1 minute. Stir in green beans and cook until tender. Add tomatoes and cook for 1 minute. Sprinkle with nuts and cumin seeds. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour an 8x8-inch baking pan. Mix together sugar and cocoa in a medium bowl. Sift together the flour and baking powder. Beat the egg whites until stiff peaks formbeat the egg whites into the cocoa mixture until smooth. Fold in flour mixture until just blended. Stir in vanilla and peppermint extracts. Spread into prepared baking pan. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Meanwhile, beat together the fat free cream cheese and egg whites until smooth. Spread over the top of the cooled brownies. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

In a heavy saucepan, combine the sugar, salt and evaporated milk. Cook and stir over medium heat until a candy thermometer reads 240 degrees. Stir in the peanut butter and vanilla. Pour into a greased and floured pan. In a small saucepan over low heat, combine the cocoa and milk. Stirring constantly until smooth. Pour over the peanut butter mixture. Beat the butter and powdered sugar until fluffy. Spread over the hot fudge. Cool and cut into squares.
This is a very rich and creamy fudge. I love it.
This is a very rich and creamy fudge. I love it. I think it's even better than the recipe in the back of the marshmallow cream jar.
This is a great tasting recipe. I would recommend it to anyone!
This is a very delicious recipe. I always get compliments when I take this to parties.
This was really good! I added a little more walnut to it, and that was good too.
I am not usually a big fan of fudge

Fry bacon until crisp. Cut into small pieces. Cook garlic in the hot bacon fat until softened. Drain. Crumble bacon. Set aside. In a small saucepan heat half-and-half. Add cream cheese. Stir until smooth. Stir in bacon mixture. Stir in blue cheese. Add chives. Transfer to baking dish. Sprinkle with almonds. Broil until hot. Serve with crackers.

Heat oil in large pot over medium heat. Add onion and celery. Cook, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are very soft. Add lentils. Stir in broth. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cover. Simmer 15 minutes or until lentils are tender. Stir in tomatoes. Cook 5 minutes. Stir in cheese until melted. Season with salt and pepper.

Place a slice of cheese on each hamburger bun. Top each piece of cheese with a piece of ham. Sprinkle with onion flakes and poppy seeds. Melt butter in microwave safe bowl. Add the mustard to the melted butter. Place the hamburger buns face down in the mustard mixture for a few seconds to cover the buns. Enjoy.
Cut tomatoes and onion into chunks. Add cucumber. Toss with remaining ingredients. Cover and chill. Add more sugar if desired.

Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Saute carrots and celery for about 10 minutes or until soft. Add onions and saute for a few minutes longer. Pour in stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10-15 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add honey and whipping cream. Bring back to a boil and cook for 2-3 more minutes. Stir in cloves and serve hot.
Cook orzo according to package directions. Drain welldo not rinse. Return to the pot. Stir in the creamheat until hot and bubbly. Sprinkle with the cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350. Wash potatoes. Peel and slice into 1/4" rounds. Toss in bowl with harissa. In a small bowl combine sesame seeds with olive oil. Toss with potato mixture. Season with salt to taste. Spread on baking sheet. Roast until done.
Combine ricotta cheese, sugar, orange zest, pistachios and chocolate chips in a bowlcover and refrigerate for 20 minutes or until ready to serveserve with strawberries and enjoy!

Cook potatoes in boiling water until done. Drain. Mash potatoes with butter. Let cool. Mix in chicken, cheese, egg, and breadcrumbs until thoroughly mixed. Form into balls. Brown in butter or margarine in a skillet. Add milk to cover bottom of pan. Cook for about 5 min. Turn and cook for another 5 min or until golden brown. Serve with cream and/or sour cream or yogurt topping or any other sauce you would like.

Place raspberry jam, honey, peanut butter and vanilla extract into food processor or blender and process until smooth. Combine dry ingredients with chickpeas. Pour into greased 8 x 8-inch baking dish. Pour jam mixture on top. Bake for 25 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Cool completely. Cut into squares and serve.
name: peas chickpeas and cuminingredients:chickpeas,peas,garlic cloves,cumin,butter,black pepperpreparation:Melt butter in a pan. Add garlic and cumin and saut for 1 minute. Add chickpeas and saut until heated through. Add peas. Season with black pepper and serve hot.
name: hazelnussomeletteningredients:flour,milk,egg,sugar,hazelnuts,salt,butterpreparation:Combine flour and milk. Stir in egg yolk. Fold in sugar, hazelnuts and stiffly beaten egg white

Heat vegetable oil in 5-quart pot over medium heat. Add garlic and saut for 2 to 3 minutes. Add all remaining ingredients except for salt and simmer for 20 minutes. Taste and add salt to taste. Serve warm or cold with beef empanadas, pork dishes, soups, stuffed sweet plantains, tortilla chips or plantain chips.

Mix together all ingredients except for the barbecue sauce and hot sauce. Add enough water to form a thick batter consistency. Heat oil in skillet and brown meatballs on all sides. Place in crockpot and cover with barbecue sauce and hot sauce. Cook for 1 hour on high or 2-4 hours on low. Serve hot with crackers or bread.

Combine oil and honey in 1-quart saucepan over low heat. Cook until honey dissolves. Add mixed nuts and chipotle powder. Toss until well coated. Spread on wax paper to cool. Store in an airtight container.

In a 10 inch skillet cook beef and onion until browned and drain. Stir in flour. Add paprika, garlic salt and pepper and continue cooking for 2 minutes. Add cream of chicken soup and mushrooms. Simmer until hot and serve over noodles.
 casserole bakeingredients: elbow macaroni, salt and pepper, margarine, evaporated milk, cocoa, sugar, vanilla extract, instant chocolate pudding mix, whipped toppingpreparation: Cook and drain macaroni. In 2 quart casserole, combine macaroni, salt and pepper. Melt margarine in large skillet. Add macaroni mixture and evaporated milk. Heat to boiling. Remove from heat. Stir in cocoa and sugar. Fold in pudding. Spread in casserole. Refrigerate. Just before serving, spoon topping over macaroni. May sprinkle with nutmeg if desired.

Combine the oil and garlic in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook the garlic until it begins to brown, about 2 minutes. Add the rice. Cook the rice, stirring frequently, for 2 minutes. Add the broth. Bring the liquid to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer. Cover and cook until the liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Stir the green onions into the rice. Season to taste with the salt. Let the rice sit for 5 minutes. Serve the garlicky brown rice with your favorite main dish.

Peel and core the pears. Cut the pears in half and remove the seeds. Cut the pears into small chunks. Place the fruit in a saucepan with 2 tablespoons of water. Cook on a low heat until tender. Cool. Preheat the oven to 180 C. Grease an oven proof dish. In a bowl, mix the fruit with the sultanas, 3 tablespoons of juice and 1 tablespoon of sugar. Pour into the greased dish. Mix the remaining juice with the flour and remaining sugar. Sprinkle over the fruit. Bake for about 45 minutes.

Bring water to a boil in a large pot. Break up egg and add to pot. Cook 5 minutes. Add gingerroot, vegetable bouillon cube and 1 teaspoon of sriracha sauce. Cook 3 minutes. Stir in ramen noodles and bean sprouts. Cook 3 minutes or until noodles are tender. Stir in soy sauce. Taste and adjust seasoning with more sriracha sauce if desired. Garnish with chives.

Combine maple syrup, sugar, and salt in heavy medium saucepan over medium heat. Bring to boil and cook without stirring until reduced to 1/3 cup syrup, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Beat egg whites in clean medium bowl with clean whisk at medium speed to stiff peaks. Gradually beat in syrup mixture until stiff peaks formmix in vanilla extract. Spread onto cake or use to fill cake layers. May be covered and refrigerated for up to 1 week or frozen for up to 2 months. Yield 1 1/2 cups frosting.

Mix all ingredients for the meatballs. Form into balls and place in a crockpot. In a skillet, cook the onions in oil over medium heat for about 5 minutes. Add the soup and cook for a few minutes more. Pour over the meatballs in crockpot. Cook on low for 8 to 10 hours or high for 4 to 5 hours. Serve hot over rice.

Combine the raspberries and lemon zest in a blender or food processor. Puree until smooth. In a large bowl, beat together the lemon curd and limoncello. Add in the raspberry puree and beat to combine. In a large bowl, beat together the mascarpone and heavy cream until light and fluffy. Add in the limoncello mixture and lemon extract and beat to combine. Divide between 8 dessert dishes and chill until serving. Garnish with fresh raspberries, fresh mint leaves and lemon verbena leaves.

Peel carrots. Slice into thin strips. Melt butter in a saucepan. Add carrots. Cook over medium heat for five minutes. Stirring frequently. Add brown sugar. Cook for another five minutes. Add cream. Bring to a boil. Add chopped chives. Serve with boiled new potatoes.

In a heavy saucepan, combine sugar and cocoa. Stir in milk and heat over medium heat until bubbles appear at the sides of the pan. Reduce heat to low. Stir in half and half and heat to a simmer. Stir in chips. Serve immediately. Garnish with whipped topping if desired.

Mix first 4 ingredients in a shallow bowl. Dip chicken in melted butterroll in bread-crumb mixture. Coat a baking pan with cooking spray. Place chicken in pan. Bake, covered, at 350 for 20 minutes. Uncoverbake 10 minutes longer or until done.
name: easy dijon chickeningredients: skinless chicken breast halves, milk, dijon mustard, fine dry breadcrumb, dried tarragonpreparation:Whisk together milk and dijon mustard. Have crumbs and tarragon mixed toegther in another bowl. Dip chicken pieces in milk mixture, and then dip them in crumbs. Place in a shallow baking dish in a single layer. Cover and bake in a preheated 375f oven for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake for a further 15 minutes, or until chicken is done as you like.
name: fast chicken parmesaningredients: vegetable oil, lemon juice, parmesan che

In a large skillet cook the garlic in oil until golden, about 4 minutes. Remove from heat. Add the chicken to the garlic in the pan. Turn to coat evenly. Add the pepper to the pan. Cover and cook over low heat about 3 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Stir in the frozen vegetables. Pour in the chicken broth. Cover and cook over low heat about 5 minutes or until the vegetables are heated through. Stir in the cooked pasta to the pan. Sprinkle with the Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese. Serve immediately garnished with the basil leaves. Serves 4.

Bring 4 cups of water to boil with 1 tsp salt. Add 2 cups of rice and return to boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for about 20 minutes until the water has evaporated. Fluff with a fork and set aside. Meanwhile, fry the bacon until crisp. Remove bacon and drain. Saute the onion and bell peppers until soft. Add the peas and saute 1 minute. In the same frying pan, scramble the egg and add to the rice mixture. Add the bacon and mix well. Serve.

Brown bacon in a large saucepan. Add onion and cook until tender. Add green pepper and cook until tender. Add rice, stirring to coat. Add stock. Add the okra. Cover the pan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cook 20 to 25 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in salt and pepper to taste.

Heat a wok over high heat until hot. Add 2 tablespoon of the oil and swirl to coat the base and sides of the wok. Add the garlic and ginger and fry for 30 seconds. Add the chicken and fry until no longer pink. Stir through the sweet chili sauce and fried fish sauce. Add the soy sauce and coriander leaves and stir through. Add the remaining tablespoon of oil and swirl to coat the base and sides of the wok. Add the noodles and stir through for 30 seconds. To serve, fill each lettuce cup with chicken mixture and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Rinse hen and pat dry with paper towels. Cut off the ends and pull out the giblets from the neck cavity. With your fingers or a knife remove the backbone from the hen. Place on a platter. Sprinkle the inside with 1/2 the seasoning salt. Place the remaining seasoning salt in a shallow dish. Dip the hen in the lemon juice. Roll it in the breadcrumbs and place in a roasting pan. Dot the hen with butter. Bake for 50 minutes. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese and bake for an additional 5 minutes. Serve.

In heavy saucepan over medium heat, melt the butteradd the onions and saute until tender. Add the potatoes, paprika and half of the flour. Stir to coat the potatoesadd the water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-lowcovercook for 10 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Stir in the remaining flourcook and stir for 1 minute or until slightly thickened. Remove from heatstir in the bullion cubes. Stir in the corn and half and halfheat through. Serve garnished with paprika, if desired.

Brown hash browns and onions. In a mixing bowl mix together cream of chicken soup, sour cream and butter. Pour into bottom of a 9x13 dish. Layer with hash browns and cheese. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.
This recipe is from my mom and we love it. You could also use pineapple juice instead of the orange juice if you want it to be sweet.
The cake has to be refrigerated to keep it from drying out.
Brown chicken in butter. Add onion and cook until tender. Add water. Season to taste. Simmer until done. Sprinkle with nutmeg.

Wash and dry two large baking dishes (17x10x3 inches) and two medium baking dishes (8x8x2 inches). Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Whisk together 1 1/4 cups of the flour with 1 teaspoon of salt and 1 teaspoon of baking powder in a large mixing bowl. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and break 3 eggs into it. Add 1 cup milk (or enough to make a thick but pourable mixture) and beat with a hand blender until smooth. Add a pinch of freshly ground black pepper. Add 1/2 cup of the remaining 2 cups of milk (or enough to make a thick but pour- able mixture) and beat until smooth. Add another pinch of freshly ground black pepper. Add the remaining 1/2 cup of milk (or enough to make a thick but pour- able mixture) and beat until smooth. Add another pinch of freshly ground black pepper. Cook rice according to package directions. Add chicken broth and hot water. Cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in frozen broccoli and chicken. Let stand for 5 minutes. Stir until broccoli is heated through. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.

In a large mixing bowl add your challah. In a separate mixing bowl beat together your heavy cream, eggs, orange juice, orange zest and orange peel. Pour mixture over challah and let soak for about 10 minutes. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Butter your 9x13 casserole dish and add your soaked challah mixture. Bake for 45-50 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Serve with maple syrup and enjoy!
Combine vodka, lime and raw sugar in a glass filled with crushed ice. Muddle together well. Stir gently. Serve in a chilled glass. Garnish with a lime wedge.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a casserole dish put a layer of crackers, then a layer of chicken breasts. Sprinkle a layer of cream of chicken soup and a layer of cream of mushroom soup on top of the chicken breasts. Continue in this manner until all the crackers are used. Sprinkle with water chestnuts. Add a layer of sour cream on top of water chestnuts. Bake for 30 minutes or until bubbly and crispy. Serve with crackers or corn bread. Serve hot.

In large skillet cook bacon until crisp, remove from pan and set aside. Add onion and cook 2 minutes stirring occasionally. Add butternut squash, corn, dry mustard and basil to pan and cook 2 minutes stirring constantly. Add bacon and vinegar and cook for 1 minute stirring constantly. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and garnish with fresh basil. Serve hot or cold.

Mix water, oil and eggs together. Stir in sugar and add cake mix. Beat 30 seconds on low speed, scrapping bowl after each mix. Beat on medium for 2 minutes. Grease 8-inch square pan and pour mixture in pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until done. Cool 10 minutes then poke holes and pour coconut flavoring over. Top with cool whip and sprinkle with shredded coconut. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Dissolve yeast in lukewarm water. Let stand 5 minutes. Add salt to the yeast mixture. In another mixing bowl combine buttermilk, honey, and melted butter. Add the yeast mixture to the buttermilk mixture. Beat until smooth. Gradually add 2 cups of the bread flour. Beat 2 minutes at medium speed of an electric mixer. Stir in enough remaining bread flour to make a soft dough. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface, knead 5 minutes or until smooth and elastic. Place in an oiled bowl. Cover and let rise in a warm place until double in bulk (about 1 1/2 to 2 hours). Punch down doughdivide in half. On a lightly floured surface, pat or roll each portion to about 1/2-inch thickness. Saute onion and butter in large skillet over medium heat until onion is tender. Add whole canned tomatoes, broth and crushed tomatoes. Simmer over medium heat for 15 minutes. In food processor or blender, process half of mixture until smooth. Return to skillet with remaining mixture. Add basil, thyme and pepper. Cook over medium heat for 10 minutes. Serve hot.

Pound out 6 crackers into 2-inch rounds. Divide chicken into 6 equal pieces. Spray a large nonstick skillet with cooking spray and place over medium heat. Cook the chicken until no longer pink. Divide the taco seasoning evenly between the 6 breasts. Spread the taco seasoning evenly over the top of each breast. Crumble the cheese over the breasts. Top each breast with a cracker round. Sprinkle the chiles over the tops. Cook over medium-low heat for 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the tops are lightly browned. Turn the bundles over and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

In a skillet, heat butter over medium heat until it is melted. Add garlic and saute until golden. Add red potatoes. Sprinkle with chili powder and salt and pepper. Cook until potatoes are fork tender. Sprinkle with fresh cilantro before serving.
Saute leeks in butter over medium-low heat for 5 minutes. Add squash, chicken stock and watercress. Cook 15 minutes. Blend. Season with hot sauce, salt, and pepper. Serve with sour cream.

Cook according to directions on back of can. Use 2 cans. Chop 1/2 onion. Cook chicken in skillet. Add 1/2 cup water. Add onion. Add remaining cans. Bring to boil. Remove from heat. Let stand 10 minutes. Drain chicken. Combine all. Spray a 2 quart casserole dish with pam. Pour mixture into dish. Cover with foil. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Remove foil. Combine dry ingredients and mix until well blended. Set aside. Beat butter and sugar until creamy and pale yellow. Beat in yogurt and vanilla. Bake at 375 degrees F for 18-20 minutes or until a wooden pick comes out clean. Serve warm. Makes about 12 muffins.

Place the water in a small saucepan over high heat. Add the sugar and stir until it dissolves, then set aside to cool for 5 minutes. Add the cucumbers to a sterilized jar, then add the chile slices. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine flour, salt and baking soda. Cut in butter. Stir in oatmeal. Press into the bottom of 9x13-inch pan. Layer with sliced apples. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Coat a baking pan with cooking spray or olive oil. Mix together the chicken and breadcrumbs in a shallow bowlset aside. Cream together the butter, eggs, sugars. Add the water, vanilla and salt. Add the flour, soda and oats. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Let cool for a minute and remove from cookie sheet to cooling rack.

In a sauce pan add textured vegetable protein and 1 cup of water and let soak for 15 minutes. In a fry pan add oil and soy sauce and then add TVP and the remaining 1 cup of water. Heat a pan over medium-high heat and add the olive oil and butter. Combine meat, pork butt, sugar, salt and water. Heat to boiling. Add garlic, ginger and mace. Simmer 15 minutes. Stuff casing and form into hot dogs. Cook over charcoal or gas grill until hot dogs are done and casing is brown.

Mix flour and cayenne in small dish. Heat oil in skillet. Dip tenders in flour mixture and fry. Drain on paper towels. Combine butter, vinegar and hot sauce in saucepan and heat until butter is melted. Serve with tenders.

Mix together pesto, tomato, onion, red bell peppers, yellow bell peppers, swordfish. Roll into tortilla. Cut in half. Serve with sour cream and guacamole.

In a large bowl combine butter, atkins baking mix, 1/2 cup water, sugar substitute and 1/8 teaspoon salt until crumbly. Press mixture into the bottom of a 10 inch springform pan. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Pour mixture over crust. Bake for 45 minutes. Remove from oven and cool completely in the pan on a wire rack.

The health benefits of frozen and canned vegetables are almost always the same as the benefits of fresh vegetables. Some nutrients may be lost during the freezing or canning process but in general these nutrient losses are minimal. In addition, frozen and canned foods are usually less expensive and often more convenient.
Sugar snap peas are one of the few frozen vegetables that are picked at their peak. They are frozen within hours of harvesting which preserves their color and texture.

Stir in tomato juice and cook uncovered another 30 minutes. Stir in garlic salt and tabasco sauce. Cook another 30 minutes. Stir in unsweetened cocoa powder. Serve over cooked pasta or cooked rice. Serve with shredded cheese and diced avocados.

Sweat the onions, celery and carrot in olive oil until tender, add the garlic and cook for a few seconds. Deglaze with the vinegar, add the ham bone and cover with water. Bring to a boil then simmer for 45 minutes or until the split peas are tender. Remove the ham bone, remove any meat from the bone and return the meat to the soup. Season with pepper to taste.

Place dried cranberries in small bowl. Add boiling water to cover. Let stand 10 minutes. Drain and reserve syrup. Cut orange in half. Add cranberries to bowl of a food processorprocess until smooth. Add orange juice, bourbon, gingerroot and orange peel. Process 1 minute or until smooth. Add orange half with its membrane and seeds and process 1 minute or until smooth. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add butter to panswirl until melted. Add green onion and cook 2 minutes or until softened. Remove from heat. Add cranberry mixture and orange half to panstir to combine. Cook 1 minute or until hot. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add oil to panswirl to coat. Add scallops to pancook 2 minutes or until lightly browned on each side. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Spoon cranberry mixture over scallopssprinkle with gingerroot. Serve immediately.

Mix light brown sugar, light corn syrup and butter in a 3 quart heavy saucepan over low heat. Stir till well blended and smooth. Heat to boiling over medium high heat. Remove from heat. Stir in baking soda and salt. Pour over popcorn and stir. Spread on a cookie sheet. Bake at 250 for 1 hour. Cool and store in airtight containers.

Melt the unsalted butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Slowly add the low sodium chicken bouillon cubes to the melted butter and continue to stir the mixture over medium heat. Add the Wondra flour, salt, poultry seasoning and black pepper. Stir the mixture constantly for 2 minutes or until the mixture is the consistency of a light paste. If the mixture is too thick add the low sodium chicken bouillon cubes and water. Serve over the chicken that you are serving or your favorite vegetables.

Heat oil in a pot and saute garlic until golden brown. Add onion, potato, rice, broth, parsley, and 2 cups water. Stir, bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour, stirring occasionally. Add more water if soup appears too thick. Stir in cheese and serve.

Thaw pastry at room temperature for 1 hour. Preheat oven to 425°F. Cut puff pastry into 24 squares. Roll squares into balls and place 1 inch apart on ungreased baking sheet. Brush with egg and sprinkle with chocolate. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire rack. Serve warm or cold.
Remove stems from caps. Chop stems. Sauté chopped stems in butter with chopped garlic. Add breadcrumb mixture. Cook until thick. Fill caps with mixture. Top with Parmesan cheese and parsley.

Place roast in slow cooker. Mix remaining ingredients together and pour over roast. Cook on low for 4-6 hours. Turn roast every 2 hours and baste frequently.
name: slow-cooked pork roastingredients: boneless pork roast, ketchup, water, brown sugar, white wine or chicken broth or vegetable broth, Worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, salt and pepperpreparation:Cut 2-inch slits into roast every 1 to 2 inches. Insert a sliced onion halfway into each slit. Pour ketchup into bottom of crockpot. Place roast over top. Cover roast with liquid. Cook on low for 6 to 8 hours. Remove roast from liquid and discard liquid. Cut roast into 1/4-inch thick slices. Serve hot or cold.
name: honey-sweet mustard roastingredients: boneless pork roast, slices of sweet onion, slices of orange, slices of lemon, slices of grapefruit, s

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grease 12 muffin cups or line with paper liners. Sift together the dry ingredientsset aside. In a medium mixing bowl, cream the margarine with the splenda granular until light and fluffy. Beat in the milk. Add the egg, honey, vanilla extract and saltbeat until smooth. Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, stirring just until combined. Fold in the blueberries. Fill the prepared cups about 2/3 full. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the tops of the muffins are golden brown. Cool in the pan for 10 minutestransfer to wire racks to cool completely. Makes 12 muffins.
Brown beef. Add onion and cook until tender. Add chili con carne. Heat through. Add remaining ingredients. Bake in 2-quart casserole at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Top with cheese.

In a large pot combine tomatoes, peppers, vinegar, sugar and spices. Bring to a boil and cook 15 minutes or until the peppers are tender crisp. Ladle into sterilized pint jars, leaving 1/2 inch headspace. Remove air bubbles and adjust lids. Process in a boiling water bath for 10 minutes. Makes about 10 pints.

Beat the eggs with a whisk until lightly frothy. Add the rest of the ingredients, stirring to combine well. Heat a skillet or griddle until hot but not smokingbrush it with a bit of butter. Add 1/4 cup of batter for each pancakecook until it starts to bubble, then flip it over and cook until golden brown on both sides. Serve warm with syrup or jam or honey.

In a slow cooker, place the ribs in the bottom of the pan. Combine the remaining ingredients. Pour over the ribs. Cover and cook on low for 8-10 hours. Serve with your favorite coleslaw.
 huli-huli chickeningredients: chicken breasts, vegetable oil, huli-huli saucepreparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place chicken in a baking dish. Brush chicken with vegetable oil. Bake until cooked through. Serve with huli-huli sauce.

Rinse the chicken breasts under cold water to remove any blood and pat dry with paper towels. Put the breadcrumbs, water, oil and pepper in a shallow bowl and mix well. Dip the chicken in the mixture to coat lightly and place in a single layer in a shallow baking dish. Spoon about a tablespoon of preserves on each piece of chicken and cover with foil. Roast in a preheated 350F oven for 35 to 40 minutes until the chicken is cooked through and the preserves are bubbling.

Peel and chop sweet potatoes. In a sauce pan, add a small amount of water to prevent sticking. Bring to a boil then cover and cook until tender. Meanwhile melt margarine & brown sugar in a small sauce pan over medium heat. Remove from heat & mix in marshmallow cream. Fill cooked potato halves with marshmallow mixture & return to pan. Top each with a marshmallow & a little more marshmallow cream on top. Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes or until topping is golden brown.

In a saucepan, heat oil over medium heat. Add mustard seeds, cloves and cumin seeds. Saute until seeds start to sputter. Add red onion and saute until soft. Add tomato paste and saute until a thick paste forms. Add tomatoes and salt and simmer for 15 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in peanuts. Let cool to room temperature before serving. Serve with toast points or crackers. Serve warm.
Chop garlic. In a bowl, combine all of the above ingredients and mix well. Spread on crackers and chill.
In a medium saucepan, bring together all but nuts. Stirring constantly over medium heat, cook until mixture is thick. Add vanilla. Stir in nuts. Serve warm.

Combine all the ingredients together in the bowl of a stand mixer. Beat with a paddle attachment for a few minutes or until the mixture is well combined. Place the mixture into a serving dish or container and chill for at least 2 hours before serving. Serve with crackers or bagel chips.

Bring the water to a boil in a 2-quart saucepan. Add the butter and half-and-half. Stir in the pinhead oats and cook, stirring occasionally until the liquid is almost absorbed. Add the salt and stir. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

In a large bowl combine the barley, thyme, and 2 cups of water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer for about 20 minutes or until barley is tender. Drain barleytransfer to a bowl. Add carrot juice, cayenne, and lemon juice. Whisk in oil. Cover and chill for several hours. Stir in beans, tomato, and avocado. Season to taste with additional salt and pepper.

Boil potatoes until tender, drain and set aside. Add heavy cream to potatoes and mix well. Add cheese, cilantro, and salt to taste. Transfer to 9-inch deep pie pan. Cover with foil and bake at 350 degrees f for one hour. Remove from oven and let stand 15 minutes before serving.
name: something special mashed potatoesingredients: idaho potatoes, whole milk, evaporated milk, salt, sugar, butterpreparation:Peel and cut potatoes into small chunks. Boil in salted water until you cannot pick up a piece with a fork. Drain all the water from the potatoes and place all ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Beat until creamy smooth. Serve hot.
name: peppered potatoesingredients: idaho potato, garlic, black peppercorns, skim milk, salt, paprikapreparation:Peel potatoes and thinly slice. Place potatoes in saucepan with garlic and peppercorns. Cover with water and bring to a boil. Cook

In a large bowl, add the eggs and beat until foamy. Add the water and salt and beat again. In another bowl, combine the flours. Add the flours a little at a time to the egg mixture and beat well. Add a little more and beat some more. If it's too dry, add more water. If it's too wet, add more flour. The consistency should be like pancake batter. Heat the oil in a small pot. Take a small scoop of the batter and drop it into the oil. It should float and bubble for a minute or two. If it does this, then your batter is ready. If not, keep adding a little more water until it does. Fry the tortillas for 2 minutes per side. Put them in the oven for 30 minutes, then cut them up. This recipe makes about 8 - 10 tortillas.
Combine all ingredients. Pour over cooked boneless pork steaks or chops. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve over rice.

Peel bananas then cut each one into 3 or 4 pieces. Place these pieces into a greased baking dish. Mix together 1/2 cup of brown sugar, 2 tablespoons of butter and 1 tablespoon of orange juice. Sprinkle this mixture on top of banana pieces. Pour 1/4 cup of dark rum over all. Bake for 15 minutes. Serve warm.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium high heat. Sprinkle both sides of steak with rosemary and season with salt and pepper. Place in skillet and cook for 4 minutes, turning once. Sprinkle with lemon juice. Sprinkle with garlic and continue cooking until desired doneness. Cut into slices. Serve with lemon slices.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease two baking sheets. In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt butter and oil. Stir in cayenne to taste. In a bowl, combine water and flour. Gradually add to the saucepan and stir until smooth and thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in eggs one at a time until smooth. Add asiago, parmesan and pecorino pepato cheesesstir until well blended. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto baking sheets. Bake for 20 minutes or until puffed and golden brown. Serve warm or at room temperature with marinara or pesto dipping sauce. Makes about 100 puffs.

Drain cool whip from container and measure 2 cups to set aside. In a medium bowl, add 1 cup sugar-free gelatin to 1 cup hot water and stir to dissolve. Add 3 cups strawberries to gelatin mixture and stir to combine. Divide strawberry mixture among 4 dessert dishes. Cut 4 twinkies in half horizontally and place 1 half on top of each serving of fruit mixture. Top each twinkie with 2 tablespoons fat-free cool whip. Refrigerate at least 3 hours before serving.

Heat oil in a large saucepan. Add onion and cook until soft. Add garlic and cook for another minute. Add bacon and cook until crispy, then add to pan. Add pumpkin to pan and cook for about five minutes. Add beetroot to pan. Season to taste with pepper. Add feta cheese and cook for another minute. Serve as a side dish with roast poultry, fish, lamb or beef.
16)	What does “fresh” mean to you?
17)	What is your favorite dish to order at an Indian restaurant?
18)	What is the one dish you would never eat?
19)	What are some of your favorite things to make in the slow cooker?
20)	What’s your favorite thing to cook for dinner?
21)	What is your favorite healthy snack?
22)	What is your favorite healthy breakfast?
23)	Do you like to cook?
24)	If you were on death row what would be your last meal?
25)	Do you eat breakfast every day?
Beat cream cheese until soft. Blend in egg until smooth. Blend in vanilla and cake mix. Drop by teaspoon onto waxed paper. Let cool. Roll in powdered sugar before serving if desired.
Toss together iceberg lettuce and all other ingredients. Add more or less of each to suit taste. Serve immediately or refrigerate overnight. Serve at room temperature.
Dissolve orange jell-o into boiling water and pour into shot glasses. Fill with peach schnapps and let chill for at least four hours.
Preheat oven to 375f. Mix together butter and mayonnaise. Add parmesan cheese. Cut rolls into halves. Spread with butter-mayonnaise mixture. Bake until golden brown. Serve with salad.

Place all ingredients in a large punch bowl or pitcher and mix well. Refrigerate for 2-3 hours or overnight. Before serving stir in club soda. Serve cold in punch glasses over ice. Garnish with fresh pomegranate arils or cranberries and a slice of fresh orange.

In a medium-sized saucepan combine water and sugar substitute. Bring to a boil and stir until sugar substitute is dissolved. Remove from heat and add lemon and gingerroot slices. Strain syrup into a large pitcher and cool for about 30 minutes. Refrigerate syrup until ready to serve. To serve, pour 1 ounce syrup into each glass. Top each glass with seltzer water and a few ice cubes. Garnish with lemon slices and a sprig of fresh gingerroot.

Mix together flour, salt, and paprika. Toss in chicken drumsticks and coat with flour mixture. Heat margarine in skillet over medium high heat and add chicken. Cook until brown. Turn to cook other side and continue cooking until golden brown. Serve.

Prepare your favorite barbecue rub and sprinkle it liberally over both sides of each rib. Wrap each rib individually in plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight to allow flavors to combine. When ready to cook your ribs, preheat oven to 300 degrees fahrenheit. Unwrap your ribs and set them in a large roasting pan. Pour 1 cup of low-carb barbecue sauce over the ribs. Cover pan tightly with aluminum foil and bake for 3 hours, basting frequently with remaining barbecue sauce. Remove from oven and cool for 1 hour before serving. Makes 2 servings.

Preheat oven to 375. Whisk together egg white and 1 tablespoon water in a small bowl. Toss beets with 1 tablespoon oil in a large bowl. Pour egg mixture over the beetstoss to coat. Place the beets on a baking sheetroast for 15 minutes or until the beets are tender. Transfer the roasted beets to a medium bowllet cool. When the beets are cool enough to handle, peel them. Add remaining 2 tablespoons oil, vinegar, green beans, walnut pieces, parsley and goat cheese. Toss to combine. Arrange the salad on a serving platter. Garnish with parsley.

Whisk eggs together with Tabasco Sauce, Tabasco Jalapeno Sauce, parmesan cheese, and salt. Cook eggs in nonstick skillet. When eggs are set, place one half of the flour tortilla over the eggs. Fold over top half of tortilla. Cook over medium heat until cheese is melted and bottom is crisp and golden brown. Cut into wedges. Serve with Tabasco Sauce for dipping.

Combine Italian bread crumbs and herbs. Dip drumsticks into egg and milk then into crumb mixture. Bake in 350 degree oven for 20 minutes. Turn and bake an additional 10 minutes. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Serve with a salad and garlic toast.

This is a list of things I have done and should do that I have not done but will and should.
This is a list of things I have done and should do that I have not done but will and should but will not.
This is a list of things I have done and should do that I have not done but will and should

Combine cake mix, butter and 2 cups of water in a large mixing bowl. Beat on low speed for 30 seconds, scrape sides of bowl and beat on low speed for 30 seconds more. Pour into 13x9-inch baking pan. Top with cherry pie filling and bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes.

Bring a large pot of salted water to boiling. Add rigatoni and boil over medium heat until tender but still firm to bite, about 9 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water. Drain well. Combine olive oil, garlic, cilantro leaves and oregano leaves. Add rigatoni and toss to coat. Add black olives and toss to blend. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Let stand at room temperature for 15 minutes before serving. Garnish with pine nuts.

In a large bowl, combine the popcorn, cereals and peanuts. Combine brown sugar, corn syrup, butter and baking soda in saucepan over low heat until melted. Add vanilla. Pour over popcorn mixture. Stir until evenly coated. Spread in shallow baking pan. Cool. Store in airtight container.

Grease 13x9 inch pan with cooking spray. In medium bowl stir together all ingredients with spoon until blended. Spread into pan. Bake 25 min or until done. Cool 10 min. Spread caramel topping over top. Cool completely. Cut into bars.

Spray a 3-quart crock-pot with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine the frozen hash browns, ham, onion and green bell pepper. Spread into the crock-pot. In a medium bowl combine the eggs, skim milk, salt and pepper. Pour over the hash-brown mixture. Cover and cook for 4 hours in the slow cooker on high or 8 hours on low. Sprinkle with monterey jack cheese. Cover and cook for an additional 30 minutes or until set. Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting into wedges. Serve with toast or biscuits.

Season the pork chop with salt and pepper. Brown the chop in a skillet until it is nicely browned. Add the sliced onion to the skillet and cook until the onions are translucent. Add garlic and cook for about 1 minute. Add the beer to the skillet. Add the sauerkraut along with about half of its liquid. Stir to combine, cover the skillet, reduce heat to low, and simmer for approximately 20 minutes. Remove cover from skillet and cook off any remaining liquid, moving the chop to the bottom of the pan for final browning on both sides. Add the summer savory just before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Sprinkle the herbs over the meat. Rub the butter and olive oil over the top of the herbs and roast for 30 minutes. After 30 minutes remove the roast from the oven and sprinkle the garlic over the top of the roast. Return roast to the oven for another 30 minutes. Remove the roast from the oven and serve hot.

Place the wings in a large plastic bag or bowl. Add the butter and olive oil. Add the red pepper flakes, lemon juice, garlic, pepper, and parsley. Mix well. Place in a shallow baking dish. Cover tightly with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 12 hours. Remove from the refrigerator 1 hour before cooking time. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Bake the wings uncovered for about 20 minutes or until the wings are tender and no longer pink.

In a food processor, process the bulgar wheat into a coarse flour. In a large mixing bowl combine the lamb and bulgar wheat mixture. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well. Form into small balls. Brown in a saute pan. Serve with rice and yogurt.

Combine flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside. Cream the shortening, sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla until creamy. Beat the eggs into the mixture one at a time. Gradually add the dry ingredients, mixing well after each addition. Stir in the toffee pieces. Drop by level tablespoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 12 minutes.

In a large bowl beat together the flour, cinnamon, sugar, and butter until well blended. Press mixture evenly into a 9-inch square baking pan. Bake in a 350f oven for 20 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. In a small saucepan combine sugar and golden syrupbring to a boil. Cook for 3 minutes or until mixture is thickened and bubbly. Quickly pour over the baked crustdo not stir. Cool on a wire rack for 15 minutes or until set. Cut into bars. To decorate bars, brush with jam and sprinkle with coconut. Serves 8
Place cracked ice into large glasses. Pour in lemonade and top with soda. Garnish with limes.
Combine first 5 ingredients in a large pitcher, stirring until sugar dissolves. Refrigerate 3 hours. Add apples, club soda, and ice cubes to pitcher just before serving.

Slice the french bread on the diagonal into 1-inch thick slices. Place the french bread in a single layer on a baking sheet and bake for 5-7 minutes at 350. While the french bread is baking prepare the spread by mixing the mayonnaise, herbs, salt and pepper together in a small bowl. When the french bread is done baking remove from the oven and spread the top side with the herb spread. Return to the oven and bake for 5-7 minutes until the top is slightly browned and the spread has melted. Cut into wedges and serve.

Combine all ingredients in a heavy kettle and cook over low heat until mixture comes to a full boil (a small amount of sugar will be left on the side of the kettle). Continue cooking until mixture reaches a soft-ball stage (238 to 240 degrees F on a candy thermometer). Remove from heat, add vanilla, and beat vigorously with a wooden spoon for 2 to 3 minutes. Drop by the spoonful on a wax-lined baking sheet and allow to cool completely. Store in an airtight container or wrap in wax paper.
Cream together peanut butter and creamy peanut butter. Add candy corn. Shape into balls. Dip into melted chocolate and place on wax paper. Let set.

Whip 2 1/2 c. cream cheese until light and fluffy. Beat in 1/2 c. chopped red pepper jelly. Add 2 c. sharp cheddar cheese and 2 eggs. Beat well. Pour into 10 in. Springform pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Cool. Slice and serve on crackers.
Brown ground beef and onion in butter. Add bouillon powder. Stir to mix. Add cream cheese. Stir until melted. Spoon mixture on tortillas. Roll up.

Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Fry onion and garlic for 2 minutes or until golden brown. Stir in potato and corn, cook for another 4-5 minutes or until tender. Cool for 5 minutes. Add oregano, egg, cheese. Mix well. Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Spoon mixture into pan, flatten a little with a spatula. Cook until golden brown. Turn over and cook for another 2-3 minutes or until cooked through. Serve hot.

Mix dry mix with rosemary. Add cream and salt. Mix to form a dough. Roll out to 1/2 inch thick. Cut with biscuit cutter. Top each scone with a smoked ham slice. Drizzle with sugar and zest. Bake until done.

Preheat oven to 375f. Unroll crescent dough into large rectangle on ungreased baking sheet. Seal perforations. On a cutting board, cut dough into 10 long strips. In small bowl, beat cream cheese, sugar, and extract until blended. Roll up each strip, starting at one long side. Tucking ends under. Pinch seams to seal. Place 2 inches apart on greased baking sheet. Beat egg white. Brush strips with egg white. Sprinkle with sliced almonds. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes until pastry is deep golden brown. Cool 10 to 15 minutes. Serve warm or room temperature.
Name: Almond Pie Crust Ingredients: Butter, Brown Sugar, Xanthan Gum, Rice Flour, Vanilla, Almonds Preparation: Combine brown sugar, xanthun, rice flour, vanilla and almonds in a medium mixing bowl. Cut in butter with pastry cutter or fork. Spread the mix into a nine inch pie

Mix the dry ingredients together. In another bowl combine the soy milk, cinnamon, vegetable oil and vanilla. Pour the liquid ingredients into the flour mixture, stirring only until the mixture is moistened (a few lumps are OK). The batter should be very thin (almost like a pancake batter). Heat a lightly greased griddle or frying pan over medium heat. Using a measuring cup or scoop, pour batter onto the griddle (3" diameter). Cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until the top of the pancake is covered with bubbles that are about to pop. Flip pancake over and cook for 1 minute longer or until browned on the other side. Makes 6 servings. Serve with fruit spread or your favorite syrup.

Cook noodles in boiling water for about 10 minutes or until tender but firm. Drain well and return to pot. Add butter or margarine and stir until melted. Add hamburger with all the juices from the package. Add spaghetti sauce, velveeta, and mozzarella cheese. Mix well. Pour into greased 9x13 casserole dish. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for about 45 minutes or until top is brown and bubbly. Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting into squares.
In a small bowl, stir together the mayonnaise, garlic powder and onion powder until smooth. Spread mayonnaise mixture evenly over each side of the bread slices. Place bread slices on a baking sheet. Broil 1 inch from heat for 2-3 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve warm.

Bring stock to boil in a large saucepan over high heat. Add bulgur wheat, cover pan, reduce heat to low, and cook for 15 minutes. Uncover pan, add onion, stir gently for 5 minutes, season to taste with salt, and serve.
Cook and chop chicken. In small bowl combine Miracle Whip Light, sugar and pepper. Mix with chicken. Add in pickles and toss to coat. Serve cold or room temperature.

Soak the octopus in the vinegar overnight. Drain the octopus. Heat the olive oil in a saucepan. Add the octopus and cook until tender. Remove octopus to serving plate. Combine the vinegar and the rest of the ingredients. Pour over octopus. Garnish with parsley.
name: shrimp or crawfish monicaingredients: butter, shrimp, salt, red peppers, shallots, whipping cream, white pepper, paprika, cooked pasta, garlicpreparation: Saute shallots and seasonings with butter. Add shrimp or crawfish and cook until pink. Add cooked pasta and whipping cream. Cook to desired thickness. Serve immediately, great with bread.
name: lemon linguini with shrimpingredients: linguine, olive oil, lemons, juice of, green onion, fresh parsley, salt, fresh ground pepper, parmesan cheese, asparagus, shrimppreparation: Cook linguini according to diretions. Combine next

Cook noodles according to package directions. In skillet brown beef, drain fat. Add onion and all other ingredients except noodles, corn and cheese. Simmer 10 minutes. Place noodles in bottom of 13 by 9 by 2 inch dish. Pour meat mixture over noodles. Sprinkle with corn and top with cheese. Bake 20 minutes at 350 degrees.

Brown sausage and onion in a dutch oven. Add macaroni and cook for 3 minutes. Add in vegetable oil and mix. Add in can of soup and bring to a boil. Add milk and parmesan cheese. Add in broccoli and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in parmesan and italian seasoning.
Combine all in a saucepan. Cook over low heat until it boils. Take off the heat and add in vanilla. Stir well. Drop by teaspoons onto wax paper or cookie sheet to cool.

Peel and slice potatoes very thin. Put 1/2 cup of butter and 1/2 cup of beef broth into a 1 1/2 quart casserole. Arrange potatoes in layers. Season with pepper and add beef broth and butter until all the potatoes are used. Cover and bake at 375 for about 40 minutes or until tender and top is browned and bubbly. Serves 4 to 6.

In a large mixing bowl beat egg whites with cream of tartar until stiff. Gradually beat in sugar about 1/4 cup at a time until stiff peaks form. Stir in whole berry cranberry sauce until well combined. Shape into 1-inch balls. Place 1-inch apart on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 20 minutes or until set but still shiny. Cool for 5 minutes. Transfer to wire racks to cool completely. Dip the bottom of each ball into melted chocolate, then into coarsely chopped dried cranberries to coat. Place on waxed paper. Cool completely before storing or serving.

In a large pot over medium heat, add bratwursts. Cook until lightly browned. Add beer and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer for 30 minutes. Add onions. Cook until soft. Stir in spices. Simmer 5 minutes longer. Serve in buns with spicy brown mustard.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place tenderloin in a resealable plastic food storage bag. In a small bowl, combine hoisin sauce, ginger, and sesame oil. Pour over tenderloin.
