Marinate in the refrigerator for 2 hours. Remove from marinade and pat dry with a paper towel. Mix sesame seeds and sesame oil in a shallow bowl. Place the pork in a roasting pan and bake for 30 to 40 minutes or until a meat thermometer registers 160 degrees. Cut into thin slices and serve.

Mix together the cabbage and carrots in a large salad bowl. Mix the salt, pepper and lemon juice and add to the slaw mixture. Add the mayonnaise and mix well. Chill for several hours.
Name: Grandma S Coleslaw
Ingredients: Cabbage, Green Pepper, Celery, Onion, Carrot, Vinegar, Sugar, Salt, Celery Seed, Mustard Seeds
Preparation:Prepare vegetables as directed. Combine in medium bowl. Set aside. In a small saucepan, combine vinegar, sugar and salt. Simmer until sugar is dissolved. Add celery seed and mustard seed. Cool. Pour vinegar mixture over vegetables. Stir until well coated. Chill and serve.
Name: Delicious Coleslaw For Diet
Ingredients: White Cabbage, Carrots, Onion, Mayonnaise, Mustard, Vinegar, Salt And Pepper, Sugar, Pasta, Chicken
Preparation:Dice the white cabbage, carrots and onion long and thin.

Cook pasta according to directions on box. Drain and return to pasta pot. Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Add tomatoes and season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in pasta and 1 1/2 cups of the cheese until smooth and creamy. Pour into a 3 quart baking dish and sprinkle remaining 1/2 cup of cheese on top of mixture. Bake at 350 for about 25-35 minutes or until golden brown on top. Serves 6-8.

Combine the butter, minced garlic, oregano, basil and thyme in a small mixing bowl. Using the palms of your hands, knead the mixture until it becomes a smooth, creamy consistency. Form the mixture into a 3-inch log. Wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate up to two weeks. To serve, unwrap the butter and cut off small pieces with a paring knife.

In skillet heat oil. Saute chicken in oil till done. In seperate bowl mix apricot halves with apricot nectar. Pour apricots over chicken. Stir in french onion soup. Boil 5 min stirring constantly. Add cellophane noodles, stir fry vegetables and garnish with apricot halves.
I want to have a healthy diet but it is not possible to give up pizza and pasta!
I've never seen this product in stores where I live (I'm in the USA). Where can I find it?
I love this pasta but I am having difficulty finding it. Any suggestions?
I had this in an Italian restaurant here in London, England. I was so pleased that I have found this site as I can now order it online as I can't find it in my local supermarket. It's the only pasta I will eat!!
I tried to get this at my local grocery store, but they did not have it on their shelves or in their deli section (where they usually carry it). They told me that they had been getting more requests for
Mix all together, brush on roast during cooking.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter six ramekins. Place eggs in a small saucepan. Cover with water by 1 inch. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and cover. Let eggs stand 10 minutes. Drain and run cold water over them. Peel and cut into quarters. Melt butter in a saucepan. Stir in flour and cook 1 minute. Add cream and season with nutmeg and pepper. Stir until sauce thickens and is smooth. Add cheese and stir until melted and smooth. Spoon sauce into ramekins. Arrange egg quarters on top. Sprinkle with a little more cheese. Place ramekins in a baking pan. Pour boiling water in pan until it is half way up sides of ramekins. Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until eggs are cooked through. Serve immediately. Serves 6.

In a large pot of boiling water, cook pasta according to package directions. While pasta is cooking, heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add leek and cook until soft, 4-5 minutes. Add half-and-half. Bring to a simmer. Add spinach. Cook until wilted. Remove from heat. Drain pasta, reserving 1/2 cup liquid. Add pasta to sauce and toss. Serve topped with basil.

Place cutlets in a gallon size zip lock bag. Add garlic pepper. Seal. Shake until coated. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Add cutlets, cook 3 minutes per side. In a bowl, combine syrup and wine. Stir. Add cooked cutlets. Cook until heated through. Add onions. Simmer for 2 minutes. Add cutlets. Simmer 2 minutes longer. Serve with cooked couscous. Top with fresh herb. Serve with cooked couscous. Top with fresh herb. Serve with cooked rice.

Combine the butter, 3 tablespoons of the granulated sugar, the vanilla and the water in a small saucepan over low heat. Bring to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and whisk in the cream and the remaining 3/4 cup granulated sugar. Stir until the mixture comes back to a boil over medium-low heat. Remove from the heat and stir in the pecans. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with wax paper or parchment. Let stand until cooled, about 2 hours. Store in an airtight container for up to 5 days or freeze for up to 6 months.
Dip eggplant into batter and deep fry. Drain on paper towels and season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the white sugar, cocoa powder, salt and water. Bring to a boil and cook, stirring constantly, until mixture is smooth. Stir in the butter and continue cooking for 1 minute. Remove from the heat and stir in the homogenized milk and heavy cream. Add the maple syrup and vanilla and stir well. Pour into mugs and serve with marshmallows.

Mix together cornstarch and water and add to orange juice and sugar. Stir in rind and bring to boil over medium heat. Add vanilla and strawberries and cook for 5 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heat and pour into serving bowl and chill until ready to serve. Serve over ice cream or alone and top with brandy.

Preheat broiler. Slice bread in half lengthwise. Place bread on a cookie sheet. Brush both sides of bread with butter or margarine. Top with monterey jack cheese and parmesan cheese. Broil 4 to 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Remove from broiler. Sprinkle with green onions. Spread tomato mixture on each half of bread. Sprinkle with black olives and oregano. Broil 1 to 2 minutes or until cheese is melted again. Serve immediately.

Melt butter and oil together. Add garlic to mixture. Add honey mustard dressing. Cook on low heat for 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Add chicken breasts and cook on medium heat for 5 minutes per side, or until done. Remove from heat and cool for 5 minutes. Chop broccoli stems and potatoes into small pieces. Add to the skillet with the honey mustard dressing. Add cheddar cheese. Cover the skillet and let simmer on medium heat for 10 minutes or until potatoes are done.

Place the potatoes in a saucepan with cold water, bring to the boil then reduce to a simmer and cook until tender. Drain well. Whisk the mayonnaise together with the aioli and lemon juice and season with salt and black pepper. Add the spring onions and then combine the dressing with the new potatoes. Gently fold together. Transfer to a serving dish and serve warm or cold.

Combine marmalade, ginger, soy sauce & garlic in a small saucepan over medium-low heat. Stir until smoothset aside to cool while preparing the chicken. Combine marmalade mixture with flour, sesame seeds & a little salt & pepper. Coat the chicken with the mixture & bake 30-35 minutes at 350 degrees.
I have a question on the shrimp cheese broil recipe. What is melba toast?
Sounds delicious!! I'll have to try some.
I am all over the sesame marmalade chicken recipe! I love chicken!
I just love the rice crispie treats!!
Thanks for all the great recipes! My kids will love these!
I just made the cajun shrimp for the second time! Yum!
I have not made any recipes from the book yet...but I am going to soon!

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook pasta according to package directions until al dente. In a medium skillet, melt the butter. Add the nutmeg and pepper. Whisk in the heavy whipping cream and the cheese. Bring to a simmer and cook until thickened, stirring constantly. Drain the pasta and toss with the sauce. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 F. Lightly brush pizza crust with olive oil. Spread hummus evenly over the crust. Sprinkle with dried rosemary. Bake pizza crust for 5 minutes or until crust is slightly crisp. Remove pizza crust from oven and spread onions over the crust. Sprinkle with roasted red peppers and sprinkle with balsamic vinegar. Bake pizza crust for another 5 minutes or until onions are softened and beginning to caramelize. Serve with rosemary sprigs, if desired.
Combine all ingredients in blender or food processor until smooth. Serve in tall glasses topped with whipped cream and crushed candy cane or candy sprinkles if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Season chops on both sides with salt and black pepper. Heat olive oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet or oven-safe saute pan. Add onion and garlic and saute until onion is tender, 3-5 minutes. Add mushrooms, apple juice and salt and black pepper and saute until mushrooms are soft, 5-7 minutes. Add heavy cream to pan and bring to a boilreduce to simmer and let sauce simmer for 5 minutes. Place pork chops into pan and cook 2-3 minutes on each side for medium-rare. Remove from heat and top with chopped fresh chives.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).In a 13x9x2 inch baking dish, spread 2 cans of creamed soup evenly over the bottom of the pan. Lay 8 rolls on top of the soup. Spread cheddar cheese over the tops of the rolls. Sprinkle with onion and pepper.Place chicken in the center of the rolls in the pan.Pour the remaining can of creamed soup over the chicken.Bake in the preheated oven until the rolls are golden brown, about 20 minutes.Remove from the oven, spoon the gravy over the rolls, and sprinkle with onion to garnish.

Combine white wine, mustard, salt and pepper in shallow bowl. Soak chicken in this mixture for 30 min. Dip in bread crumbs. Place on baking sheet. Bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes. Turn once. Baste with wine mixture. Sprinkle with parmesan. Bake until done. Serve with mushroom sauce or gravy.

Bring water and salt to boil in a large pot. Add the mushrooms and onion and cook over medium heat until mushrooms are tender and onion is soft and translucent about 8 minutes. Stir in the noodles and cook for 10 minutes or until tender. Remove from heat. Mix the cooked noodles and mushrooms together. Stir in the remaining ingredients and toss until evenly distributed. Serve immediately.

Cover ribs in marinade. Refrigerate for 2- 3 hours. Place ribs in roasting pan. Bake at 350 for 2 hours. Remove from pan. Toss in soy sauce mixture. Heat until ribs are glazed. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve with rice.

Slice chicken and celery into bite size pieces. Add to boiling broth or water. Boil until celery and carrots are crisp tender. Remove from heat and add noodles. Boil until tender. Add soy sauce to taste. Garnish with green onions and serve.

Bake cake according to package directions. Let cool. In small saucepan over medium heat, combine butter, water, oil, eggs and vanilla. Beat with wire whisk for 2 minutes until smooth. Spread over cake. Refrigerate at least 2 hours before slicing.

In a sauce pan mix the flour, mustard, sugar and lemon juice. Mix well until smooth. Add the egg. Whisk until the egg is well mixed. Gradually stir in the water. Heat until boiling. Add the oil. Remove from heat. Cool completely. Stir in the vinegar.

Place the kombu seaweed in a large bowl. Pour boiling water over the seaweed. When the seaweed is soft and the water has cooled a little, strain the kombu seaweed. Place the dashi back into the bowl. Add the dried shiitakes and simmer on low heat for 20 minutes. Add light soy sauce and season with sea salt. Serve immediately with green onion.

Heat butter in a 10 inch frying pan. Add onions and saute until tender. Add yellow squash and red bell peppers. Cook until crisp tender. Add tomatoes and continue to cook 3 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle spinach over the vegetables and cover for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Sprinkle cheese over the top. Place under broiler until cheese is melted.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Mix brown sugar, miso, and soy sauce until smooth and spread over the salmon fillets. Bake for 10 minutes or until fish is opaque and flakes easily with a fork.
I just love salmon and the way you have prepared it looks yummy!
I have been making baked salmon for years but this sounds like a great way to prepare it for the grill!!
I love grilled fish in general, but I haven't had much luck with grilled salmon. I'll try this out on my next attempt! Thanks!
Mmmmmm I love grilled salmon but I have never tried the mustard and molasses glaze...I'll have to try that one!
I haven't had grilled fish in a while, but this is making me hungry for it!
Yum! I love grilled salmon!
I love grilled salmon! I'm going to have to try one of those recipes this week!
I've never tried grilled salmon but I think it would be really good! I'm going to try it this week
Boil the water, add the tea bag. Steep for three minutes. Cool. Add the fruit and the almonds. Blend with the ice cubes until smooth. Add the yogurt. Blend again. Serve immediately.

Sprinkle cutlets with lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper. Heat oil in 10-inch skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute for 2 minutes. Add the turkey and cook for 5 minutes or until browned. Add white wine. Cook for 2 minutes or until liquid is almost evaporated. Add flour and stir constantly until bubbly. Add water and cook until thickened. Stir in the remaining 2 tablespoons of lemon juice. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350F. Sprinkle paprika, garlic powder and salt and black pepper over chicken. Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add margarine. Cook chicken in skillet 4 to 5 minutes per side or until browned. Remove to a baking dish and set aside. In same skillet, cook onion in margarine until tender. Add brown sugar, soy sauce. Bring to a boil. Cook until thickened. Pour over chicken. Sprinkle with almonds.

Preheat oven to 350. Spray bundt pan with nonstick cooking spray. Combine cake mix, eggs, oil and sour cream. Beat until well blended. Stir in chocolate chips. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake for 50-60 minutes or until done via toothpick test. Cool in pan for 15 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool completely. In a small bowl combine powdered sugar and Kahlua. Drizzle over cooled cake.

Put the whole milk and the cream of coconut into the blender and blend at medium speed until well mixed. Pour half of the mixture into the blender and add the frozen strawberries and the banana. Blend at high speed for about 2 minutes or until the fruit is well pureed and the mixture is smooth and frothy. Pour the remaining mixture into the blender and blend again for about 1 minute or until the mixture is smooth and frothy. Serve immediately.

Place flour, sugar, milk, cardamom pods, saffron, rose water and 2 cups water in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Simmer until thick and creamy, stirring constantly. Pour into dish and sprinkle with chopped pistachios.

Cut potatoes into bite size chunks. Cut bell pepper into bite size chunks. Cut sausages into bite size chunks. Heat olive oil in a pan and saute bell pepper, onion, and sausages until tender. Remove from heat. Combine potatoes with sausages, bell pepper, onion and Creole seasoning, paprika and pepper. Toss to coat with seasoning mixture. Transfer to a baking pan and bake for 25-30 minutes or until tender.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Rinse fish fillets and pat dry with a paper towel. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and set aside. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook onion in butter until tender. Remove from heat and set aside. Place fish on a greased cookie sheet. Divide onion mixture among fillets and sprinkle with lemon juice. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until fillets flake easily with a fork. Serve over hot rice with lemon wedges on the side.

Heat olive oil over low heat in a large skillet, add white onion, and saute until soft. Add the white rice and water, then bring to a boil. Cover the skillet, turn down the heat to low, and cook for 20 minutes. Stir occasionally. Season with salt and pepper when done. Serve with freshly squeezed lime juice, kosher salt, and monterey jack cheese on top.

Slice tomato into thin slices. Mix raspberries and vinegar together. Spread tomato slices and raspberry mixture onto the center of each tortilla. Sprinkle bean sprouts and spinach on top of tomato. Fold the tortillas over and enjoy!

Preheat oven to 375. Dip chicken pieces into the margarine then into the flour to coat evenly. Place the coated pieces into a shallow pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until the pieces are no longer pink at the center. In the meantime, combine the honey with the pecans and sprinkle over the pieces before serving. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Prepare a 13-by-9-inch baking dish by greasing it with cooking spray. Put the peaches in the baking dish. Beat the butter with the next 6 ingredients at medium speed with an electric mixer until the mixture is crumbly. Sprinkle the mixture over the peaches. Bake the dish for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with the flaked coconut and toasted pecans. Bake for another 20 minutes or until the filling is lightly browned and the peaches are tender. Cool for about 10 minutes before serving.

In food processor pulse together the carrots, parsley and garlic until finely chopped. Then add the celery and pulse until finely chopped. In a saucepan bring 1/2 c of water to boil. Add carrot mixture and boil for 2 minutes until slightly softened. Cool mixture. In a jar or small bowl place carrot mixture and add apple cider vinegar. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or up to 48 hours. Stir before serving. Makes 4 servings.

Chop all vegetables into small pieces and boil for 5 minutes in water until tender. Drain and allow to cool. Beat eggs with salt and pepper and mix in with flour and olive oil. Add vegetables and mix well. Form into small cakes and cook in oil until brown on both sides and cooked through. Drain and serve with lemon wedges.

Melt the fat in a saucepan or skillet. Stir in the flour. Gradually add the broth, stirring constantly. Simmer until the mixture thickens. Add the salt and pepper.
I've always loved gravy - especially homemade.
I love the idea of adding nutritional yeast to a vegan gravy. I've never tried it before.
I'll have to give that a try.
I think I will make this recipe tomorrow night.
I've got all the ingredients. I can't wait to try it.
This is going to make a great gravy for our Thanksgiving dinner tomorrow.
I think I will make this recipe tomorrow.
I have got to try this recipe. It sounds great!
This is a great idea. I can't wait to try it.
I think I'll try it tomorrow night.
This recipe sounds great. I can't wait to try it.
This is a great idea. I can't wait to try it.

Bring water to boil in small saucepan. Add green tea and honey and bring back to boil. Boil 1-2 minutes. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Add lemon juice and ginseng extract. Serve over ice. Garnish, if desired.

In a large container with a seal-able lid combine the water, apple juice, honey, worcestershire sauce and salt until dissolved. Add the bay leaves and accent seasoning. Cool before filling. Remove the bay leaves before use. Use to brine fish or poultry before smoking or grilling. Fish or poultry may be refrigerated in the brining solution for up to 24 hours before use.

Stir together cucumber slices, onion, sugar, prepared horseradish, celery seed, and white vinegar in a large bowl. Cover with plastic wraprefrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 4 hours before serving.

In a large bowl, combine the flour, nutmeg, and salt. Make a well in the center and add the eggs and milk. Beat well with a fork until smooth. Heat a large frying pan with olive oil over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Drop the batter into the pan in small handfuls. Using a slotted spoon, lift the spaetzle out of the pan when they are golden brown and float to the top of the pan. Serve immediately with the fried bacon and onion. Garnish with parsley

Peel and cut vegetables into 1/2 inch dice. Place in heavy bottom pan with water and bring to a boil. Cook until tender. Mash vegetables and add butter. Add milk. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with paprika and serve.

Dip each tenderloin in flour to coat lightly. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the tenderloins and brown on both sides, about 10 minutes total. Remove the tenderloins to a plate. Add the brandy, berry juice, broth, salt, pepper, and thyme to the skillet and cook until the liquid is reduced to 1/2 cup, about 8 minutes. Return the tenderloins to the skillet and stir to coat. Transfer the tenderloins to a serving platter. Sprinkle with the cheese. Serve with hot cooked rice.

Combine first 4 ingredients in small bowlstir until well blended. Coverchill until ready to serve. Wash fruitcut fruit into bite-size pieces. Thread fruit onto bamboo skewers. Serve fruit kabobs with dipping sauce.

Cut the tops off the tomatoes. Scoop out the flesh with a teaspoon. Put the breadcrumbs in a bowl. Add the egg and mix well. Add the garlic and parsley and mix well. Divide the mixture evenly among the tomatoes. Sprinkle with a little olive oil. Place the tomatoes in the baking dish. Bake until the mixture is firm. Makes 4 servings.

Cut squash in half and remove seeds. Place squash in baking dish with apples. In a bowl, mix margarine and brown sugar. Dot the top with this mixture and sprinkle with flour. Add salt and seasonings. Bake at 350 degrees for 2 hours.

Sauté onion and bell pepper in butter till tender. Add ground beef. Cook until browned. Stir in tomato soup. Add the sugar. Stir. Simmer until heated through. Add the whole kernel corn and mix well. Season with worcestershire sauce and fresh cracked pepper.
I am a member of the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants (AICPA), the Texas Society of Certified Public Accountants (TSCPA) and the Austin chapter of TSCPA.
I am an active member of the Austin chapter of the Texas Society of Certified Public Accountants (Austin TSCPA).

Brown hamburger meat with a little oil. Add chopped white onion to meat mixture. Mix tomato soup and bean soup in a large pot over medium heat. Add beans. Mix the hamburger meat mixture in the beans and soup. Add the frito corn chip and a little more chopped white onion. Bake in 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Serve in a casserole dish.
If you have any questions about this product by Fritos, contact us by completing and submitting the form below. If you are looking for a specif part number, please include it with your message.

Pulse cilantro and parsley in a food processor. Add serrano and garlic. Pulse to combine. Add cumin and pulse to blend. With machine running add lemon juice and then add a few drops of lemon juice at a time until mixture is bright green. Transfer to a bowl and stir in olive oil. Season to taste with pepper and kosher salt. Serves 4 to 6.

Spread mayonnaise on biscuits. Top with cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 15 minutes or until biscuits are brown and cheese is melted. In skillet, brown bacon and drain off grease. Add tomatoes and green chilies to skillet. Add seasoning salt and fresh ground pepper to taste. Pour over biscuits. Sprinkle with green onion. Serves 6.

Remove beans from the pods and rinse thoroughly. Place them on a steamer basket. Bring the water to boil and steam for approximately 3 to 4 minutes. Stir occasionally so they don’t stick to the bottom. When they’re cooked, immediately drain the beans in a colander. Add the salt and let them sit for about 3 minutes. Rinse them again. In a small bowl mix the olive oil, lemon juice and lemon zest. Toss the green beans with the dressing. Sprinkle the sesame seeds on top.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Grease a 9x13 baking dish with olive oil. Layer half the hash browns in the bottom of the dish. Sprinkle with half the lobster meat. Top with the remaining potatoes and lobster. In a small bowl, stir together the Old Bay seasoning and lemon-infused olive oil. Spoon over the potatoes. Sprinkle with green onion. Bake for 30 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 425. Combine all the dry ingredients and stir to mix well. Combine the wet ingredients and stir to mix well. Fold the wet ingredients into the dry until just combined. Fold the cooled melted butter into the batter. Drop by 1/4 cupfuls onto a parchment lined baking sheet. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with jam or honey.

Cut chicken in half and pound to 1/2 thickness. In a shallow bowl combine lemon juice, oregano, and pepper. Dip chicken in mixture and place on broiler rack. Broil 3-4 in. from heat for 6 min or until no longer pink in center. Meanwhile, combine feta cheese and green onions in a bowl. Top broiled chicken with cheese mixture. Makes 4 servings.

Trim off fins. Make shallow cuts across both sides of each trout. Rub with olive oil. Season with salt, black pepper and thyme. Place in a shallow baking dish. Arrange shallots around trout. Bake at 200c for about an hour. Serve with a salad.

Slice bread lengthwise (about 1/4-inch thick). Spread cream cheese on one slice of bread. Add butter and sugar to taste. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Roll up and place seam side down on waxed paper. Chill before serving.

Combine first 4 ingredients. Beat with mixer until well blended. Stir in egg and next 4 ingredients. Pour into pie shell. Bake at 375 degrees for 40 minutes or until set. Cool on wire rack 1 hour. Garnish with whipped cream and toasted nuts.

Sauté green onions and bell peppers in oil. Add carrots. Add zucchinistir-fry 1-2 minutes. Add lentilsstir-fry 2-3 minutes. Stir in garliccook 30 seconds. Stir in chicken brothbring to boil. Reduce heatcoversimmer 20 minutes or until lentils are tender. Stir in cayenne and parsley. Serve.

Put ears of corn into boiling water. Remove from heat and let cool. Cut off corn from ears and remove kernels with knife or kitchen shears. Stir together milk and butter and let stand until slightly thickened. Add corn and pepper and salt to taste. Pour into greased container and freeze. Makes 2 qts.

Process the pine nuts, garlic cloves, fresh spinach, italian parsley and sage until the mixture is smooth. Add the parmesan cheese, lemon juice and salt. Stir to combine and then with the processor running add the olive oil in a steady stream. Stir in the parsley and serve.

Stir together 1 cup flour, nonfat dry milk powder, instant yeast, and 1 tsp. Salt in a large bowl. Stir together water and honey in a small saucepan. Heat over medium heat until mixture boils and honey dissolves. Remove from heat and stir in 1/4 cup olive oil. Pour into large bowl with dry ingredients and stir until a soft dough forms. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic. Place dough in a lightly greased bowl and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour. Punch down dough and divide in half. Knead each half into a ball and place in a lightly greased 8-inch-square or 9-inch-round pan. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour. Bake in a preheated 350 degrees oven for 30 minutes. Turn out bread onto a wire rack to cool completely. Cut a hole in the center of each bread using a round cookie cutter or a

Combine the first 4 ingredients. Stir until sugar dissolves and the meat is well coated. Heat the oil in a large skillet. Add the meat and brown it on all sides. Add the lemongrass and onions. Cook over medium-low heat for 4-5 minutes. Pour the soy sauce into the pan and bring to boil. Boil for 2 minutes. Serve over rice.
Mix together all of the ingredients. Serve as a dip or a salad. Serve with vegetable sticks or chips.

Cream together butter and sugar. Add in eggs one at a time until light in color and well combined. Stir in almond extract. In a separate bowl whisk together the dry ingredients (except the colored decorating sugars). Slowly mix into the creamed mixture. If the dough is too stiff add a little milk to thin it out slightly. Use a cookie press fitted with your choice of cookie cutters or a star tip to press the dough onto an ungreased cookie sheet. If desired top with colored sugars. Bake in a preheated oven at 400 degrees for about 6-8 minutes or until lightly browned on the bottoms. Remove from oven and let cool slightly on the pan before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

In a small bowl whisk together the wine, vinegar and soy sauce. Add the ginger and wasabi paste and whisk again. Pour over the salmon and marinate in the refrigerator for 20 minutes. In a small bowl whisk the honey and water together and add salt and pepper to taste. Pour over the salmon and marinate in the refrigerator for another 20 minutes. Remove the salmon from the marinade and place on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Broil for 10-12 minutes or until done. Drizzle with the scallions and serve.

Heat oil in pan over medium high heat. Add onions and saute until soft. Add garlic and saute for 1 minute. Stir in couscous and continue to saute until couscous is lightly toasted. Add fish stock and saute 2 minutes more. Season couscous mixture with parsley, mint, and cilantro. Mix together egg whites and water in a small bowl and set aside. Season trout on both sides with salt and pepper. Coat each trout fillet evenly in egg whites then coat evenly in couscous mixture. Place trout on a baking sheet coated in cooking spray. Bake in a 375 degree preheated oven until golden brown and cooked through, about 12 minutes. Serve topped with slivered almonds.

Split rolls and butter outsides with butter or oil. Place 1 slice of cheese in each half. Add ham and roasted peppers to each half. Cook in skillet or grill press. Cook until cheese is melted and the bottom is golden brown and crisp. Serve immediately or wrap and refrigerate for up to 2 hours.

Combine first four ingredients. Cut in butter until crumbly. Press into greased 13x9x2-inch pan. Beat together cream, brown sugar, egg yolks, cinnamon. Pour over crust. Arrange sliced peaches on top. Bake at 350 degrees for 40-45 minutes.

Dissolve yeast in water. Add 1 teaspoon sugar to the yeast mixture and let sit until foamy, about 5 minutes. In a large bowl combine 1 1/4 cups of flour, cornmeal, salt and spices. Stir in yeast mixture. Add sweet potatoes, 2 tablespoons of flour and vegetable oil to form a dough. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until dough is smooth and elastic. Place in a greased bowlturn once to grease top of dough. Coverlet rise in warm place until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour. Punch down dough. Turn out onto lightly floured surfacedivide in half. Roll each half into 18x7-in. rectangle. Cut each rectangle into 15 (1-in.) strips. Place on greased baking sheets. Coverlet rise in warm place until doubled in bulk, about 40 minutes. Preheat oven to 400°F. Bake until golden brown, about 8 minutes. Makes 15 servings.

Brown ground beef. Add mushrooms. Combine soup and milk and pour over meat and mushrooms. Stir in tater tots. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Top with cheddar cheese. Bake an additional 10 minutes until cheese is melted.

Cream shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs and vanilla and beat until mixed well. Add pineapple and mix well. Stir in flour and salt and baking soda. Drop by teaspoon onto ungreased baking sheet and bake at 375f for 10-12 minutes. Cool on wire rack.

Melt the butter in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and saute for about 1 minute. Add the broccoli and saute until tender-crisp. Remove from the heat. Combine the mayonnaise with the parmesan cheese. Spread the mayonnaise mixture onto both slices of bread. Divide the broccoli mixture between the two slices. Top with the cheddar cheese. Spread the remaining mayonnaise onto the top slice. Put the top slice onto the bottom slice. Grill or press according to the manufacturer's directions. Cut into wedges.

Combine instant coffee with boiling water in a small saucepanlet stand for 2 minutes to dissolve. Meanwhile, microwave marshmallows for 1 minute or until puffedspread on wax paper to cool. In medium bowl, combine marshmallows, cool whip, and 1/2 of the instant coffee mixturebeat until smooth. Line 2-quart glass or plastic serving dish with ladyfingers. Spoon 1/3 of the mallow mixture onto each layer. Chill for 2 hours or until ready to serve. To assemble, top with remaining mallow mixture and chocolate curls. Makes 16 servings.

Form meat into 4 patties. Season with salt and pepper. Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Cook patties 3-4 minutes per side or until cooked through. Remove patties from skillet and set aside. Place patties back into pan with butter. Place mushrooms around each patty and top with sherry and shaved gouda. Broil until cheese is melted.

Mix meat with crumbs. Shape into 1 1/2 inch balls. Place in refrigerator for 30 minutes. Roll meatballs in egg. Sprinkle with basil. Place on greased grill. Grill until done. Serve on rolls with spaghetti sauce and cheese.

Cook garlic clove in cooking oil. Add remaining vegetables. Saute until tender. Add hot water. Simmer until vegetables are tender. Add corn. Stir in milk. Bring to a boil. Add potatoes. Reduce heat. Cover. Simmer 10 minutes. Stir in minced clams. Serve with crackers or bread.
The Canadian Military Chowder is a favorite among the Canadian Military. It is a hearty meal that is perfect for winter weather. The soup is made with potatoes, clams, and other vegetables. It is then thickened with a roux made from flour and butter. The end result is a thick and creamy soup that is perfect for cold weather.
I’ve been making this recipe for years now and it never fails to impress. The Canadian Military Chowder is hearty and filling, with just the right amount of spice. It’s perfect for a cold winter night or any time you need a delicious soup.
This soup is very easy to make and is a great way to use up leftover turkey. Simply combine cooked turkey, canned vegetables, and her

Place breasts in a 4-quart slow cooker. Sprinkle with salsa. Cover and cook 4 hours on low. Remove chickenshred. Add soup and salsa to mixture in slow cooker. Cook 15 minutes or until heated through. Stir in 1/2 cup of the sour cream. Serve over tortillas topped with remaining 1/2 cup sour cream and cheese. Serve with tortilla chips.

In a medium saucepan, mix together milk, 1/3 cup cornstarch, 1/4 cup sugar, 1 teaspoon salt, egg yolk, and vanilla extract until well blended. Cook over medium heat until mixture thickens, about 10 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat, let cool to room temperature. Chill until well chilled. Stir in 1 cup fresh or frozen strawberries. Coverchill until mixture is set, about 4 hours. Serve at room temperature or chilled. Makes about 4 servings.

In a large bowl, pour boiling water over the lime jello. Stir until the lime jello is completely dissolved. Stir in the limeade concentrate. Stir and fold in the cool whip. Pour into a 9X13 glass dish and chill for 4 hours or overnight. Cut into squares and serve.

Preheat oven to broil. Line a baking pan with foil. Line fish on baking pan. Combine all other ingredients. Broil fish 5-7 minutes. Turn fish and broil 5-7 minutes more. Top with sauce. Serve with potato salad.
Name: coriander chutney broiled fishIngredients: white fish fillets, garlic cloves, coriander leaves, hot green peppers, whole cumin seed, chopped coconut, ground turmeric, lemon juice, oil, saltPreparation:Pat fish dry and set aside. Make a paste of all the other ingredients. Apply thickly on the fish on both sides. Broil for 10 minutes on either side. Serve very hot, straight from the oven.
Name: seafood chickenIngredients: cooked chicken, tuna in vegetable oil, lemons, kalamata olive, hard-boiled eggs, artichoke hearts, lettuce leaf, mayonnaise, fresh parsleyPreparation:Place lettuce leaves on a serving platter and

Cook and shred chicken. Put 1/2 of the mixture in 2-quart casserole. Combine chicken broth and sour cream. Pour over chicken. Mix remaining chicken with mushrooms and 3 cans of soups. Sprinkle over chicken. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Sprinkle chilies and tortillas over top. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 10 minutes or until cheese melts.
I make a lot of quick and simple meals. Here are a few of my favorites.
name: lemon chicken and noodlesingredients: chicken breasts, noodles, lemon juice, butter, parsleypreparation:Heat noodles. Butter a 13x9 inch baking pan. Cut the chicken breasts into bite sized pieces. Combine the butter and lemon juice and stir well. Pour half the butter mixture into the baking pan and spread out. Put the noodles on top of the butter mixture. Put the rest of the butter

Clean and slice chillies. Heat evaporated milk, and add spices and Tabasco sauce. Add eggs and shake gently until mixed. Add cheeses and mix well. Add chopped chillies and mix well. Bake in pie pan at 350F for about 15-17 minutes or until firm. Makes 6 servings.
Beat eggs well and add milk and butter. Sift the flour with the sugar and baking powder. Blend the dry and wet mixtures. Pour onto a hot griddle or iron and bake.

Combine flour, granulated sugar, poppy seeds, baking powder, ground ginger, and baking soda in large bowl. Combine yogurt and eggs in medium bowl. Add yogurt mixture and melted butter to dry ingredientsstir just until moistened. Gently stir in diced Clementines. Spoon batter into muffin cups. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes or until tops are light golden brown. Cool in pan on wire rack 10 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool completely on wire rack.
name: citrus french toastingredients: self-rising flour, sugar, salt, cinnamon, lemons, zest of, milk, vanilla extract, egg, butter, breadpreparation: In a bowl mix together the flour, sugar, salt, cinnamon and zest. Add the milk and mix until you have a smooth and lump free batter. Add the egg and vanilla, mix, now add the melted butter and mix again. Heat a non-stick fry

Peel the potatoes and boil until tender. Drain the water from the potatoes. Mash the potatoes with the raw potatoes, white flour, baking powder, buttermilk, salt, and butter. Bake in a greased pan in the oven at 350 F for 45 minutes. Turn the pancake over while it is still warm so that the pancake does not stick to the pan. Serve warm with butter or syrup.

Melt cheeses over low heat in a saucepan and stir till smooth. Pour mixture into a bowl and add the brandy and white wine. Blend well and pour into a shallow dish or a bread bowl and sprinkle the top with the parsley. Serve with crusty sourdough bread and a salad.

Bring water to boil. Add macaroni. Cook for 8-10 minutes. Drain well. Combine cottage cheese with cottage cheese and grated cheese. Add seasonings. Combine with pasta. Bake in shallow casserole dish for 30 minutes in 350F oven. Stir once after 15 minutes of baking. Serve hot.

Melt butter in skillet, stirring frequently. Add flour, salt & pepper, cayenne, dried mustard. Continue to stir until mixture is bubbly. Stir in milk gradually, stirring constantly until thickened and smooth. Add cheese stirring until melted and smooth. Serve over vegetables, potatoes or meat.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan. Mix together the first four ingredients. Beat in bananas. Fold in craisins. Add the milk and stir with a spoon. Pour into the loaf pan. Bake for 1 hour. Cool on a wire rack.

Season both sides of chicken breasts with chili powder and cumin. Drizzle olive oil over both sides of chicken. Place in skillet and brown both sides. Add garlic and cook until tender. Add salsa and Dijon mustard. Cook over low heat for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and add cheese. Top with green onions. Serve over cooked pasta or rice.

Boil chicken stock. Pour into a large bowl. In a small bowl, combine the ginger and garlic cloves and mix. Stir into the stock. Add the jasmine rice and stir. Cover the bowl tightly and let stand for 1 hour. Stir well and let stand for 15 minutes. Fluff the rice with a fork and stir in the cilantro.

Prepare chicken rice-a-roni according to package directions. Saute chopped onion in butter until golden brown. Add coconut, broth, pineapples and noodles. Cook over medium heat until noodles are tender. Remove from heat. Add shredded chicken. Stir in almonds. Serve over rice. Top with cheese.

In a bowl, mix together the olive oil, garlic cloves and steak seasoning. Rub over the pork tenderloins. Place on a broiling pan in the oven for about 20 minutes, then turn to the other side and broil another 10 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 155 degrees F (68 degrees C) on a thermometer. Remove from the oven and drizzle with the balsamic vinegar. Garnish with the rosemary and thyme. Serve with a side of mashed potatoes or rice pilaf.
Brown and drain the beef. Stir in the taco seasoning and the water. Bring to a boil. Stir in the pasta. Turn off the heat and stir in the salsa. Stir in the black beans and the cheese.

Place the dark chocolate in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir until melted and smooth. Add the coffee. Stir well. Stir in the almond extract and the milk. Heat through, but do not boil. Divide among 2 or 3 cups. Top each cup with a dollop of whipped cream. Sprinkle with the shavings. Serve immediately.
Combine the shredded cabbages, vinegars, mustard, sugar and seasonings. Mix well and refrigerate at least 30 minutes to blend flavors before serving.

In a 9×13 pan, mix together the macaroni, sour cream, milk, eggs, 1 cup of cheese, butter, salt, and pepper. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Top with remaining cup of cheese for 5 minutes.
I am in LOVE with this recipe! I didn’t have time to make homemade noodles so I used boxed macaroni noodles and it was delicious! I will make this again!
The best ever! My husband has been asking for this for weeks now!
I made this in my crockpot. I cooked it on low for 5 hours and it was perfect!
This is one of our favorite comfort food meals. I usually make it in my crockpot.
This is a great recipe. I’ve made it several times for my family.
Amazing! It is now my favorite comfort food!
I love this dish! We eat it for supper at least once every two weeks!
I can’t wait to make this recipe!
I love this recipe. We eat it for supper at least

Cut cheddar cheese into cubes. Combine cheddar cheese cubes with margarine. Stir in flour, salt and red pepper flakes. Roll cubes in flour mixture until coated. Place cubes on baking sheet. Bake in oven for 10 minutes.
Christmas is a time for celebrating. And celebrating is a time for food. The following recipes are for food that you can make for your family to enjoy during this holiday season. You can also make these as gifts for your neighbors and friends.
Put all ingredients in a medium saucepan and heat over medium heat. Stir occasionally until mixture reaches boiling. Remove from heat. Add 1-2 drops food coloring. Stir until well blended. Cool slightly. Pour into plastic bag with a corner cut out or in a decorated bowl. Makes about 1-1/2 cups.
Put all ingredients in a small saucepan. Stir until butter is melted. Remove from heat. Add 1-2 drops food coloring. Stir until well blended. Cool slightly

Mix all the ingredients together in a bowl. Shape into 8 patties. Lightly spray a skillet with nonstick cooking spray. Heat over medium heat until hot. Add the patties. Cook for 8 to 10 minutes, turning once. Serve hot. Makes 4 servings.

Prepare and cook the wings by using whatever method you prefer. I deep fry them in oil heated to 375 degrees. Once cooled toss in the spices. I use about a teaspoon of each spice for a half dozen wings. Serve with corn chips and salsa.

Heat the oven to 400 degrees F. Place the bread on a baking sheet and brush the top of each slice evenly with the butter. Bake the bread until it is golden, about 5 minutes on each side. Increase the oven temperature to 450 degrees F. Meanwhile, mash the bananas in a medium bowl. Add the butter and maple syrup and stir until thoroughly blended. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat and add the ham steaks. Cook until the meat is no longer pink in the center, about 8 minutes per side. Drain the cooked meat on paper towels and add the banana mixture to the panstir to combine the meat and fruit. Spread the mixture onto the top of each slice of bread and cook the sandwiches in the oven until the mixture is bubbling and golden brown, about 5 minutes per side. Cut the sandwiches in half and serve immediately.

Prepare kulolo by peeling taro root and cutting into 4 inch pieces. Boil with just enough coconut water to cover the pieces of taro. Cook until taro is soft. Add brown sugar and continue to boil until the mixture is dry enough to hold its shape. Pour into baking dishes or casserole dishes. Drain the taro root of its liquid by pressing down with a strainer or cloth towel. Shred the taro root and mix with the shredded coconut. Combine with the remaining liquid to make a soft paste. Spread evenly onto the kulolo. Chill overnight.
Mix together all ingredients in a mixing bowl. Mix well. Divide dough into 8 equal portions. Roll each portion into a ball and place on a greased sheet. Let rest in a cool place for 24 hours.
Combine all ingredients in blender. Heat olive oil in a saute pan. Dip tenders in batter and pan fry in olive oil until cooked through. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Slice 2 large roasted red peppers into small pieces. Melt reduced-fat cream cheese in small saucepan over medium heat. Stir in roasted red peppers, chicken broth, and garlic. Remove from heat. Add ground red pepper to taste. Add vermicelli and toss well. Add shrimp and basil. Spoon mixture into 6 individual serving dishes. Top each serving with 2 basil leaves. Bake for 2-3 minutes to heat through. Serve immediately.
In a medium bowl, combine creole seasoning, chicken, butter, oil, maple syrup, brown sugar. Place in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with pecans. Bake for 45 minutes. Serve with rice.
Preheat broiler. Place flour tortillas on a broiler pan. Brush with garlic oil. Top with slices of mozzarella and slices of eggplant. Broil until cheese is melted. Serve hot.

In a mixing bowl beat together milk, egg and seasonings. Heat a skillet over medium heat. Add butter and saute onion, pepper and tomatoes for 5 minutes. Add in remaining vegetables and stir. Pour in egg mixture. Cook until set. Top with grated cheese and ham. Serve with toast or biscuits.

Preheat oven to 350. Cook ground beef until done. Drain off fat. Stir in cheeses, chilies, enchilada sauce and eggs. Spray an 8x8 baking dish with cooking spray. Transfer meat mixture to the prepared baking dish. Bake for about 40 minutes or until knife inserted comes out clean. Let cool for 15 minutes. Cut into squares. Serve with tortilla chips and salsa.
In a large bowl, combine broccoli, onion, ham, cheese and miracle whip. Add lemon juice and season to taste. Chill for several hours before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In 1 qt saucepan melt butter. Stir in Jiffy cornbread mix. Add egg and milk. Mix well. Add peppers and cheese. Pour into greased 8x8 pan. Bake 20-25 minutes. Cool. Cut into squares.
I just got home from a 2 day trip to Chicago. We drove through some pretty bad weather. It was freezing cold and wet. It was snowing. The roads were not too bad. But then we got stuck on I-88. A truck had broken down and was in the middle of both lanes. They had to move it off. So we had to sit there for almost an hour. It was so cold. I just wanted to go home. I got home and all I wanted to do was sleep. So I did. I just woke up. I am so tired. I think I am going back to sleep. I have to work tomorrow. I do not want to go to work. I do not have anything to wear. I will have to find something to wear. I wish I could just stay home. I
Prepare gelatin according to package directions. Cool slightly. Combine with next 5 ingredients. Pour into prepared piecrust. Refrigerate until firm. Garnish with lemon slices and whipped topping.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine 1 cup apple juice concentrate with 1/3 cup water in the bread pan. Add the rest of the ingredients in the order shown in your bread makers instruction manual. Select the basic white cycle. Bake for 60 minutes. Test with toothpick after 45 minutes. If done, remove from the pan and let cool. If not done, test again after 15 minutes. Repeat as necessary.

In saucepan combine the first four ingredients. Heat to boiling. Remove from heat. Tie together cheesecloth and twine. Strain cider mixture through cheesecloth. Store in refrigerator. Serve warm. Garnish with a sprig of fresh rosemary or a slice of lemon if desired.

Cut open the avocado and scoop out the flesh. Put in the food processor. Add the cream cheese and alfalfa sprouts. Process until smooth. Spread on the bread. Top with tomato slices, banana pepper slices, and bacon slices.

In a large bowl mix together jiffy cornbread mix and creamed corn until well blended. Add eggs and mix well. Stir in cream and sugar. Pour into a greased 9x13-inch pan and bake in a 375 degree oven for 35-45 minutes or until cake test done in center. Cool and serve.

Heat chips and milk in saucepan over low heat until smooth. Add sugar and stir until melted and combined. Cool slightly. In a mixing bowl beat cream cheese until light and fluffy. Gradually beat in melted chocolate mixture. Gently fold in non-dairy topping until blended. Spoon into crust. Refrigerate. Serve cold.

Saute the baby portabella mushrooms in the oil with the minced garlic. Add the baby spinach and sprinkle with the breadcrumbs. Add the Parmesan cheese. Top with a bit more olive oil. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes.
Puree tomatoes in a food processor. Strain through a strainer to remove the skins. Add the bottled lemon juice. Cover and refrigerate.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 9x13 pan with butter and dust with flour. Mix together rhubarb and sugar and place in pan. Sprinkle with gelatin and water and stir well. Add cake mix and water and stir well until crumbly. Bake for 40 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 20 minutes then spread with frosting and sprinkle with coconut.

In a large pot of boiling water, cook spaghetti until tender. Drain and place in a large serving bowl. Add the olive oil and 1/2 stick of melted buttertoss lightly and set aside. Melt the remaining 1/2 stick of butter in a saucepan over low heat. Stir in the grated Parmesan and stir until blended and the cheese has melted. Sprinkle the Parmesan over the pasta and toss lightly. Serve immediately.

Separate 1 egg. Melt 1 teaspoon butter in pan. Add egg. Cook until whites are set. Flip, but do not cook more than 1 minute. Toast buns. Spread 1 teaspoon butter on each bun. Stack 2 slices of cheese on each bun. Top each cheese slice with 1 slice of ham. Top each sandwich with egg. Serve.

Preheat the oven to 450F. Place parsnips in a bowl and toss with butter. Add dark brown sugar and balsamic vinegar and toss to coat well. Transfer to a baking sheet and arrange in a single layer. Roast until crisp and golden, about 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and sprinkle with thyme.

Bake shells. Cream together flour, walnuts, sugar and butterpress into tart shellschill. Melt chocolate with creamlet cool slightly. Spoon into shellstop with mint leaves and walnut halves. Whip whipped topping to stiff peaksspread over tart topssprinkle with additional walnuts. Chill until ready to serve.

Dissolve gelatin in boiling wateradd sugar and mix until smoothmix in dry milk powderrefrigerate until firmbeat with mixer until light and fluffyadd oilmix until combinedbeat in vanillarefrigerate until ready to use.
This is the first time I made this cake for my nephews birthday party, I was nervous that it would not turn out right but it did great!! I used the recipe exactly as it was written with the exception of using a 10x14 pan instead of an 8x8 pan. It came out really moist and delicious!
I made this cake for my mom's birthday using a 10x13 pan. It was delicious! It was very moist. I had a little trouble getting it out of the pan but I put it on a plate and it was fine.
This cake was easy to make and was delicious. I used 1-3/4 cups of sour cream instead of the yogurt. I also used a 9 inch round pan instead of a 8x8 pan.
This c

Heat olive oil in stockpot. Add onion and cook until tender. Add marinara sauce, crushed tomatoes and water. Heat through. Brown ground beef, drain fat. Add beef to pot. Add sausage to pot. Cook over medium-high heat for 20 minutes. Add spices and pepperoni. Cook for additional 15 minutes. Serve over pasta or rice.

Combine 1 cup all-purpose flour, 2 eggs and a pinch of salt in a bowl and mix well. Set aside. Bring 4 cups water to a boil in a large saucepan over high heat. Add 4 teaspoons of bouillon cubes and stir to dissolve. Add 2 cups chicken broth and 2 cups water to the saucepan. Return the mixture to a simmer. Add 2 cups all-purpose flour to the bowl with the eggs. Slowly whisk in the remaining 1 cup of water to form a smooth dough. Using a teaspoon measure out pieces of the dough and place on top of the simmering broth. Cover the pan and continue cooking over low heat until the dough is cooked through and the broth is thickened. Season with salt to taste. Remove the pan from the heat and let stand for 2 minutes before serving. Serve with whole chicken that has been cut into pieces.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Add asparagus and/or broccoli during the last 5 minutes of cooking. Drain. Return to pan. In a 2 cup measurer stir cream cheese into milk. Add mixture to pasta and stir gently over medium heat until heated through.

Cook pasta as directed on packagedrain well. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heatadd onion, bell pepper, garlic salt, onion salt, and Italian Seasoningcook 5 minutes or until tender. In a large bowl combine pasta, cooked beef mixture, pasta sauce, and cheesesspoon into a 3-qt casserole sprayed with cooking spray. Bake at 350° for 25 minutes or until heated through.

Sprinkle flour over sugar in a bowl. Stir until well mixed. Add milk. Mix well. Stir in margarine and coconut. Pour over pie filling. Bake 30-40 minutes or until edges are browned and set. Serve with sour cream. Prep time includes baking time.

Combine meat, onion, cheese in a bowl. Shape into 8 small patties. Place in an ungreased 13 x 9 inch pan. Combine the remaining ingredients. Pour over meat. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Serve on a bed of lettuce.

Melt butter in small skillet. Add onion and saut until tender. Stir in blue cheese, 1/4 tabasco. Stir until cheese is melted. Remove from heat and let cool. Mix with almonds. Store in tight container. Serve with crackers or as salad dressing.

Bring half-and-half to a simmer in a medium saucepan. Remove from heat and stir in egg yolks until smooth. Pour through a fine strainer into a medium bowl set over ice bath. Cool completely then whisk in cheeses until melted. Season with salt and pepper. Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Lightly butter a shallow gratin dish or baking dish. Pour in the macaroni mixture and sprinkle with parsley. Bake until golden brown, about 25 minutes. Serve hot with salsa.

Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Cook the onions until slightly browned. Add the ground beef to the pan and cook until browned. Sprinkle the cumin powder over the meat, turn the heat down to low and continue to cook until the meat is no longer pink. Drain the meat and reserve the drippings. Prepare the cauliflower. Melt the butter in a saucepan. Add the cauliflower florets to the pan and stir fry until lightly browned. Add the lemon juice to the pan and stir fry until the cauliflower is cooked through. Remove the pan from the heat and transfer the cauliflower to a mixing bowl. In a casserole dish, layer the meat over the bottom of the dish. Sprinkle the cheese over the top of the meat. Add the cauliflower to the meat and sprinkle the top of the cauliflower with the reserved drippings from the meat. Bake the pie for 20 minutes in a preheated oven at 350 degrees F. Turn the oven off and let the

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place potatoes in a bowl and add enough water to cover. Bring to a boil and cook for 30 minutes or until tender. Drain potatoes and return to bowl. Add cranberries and pecans. Mash with a potato masher until smooth. Add orange zest and jalapeño. Stir to combine. Season with cinnamon and salt. Spoon into a serving dish and chill in refrigerator for 1-2 hours. Sprinkle with chopped cilantro before serving. Serve with crackers and veggies.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly spray 2 baking sheets with cooking spray or use baking mat. In a large bowl mix together the zucchini, onion, all-purpose flour, egg, garlic, seasoning salt, and fresh ground black pepper. Add the mozzarella and parmesan cheeses and mix well. Form into 1-inch thick patties and place 2 inches apart on baking sheets. Spray the tops of the patties with olive oil spray. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until lightly browned and cooked through. Serve with your favorite pasta sauce or pasta salad.

Mix together boiling water, dressing and vanilla. Cool to lukewarm. Sift together flour, sugar and cocoa. Stir into dressing mixture. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form and fold into batter. Bake in greased muffin pans at 375 degrees for 18 minutes or until done. Frost with 1/4 cup salad dressing frosting.

Place one layer of the pastry shell into the baking dish. Layer with the mincemeat. Place the next layer of pastry. Pour the amaretto liqueur over the mincemeat. Top with the remaining pastry layer. Roll out the remaining pastry. Cut into strips. Lay them over the top of the pie. Press lightly. Bake for 35 to 45 minutes until the pastry is golden brown. Let stand for 20 minutes before slicing.

In small microwave-safe dish, microwave butter on high about 30 seconds or until melted. Add brown sugar and honeystir until blended. Add spices and rum flavoringstir until combined. In large microwavable bowl, mix all cereals. Pour butter mixture over cereal mixturestir until evenly distributed. Microwave uncovered on high 5 minutes or until mixture begins to brown, stirring every minute. Stir in marshmallows. Microwave an additional minute or until marshmallows are softened. Spread on wax paper or a cookie sheet to cool. Store in airtight container.

Combine all the ingredients in a medium bowl. Place the chicken breast in a large freezer bag. Add the marinade. Seal the bag and turn to coat. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Remove the chicken from the marinade. Grill the chicken for 10 minutes each side, 2 inches or so from the heat. Brush frequently with the leftover marinade. Serves 1-2 people.

Heat olive oil in heavy skillet. Add chops and brown lightly. Add green peppers and mushrooms and stirfry for 5 minutes. Add tomatoes, garlic and tomato sauce. Stir in white wine and oregano. Cover and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until meat is tender. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, combine the eggs, half-and-half, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon white pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg. In a small bowl, combine the sweet corn, cracker crumbs, unsalted butter, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon white pepper, 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg and paprika. Place the mixture in a lightly greased 2-quart baking dish. Bake for 45 minutes or until the mixture is set when lightly jiggled in the center. Let cool for 15 minutes. Garnish with chopped chives or parsley and serve hot or cold.

Beat first four ingredients on high for 3-4 minutes. Gradually add flour and baking powder. Beat till combined. Drop by teaspoon on waxed paper and bake at 375 degrees for 6 minutes or till lightly browned.
In a small bowl combine lemon juice, dijon mustard, red wine vinegar, egg substitute, tarragon, thyme and pepper. Whisk until smooth. Stir in oil. Refrigerate until serving time.

Mix spaghetti sauce with cornstarch in a bowl. Heat red wine in a sauce pan. Add spaghetti sauce mix to the wine mixture. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Serve with Italian bread or crackers for dipping. Top with mozzarella cheese and cheddar cheese.

Follow package directions for cooking macaroni & cheese. Let cool. In a casserole, layer with sauce, meat and mozzarella cheese. Repeat until all is used up, then sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake at 350* for 30 min or until bubbly.

Combine shrimp, chili oil, garlic, and lime juice in a bowl. Allow shrimp to marinate in refrigerator for 1 hour. When ready to serve, heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add shrimp mixture with its marinade to skillet. Stir-fry until shrimp are cooked through and curled. Serve with papaya, mango and avocado slices. Garnish with fresh cilantro.

Sift dry ingredients together. Add egg and 2 cups of beer. Beat until smooth. Batter will be about the thickness of heavy cream. Batter will thicken as it sits. Refrigerate until ready to use or add more beer if needed.

In a medium saucepan, combine all of the ingredients except the nuts. Bring to a boil over medium heatcook 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add nutscook 3 minutes or until nuts are glazed and mixture thickens, stirring constantly. Remove from heatcool slightly. Spread over cake or ice cream, or pour into individual dessert dishes for an elegant dessert topper.

Bring a large pot of water to boil. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta. Toss in rice vinegar, sugar, hot chili oil. Toss together until well coated. Add salt to taste. Add cucumber, red bell pepper, red onion. Toss until combined. Chill until ready to serve.

Place all the ingredients for the slow cooker Italian pork loin into the crockpot, cover, and cook on low for 6-8 hours. Check the meat after 6 hours to see if it's done. If not, continue to cook until it is tender and shreds easily when poked with a fork. Serve over pasta or rice.

Cut each wrapper into 6 wedges. In a large bowl toss together crab meat, scallions, radishes, parsley, olive oil, lime zest, lime juice, and hot sauce. Spoon 1 heaping teaspoon of the crab mixture into the center of each wrapper. Bring edges together to form a cup and pinch together at the top to seal. Place on a baking sheet coated with nonstick cooking spray. Bake at 375 for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve immediately.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Serve with crackers or vegetables. Refrigerate leftovers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In small bowl combine cumin seed, thyme, salt and black pepper. Cut off top 1/2-inch of each carrot. Using sharp knife, carefully slice lengthwise to expose center. Press cumin mixture into each carrot. Place on baking sheetbrush with melted butter and bake 20-25 minutes or until tender. In small saucepan, stir together chardonnay, brown sugar, butter and thyme. Bring to a boilboil 1 minute or until slightly reduced and thickened. Serve carrots warm with sauce.

Rinse the vegetables in cold water. Place in a pot. Add water to cover the vegetables. Add 2 tablespoons olive oil. Cook until the vegetables are tender. Add the tomatoes. Stir well to combine. Add cilantro and culantro. Cook for 2 minutes more. Serve with rice.

Combine all ingredients except butter in a large mixing bowl. Melt the butter in a small pan. Pour over the dry ingredients and mix well. Spread in a single layer in a large cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Stir half way through. Cool completely. Store in an airtight container.
I was just looking for a recipe for this. I saw a recipe for a similar one at a friend's house last weekend. I've had a few requests for it since then. Thanks for posting this.
My mom makes a similar one (though a bit more involved) that is really good. I love this.
I love ramen! I can't wait to try this!
Thanks for sharing! I have always wanted to make a recipe with the seasoning packets.
I love making things like this with the seasoning packets. We were given a big jar of the seasoning at Christmas. We've used it in all kinds of things. I'm going to have to make this one.
I made this today. I used the chicken flavor packet. I didn't have any of

Combine the syrup, sugar and butter in medium saucepan over low heat. Stir in butter flavoring. Stir in baking soda and stir to blend. Remove from heat and add the graham cracker cereal. Spread on cookie sheets and let cool. Makes 25 lbs.
Sift dry ingredients together 5 times. Fold in sweet bean paste and water. Bake as for angel food cake.
Mash together avocados, garlic, onions, cilantro, tomatoes and jalapeno. Season with lime juice, salt, and pepper. Serve with tortilla chips.

Halve the eggs lengthwise. Scoop the yolks into a small mixing bowl, and mash with a fork or a potato masher until smooth. Add the mayonnaise, horseradish mustard and cajun seasoning. Mix until well blended. Spoon the mixture into the whites and serve at once or refrigerate until ready to serve.

Place strawberries in blender containerprocess until smooth. Pour into a large punch bowl or serving container. Add remaining ingredientsstir until blended. Serve with crushed ice. Garnish with fresh strawberries if desired.

In small saucepan mix together first 4 ingredients, boil 1 minute. Remove from heat. Brush on ham steaks. Grill over med heat for 15-20 min or bake at 350 for 15 min each side or until hot. Cut ham in halves or quarters. Arrange on platter. Top with avocados. Drizzle with sauce. Garnish with parsley if desired.
name: sausage with warm fruitpreparation:Cook sausage until done. Add pineapple and brown sugar. Heat through. Add banana. Toss to coat and serve.
name: creamy ham and eggspreparation:Melt butter in a large saucepan. Stir in flour and seasonings till smooth and bubbling. Stir in milk stirring constantly, till thick and bubbly. Stir in ham and eggs. Heat till hot. Serve on toast.
name: pineapple bread bread machinepreparation:In bread machine pan, place the first eight ingredients in order suggested by manufacturer. Select basic bread setting. Choose cr

Cook beef in skillet until browned. Add onion. Drain off excess fat. Stir in all remaining ingredients until well blended. Pour into greased muffin cups. Bake at 350 for 15-20 minutes or until muffins are done. Top with cheese.

Spray nonstick baking sheet with cooking spray. Place fillets on baking sheet and sprinkle with lemon pepper. Bake in preheated 350-degree oven for 10-15 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Mix tomato, onion and basil. Serve fish with tomato mixture.

Cook pasta. While it is cooking cut up cabbage. Melt butter in sauce pan. Add cabbage, margarine, lemon juice. Cook until tender. Drain pasta. Add cooked pasta to cabbage mixture. Add balsamic vinegar, cottage cheese, and parmesan. Stir until well blended. Season with salt and sugar if desired. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Sprinkle fish with salt. Drizzle with 1 tbsp orange juice. Wrap fillet in foil. Bake 10 minutes. Melt butter in medium skillet over medium-high heat. Add zest, tarragon, and remaining orange juice. Simmer until reduced by half. Sprinkle fillet with remaining 1/8 tsp salt. Arrange on serving plates. Spoon sauce over fish. Garnish with parsley sprigs.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Combine first four ingredients in a bowlcut in butter until crumbly. Pat evenly into an 8 inch square baking dish coated with cooking spraybake for 15 minutes, or until lightly browned. Combine remaining ingredients in another bowlpour over shortcake crust. Bake 25 minutes longer, or until set. Cut into squarestop each with whipped cream and berries.

In a large saucepan combine the soup, milk and mustardmix well. Bring to a boil over medium heatreduce heat. Add cheese, stirring until melted. Stir in pepper. Cook, stirring constantly, until heated through. Add the macaronicook and stir until thoroughly heated. Sprinkle with french-fried onions, if desired.
Muddle lemongrass with ginger, then add sugar and vanilla bean. Steep for 10 minutes. Add lemon juice and strain into a large pitcher. Add ice cold soda water and stir well before serving.

Combine all ingredients except the chocolate and walnuts. Cook over medium heat until mixture thickens. Pour into 8 x 8 pan. Sprinkle chocolate over top. Melt chocolate slightly. Pour over top. Sprinkle walnuts over chocolate. Refrigerate. Cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Wash and trim fat from pork. Tie ends together with cooking twine. In a small bowl, combine lemon rind and garlicstuff in the pork cavity. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place in a shallow baking pan. In a small bowl, mix together broth and remaining lemon rind. Pour over pork. Bake uncovered for 1 hour and 30 minutes. Check for doneness by inserting a meat thermometer into the thickest part of the meat. The pork should be done when the thermometer reads 150 degrees F. Cut in half, and serve with the juices. Serve with rice.
